July 26 — 5:15 p.m. Air Defense Command radar detects a UFO over Williams, California. An F-94 jet interceptor is scrambled and locks onto the object with its radar. The crew sees a yellow-orange light. As confirmed by ground and airborne radar, the UFO plays tag with the F-94, alternately accelerating away when it gets close, then slowing down until it catches up again. (NICAP, “[F-94 Intercept with ADC Detection](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520726williams_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921788293&usg=AOvVaw0nteohPNS1y_UxMC5Hz2H6)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921788661&usg=AOvVaw0BdHKpj6nKDNHCYNnxcmuD), p. 158)

July 26 — 11:00 p.m. Three women in Oran, Algeria, notice a large, orange-red, luminous patch in the sky. It travels from east to west, halts, then vanishes. It is one of many UFOs seen in the province of Oran over several weeks. (ClearIntent, [pp. 120–121](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/120/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921789249&usg=AOvVaw15ZjJ0GDvxJWgj2oAfVU5u))

July 27 — 10:40 a.m. Bowling Green State University biologist [Charles H. Otis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64357313/charles-h-otis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921789722&usg=AOvVaw2auTyUh1pk48f-K-93AdTj) sees a “flotilla” of UFOs “seemingly floating along, making no sound” at 3724 Dexter Road, Ann Arbor, Michigan. He grabs a pair of 5x binoculars and studies them until they disappear. He counts 15 of them in a loose formation, moving slowly. One object leaves the formation and disappears in a burst of speed. The body of each seems to be elongated but split at the rear. A bright glow is visible in the front, and they have a bifurcated tail streaming out horizontally, never changing in length (UFOEv, [pp. 50–51](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D62%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921790238&usg=AOvVaw0mXUib6mAqKUCSjm69BGen))

July 27 — 6:35 p.m. A group of eight pilots and engineers see a large, silvery object moving rapidly at a high altitude over Manhattan Beach, California. After it makes a turn, the UFO separates into 7 discs that form into groups, circle, and speed out of sight. Former Navy pilot and aircraft engineer J. E. Kempf says the formation looks like a “stack of coins.” (NICAP, “[Large Object Separates into 7 Discs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520727manhattanbeach_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921790738&usg=AOvVaw0tvBpriGENVoN7Zo54kcqt)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921791050&usg=AOvVaw2qhhSnCBWgzwYHi4YPDNlu), p. 159; Michael D. Swords, “Intelligent Motions,” IUR 33, no. 1 (March 2010): 13, 15)

July 28 — Early morning. While napping between shifts as a heavy-equipment operator in the Nevada desert, [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truman_Bethurum&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921791482&usg=AOvVaw1Hj-8zrVvQpnwJ-Q3rtR9w) [Bethurum](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truman_Bethurum&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921791725&usg=AOvVaw3kezld2U0HWyPUHIqpSzr0) is awakened by 8 small men who “seem to be of Latin extraction.” They take him to a nearby flying saucer where he meets the captain, a “gorgeous woman, shorter than any of the men, neatly attired, and also having a Latin appearance: coal black hair and olive complexion. She appeared to be about 42 years old,” although Bethurum learns that she is hundreds of years old. Her name is Aura Rhanes. Her ship is called a “scow,” and her crew is from the planet Clarion, a world that is always on the other side of the moon. He later tells this story and his later adventures in his 1954 book Aboard a Flying Saucer, ghostwritten by Mary Kay Tennison. (Truman Bethurum, Aboard a Flying Saucer, DeVorss, 1954; Clark III 192–194)

July 28 — USAF Maj. Gen. [John A. Samford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921792318&usg=AOvVaw0dHEWK6yyn93fdxrfEp_Yp) secretly orders a deemphasis on or elimination of human anecdotal UFO reports. Instead, they would be “going on instruments,” as worded in his briefing, so that he can close down Blue Book. Technological hurdles and budget limits greatly delay the plan, but Blue Book does transition into a propaganda debunking mission over the next 6 months. (Clark III 813)

July 28 — Late afternoon. [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921792714&usg=AOvVaw1xmor5aXz6p3xrNiXQVtb9) and Maj. Ed Gregory arrive in Washington, D.C., dodging newspaper reporters at the Roger Smith Hotel. Blue Book receives an astonishing total of 50 UFO reports in a single day. UFO inquiries are jamming the Pentagon telephones. Air Force and CIA officials concede that the Soviet Union might take advantage of the confusion. (Ruppelt, [pp. 166–167](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/166/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921793217&usg=AOvVaw1Sn8pklBHzCjkBpcpgoY1v))

July 28 — According to the United Press, the Air Defense Command has alerted jet interceptor pilots to take off instantly in pursuit of any flying saucers. The International News Service amplifies this by quoting the Air Force that orders have been issued to shoot them down if they refuse to land. The Air Force refuses to confirm this, but USAF Deputy Press Officer Lt. Col. [Moncel A. Monts](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/61435014/moncel-adron-monts&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921793618&usg=AOvVaw29fc1q3B4aoC--ERWusbsi) states that “jet pilots are, and have been, under orders to investigate unidentified objects and to shoot them down if they can’t talk them down.” (“[Air Force Alerted for](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93402643/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921793889&usg=AOvVaw0dsyvsBnP3L-RcymlM89Tu) [‘Discs’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93402643/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921794069&usg=AOvVaw2Rmg4JRQknIRN4NipXanun): [Sightings over Washington Put Jets at Ready,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93402831/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921794302&usg=AOvVaw3AVZjxJhsoR_m2hGn2vmF7)” Honolulu Star-Bulletin, July 28, 1952, p. 1; “[Jets on 24-](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/68880923/the-san-francisco-examiner/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921794713&usg=AOvVaw39wQmfhTiOV0Inxm3JtmYM) [Hour Alert to Shoot Down ‘Saucers,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/68880923/the-san-francisco-examiner/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921794953&usg=AOvVaw3ajylz0s4mGRxqmgw58w1w)” San Francisco Examiner, July 29, 1952, p. 2; Shoot 49–50; David Rudiak, “[1952 Flying Saucer ‘Shoot Down’ Stories](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellproof.homestead.com/ShootDown_INS_72952.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921795341&usg=AOvVaw1SrteivLzjseaaQvoamGq0),” Roswell Proof)

July 28 — In charge of jet interceptions over Washington, D.C., during the big UFO flap, USAF Director of Operations Gen. [Roger M. Ramey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/1686367/lt-gen-roger-m-ramey/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921795781&usg=AOvVaw1e0jQGY4gpW4Et3YxuuHco) issues an ambiguous public denial that the interceptors have been ordered to shoot down any saucers. However, newspaper articles and other documents say there was such an order. (David Rudiak, “[Background on Gen. Roger M. Ramey,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellproof.homestead.com/ShootDown_INS_72952.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921796069&usg=AOvVaw3lXdCeV7PSKwV227bP1epd)” June 4, 2013)

July 28 — President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921796330&usg=AOvVaw3BjVBv4ftwLrGFHOHSKXD0)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921796487&usg=AOvVaw3y-iZqQoGO5eRpYFh861cC) resting in Kansas City, Missouri, after the Democratic Convention, calls CIA Director [Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921796760&usg=AOvVaw0vIsUEd5A_3BGqO-M-vUvP) and asks him to investigate the Air Force’s mishandling of the Washington National sightings. Smith later directs, through Deputy Director for Intelligence [Loftus E. Becker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/lawyer-loftus-e-becker-to-us-state-department-in-his-office-news-photo/50709548&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921797117&usg=AOvVaw13acPFGiWbeX4qoH8fKsCM), that a CIA/OSI group be put together to review the USAF UFO intelligence program at ATIC. Truman’s involvement is meant to be kept Top Secret and is not revealed until 1992. (Clark III 1012)

July 28 — Canadian researcher [Wilbert B. Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921797427&usg=AOvVaw1iyR9KwfjPF-ideTh8ikDw) allegedly shows Rear Admiral [Herbert B. Knowles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/121964370/herbert-bain-knowles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921797774&usg=AOvVaw2XnUmTJReSAL6epljAEX4a) a metallic piece from a saucer that was shot down near Washington, D.C. It is twice the size of a man’s thumb and has been loaned to him by the Air Force, but he must return it to the CIA (or another secret agency). (David Rudiak, “[Wilbert B.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellproof.homestead.com/debris8_misc.html%23anchor_3699&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921798182&usg=AOvVaw0bWhjFw9yMXygHz8tg_4sv) [Smith,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellproof.homestead.com/debris8_misc.html%23anchor_3699&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921798435&usg=AOvVaw2q-G9jaOn95utrxQpcb5G3)” Roswell Proof; Frank Edwards, FS Serious Business, Bantam ed., 1966, [pp. 48–49](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersser00edwa/page/48/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921798857&usg=AOvVaw1RP9BHHykY70K4c_hjLZgW); Good Above, [p. 188](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/188/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921799167&usg=AOvVaw2Vhewk39xd3GdjkD9xdmEW))

* * *

July 28 — UK Prime Minister [Winston Churchill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winston_Churchill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921799677&usg=AOvVaw15uwAMCvqeI5c8EoCjW-NZ) writes to [William Sidney](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Sidney%252C_1st_Viscount_De_L%2527Isle&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921800092&usg=AOvVaw25I4AgfUwj3MJx7I4MNP0b), Secretary of State for Air, and scientific adviser and friend [Lord Cherwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_Lindemann%252C_1st_Viscount_Cherwell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921800423&usg=AOvVaw3KRfjFPPEzOaaJS9ywf9nC), saying, “What does all this stuff about flying saucers amount to? What can it mean? What is the truth? Let me have a report at your convenience.” The response, dated August 9, begins: “The various reports about unidentified flying objects, described by the Press as ‘flying saucers,’ were the subject of a full Intelligence study in 1951” \[presumably the report by the Flying Saucer Working Party\]. (“[Records Show](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thecosmicreport.com/records-show-winston-churchills-interest-in-ufos/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921800957&usg=AOvVaw3AmVkjQI6TKw3vu1zxn1h9) [Winston Churchill’s Interest in UFOs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thecosmicreport.com/records-show-winston-churchills-interest-in-ufos/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921801328&usg=AOvVaw1pnJLVgY_8UGXrR71rBLN-)” The Cosmic Report, December 12, 2020; Good Above, [pp. 30](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/30/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921801641&usg=AOvVaw11bOQe8_pD59WQiV1ZKqx7), [448–449](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/448/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921802038&usg=AOvVaw22C6zJUQcrOXuEAXdQPrna); UFOFiles2, [pp. 43–44](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n73/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921802449&usg=AOvVaw2CDj-NaCJ8cSuolq4irMQb))

July 29 — 1:30 a.m. An Air Defense Command radar outside of Osceola, Wisconsin, picks up some unidentified targets.

Four F-51s from St. Paul, Minnesota, are scrambled, but the targets are moving around so quickly that it is impossible to vector in on a single target. The F-51 pilots see many lights; one pilot at 25,000 feet sees an object blaze across the nose of his airplane. Two other pilots vainly try to climb up to a hovering light that is in the same position as the radar targets. ATIC’s Robert M. Olsson and Wendell Swanson explain the radar incident as a temperature inversion and the visual sighting as a meteor. (NICAP, “Clusters of Small Targets and One Large Target”; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1952 July 21st–31st,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-July-21-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921803361&usg=AOvVaw1ioSTyZX9686B5yddTmeGt) [Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-July-21-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921803668&usg=AOvVaw1GQKX9C9UY8MWFi8UlJ-x9), The Author, 2001, pp. 80–85; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921804010&usg=AOvVaw0YQK_ZJ6S1-SYRaUt5XflY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921804214&usg=AOvVaw2lEUoCqCbn1WXeEbYqf3MT) p. 161)

July 29 — Early morning. CAA radar tracks 8–12 UFOs at a time traveling 100–120 mph in a 10-mile arc around Washington, D.C. When an Eastern Airlines pilot tries to check on the radar targets at the request of the CAA at 3:00 a.m., he sees nothing. The targets disappear from CAA radar when the airliner approaches then come back in behind him after he passes through the area. (“[Air Force Debunks ‘Saucers’ As Just ‘Natural Phenomena,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1952/07/30/84338117.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921804702&usg=AOvVaw07hRQ8E1t20Jz6cNKQuLEo)” New York Times, July 30, 1952, pp. 1, 10)

July 29 — 10:00 a.m. President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truman_Bethurum&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921805223&usg=AOvVaw0FdY5kLhsyAKgHTVJG3bw3) tells his air force liaison, [Robert B. Landry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106440/major-general-robert-b-landry/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921805618&usg=AOvVaw2QQghVyF5dJOUnyf_L4NyA)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106440/major-general-robert-b-landry/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921805920&usg=AOvVaw1vFW-OObQip8BvqbmferGF) to find out what is going on with UFOs. Landry calls ATIC and eventually reaches [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921806234&usg=AOvVaw0YT0oMkl3cV1RAt2vIPSg-), who tells him that weather may have caused the radar targets, but there is no proof. He later learns that Truman is listening in. There is some evidence that Truman or Landry soon contact the National Security Council directly to find out how to proceed with the UFO problem. (Ruppelt, [p. 167](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/166/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921806574&usg=AOvVaw2geb2w77Cc50KodUbclwBO); Swords 170)

July 29 — 10:00 a.m. Several employees of Los Alamos Scientific Labs, New Mexico (including Robert B. Leachman, W. Schafer, E. T. Jurney), see a white object moving east to west with a gyrating motion. Two jet interceptors from Kirtland AFB in Albuquerque arrive 5 minutes later. The object disappears but reappears in front of the jets, makes a 360° turn, comes around in back, follows for 2 minutes, then disappears. (NICAP, “[Jets Scrambled from](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520729losalamos_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921807044&usg=AOvVaw0SzvzpcKQEzvawIYygSrYf) [Kirtland](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520729losalamos_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921807312&usg=AOvVaw3p7nWfR2cvl5Jgq8HHejCC)”; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 61–64](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/60/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921807672&usg=AOvVaw37q4a-2gM_84wIU5ljcQx_); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921807955&usg=AOvVaw2DB47gc3Rtldw_2TlOKZTx)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921808172&usg=AOvVaw0-Ye3IeBGCisw5BxOSqoao) p. 161)

July 29 — Four weather observers at Walker AFB \[now closed\] in Roswell, New Mexico, watch several high-speed discs through a theodolite. (Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 114–115](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/114/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921808644&usg=AOvVaw0Ei26d1WFfHdetjAyekEdq); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921808953&usg=AOvVaw0_uJcjfeD-42k6XPvKH5AP), p. 161)

July 29 — An FBI memo from Victor P. Keay on “Flying Saucers” discusses a classified briefing about UFOs by Cmdr.

[Randall Boyd Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://navy.togetherweserved.com/usn/servlet/tws.webapp.WebApp?cmd%3DShadowBoxProfile%26type%3DPerson%26ID%3D520321&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921809422&usg=AOvVaw3nb3OzPCcA3bTLtcBatGce) of the Air Intelligence Estimates Division to [Norman W. Philcox](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/155730842/norman-walter-philcox&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921809798&usg=AOvVaw34aCg13C846TU0ZlmqkH5y)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/155730842/norman-walter-philcox&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921810070&usg=AOvVaw2uqQC8W9_S88qmurKCHBK4) an FBI liaison to the Air Force. The Air Force has “failed to arrive at any satisfactory conclusion” on UFOs. Reports are being received from all parts of the US and distant parts of the world. Boyd explains that USAF has made no progress in ascertaining the nature of UFOs, but it is filing them into three classifications: reports by civilians on the ground, reports by commercial or military pilots, and reports by pilots that are confirmed by radar or ground observations. He concludes by writing that it is “not entirely impossible that the objects sighted may possibly be ships from another planet such as Mars,” but he adds that “air intelligence is fairly certain that these objects are not ships or missiles from another nation in this world.” (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-July-21-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921810510&usg=AOvVaw0WLJPYcJdBOM3PiAGxE-mp) [History: 1952 July 21st–31st, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-July-21-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921810893&usg=AOvVaw0A3IGQnzbWCcTpDuU7UKuI), The Author, 2001, pp. 55–56; ClearIntent, [pp. 175–177](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/174/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921811375&usg=AOvVaw2xL92KkgjXmwnTXc64xW_c))

July 29 — [Ralph L. Clark](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1994/01/28/ralph-clark-dies/a5579bb9-2ac2-400e-8c13-af6cc74befde/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921811873&usg=AOvVaw3acNkL8Bb2E-1NmcHf20-K)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1994/01/28/ralph-clark-dies/a5579bb9-2ac2-400e-8c13-af6cc74befde/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921812198&usg=AOvVaw0TRzMJ4bz5Zzze9SQXGKgs) acting assistant director of the CIA Office of Scientific Intelligence, sends a memo to OSI Deputy Director [Robert Amory Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1989/04/21/obituaries/robert-amory-jr-74-ex-official-of-cia-and-us-budget-bureau.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921812579&usg=AOvVaw3RnhoG2NxFZ4PHxoiO0Fgr)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1989/04/21/obituaries/robert-amory-jr-74-ex-official-of-cia-and-us-budget-bureau.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921812909&usg=AOvVaw3C0VareOnVm3YYOqFLJohc) indicating that the agency will be looking into UFO matters a bit more thoroughly, even though it has been collecting cases for the past three years (since 1949): “a special study group has been formed to review the subject to date. D/CI \[[Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921813292&usg=AOvVaw3w67IugDSkfrV8AIfVE0yV)\] will participate in this study with D/SI \[[H. Marshall Chadwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921813606&usg=AOvVaw3O01lo_gwst45Ri8XE4oy1)\], and a report should be ready about 15 August.” It alludes to his meeting with CIA rocket consultant [Frederick C. Durant](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.thespacereview.com/article/2856/1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921813944&usg=AOvVaw1W9-jL0L0PJnkN77Pojr8R) and others the previous day. (Ralph L. Clark, “[Recent Sightings of Unexplained](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100060002-4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921814333&usg=AOvVaw2Meg7OZF08tmutzrw9MvTG) [Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100060002-4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921814669&usg=AOvVaw3Oj7FHqjyjf88b3uHGkX5I)” July 29, 1952, [reprinted](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921814986&usg=AOvVaw0Ks4yI5Q_7IjlV7mBwVwCc) in “The CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-Related Document Sampler”; Good Above,

[pp. 330](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/330/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921815429&usg=AOvVaw1itohdSJG0FRdjVcneBc8E)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/330/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921815667&usg=AOvVaw2RMDj263-0f9l2LVQNio9Y) [505](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/504/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921816000&usg=AOvVaw0m446y-ogSTUc5_IJba6_N))

July 29 — Robert L. Farnsworth, president of the American Rocket Society, urges President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921816453&usg=AOvVaw2XK-BCvXo7bnAiQxdyI12j) and defense officials to restrain the US armed forces from shooting at UFOs. He says that hostile action might alienate us from “beings of far superior powers.” (Robert L. Farnsworth, \[[Telegram to President Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellproof.homestead.com/Protests_1952.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921816891&usg=AOvVaw2eAs2_fG5IYJ4Hf3-IYiGp)\], July 28, 1952; “[A Pro-Saucer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93410948/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921817205&usg=AOvVaw1oGu4jdGzOS6O7yXrahCFN) [Voice Heard,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93410948/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921817508&usg=AOvVaw3N1aPwCaQ7p1RROOpL8Hgp)” New York Daily News, July 29, 1952, p. 2)

July 29 — An orange, oblong stationary object is observed at the airport in Macdonald, Manitoba, in the south- southwestern sky for 2 minutes. It seems to change into a group of small round lights. They all disappear together. (Jan Aldrich; Project Second Storey)

July 29 — 4:00 p.m. The Air Force holds its largest and longest press conference since the end of World War II. Maj.

Gen. [John A. Samford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921818487&usg=AOvVaw0ECLHMKURPwPO6zR5koFGl)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921818713&usg=AOvVaw0JHL2siqSjHxIXhQQj2jBP) director of USAF intelligence, leads it. He is accompanied by Eighth Air Force Maj. Gen. [Roger M. Ramey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/1686367/lt-gen-roger-m-ramey/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921819080&usg=AOvVaw3pYwvHsfC7IWeGwuqe00A5)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/1686367/lt-gen-roger-m-ramey/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921819357&usg=AOvVaw2zJskIl60kXi6P2YRZ92pM) director of operations and commander of the Eighth Air Force; USAF Col. [Donald L. Bower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49126583/donald-langlitz-bower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921819693&usg=AOvVaw3QT1YS8Cr8kfQbe1Cc8aku), Technical Analysis Division, Air Technical Intelligence Center (ATIC), Wright-Patterson AFB, Dayton, Ohio; Project Blue Book head Capt. [Edward J. Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921820032&usg=AOvVaw1YnhcZi8Gu71Q4D11RcAfV); USAF Capt. [Roy L. James](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/feaf/feafintros.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921820415&usg=AOvVaw0f64BF0cUqT_DIuo1n0G9F), ATIC radar specialist; and [Burgoyne L. Griffing](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/107124036/burgoyne-lee-griffing&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921820773&usg=AOvVaw2Dv6KSo1EnTMFKmXPUaHMm), electronics branch, ATIC. Samford says that the Air Force has been monitoring US air space since 1947. Approximately 20% of UFO reports come from “credible observers of relatively incredible things,” which keeps the Air Force concerned. He explains that the Washington, D.C., sightings earlier in July were caused by “weather phenomena” that caused radar beams to bend and pick up objects on the ground. James offers more technical explanations about temperature inversions that cause radar echoes. Pro-UFO Maj. [Dewey J.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/ufochop2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921821203&usg=AOvVaw3oIlSqUjyZA-zl4UPYxSVt) [Fournet Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/ufochop2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921821494&usg=AOvVaw1WhcEQLnDW2GQN7rgANnto)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/ufochop2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921821719&usg=AOvVaw0DYZR0kNUX68Loi5QwUCbP) USAF public relations officer [Al Chop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/interviews/bios/chop-albert.php&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921822035&usg=AOvVaw36F8cxhYKO5Un6iP4u87iH)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/interviews/bios/chop-albert.php&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921822285&usg=AOvVaw1ULqVZMm-CY_zG-88bjfi1) and Navy radar specialist Lieut. John Holcomb are conspicuous by their absence. (NICAP, “[General Samford’s Press Conference,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/waves/pressconf_1952.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921822623&usg=AOvVaw1wIYYT0zd0YTESe6Bnsii6)” July 29, 1952; Ruppelt, [pp. 168–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/168/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921822999&usg=AOvVaw3XULJqbTat4MMx5U9LgLNg) [169](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/168/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921823366&usg=AOvVaw3ZrBtEuCLQ8Fhy9Ciw9U6e); “[General Samford’s UFO Press Conference, Pentagon, July 29, 1952,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DtcRtkA1Rmvw&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921823698&usg=AOvVaw2cHrLpW4SKGjwMPM5GW8zn)” knightskross YouTube channel, August 3, 2010; “[The Air Force Makes a Pass at the Saucer Stories,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://books.google.com/books?id%3DTFYEAAAAMBAJ%26lpg%3DPP1%26dq%3Dlife%2520magazine%26pg%3DPA35%2523v%253Donepage%26q%26f%3Dtrue&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921824114&usg=AOvVaw0ZW800WLIaOC_upvvf5pOn)” Life 33, no. 6 (August 11, 1952): 35; Swords 159–163; Don Berliner, with Marie Galbreath and Antonio Huneeus, UFO Briefing Document: The Best Available Evidence, Dell, 2000, [pp. 60–63](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufobriefingdocum0000berl/page/60/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921824857&usg=AOvVaw2Dpe78bh-3AxnTZr9ACj_N); Kevin D. Randle, Invasion Washington: UFOs over the Capitol, HarperTorch, 2001, pp. 77–126; Shoot 53–57)

July 29 — 9:15 p.m. Air Force Reserve Lt. Col. [Robert G. LeCompte](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/17567749/robert-g-lecompte&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921825546&usg=AOvVaw2L44vJEvk7hDi6rjoa3rfU) sees a flight of at least 10 luminous objects pass over Albuquerque, New Mexico. At first they appear overhead in no pattern, heading north, then shift to a V formation. They then shift into two rows. (NICAP, “[AF Reserve Colonel Observes Rapid Ellipse](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520729albuquerque_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921826021&usg=AOvVaw3rqy3ef3zxQ81kBSE9BztY)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921826361&usg=AOvVaw1k_tMhS8ksTedZlMQingp9), p. 163; Michael D. Swords, “Intelligent Motions,” IUR 33, no. 1 (March 2010): 13, 15)

July 29 — 9:35 p.m. Marine Pfc Ralph C. Mayher, using 16 mm film exposed at 24 frames per second, obtains footage of a high-speed UFO over Miami Beach, Florida. Retaining a few frames for personal study, Mayher submits the main portion of the film to the Air Force for analysis. The film is never returned, and no analysis report is ever released. Enlargements of a few frames show a fiery looking, roughly circular object, symmetrical, with two small peaks or projection on opposite sides of the disc. The CIA examines the film in 1957 and returns it with no comment or analysis. The Mayher case features prominently in the subsequent lawsuit by Ground Saucer Watch against the CIA and is important because it is a confirmed case of direct interaction of the CIA with a witness, clearly indicating that there was CIA interest in the subject. (NICAP, “[Ralph Mayer / Miami Film](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520729miami_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921827159&usg=AOvVaw2YxxygjOgnqjn0gXglfc5K)”; Ralph Mayer, “[I Proved Flying Saucers Are Real,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1952mayher.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921827492&usg=AOvVaw2a4dAyzv3h6kWM_ok9WTS7)” Pic, June 1954; Good Above, [pp. 355–356](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/354/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921827972&usg=AOvVaw1ob4DkgdyZBRN6IQeXOErH))

July 29 (or July 28) — 9:40 p.m. An Aircraft and Warning Station in Port Huron, Michigan, tracks an unidentified return on radar for 20 minutes. GCI asks Capt. Edward J. Slowinski flying an F-94B on a practice run to investigate. The pilot sees a bright, flashing, colored light in the location of the blip 29 miles west of Port Huron and follows it for 20 minutes. Slowinski is unable to close on the object. (NICAP, “[Key Radar Case (CCL #17)](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520729porthuron_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921828543&usg=AOvVaw2HIH-_bS9Bw0mnfafP20TV)”; Sparks, p. 160; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23radar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921829512&usg=AOvVaw1ZvW6H988dpmCauuIk5PQO)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 72–73; Center for UFO Studies, \[[documents and case files](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1952_07_29_US_MI_Port-Huron_NICAP_Air-to-Air-RV.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921830051&usg=AOvVaw3IFwT5cfD8rWhHo0tvia4a)\])

July 30 — Flight Sgt. Roland Hughes of No. 20 Squadron RAF is on a training flight in a de Havilland Vampire FB-9 jet fighter and returning to base at RAF Oldenburg, Germany, when he sees a “gleaming silver, metallic disc” drop down from above and fly alongside his aircraft for several seconds before speeding off. The object is about 100 feet long. Its surface is shiny “like tinfoil,” highly reflective, and “without a single crease or crinkle in it.” On August 5, Hughes is ordered to fly to RAF Faßberg for further questioning. He arrives and finds a number of officers, including his commander and the UK Minister of Supply, [Duncan Sandys](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duncan_Sandys&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921830629&usg=AOvVaw05Lly7doBPyo0t7QYPMVu0) ([Winston Churchill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winston_Churchill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921831019&usg=AOvVaw1J1raZodrDRgfkaFqMt3U6)‘s son-in- law), who asks Hughes how many beers he had before his saucer sighting. The Air Commanding Officer then reveals that the object had also been tracked on radar going faster than any known aircraft. This convinces Sandys that the case is a serious one, a view that he communicates to [Lord Cherwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_Lindemann%252C_1st_Viscount_Cherwell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921831430&usg=AOvVaw3osLBFj_qKl53FJFaa5Tk_), the government’s chief scientific adviser, in a letter, saying there is “ample evidence of some unfamiliar and unexplained phenomenon.” (UFOFiles2, [pp. 44–46](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n75/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921831896&usg=AOvVaw03rlwZUQufyul3-qLporHf); “[The UFO Sighting That Convinced a Government Minister,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/howaboutthat/ufo/9292417/The-UFO-sighting-that-convinced-a-Government-minister.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921832328&usg=AOvVaw10alw3lrtIpyZNAO1IfWIU)” The Telegraph, May 27, 2012)

July 30 — Gen. [Hoyt Vandenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Vandenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921832926&usg=AOvVaw1wiNpr8gPL2_PeRHGo_Chl) tells the press that, although he does not believe there are flying saucers, he dislikes the “mass hysteria” about them. He says the Air Force has had experts investigating them since the end of World War II and never found anything substantial. (“[‘Double Vision,’ Vandenberg,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93411553/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921833346&usg=AOvVaw12eNep3h7HlZOl_tDFQ48m)” Santa Rosa (Calif.) Press-Democrat, July 31, 1952, p. 6)

* * *

July 30 — 1:10 p.m. [Willie Vaught](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/36454642/willie-i-vaught&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921834110&usg=AOvVaw1YWXe3oqdHi_F-YUnHglGa) of Alexandria, Indiana, sees a strange looking cloud and calls her two teenage daughters ([Laura](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/96294064/laura-n-humphries&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921834525&usg=AOvVaw1tNU_244QWbh_DYGUqT9WE) and [Patsy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/38958136/patsy-l-vaught&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921834930&usg=AOvVaw19wiAvYw01RNz8sSrHpBFB)) and [Laura Oliver](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/193684621/laura-a-oliver&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921835271&usg=AOvVaw233ikYOSZsMSUUAQBdxXtj) to see it. While looking at it, they see six flat, aluminum-like objects streak across the cloud, merge, and disappear within a minute. (“[Alexandria Family Reports Seeing](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93412845/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921835669&usg=AOvVaw2DheyYPIW-DU_sBiZZj0Tl) [‘Flying Saucers,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93412845/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921836003&usg=AOvVaw1n6shcDEtvnqYz0X15rzvV)” Alexandria (Ind.) Times-Tribune, July 31, 1952, p. 1; Herbert S. Taylor, “Mystery Clouds and the UFO Connection,” IUR 29, no. 4 (July 2005): 19)

July 31 — Brig. Gen. [Alfred R. Maxwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106293/brigadier-general-alfred-r-maxwell/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921836582&usg=AOvVaw14RNqV8DS65YIBMygiG7Yx) of the Research and Development Board prepares a memorandum that generally supports the official position that UFO reports contain no information of value, he writes: “The Air Force has made very little progress in learning what the phenomena or objects are.” (Don Berliner and Stanton T. Friedman, Crash at Corona, Marlowe, 1994, [pp. 30–31](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/crashatcoronausm0000berl/page/30/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921837001&usg=AOvVaw12ZsLD7Zid_m47gVVlwvF4))

August — Hollywood producer [Clarence Greene](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clarence_Greene&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921837325&usg=AOvVaw1ccMTTq7mVGV2FhH7OpFO_) and a friend see a “sphere of light” in the sky over Los Angeles, California. Visible for 5 minutes, the object alternately hovers and turns before speeding off over the horizon. The next morning, Greene tells his business partner [Russell Rouse](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russell_Rouse&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921837731&usg=AOvVaw2x5EmgIlUwExrk-ygSQ33i) about the sighting. As he reflects on the experience, he grows ever more irritated by the stigma attached to UFO sightings. (Clark III 1188)

August 1 — 10:51 a.m. An Air Defense Command radar site on Campbell Hill at Bellefontaine, Ohio, tracks a target 20 miles NNW of Wright-Patterson AFB, traveling 500 mph against the wind. It vectors two F-86s piloted by Maj. James B. Smith and Lt. [Donald J. Hemmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81269106/donald-john-hemmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921838318&usg=AOvVaw0T1Nu64Wh7K1_IpPSuj7vx). They make visual contact but climb to 48,000 feet twice without reaching it. Smith gets a weak return on his radar gun sight and shoots a gun camera film of a white or silvery sphere estimated at 60,000 feet. They break off the intercept at 11:13 a.m. about 100 miles west-southwest of Dayton. The film reportedly shows a UFO in the upper right of the frames with noticeable motion to the lower left. Although Blue Book Capt. [Edward J. Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921838710&usg=AOvVaw1Wksq2RESg8-BUDFuQ5YUn)’s assistants Lt. [Anderson G. Flues](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.stltoday.com/news/multimedia/look-back-ufo-sightings/image_7b99baf9-07e8-5407-b231-d7d2bd474abe.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921839251&usg=AOvVaw36j9G40pZRN1vi0zG_kUaN) and Lt. Robert Olsson initially declare the case an “unknown,” Ruppelt changes that evaluation a few weeks later after ATIC Technical Analysis Division Chief Col. [Donald L. Bower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49126583/donald-langlitz-bower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921839696&usg=AOvVaw2DGunrlLcpofOLJtQWBqXS) transfers out, explaining it as two separate but coincidental IFOs—a weather balloon and a jet. Ruppelt goes to great lengths to debunk the case in his ADC briefings to the Robertson Panel. (NICAP, “[Gun Camera R/V Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520801troy_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921840107&usg=AOvVaw03eJJoAwrBiyqC1MznJ4xd)”; Condon, [pp. 161–163](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/160/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921840450&usg=AOvVaw28irgIhEOuim2sMeYbQQMi); Clark III 392–395; Hynek UFO Report, [p. 21](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/20/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921840866&usg=AOvVaw1xL0V5FqVyx2xqkEMIEnMT); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921841186&usg=AOvVaw0kxap-wOWzyy4R5pAkgrS1), p. 165; Patrick Gross, “[The Bellefontaine, Ohio, Radar/Visual/Photographic Case, 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/bellefontaine52.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921841536&usg=AOvVaw3nD42tzdSnGIbxfF4v8Rn5)”; Shoot 71–73; Center for UFO Studies, \[[Blue Book documents and files](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/cases/1952_08_01_US_OH_Bellefontaine_NICAP_Air-to-Air-RV.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921841941&usg=AOvVaw0Msq05XaFMkyzhj4ve7mRY)\])

August 1 — [Edward Tauss](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3005011/edward-tauss&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921842404&usg=AOvVaw371vnz5L5o2w608dMjxPYd)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3005011/edward-tauss&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921842559&usg=AOvVaw0R36X8n74z9u95Az5SiJnT) acting chief of the Weapons and Equipment Division of the CIA’s Office of Scientific Intelligence, writes a letter to OSI Deputy Assistant Director [Ralph L. Clark](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1994/01/28/ralph-clark-dies/a5579bb9-2ac2-400e-8c13-af6cc74befde/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921842970&usg=AOvVaw0X7i6ZzRro2QUFiiY8K2_K)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1994/01/28/ralph-clark-dies/a5579bb9-2ac2-400e-8c13-af6cc74befde/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921843335&usg=AOvVaw23EShcBTHSKuSrLYjH9aUN) saying that less than 100 credible reports remain unexplainable. “interplanetary aspects and alien origin not being thoroughly excluded from consideration.” He recommends the CIA continue to cooperate with ATIC, but “no indication of CIA interest or concern reach the press or public.” (ClearIntent, [p. 123](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/122/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921843717&usg=AOvVaw2rfcgzDF_Cunx2MQ3bwYWe))

August 1 — 8:30–9:00 p.m. We, the People, a 30-minute TV news show produced by Life magazine, devotes its airtime to the recent UFO sightings over Washington, D.C. WNBW-TV, which originates the program, rents a DC-3 airliner, fills it with 20 newsmen, and has the plane circle over Washington, just in case the saucers return. On the ground in the radar room of Washington National Airport there are more newsmen and TV cameras. The show features editors and journalists [Frank Blair](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Blair_(journalist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921844591&usg=AOvVaw3aAh_TLln0BCcYX2PQQ8Lc)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Blair_(journalist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921844904&usg=AOvVaw3z5EBSCeciIoDKwdTyBtTG) [David Brinkley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Brinkley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921845252&usg=AOvVaw3T42SMTGXBDj-MxqVkU_cl)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Brinkley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921845497&usg=AOvVaw1tCb0HhBrq0pyW0IoIzbSC) [Clay Blair](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clay_Blair&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921845812&usg=AOvVaw3OcOJIXOtscsZN3paMx0Ho)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clay_Blair&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921846075&usg=AOvVaw0Qf4IJaHLQ8idsMYDsmLci) and various UFO witnesses. (Curt Collins, “[UFOs on TV: The 1952 Washington, DC Saucer Flap,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2018/07/ufos-on-tv-1952-washington-dc-saucer.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921846496&usg=AOvVaw1Y1HDxRs_sWmBi1mGcHu1C)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, July 5, 2018)

August 1 — 9:50 p.m. Scripps-Howard reporter [Howard Doyle Kline](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/150963009/howard-doyle-kline&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921847144&usg=AOvVaw1k5wnOA33ZYpclty5rM04h) sees a cluster of glowing white objects overhead in Albuquerque, New Mexico. The objects shift around into various patterns, including a perfect V at one point.

Their shifts in position are incredibly swift and fantastically violent, he says. “They made” a flying saucer believer out of me.” He reports the incident to [Lincoln LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921847687&usg=AOvVaw3GlpYVSADOVPuOmNSlYNRG), University of New Mexico meteoriticist, and Col. [William A. Matheny](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/59346824/william-albert-matheny&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921848070&usg=AOvVaw3ZocCvb-HN2P7fMA-1_3_v)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/59346824/william-albert-matheny&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921848365&usg=AOvVaw0NZnJ9o6AMy2XCFcswyK13) commander of the 34th Air Defense Division. The report, which is one probably used in Maj. [Dewey Fournet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/ufochop2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921848687&usg=AOvVaw2vZga5wmOltfSzI5gfo8q9)’s Motion Study, is missing from the Project Blue Book files. (New York World-Telegram, August 2, 1952; UFOEv, [pp. 69–70](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D81%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921849190&usg=AOvVaw04hT1hFIeoi7Qd7JbyOU26); Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-July-21-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921849639&usg=AOvVaw3154LLX4BU-Pl9lVpXjqjY) [1952 July 21st–31st, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-July-21-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921850020&usg=AOvVaw38xxUiLPbUnvijl7zkdXdX), The Author, 2001, p. 95)

August 2 — 3:00 a.m. USAF 1st Lt. W. A. Theil and enlisted man Edwards see a red ball with a trail of blue flame fly straight and level over Lake Charles, Louisiana. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921850575&usg=AOvVaw2lvTQLX2toCqLpzRgBsgXK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921850859&usg=AOvVaw31_J5ncn2fWKd5QOst7XY1) p. 165)

August 2 \[or July 30\] — [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921851327&usg=AOvVaw0L2WOueteLmcMiqbivS-Gl) and his wife Betty are visited in Prescott, Arizona, by two other metaphysics enthusiasts, Alfred C. Bailey and his wife Betty of Winslow, Arizona. This evening, in the course of an automatic-writing experiment using a sort of Ouija board, they receive a message from an extraterrestrial in a spacecraft. In the days and weeks that follow, “Nah-9 of Solar X Group” and many other planetary and star people communicate with them. The space people call earth “Saras.” Nah-9 says that the good men of Saras must unite with good space people to avert a calamity. More Ouija sessions take place through August 17. A message comes through that they will be contacted via radio with an International Morse Code message on August 22.

Bailey approaches a coworker on the Santa Fe Railroad, a ham radio operator named [Lyman Streeter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111409702/lyman-h_-streeter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921851998&usg=AOvVaw13uOCEabRVEUq0hD55hLDY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111409702/lyman-h_-streeter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921852274&usg=AOvVaw2unvmGT9pQfmZKdoplDofN) and asks for

* * *

his help in picking up the space signals. (Clark III 1283; George Hunt Williamson and Alfred C. Bailey, The Saucers Speak! New Age, 1954; Michael D. Swords, “Strange Days,” IUR 30, no. 4 (Aug. 2006): 21–22; Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, pp. 178–181)

August 3 — 3:00 p.m. An Air Force master sergeant on the ship Santa Luisa observes three round, flat, metallic objects hovering at 30,000–40,000 feet some 10 miles away from his position at the mouth of the Rio Guayas near Isla Puná, Ecuador. After 5 seconds, one object dives to the west then turns back northwest. They all disappear after another 5 seconds. (Project 1947, \[[case documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1952_08_03_Puna_Island-EC.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921853559&usg=AOvVaw3oXHB2XZAAJSyoPjNdqG2h)\]; Project 1947, “[UFO Reports, 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1952a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921853935&usg=AOvVaw1wTOQZgeeV4hqSoxa9yXQo)”)

August 3 — 4:15 p.m. Two huge silvery discs are observed visually and tracked on radar for 1 hour and 15 minutes over Hamilton AFB \[now closed\] near Novato, California. The ground observers are pilots Capt. [Leslie R. Hadley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/185176492/leslie-r_-hadley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921854464&usg=AOvVaw0OyLv_krAZHYq7nj16bIVW)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/185176492/leslie-r_-hadley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921854772&usg=AOvVaw1ddtiCAuLmt6lQgjtR53B8) Capt. [Wayne T. Perske](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/105621103/wayne-t-perske&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921855129&usg=AOvVaw1KyPD1VQOfqfNDIOFqnreO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/105621103/wayne-t-perske&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921855420&usg=AOvVaw2x4arx9GwMK4ehFNYwM5gd) and 2d Lt. [Duane A. Swimley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/82411150/duane-a_-swimley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921855789&usg=AOvVaw2yHzy44TACMzAvlx-WGrrC)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/82411150/duane-a_-swimley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921856083&usg=AOvVaw1cOvkW36qgP52mNpPJOdTG) They dive at each other and maneuver as if in a dogfight. After F-86s are dispatched to intercept, 6 more objects appear, take up a diamond formation, and accelerate out of sight. (NICAP, “[Eight Huge Objects Observed by 8 Witnesses and Radar](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520803hamilton_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921856465&usg=AOvVaw0OSEfYjx-XQkpVp5dFnSvU)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921856774&usg=AOvVaw33AhYsanrTXCMQgKmg84iq), p. 165; Project 1947, “[Hamilton Air Force Base, Hamilton, California, August 3, 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1952_08_03_hamafb.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921857136&usg=AOvVaw0ZDMzaBtjoMMXG8YSp0aXF)”; Project 1947, \[[Blue Book documents and](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520803hamilton_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921857472&usg=AOvVaw1zxkvVBhTUec8sWtdjLcd8) [files](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520803hamilton_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921857782&usg=AOvVaw2ZQB75vAOddemUbUUF_AKx)\]; Michael D. Swords, “Intelligent Motions,” IUR 33, no. 1 (March 2010): 14, 15)

August 3 — 10:20 p.m. Civilian engineer Paul L. Anderson sees 3 light-green cylindrical objects at Truth or Consequences, New Mexico. They are hovering at 45° elevation in an inverted-V formation, switching to echelon when one object moves with a rolling motion along its long axis. It disappears by rapidly rising vertically. The observation lasts 9 minutes. (NICAP, “[Three Cylindrical Objects Observed by Engineers](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520803truth_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921858487&usg=AOvVaw2_84NwoEhNc8rVDZvjZJbh)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921858792&usg=AOvVaw1NuhYfraqo4nrJmfCUyRTk), p. 165; Michael D. Swords, “Intelligent Motions,” IUR 33, no. 1 (March 2010): 14, 15)

August 5 — 12:25 a.m. A trio of brilliant white dots of indefinite shape, at an altitude of an estimated 5,000 feet, passes over Westover AFB \[now Westover Reserve Air Base\] in Chicopee, Massachusetts. The second object is half the size of the first, and the third is half the size of the second one. The first one resembles an automobile headlight. The appearance of other two is not given. The three are in a triangular formation. No jet activity is recorded over the airbase at the time and witnesses say the objects are moving “faster than jets.” (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921859630&usg=AOvVaw1dSNNSfrdBIMTR4LM4XGj6) [History: 1952, August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921859992&usg=AOvVaw3kubaaK9C_83Vj1Xc-tnSj)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921860274&usg=AOvVaw0Ax3VFKCZjMbBFGpBg6grO) The Author, 1986, p. 23)

August 5 — Day. During a daylight observation of Venus, astronomer [James C. Bartlett Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Bartlett_pending.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921860800&usg=AOvVaw0EfVf-50UMYH_cx1aoeb5F) watches two discs fly overhead in a southerly direction at Baltimore, Maryland. They move away to the east, then two more objects with dome-like protrusions in the center fly past. (“[Two Huge UFOs Sighted by Baltimore Astronomer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/005%2520AUG-SEPT%25201958.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921861294&usg=AOvVaw0nBpKFdakVgKR6X8QH4wyo)” UFO Investigator 1, no. 5 (Aug./Sept. 1958): 1, 3)

August 5 — 9:46–12:00 midnight. A visual sighting is made at 9:46 p.m. by an observer on the ground at Manassas, Virginia, who spots a brilliant oval flying south. About 10:50 p.m., Andrews AFB in Maryland picks up two unidentified blips moving slowly and steadily away from Washington, D.C., on a course toward Mount Vernon, Virginia. Minutes later the fluorescent screens at Andrews show two more UFOs to the east of the field moving for a short distance, stopping, and then moving again. The speed of the targets is a slow 60 mph. The height of the targets is unknown. Planes from both Andrews AFB and Bolling AFB are sent up to investigate but rainy weather forces them to turn back after they reach 15,000 feet altitude. Around 12:00 midnight yet another target appears on radar, and jets from New Castle AFB in Delaware are scrambled. The jets see no UFOs when they arrived over Washington; however, a spokesman for Andrews radar tells the press that “no radar sightings were made while the planes were overhead.” (“[Flock of ‘Saucer’ Objects Again Puzzles Wash. DC,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93432794/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921862109&usg=AOvVaw1AScXPwjuT71zPkmuZ288_)” Visalia (Calif.) Times-Delta, August 6, 1952, p. 1; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921862614&usg=AOvVaw1stghmFTJWVEtwYhaOAmgH)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921862897&usg=AOvVaw3OSRD1nQWlTesvilDNMyEh) The Author, 1986, pp. 23–24)

August 5 — 10:45 p.m. Eight residents of Camden, New Jersey, report a bright, round, orange object hovering or moving slowly in the western sky. (“[8 City Residents Report ‘Saucers’ on Nocturnal Sweep through Sky,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93433118/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921863444&usg=AOvVaw1QhYUqNPWogRCZXuMixua0)” Camden (N.J.) Courier-Post, August 6, 1952, p. 16)

August 5 — 11:45 p.m. A complex radar-visual sighting takes place at Haneda AFB \[later Tokyo International Airport\], Japan. Control tower operators watch a disc as it passes over Tokyo Bay at about 1,500 feet. It is a dark round shape surrounded by a bright light with a curved outer edge and smaller lights around it. While being tracked on radar, a scramble alert is issued at 11:55 p.m., and an F-94 Starfire jet from nearby Johnson Air Base \[now Iruma Air Base\] in Sayama, Saitama Prefecture, goes after the object. The interceptor, piloted by 1Lt. [Wesley R. Holder](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65715214/wesley-r-holder&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921864174&usg=AOvVaw2vdOSjQ8wsOH__ys7Mpees) and Radar Observer 1Lt. Aaron M. Jones Jr., chases the object, which speeds away while being tracked by onboard radar. During the next 30 minutes, the UFO disappears and reappears throughout the sky, vanishes when the jet closes in, performs intricate maneuvers, and at one point splits into three radar targets. The jet searches over Tokyo Bay until 12:33 a.m. when it is recalled. (NICAP, “[F-94 Pilots Tracked Object for 90 Seconds](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520805haneda_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921864659&usg=AOvVaw2OzwQKl95NO5Pn0XrChsMb)”; Ruppelt, [pp. 187–189](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/186/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921865017&usg=AOvVaw2q_W3eVUZz2Mgldz_pOYWz); Condon, [pp. 123–126](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/122/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921865286&usg=AOvVaw1WR9BAIXFThiBmwaKxejZS); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921865471&usg=AOvVaw0ZcVD9EplWYbAVJYIw5Xqq), p. 166; Martin L. Shough, “Radar and the UFO,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, pp. 217–219; Patrick Gross, “[The Haneda AFB Case, Japan, August 5, 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/haneda.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921865775&usg=AOvVaw2yOA88FyWR3b2rIMayRBcW)”)

August 6 — [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921866083&usg=AOvVaw3qe3cgpj8bAoITUSwditiy) sends Project Blue Book a report on his interviews with 45 astronomers about their opinions on UFOs at a June meeting of the American Astronomical Society and finds that five (11%) have seen a UFO, seven are

* * *

indifferent to the subject, more express at least some interest, and a few are very interested but wary of publicity. (J. Allen Hynek, “[Special Report on Conferences with Astronomers on Unidentified Aerial Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.fold3.com/image/1/11883955&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921866587&usg=AOvVaw1s5suLL3IvXx1lKODCvfLe)” August 6, 1952; “[Seven Status Reports for Project Stork, Part 2,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cufon.org/cufon/stork1-7a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921866792&usg=AOvVaw1GZFkgp_z3z_qDDlsLNPvV)” CUFON; “[Seven Status Reports for Project Stork, Part 3,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cufon.org/cufon/stork1-7b.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921867033&usg=AOvVaw3504zcZRMiwc_HD-Eyxi9o)” CUFON; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921867288&usg=AOvVaw3mbnVAZgVNBtJzU7awYybD), The Author, 1986, pp. 83–85)

August 6 — 9:00 p.m. James J. Allen sees a UFO 6 feet high, 8 feet long, and lighted inside strike the chimney of his home in West Lumberton, North Carolina. It crashes into his backyard. When he approaches it, the lights go off and he sees a man about 30 inches tall standing next to it. He asks if he is hurt, then the figure reenters the vehicle and it zooms away. (“[West Lumberton Event Added](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/58948450/the-robesonian/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921867693&usg=AOvVaw1sGi-1PLPBY24ZbHHGkHNN) [to Growing ‘Saucer’ Reports,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/59021152/the-robesonian/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921867968&usg=AOvVaw136hAcJulGX6sbP0FvzQPj)” Lumberton (N.C.) Robesonian, August 7, 1952, pp. 1, 4; Clark III 326; Curt Collins, “[James J. Allen’s Alien Encounter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2018/01/james-j-allens-alien-encounter.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921868357&usg=AOvVaw08twe3B7usixeNnLh8EoAe) [Embarrassment: Aug. 6, 1952,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2018/01/james-j-allens-alien-encounter.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921868589&usg=AOvVaw2M7vAr8aK7-v5_zREhcpUs)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, January 19. 2018)

August 7 — 12:02 a.m. At Kerkrade, Netherlands, marine engineer Will Jansen watches a domed object swoop down to a low altitude, hover, zigzag, then speed away. He sees a similar object hovering further away. It finally tilts up vertically and shoots out of sight. (UFOEv, [p. 122](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D134%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921869013&usg=AOvVaw0OG35i63mqEcqUdW-nU69w))

August 7 — 9:08 a.m. Mrs. Susan Pzuhl (or Pfuhl) observes over San Antonio, Texas, four round UFOs that give off a color similar to white-hot metal. The objects appear to be approximately 18 inches in diameter and are observed one at a time at intervals of approximately 20 minutes. With the exception of one object that moves slowly, the speed must have been 3 times as fast as a propeller-driven aircraft. No sound can be heard. Their maneuvers consist of radical directional change by the first object, straight and level flight by the second object, a slight directional change by the third object, and a large circular maneuver by the fourth object. An aircraft passes under the fourth object with no apparent reaction by the plane or the object. It vanishes suddenly like an extinguished light. Duration is 70 minutes. (NICAP, “Four 18ʺ UFOs Observed”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921869680&usg=AOvVaw1GBV6hHAii186Modzzqcwr)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921869897&usg=AOvVaw048lGbusQydp-pjPGpYC0f) p. 166)

August 7 — 3:00 p.m. Two Ground Observer Corps skywatchers in Silverton, Oregon, [Ida Pfeifer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/179055768/ida-elizabeth-pfeifer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921870313&usg=AOvVaw2EEYUk4Lx3SrSAxhd-B8Fb) and Dorothy Sthamann, see an aluminum-colored object 3 miles away that appears at first triangular, then more saucer shaped. Army and air observers in Portland confirm that jet interceptors are at that moment in pursuit of the object. Replacement skywatchers [Sadie Barkhurst](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/91684694/sadie-e-barkhurst&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921870603&usg=AOvVaw0JkhrwNvHVooWq5KuE5bih) and Mrs. Olaf Teglund also see the object at 5:00 p.m. All agree that the UFO is headed east at a moderate speed, but darts “fiercely” toward the interceptor when it approaches. (“[Flying Saucer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93434942/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921870915&usg=AOvVaw3xHCrpf8VAOcl3PNreBMTk) [at Silverton,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93434942/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921871092&usg=AOvVaw0tBOx4p4taIv6Vnbyz8bJu)” Salem (Oreg.) Capital Journal, August 9, 1952, p. 14)

August 8 — A special CIA/Office of Scientific Intelligence team consisting of [Philip Grandin Strong](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49359563/philip-grandin-strong&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921871501&usg=AOvVaw2TcJ7CFmLJvetvSuqicdvX)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49359563/philip-grandin-strong&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921871687&usg=AOvVaw0SxJCrUvAKNb2UDzCFufFG) Ransom L. Eng, and [Frederick C. Durant](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.thespacereview.com/article/2856/1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921871895&usg=AOvVaw3YyxpysqkpDtEFa1SVtQlh) visits Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio for a comprehensive briefing about UFOs from Blue Book staff. This classified visit is in response to secret orders from President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921872188&usg=AOvVaw2_wOLCeWmrTmcI02WVJAww) to the CIA to investigate the Air Force’s mishandling of UFOs during the Washington National Airport cases. (CUFON, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921872520&usg=AOvVaw2P2C4fmISQdp7EKEtRLMRZ) [CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-Related Document Sampler, Part 1 of 2 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921872796&usg=AOvVaw10eBIqJzgm5I1KvELga4CG)” May 17, 1996; Clark III 397; Swords 172–173)

August 9 — 1:45 a.m. A/3C [Joseph F. Raley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/73773013/joseph-f_-raley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921873180&usg=AOvVaw1c0ZQdVSuIl1WW6KL_c6q2) is walking to work at Lake Charles Air Force Station \[now closed\] in Lake Charles, Louisiana, when he observes a disc-like object from a distance away of 3,000–5,000 feet. The object is at an estimated altitude of 5,000 feet. It moves several hundred mph faster than any known jet aircraft. No sound is heard. The object is first seen moving north to south until it crosses the air station, where it stops and hovers for approximately 2 seconds, then takes off to the west. (NICAP, “[Faster-Than-Jet Disc Stops, Hovers Two Seconds,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520809lakecharles_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921873510&usg=AOvVaw2fD7YFpA_OnVQlpbTcHvDa) [Accelerates](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520809lakecharles_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921873749&usg=AOvVaw0UKHkCAy1i4o_GIot1E4cE)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921873988&usg=AOvVaw2bHM1E-z8O5NT0s_JH5sFg)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921874176&usg=AOvVaw1G0arSP6WgQMLgrckF5TYt) p. 167)

August 10 — 5:38 p.m. Roy E. Munson is resting in his hammock at 1231 Widergren Drive, Rockford, Illinois, when he sees a disc-shaped object moving west to east and streaking across the sky in 6 seconds. Within minutes, another appears on the same flight path. Some family members and neighbors join him to watch the objects, which keep appearing for the next 90 minutes by which time a total of 54 have gone by. Munson alerts the CAA operator at the Rockford airport, who calls O’Hare Airport in Chicago, which sends two USAF jet interceptors to the area. They appear just as the last of the discs, which seem surrounded by a haze, disappears. Of the 54 objects, 36 appear larger that the others and move faster. Fifty follow the straight west-to-east path out of sight. Three deviate from the path to the north, and one deviates to the south. (NICAP, “[Rockford, Illinois, Monday, August 11,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/rockford520811dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921874634&usg=AOvVaw2WP5oRDQYBtI_C6LvYlx5J) [1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/rockford520811dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921874947&usg=AOvVaw2eVf6dt7i1gwMMvwdu08wA)”)

August 11 — A CIA memo refers to a meeting of the newly created study group on UFOs attended by eight operatives. (Central Intelligence Agency, “[Minutes of Branch Chief’s Meeting of 11 August 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100020014-5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921875398&usg=AOvVaw2ldVNTgXB77WsEupe_TIfm)”; CUFON, “[The CUFON](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921875709&usg=AOvVaw2P8cfFJhICfb4Bie0dpDeL) [1952 CIA UFO-Related Document Sampler, Part 1 of 2 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921876023&usg=AOvVaw2aKIX_qb4EqTf6owixoTEL)” May 17, 1996; Swords 173)

August 12 — 1:43 a.m. An Air Force F-94B jet fighter from Dover AFB in Delaware is flying at 20,000 feet when both the pilot and his radar crewman sight a glowing object 45° to their left and at a lower altitude, with the waters of the Delaware Bay as a dark backdrop. Curious, the jet pilot adjusts his course and heads directly at the object, which is stationary. In an apparent reaction, the object loses some of its brilliance and diminishes in size, apparently moving away. The pilot determines that the object had halted above Cape May, New Jersey, where it

* * *

again hovers. Without success, the pilot tries to raise the local CCI station on the radio on F channel to request a radar scan of the Cape May area. Low on fuel, the pilot cannot pursue the UFO any further, so he breaks off the chase and heads for home. The UFO follows the jet, increasing in apparent size as it draws near and overtakes it. Eventually, the UFO loses interest and flies away to the south. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921876628&usg=AOvVaw00_EQ8h5Ba5KDrARCnK-h-), The Author, 1986, p. 36)

August 13 — Around 7:00 p.m. Two civilians in the Tampa, Florida, area watch three UFOs. One object changes its course abruptly to the west, moving in excess of 600 mph. The same object hovers for about 5 minutes then moves at an excessive rate back to the east and resumes its course to the north and disappears. The two other objects do not alter course but disappear to the north. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921877009&usg=AOvVaw1VyZGppzxjAFkOkE1amd1d)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921877182&usg=AOvVaw0_koEMYs4eqMUfpw2qf5XK) The Author, 1986, p. 39)

August 13 — Night. Pioneer Airlines pilot Capt. Max M. Jacoby sees a mystery light while on a routine test flight out of Dallas Love Field, Texas. He tries to intercept it, but the light evades him and disappears. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921877654&usg=AOvVaw37Y-ocTi7-mutpzZt_MA4w) [a History: 1952, August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921877951&usg=AOvVaw3i1IhZlmainoBC-j0g_YSr)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921878108&usg=AOvVaw34AnE4R3Ek02lSYiP1Pl9T) The Author, 1986, p. 39)

August 13 — 9:10 p.m. A witness in Oakland, California, calls Hamilton AFB \[now closed\] in Novato to notify them he is watching “two balls of fire” making a 10-mile circle and leaving in the direction of Hamilton. When the report is made to Capt. [Kenneth Broden](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69038388/kenneth-broden&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921878497&usg=AOvVaw0EfoIlDiCsTQJWxWABghHE)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69038388/kenneth-broden&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921878751&usg=AOvVaw16L4ffr9QpHn8kQcyaSXkR) Hamilton AFB Airdrome Officer, he orders an F-94 jet scrambled to search the bay between Oakland and the air base. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921879106&usg=AOvVaw19AO2cPSXAUF3yZUffCJT8), The Author, 1986, p. 39)

August 13 — 9:45 p.m. In Tokyo, Japan, US Marine Corps pilot Maj. [James D. McGough](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/115912870/james-deasy-mcgough&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921879593&usg=AOvVaw3h_28RanVhXf-KObJUf3V7) sees an orange light fly a left orbit at 8,000 feet and 230 mph, then spiral down to no more than 1,500 feet, remain stationary for 2–3 minutes, and go out. An attempted interception is unsuccessful. (NICAP, “[Orange Light Maneuvers Then Stops in Mid-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520813tokyo_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921879991&usg=AOvVaw2ZqHA0fXd33-oHOnolaT02) [Air](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520813tokyo_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921880268&usg=AOvVaw10wHsHJ5OI0hqJ_jeWuIdo)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921880486&usg=AOvVaw1Q_tx9OGrX-_IqOuFcrdMU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921880630&usg=AOvVaw3ttrywldX56DkXIoB-0xJu) p. 167)

August 13 — 11:10 p.m. USAF Reserve Capt. Stanley W. Thompson sees a formation of lighted objects flying rapidly over Tucson, Arizona. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921881021&usg=AOvVaw0uH1tgmIlskoq-UOMW2_V8), The Author, 1986, p. 39)

August 14 — Australian Minister for Air [William McMahon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_McMahon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921881467&usg=AOvVaw0VWnswcnbR83uKFbxz55dV) states facetiously in Parliament that flying saucer reports are “probably based on flights of imagination,” but indicates he will “cause a thorough investigation to be made.” (Swords 376)

August 14 — The CIA’s special UFO study group meets for the first time and is given a summary (probably written by [A.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/85827067/alexander-ray-gordon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921881912&usg=AOvVaw39jYEisGDjWtvm2mhre4xC) [Ray Gordon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/85827067/alexander-ray-gordon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921882219&usg=AOvVaw3sa4dq6lbQjWM-712RMGdW)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/85827067/alexander-ray-gordon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921882480&usg=AOvVaw1ox9UlidJuTtkzvbSecuf_) project officer of the CIA’s Physics and Electronics Branch) of UFO history, an analysis of Project Blue Book, and a discussion of explained sightings and theories about unexplained sightings. (Central Intelligence Agency, “[Flying Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100020013-6.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921882801&usg=AOvVaw1Ki7NK6_Eg37bLxDUb847P)” August 14, 1952; Good Above, [pp. 331–333](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/330/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921883042&usg=AOvVaw2CesxOwTN3BUn5WviPEG2F))

August 14 — 7:20 p.m. People on the docks of Phillippeville \[modern Skikda\], Algeria, see an enormous red disc leaving behind a greenish trail. At 9:15 p.m., two people in Constantine, Algeria, watch a luminous object flying at high speed. It emits a bright light. (ClearIntent, [p. 122](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/122/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921883349&usg=AOvVaw2weoY1KdG2Qmqe-pVHG901))

August 14 — 10:30 p.m. A yellow ball of light undulates up and down and from side to side over the Mathieson chemical plant in Lake Charles, Louisiana. It is also seen to shoot ahead abruptly and come to a halt in the same manner.

Witnesses estimate that the ball passes over at 5,000 feet, growing fainter and fainter as it moves away. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921883871&usg=AOvVaw2VWen--gHuOP2EahH7zdGI), The Author, 1986, p. 43)

Mid-August — 10:30 p.m. [John D. Moorman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/151329100/john-daggett-moorman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921884229&usg=AOvVaw0e_R_fN5Y6lVEHWo_OEOXM), deputy sheriff of Starke County, is fishing in a boat with [Surphin Casper](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/56081712/surphin-casper&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921884470&usg=AOvVaw11XK0u5f6AtMbaoSUsDRZp) on the Tippecanoe River about 3 miles northwest of Monterey, Indiana. Moorman looks up and sees 7–8 objects hovering. They watch for a few seconds until the objects move away to the west. About half of them return east momentarily, and all of them disappear by blinking out. (NICAP case file)

August 15 — 4:20 a.m. Ground Observer Corps observers in Davis, California, see a rainbow-colored, round object hovering in the air. Soon they notice eight more objects of a strange appearance. At 5:30 a.m., two more UFOs are seen, one moving west while the other moves east. The Air Force scrambles a F-94 jet interceptor to search the area at altitudes of 10,000–20,000 feet. The military claims the pilot can see nothing unusual, although the GOC spotters say that the UFOs and the jet are both visible in the sky at the same time and possibly at the same altitude. At 5:00 a.m., in Napa, California, GOC post observer Diane Robinson sights a “cigar-shaped silver thing” traveling at tremendous speed at 10,000 feet toward the southwest. (Loren E.
