Gross, [UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921884941&usg=AOvVaw3nzlGdlcQlyHdocxj8eAo7) [1952, August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921885135&usg=AOvVaw14mxgBBPL_xEYS2Xo39Xl6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921885302&usg=AOvVaw1WtAQgdfuhvt9YrbuzeFmu) The Author, 1986, p. 43)

August 15 — CIA operative [Frederick C. Durant](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.thespacereview.com/article/2856/1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921885777&usg=AOvVaw1rRyGXeC6jVxyyhpbKa-38) \[and/or Ransom L. En\] writes a top-secret draft memo for DCI [Walter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921886115&usg=AOvVaw2O-kPpG__hgJMAjiTcxTLS) [Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921886387&usg=AOvVaw0OfPNF_LUh3qzdnF9fpgKE) on the OSI teams visit to Wright-Patterson AFB and a summary of its findings. It offers an analytical description of UFOs going back to the 1946 Scandinavian ghost rockets. It rules out the possibility of Russian secret weapons and mentions the sightings at Los Alamos and Oak Ridge at a time when the “background radiation count had risen inexplicably. Here we run out of even ‘blue yonder’ explanations that might be tenable, and, we still are left with numbers of incredible reports from credible observers.” Yet “even though we might admit that intelligent life may exist elsewhere and that space travel is possible, there is no shred of evidence to

* * *

support this theory at present.” (Central Intelligence Agency, “[Flying Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100020012-7.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921887033&usg=AOvVaw2FROPi09l4r1HoDH94PNxd)” August 15, 1952; CUFON, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921887355&usg=AOvVaw3Rel9l6CQ7oo0N782xP7xQ) [CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-Related Document Sampler, Part 1 of 2 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921887643&usg=AOvVaw33F4vC0r_kRCjTvh97wJe9)” May 17, 1996; Clark III 397; Swords 172–173)

August 15 — RAAF Flight Lt. William H. Scott, chief test pilot of the Government Aircraft Factories, is flying a de Havilland Vampire jet between 35,000 and 36,000 feet near Rockhampton, Queensland. Looking east toward the coast, he sees a large, circular light at a lower elevation. It is the color of an ordinary incandescent light bulb.

After about 60 seconds, 6–10 smaller lights break off from the main light, surrounding it for 2 minutes before disappearing. After another 2 minutes, the big light also disappears. (Swords 376)

August 19 — The CIA/OSI study group prepares an internal 6-page document of its findings. It has made a study of the Soviet press that shows “not one report or comment” about UFOs, which indicates official censorship. It perceives a danger that the Russians might try to infiltrate civilian UFO groups (such as Civilian Saucer Investigation of Los Angeles) or add UFO disinformation during a nuclear attack: “We give Russia the capability of delivering an air attack against us, yet at any given moment now, there may be a dozen official unidentified sightings plus many unofficial.” It briefs CIA Director [Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921888531&usg=AOvVaw3UI00E0SKN328jyXl5Rmtw) on August 20. (Central Intelligence Agency, “[Flying Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100020012-7.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921888922&usg=AOvVaw2lguDKeHiuDTmH1PdXwx1f)” August 19, 1952; CUFON, “[The CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-Related Document Sampler,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921889195&usg=AOvVaw2v2dkbA_xMyf0HevkPGenw) [Part 1 of 2 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921889437&usg=AOvVaw3ePJHujIFiDr28Y5B4W1gp)” May 17, 1996; Clark III 1013; Swords 174)

August 19 — 2:38 p.m. Ground Observer Corps observer Albert Lathrop sees two objects shaped like fat bullets flying straight, level, and fast over Red Bluff, California. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921889806&usg=AOvVaw0XIuShs11xEq4nSJLJdBt7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921890041&usg=AOvVaw2-d2oCWTykZDpT_pD0O02e) p. 167)

August 19 — 8:00 p.m. An oval disc is seen above Boron Air Force Station \[now closed\] in Boron, California. Two jet fighters are guided into the area by Capt. [Ralph J. Borgerson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3553913/ralph-john-borgerson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921890493&usg=AOvVaw2M1Jix7BTTa3Ia6FGYN1DS) at the base, but the object speeds away to the east as they close in. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921890905&usg=AOvVaw3tyEnoZ0SdjYGHXOtqn-br), The Author, 1986, p. 49; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921891239&usg=AOvVaw3ZSbrGkkyaXC8dwuHd2qs9), p. 167)

August 19 — About 10:00 p.m. Scoutmaster D\[unham\] S\[anborn\] “Sonny” DesVergers is driving with three scouts on the edge of the Everglades south of West Palm Beach, Florida, when he sees a light in a wild palmetto grove. The boys do not see it, so he drives on. Another boy admits he has seen a light in that direction too, so DesVergers returns to the spot and goes into the grove, telling the boys to stay in the car unless he is delayed. Soon all three boys see red lights flashing in the grove. This alarms them, and they go to a nearby house for help. They return to see DesVergers staggering out of the grove, incoherently saying he has been zapped into semiconsciousness by some kind of red flare coming from a hatch in a red ball of light (and burns his cap as well). An area of flattened and burned grass is found after the event. DesVergers has a reputation as a prankster and hopes to monetize his story somehow, but the scouts do corroborate his story and there are physical traces. Grass samples from the site sent to the Air Force show root damage extending 4 inches or more into the soil, suggesting overheating, possibly by microwave radiation. [Karl Pflock](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_T._Pflock&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921891895&usg=AOvVaw2Sn9lwkNY0-Ldrf7Pkisl6) thinks it is a hoax, but [Jerry Clark](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerome_Clark&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921892235&usg=AOvVaw0r8--nSwVpEyfBLVLST9nS) isn’t 100% sure. (NICAP, “[Florida](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/scoutmas.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921892596&usg=AOvVaw2GL8AEZdGf8iacx_iq2_xa) [Scoutmaster Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/scoutmas.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921892892&usg=AOvVaw0CDosX1Zr-jvz7vMhOOUvL)”; “[Attack by Flying Saucer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93449895/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921893183&usg=AOvVaw1ZXKL9Mqv4KmYKL9Vn8NH9) [Described by Scoutmaster,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93450016/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921893439&usg=AOvVaw3gAhSXqsrOJh-xKSfZQS_9)” Miami (Fla.) Daily News, August 24, 1952, pp. 1A, 4A; “[‘Line Forms at Left’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93449572/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921893844&usg=AOvVaw1Z0h0r24J7L9DvmBN-ygBR) [for That Saucer Yarn,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/43214689/the-miami-news/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921894065&usg=AOvVaw0J7sYDMVx0FDV98hlXuUE_)” Miami (Fla.) Daily News, August 25, 1952, p.

1A; “[Boy Scout Wants New Saucer Hunt,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93449087/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921894467&usg=AOvVaw2qwfMm7YZXXz_TS88nngs0)” Miami (Fla.) Daily News, August 26, 1952, p. 2A; “[‘Saucer’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93448814/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921894731&usg=AOvVaw3iJiPX9vH6R6OdMDAPTIHf) [Witnesses](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93448814/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921894921&usg=AOvVaw2nofoMHhttKaeqwlQ3JjJw) [Talking,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93448912/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921895089&usg=AOvVaw2wkj6rCp-QJ70j0fJ2eVLV)” Miami (Fla.) Daily News, August 27, 1952, pp. 1A, 8A; Clark III 496–498; Ruppelt, [p. 176](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/176/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921895387&usg=AOvVaw1IBxFm7bClppKUd4wo8c88); Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1952 August, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921895613&usg=AOvVaw1ZAlADSzaBxmhP8c-oCjAi), The Author, 2001, pp. 115–119; Story, [pp. 128–131](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/128/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921895864&usg=AOvVaw2vtgJuV7WkZ_7q2yHf6T8t); Jenny Randles, UFO Reality, p. 143; Karl T. Pflock, “[The Best](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bhoax.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921896104&usg=AOvVaw0XwaHS2c2Gi1xjMkOOBnzL) [Hoax in UFO History?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bhoax.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921896282&usg=AOvVaw31HgSkFkaJ2j3QJU3hZGr_)” 1997; “[The Scoutmaster’s Tale,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/thescoutmasterstale.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921896495&usg=AOvVaw3V5nArOerLCEC4BdivKK-c)” Saturday Night Uforia, March 27, 2013)

August 20 — The CIA/OSI UFO study group briefs CIA Director [Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921896775&usg=AOvVaw1FSuc8k44J-kMoPx6AqU4w)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921896942&usg=AOvVaw0cOOHzQ3trueKNjGEqP5kN) who then orders the preparation of a National Security Council Intelligence Directive for submission to the NSC stating the need for a UFO investigation. (H. Marshall Chadwell, “[Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100020008-2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921897254&usg=AOvVaw0-CduszpmIKXhEPCDNxt56)” December 2, 1952)

August 20 — Air Defense Command radar at Congaree AFB \[now McEntire Joint National Guard Base\], southeast of Columbia, South Carolina, tracks a target traveling more than 4,000 mph some 60 miles from the base. (NICAP, “[ADC Tracks Object at 4,000 MPH](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520820congaree_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921897660&usg=AOvVaw0e8Y0lB8Xnemk-gGI1Fhb8)”; UFOEv, [p. 78](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D90%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921897998&usg=AOvVaw3Fx7i_6uQAziQAJ5h9hsVG))

August 21 — 10:10 p.m. Ground Observer Corps Supervisor D. C. Scott spots a yellowish-white light flying in the sky at 2,000 feet northeast of Elgin, Illinois. Several times it rises to 5,000 feet in three minutes, hovers, then descends again. Scott alerts Capt. Everett A. Turner at the Chicago Filter Center, who tells him to call again when the light settles down. After one hour and 23 minutes the light begins to hover, Scott calls Turner again, and Turner has at least one F-86 Sabre jet scrambled from O’Hare Airport in Chicago. The pilot makes four passes between 10,000 and 2,000 feet. On the fourth pass, it heads directly toward the light, which blinks out. (“[Jets Pursue Mystery](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93453893/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921898489&usg=AOvVaw0frMNtyvjhIQGTxlH5-TYz) [Light,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93453893/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921898746&usg=AOvVaw28e6KAV3M6fAS8Tt5VB4RW)” Carbondale Southern Illinoisan, August 23, 1952, p. 1; UFOEv, [p. 66](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D78%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921899209&usg=AOvVaw12WljhydjDdYU_iQGPJHE_); Shoot 102–103)

August 22 — George G. Carey, CIA assistant director for operations, writes a memo to [Chadwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921899619&usg=AOvVaw1jMw74g8NIIqwm0qdCEky-) on “USSR and Satellite Mentions of Flying Saucers” that reviews mentions of UFOs in the Soviet press during the past two years. (“[USSR and Satellite Mentions of Flying Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100020012-7.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921900033&usg=AOvVaw3ke2Rn23O7JwAxJdG7ToPP)” August 22, 1952; CUFON, “[The CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921900338&usg=AOvVaw01Nenjp8ezQ6X6uxk1Ulqi) [Related Document Sampler, Part 1 of 2 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921900636&usg=AOvVaw1WmWbqEMmu6hlqG7FMHC-G)” May 17, 1996)

* * *

August 22 — [A. Ray Gordon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/85827067/alexander-ray-gordon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921901194&usg=AOvVaw0Dr-uzOwl8fDP_nYhMsaY_)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/85827067/alexander-ray-gordon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921901451&usg=AOvVaw0U0pIz3W2R8J-CwpgFD19q) project officer of the CIA’s Physics and Electronics Branch, provides a briefing document explaining the “Air Force Stand on ‘Flying Saucers’” to CIA Director [Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921901796&usg=AOvVaw1rB98ljj_KAvDWKZvoHLgs), who then briefs President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921902201&usg=AOvVaw03pdNeDuj0FSJibrLh7als) on the CIA UFO study group’s reports at his regular Friday intelligence briefing. (“The Air Force Stand on ‘Flying Saucers’,” August 22, 1952; CUFON, “[The CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-Related Document](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921902684&usg=AOvVaw2ZeEJr4XcjOAxXNAmBGFUK) [Sampler, Part 1 of 2 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921902981&usg=AOvVaw0iKj3HJrUQ0szPGdVe6tEQ)” May 17, 1996; Clark III 1013)

August 22–23 — Evening. [Lyman Streeter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111409702/lyman-h_-streeter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921903421&usg=AOvVaw1fUqV0zvTvfK6nR_LNvZU_) sees unusual lights near Winslow, Arizona, and hears strange signals on his ham radio. Not long afterward, Lyman, his wife, and Alfred C. Bailey hear a mysterious code coming through the air itself. Eventually, at 2:00 a.m., a Morse Code-like message comes through the radio from Regga of Mars and Zo and Nah-9 from Neptune. Zo refers to Affa from Uranus, who thinks earth is too evil. He also warns them that the evil Orion Solar System is coming to earth in a “square star body.” [Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921903947&usg=AOvVaw1NKF9oY2nrhV_uH1ES-7kB) arrives from Prescott on August 23. (George Hunt Williamson and Alfred C. Bailey, The Saucers Speak! New Age, 1954; Michael D. Swords, “Strange Days,” IUR 30, no. 4 (Aug. 2006): 22; Clark III 1283–1284)

August 23 — Telenews Productions re-releases its 1950 UFO documentary short, The Flying Saucer Mystery, edited and expanded to 12½ minutes with new material. It features footage from the July 29, 1952, press conference given by Air Force Maj. Gen. [John A. Samford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921904869&usg=AOvVaw1_gV3M9DaH7rSkTPJHtZPk), the UFO photo taken by [Shell Alpert](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9302407/shell-r_-alpert&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921905216&usg=AOvVaw1ctZqX2HRo0O4FG6Tb8z73), a photo taken by [August C. Roberts](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.phantomsandmonsters.com/2018/08/the-moon-is-venusian-colony-part-ii.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921905575&usg=AOvVaw1kSFxK545ZdUr3gUis-ubW), German UFO occupant witnesses Oskar and Gabriele Linke, [Frank Scully](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Scully&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921905900&usg=AOvVaw1cSQBDLlNk-maa2BH6O89c), and U.S. Army Engineers physicist Noel W. Scott. (“[The Flying Saucer Mystery (Full) (1952),](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3Dw-gobjVfFiQ&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921906237&usg=AOvVaw1SnFPlQHoK2yjy3CFRM8JY)” TheUFOVideoChannel YouTube channel, September 1, 2010; Internet Movie Database, “[The Flying Saucer Mystery](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0188624/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921906549&usg=AOvVaw3JQ43iMpR_apJKT7WAda0I)”; Curt Collins, “[The Flying Saucer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2020/01/the-flying-saucer-mystery-and-1952-ufo.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921906948&usg=AOvVaw2BB-YRM_sjfjn1Uwt3K40g) [Mystery](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2020/01/the-flying-saucer-mystery-and-1952-ufo.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921907302&usg=AOvVaw0QANJERCgDsbDO5EIc46at) [and the 1952 UFO Flap,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2020/01/the-flying-saucer-mystery-and-1952-ufo.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921907615&usg=AOvVaw3eNxpeqph2yhHGauOYX_6e)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, January 9, 2020)

August 24 — 10:15 a.m. USAF Col. [Gerald W. Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.arlingtoncemetery.net/gwjohnson.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921908215&usg=AOvVaw1Ya64JayUmudnzxHGnh2tM) is flying an F-84G when he sees two silver balls in the vicinity of Hermanas (a ghost town), New Mexico. They seem to be 6 feet in diameter and 2 miles away. One seems to change into a long, gray object as it is turning to the right. After 3 minutes they disappear, then reappear 7 minutes later, by which time the F-84 is over El Paso, Texas. One after the other, the objects climb straight up 2,000–3,000 feet. (NICAP, “[F-84 Encounters Two Silver Balls](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520824hermanas_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921908649&usg=AOvVaw0R3QZPhJU_LU3RoXbqIhIp)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921908970&usg=AOvVaw08XT2ILa3SzJQNM5MxKvmg), p. 168; Michael D. Swords, “Intelligent Motions,” IUR 33, no. 1 (March 2010): 14, 15)

August 24 — [Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921909539&usg=AOvVaw2lreXQk55VJLnGMpaWQXQb)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921909773&usg=AOvVaw0132PYn7N2SlwQ97vmLK8i) [Streeter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111409702/lyman-h_-streeter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921910232&usg=AOvVaw3qDP2-NmP0dnPSbmJe9wAt), and Bailey receive coded radio messages indicating the saucer intelligences intend to land, inviting them to help. (George Hunt Williamson and Alfred C. Bailey, The Saucers Speak! New Age, 1954 Michael D. Swords, “Strange Days,” IUR 30, no. 4 (Aug. 2006): 22)

August 25 — 3:40 p.m. At Holloman AFB, New Mexico, plant supervisor Fred Lee and foreman [Lawrence A. Aguilar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64152017/lorenzo_lawrence-arthur-aguilar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921911103&usg=AOvVaw3-2Fdt2yY2TuE2jRZBI9nC) watch a round silver object for 5 minutes. It flies south, turns and flies north, makes a 360° turn, then flies away vertically. (NICAP, “[Silver Sphere Maneuvers over Base](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520825holloman_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921911522&usg=AOvVaw2wEfJnear43c2lAkrTa-p4)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921911802&usg=AOvVaw1pfEyBioivM03I6IGwJyCH)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921912048&usg=AOvVaw26FhNM5VeX1NjjWNFBWtbZ) p. 168)

August 25 — 5:50 a.m. [William Squyres](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/106009163/william-v_-squyres&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921912502&usg=AOvVaw0XcwiIYZOiYIyt9ylUnyXt)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/106009163/william-v_-squyres&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921912762&usg=AOvVaw2O_tm4oRJyfiEf0t8LjTJl) a radio station musician at KOAM \[now KKOW-AM\] is driving from his home northeast of Frontenac, Kansas, to the station at Pittsburg. He is in his 1952 Jeep station wagon on a rough gravel road about a quarter of a mile from US Highway 160 when he sees a large, disc-shaped object hovering 10 feet in the air on the right side of the road 750 feet away. The UFO looks like two bowls placed together end to end, 75 feet long, 40 feet wide, and 15 feet high in the midsection. Through a window he can see the head and shoulders of a motionless human figure. Along its outer edge are a series of propellers 6–8 inches in diameter, spaced closely together and mounted on a bracket so they revolve “in a horizontal plane” along the edge of the object. He stops and gets out to watch it. As he is walking toward the object, it rises into the air and flies away at great speed. (Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 200–203](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/200/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921913342&usg=AOvVaw3k4SebmmED1pqvtc-Sbzme); Patrick Gross, “[Project Blue Book Unexplained Cases](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/bb/1972.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921913643&usg=AOvVaw0GJubaTXG6ArBMWtqRVY1e)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921913999&usg=AOvVaw2dFUc-Cjkw1ekjmoFpe06o)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921914270&usg=AOvVaw1e8Vul8MlYkDRdlcPLTEji) p. 168)

August 25 — 9:25 p.m. Affa of Uranus contacts the Baileys, the Streeters, and the Williamsons (as well as two students named Ronald Tucker and Betty Bowen) by radio, using 405 or 450 kilocycles. Zo and Um of Neptune, Regga of Mars, and other aliens continue sending messages by both radio and telepathy. [Streeter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111409702/lyman-h_-streeter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921914791&usg=AOvVaw14RNwu4IpiuwpF0Gs8Eion) sees a dark spot in the sky that he claims is Affa. [Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921915166&usg=AOvVaw1uyBejrSJkifkytXo-fXDT) sees a blue light that he thinks is Zo. Everyone signs an affidavit that the events have truly taken place. (George Hunt Williamson and Alfred C. Bailey, The Saucers Speak! New Age, 1954; Michael D. Swords, “Strange Days,” IUR 30, no. 4 (August 2006): 22, 24; Clark III 1284)

August 27 — 4:45 a.m. Two meteorological officers at Macdonald Airport in Manitoba see a disc-shaped object with shadows on it. It makes two turns around the airfield. When the rotating airport beacon light strikes it, the object glints like shiny aluminum, speeds away to the northeast, and vanishes. (Good Above, [pp. 184–185](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/184/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921915997&usg=AOvVaw2czcciT6hTv18a6PWEULs4))

August 28 — A family on the ground in Le Roy, New York, sees a disc making tight vertical circles around an airliner. (UFOEv, [p. 10](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D22%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921916488&usg=AOvVaw3M3VOYazYlfN6WWHHOhbqu))

August 28 — 9:30 p.m. Three civilians in Chickasaw, Alabama, report to Brookley AFB \[now Mobile Downtown Airport\] in Mobile, Alabama, their observation of multiple red stationary and maneuvering objects to the south, and another one moving from south to west, all in the direction of Brookley. AFOSI agent Charles A. Robinson arrives in Chickasaw at 9:50 p.m. to investigate and sees the same four objects to the south and southwest at an estimated 8–12 miles distance. One fiery red object is stationary for 15 minutes then drifts 15°–20° to the right

* * *

after which it is stationary again. Radar operator A/2C [Irl A. Whitaker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/187133390/irl-allen-whitaker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921917267&usg=AOvVaw1NdyIDzoIf_lxsYfcLl2Jv) visually spots a red-green object over Chickasaw to the north. USAF duty officer Capt. William A. Edwards and control tower operators see one object to the southwest to the right and lower than the moon, and another object to the west at 10°–20° elevation. The latter is confirmed by radar as a stationary target at four miles range and 4,000 feet altitude. Robinson and others see one object explode, and another does a figure 8 maneuver. There are 4–6 objects larger than a star or planet varying from fiery red, red-blue, red-green, and sparkling diamond appearance. A civilian Air Force employee sees a flat oval shape. (NICAP, “[GCA Paints Stationary Target](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520828brookleydir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921917755&usg=AOvVaw0YVnW1HS-2Hq7BAQHmJNzx)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921918053&usg=AOvVaw2QQTGLXjp7qMW-qOvh1VFz), p. 169)

August 29 — 10:50 a.m. Pilot LtJG William A. O’Flaherty and navigator LtJG R. S. Moore are flying a P4Y-2 patrol plane west of Thule Air Base, near Qaanaaq, Greenland. They are following an 85-foot-diameter Skyhook balloon launched from an icebreaker, US Coast Guard Cutter [Eastwind](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USCGC_Eastwind_(WAGB-279)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921918570&usg=AOvVaw3A8cVYwdMd6C0YKTaEDyPb)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USCGC_Eastwind_(WAGB-279)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921918788&usg=AOvVaw0sZb0p1wiUfJJMLT-eSzC_) when, upon release of the parachute instrument package from the balloon, they see 3 white discs or globes, about ½ to almost the full apparent size of the balloon, in triangle formation clustered to the right of the Skyhook instrument package at 74,000 feet for some 2–3 minutes. (NICAP, “[Three Objects Shake Up Air Crew](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520829thule_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921919159&usg=AOvVaw0ti9oZtNeG3uOI9kVyV3sQ)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921919432&usg=AOvVaw1pFcGzLz0rKRr7buuP5aK-), p. 167)

August 29 — 8:35 p.m. Civil Air Patrol pilot [Carlton A. Magruder](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520829colorado_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921919858&usg=AOvVaw0RU51MDr2nWgSI2cTdq3cz) sees three aluminum-colored objects with a red-yellow exhaust over Colorado Springs, Colorado. They are 50 feet in diameter and 10 feet high, flying in line at about 1,500 mph. (NICAP, “[Pilot Reports Three Objects 50ʹ in Diameter](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520829colorado_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921920245&usg=AOvVaw14GMhrzlVscC7x8euzuHXy)”; Sparks, p. 169; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921921140&usg=AOvVaw342dC_lvSWG5oinktOuBuF) [History: 1952, August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921921469&usg=AOvVaw1AWdQYLhstxC3iHbKOX2g8)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921921721&usg=AOvVaw3wBau6gGhCAdfCPpybP2OA) The Author, 1986, p. 80)

Late August — Albert and Betty Bailey go to the Palomar Gardens Café in California to visit [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921922234&usg=AOvVaw1h0UlzDmXN5Ni6DGfIKbU-) and tell him about their contacts and their friendship with [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921922593&usg=AOvVaw3OCmmmaSMzAt90YkBq9L9X)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921922839&usg=AOvVaw0TlWHgb7sLzmgfJbm2e36Y) (Michael D. Swords, “Strange Days,” IUR 30, no. 4 (Aug. 2006): 22)

Late summer — As a Signal Corps employee working the night shift, Vivian Walton handles decoded teletype messages inside a high-security building at the Defense Supply Center near Columbus, Ohio. She walks into the photo lab, where colleague Joe Sheehy is developing photos, one of which he says is a UFO that had landed in the “hill country” somewhere near Columbus. He says the object is 30 feet in diameter and unoccupied, with minimal damage. A few days later, an alert is sounded, allegedly because of danger of attack by UFOs. Walton claims the downed UFO has gone through the depot on the way to Wright-Patterson AFB in Dayton. (James W. Moseley, “[The Wright Field Story, or Who’s Lying?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/Nexus/1954_09_00_Nexus03.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921923604&usg=AOvVaw01-ub9TpmAx-UYY8hTx8Ze)” Nexus 3, no. 1 (September 1954): 11–15; James W. Moseley, The Wright Field Story, Saucerian, 1971; Jerome Clark, “A Catalog of Early Crash Claims,” IUR 18, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1993): 18; Irena Scott and William E. Jones, “Crash Claims,” IUR 18, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1993): 21; Good Need, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/158/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921924427&usg=AOvVaw1TtB8vv_pY3UBdQt-PQnIg) [159](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/158/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921924724&usg=AOvVaw2pozqtlAV0aeXtN2mHC5K7); Clark III 329)

September — 10:00 a.m. A radar scope near Kirtland AFB in Albuquerque, New Mexico, picks up an unknown target approaching at 700 mph then slows down to 100 mph northeast of the airfield. Two F-86 Sabre jets are scrambled but at first cannot locate the target. The second pilot suddenly spots what seems to be a balloon but as he gets closer it looks more like a “doughnut without a hole.” He gets as close as 1,500 feet before the object accelerates. When it is again at a range of 3,000 feet, the pilot begins firing at the object, but it pulls up in a climb and disappears in seconds. Capt. [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921925300&usg=AOvVaw20N_2w6BatpSWD-c7N_xy8) is given this report by an intelligence officer (probably Lt. Glen Parrish) at the base, who is about to forward the incident report to ATIC but the commanding officer (Brig. Gen. [William A.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_A._Matheny&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921925618&usg=AOvVaw0CLM3z2hFZXjkq2XBRLPmk) [Matheny](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_A._Matheny&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921925791&usg=AOvVaw11nGMpLAZNxaeQFdyrgtkq)) orders it destroyed. Parrish shows the last copy of the report to [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921925996&usg=AOvVaw3-u7TBn3KFlC3nQ55-Vh_H) during a visit to Kirtland. (Ruppelt, [pp. 1–5](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/n13/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921926225&usg=AOvVaw3H12l4an5nodWq8GsSDHZy); NICAP, “[F-86 Shooting Incident / 700 MPH Target](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/5209XXalbuquerque_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921926422&usg=AOvVaw0NsOSlnuGpaOQaa-npE4g_)”)

September — UFO witness turned researcher [Kenneth Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921926739&usg=AOvVaw10STOq-AzKKFy_21CpqMr4) releases The Coming of the Saucers, coauthored by his friend and publisher, [Raymond A. Palmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921927293&usg=AOvVaw128oXkt4xVxpEMTxUWQvHV)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921927541&usg=AOvVaw1CHwfcshvRABwanAGzqGrH) As publicity, the story “Flying Saucer-y” is prepared by King Features Syndicate and carried in many newspapers as a full-page story. (Kenneth Arnold and Ray Palmer, The Coming of the Saucers, Palmer, 1952; Curt Collins, “[Kenneth Arnold’s 1952 UFO Book Promotion,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2018/09/kenneth-arnolds-1952-ufo-book-promotion.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921928160&usg=AOvVaw38xICiRvC3Jk7ZvQN-PQWP)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, September 28, 2018)

September — Civilian Saucer Investigation in Los Angeles publishes the first of only four issues of its CSI Quarterly Bulletin. The final issue appears in early 1954. ([CSI Quarterly](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/CSI%2520Quarterly/CSI%2520Quarterly%2520-%25201952%2520Fall.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921928950&usg=AOvVaw3Zb8PDcqR7RJ5dx2fL4VIn)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/CSI%2520Quarterly/CSI%2520Quarterly%2520-%25201952%2520Fall.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921929302&usg=AOvVaw1kGz4DoYlOh8vO5kfM44dg) no. 1 (Fall 1952))

September — [John P. Cahn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/27512833/john-p_-cahn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921929874&usg=AOvVaw1dS7LkXSsEerC6wFfBsK03) publishes an exposé of [Frank Scully](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Scully&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921930277&usg=AOvVaw3mrPSZLxf3RTCsd0NNQErs)’s Behind the Flying Saucers in True magazine. Scully’s sources are an oil prospector named [Silas M. Newton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/127850405/silas-mason-newton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921930936&usg=AOvVaw02VkjVEpyM0zgaiWf4AMxt) and a mysterious “Dr. Gee,” later identified as [Leo](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/leo-gebauer-and-silas-newton-flak-one-of-their-defense-news-photo/162001660&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921931429&usg=AOvVaw0DXsp5dqD4f6qtnFGUqO4f) [GeBauer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/leo-gebauer-and-silas-newton-flak-one-of-their-defense-news-photo/162001660&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921931862&usg=AOvVaw2IRa_I4yduXCU5mbeWO5yI)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/leo-gebauer-and-silas-newton-flak-one-of-their-defense-news-photo/162001660&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921932202&usg=AOvVaw3glqMBU1seX1tkmRrqYBZr) a con man with a long arrest record. The tale is a ploy to gain the attention of potential investors in a bogus oil detection scheme allegedly linked to alien technology. [Jerome Clark](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerome_Clark&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921932543&usg=AOvVaw3tgMIUyaDjvcQ25MqpF2ck) writes that Scully was himself a victim, not a perpetrator. (J. P. Cahn, “[Flying Saucers and the Mysterious Little Men,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.physics.smu.edu/%257Epseudo/UFOs/Scully/Cahn1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921933022&usg=AOvVaw0V082LzZKpoetWJVYuRbNR)” True, September 1952, pp. 17–19, 102–112; Clark III 1044–1045)

September 1 — 8:23 p.m. Air Defense Command radar at Yaak Air Force Station in Montana picks up UFOs exhibiting changes of direction as many as five times a minute. Some course changes are 90° and speeds are measured at 1,400–1,600 mph. Six blips at one time appear on the FPS-3 radar scopes and the strange targets come within 10

* * *

miles of the GCI site. So close is the indicated range the radar personnel leave their windowless operations room to check the sky. Six objects can be seen an estimated 10 miles away. When first spotted, the UFOs are in an in- trail formation, and shortly thereafter that changes to an in-line abreast grouping. Finally, the UFOs switch to a vertical stack. S/Sgt. William Kelly remembers tracking the UFOs on the radar executing vertical climbs that exceed the limit of the site’s height-finding equipment. (NICAP, “[Radar/Visual at Air Force Radar Site](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520901yaak_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921934042&usg=AOvVaw0tN7I9UuZxu1yOG-hSt_oW)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921934366&usg=AOvVaw2qKuKSM6ipRnSghxadWO-J)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921934578&usg=AOvVaw3qN4umzd18vVYsG7xKkUnR) p. 170)

September 1 — 10:30 p.m. An ex-artillery officer named Bowman and 24 others at Marietta, Georgia, see a red, white, and blue-green object that spins and shoots off sparks. An unidentified witness using binoculars sees two large objects shaped like spinning tops with red, blue, and green colors, flying side by side and leaving a sparkling trail for 30 minutes. At 10:50 p.m., a former Army Air Force B-25 gunner sees two large white disc-shaped objects with green vapor trails fly in trail formation, merge, and fly away quickly. (NICAP, “[Two Discs in Trail](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520901marietta_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921935262&usg=AOvVaw3LOgphkbrZeiUzDNwx23VF) [Formation](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520901marietta_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921935576&usg=AOvVaw0brT0Lxe3YGeENnDLjO0G5)”; Sparks, p. 170)

September 2 — 12:01 a.m. CAA radar controllers [Robert L. Terneuzen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/100317697/robert-l-terneuzen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921936444&usg=AOvVaw1RzDwLxA1OOHRwkNtP8Vt-) (GCA), Ralph L. Frick, Dale E. Warner, Warren J. Weber, and Radar Maintenance Technician Gordon R. Copeland track as many as 30 targets simultaneously at Midway Airport in Chicago, flying in various directions with an average speed of 175 mph at about 2,000 feet.

The 755th Aircraft Control and Weapons radar station in Elkhorn, Wisconsin, claims that the Midway Airport Tower supervisor has called them at 2:50 a.m., saying there are 40 targets plotted by airport radar flying from 3,000 to 6,000 feet at a speed of 120–150 mph. The targets are the size of blips from light planes or larger (the best target quality is in the 6–10-mile range) and move in no particular pattern—sometimes erratically and sometimes in straight lines up to 15 miles long. In at least one instance, the targets fly in formation with an aircraft. At 5:14 a.m., the Air Defense Command is alerted and authorizes the scramble of two jets from the 4706th Interceptor Wing at O’Hare Airport in Chicago. At 5:55 a.m., a pair of F-86 Sabre jets piloted by Capt. [William W. Maitland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/42353620/william-ward-maitland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921937209&usg=AOvVaw1Hyb0fhYnIsQGwnua4F_QZ) and Lt. Beverly L. Dunhill, lift off and are vectored right through the targets as shown on radar, making passes at 800 and at 4,000 feet without making contact. The F-86s are evidently without airborne radar because they only mention visual descriptions. Maitland and Dunhill later tell the media: “We didn’t hit anything. We didn’t see anything. We went through the target showing on the scope and there was nothing there, not even a cloud.” The jets break off their aerial search at 6:19 a.m. and return to base. By 7:00 a.m. all of the mysterious targets disappear off the scopes toward the south. The Midway radar crews are convinced the targets are returns from tangible bodies, but CAA chief Bob Zeigler overrules them and blames “peculiar atmospheric conditions.” (“[Sabre Jets Fly through ‘Object,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93459288/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921937720&usg=AOvVaw0ngOMLjRV9-GGqbNyJQLKz)” Spokane (Wash.) Spokesman-Review, September 3, 1952, p. 1; NICAP, “[40 Targets at Midway Airport](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520902chicago_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921938205&usg=AOvVaw1lCYzHyxN517TzzJi3fcsO)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921938509&usg=AOvVaw1Pn6vQsndeX0q2m8hD1UUe), p. 171)

September 3 — 9:00 a.m. Instructor pilot [Donald L. McCraven](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/36505184/donald-l-mccraven&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921938998&usg=AOvVaw2pSDOG7OUcVgKoIB7jb-hs) and N. D. Thomas observe a dark elliptical object reflecting sunlight 6 miles north of Tucson, Arizona. The object makes three well-coordinated turns with no perceptible sound. It moves at tremendous speed during a slight climb and is observed for approximately 90 seconds. (NICAP, “[Dark Ellipse Makes Three Coordinated Turns](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520903tucson_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921939424&usg=AOvVaw1w_lG8SIAELCgO8q2GQT_1)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921939723&usg=AOvVaw2tAp-9KQ6lrnevrCGx-Xqa), p. 172)

September 3 — 12:30 p.m. [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921940173&usg=AOvVaw1Wl-NQDFqp_fsKfFqk7NfL) meets in the Cabinet Room with Gen. [William M. Garland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49186828/william-madison-garland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921940583&usg=AOvVaw09GP69ohJt8mHyPZttyddD)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49186828/william-madison-garland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921940870&usg=AOvVaw0VeOC8FLABWwZoOuvj6hnC) Col. [John Gordon Fowler](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Gordon_Fowler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921941258&usg=AOvVaw1-Rx1w3dW9iO0Pwcs8Gwwr), and three other USAF officers; [Lawrence J. Henderson Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1973/03/28/97122067.html?pageNumber%3D26&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921941627&usg=AOvVaw2eMi5SWPZj6MelHGXdSYtk) and [Walter W. Niles](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cv14.com/shipmates2.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921941994&usg=AOvVaw3y0BrgW1gJXu_e5aDP1BG4) from the RAND Corporation; and [Robert B. Landry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106440/major-general-robert-b-landry/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921942408&usg=AOvVaw23nF9HMcmA3UiDhvnpEA2p) and four others from the National Security Resources Board. The topic is the Washington UFO incident. (Frank Stalter, “[The Real Majestic 12: Harry Truman’s 1952 DC UFO Meeting,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufopartisan.blogspot.com/2009/10/trumans-white-house-meeting-on-1952-dc.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921942887&usg=AOvVaw0nBhpyst2cXSpEtPO9jItv)” The UFO Partisan, 2009)

September 6 — 10:10 a.m. Walter Borys and George McCracken, two guards at the Osborn Prison Farm \[now Osborn Correctional Institute\] in Somers, Connecticut, are with 13 inmates in the yard when they hear an odd motor noise and see a silvery object in the northern sky. It appears to be descending in a zigzag motion but stops and shoots upward at a right angle at terrific speed after releasing a puff of smoke. Other witnesses in the area think it is a jet aircraft. (Hartford (Conn.) Courant, September 7, 1952, p. 1; Audrey H. Hennis, “[The ‘Flying Saucer’ Was from](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93468816/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921943574&usg=AOvVaw3Mbu0w7O37VtiwzQ2pABDR) [a Jet After-Burner,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93468816/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921943878&usg=AOvVaw14tuh9QRXRe1gIpM_OI4eN)” Hartford (Conn.) Courant, September 19, 1952, p. 18; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Sept-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921944337&usg=AOvVaw1zalhJh2KxqxzT-eZBUPfq) [1952, September–October](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Sept-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921944666&usg=AOvVaw2bUfDGpHypkWQUCjWdnn8Y)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Sept-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921944964&usg=AOvVaw0PADI209ECq97ya_aO4UAs) The Author, 1986, pp. 11–12)

September 8 — [Wilbert B. Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921945653&usg=AOvVaw2ah8iyIU4um3XRobZYbY7p) and Department of Transport associates launch a large weather balloon with a magnesium flare over Ottawa, Ontario, but it does not inspire any UFO reports. (Clark III 1078; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, September–October](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Sept-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921946263&usg=AOvVaw3w-dl7kC2BIhSdKmtNNqi3), The Author, 1986, pp. 17–18)

September 9 — 9:00 p.m. US Air Force civilian illustrator E. J. Colisimo sees a disc with lights along part of its circumference over Rabat, Morocco. It is flying twice as fast as a T-33 jet trainer in a slightly curved path. (NICAP, “[Disc Twice As Fast As T-33](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520909rabat_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921946969&usg=AOvVaw24wh2euY-6rWyNYEGke4Od)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921947345&usg=AOvVaw27L4OfPM0nDUvwRAGZo65s)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921947568&usg=AOvVaw2jmtNwktKbpyLfR0VvxIjA) p. 172)

September 10 — Battelle issues its fifth status report on Project Stork to ATIC. It says that 800 copies of its revised report questionnaire have been sent to the Air Force, many of which were passed on to military witnesses as a trial test.

* * *

The group has now examined UFO reports from 1947–1949 and 1951. It decided to discontinue the news clipping service. (“[Seven Status Reports for Project Stork, Part 3,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cufon.org/cufon/stork1-7b.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921948354&usg=AOvVaw1tug3j7tVdTC97mWP6Sgt1)” CUFON)

September 10 — 2:30 p.m. The wife of a civilian employee at Andrews AFB \[now Joint Base Andrews\] in Prince George’s County, Maryland, sees a shiny, metallic, elliptical, silent object moving back and forth near the base. It is visible for 2–3 minutes. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, September–October](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Sept-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921948979&usg=AOvVaw1nn1UiXCKcgug2BIwqMshy)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Sept-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921949265&usg=AOvVaw2TOz7DIj0_R8QsLLLtjQ-e) The Author, 1986, p.

25)

September 11 \[or 7 or 17\] — CIA Office of Scientific Intelligence Director [H. Marshall Chadwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921949915&usg=AOvVaw2PnfgBandfXWzX4_WmvDxx) writes a memorandum to Director of Central Intelligence [Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921950320&usg=AOvVaw3p-MDsBHAUTKOJf02DD71i) that sets out two national security implications of UFOs for the government of the United States: the potential for psychological panic by citizens, and demonstrating the nation’s vulnerability by air. It recommends that “A national policy should be established as to what should be told the public regarding the phenomena, in order to minimize risk of panic.” (H. Marshall Chadwell, “[Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100020012-7.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921950808&usg=AOvVaw3rgRNEYJqIZFHtMBBfPdxb) [Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100020012-7.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921951173&usg=AOvVaw3K86puO8_OCyB_SmzeGqYG)” September 11, 1952; CUFON, “[The CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-Related Document Sampler, Part 1 of 2](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921951506&usg=AOvVaw2KnGVdIVy2aKDVfVrd_byG) [Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921951810&usg=AOvVaw1fMjdoHPhDE1_hqUm9ycXk)” May 17, 1996; Swords 175–181, 503–507; Good Above, [p. 224](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/224/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921952185&usg=AOvVaw2wudFlvra07CN3FOz8LwbF))

September 11 — [Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921952663&usg=AOvVaw00AGUZ4IxLL4RbzZxDV6S1)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921952948&usg=AOvVaw0QCYvBeZTNN88-TvoMKW_a) [Streeter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111409702/lyman-h_-streeter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921953316&usg=AOvVaw0PA4W9tfjofGNG26-tH9oU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111409702/lyman-h_-streeter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921953550&usg=AOvVaw2cyKjH9PaiZSjUwa4cjAg9) and Bailey receive a radio message saying, “I hope we might have a landing soon,” and later, “We must make landing contact soon… If you believe us, you will act accordingly.” (George Hunt Williamson and Alfred C. Bailey, The Saucers Speak! New Age, 1954; Michael D. Swords, “Strange Days,” IUR 30, no. 4 (Aug. 2006): 22)

September 12 — 1:30 a.m. Two oil well drillers, William Darling and Donald Davis, see a lighted object with windows on one side circling 150 feet above the ground silently for nearly 30 minutes at Bladensburg, Ohio. Suddenly it makes a noise like steam blowing and shoots out of sight. (“Report from the Readers,” Fate 6, no. 2 (February 1953): 108)

September 12 — Around 7:15 p.m., in Flatwoods, West Virginia, two brothers, Edward and Fred May, and their friend Tommy Hyer (ages 13, 12, and 10 respectively) witness a bright object cross the sky, coming to rest on land belonging to local farmer [G. Bailey Fisher](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/34255036/george-bailey-fisher&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921954701&usg=AOvVaw2hKHEHM0E5LqalrKKEXXM4)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/34255036/george-bailey-fisher&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921955005&usg=AOvVaw1TMxyzcTmvNmjgDlEjhaIx) The boys go to the home of the May brothers’ mother, [Kathleen May](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/93511683/kathleen-may&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921955367&usg=AOvVaw0UbuBCscYLX-6e_xULQR8u)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/93511683/kathleen-may&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921955638&usg=AOvVaw1WsKH7ZZ2pp1n3Yj6iq7fV) where they tell the story of having seen a UFO crash land. From there, Mrs. May, accompanied by the three boys, local children Neil Nunley, 14, and Ronnie Shaver, 10, and West Virginia National Guardsman Eugene Lemon, 17, walk to the Fisher farm. At the top of a hill, they reportedly see a large pulsating “ball of fire” about 50 feet to their right. They also detect a pungent mist that makes their eyes and noses burn. Lemon then notices two small lights over to the left of the object, underneath a nearby oak tree and directs his flashlight towards them, revealing a creature, which May reports as bounding towards them. Other sources describe it as emitting a shrill hissing noise before gliding towards them, changing direction and then heading off towards the red light. The group flees in panic. Sheriff [Robert L. Carr](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/44567805/robert-l-carr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921956507&usg=AOvVaw27eNCXDV6RS0X4UEtL-UOf) and his deputy [Burnell J. Long](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/112739758/burnell-j_-long&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921956923&usg=AOvVaw220Rpw0NLzNKTla6WpBZ9j) search the area separately, but find no trace of the encounter other than the smell. Early the next morning, [A. Lee Stewart](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.genealogybuff.com/wv/wv-kanawha-obits78.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921957376&usg=AOvVaw0s4TZlauUFSWY_8O0Rrx7z)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.genealogybuff.com/wv/wv-kanawha-obits78.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921957551&usg=AOvVaw3Ea-uYqYO63ebOgKeXAKDG) co-owner of the Braxton Democrat, visits the site of the encounter for a second time and discovers two elongated tracks in the mud, as well as traces of a thick black liquid. It is later revealed that the tracks are likely those of a 1942 Chevrolet pickup truck driven by local [Max Lockard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/133730941/max-junior-lockard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921957986&usg=AOvVaw0uSfbGpM0P-T4agmhCJd-9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/133730941/max-junior-lockard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921958164&usg=AOvVaw0ezzwJezWhGxS4U5Zt87BS) who had gone to the site to look for the creature some hours prior to Stewert’s discovery. [Ivan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivan_T._Sanderson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921958421&usg=AOvVaw0LRWbeWS_m2VRFRaXM1TTA)

[T. Sanderson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivan_T._Sanderson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921958675&usg=AOvVaw0uW_60GmaAoRuoUuJCw68v) interviews the witnesses several days later and concludes that a flight of “intelligently controlled objects flew over West Virginia.” The Air Force concludes that people have seen a meteor and that the monster was only the glowing eyes of a barn owl. [Joe Nickell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Nickell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921959031&usg=AOvVaw1Q-XbDa9jbovTfrdIEpyi4) also concludes in 2000 that the bright light in the sky reported by the witnesses on September 12 was most likely a meteor, that the pulsating red light is likely an aircraft navigation/hazard beacon, and that the creature described by witnesses closely resembles a barn owl. Nickell claims that the experience was distorted by the heightened state of anxiety felt by the witnesses after having observed the original meteor. However, [Frank C. Feschino](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.flatwoodsmonster.com/index-id%253D228330%2526fuseaction%253Dbrowse%2526pageid%253D22.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921959521&usg=AOvVaw0bzNtjt_TEtXhFMhZ_VGXN) has done extensive research to support his hypothesis that the Flatwoods incident was only one small part of a major UFO display involving multiple objects (many of them reported as “meteors” or “balls of fire” or “flaming planes”) passing in westerly and other directions across the eastern and southern United States between 6:50 and 7:25 p.m. The trajectory of one of these objects (moving first northwest then northeast then south) alone takes it over Baltimore, Catonsville, Frederick, Hagerstown, Cumberland, and Garrett County, Maryland; Preston County, Morgantown, Fairmont, Wheeling, Charleston, Parkersburg, Nitro, Ward, and Chelyan, West Virginia; Selma, Columbus, Zanesville, St. Clairsville, Ohio; it is last seen moving south around Bluefield, West Virginia. Another object is seen over Washington, D.C., heading due west towards West Virginia, apparently landing in Flatwoods. A third object travels southwest over Roanoke and Pulaski, Virginia, possibly landing near Arcadia, Tennessee. Feschino thinks that these three objects had been damaged by fire directed at them by Air Force interceptors. Five other objects are observed in North Carolina in that time period, and these Feschino suspects may have been attempting to look for and assist the damaged objects. He also speculates that the disappearance of an F-94 jet fighter out of Tyndall AFB in Panama City, Florida, piloted by 2Lt [John A. Jones](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/27843010/john-a-jones&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921960143&usg=AOvVaw0Msp9FWXWLtLuPxG20AycX) and radar operator 2Lt [John S. DelCurto](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/73733140/john-s_-delcurto&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921960551&usg=AOvVaw1COlTa4m6g9gpKPU_2bScx)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/73733140/john-s_-delcurto&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921960811&usg=AOvVaw31D8eYdRAweHiTi_tljyZT) might have involved a tragic

* * *

UFO interception that began three hours earlier; the last known contact with the fighter is at 5:43 p.m. over the Gulf of Mexico 70 miles northwest of Tampa, the accident takes place under unusual circumstances, and the wreckage has never been found. Feschino thinks that a UFO damaged in dogfights with many interceptors over the Gulf might have triggered the second battle over the Atlantic seaboard around 7:00 p.m. Then a second wave of multiple objects is observed 8:00–8:10 p.m. in the Washington, Maryland, Virginia, Ohio, and West Virginia region that, according to Feschino, involves a search for a second downed UFO. Although Feschino jumps to many conclusions and his documentation for specific incidents and conditions is somewhat confusing, he may well have grasped more truth than the meteor-and-owl explanation of the skeptics. (Wikipedia, “[Flatwoods](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flatwoods_monster&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921961594&usg=AOvVaw3zVkt9YiiQ5qxDLTmxaUAQ) [Monster](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flatwoods_monster&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921961920&usg=AOvVaw0GMa32MMejqKZ5Lbvdx9JD)”; Gray Barker, “The Monster and the Saucer,” Fate 6, no. 1 (January 1953): 12–17; Gray Barker, They Knew Too Much about Flying Saucers, University Books, 1956, [pp. 11–35](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/graybarkertheyknewtoomuchaboutflyingsaucers_201910/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921962597&usg=AOvVaw0nv_Y71VWAiqpDHp8dh6bF); Keyhoe, FS from OS, [pp. 116–120](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsos/chVII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921963050&usg=AOvVaw24OK9Op9PSlxowtKBJgOVp); Clark III 494–495; Ivan T. Sanderson, Uninvited Visitors, Cowles, 1967, pp. 39–51; Northern Ontario UFO Research and Study, “[The Braxton Democrat](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/the_braxton_democrat.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921963504&usg=AOvVaw0cNdpWNlpy_OzlIRimDAG3)”; Shoot 112–313, 320–327; Joe Nickell, “[The Flatwoods UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://cdn.centerforinquiry.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/29/2000/11/22164839/p15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921963900&usg=AOvVaw3okJ6BGTjbDP_6daG_9jpZ) [Monster,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://cdn.centerforinquiry.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/29/2000/11/22164839/p15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921964257&usg=AOvVaw2CC2Rz4shpfnMVg-cmYri0)” Skeptical Inquirer 24, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 2000): 15–19; Michael D. Swords, “[Peeking at Ivan’s SITU](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://thebiggeststudy.blogspot.com/2011/04/peeking-at-ivans-situ-files-flatwoods.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921964755&usg=AOvVaw1JiCVjv1mn5aaJPyBGWZNM) [Files: The Flatwoods Monster,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://thebiggeststudy.blogspot.com/2011/04/peeking-at-ivans-situ-files-flatwoods.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921965195&usg=AOvVaw39Nw4mAqMMNVtpv86DsIJ8)” The Big Study, April 11, 2011; Frank C. Feschino, The Braxton County Monster: The Cover-Up of the Flatwoods Monster Revealed, Quarrier Press, 2004)

September 14 — 4:30 a.m. Fred J. Brown is preparing to milk the cows at the Everglades Experiment Station \[now the Everglades Research and Education Center\] in Belle Glade, Florida, when he spots a circular object about 35 feet in diameter hovering about 100 feet above the ground. It has a row of red and amber lights spaced around the outside rim and the underside. As it descends to about 40 feet, the 13 cows bolt as the object disappears to the west. As Brown is rounding up the cows, the object appears again, moving from south to north at a speed of 30 mph, making a high-voltage buzzing noise, and emitting an odor “like acid or ammonia” that makes Brown’s eyes smart. The cows stampede once again. The object’s glow illuminates the ground as it passes, and it gains altitude and disappears again. (“[Cattle Stampeded Twice by Mysterious ‘Object,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93472641/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921966033&usg=AOvVaw119f4EaHT4m9LfpWih0-OH)” Palm Beach (Fla.) Times, September 16, 1952, p. 1)

September 14 — Exercise Mainbrace begins in the North Sea. It is the first large-scale naval exercise undertaken by NATO and jointly commanded by Admiral [Lynde D. McCormick](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lynde_D._McCormick&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921966628&usg=AOvVaw3mR-yAqyPqysbs6SWyfSFA) and Gen. [Matthew B. Ridgway](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matthew_Ridgway&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921967028&usg=AOvVaw0_HFbtWn-uV21Un8Nf8QR0). It involves the US Navy and the navies of Great Britain, France, Canada, Denmark, Norway, Portugal, Netherlands, and Belgium. Its objective is to convince Denmark and Norway that they can be defended against an attack from the USSR, and involves 80,000 men, 200 ships, and 1,000 aircraft. The operation lasts through September 25. (Wikipedia, “[Exercise Mainbrace](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exercise_Mainbrace&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921967405&usg=AOvVaw2i58qK6izeI_LrYBtyT5S9)”)

September 14 — 10:13 p.m. The Danish destroyer [Willemoes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.navalhistory.dk/English/TheShips/VW/Willemoes(1947).htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921967893&usg=AOvVaw23UyEKafO4eTZI8Yx0NvBJ), during the Exercise Mainbrace maneuvers, is north of Bornholm island, Denmark, in the Baltic Sea. Lt.Cmdr. G. Schmidt-Jensen and several members of the crew see an unidentified object, triangular in shape, that moves at high speed toward the southeast. It emits a greenish glow and jets three rays of fire from its rear. Jensen estimates the speed at 930 mph. (NICAP, “[Operation Mainbrace](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/5209XXmainbrace_report.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921968356&usg=AOvVaw3_gj5XyHOfi__r6jXO-WqM) [Sightings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/5209XXmainbrace_report.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921968670&usg=AOvVaw0p5iNOOcemyCTJQh3xbqHC)”; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, September–October](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Sept-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921969036&usg=AOvVaw0njLwB07u2sQJTkZzQwGOB), The Author, 1986, p. 28; Marler 128– 129, 265)

September 19 — 10:53 a.m. During Exercise Mainbrace maneuvers, a silvery, spherical UFO appears near RAF Topcliffe in North Yorkshire, England, following an RAF Meteor jet (possibly piloted by Flight Lt. John W. Kilburn and Flight Lt. Marian Cybulski) about to land. It has been following about 5 miles behind the jet at15,000 feet, swinging like a “falling sycamore leaf” and descending. As the jet turns toward Dishforth, the object follows but begins rotating on its axis then suddenly accelerates and disappears. Several ground crew members of RAF 269 Squadron (Master Signaller Albert Thomson, Sgt. Flight Engineer Thomas Deweys, Flight Lt. R. Paris, and Leading Aircraftman George Grime) and civilians also see it. [Prince Philip](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_Philip%252C_Duke_of_Edinburgh&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921969735&usg=AOvVaw0GdqHnRg-UoLFyPhGqNA6K) suggests to RAF Air Marshal [Peter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Horsley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921970140&usg=AOvVaw1GkfXvh8UHeKGVGTrRV5jT) [Horsley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Horsley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921970440&usg=AOvVaw2G8cfVu1Th2MwAzlTZK3ss)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Horsley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921970681&usg=AOvVaw3oJakMzE6f9VsA0KLiALk0) who is serving as equerry to the duke, that he investigate credible reports of UFOs, especially those by fighter pilots who have seen them. He arranges for RAF Fighter Command to send copies of any reports for examination at Buckingham Palace and begins an informal study that lasts until 1955. (NICAP, “[Swaying Silver](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520919topcliffe_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921971063&usg=AOvVaw1TZJjnDvj6s96ypXcFWPe6) [Object Follows Jet](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520919topcliffe_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921971391&usg=AOvVaw3vTB7wGcScsPvzM0zkYB3z)”; Richard Hall, “Operation Mainbrace Sightings”; Good Above, [pp. 31–32](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/30/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921971863&usg=AOvVaw3IjcC2Hbpoyj9aSPyeJx9l), [450](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/450/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921972181&usg=AOvVaw0Z0KeOChmeHOFt1XUY6U6T); Nick Redfern, “[UFOs and NATO: The Mainbrace Affair,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://mysteriousuniverse.org/2014/04/ufos-nato-the-mainbrace-affair/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921972526&usg=AOvVaw2ci49BnZMoGR93pCjfrwy7)” Mysterious Universe, April 22, 2014; David Clarke, “The Prince and the Saucers,” Fortean Times 406 (June 2021): 18–19; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921973008&usg=AOvVaw2G8xoqzEReJepz7GHM18uc), p. 173; Ruppelt, [pp. 195–196](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/194/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921973345&usg=AOvVaw2UZrmPLe6S5mX7Ef9OK5cz);

UFOFiles2, [p. 47](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n79/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921973869&usg=AOvVaw3_0e0s0hG8BGnuqpAMuicK))

September 20? — Sometime during Exercise Mainbrace, at the underground RAF Ash, near Woodnesborough, Kent, England, Senior Aircraftman William Maguire tracks on radar a huge UFO high above the English Channel for 18 minutes. Eventually it splits into three and speeds away, one object to the north, another toward France, and the third toward Eastern Europe. (Good Need, [p. 152](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/152/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921974394&usg=AOvVaw2eeb_W6cBM6dE6t4CLetZX); Nick Redfern, “[UFOs, NATO, and Military Encounters,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://interestingandcuriosities.blogspot.com/2018/10/ufos-nato-and-military-encounters.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921974761&usg=AOvVaw0mXsI0jnwHJbHNphMkigtc)” Interesting and Curiosities, October 28, 2018)

* * *

September 20 — Naval personnel on the US aircraft carrier [USS](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Franklin_D._Roosevelt_(CV-42)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921975196&usg=AOvVaw27Bg5tpFP3YRm6-7EEE_kg) [Franklin D. Roosevelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Franklin_D._Roosevelt_(CV-42)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921975425&usg=AOvVaw0elmoEfgqwHwkPz-a5Kqv0) in the North Sea observe a silvery sphere moving across the sky behind the fleet. Photographer Wallace Litwin takes three color photos that are developed and examined by naval intelligence officers. [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921975695&usg=AOvVaw3qhFXSMTgA0GTYqEynGFHe) says they “turned out to be excellent … judging by the size of the object in each successive photo, one could see that it was moving rapidly.” No balloon has been launched. (NICAP, “[Object Photographed during Operation Mainbrace](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520920norway-denmark_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921976042&usg=AOvVaw3LS8fOkugauEkPDIQvAIDC)”; Ruppelt, [pp. 195–196](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/194/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921976296&usg=AOvVaw1Emd8CvpKhJKeKopyZ9jQ5); UFOEv, [p. 162](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D174%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921976555&usg=AOvVaw3gZB4xFqqIH687aMvGUqnu); “[In the News 1952,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/itn52part43.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921976776&usg=AOvVaw15sfoRgRpBUsd12XyuzBbZ)” Saturday Night Uforia, 2013)

September 20 — 7:30 p.m. At Air Base Karup in Jutland, Denmark, three Danish Air Force officers see a shiny, metallic UFO pass overhead and disappear in clouds to the east. (Aimé Michel, The Truth about FS, 133)

September 21 — Six RAF Meteor jets flying above the North Sea observe a shiny sphere approaching from the direction of the Mainbrace fleet. It eludes their pursuit and disappears. As they are returning, it reappears following one of the jets, but when he turns to chase it, it speeds away. [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921977377&usg=AOvVaw2f5kE4RqQOEOHmk5gm1mfN) says the Mainbrace sightings forced the RAF to “officially recognize the UFO.” (NICAP, “[Six RAF Jets Approached by Shiny Sphere](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520921northsea_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921977751&usg=AOvVaw2POv3M3aBjqeOUhEz8NSF2)”; Ruppelt, [p. 196](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/196/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921978107&usg=AOvVaw0cmtzCNwgEh2ep04oH7Rrq); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921978422&usg=AOvVaw2042D21_mI4o_WuTxBTRQf), p. 173)

September 22 — Night. A UFO hovers over the Army’s Camp Drum \[now Fort Drum\] near Watertown, New York, for 30 minutes. Eight soldiers say the object is 200 feet across, trailing red-orange sparks. (“[Mysterious, Gyratuing](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/35533354/democrat-and-chronicle/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921978884&usg=AOvVaw08YwWJZLapWMFA0_VvZrrE) [Object Looks Down on Camp Drum,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/35533354/democrat-and-chronicle/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921979220&usg=AOvVaw3_ZK02SZukpaqhmoHYsN7Q)” Rochester (N.Y.) Democrat and Chronicle, September 27, 1952, p. 1)

September 24 — CIA Assistant Director of Scientific Intelligence [H. Marshall Chadwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921979809&usg=AOvVaw1gbnk2Hi0duQmhpBWY9-4s) writes a 4-page memo to CIA Director [Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921980206&usg=AOvVaw0MSxtip84PF3Yb167iNLFG), summarizing his earlier memo and stating that since 1947 unexplained sightings were running at 20% and in 1952 they rose to 28%. “I consider this problem to be of such importance that it should be brought to the attention of the National Security Council in order that a community-wide coordinated effort toward its solution may be initiated.” His CIA scientific consultants ([Julius Stratton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julius_Adams_Stratton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921980568&usg=AOvVaw01ULpQcZlGpBZkOeFb6C-0)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julius_Adams_Stratton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921980795&usg=AOvVaw04ZhY4i4dN2q9If8RmRSL7) and perhaps [Lloyd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lloyd_Berkner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921981098&usg=AOvVaw23kDimurvD5llgXHX2gXyS) [Berkner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lloyd_Berkner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921981378&usg=AOvVaw2PfQyBr9J5qzp3rDVb0g6g) and [Howard P. Robertson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_P._Robertson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921981704&usg=AOvVaw3wpMHkPxIwiwTeEDypbGSt)) think the answer will be found “on the margins of just beyond the frontiers of our present knowledge in the fields of atmospheric, ionospheric, and extraterrestrial phenomena, with the added possibility that the present dispersal of nuclear waste products might also be a factor.” (H. Marshall Chadwell, “[Flying Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100020012-7.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921982102&usg=AOvVaw02EV75_QFnfueFgG2SwexI)” September 24, 1952; CUFON, “[The CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-Related Document Sampler, Part](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921982417&usg=AOvVaw2P3YdhTKYHKSbln3AsDYJ8) [1 of 2 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921982673&usg=AOvVaw0qRW9sR353VT8vxW_fuYYd)” May 17, 1996; Good Above, [pp. 328–329](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/328/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921982991&usg=AOvVaw0aXXK0_jod8pD1c-eOmd3P)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/328/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921983232&usg=AOvVaw25qUlvrDdHj1Cbi_dBsHaG) [506–507](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/506/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921983527&usg=AOvVaw1eA-siqL7WMGGvzqQBvgpJ))

Late September — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921983981&usg=AOvVaw2QixLUB_kX6OXX5Pvcfs6p) visits the headquarters of the Air Defense Command at Ent AFB \[now the US Olympic Training Center\] in Colorado to brief Gen. [Benjamin W. Chidlaw](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_W._Chidlaw&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921984363&usg=AOvVaw37z9-H8yo58GjUJzyveOl1) and his staff on the past few months of UFO activity at a lunch at the officer’s club. One of the attendees is Maj. [Vernon L. Sadowski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.tributearchive.com/obituaries/2140264/Vernon-L-Sadowski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921984746&usg=AOvVaw0RvoxXYvbMo0h9puEUC1v_), the ADC Intelligence liaison to Blue Book, who says that “no one can understand why Intelligence is so hesitant to accept the fact that something we just don’t know about is flying around in our skies, unless you are trying to cover up something big.” (Ruppelt, [pp. 194–197](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/194/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921985120&usg=AOvVaw12CX4kFSvPFZAQAxtEd0w7))

September 26 — Syndicated aviation columnist [Robert S. Allen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_S._Allen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921985518&usg=AOvVaw0Gt423WNcvtrGg9kHc49UJ) writes in his column that the “Air Force has a breathtaking report” ready on UFOs. The study expresses the belief that some reports are genuine and originate from “sources outside of this planet.” The supposed document also says that some sightings involve secret US military devices. The study is allegedly based on more than 1,800 sightings in the past 5 years. (Robert S. Allen, “[Report on Flying Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93486106/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921985933&usg=AOvVaw3Zfl96Xn0c2kZopDiA2tN8)” Los Angeles Mirror News, September 26, 1952, p. 43; Michael Hall, “Was There a Second Estimate of the Situation?” IUR 27, no. 1 (Spring 2002): 10–11)

September 26 — 11:16 p.m. The pilot and crew of a USAF C-124 see two distinct green lights to the right and slightly above the plane, about 400 miles north-northwest of the Azores Islands. At one point, they appear to turn toward the plane. They remain visible until the plane sights the islands.
