(NICAP, “[Air Crews Observe Green Lights](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520926azores_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921986656&usg=AOvVaw3FKhura8HTZvGFA4o0YbIu)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921986969&usg=AOvVaw1DeYI3JhTVahZiSNKkbeCL)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921987174&usg=AOvVaw2tAkRDrjeKyU_4fAyFg7en) p. 174)

September 27–28 — Throughout West Germany, Denmark, and southern Sweden, there are widespread UFO reports. A luminous object with a comet-like tail is seen moving irregularly near Hamburg and Kiel, Germany. Once, three satellite objects are reported moving around a larger object. A cigar-shaped UFO moving silently eastward is also seen. (UFOEv, [p. 163](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D175%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921987627&usg=AOvVaw1XERbxYceAO0Uz0gnPzE5J))

September 28 — 2:00 p.m. [Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921988032&usg=AOvVaw154XgFuDE-cFMR2CmAowgs), [Streeter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111409702/lyman-h_-streeter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921988368&usg=AOvVaw2qdrhiPyJ6YOeZdCxtMfRP), and Bailey attempt to meet the saucer intelligences for a landing somewhere in the Arizona desert, but apparently get lost. They return to Streeter’s home, where the radio sends sinister-sounding messages about the radio being dangerous, a man coming, and Streeter having a deep secret (perhaps that Streeter has attempted psychic contact once before in 1950). (George Hunt Williamson and Alfred

C. Bailey, The Saucers Speak! New Age, 1954; Michael D. Swords, “Strange Days,” IUR 30, no. 4 (Aug. 2006): 22)

September 28 — 8:35 p.m.–10:09 p.m. USAF radar operator A/3c Carlton L. Hall, stationed on the southwest coast of Tsushima Island, Japan, notices unusual targets on six separate occasions, each time for a duration of 2–4 sweeps. On two separate outbound tracks from Itazuke Air Base \[now Fukuoka Airport\], a series of targets appear directly behind aircraft when entering an azimuth of 50°–70° from nearby Tsutsusaki Lighthouse. The objects appear as

* * *

normal aircraft but are rounder in shape, trailing about 2–3 miles to the rear of the aircraft. A/2c Warren D. Grovenstein also observes four of these anomalies with Hall. (\[[Blue Book report](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs2/1952-09-28%2520TsuShima-Japan-min.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921989488&usg=AOvVaw2-6I0KwIsCidzGt_tJSK6P)\])

September 29 — 6:30 p.m. Capt. Dursemaine, commanding officer of the Gendarmerie Maritime en Allemagne, watches a luminous, egg-shaped object with a black spot in its center flying at an altitude of 3.7 miles above his home 1.2 miles south of Mainz, Rhineland-Palatinate, Germany. It emits a low-pitched hum and white exhaust. (Jan Aldrich)

September 30 — 10:30 a.m. A North American Aviation Company film crew, headed by Dick Beemer, is at Edwards AFB in southern California to film some tests. They are at Rogers Dry Lake when a B-29 passes overhead.

Cameraman Carlos Garcia sees an unusual object moving near the plane. A second object appears. Soon the whole crew is looking up. Beemer says the objects are silent, leave no vapor trail, take turns maneuvering around each other, and look like “flattened spheres.” They have a color motion picture camera with them, but the UFOs are too near the sun. (UFOEv, [pp. 57–58](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D69%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921990307&usg=AOvVaw2ETxZZomC1p1SCa2wjMAHt))

Fall — Evening. [Paul Solem](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88132621/paul-renshaw-solem&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921990890&usg=AOvVaw0NXxlkX874jITCDtH_VTQZ) has his first contact with a flying saucer around the Lost River Sinks a few miles from his ranch in Howe, Idaho. After watching a metallic object land, Solem sees a man with long blond hair and dressed in a white uniform standing next to it. He tells Solem to call him “Paul 2.” He says he is from Venus and tells Solem to work with Indians in North America in preparing for a postapocalyptic social order. This will be the first of many contacts for Solem. Over the next 17 years he wanders through the western states, speaking with Indians and contactees, gathers a small group of followers, and generally avoids the limelight. (Clark III 1094)

October — The first number of [Albert K. Bender](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_K._Bender&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921991478&usg=AOvVaw0hOuw1d8gS4KQQATCF4sPA)’s Space Review is published. ([Space Review](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Space%2520Review%2520(Bender)/Space%2520Review%2520-%2520Volume%25201%2520number%25201%2520-%25201952%252010.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921992028&usg=AOvVaw2EAVqyoRUz-7AD7PZRB5yu) 1, no. 1 (October 1952); Clark III 189)

October — Opal Church is driving with her nephew in a car between Salem and Corvallis, Oregon, when they see an 8- foot, heavily built figure walking with “fluid movements” along the road. It is wearing an Arab-style headdress and a uniform, with gloves and boots, of fine metallic mesh. A ribbed belt surrounds the waist. Its face is pale and the huge round eyes, nearly 3 inches in diameter, glow. Inside them are reticulations “resembling the filament in old electric light bulbs.” Church turns around immediately, but the figure is gone, even though the terrain is flat. (Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT Index 1952–1953,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1952-1953.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921992642&usg=AOvVaw2UYNMxAWQOIycCpZ8mkwEa) p. 28; Clark III 267)

October — [Andrija Puharich](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrija_Puharich&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921993128&usg=AOvVaw31u_khrsovsnbPwbzZkdF2)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrija_Puharich&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921993357&usg=AOvVaw1US_k2QXiDfGyvu4w_2OaW) a medical doctor interested in parapsychology, discovers that a person’s ESP abilities are enhanced when they are placed inside a Faraday cage. His experimental subject is none other than gifted psychic [Eileen J. Garrett](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eileen_J._Garrett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921993661&usg=AOvVaw0teMBi1a22d82hB1uljfi7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eileen_J._Garrett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921993905&usg=AOvVaw1KJIlYJgNiYs5g7zTdufBh) whom he has tasked with clairvoyantly perceiving cosmic ray bursts of sufficient magnitude to trigger a signal in a detector. (Michael D. Swords, “Strange Days, Part 2,” IUR 32, no. 2 (December 2008): 8)

October — Stanley Glickman, an American artist living in Paris, France, joins a group of fellow Americans at a café, one of whom is CIA mind-control and poison specialist [Sidney Gottlieb](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidney_Gottlieb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921994569&usg=AOvVaw0AqcPVz6aTNPr6NktLtIjd)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidney_Gottlieb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921994812&usg=AOvVaw09XMloVAubDX1Gx9-CeCF7) A heated political debate ensues, and when Glickman decides to leave, he is offered a drink to soothe ill feelings. Gottlieb surreptitiously slips LSD into Glickman’s drink and it derails his life. Glickman suffers a complete mental breakdown from which he never recovers. In 1977, he learns about Gottlieb and CIA’s LSD experiments on unwitting involuntary subjects from the [Kennedy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ted_Kennedy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921995221&usg=AOvVaw3VdnoUoWbIcfwC6AV8JZSX) congressional hearings. Glickman sues in 1981, but the trial is delayed 17 years on technical grounds, by which time Glickman has died in 1992. His sister, Gloria Kronisch, pursues the case in the US Court of Appeals, Second Circuit, as his executrix in 1998, but it is thrown out on July 9 because the statute of limitations has passed. (H. P. Albarelli Jr., [A Terrible Mistake: The Murder of Frank Olson and the CIA’s Cold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/terriblemistake00hpal/page/n3/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921995698&usg=AOvVaw0pxcE6Ntcp3dlioSZOt39m) [War Experiments](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/terriblemistake00hpal/page/n3/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921996027&usg=AOvVaw3XmZ6sg6AuMw7iNzN9svQd)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/terriblemistake00hpal/page/n3/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921996304&usg=AOvVaw04zNFi_rtjVKU80N-gc_Kr) Trine Day, 2009; [Kronisch v. United States](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://caselaw.findlaw.com/us-2nd-circuit/1364923.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921996693&usg=AOvVaw3XDGpmo7cNOuZvPwYBFhMd), US Court of Appeals, 2d Circuit, July 9, 1998)

October — Evening. Aeronautical engineer and former Project Sign liaison [Alfred Loedding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921997287&usg=AOvVaw1i7d47rd_vKPJTB-En0LMN) and his wife Marion see an odd object while driving near Plainsboro, New Jersey. At first, they think it is an aircraft crashing, but the object levels off and flashes away at high speed, emitting a bluish-green light. He estimates it is 100 feet in diameter and 500–600 feet high, and it gives off a “weird light like looking at a firefly” while changing shape. Loedding says Rep. [L. Gary Clemente](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/L._Gary_Clemente&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921997723&usg=AOvVaw1gtNtWefRx5Gi1ZU95WpKq) (D-N.Y.) is also a witness. (“[Flying Saucer Design Practical, WADC Aid Says; U.S.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/59508517/the-journal-herald/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921998129&usg=AOvVaw1z-Pwk771aaP_kOTgsGrO-) [Interested,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/59508517/the-journal-herald/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921998449&usg=AOvVaw2km0q41WuSlNmqRTOIvtma)” Dayton (Ohio) Journal Herald, August 9, 1957, p. 13)

October 2? — Shortly before 7:00 a.m. One Thursday this month, Johannes Nordlien is waiting for coworkers when he hears a howling sound. A white, saucer-shaped object, 13 feet in diameter, comes in from the west at high speed and passes him only 325 feet away. It falls with a violent splash into the river Lågen \[Gudbrandsdalslågen?\] in Norway. When his colleagues show up, the water is still roiling. (Ole Jonny Brænne, “Observations of Unidentified Submarine Objects in Norway,” IUR 20, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1995): 12)

October 2 — CIA Office of Scientific Intelligence Director [H. Marshall Chadwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921999302&usg=AOvVaw3AMWH-iAWvdIoti3o19gcd) writes a memorandum to Director of Central Intelligence [Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889921999690&usg=AOvVaw3bcQFJnAbc_9CQKoJfKncV) recommending he advise the National Security Council that more research is needed on UFOs to investigate their national security threat. (H. Marshall Chadwell, “[Flying Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100020012-7.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922000130&usg=AOvVaw3nOfE3vSlt6v5VcFhHPQGD)”

October 2, 1952; CUFON, “[The CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-Related Document Sampler, Part 1 of 2 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922000565&usg=AOvVaw2-bmdCyI9bxg_5wEO8UhJo)” May 17, 1996; Good Above, [pp. 509–510](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/508/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922000850&usg=AOvVaw10SKYmyBGgU4WPo9gMlhzR))

October 9–11 — At the Optical Society of America meeting in Boston, Massachusetts, [J. Allen Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922001303&usg=AOvVaw0oeqJVyNRDQEtSWETm5Pvd) presents a paper on “Unusual Aerial Phenomena,” in which he expresses skepticism for most reports, except for nocturnal lights that do “not appear to be readily explainable on an astronomical basis, or by mirages, balloons, or by conventional aircraft.” Astronomer [Donald Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922001852&usg=AOvVaw0k42-dMKEBcx2McRlTuMH1) presents a dismissive paper on radar angels and mirages, while [Urner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1979/10/03/urner-liddel-ex-physicist-headed-lunar-planetary-unit/126c1f5b-1d2a-4045-9bb5-9f7327808c1c/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922002252&usg=AOvVaw2QpTslDqkwSmOZXOYmgU-6) [Liddel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1979/10/03/urner-liddel-ex-physicist-headed-lunar-planetary-unit/126c1f5b-1d2a-4045-9bb5-9f7327808c1c/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922002662&usg=AOvVaw1mI7s8glKRANgh5rlpALQC) presents “Phantasmagoria or Unusual Observations in the Atmosphere,” dismissing UFO reports as mass hysteria, fear psychosis, and sensation-seeking. (J. A. Hynek, “[Unusual Aerial Phenomena,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://opg.optica.org/josa/abstract.cfm?uri%3Djosa-43-4-311&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922003103&usg=AOvVaw0jMzOvmCJSrTnuVAk-v6ND)” Journal of the Optical Society of America 43 (1953): 311–314; Urner Liddel, “[Phantasmagoria or Unusual Observations in the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://opg.optica.org/josa/abstract.cfm?URI%3Djosa-43-4-314&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922003535&usg=AOvVaw3JnsBBtkgKKN_V1cz6OSUA) [Atmosphere,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://opg.optica.org/josa/abstract.cfm?URI%3Djosa-43-4-314&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922003865&usg=AOvVaw3aUdXbrT7XKxQ-UirQb_bo)” Journal of the Optical Society of America 43 (1953): 314–317)

October 10 — Battelle issues its sixth status report on Project Stork. UFO reports through 1951 have been coded and put on IBM punch cards. About 60% of the reports have been evaluated. The panel has looked at two films and soil and vegetation samples from cases in Florida and Pittsburg, Kansas. The witness questionnaire is further refined and will become the basis for Project Blue Book’s form. (“[Seven Status Reports for Project Stork, Part 3,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cufon.org/cufon/stork1-7b.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922004484&usg=AOvVaw3cJ75fNeFLx2O-7n1RFl0A)” CUFON; “[Seven Status Reports for Project Stork, Part 4,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cufon.org/cufon/stork1-7c.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922004795&usg=AOvVaw3WNVzm2_FaXRALmqulatzH)” CUFON)

October 12 — Harold H. Fulton founds Civilian Saucer Investigation (New Zealand) in Auckland. It begins publishing a quarterly newsletter, Flying Saucers, in May 1953, which continues until September 1959 with a name change in 1958 to Space Probe. ([Flying Saucers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/New%2520Zealand/Flying%2520Saucers%2520(CSI%2520NZ)/Flying%2520Saucers%2520-%2520Vol%252001%2520No%252001%2520-%25201953%252005.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922005910&usg=AOvVaw0nYquI732rv5Qh6pF5p4m6) 1, no. 1 (May 1953); [Space Probe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/New%2520Zealand/Space%2520Probe%2520(CSI%2520NZ)/Space%2520Probe%2520-%25201958%252012.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922006265&usg=AOvVaw1faQHyj6ery1n3tzQBMwou)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/New%2520Zealand/Space%2520Probe%2520(CSI%2520NZ)/Space%2520Probe%2520-%25201958%252012.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922006516&usg=AOvVaw2c5AbzeElikxnV7OPRkZ_I) Christmas 1958)

October 13 — [James Q. Reber](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Q._Reber&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922006810&usg=AOvVaw2Dy6iq-5JFGknE6FWHXp6W)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Q._Reber&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922006980&usg=AOvVaw2m8FeJ0pbeEm2z7QvfwZ1q) assistant director of CIA intelligence coordination, writes a memo to the CIA deputy director of intelligence, arguing that fundamental research into the question of positive identification is the responsibility of the Defense Department and that while investigating Soviet knowledge of UFO phenomena is a “primary concern” for the CIA, it “is far too early in view of the present state of our knowledge regarding Flying Saucers for psychological warfare planners to start planning how the United States might use U.S. Flying Saucers against the enemy.” Reber goes on to recommend that when “intelligence has submitted the National Estimate on Flying Saucers there will be the time and basis for a public policy to reduce or restrain mass hysteria.” (James Q. Reber, “[Flying Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100020012-7.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922007495&usg=AOvVaw1vQWlAbj8OMdGeresb1anM)” October 13, 1952; CUFON, “[The CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-Related Document Sampler,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922007896&usg=AOvVaw079gK8OuRWroRaH5sIk3Re) [Part 1 of 2 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922008192&usg=AOvVaw0fuSrKVZzwHQO70rJbQC--)” May 17, 1996)

October 13 — 7:08 p.m. USAF pilot Maj. [William D. Leet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/139829263/william-dean-leet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922008664&usg=AOvVaw3VvBlWofaBGV67M7FCXL7a) and his engineer, flying a C-54 troop carrier, watch an elliptical UFO hovering in clouds near Oshima, Japan. It speeds away after 7 minutes. (UFOEv, [p. 24](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D36%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922009111&usg=AOvVaw1czTW-t7oLHgaADHHKqNTy))

October 14 — OSI Deputy Assistant Director [Ralph L. Clark](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1994/01/28/ralph-clark-dies/a5579bb9-2ac2-400e-8c13-af6cc74befde/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922009613&usg=AOvVaw0lSKyw6SwPTqWJ3kzBmfF_) writes a memorandum for the record suggesting a meeting on October 20 or 21 to work out a research and intelligence program on UFOs. Clark, “[Flying Saucers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/DOC_0005515939.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922010001&usg=AOvVaw3S8Gwpq_1-XEN3eimSSGpl) [Problem,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/DOC_0005515939.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922010321&usg=AOvVaw2c-rkP5hJs33NfGeiEgL3h)” October 14, 1952)

October 16 — [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922010789&usg=AOvVaw3nXdqW08tQzZhj8mpLlIvb) is in a state of panic from the messages he and the Baileys have received from space people. He writes an associate doing missionary work in Guatemala that disaster will strike the earth before December 1. He says radio contacts have stopped and that he has been told there will be a direct contact with a spaceman: “Professor [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922011225&usg=AOvVaw2aDUtEHuAZSyHYaDSzsyAa) is in on this too.” The Baileys have already met with Adamski (in August) and now the messages are urging another meeting with him. (Y. N. ibn Aharon \[Yonah Fortner\], “Diagnosis: A Case of Chronic Fright,” Saucer News 4, no. 5 (Aug./Sept. 1957): 3–6; Clark III 1284)

October 17 — Early afternoon. Residents of Oloron-Sainte-Marie, Pyrénées-Atlantiques, France, see a large cigar-shaped structure in the blue sky, inclined at a 45° angle. The witnesses include the family of Yves Prigent, general superintendent of the local high school. A plume of white smoke is escaping from its upper end. At some distance in front of the cylinder, about 30 round, puffy objects with a central red spot are following the same trajectory.

The smaller objects move in pairs following a broken, zig-zag path. They leave an abundant trail of a white substance (angel’s hair) behind them, which slowly falls to the ground as it disperses. For several hours, clumps of it hang on the trees, on the telephone wires, and on the roofs of houses. (“[Les Soucoupes Volantes vues à](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/The_Spectrum_of_UFO_Research.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922012162&usg=AOvVaw1pjyteOxDdPI4AgmvuVfWP) [Oloron le 17 Octobre,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/The_Spectrum_of_UFO_Research.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922012494&usg=AOvVaw3D_6QKd-Nuy5lcSnU-ddXm)” France-Dimanche, October 26, 1952, in The Spectrum of UFO Research, CUFOS, 1988,

p. 114; Jimmy Guieu, Flying Saucers Come from Another World, Hutchinson, 1956, pp. 87–92; Jacques Vallee and Janine Vallee, Challenge to Science: The UFO Enigma, Regnery, 1966, [pp. 120–121](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/challengetoscien00vall/page/119/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922013414&usg=AOvVaw349YB4B7CvHl7TN53VNJ11); Clark III 123; Patrick Gross, “[Documents: Found in the Attic](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/attic/1952-10-17-oloron-dr.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922013731&usg=AOvVaw03WUONKsEkYa1Mj56zoTZT)”; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, September–October](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Sept-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922014097&usg=AOvVaw1mErmPYSPidKgZyFb1TIBF), The Author, 1986, pp. 73–74; Lotharson, “[Unidentified Flying Spiders in Southern France?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://shardsofmagonia.wordpress.com/2017/03/12/unidentified-flying-spiders-in-southern-france/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922014557&usg=AOvVaw2pUnOeIagrI70_Sagc-ESx)” Shards of Magonia, March 12, 2017)

October 18 — 9:44 p.m. Journalist Keith Hooper is returning home from an assignment for the Adelaide Advrtiser when he sees a greenish-white, cigar-shaped object about the size of a Boeing 707 some 10 miles away over the

* * *

Adelaide Hills, South Australia, moving southeast to northwest. The object makes a sharp, right-angle turn upward, recedes, then vanishes at tremendous speed. The duration is 5–7 seconds. (Keith Hooper, “[My Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93520589/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922015413&usg=AOvVaw2gF1izSBhmCOZz7z3hnUaV) [Saucer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93520589/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922015715&usg=AOvVaw0dquxZBx0ppkqEKXnk02Ai)” Sydney (N.S.W.) Morning Herald, March 13, 1965, p. 13)

October 21 — Afternoon. Flight Lt. Michael Swiney and a student pilot, Royal Navy Lt. David Crofts, are flying a Meteor

T.7 trainer out of RAF Little Rissington, Gloucester, England, for a high-altitude navigation exercise at 35,000 feet. Not long after breaking out of a cloud during a climb at 13,000–14,000 feet, they see three circular, white objects in front of them. As the aircraft get closer and turns to avoid them, the objects become visible as discs. They disappear quickly when the pilot looks away briefly. Two Meteor F.8 fighters are scrambled from RAF Tangmere \[now closed\] in West Sussex to chase three unknown radar targets moving at 3,000 mph but fail to intercept them. (Wikipedia, “[Little Rissington UFO incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_Rissington_UFO_incident&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922016524&usg=AOvVaw1ZlnjF0IbQCsMDFmj-QfxS)”; David Clarke and Andy Roberts, Out of the Shadows, Piatkus, 2002, pp. 98–102; UFOFiles2, [pp. 47–49](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n79/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922017077&usg=AOvVaw0SB6uqcWiBXLLbsB7z9VyI))

October 23 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922017494&usg=AOvVaw28eNJ67AResDv2_HSKFe7Q) holds a briefing on UFOs at Los Alamos Scientific Laboratory, New Mexico. Afterward Assistant Director for Scientific Personnel William H. Crew arranges a special meeting for Ruppelt and Col. [Bower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49126583/donald-langlitz-bower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922017936&usg=AOvVaw36q-ZTd-EMnRmvwewsIi0z) with seven people from the laboratory. Several of them have evidence that there is a possible correlation between sightings of UFOs and unusual radiation detection. (Edward J. Ruppelt, \[[Message referring to a December 1](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/MAXW-PBB7-926-927.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922018344&usg=AOvVaw06uwEJOjFM3c8QJFNTo9rB) [telephone call](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/MAXW-PBB7-926-927.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922018648&usg=AOvVaw31z0seWXNBsAx2WX_T2uRA)\], December 2, 1952)

October 24 — President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922019113&usg=AOvVaw3Ylh_aO0xvVAoLkQ-iGOyq) signs National Security Council Directive 6, a 7-page document that eliminates the Armed Forces Security Agency formed in 1949 to unite all military signal intelligence operations and creates the National Security Agency. Since the memo is a classified document, the existence of the NSA is not known to the public. Due to its ultra-secrecy the US intelligence community refers to the NSA as “No Such Agency." The NSA is responsible for global monitoring, collection, and processing of information and data for foreign intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. NSA inherits Project Shamrock from the AFSA. It also inherits collection of UFO data, at least by 1958, but probably in 1953. (ClearIntent, [p. 189](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/188/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922019989&usg=AOvVaw2GtTyAseOBdR2mPJjo_rGL); Thomas L. Burns, The Origins of the National Security Agency, 1940–1952, National Security Agency, 1990, pp. 97–99)

Late October — Night. Radioman Tom Kramer is serving aboard the [USS](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Curtiss_(AV-4)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922020792&usg=AOvVaw2yVnerOL1hFyt7-zuikP4b) [Curtiss](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Curtiss_(AV-4)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922021055&usg=AOvVaw220iibVg965ChPYmKz9Cjc), the AEC flagship for Ivy Mike, the first detonation of a hydrogen bomb at Elugelab Atoll in the Marshall Islands. After an onboard movie, Kramer and other crewmen see a round, silent, bright white light that is motionless at first, then starts zigzagging for less than 10 seconds and takes off at high speed. (Nukes 100–101)

Late October — 3:45 a.m. Seaman Abelardo Marquez, posted on the [USS](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Fletcher_(DD-445)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922021561&usg=AOvVaw1kYc0Xa66Z1H0wT8dIiw32) [Fletcher](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Fletcher_(DD-445)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922021800&usg=AOvVaw1CR9Oe8LEXf-KEKr0qjkAp) near Eniwetak Atoll for the upcoming Ivy Mike thermonuclear test, is going on duty to the bridge when he notices that the ship is uncharacteristically moving at full speed. Other crew members tell him it is because of a round white light that has been moving above the ship. Marquez sees it descending, then it stops and hovers about 40°–45° above the horizon and perhaps one-half mile from the ship. Capt. [Grover L. Rawlings](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/islandpacket/obituary.aspx?n%3Dgrover-l-rawlings%26pid%3D180203035&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922022329&usg=AOvVaw0vT61y0nLesubUoWace3nt) is talking with other officers on the bridge, saying they do not know what the light is, and that is not tracked on radar. After about 4–5 minutes, the light takes off straight up at the same speed it had descended. (Nukes 101–105)

October 27 — 2:03 a.m. Customs officer Gabriel Gachignard observes a cigar-shaped object land briefly on a runway of the airport at Marignane, Bouches-du-Rhône, France, 100 meters away, producing a dull sound. The object is dark with four lighted windows. It takes off with a “swish” and a shower of sparks when he runs toward it. (Clark III 243–244; Jimmy Guieu, Flying Saucers Come from Another World, Hutchinson, 1956, p. 53; Michel, The Truth about FS, pp. 152–156; Jacques Vallee and Janine Vallee, Challenge to Science: The UFO Enigma, Regnery, 1966, [pp. 6–11](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/challengetoscien00vall/page/5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922023196&usg=AOvVaw0rUPoBU_Zyr1ag2XbDoaXx); Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, September–October](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Sept-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922023410&usg=AOvVaw3K5MC087f7yXmofBdR1l9M)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Sept-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922023570&usg=AOvVaw0fgXBgBNn_hPORrbDiGqfG) The Author, 1986, pp. 82–84)

October 27 — An FBI memorandum to [Alan H. Belmont](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://spartacus-educational.com/JFKbelmontA.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922023910&usg=AOvVaw1KSwUAuVSyibRxmCEMiwam) from Victor P. Keay reports that “Air Intelligence still feels that the so-called flying saucers are either optical illusions or atmospheric phenomena. He pointed out, however, that some Military officials are seriously considering the possibility of interplanetary ships.” (V. P. Keay, “[Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/docs85-86.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922024157&usg=AOvVaw0srvXQmuTqde6N14-D94SI) [Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/docs85-86.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922024320&usg=AOvVaw3s-2MbXN3k6h17pbm4bFB8)” October 27, 1952)

October 27 — 4:00 p.m. Residents of Gaillac, Tarn, France, see a formation of 16 disc-shaped UFOs ranged in twos. An elongated cylinder is in the center of the objects, all of which are discharging angel’s hair like glass wool. (Aimé Michel, The Truth about FS, p. 148; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, September–October](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Sept-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922024889&usg=AOvVaw06AkLaBZlfii7YcuBGsgSg), The Author, 1986, pp. 84–85; Lotharson, “[Unidentified Flying Spiders in Southern France?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://shardsofmagonia.wordpress.com/2017/03/12/unidentified-flying-spiders-in-southern-france/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922025390&usg=AOvVaw1ueRICF9HxTBEdh5DWap0G)” Shards of Magonia, March 12, 2017)

October 29 — 5:10 a.m. Two USAF F-94 crews see a white luminous object maneuvering at high speed for 20 minutes above Hempstead, Long Island, New York. Lt. William F. Hamilton and Lt. Norman W. Booth write: “Based on my experience in fighter tactics, it is my opinion that the object was controlled by something having visual contact with us. The power and acceleration were beyond the capability of any known aircraft.” (NICAP, “[Two F-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/521029hempstead_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922025931&usg=AOvVaw2B_c_7SY8d99fPgBMzewF3) [94’s Encounter Controlled Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/521029hempstead_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922026240&usg=AOvVaw2XRXwu26n2RM1cc9NEk4Gn)”; Sparks, p. 177)

* * *

November — [Aladino Félix](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aladino_F%25C3%25A9lix&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922027347&usg=AOvVaw18nWdBdBiUeUgfL5vKjKEx) and a friend are climbing a hill near Angatuba, São Paulo, Brazil. When they get to the top, Félix claims they see numerous UFOs flying around. Félix comes back another day by himself; eventually a saucer lands and he is invited inside to meet its crew and examine the technology. Several months later, he is visited at his home in São Paulo by the saucer captain, who claims to come from one or two of the satellites of Jupiter. Félix, under the pseudonym of Dino Kraspedon, writes about his various conversations with the spaceman in Meu Contato com os discos voadores in 1957. He writes other mystical and religious tracts under the names Dunatos Menorá and Sábado Dinotos. In 1967–1968, Félix is operating a right-wing terrorism group that sets off bombs, steals arms and explosives, and robs a bank. He serves three years in prison. (Clark III 661–662; Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, pp. 164–165)

November 1 — Nuclear test Ivy Mike is the first successful full-scale test of a multi-megaton thermonuclear weapon (“hydrogen bomb”) using the Teller-Ulam design the size of an airplane hangar. Unlike later thermonuclear weapons, Mike uses deuterium as its fusion fuel, maintained as a liquid by an expensive and cumbersome cryogenic system. It is detonated on Elugelab in the Marshall Islands yielding 10.4 megatons, almost 500 times the yield of the bomb dropped on Nagasaki. The fireball is 3 miles wide and completely destroys the atoll. USAF Capt. [Jimmy Priestly Robinson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22314541/jimmy-priestly-robinson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922028666&usg=AOvVaw1eAeYzykAkIL3lbUGWd3At) of the 561st Fighter-Day Squadron, is lost near the end of his mission to successfully pilot his F-84G through the mushroom cloud’s stem to collect radiochemical air samples. After re- emerging from the cloud, both he and his wingman, pilot Captain [Bob Hagan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/172623461/robert-s_-hagan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922029167&usg=AOvVaw0l5qP5HqdBj_PzNjTKsGqp)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/172623461/robert-s_-hagan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922029445&usg=AOvVaw1eYdN8fIfeAtwEODTvNFAO) encounter difficulties picking up navigational beacons due to “electromagnetic after effects” of the detonation. By the time they are successful in finding the signal four hours later, they are dangerously low on fuel, and before reaching the runway, both have depleted their reserves. While Hagan is able to glide to the runway and achieve a hard landing, Robinson is too far out to follow the same path and therefore attempts to land on water. Neither his plane nor his body has ever been found; his family only learned the truth in 2008 after repeated FOIA requests. (Wikipedia, “[Ivy Mike](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivy_Mike&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922029868&usg=AOvVaw2KrM1yad8xhTUmEXHKyaAK)”)

November 4 — Capt. [Edward J. Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922030296&usg=AOvVaw26DKdXXXsKWIqqtm4uRctq) and Lt. Robert M. Olsson visit Col. [John R. Hood Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/40669343/john-r_-hood&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922030633&usg=AOvVaw0PpDT0AIvX5U8A6fVVnge7), AMC chief of the Nuclear Powered Aircraft Branch of Wright Air Development Center. Hood had contacted ATIC in December 1950 in regard to certain sightings of UFOs at Oak Ridge National Laboratory, Tennessee, in which he and a naval officer attempted to obtain correlation between sightings and peaks in radiation backgrounds. Now there are indications that there may be some correlation present between unknown radar pickups and rises in radiation, and he suggests that ATIC begin an instrumented radiation program. (“[Visit to WADC](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/MAXW-PBB7-932-933.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922030917&usg=AOvVaw2k4_j4qQ70YJwNS8VDL1GV),” November 4, 1952; Patrick W. Hayes, “[Unconventional Aircraft,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/madar/radiation/501221OakRidge_docs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922031168&usg=AOvVaw0ZPT3fG3OxPU1afSupOtqZ)” Spot Intelligence Report, Dec. 1950)

November 4 — The National Security Agency is established in Fort Meade, Maryland, in a memo by Secretary of Defense [Robert A. Lovett](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_A._Lovett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922031478&usg=AOvVaw04AbBeQesGLdz7vQaYcmyv)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_A._Lovett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922031633&usg=AOvVaw2naxpmgUJvPl96pXOB2-oD) making the new agency responsible for all communications intelligence. The existence of the NSA is not known to the public at this time. (Wikipedia, “[National Security Agency](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Security_Agency&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922031931&usg=AOvVaw1IuB6ZwTRjNHJmN06BTVzf)”)

November 4–6 — The Baileys and Williamsons come up together for a visit to the Palomar Gardens Café. [Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922032254&usg=AOvVaw2NBlF3uTzSQ1sh-x3iKTuW) tells them he has been making special trips into the desert in hopes of meeting a saucer. Soon Adamski begins channeling space messages in the presence of the Williamsons and the Baileys. At one of these sessions, a space being declares that a face-to-face meeting will take place soon. [Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922032510&usg=AOvVaw2qR1teomsmocRd8u_2pVLk) and Bailey ask Adamski to call them before he attempts his next contact. (Michael D. Swords, “Strange Days,” IUR 30, no. 4 (Aug. 2006): 23; Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, p. 357)

November 5 — [Dwight D. Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922033287&usg=AOvVaw2d7SJLBBeyccaCbGd7TFhb) is elected president. ()

November 10 — Battelle’s Project Stork notes in its seventh status report that current UFO reports “are now in more detail and often consist of sightings of one object by more than one individual.” 500 copies of a final version of the sighting questionnaire were delivered to ATIC at Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio. It expects to have all UFO reports dated before June 15, 1952, processed and evaluated by December 10, ready for IBM analysis later. (Clark III 929; “[Seven Status Reports for Project Stork, Part 4,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cufon.org/cufon/stork1-7c.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922033876&usg=AOvVaw1_fBFinVikBe1CK0XMRx75)” CUFON)

November 16 —Around 5:00 p.m. An air traffic controller at Florence Airport, South Carolina, watches a huge, gleaming disc through binoculars and sees it tilt up sharply before climbing out of sight. About 6 minutes later, people see a group of round, glowing objects north of Landrum, South Carolina. [David S. Bunch](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89210457/david-sumter-bunch&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922034404&usg=AOvVaw30NOZV9Nslh4dUtz-7VM8u) takes 40 minutes of film with an 8mm camera and telephoto lens before the UFOs disappear to the west. [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922034849&usg=AOvVaw0z58xJvPUDLmeaJyZ-R7dU) reviews the film along with some Air Force officers. It shows five glowing, oval-shaped objects. (Keyhoe, FS from OS, [pp. 4–5](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsos/chI.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922035382&usg=AOvVaw0RdDlPq39UQdF1vQfTxd3I); UFOEv, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D101%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922035742&usg=AOvVaw3ab8FUm_NZjrS6ryZeh2Ce)

[89](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D101%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922036240&usg=AOvVaw2-dkGSG3S_1luosSplVhmi); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922036558&usg=AOvVaw2mnG9TeBi0IOorfjc-mwiT), p. 180)

November 18 — Date of the fake four-page “Briefing Document: Operation Majestic 12. Prepared for President-Elect [Dwight D. Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922037059&usg=AOvVaw0_ddIpcLTNELm55vb_qly2): Eyes Only.” It states that UFOs are the product of an extraterrestrial civilization, that several had crashed and came into the possession of the US government, and that the US had custody of an alien for some time before it died. It says that [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922037444&usg=AOvVaw05IYo2fTefyRwSiB3QXKdD) established the MJ-12 group in 1947. Called Majestic-12, the group supposedly consists of CIA Director [Roscoe Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922037885&usg=AOvVaw1TWrf0Fbn6ZHDeR4kMUp8l)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922038142&usg=AOvVaw2CAoxxnwuXnD0NzErtCoqN) [Vannevar Bush](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vannevar_Bush&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922038464&usg=AOvVaw3NOJP8r70Tx_34q5w6TFis)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vannevar_Bush&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922038712&usg=AOvVaw37xWncrpXlMA00c_oSE75o) Secretary of Defense [James](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Forrestal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922039066&usg=AOvVaw2tjVinzx0VVRDtvRIkvZg6) [Forrestal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Forrestal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922039390&usg=AOvVaw2R59VF9m2Q912a0phW8GpI) (replaced by Gen. [Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922039739&usg=AOvVaw2UM850ErIVkD05e8j58LZu) in 1950), Gen. [Nathan Twining](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922040104&usg=AOvVaw0-H6i7XITVpzpu7K71-s2T), Gen. [Hoyt Vandenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Vandenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922040428&usg=AOvVaw3n56waJNsW0ntGlXd29sD_), [Detlev](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Detlev_Bronk&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922040723&usg=AOvVaw0XEL_6pVjUU3W9-RHKytWr)

[Bronk](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Detlev_Bronk&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922041221&usg=AOvVaw0TIR1WDBJrrruZ1uI7s8LB)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Detlev_Bronk&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922041432&usg=AOvVaw0uwX643S__xzibApLpgQ8n) [Jerome Clarke Hunsaker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerome_Clarke_Hunsaker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922041748&usg=AOvVaw2YTSBf7tyblBtK3sg3GUeu)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerome_Clarke_Hunsaker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922042015&usg=AOvVaw0ccGt8MI4LG6tXhcpR-JDI) [Sidney Souers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidney_Souers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922042320&usg=AOvVaw3CmNJTrqbS5qXMW2vuC2y2)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidney_Souers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922042557&usg=AOvVaw22OhADya8MVMlUIR3u0rTQ) [Gordon Gray](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gordon_Gray_(politician)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922042930&usg=AOvVaw0mdZLkpHQAAd0XP86JYWNj), [Donald Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922043255&usg=AOvVaw0PFJ_lVypjZU1etq6iCZbh)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922043507&usg=AOvVaw0wb_kuqRZBieHmrexADc13) Gen. November 18 — President-Elect [Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922046781&usg=AOvVaw20_uL5zGYNdpxLpjlaflba) receives a 43-minute national security briefing on matters that are still classified. Gen. [Nathan Twining,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922047231&usg=AOvVaw20VGh6y-P7TaqK_u9_S_lx) Gen. [Omar Bradley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omar_Bradley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922047602&usg=AOvVaw1A5ZmSxclquW6SENmFJ7Ep)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omar_Bradley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922047867&usg=AOvVaw3PoHHx6yRmT5m3yUVsTB7r) Adm. [William Fechteler](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Fechteler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922048192&usg=AOvVaw1Eq-GarubgHr2UkPcVonjY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Fechteler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922048427&usg=AOvVaw0AYB4vKPncOqBfB1RRcUSn) Gen. [J. Lawton Collins](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Lawton_Collins&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922048755&usg=AOvVaw3ioruSkz_prfMj5208ogGJ), Gen. [Lemuel C. Shepherd Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lemuel_C._Shepherd_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922049113&usg=AOvVaw01SdBlTijDcuKPJLgLh49T)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lemuel_C._Shepherd_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922049366&usg=AOvVaw0U_TBk9y6to61ohwer9wUW) and Secretary of Defense [Robert A. Lovett](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_A._Lovett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922049692&usg=AOvVaw3CTlWyK8Af8hhGCVMwQLpg) are present. (Stanton T. Friedman, “MJ 12: The Evidence So Far,” IUR 12, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1987): 16)

November 18 — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922050371&usg=AOvVaw1lHZPo13ONRN8l33tRzNX4) telephones [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922050740&usg=AOvVaw3C-_-bh5QKnzU8XEjTyCwr) and tells him that the space people have informed him a physical encounter will take place on November 20. (Clark III 1284; Michael D. Swords, “Strange Days,” IUR 30, no. 4 (Aug. 2006): 23; Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, p. 358)

November 19 — Pilot J. Slade Nash reaches 698.5 mph in a North American F-86D Sabre over the Salton Sea, California. (Bryan R. Swopes, “[19 November 1952,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.thisdayinaviation.com/tag/james-slade-nash/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922051632&usg=AOvVaw1B9BPF4XW3GQMrtxH9gKh1)” This Day in Aviation, 2018)

November 20 — Morning. [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922052106&usg=AOvVaw1SH1RY2vYjBjoeIJ64hLtb) and two associates, Lucy McGinnis and Alice Wells, drive out from the Palomar Gardens Café. They meet the Williamsons and the Baileys at Blythe, California, at 8:00 a.m., and they drive to Desert Center, California, taking Desert Center Rice Road 117 toward Coxcomb Mountain. (Clark III 1284; Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, p. 358)

November 20 — 1:00 p.m. [Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922052762&usg=AOvVaw10VNSJOCwoOaGJR0v_cxq6)’s group picnics along the roadside. At 1:30 p.m., they see a cigar-shaped UFO that appears shortly after a US Air Force B-29 passes overhead going in the direction of Parker, Arizona. Adamski asks Lucy McGinnis, accompanied by Alfred Bailey, to drive him a bit more than half a mile away to a flatter area near the foot of Coxcomb Mountain where he can set up his telescope. The cigar-shaped UFO is allegedly following them. (Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, pp. 54–56, 358–359)

November 20 — 1:57 p.m. [Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922053441&usg=AOvVaw168h6sFn5_BI2bq2ld4tMj) stays behind to set up his equipment as McGinnis and Bailey return to the rest of the group. At 2:04 p.m., another UFO, this time a “Scout ship,” appears near Adamski, who takes seven photos through his telescope. The cigar-shaped UFO is still visible through binoculars. At 2:12 pm., Adamski takes three more photos of the Scout ship with a Kodak Brownie before it disappears behind a hill. Air Force jets circle the area at least twice. (Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, pp. 359–360)

November 20 — 2:15 p.m. As he is packing up his telescope, [Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922054234&usg=AOvVaw3B0FQR8pSIA4qzq8U1_c4j) sees a man waving to him from about a quarter- mile away. He walks over to him and meets an entity named Orthon as his 6 companions watch from a distance. Five-and-a-half feet tall, Orthon \[could Adamski have thought of this name from Kodak Ortho film?\] is a beautiful being with long blond hair and an extremely high forehead. Through gestures, sign language, a few words, and telepathy, Adamski learns that he is from Venus and the Venusians are visiting earth out of concern for nuclear weapons. The conversation lasts about 45 minutes. Orthon declines to be photographed but asks Adamski to borrow one of his unexposed photos. After Orthon leaves in his Scout ship around 3:04 p.m., Adamski finds tracks in the desert floor. His companions rejoin him at the site. Around 3:45 p.m., [Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922054741&usg=AOvVaw3o4wUAL8kWZ5kk4PranuiG) takes casts with plaster of paris, which he just happens to carry with him in case he runs into a stray bone. Each track contains within it a distinct set of symbols. After several hours of assessing the situation and waiting for the plaster to dry, the group returns to Desert Center, California. (Desmond Leslie and George Adamski, Flying Saucers Have Landed, British Book Centre, 1953, [pp. 185–215](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucershav00lesl/page/184/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922055324&usg=AOvVaw2-5I1KoTYCMhoBacmHjcBk); Adamski Foundation, “[The Landing](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.adamskifoundation.com/html/Landing.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922055543&usg=AOvVaw0evpYKS57ooCGXIiDvYvWf)”; James W. Moseley, “[Special Adamski Exposé Issue,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://app.box.com/s/ffh3qv14hz8i5vcbwn5x&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922055852&usg=AOvVaw0BiAtxqYRSEygGT0pv4EiT)” Saucer News, no. 27 (October 1957); Curt Collins, “[Saucer News](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.jimmoseley.com/2014/05/saucer-news-presents-the-george-adamski-expose/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922056358&usg=AOvVaw2HJHX0L0k_qFQ_NFvCeEy1) [Presents: The George Adamski Exposé,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.jimmoseley.com/2014/05/saucer-news-presents-the-george-adamski-expose/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922056627&usg=AOvVaw1qvpuwYgeGT3Z4_y9UpOt_)” In Honor of James Moseley, May 30, 2014; Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, pp. 41–89, 360–362; Clark III 39–40, 1284; Michael D. Swords, “Strange Days,” IUR 30, no. 4 (August 2006): 23; Michael D. Swords, “Adamski in the Desert,” IUR 31, no. 3 (October 2007): 22; Rene Erik Olsen, \[[George Adamski photo analysis](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.adamskifoundation.com/Rene%2520Erik%2520Olsen%2520-%2520Denmark/Rene-Denmark.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922057360&usg=AOvVaw1zjgW7EJnKgFbCwRnNClm0)\], Adamski Foundation; Marc Hallet, [A Critical Appraisal of George Adamski: The Man Who Spoke to the Space Brothers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ACriticalAppraisalOfGeorgeAdamskiTheManWhoSpokeToTheSpaceBrothersREVISEDANDENLARGEDEDITION2016/page/n1/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922057700&usg=AOvVaw0bH_-nHMperH2EnnZH827G)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ACriticalAppraisalOfGeorgeAdamskiTheManWhoSpokeToTheSpaceBrothersREVISEDANDENLARGEDEDITION2016/page/n1/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922058067&usg=AOvVaw3oeT7hVXIq6s_xi8ui6fLu) The Author, 2016)

November 20 — 9:00 p.m. The Williamsons and the Baileys, with [Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922058618&usg=AOvVaw1M4_LLronq0jGRrxs120Q-)’s permission, drive to Phoenix, Arizona, and tell the story of their contact to reporters at the Phoenix Gazette. (Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, pp. 363)

November 21–23 — An Air Force review panel meets at ATIC for three days and recommends that a “higher court” be formed to review UFOs. It schedules this tentatively for late December or early January. (Ruppelt, [pp. 200–201](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/200/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922059140&usg=AOvVaw3ljVOMIAm5z_KX9S69kxUm))

* * *

November 22 — 10:00 p.m. Fr. Carlos Maria, a Capuchin missionary, and five others are driving along the road to Bocaranga, Ubangi-Shari \[now Central African Republic\] when they notice a large disc speeding overhead. Later, they see four others, motionless. They watch the UFOs for 20 minutes, changing shape and color. (Aimé Michel, The Truth about FS; Jimmy Guieu \[pseudonym of Henri René Guieu\], Les soucoupes volantes viennent d’un autre monde, Fleuve Noir, 1954; ClearIntent, [pp. 128–129](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/128/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922060013&usg=AOvVaw3ZqW0kIFK_JnlZgryiRsMt))

November 24 — [Andrija Puharich](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrija_Puharich&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922060419&usg=AOvVaw2pPpstA_lu8VLQCHdLk_J2)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrija_Puharich&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922060586&usg=AOvVaw0j6Orv2u_LHNYg3WALBgfz) invited by an Army colonel friend who is chief of the Research Section of the Office of the Chief of Psychological Warfare, delivers a lecture on ESP to high-ranking Pentagon officers in the Army’s Psychological Warfare Research Section and the Air Force’s Office of Special Investigations. Col. [Howard](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922060918&usg=AOvVaw2_6WQqDmoqqnhPnEP3G1Zy) [McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922061254&usg=AOvVaw1cSpUCi_5vQOJbahKKraH3) is probably present. (Nick Redfern, The Pyramids and the Pentagon, New Page, 2012; Michael D. Swords, “Strange Days, Part 2,” IUR 32, no. 2 (December 2008): 8)

November 24 — The first printed account of the encounter with Orthon appears in the Phoenix Gazette. The newspaper publishes one of [Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922061899&usg=AOvVaw3ret55DINmsVgvazFFhrVn)’s photos as well as a photo of the Williamsons and the Baileys. Adamski becomes instantly famous, and [Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922062098&usg=AOvVaw0efq78Y-Gz-x9W4Bg32Wga) moves to Palomar Gardens for several days. When he tells Adamski he is planning to write a book about his channelings and contacts, Adamski warns him not to mention the contacts have been largely psychic. Adamski discourages him and they have a falling out. Alfred C. Bailey later says he has seen neither spaceship nor spaceman and doubts that anyone else has either. (Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, pp. 45–52, 99, 358–363; “[Palomar Mountain, 1940–1960:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/mount-palomar/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922062496&usg=AOvVaw1RTY90LyPR2cp5BaEfZotg) [From Obscurity to World Fame,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/mount-palomar/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922062729&usg=AOvVaw0T0N6mQYaw38copg7zv5bd)” The Adamski Case, September 22, 2019)

November 25 — ATIC Col. [Donald L. Bower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49126583/donald-langlitz-bower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922063188&usg=AOvVaw1OeHe63cAECRUNfhthnGwe) and Maj. [Dewey Fournet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8653239/dewey-j_-fournet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922063548&usg=AOvVaw3t1HImvH7hTO1YB8qFT7cv) brief CIA consultants [Frederick C. Durant](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.thespacereview.com/article/2856/1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922063876&usg=AOvVaw3oeCICY37CE8wB3RDe4ryq) and [Edward Tauss](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3005011/edward-tauss&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922064193&usg=AOvVaw2dei3viYm99VHU0dA3cSUE) on Blue Book’s top three cases: the Tremonton UFO film of July 2; a dubious sighting of an object seen at Presque Isle and Limestone AFB \[now Loring International Airport\], Maine, on the night of October 10– 11 (which [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922064449&usg=AOvVaw3dVlhw0D7Cf8D3DenAiAPX) has already explained as a theodolite miscalibration causing Jupiter and its 4 prominent moons to be visible); and the problematic Florida scoutmaster case of August 19. USAF wants the CIA to think these are good cases until they unravel at the proposed Robertson Panel meeting. (CUFON, “[The CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922064710&usg=AOvVaw32i2IQU77RKflIA4_d0wYk) [Related Document Sampler, Part 1 of 2 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922064933&usg=AOvVaw373RxByQBWhyHXphNi0hKV)” May 17, 1996; Clark III 1014)

November 25–26 — Two UFOs are tracked by defense radar in the Panama Canal Zone. (NICAP, “[Two Objects Tracked](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/521125pcanal_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922065326&usg=AOvVaw0OdA253b0CuFMsv99FYtf-) [by A/A Gun Radar](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/521125pcanal_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922065518&usg=AOvVaw1-mWAqtt-73AEITJ8Mjg9r)”; Condon, [pp. 168–170](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/168/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922065781&usg=AOvVaw34XsGvfA6VRnhuIRDu5lMl))

November 26 — 5:56 p.m. An F-94B from the USAF 59th Fighter-Interceptor Squadron at Goose Bay AFB \[now CFB Goose Bay\], Labrador, for 15 minutes chases a maneuverable object that changes color from white to red, heading south or southwest. The fighter gets a brief radar lock-on. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, November–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Nov-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922066277&usg=AOvVaw1sKaSDdqMddwlsEpfOYG8x) [December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Nov-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922066569&usg=AOvVaw20YhqJgzMpTr3bzi6kRT3Y), The Author, 1986, p. 44; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922066910&usg=AOvVaw1yvwGqvdTt1LbDlKTDT-4s), p. 181)

November 30 — 12:30 a.m. Numerous slow-moving 90–100 mph radar targets appear on the MEW VG-2 radar at Washington National Airport in Washington, D.C. Suggestive of anomalous propagation, but they are unlike the July 1952 cases since there is no visual confirmation, no other radars confirming, and no fighters scrambled. A pilot at 6,000 feet sees nothing. CAA Senior Airways Specialist Austin M. Stapf claims the same thing was observed at same time on November 29, and that the Andrews AFB watch supervisor could not visually confirm targets over Andrews displayed on the ARTCC radar scope. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922067344&usg=AOvVaw3PMQS-CEYzLrI_zAz-iCfL), p. 181)

December — Maj. [Dewey Fournet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8653239/dewey-j_-fournet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922067861&usg=AOvVaw25hNycB_036gp-O1gtA3YK) completes a study of UFOs to assess whether their motions are random or ordered. He concludes that their reported movements show that UFOs are under intelligent control. (Ruppelt, [pp. 189–190](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/188/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922068267&usg=AOvVaw0nyWzo5gE8xgmf9mzKG9RT); Michael D. Swords, “[Intelligent Motions,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/articles/swordsfournet.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922068561&usg=AOvVaw1djR_KZq6javM4ClS63d2w)” IUR 33, no. 1 (March 2010): 8–15)

December 2 — CIA Office of Scientific Intelligence Director [H. Marshall Chadwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922069068&usg=AOvVaw35Ou7LZ8xbbiniejwnZ7es) writes another secret memo to Director [Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922069402&usg=AOvVaw2Oy-JUzEQTcvDz7yEgpzrG) on UFOs: “At this time, the reports of incidents convince us that there is something going on that must have immediate attention. The details of some of these incidents have been discussed by AD/SI with DDCI. Sightings of unexplained objects at great altitudes and traveling at high speeds in the vicinity of major U.S. defense installations are of such nature that they are not attributable to natural phenomena or known types of aerial vehicles.” Physicist [Julius Adams Stratton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julius_Adams_Stratton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922069707&usg=AOvVaw29j4TP7ILAEpCzCERSz40I) and economist [Max Millikan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Max_Millikan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922069946&usg=AOvVaw0kitF0T0-7r2TFKcMs4jJG) tell Chadwell that scientists at the MIT Lincoln Laboratory would like to be a part of any scientific study of the UFO phenomenon, perhaps through Millikan’s MIT Center for International Studies. Stratton indicates that Lab Director [Albert G.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_G._Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922070185&usg=AOvVaw3vZAb6Pd7WSMYwVmsLhrUU) [Hill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_G._Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922070357&usg=AOvVaw08jFbOqhlb-mehqU3HL4C5) should organize the study. Attached is a draft of an intelligence directive by Chadwell on behalf of Smith to the National Security Council recommending that the CIA “formulate and carry out a program of intelligence and research activities required to solve the problem of instant positive identification of unidentified flying objects.” But Smith refuses to approve or sign the directive because he is briefing the president directly. (H. Marshall Chadwell, “[Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100020008-2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922070652&usg=AOvVaw2TafoK_Sj4XuVhH3h-4Alg)” December 2, 1952; CUFON, “[The CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-Related](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922070870&usg=AOvVaw2bl5SCnSLwK6XB66ZL3_kM) [Document Sampler, Part 1 of 2 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922071056&usg=AOvVaw150wNhaOuc00aZOjJt82nr)” May 17, 1996; Swords 175; Clark III 1013)

* * *

December 3 — In another “Flying Saucer” memo, [Chadwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922071387&usg=AOvVaw0OkGSIfTqzFGGrH3ZwOdbp) admits the Air Force would be suspicious of any MIT Lincoln Lab involvement, and that Princeton or Cal Tech would do, and that “it will be necessary to secure the full backing of the DCI in order that a scientific review of the problem may be laid on.” However, he recommends that this “External Research Project Concerned with Unidentified Flying Objects” be administered by Max Millikan at the MIT Center for International Studies. (P. G. Strong, “[Flying Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/DOC_0005515940.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922071795&usg=AOvVaw2iPhuH6I0wmu-1Axy_SeFk)” December 3, 1952; CUFON, “[The CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-Related Document Sampler, Part 1 of 2 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922072003&usg=AOvVaw1huvXFI1hLs92XAnI5BmY1)” May 17, 1996; Swords 185–186)

December 4 —The CIA Intelligence Advisory Committee recommends that “the Director of Central Intelligence will ‘enlist the services of selected scientists to review and appraise the available evidence in the light of pertinent scientific theories.’” The meeting, chaired by [Chadwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922072273&usg=AOvVaw103mTVOUD9XdEOXHh94R49)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922072416&usg=AOvVaw0TbaO-8hVzhE0D5yagCNkp) is attended by [Robert Amory Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1989/04/21/obituaries/robert-amory-jr-74-ex-official-of-cia-and-us-budget-bureau.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922072632&usg=AOvVaw09z9qZxPns4UzDVK7aREI_), Gen. [John Samford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922072809&usg=AOvVaw0Id_TwwAsUuHkBsYh7UK_J), Rear Admiral [Carl F. Espe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9048606/carl-f-espe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922073069&usg=AOvVaw3wh14mQ3TVThP6hBrZ00Ji)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9048606/carl-f-espe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922073240&usg=AOvVaw35j8zvi_jrTSShgeNRbe0E) Gen. [John M. Willems](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1976/09/16/archives/maj-gen-john-willems-dies-at-74-served-under-patton-in-africa.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922073460&usg=AOvVaw2yTIUDJTTU9joDVQC0iqmU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1976/09/16/archives/maj-gen-john-willems-dies-at-74-served-under-patton-in-africa.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922073651&usg=AOvVaw2kslNPvxHAHQoXa2bN9tjn) [William Park Armstrong](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/105095607/william-park-armstrong&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922073879&usg=AOvVaw0sEzCEgP2K2eftZKJOqSCh)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/105095607/william-park-armstrong&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922074039&usg=AOvVaw0IUat5uHrtc0MqVMJqpHAo) [Walter F. Colby](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/118649040/walter-francis-colby&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922074356&usg=AOvVaw0-eYApdF46q6ZJMtN9cUMt)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/118649040/walter-francis-colby&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922074516&usg=AOvVaw10VF8_6mv2KU3ahgZ0QqzC) Col. [Edward R.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105922/brigadier-general-edward-h-porter/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922074725&usg=AOvVaw2p_lDJM_zbtpLgA45_gUWz) [Porter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105922/brigadier-general-edward-h-porter/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922074965&usg=AOvVaw1eH2dBy5edBXZQkf9k0M19)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105922/brigadier-general-edward-h-porter/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922075252&usg=AOvVaw2ROdZA5R6ipfWDCTVcOKi5) and Col. [Jere Boggs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Boggs_J.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922075472&usg=AOvVaw2Wd1azndVnRm1LRoo6g5DU)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Boggs_J.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922075701&usg=AOvVaw0xJBX-ziGcXCb47e_N0U_Y) This is to be done “immediately” through a National Security Council Intelligence Directive and is essentially the go-ahead for what will be the Robertson Panel. December 4 — 8:46 p.m. USAF pilot Lt. Robert O. Arnold, 3640th Pilot Training Wing, Laredo AFB \[now Laredo International Airport\], Texas, is flying a T-28 trainer at 6,000 feet when he sees a bright bluish-white glowing object below him at about 1,500–2,000 feet and rapidly climbing to his level. It shows no navigation lights. He tightens his left turn to keep the object in view, but it suddenly climbs to 9,000 feet in several seconds and drops down to his altitude again, then stops and hovers. Arnold pursues but after 2 seconds the object suddenly heads towards him on a collision course at high speed at 8:53 p.m., wavering slightly at about 300 feet. He sees the object as a blurred reddish-bluish haze smaller than his T-28. It rapidly ascends to 15,000 feet then circles left as if positioning for another pass. In fear Arnold turns off his running lights, spirals down to 1,500 feet while keeping the object in sight as it continues to head towards him in a dive, then pulls up and climbs out of sight. A lighted weather balloon is launched at 8:53 p.m. from Laredo AFB but it is not observed near any aircraft. (NICAP, “[The Laredo / ‘Earl Fogle’ Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/521204laredo_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922077934&usg=AOvVaw0eQwNhtSSzYOQNDSFUHEZj)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922078122&usg=AOvVaw1519c6hRiv3n3DH7m2Z1aF), p. 182)

December 6 — 5:24 a.m. The 3-man crew of a USAF B-29 (1st Lt. [Norman Karas](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/194604791/norman-karas&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922078396&usg=AOvVaw2_NiL7B2bFM5qAB8n8X9Ec) and 1st Lt. William W. Naumann) over the Gulf of Mexico 100 miles south of Louisiana track five unidentified blips on the bomber’s radar. They maneuver around the plane at a speed of 5,240 mph. The crew sees some flashes of light, but the targets are 20 miles or more away. The five UFOs merge with a huge blip that accelerates and vanishes at a speed of 9,000 mph. Additional crewmen involved are 1st Lt. William W. Naumann, Jr., Staff Sgt B. R. Purcell, Staff Sgt. William J. De Rause, 2nd Lt. Robert J. Eckert, and Staff Sgt. Harry D. Shogren. (NICAP, “[B-29 Encounters High Speed](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/521206gulf_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922078705&usg=AOvVaw0VKDQCI9YowydbXifyRgx5) [Objects over Gulf](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/521206gulf_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922078912&usg=AOvVaw2IIcokGi_UCIUFYpQWF6EL)”; Keyhoe, FS from OS, [pp. 161–166](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsos/chIX.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922079159&usg=AOvVaw1qM2mMHZ8szE_cBWw3YyoM); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922079430&usg=AOvVaw01SSB50igeKMDLZJjjTbqd), p. 183; Condon, [pp. 148–150](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/148/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922079763&usg=AOvVaw1iAuVFWabLY1MmZGfcVzvN); Patrick Gross, “[B-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/coleman52.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922080298&usg=AOvVaw2zXTYjDPKkgY4vw4HDwbUK) [29 Radar and Visual Multiple Witnesses Observations, Dec. 6, 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/coleman52.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922080519&usg=AOvVaw1bohTLRtRGyU14A-Di63gx)”)

December 9 — Col. [Donald L. Bower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49126583/donald-langlitz-bower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922080895&usg=AOvVaw3bneNYt_ZhluBiMyWL59iz) forbids [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922081174&usg=AOvVaw3bqel_xJMJL6LdIFKgbW8M) from visiting the CIA to give its Office of Scientific Intelligence certain UFO cases in preparation for the Robertson Panel in January. CIA consultant Frederick C. Durant learns about this the same day in a phone call to Ruppelt. (Frederick C. Durant, “[Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100020005-5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922081540&usg=AOvVaw2H3oN7mHkIJO7lua1q2eRs)” December 9, 1952; CUFON, “[The CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-Related Document Sampler, Part 1 of 2 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922081742&usg=AOvVaw1aZNCZH3TM86ggOJo9BvHe)” May 17, 1996; Thomas Tulien, ed., [Proceedings of the Sign Historical Group UFO History Workshop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/Sign-Historical-Group-Workshop-Proceedings.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922081982&usg=AOvVaw0t67GzS09Ry0dPSrzP15IJ), Sign Historical Group, November 2001, p. 47; Clark III 1014)

December 10 — [H. Marshall Chadwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922082308&usg=AOvVaw1r5q4pWWxZHzWo2N5-NxD-) writes to [Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922082532&usg=AOvVaw3YZea1IHM6QbWLfUFcpDAf) that OSI has been working with mathematician [Howard P. Robertson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_P._Robertson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922082747&usg=AOvVaw22BG1B5kf_9khEx1s7_yO7) of Cal Tech to establish a panel of scientists (including astronomer [Thornton Leigh Page](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thornton_Leigh_Page&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922083016&usg=AOvVaw1Ng435wEEmtv8bihweYyZw)) and engineers to review the status of UFOs in January. Somewhere along the line, MIT’s Lincoln Labs and CIS have been eliminated. (Thornton Page, \[[Letter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP81R00560R000100020005-5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922083284&usg=AOvVaw1ql8ECfAkzYmWt9Hnx_YAV)\], December 12, 1952; CUFON, “[The CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922083567&usg=AOvVaw19WhHhbtC8SuoX9UKlDZeL) [Related Document Sampler, Part 1 of 2 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922083880&usg=AOvVaw0KJ94sLr6k_KU3RTRU2qIV)” May 17, 1996; Swords 187–188)

December 10 — 7:15 p.m. The pilot and radar observer of an F-94 patrolling from Moses Lake AFB \[now the Grant County International Airport\] spots a light over the Hanford nuclear plant near Richland, Washington, while flying at 26,000 feet. They contact the ground control station, which reports that they know of no planes in the area and that their ground radar shows nothing. They close in on the object, which is large, white, and round and features a dim reddish light coming from two windows. They lose visual contact then get a lock-on from their ARC-33 airborne radar. As they attempt to close in, the object reverses direction and dives away. They attempt several more times to approach the light and have to alter course to avoid a collision that seems imminent. (NICAP, “[F-94 R/V with Round Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/521210odessa_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922084432&usg=AOvVaw1txQCcZ4okXXlcdiNPU6Cq)”; Ruppelt, [pp. 61–62](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/60/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922084750&usg=AOvVaw348ZoGqDdkA0MOz4rHrY_j); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922085029&usg=AOvVaw3HEp3BWz_rU4ik589BhOnY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922085200&usg=AOvVaw2HIgAuHVrV3ZqttNZsO3dd) p. 185; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23balloons&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922085485&usg=AOvVaw0JEWGvHhtLgt_iXhtzBNcb) [Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23balloons&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922085808&usg=AOvVaw0Bf-EO7ssMgXcpnxv0UR3p)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on

* * *
