Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, p. 66; Center for UFO Studies, \[[case file](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1952_12_10_US_WA_Odessa_NICAP_pilots-Air-to-Air-Radar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922086421&usg=AOvVaw1C1OnTLTWFvL41CguUS1mh)\]; Patrick Gross, “[Radar Visual Aircraft UFO Encounter near Hanford Nuclear Plant, December 10, 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/hanford10dec52.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922086690&usg=AOvVaw1TjzsB_ZPyC2Q85mLeF7at)”)

December 12 — The CIA, having learned that ATIC is withholding significant case reports for the upcoming Robertson Panel, sends a three-man team to Wright-Patterson AFB in order to obtain relevant documents. The team includes [Robertson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_P._Robertson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922087066&usg=AOvVaw3YW2q3aADhN4e19GWrCwGr) himself, CIA Assistant Director [H. Marshall Chadwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922087296&usg=AOvVaw0AhPrtCGeqyJTCFm2E9QzQ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922087432&usg=AOvVaw1O8TTrNz5owz6v005KIi2O) and CIA rocket consultant [Frederick C. Durant](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.thespacereview.com/article/2856/1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922087649&usg=AOvVaw0PqhdirvGmULSRL5IP11BK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.thespacereview.com/article/2856/1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922087807&usg=AOvVaw3ODEes0hnczp4pq8Plimzz) a personal friend of [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922088077&usg=AOvVaw3TnTKDo_kv3l-fVI70cYdJ) who urges him to comply. At ATIC they meet with personnel from Battelle Memorial Institute in Columbus, Ohio, which has been studying the UFO data in great secrecy. Battelle requests the CIA to postpone the panel until March so they can finish the study. Robertson agrees to postpone the panel, but is later overruled by CIA Director Gen. [Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922088440&usg=AOvVaw1DGmtuQKftjkoNMpPebqSY)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922088677&usg=AOvVaw1pa6JXdUjdC4eNg02xrzYb) (CUFON, “[The CUFON 1952 CIA UFO-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922088920&usg=AOvVaw08tHANJqoemqdF70q2WISg) [Related Document Sampler, Part 1 of 2 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/cia-52-1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922089142&usg=AOvVaw1QrXoQHHTOB-KpWDCJ3SFm)” May 17, 1996; NICAP, “[The 1952 Sighting Wave](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/chronos/1952FIXED.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922089343&usg=AOvVaw1ayqa9w0hzDvMQqLL9-Hf0)”; Thomas Tulien, ed., [Proceedings of the Sign Historical Group UFO History Workshop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/Sign-Historical-Group-Workshop-Proceedings.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922089619&usg=AOvVaw3rQewpV7YdVRESVAo7ahGj), Sign Historical Group, November 2001, p. 47; Clark III 1014)

December 13 — Morning. [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922090137&usg=AOvVaw2YRwmzb0gWbxFBBMwQa9qS)’s scout ship makes a second appearance, this time at the Palomar Gardens Café in California, ostensibly so that Orthon can return the photo he borrowed. The film holder is pushed out of a porthole to the ground. One of the three Venusian photos taken by Adamski, though credited to [Jerrold E. Baker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/time/1/9/5/5/01/Nexus07/%2523/TheEvidencePresentedbyMrJerroldBaker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922090559&usg=AOvVaw2sE0d9x83obEZ8_6KcPZTM)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/time/1/9/5/5/01/Nexus07/%2523/TheEvidencePresentedbyMrJerroldBaker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922090859&usg=AOvVaw0lyzv_mc41j66sKzu0gdxU) is taken secretly the day before by Adamski, probably of a model. [Bill Moore](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Moore_(ufologist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922091123&usg=AOvVaw0pn4okuj4LzWZB3fuWeHSw) claims in 1985 that the photos resemble the prototype space vehicle described in [Mason Rose](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.linux-host.org/energy/rose.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922091400&usg=AOvVaw25yK1xpTjmUdnW9-XsYiqB)’s A Simplified Explanation of the Application of the Biefeld-Brown Effect to the Solution of the Problems of Space Navigation, published in February 1952 (Clark III 40; Desmond Leslie and George Adamski, Flying Saucers Have Landed, British Book Centre, 1953, [pp. 217–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucershav00lesl/page/216/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922091772&usg=AOvVaw1nIhH-m6CiSKLqiaS0V5QX) [221](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucershav00lesl/page/216/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922092024&usg=AOvVaw30Hc0PR2uehAifDYaUdcEv); Paul E. Potter, “The Flying Saucer”; “[Some New Facts about](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Nexus/1955_01_00_Nexus07.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922092316&usg=AOvVaw1fa4-hZeUsrkwDjAGxVCIl) [Flying Saucers Have Landed,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Nexus/1955_01_00_Nexus07.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922092475&usg=AOvVaw1a23VVVc421MP56kDdRuMV)” Nexus 2, no. 1 (January 1955): 13–17; James W. Moseley, “[Special Adamski Exposé Issue,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://app.box.com/s/ffh3qv14hz8i5vcbwn5x&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922092719&usg=AOvVaw3wC0xYyquwgGsiO1UQM1kU)” Saucer News, no. 27 (October 1957); Curt Collins, “[Saucer News Presents: The George Adamski Exposé,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.jimmoseley.com/2014/05/saucer-news-presents-the-george-adamski-expose/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922093027&usg=AOvVaw0TqWZG6glt7b3B9eQHkyd6)” In Honor of James Moseley, May 30, 2014; George M. Eberhart, “Postcards with a UFO Theme,” IUR 29, no. 2 (Summer 2004): 21; Rene Erik Olsen, “[The 13th December 1952 Photos of George Adamski Analysis,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nemmehjemmesider.dk/aspuploader/savefiles/17090/3191Research%2520into%2520the%252013th%2520December%25201952%2520George%2520Adamski%2520photos.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922093365&usg=AOvVaw18Y_Rd57HDuHfhivbxMaGI)” April 23, 2019; Rene Erik Olsen, \[[George](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.adamskifoundation.com/Rene%2520Erik%2520Olsen%2520-%2520Denmark/Rene-Denmark.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922093600&usg=AOvVaw0pq8Kq5dqpu9TirBt7TtDg) [Adamski photo analysis](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.adamskifoundation.com/Rene%2520Erik%2520Olsen%2520-%2520Denmark/Rene-Denmark.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922093862&usg=AOvVaw2LYybI9yLwY3aujNMHByuQ)\], Adamski Foundation; Marc Hallet, [A Critical Appraisal of George Adamski: The Man](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ACriticalAppraisalOfGeorgeAdamskiTheManWhoSpokeToTheSpaceBrothersREVISEDANDENLARGEDEDITION2016/page/n1/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922094139&usg=AOvVaw0W6VrBqksST0T0jQH5udKg) [Who Spoke to the Space Brothers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ACriticalAppraisalOfGeorgeAdamskiTheManWhoSpokeToTheSpaceBrothersREVISEDANDENLARGEDEDITION2016/page/n1/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922094405&usg=AOvVaw164N9OTNiRz5_j-ojDYHdq)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ACriticalAppraisalOfGeorgeAdamskiTheManWhoSpokeToTheSpaceBrothersREVISEDANDENLARGEDEDITION2016/page/n1/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922094608&usg=AOvVaw3ztb4Qkc4eYfIf-tD0R_X-) The Author, 2016)

December 15 — 7:15 p.m. Two Air Force pilots get a momentary lock on a strange object above Goose Bay, Labrador. A T-33 and an F-94B (piloted by Capt. E. T. Johnson and Radar Observer Lt. H. S. Norris) see a bright red and white light. (NICAP, “[Momentary Lock On](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/521215goose_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922095030&usg=AOvVaw1JSYPvRugOBVDYzu7Dmd27)”; Condon, [pp. 126–127](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/126/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922095252&usg=AOvVaw06ggim_9ICmjLjWCfYkpWx); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922095466&usg=AOvVaw1WdAaz8SzIbPUxgwwsWw8W), p. 186)

December 16 — [Chadwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922095810&usg=AOvVaw1GzAUq2DxC2WXFeFwZxLM0) tells CIA Acting Deputy Director for Intelligence [Robert Amory Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1989/04/21/obituaries/robert-amory-jr-74-ex-official-of-cia-and-us-budget-bureau.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922096111&usg=AOvVaw2owER0zuB7MG8rF5H_TShU) that he is unimpressed with the three Blue Book cases, especially since Presque Isle was identified as the planet Jupiter. (Clark III 1014)

December 21 — [Lyman Streeter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111409702/lyman-h_-streeter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922096466&usg=AOvVaw3EFgeoKUgIdZHZxXgd3YKK) and five other witnesses observe a large, cigar-shaped object over Winslow, Arizona. (Michael D. Swords, “Strange Days,” IUR 30, no. 4 (Aug. 2006): 24)

December 21 — Evening. J. E. Hawkey, civil commissioner of Fort Victoria \[now Masvingo\], Zimbabwe, is driving near Mvuma when he sees a bright red light crossing the road about 30 feet in the air, then hovering. Suddenly it shoots straight up and disappears. After a short while it descends some distance away and travels straight down the road. Hawkey follows it at about 80 mph, after which it speeds up and disappears at three or more times the speed. He has the object in sight for about 20 minutes. (Southern Rhodesia Newsletter; Jan Aldrich)

December 22 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922097026&usg=AOvVaw3iHYNyQjY5jP6NzrZH3tJ2) finds out that the CIA Robertson Panel is back on again after being postponed on December 12. Apparently under pressure from the Air Force, which is setting a trap to embarrass the CIA with sensational IFO cases dressed up as “best” unknown UFO cases, CIA Director Gen. [Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922097310&usg=AOvVaw2iqMadRzspMu6YBSVheYi2) reverses the decision to postpone the panel meeting till March 1953 or later. Smith orders the Robertson Panel to be carried out immediately. A rush-to-judgment panel will have no time to reflect on the USAF trickery involved in the IFOs-as- UFOs deception and will just react in dismissive skepticism that there is no scientific evidence for UFO reality, and hence no reason for the CIA to intrude into USAF jurisdiction over air intelligence matters such as unidentified aerial threats (UFOs). Ruppelt calls ADC to say that he will not be able to conduct the ADC UFO briefing tour as previously scheduled due to the CIA meeting now tentatively set in early January 1953 (he confirms the call by teletype December 23). (Thomas Tulien, ed., [Proceedings of the Sign Historical Group UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/Sign-Historical-Group-Workshop-Proceedings.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922097612&usg=AOvVaw16yKxvCFnYss6r_ZOx2jzf) [History Workshop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/Sign-Historical-Group-Workshop-Proceedings.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922097940&usg=AOvVaw0I-h9mLZZvwnt5USep-Z7W)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/Sign-Historical-Group-Workshop-Proceedings.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922098143&usg=AOvVaw2_fLHzDoE-z-pwyfD61DC9) Sign Historical Group, November 2001, p. 48; Clark III 1014)

December 22 — 7:30 p.m. An instrument technician driving toward Larson AFB \[now Grant County International Airport\] near Moses Lake, Washington, stops his car to watch a hat-shaped glowing object rising vertically in odd spurts right and left, then level off at high speed. The object glows white with a red side when it is rotated.

Halfway through a roll the light disappears, then it holds stationary in the sky with jumpy movements. Duration is about 15 minutes. (NICAP, “[Hat-Shaped Object Observed by Technician](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/521222larson_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922098588&usg=AOvVaw0nkpHNNUsDhiXo9Y5-fGRC)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922098796&usg=AOvVaw2E-El16IO8C5VFWyTj10HD), p. 16)

December 29 — 7:48 p.m. Col. [Donald J. M. Blakeslee](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49123726/donald-j-blakeslee&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922099176&usg=AOvVaw1Y0wQOoLgmyG5Zg4jG9LUM), 27th Fighter Escort Wing, while flying near Misawa, northern Honshu, Japan, in an F-84G at 27,000 feet in altitude, observes an object like a rotating cluster of lights colored

* * *

white, green, and red. Blakeslee climbs to 35,000 feet, at which point he is level with the unknown object. He attempts a pursuit, but the UFO disappears in 30 seconds. (NICAP, “[Col. Blakeslee / F-84 Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/521229misawa_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922099711&usg=AOvVaw3YaGtizIEAvQOAkdIOnc_E)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922099922&usg=AOvVaw2-AKA8UJisKpT3BSwfir00), p. 187; Swords 212–213)

December 29 — 9:05 p.m. Capt. [William T. Bowley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/122145578/william-theodore-bowley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922100325&usg=AOvVaw2N6uLw3Fa6PyJoqIm4G-7I) and Capt. [Herbert T. Lange](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/54063034/herbert-theodore-lange&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922100716&usg=AOvVaw1hTB2ObIrzPh3UniEXxsYo), both of Perrin AFB \[now North Texas Regional Airport\] near Denison, Texas, are piloting a B-26 on a training flight headed west at 6,000 feet altitude and 300 mph when they see a large, intense, bluish-white light near Vega, Texas. It is about 350 feet long at their 11 o’clock position, paralleling their course at the same altitude and closing slightly. After 5 minutes, the object suddenly climbs vertically 7,000 feet in 5 seconds (about 2,000 mph) to disappear in thin clouds at 13,000 feet and causing the clouds to glow as if lit by a searchlight. Bowley radios the CAA controller in Tucumcari, New Mexico. Shortly after, the object reappears under the clouds and the CAA controller is told to look for it but he can’t see it (possibly because he is told to look in the wring direction). After 2 minutes, it climbs to the west and disappears. (NICAP, “[Object Closing on B-36 Suddenly Climbs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/521229vega_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922101240&usg=AOvVaw3HEXc9LCSsslf5c5ih9wky)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922101517&usg=AOvVaw0bJ-Q8yc2NizwFiS1OR33O), p. 187)

December 31 — Project Blue Book issues its Status Report #8, classified “confidential.” (US Air Force, [Projects Grudge](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922102115&usg=AOvVaw3VQvsxUSCobOwRZXFJAEqd) [and Blue Book Reports 1–12,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922102520&usg=AOvVaw0_Bz9RCuiepOPjbk7tJ08T) NICAP, 1968, pp. 131–154)

1953

1953 — During off-shore combat maneuvers, a squadron of carrier-based Navy AD-3 attack planes is approached by a rocket-shaped UFO that swoops down on the flight from above. The object levels off about 1,000 feet overhead, slows, and paces the aircraft. When the Squadron Commander leads his flight in pursuit of the UFO, it turns sharply so that its tail is pointed away and shoots upward out of sight in seconds. (Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 266–267).

1953 — Midday. A member of the crew of a Shell tanker in Hong Kong harbor, China, watches, along with many others on shore and aboard the ship, a silver-white disc hovering at 6,000–7,000 feet. Within a second or so, it moves a full 45° arc to an area where there are some white clouds at about 5,000 fee. It shines through the cloud cover like the moon through a mist. (J. Allen Hynek, “A Daylight Disc in Hong Kong Harbor,” IUR 2, no. 8 (August 1977): wrap)

1953 — Evening. An Air Force pilot and a student are flying an F-84 Thunderjet on the home leg of a training flight over North Texas when the student notes an out-of-place light. At first the pilot thinks it’s Venus, but they realize it is moving. The student steers the plane toward the light, but it zooms past them at high speed. The pilot takes the stick and turns the aircraft to follow it. The light, which now looks like a metallic domed disc with windows, passes them again. The pilot accelerates to more than 500 mph and pursues it; the disc roars past them again. The chase goes on for 10–15 minutes until a final pass when the object shines a bright light into the cockpit. The pilot takes an evasive measure and flies back to base. (CUFOS case file)

1953 — Fred P. Stone founds the Australian Flying Saucer Club in Adelaide, South Australia. It later becomes the Australian Flying Saucer Research Society and publishes the Australian Saucer Record from 1955 to 1963. From 1962 to 1971, it publishes Panorama. ([Australian Saucer Record](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Australia/Australian%2520Saucer%2520Record%2520(Stone)/Australian%2520Saucer%2520Record%2520-%2520Vol%252001%2520No%252002%2520-%25201955.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922104622&usg=AOvVaw3RT2erM-WtefPtiUAqLqk8) 1, no. 2 (2nd Quarter, 1955); [Panorama](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Australia/Panorama%2520(Stone)/Panorama%2520-%2520Vol%252001%2520No%252001%2520-%25201962.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922105179&usg=AOvVaw3r4y1SkG3rBh0NRh3IPFSi) 1, no. 1

(1962))

January — Beams of microwaves, varying between 2.5 and 4 gigahertz, from Soviet sources aimed at the US embassy in Moscow are first detected, increasing in intensity by 1975. Detected by routine background radiation testing, the beams come from a source in a Soviet apartment building about 325 feet west of the embassy, affecting the west façade of the central building, with highest intensities between the third and eighth floors. The microwave transmissions are only five [microwatts](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microwatt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922106159&usg=AOvVaw1ww6ooy-olj2n5O7GZw05o) per square centimeter, well below the power level of microwave ovens and well below what would be needed to [heat](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heat&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922106658&usg=AOvVaw3okdODNrkFNilmT2-4MUSF) anything. Shielding is put in place by 1964, but the discovery is kept secret. (Wikipedia, “[Moscow Signal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moscow_Signal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922107092&usg=AOvVaw3-CpjkEtu95mX656bSBJ_M)”; J. Mark Elwood, “[Microwaves in the Cold War: The Moscow Embassy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.researchgate.net/publication/233417821_Microwaves_in_the_cold_war_the_Moscow_embassy_study_and_its_interpretation_Review_of_a_retrospective_cohort_study&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922107600&usg=AOvVaw2xH-lROx0evYX4N2qnt9nm) [Study and Its Interpretation,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.researchgate.net/publication/233417821_Microwaves_in_the_cold_war_the_Moscow_embassy_study_and_its_interpretation_Review_of_a_retrospective_cohort_study&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922108133&usg=AOvVaw3QG-xLSle13aQwmw_NaNRh)” Environmental Health 11 (2012))

January 1 — 8:45 p.m. While driving on Hwy 91 between Craig and Wolf Creek, Montana, [Warner E. Anderson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22993632/warner-eldon-anderson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922108838&usg=AOvVaw3ZQj3NAO93g__tGpxAjpiA)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22993632/warner-eldon-anderson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922109137&usg=AOvVaw0UmSZs6AWsUQEL-ThEFO-c) manager of a photo shop with wartime air spotter experience; Mrs. Greta C. Wills, manager of women’s apparel store; and teenager Marlene Wills see a saucer-shaped object above horizon about 5 miles away to the southwest. The object is an estimated 25–40 feet long and 6–8 or 18–25 feet thick and looks like two soup bowls joined at the rims. It has a red glowing bottom and portholes. The object dives low over the Missouri River to within 150–300 feet away then climbs fast horizontally at an estimated 3,600 mph to the northeast. (NICAP, “[The 1953 UFO Chronology](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/chronos/1953fullrep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922109570&usg=AOvVaw0Ns-GtanKii7tyfI9xQm3E)”; Sparks, p. 188)

January 3 — The 4602d Air Intelligence Service Squadron (AISS) is created at Ent AFB \[now the US Olympic Training Center\] in Colorado Springs, Colorado, by Air Defense Command Regulation AFR 24-4. One of its missions is to

* * *

collect physical UFO evidence. (Brian Skow and Terry Endres, “The 4602d Air Intelligence Service Squadron and UFOs,” IUR 20, no. 5 (Winter 1995): 9)

January 6 — 1:05 a.m. The 147th AC&W Squadron at Duncanville, Texas, is notified by the CAA at Meacham Field \[now Fort Worth Meacham International Airport\] about a UFO northeast of Dallas. Tinker AFB in Oklahoma City reports a radar target 20 miles southwest of Paris, Texas. An arrowhead-shaped UFO with green and white lights is seen by some witnesses in the Dallas area. (NICAP, “[Arrow-Shaped Object Tracked at 600 Knots](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530106duncanville_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922111060&usg=AOvVaw31NzFatL_Jdk4nynJ2UQKO)”; “[‘Flying Arrowhead’ Seen over Dallas: ‘Not a Star or Plane,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/98856097/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922111395&usg=AOvVaw03HOFXq4PVcqjZpwBB5aPG)” St. Louis Post-Dispatch, January 6, 1953, p. 1; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922111868&usg=AOvVaw1JtKpOkTIHIyq4pq506rY4)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922112106&usg=AOvVaw1Z_QO1TNJFBu819lQvVfBj) p. 188)

January 8 — 7:15–7:30 a.m. USAF ADC 82nd Fighter Interceptor Squadron personnel at Larson AFB \[now Grant County International Airport\], Moses Lake, Washington, all on the ground, see a green, disc-shaped object about the size of large weather balloon flying to the southwest. It has a vertical bobbing motion and makes sideways movements at about 8,000 feet below scattered clouds. It moves away against the wind until it disappears in the distance. The object is also observed by base personnel at Ephrata, Washington. An F-94 is scrambled at 7:43 a.m. and searches for 30 minutes, but the UFO is gone. (NICAP, “[The 1953 UFO Chronology](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/chronos/1953fullrep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922112696&usg=AOvVaw1VsuuwnadxTXNW1QwEwTpt)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922113040&usg=AOvVaw0EJx3cdzIX-8z0j2YOu9dS)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922113282&usg=AOvVaw2TE8n5cmx6hTNWK1vQCgli) p. 188; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23multiwit&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922113634&usg=AOvVaw125QCzM7FP5a8ARwfKGyPu)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 50–51)

January 8 — 10:20 p.m. A triangular object with a brilliant reddish glow is seen for 10 minutes at Mosgiel, New Zealand. It fades, then reappears with a rising and falling motion, accompanied by a small white light. (“[The New Zealand](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/Flying_Saucer_News_No_01_1953_Spring/page/n7/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922114341&usg=AOvVaw1OCn5OpTq2zmmEjltJSHVa) [Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/Flying_Saucer_News_No_01_1953_Spring/page/n7/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922114717&usg=AOvVaw0g8wzkn4KqTxORUC06mYUO)” Flying Saucer News, no. 1 (Spring 1953): 8)

January 9 — Howard C. Cross, a senior staff member at Battelle, writes a letter to Col. [Miles E. Goll](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Goll_M.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922115320&usg=AOvVaw2wv1uvPvZ42YYdDalKIDSj) of ATIC, arguing that “agreement between Project Stork \[Battelle’s study\] and ATIC should be reached as to what can and what cannot be discussed at the meeting in Washington on January 14–16.” He suggests a “controlled experiment” be undertaken by USAF to obtain physical data. This would consist of “observation posts with complete visual skywatch, with radar and photographic coverage, plus all other instruments necessary or helpful in obtaining positive and reliable data on everything in the air over the area.” The suggestion is that “Many different types of aerial activity should be secretly and purposefully scheduled within the area,” meaning that the Air Force would release balloons to generate spurious UFO phenomena. The memo is a desperate effort to buy time for Battelle to finish its statistical analysis. [Jacques Vallée](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacques_Vall%25C3%25A9e&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922115878&usg=AOvVaw0Ljx19prdDjWeazb0nbmIO) speculates that this letter by Cross (to whom Vallée assigns the pseudonym “Pentacle”) could have led to the military setting up artificial UFO waves and simulated cases in selected areas; however, this is clearly not the case, as [Jennie Zeidman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/name/jennie-zeidman-obituary?pid%3D195927848&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922116349&usg=AOvVaw38Ao6AWm7XiWMgdobL9v60) and [Mark Rodeghier](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/mark_rodeghier.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922116688&usg=AOvVaw1IV5V2TtYIaBxU8DfX4bZW) elaborately demonstrate in IUR. ([H. C. Cross letter to Miles E. Goll](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/papers/Pentacle/pentacle_doc.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922117279&usg=AOvVaw2ILk9WdpxiZXSnSPhtDrls)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/papers/Pentacle/pentacle_doc.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922117522&usg=AOvVaw2e1MMPt4RfhNXIKfMgG1bG) January 9, 1952; NICAP, “[The ‘Pentacle Memorandum,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/pentacle.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922117850&usg=AOvVaw04cm-p4LFakSQwEHsILdg1) [Including Text of Correspondence with Dr. Jacques Vallee,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/pentacle.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922118155&usg=AOvVaw0dpd4ViA0pdJRhMvLkGzmN)” August 17, 1993; Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [p. 191](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/190/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922118551&usg=AOvVaw1UWZAEtzQDlp3jezwHoSMs); The Hynek UFO Report, [p. 21](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/20/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922118784&usg=AOvVaw2qFulVgPHA56YGcqlrhbsz); Jacobs, The UFO Controversy, Signet ed., 1976, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/78/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922119243&usg=AOvVaw26HGT4WIY59sFddGmETeMj)

[79](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/78/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922119680&usg=AOvVaw0X3Gz8ZpG2kvjABZ5x0gQG); Jacques Vallée, Forbidden Science, North Atlantic, 1992, [p. 428](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/forbiddenscience00vall_0/page/427/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922120175&usg=AOvVaw2F0tSXPerUr5bqBRTA9rEz); Clark III 1214–1215; Thomas Tulien, ed., [Proceedings of the Sign Historical Group UFO History Workshop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/Sign-Historical-Group-Workshop-Proceedings.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922120515&usg=AOvVaw0cac96iBKk0Y4stmcrcoLM), Sign Historical Group, November 2001, p. 48; Jennie Zeidman, “I Remember Blue Book,” IUR 16, no. 2 (Mar./Apr. 1991): 7–12, 23; Jennie Zeidman and Mark Rodeghier, “The Pentacle Letter and the Battelle UFO Project,” IUR 18, no. 3 (May/June 1993): 4–12, 19–21)

January 9 — The CIA/OSI attempts to get [Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922121323&usg=AOvVaw3_6OSnMjGdBxhBEFDCoCJJ)’s approval for “two series” of scientific panels in January and February, which would buy some time, but the suggestion is rejected. (Clark III 1014)

January 9 — Radio station KVET in Kerrville, Texas, blames a 75-second interruption in its operation on a red-orange oval object seen by four junior high school students over the city at the same time. Ivan Young, 13, and Edgar Rasmussen, 14, see the object fly in from the west, circle, and disappear to the north. They see two fins on its end shooting out red and green flames. It is making a buzzing noise. KVET engineer Britt Lamb says the radio interference is the weirdest he has ever seen—heavy static “with a roar that traveled up and down the scale.” (“[Fiery Object Jams Radio at Kerrville,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99630276/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922121944&usg=AOvVaw28G8T7oAxNw6Ti4mVBrMG0)” Fort Worth (Tex.) Star-Telegram, January 10, 1953, p. 2; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922122455&usg=AOvVaw0yys5J5EHXeGEacG2tzwW1), pp. 78–79)

January 9 — 6:50 p.m. An F-94 makes radar contact with a UFO at a range of about 13.5 miles over Misawa Air Base, Honshu, Japan. The radar locks on at 15,000 feet and contact is broken at a range of 600 feet. The radar observer reports unusual interference on the set throughout the mission, but the set appears to be operative both before and after. The radar contact lasts approximately 2 minutes. (NICAP, “[F-94 Radar/Visual of Rotating UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530109misawa_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922122948&usg=AOvVaw28dda2l_q0pHPtrhcHij-J)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922123219&usg=AOvVaw0aXV_jIgyy5usjjJqO-8B5)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922123420&usg=AOvVaw0vMBMGEuf-zxRn6jrnAUqX) p. 189)

January 9 — 7:27 p.m. B-29 copilot 1st Lt. Charles C. Loveless sees a V-formation of bluish-white lights approaching his aircraft over Santa Ana, California. Pilot 1st Lt. Lowell D. Brandt turns to avoid them. (NICAP, “B-29 Bomber Crew Watch V-Formation”; UFOEv, [p. 21](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D33%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922124200&usg=AOvVaw0GPJKpeGfxBcu5Tr6rcdjF))

January 10 — 4:45 p.m. Retired Air Force Col. Robert McNab and a Mr. Hunter of the Federal Security Agency see a flat object to the northwest of their location 8 miles west of Sonoma, California. It is traveling about 2,400 mph and

* * *

makes three 360° right turns in 2–3 seconds each in about 1/8 the radius required for jets (about 1/4 mile) and two abrupt 90° turns to the right and left, each turn 5 seconds apart. It almost stops, accelerates to its original high speed, almost stops again, speeds up again, and finally flies out of sight vertically. (NICAP, “[Flat Object at 2,400](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530110sonoma_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922124937&usg=AOvVaw0P3U3PC2rOlkZRk3XItXU_) [MPH](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530110sonoma_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922125230&usg=AOvVaw3-cOT4TKYZzhrDSeQsx2DC)”; Sparks, p. 189)

January 12 — 1:00 p.m. Maurício Ramos is driving on grassy terrain near Santana dos Montes, Minas Gerais, Brazil, when he sees a luminous, metallic disc smaller than a Volkswagen hovering 6 feet from the ground. He approaches to within 6 feet of it, and a door opens. Two entitles shorter than 5 feet tall, wearing lead-colored clothing with shiny balls fitted to the shoes, jump out. Ramos thinks they invite him aboard, but he does not answer because he is getting an increasingly severe headache as he watches. When the headache goes away, the disc and creatures have disappeared. (“[Pesquisas sobre Tripulantes de DV,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Brazil/SBEDV/SBEDV%2520-%2520No%2520055-59%2520-%25201967.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922126402&usg=AOvVaw0TnRkeyrkeT8FuTHbWeauI)” Boletim SBEDV, no. 55/59 (1967): 1– 2, 8–9; Brazil 25–26)

January 14 — 9:30 a.m. The opening meeting of the Robertson Panel convenes in the OSI conference room at CIA Building “M” in Washington, D.C. Present are scientists [Howard P. Robertson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_P._Robertson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922127018&usg=AOvVaw3_eGxsm_GHl7rfh6x2LS88)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_P._Robertson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922127273&usg=AOvVaw1T_dh1L11KY-dt2JObStcb) [Samuel A. Goudsmit](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_Goudsmit&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922127492&usg=AOvVaw3tqHskFcMRJCtMR3dTIpC_), [Luis Walter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Walter_Alvarez&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922127803&usg=AOvVaw2hqbUQ2xCaZ-k3OG7iakBa) [Alvarez](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Walter_Alvarez&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922128161&usg=AOvVaw2UdvlU5cgSO4lQqlKb3PnL)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Walter_Alvarez&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922128428&usg=AOvVaw34MOp2mBAIn5XDbzbMEJ3S) and [Thornton Leigh Page](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thornton_Leigh_Page&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922128747&usg=AOvVaw2BRfhB7wRalyjbN8V8T1OE)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thornton_Leigh_Page&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922129020&usg=AOvVaw1jJoV3ujQJ9XK_m_itRpnO) CIA members [Philip Grandin Strong](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49359563/philip-grandin-strong&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922129389&usg=AOvVaw38tIPFZCa0ggVNXlA1kUoi)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49359563/philip-grandin-strong&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922129667&usg=AOvVaw34fQSt0UCjxHDS5JRLE4b6) Lt. Col. [Frederick C. E. Oder](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nap.edu/read/12473/chapter/39&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922130012&usg=AOvVaw3SWv4mZfYJU3E45WwoKhvu), David B. Stevenson, and [Frederick C. Durant](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.thespacereview.com/article/2856/1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922130340&usg=AOvVaw1S1vvnFDRQ-d2w6oXFIRyc) are also present. All are skeptical, if not openly hostile to UFO reports. Page later says that “H. P. Robertson told us in the first private (no outsiders) session that our job was to reduce public concern and show that UFO reports could be explained by conventional reasoning.” The panel first reviews the CIA OSI study from August, the ATIC November 21 meeting, the December 4 IAC decision, the visit to ATIC by [Chadwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922130802&usg=AOvVaw0VYA5tm9Is4ZAgQFHxb5Lu) and Robertson, and CIA concern over potential national security dangers. They watch the Montana and Utah films. Lt. [Robert S. Neasham](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/n/NeashamRobertS/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922131233&usg=AOvVaw0AszeZEkhTsPuwjDrpa3Bw) and Harry Woo of the Navy Photo Interpretation Laboratory report on their analyses of both films, which conclude that the objects are unidentified. [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922131653&usg=AOvVaw2jEaLqIYMDxO8YAlxUG6Ni) speaks for 40 minutes on the Blue Book method of UFO investigation. It is possibly here that he first suggests using 4602nd AISS field units to conduct Blue Book field investigations. The meeting adjourns at 5:15 p.m. (Frederick C. Durant, “[Report of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP79B00752A000300100010-4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922132133&usg=AOvVaw1BjAqs3QB8Qnd9m4oFZbl2) [Meetings of Scientific Advisory Panel on Unidentified Flying Objects, January 14–18, 1953,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP79B00752A000300100010-4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922132459&usg=AOvVaw0So52VQvFacT1ZS5YE5ZSc)” memorandum for Assistant Director for Scientific Intelligence, February 16, 1953; Clark III 1014–1015; Michael D. Swords, “Dr.

Robertson Requests the Honor of Your Attendance,” IUR 20, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1995): 16–20; Good Above, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/334/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922132865&usg=AOvVaw1mHYU39dKenqRVva8Rfo8s) [335–339](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/334/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922133055&usg=AOvVaw3YgAb2ZCw2j0CCs_lhDaet); Swords 188–192)

January 15 — The second day of the Robertson Panel. [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922133378&usg=AOvVaw1DWS88aFV-KwRaNbAAvZRB) completes his presentation, then [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922133749&usg=AOvVaw0Cl7NnZTpFR1fRPlo8-Uv3) discusses Battelle’s Project Stork. The CIA shows a film of seagulls in flight. Lt. Col. [Oder](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nap.edu/read/12473/chapter/39&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922134163&usg=AOvVaw3xcRDWW_pw8FIjKwcrywKV) gives a 40-minute presentation on Project Twinkle. In the afternoon, Gen. [William M. Garland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49186828/william-madison-garland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922134578&usg=AOvVaw2YZ3pbqbfo7iLL11-fdV1e) states his desire to increase the use of thoroughly briefed USAF intelligence officers to investigate UFO reports, declassify as many reports as possible, and enlarge Blue Book. Other USAF representatives discuss the difficulties of setting up instrument watches to monitor sightings. (Frederick C. Durant, “[Report of Meetings of Scientific Advisory Panel on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP79B00752A000300100010-4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922135020&usg=AOvVaw3kP3ECukFy1RtEMCt6vRff) [January 14–18, 1953,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP79B00752A000300100010-4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922135241&usg=AOvVaw1C5swer-8UPAfBvnNhpsXy)” memorandum for Assistant Director for Scientific Intelligence, February 16, 1953; O’Connell 87–89; Clark III 1015; Michael D. Swords, “Dr. Robertson Requests the Honor of Your Attendance,” IUR 20, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1995): 16–20)

January 16 — The third day of the Robertson Panel. [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922135599&usg=AOvVaw2WzmJgpAUaQ-zhSGd3a3-_) speaks again, followed by Maj. [Dewey Fournet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8653239/dewey-j_-fournet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922135910&usg=AOvVaw0E8ZLC7RYol_1XnxMky7Qj)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8653239/dewey-j_-fournet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922136083&usg=AOvVaw3dFvLkidETGa2f18TdyYvZ) who talks about his motion studies of UFOs that indicate controlled flight. Physicist [Lloyd Berkner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lloyd_Berkner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922136344&usg=AOvVaw2LdPYzH0L3ZmQPFNWISefu) joins the panel in the afternoon. In the afternoon, panel members talk about conclusions they have reached, and [Robertson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_P._Robertson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922136571&usg=AOvVaw1G9wKT86HoEd85DqDvTq76) agrees to draft a report for review (although it has already been written by [Durant](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.thespacereview.com/article/2856/1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922136800&usg=AOvVaw1yNLWELNFi48GUA9IKWhtV) prior to the meetings, which Fournet has suspected). (Frederick C. Durant, “[Report of Meetings of Scientific Advisory Panel on Unidentified Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP79B00752A000300100010-4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922137106&usg=AOvVaw24sqEze11PntgnFAic6tf_) [Objects, January 14–18, 1953,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP79B00752A000300100010-4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922137336&usg=AOvVaw3mjcDrc8DaDDACgdTrBRsF)” memorandum for Assistant Director for Scientific Intelligence, February 16, 1953; O’Connell 87–89; Clark III 1015; Michael D. Swords, “Dr. Robertson Requests the Honor of Your Attendance,” IUR 20, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1995): 16–20)

January 17 — The final day of the Robertson Panel. The panel reviews [Robertson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_P._Robertson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922137720&usg=AOvVaw1-soH0L8XQ9gurSNCOKT5n)’s draft report ([Berkner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lloyd_Berkner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922138051&usg=AOvVaw00dmlG7GtHYObJuBkSoxyd) has already seen it) and puts it into final form. (By 11:00 a.m., both CIA Director [Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922138428&usg=AOvVaw2hpyQQQOsCByOrJLQWXuuU) and Gen. [John A. Samford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922138788&usg=AOvVaw1B9AZvXqtl2aqPS4JaePjs) have seen and approved the draft.) The scientists agree that since most sightings can be explained, the rest can be accounted for with further investigation, which is a “great waste of effort.” They reject [Fournet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8653239/dewey-j_-fournet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922139264&usg=AOvVaw3p_Pld0-pKVW0eTgXqw3g9)’s UFO reports as “raw” and “unevaluated.” The Montana film is said to depict aircraft. They reject the Navy analysis of the Utah film, calling the objects “high reflectivity of seagulls in bright sunlight.” Because the “mass receipt of low-grade reports \[tends\] to overload channels of communication with material quite irrelevant to hostile objects that might some day appear” (a phony issue invented by [Thornton Page](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thornton_Leigh_Page&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922139540&usg=AOvVaw2Vb0CS3K9FPKO2BvKoyJNr)), the Air Force should embark on a debunking campaign that would “result in reduction of public interest in flying saucers” with the help of scientific pronouncements (suggested by [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922139758&usg=AOvVaw2bMh1TlZXGeHbT0htF64W4)) and media, including [Walt Disney](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walt_Disney&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922139961&usg=AOvVaw2kMpuASGxx_I6AFO1Yb1IS) Inc. animated cartoons. Blue Book should be expanded to 18 staff members (it has 5) so that it can educate and debunk effectively, but this never happens. Civilian UFO groups such as CSI and APRO should be watched “because of their potentially great

* * *

influence on mass thinking if widespread sightings should occur. The apparent irresponsibility and the possible use of such groups for subversive purposes should be kept in mind.” The panel and report are kept classified until a brief summary is declassified in 1958, and the CIA’s involvement is kept secret until 1966. (Frederick C. Durant, “[Report of Meetings of Scientific Advisory Panel on Unidentified Flying Objects, January 14–18, 1953,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP79B00752A000300100010-4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922140427&usg=AOvVaw1JUfn6dvmw9cVaeA5hx6Is)” memorandum for Assistant Director for Scientific Intelligence, February 16, 1953; Clark III 1014–1016 ; Michael

D. Swords, “Dr. Robertson Requests the Honor of Your Attendance,” IUR 20, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1995): 16–20; Swords 192–200)

January 17 — 3:55 p.m. Geologist/salesman John Townsend Sackett is riding in a bus with about a dozen passengers near Guatemala City, Guatemala, when he observes a brilliant greenish-gold object, shaped like the Goodyear blimp. It is later described as being about twice the size of a DC-3. The object is traveling at about 400 mph straight and level in a northwesterly direction at about 6,500 feet. It almost stops in mid-flight then rises vertically about 1,500 feet, hovers for about 2 seconds, then immediately resumes flight at a new altitude. The object is lost to view because of intervening terrain. (NICAP, “[Blimp-Like Object Sighted by Geologist](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530117guatemala_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922141056&usg=AOvVaw1W4UJOWOQewKoYY4uyevn_)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922141305&usg=AOvVaw3en5zI5-18YqhbFK07dpsF), p. 189)

January 18 — Upon [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922141618&usg=AOvVaw2EJISxFc5KjXHg7Jn4Vwj2)’s return to Ohio State University from the Robertson Panel, he and his new research assistant [Jennie Zeidman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/name/jennie-zeidman-obituary?pid%3D195927848&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922141877&usg=AOvVaw3QUmuzPqyyxe0Hw6mpOtpT) come up with the name “Project Henry” to describe his consultancy with the Air Force. It is based on the Flit bug-spray advertisement that has a woman saying, “Quick, Henry, the Flit!” About once a week, a courier from Battelle arrives at Hynek’s office with a manila envelope stuffed with teletype UFO reports for him to examine. Hynek travels to the Blue Book facility in Building 263 at Wright-Patterson about 2–3 times a month, with Zeidman sometimes accompanying him, (Jennie Zeidman, “I Remember Blue Book,” IUR 16, no. 2 (Mar./Apr. 1991): 7–12, 23)

January 20 — [Robertson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_P._Robertson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922142511&usg=AOvVaw05_n9-ubR6l0KdMbiBgpKO) writes a letter to [Chadwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922142915&usg=AOvVaw0nIc9slfKP4PdqQSUqgEr7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922143167&usg=AOvVaw13cBoaxd4tY6dvBs0rTqye) saying “perhaps that’ll take care of the Forteans for a while” and mentions an upcoming meeting with the “NSA group” on February 5. (Swords 189)

January 20 — [Dwight D. Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922143656&usg=AOvVaw0a55svFr_Xgv-V0tI02iA2) is sworn in as president. ()

January 24 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922144108&usg=AOvVaw2oMYD29nNGKt6BWHnU1hhL) travels to Ent AFB \[now the US Olympic Training Center\] in Colorado Springs, Colorado, to brief the 4602nd AISS on how they might help Blue Book investigate UFOs. He also puts in for a transfer to Air Defense Command here. ()

January 26 — Air Force Press Officer [Albert M. Chop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/interviews/bios/chop-albert.php&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922144487&usg=AOvVaw1m6iQ4xbgW5Dgz4sqTWM5S) writes a letter to [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922144812&usg=AOvVaw1p4PJ99DnRd2KoHtowYkBv)’s publisher Henry Holt & Co., declaring that all the sighting reports he is using for his upcoming Flying Saucers from Outer Space were cleared and made available to him from Air Technical Intelligence records. (Albert E. Chop, [Letter to Henry Holt & Company](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/chop2let.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922145253&usg=AOvVaw0tKATO3R1tna_FdXpJ2N7g), January 26, 1953; Good Above, [p. 542](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/542/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922145521&usg=AOvVaw3wjmwbON0IIqrzgAMEDOAU))

January 28 — 1:06 p.m. R. W. Love and a Mr. Ferrenti, while engaged in retrieving radio-controlled drones on a boat 1,100 yards offshore and south of Naval Air Station Point Mugu \[now Naval Base Ventura County\] near Oxnard, California, see a white, flat disc with fuzzy or shimmering edges rapidly approach from the northwest flying straight and level, overtake a jet aircraft, pass overhead, and disappear in the haze to the east. (NICAP, “[Flat Disc Observed Overtaking](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530128pointmugu_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922146051&usg=AOvVaw3_oKggY-D_cy5gS6V9OKkp) [Jet](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530128pointmugu_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922146267&usg=AOvVaw2cRED1Y4qxv17aCyV9l0Q_)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922146454&usg=AOvVaw0rzzgxDHOTX3a09bp-uB2U)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922146581&usg=AOvVaw3XG3DCPRNALrJzEYu7E1Vi) p. 190)

January 28 — 2:20 p.m. Northrop Aircraft test pilot Rex Hardy Jr. is flying over Malibu, California, when he and two other crew members see a formation of four UFOs the size of a B-36. They are circular in shape, aluminum- colored, and flying at 1,200 mph. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 50)

January 28 — A Maj. Geyer at Mitchel AFB \[now closed\] near Uniondale, New York, investigates reports of a UFO seen by both civilian and military witnesses. The UFO is an oval object glowing with different colors and having a tail or projection. He quickly concludes that it is a meteor and submits a report to Blue Book. However, one of the witnesses, author Marie Armstrong Essipoff ([Ben Hecht](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ben_Hecht&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922147167&usg=AOvVaw3Gk0M8ir7PHEC3dLfjdYds)’s first wife), later writes to [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922147358&usg=AOvVaw22BA0Z8VvX8Oa1Kresi3_F) saying that she had told Geyer that the object wobbled and it had a turret on top. She draws a picture and Geyer says it looks like one of their flight simulators. But it’s “still a meteor,” he says. (Swords 199–200)

January 28 — 9:00 p.m. The control tower at Marine Corps Air Station El Toro \[now closed\], California, spots a large, luminous, red object and asks Maj. Harvey N. Patton to give chase. He pursues it from Newport Beach to Long Beach and has it in sight for 3–4 minutes but is unable to gain on it. (NICAP, “[Marine Fighter Asked to Check on](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530128eltoro_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922147922&usg=AOvVaw08uCqy_Ndkph0W8tOn0D9A) [Amber Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530128eltoro_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922148228&usg=AOvVaw1MvqZ6_NfpnyUWeU55eNub)”)

January 28 — 9:40 p.m. Maj. Hal W. Lamb, USAF senior pilot at Moody AFB in Valdosta, Georgia, apparently sees the setting planet Venus (although this is disputed) changing color and shape while flying a T-33 (or an F-86). It is also seen by Turner AFB \[now Naval Air Station Albany\] tower operators in Albany \[not Dobbins Air Reserve Base in Marietta\], Georgia (with time errors of about 10 minutes). About the same time, two GCA radar maintenance men at Turner AFB radar track three moving targets and a stationary target. At 10:10 p.m., the GCA reports two stationary targets at 17 and 27 miles, both 300° azimuth. No visual confirmation, though binoculars are used. (NICAP, “[Several Radar Contacts](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530128georgia_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922148912&usg=AOvVaw0WXJsb4obEqlP9Huke6VYs)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922149211&usg=AOvVaw3N1UuxJp8aVUYWQbl-PBHD), p. 191; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1953, January–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Jan-Feb.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922149557&usg=AOvVaw1WJh01pGdRcCMbWrvMgLbW) [March](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Jan-Feb.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922149900&usg=AOvVaw23UW5MEDo4_AAqzr-zGnrB)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Jan-Feb.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922150194&usg=AOvVaw0s3OtMGMEDS18vrhfTW1dC) The Author, 1988, p. 66; Marler 129–130)

* * *

January 29 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922150879&usg=AOvVaw3QRDYnmS_AuaHGfADJRACj) still thinks that the Robertson Panel has accepted [Garland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49186828/william-madison-garland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922151306&usg=AOvVaw3xajvMGN1E740_QoPQNRoA)’s recommendation to expand Blue Book (it hasn’t) and that its education and debunking recommendation means that UFO information should be released to the public (it didn’t). [Fournet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8653239/dewey-j_-fournet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922151672&usg=AOvVaw1HP4cnUYiQ9tAnCBLizZJ3)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8653239/dewey-j_-fournet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922151960&usg=AOvVaw1TDscBD16aFObvW-Cl0Lt9) [Chop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/interviews/bios/chop-albert.php&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922152279&usg=AOvVaw0XUVgB9GFDA8XxOnSiNLDR), and Col. Teabert ([Kenneth E. Thiebaud](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/54677903/kenneth-e_-thiebaud&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922152621&usg=AOvVaw0BV31TQIQPgxS3IFekAwRH)?) of AFOIN-2 think the same. In Washington, Ruppelt hears that the press has heard rumors about the Utah film, and he decides to release it, focusing on the seagull explanation. (The Hynek UFO Report, [p. 236](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/236/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922153070&usg=AOvVaw00AvhrfMgDdv6Bq0OepvTG))

January 29 — A briefing of the Office of Naval Estimates Board by the CIA on UFOs includes the showing of the Utah and Montana films. (Frederick C. Durant, “[Briefing of ONE Board on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/cia/cia530130memo.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922153552&usg=AOvVaw2GaVkO8EuJ3cBWITzL7ywJ)” January 30, 1953)

January 29 — 9:55 a.m. A small gray oval-shaped object is seen between Houlton and Chatham, Maine, by 2nd Lt. Fred

T. Goetting Jr., pilot of an F-94B. Goetting points out the object to his radar observer, Lt. [Howard C. Kelley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/186885214/howard-clay-kelley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922154158&usg=AOvVaw1URpZfAe4Kl1Ljklc_Izd5). The object appears to be 10° above the F-94B, which is at 23,000 feet. Goetting attempts to intercept the object at a speed of 0.8 Mach. This chase continues for 8 minutes without the F-94 gaining, and the chase is broken off because of low fuel. The object is seen by at least two fighter aircraft from other squadrons. (NICAP, “[Gray Oval](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530129presqueisle_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922154530&usg=AOvVaw0zyne75h22NN5SvF8PF7N1) [Sighted by 3 Fighter Aircraft](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530129presqueisle_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922154862&usg=AOvVaw0EVz2IJCJRrrQq_TxmnjvW)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922155192&usg=AOvVaw1rHxtaQXzGxb2uevCQiH2H), p. 191)

January 29 — 11:30 p.m. A farmer named [Lloyd C. Booth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/82693987/lloyd-cooper-booth&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922155654&usg=AOvVaw13Upi4KMHv__nCZDlt1lEu) just north of Conway, South Carolina, hears a commotion of animals, grabs his .22 revolver, and sees an oblong-shaped, lighted object 10 feet above the trees moving slowly or hovering, with a low humming sound. He shoots at the object twice. The first bullet bounces off with a metallic sound; at the second shot the object tilts slightly and ascends at a 65° angle to the west at 600–700 mph and disappears. One of his cows had died the previous evening. (NICAP, “[Man Fires 0.22 at Hovering Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530129conway_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922156142&usg=AOvVaw00XrByLuoqsBmt0g5uCag7)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922156461&usg=AOvVaw2pBDtM2YvHD0xh1-GVg_at)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922156690&usg=AOvVaw2myVpU5Ybi9XHmLQSHkRgS) p. 191; “[Conway S.C. Man Shoots Saucer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201953%252003%252015%2520-%2520Vol%25201%2520No%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922157142&usg=AOvVaw21gCr3yQtq-RTgtiVcfEoN)” APRO Bulletin 1, no. 5 (March 15, 1953): 1, 4–5; Donald E. Keyhoe and Gordon I. R. Lore Jr., [Strange Effects from UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922157676&usg=AOvVaw0tD--SwTzzXDkc3LyLIIK5)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922158023&usg=AOvVaw0ONDcOsW46t9D3bRBoOji0) NICAP, 1969, pp. 64–66)

January 29 — 2:20 p.m. Northrup test pilot [Rex Hardy Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-2004-apr-18-me-hardy18-story.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922158590&usg=AOvVaw2IO1-5f_8SFABfI0F96FSS), test pilot Chester Mathews, and Northrup photographer Jim Wilkinson see four metallic, disc-shaped object the size of a B-36 flying in squadron formation over Malibu Beach, California. They estimate their height as 20,000 feet and speed as 1,200 mph. They watch for about 5 minutes. (NICAP, “[Four B-36-Sized Discs Observed by 3-Man Crew](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530129malibubeach_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922158996&usg=AOvVaw0fKlt7bRrTJrQ72s5FuYgn)”)

January 31 — Project Blue Book issues its Status Report #9. (US Air Force, [Projects Grudge and Blue Book Reports 1–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922159577&usg=AOvVaw2_RV7nDcgEGE8k64IVT-Gx) [12,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922159962&usg=AOvVaw2lS6HqnifWn-BvlUjrukAY) NICAP, 1968, pp. 155–174)

February — [Albert K. Bender](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_K._Bender&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922160614&usg=AOvVaw1vQZswknbxJ3IRtmLBETRg) appoints [Gray Barker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gray_Barker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922160998&usg=AOvVaw3YY00XbXvqLlA3Gm6CffUY) as IFSB’s chief investigator. (“[IFSB Forms Dept. of Investigation,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Space%2520Review%2520(Bender)/Space%2520Review%2520-%2520Volume%25202%2520number%25202%2520-%25201953%252004.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922161508&usg=AOvVaw0GPM-gLUf0GkE2lipc_Cfg)”

Space Review 2, no. 2 (April 1953): 1; Clark III 189)

February 1 — 9:30 p.m. A T-33 flying 10 miles west of Terre Haute, Indiana, sights a close group of moving lights changing color from red to blue, to green to yellow. The pilot estimates their altitude to range between 15,000 feet to 30,000 feet flying in a manner similar to conventional aircraft. Searchlights from the St. Louis, Missouri, area seem to be following the unidentified lights. (NICAP, “[T-33 Pilot Observes Unidentified Lights](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530201terrehaute_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922162255&usg=AOvVaw35XQgM-_0BkDzo5NjSOD5_)”)

February 3 — 8:00 p.m. [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922162688&usg=AOvVaw2Oa33xD_7QMPQ0QBMM5Yrb) and his wife Betty Jane watch two UFOs near the ground from their home on Brookside Boulevard in Prescott, Arizona. Another UFO passes over the house at 10:00 p.m. (Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, pp. 363–364)

February 4 — 1:50 p.m. US Weather Bureau observer Stanley H. Brown in Yuma, Arizona, tracks with a theodolite a white, oblong object. It is surrounded by a thin white mist and flies straight up and levels off. After 20 seconds, the object is joined by a second one that flies away twice and returns. Both are lost to sight behind clouds to the south-southwest. The sighting lasts 5 minutes. (NICAP, “[Theodolite Tracking of Two Elliptical Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530204yuma_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922163462&usg=AOvVaw2C9VGzsowjwp4_-oNtGEFl)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922163772&usg=AOvVaw3mxpU92FCWwHFr3NMujcoi)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922164033&usg=AOvVaw27FbmOPF9a0NNtX6W6nV_a) p. 191; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23meteorologists&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922164398&usg=AOvVaw2zOfYEVlzChRdp2fU7oyet)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 62–63)

February 6 — 1:34 a.m. A B-36 aircraft piloted by Maj. [Leo J. Moffatt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49266802/leo-james-moffatt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922165059&usg=AOvVaw1dVLsr2OS5afGGwAYQYFWc) is over Rosalia, Washington, when he sees one round white omnidirectional light at an altitude of approximately 7,000 feet on a southeast course, circling and rising as it proceeds. It is visually observed for a period of 3–5 minutes. The B-36 makes a 180° descending turn toward the light, which is estimated to be moving at a speed of 170–230 mph. Blue Book explains it as a weather balloon launched from Geiger Field \[now Spokane International Airport\]. (NICAP, “[B-36 Encounters Light at](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530206rosalia_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922165540&usg=AOvVaw2on3LZoK5K_X-c-hNX6u7A) [7,000ʹ](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530206rosalia_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922165879&usg=AOvVaw2lc-ZCaZypL3k1I3fAYgrd)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922166197&usg=AOvVaw1cEX0D9Br9RVJO56Fr5BQM)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922166427&usg=AOvVaw2bW7p7i8UZV3LaD0j4pF4G) p. 192; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23balloons&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922166768&usg=AOvVaw3B7WdapaYu0FBSr5quiP9z)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 67–68)

February 7 — 9:22 p.m. A USAF F-94 crew and other witnesses near Nemuro, Hokkaido, Japan, see a bright orange object change color to red and green at intervals and disappear behind a cloud. It is also tracked by ground radar. (NICAP, “[F-94 Crew in Air and Ground Radar Tracking](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530207okinawa_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922167459&usg=AOvVaw0F-thp5Mk9AyE4IaycJ56P)”; Condon, [p. 122](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/122/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922167807&usg=AOvVaw26GgnmUiu7Sl88QqW07kdh); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922168155&usg=AOvVaw1yg4yP-9F_tR5Mc3X1ssdE)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922168401&usg=AOvVaw26fHOlQhjiivUkVuWL8CNJ) p. 192)

February 9 — [Al Chop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/interviews/bios/chop-albert.php&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922168780&usg=AOvVaw3FW_31qwYPYZnhBCVK0vnc) has written a press release on the Utah film with the approval of Capt. Harry B. Smith of AFOIN. They decide to also release the USAF (possible aircraft) and Navy (self-luminous or light sources) analyses,

* * *

otherwise the press might suspect a cover-up. The release would state that, although no positive identification has been made, further analysis will result in an identification. Gen. [Garland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49186828/william-madison-garland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922169478&usg=AOvVaw2FzXLrRqUsMg3CRuyRavvR) approves the release, which then goes on to the Pentagon, which “screamed ‘No!’” [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922169883&usg=AOvVaw3iqO9pfB21f5S4Vwz19WYp) is ordered into silence. Chop says the CIA “killed the whole program. We’ve been ordered to work up a national debunking campaign, planting articles in magazines and arranging broadcasts to make UFO reports seem like poppycock.” Ruppelt tells [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922170327&usg=AOvVaw2f0QeTRcr1JV5lvCBS9cNu) that Blue Book must even discredit USAF pilots who report UFOs. “It’s a raw deal, but we can’t buck the CIA.” (Ruppelt, [p. 228](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/228/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922170734&usg=AOvVaw3o8ITvT3K7Vlw1v-n7bs3u); Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, [pp. 70–71](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/70/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922171271&usg=AOvVaw22pVG4b8EhzB1fjMjnTd_Z); The Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 236–237](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/236/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922171657&usg=AOvVaw3nWJw7Ix-SIawFvDMSLA61))

February 9 — CIA agent Hayden Channing writes a memo to the Domestic Contact Division describing a recent \[late January?\] public meeting of the Civilian Saucer Investigation group in Los Angeles, California. North American Aviation project engineer [Walther A. Riedel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://anniejacobsen.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/op-16.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922172187&usg=AOvVaw2D8TbZ002MD676qXiTJsNj) is a member of the organization, and he describes the analyses of the UFO reports it receives. Only about 25 sightings are unidentified, and these they forward to Project Blue Book.

Channing writes: “Apparently, an eye and interest are also directed to the USSR for reactions to sightings as reported in the PRAVDA.” (Hayden Channing, “[California Committee for Saucer Investigation,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/shg/csi/csicia.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922172849&usg=AOvVaw10HirFDqIEgkYaatVNGkKN)” February 9, 1953)

February 11 (or 19) — 10:00 p.m. At the Naval Auxiliary Air Station \[now Northeastern Regional Airport\] in Edenton, North Carolina, Marine 1st Lt. Edward Balocco is on intercept stand-by duty when the alert whistle goes off. Minutes later he is in his F9F Panther jet heading north to Virginia Beach, Virginia, while being vectored to an unknown target by the 2nd Marine Aircraft Wing at Marine Corps Air Station Cherry Point in Havelock, North Carolina. By the time he gets close to the target, it has disappeared from radar at Norfolk, Virginia. After searching the area for 15 minutes, he heads back for fuel. Flying south at 20,000 feet, he notices a light below him on the port side on or near the ocean. After turning his navigation lights back on, he notices that the light has risen to his altitude and is only 2,000 feet away. Closing in on it, he sees it is a disc with blinking red lights. At 350 feet away, his cockpit is bathed in blue-white light and everything seems motionless and silent. He looks at his gloved hand and he can see the bones in his hand like an X-ray. Suddenly there is a flash, and the UFO breaks away as sound and motion return. Balocco tries to pursue it again unsuccessfully. Captain Thomas Riggs, whose F9F Panther has also been scrambled, reports the UFO is moving south along the North Carolina coast. He is debriefed and told not to mention the incident. (“[Cherry Point, N.C.,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201953%252003%252015%2520-%2520Vol%25201%2520No%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922173551&usg=AOvVaw0v5H6NNjStn3Guk5laP4E6)” APRO Bulletin 1, no. 5 (March 15, 1953): 9–10; Good Need, [pp. 183–184](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/182/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922173940&usg=AOvVaw3d2aTQ3Zxxpw4yJ2VnSOcQ); Shoot 60–61)

Mid-February — Weapons engineer [Chester W. Lytle Sr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/31822266/chester-wallace-lytle-death-notice/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922174301&usg=AOvVaw2aJRNnSlgyKy4RwplqFTkn)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/31822266/chester-wallace-lytle-death-notice/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922174570&usg=AOvVaw1AzfXDROXuHAHZDwYsHSZT) deputy director of operations for SAC’s Eighth Air Force Headquarters, is visiting Eielson AFB near Moose Creek, Alaska, with Gen. [William H. Blanchard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_H._Blanchard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922174906&usg=AOvVaw0hmjTlcOExLLudON6BegyE) when he finds out his wife is about to give birth in Chicago, Illinois. Blanchard offers to personally fly him in a bomber to an air force base in Illinois so he can get home quickly. During the long flight, their conversation turns to UFOs.

Blanchard unexpectedly mentions the 1947 Roswell incident and that a crashed alien spacecraft had indeed been recovered. He tells Lytle that four dead humanoid beings had been aboard. (Nukes 478–481)

February 23 — Project Stork’s William T. Reid writes to [Miles E. Goll](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Goll_M.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922175362&usg=AOvVaw27tz-XaBIz4GMcQHbMqdsz) at Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio, saying that UFO reports have been processed through October 15, 1952, and evaluations completed for reports through July 31, 1952. (“[Seven Status Reports for Project Stork, Part 4 of 4 Parts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cufon.org/cufon/stork1-7c.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922175733&usg=AOvVaw0bVTRub3g3uz_7L4ndkM3r)” CUFON)

February 25— Pentagon press officer [Albert M. Chop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/interviews/bios/chop-albert.php&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922176122&usg=AOvVaw3AFI0ooTDTl_tpxhheK4uw) writes to Maj. [Donald E. Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922176347&usg=AOvVaw3_4xPn63ecOY8an7nyykP_) and verifies that the files on 41 cases investigated by the Air Force for his upcoming book Flying Saucers from Outer Space were indeed cleared for release by ATIC. (Albert M. Chop, [Letter to Donald E. Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cufon.org/cufon/stork1-7c.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922176618&usg=AOvVaw02yzMu2XwayfZezSVahstw), February 25, 1953; NICAP, “[The Chop](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/chop.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922176784&usg=AOvVaw3Tulza-U6N33Lw1sFgiNbE) [Clearance List](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/chop.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922176975&usg=AOvVaw1akImXOW5oMEc-HSEXfMrO)”)

February 25 — Project Second Storey meets for the last known time, chaired by astrophysicist [Peter M. Millman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Millman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922177306&usg=AOvVaw0f-2Hs3ofEyQjkIN2iTCep) of the Dominion Observatory in Ottawa, Ontario, and consisting of military and intelligence officers, as well as [Wilbert](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922177636&usg=AOvVaw3jIJQHnTAfzvKJPhmYBDL7) [Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922177858&usg=AOvVaw1gs461uef_puKa3YGEw0ww)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922178058&usg=AOvVaw2MYdmZRTTUR96ExX29i-MX) It concludes that, because details of most sightings cannot be adequately confirmed, UFO reports do not lend themselves to a “scientific method of investigation.” It determines that UFOs do not require a Canadian armed forces investigation, but reports should still be sent to the Directorate of Scientific Intelligence. (“[Wilbert](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922178290&usg=AOvVaw0_3qiSG7_bo7lsVcgKPtK0)

[B. Smith,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922178509&usg=AOvVaw31GOSrIty2W-bszRVGW0g_)” Northern Ontario UFO Research and Study; Chris Rutkowski and Geoff Dittman, The Canadian UFO Report, Dundurn Press, 2006, p. 229; Good Above, [p. 182](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/182/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922178860&usg=AOvVaw1-bZe-r3MVMUa58hXwjLBP); Story, [p. 276](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/276/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922179083&usg=AOvVaw0w0c2uRQrPniI6ftfhjXvL))

Late February — ADC commander [Benjamin Chidlaw](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_W._Chidlaw&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922179368&usg=AOvVaw2pO70o4vHnn1YwwvLtydhX) at Ent AFB \[now US Olympic Training Center\] near Colorado Springs, Colorado, tells future UFO researcher Robert C. Gardner that he has “stacks of reports about flying saucers. We take them seriously when you consider we have lost many men and planes trying to intercept them.” (Stringfield, [3-0 Blue](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/3-0Blue/3-0_Blue.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922179603&usg=AOvVaw13g1aKATJ8uQWKyfZqawau), p. 91; Stringfield, Situation Red, Fawcett Crest, 1977, pp. 137–138)

February 27 — Project Blue Book issues its Status Report #10, classified “secret.” (US Air Force, [Projects Grudge and](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922180216&usg=AOvVaw1owWkys5yZ8tOL4EBtXE4t) [Blue Book Reports 1–12,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922180458&usg=AOvVaw1ndoo_7imIa40CerhJLb8U) NICAP, 1968, pp. 175–198)

February 28 — Capt. [Edward J. Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922180836&usg=AOvVaw1mTv90WqCu3N7kYXvHW3m7) transfers out of Blue Book for a seven-month assignment in Denver, Colorado.

He is replaced by Lt. Robert M. Olsson, who has one staff member. (Ruppelt, [p. 228](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/228/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922181231&usg=AOvVaw3kXjXMBdjYZ2b-Xi8Tv3gJ))

March — 10:00 a.m. Pilot [Howard C.
