Strand](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/175238576/howard-c_-strand&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922181752&usg=AOvVaw3lhNGU_LPuySSH_vtIMgoY) is flying a routine patrol mission in a F-94B out of Selfridge AFB \[now Selfridge Air National Guard Base\] near Mount Clemens, Michigan, when he is asked to check out a radar target over downtown Detroit. He and his radar operator see tiny specks that seem to be a ragged formation of aircraft. As he approaches, he cannot see any wings or tails. Ground radar has the UFOs as “good, strong targets.” Strand looks at his instruments briefly and when he looks up the objects are gone, though ground radar tracks them another 4 minutes. [Gordon Thayer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/t/ThayerGordonD/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922182055&usg=AOvVaw1jSEuYZ-SYuCevYbz6ZOXK) calls it an inferior mirage. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Mar-July-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922182325&usg=AOvVaw2f0YlcqnSzH47i9w9oh_f7) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1953 March–July, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Mar-July-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922182565&usg=AOvVaw0h9QbOvjbrRx9GpCdhXrHG)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Mar-July-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922182722&usg=AOvVaw3AeV6uCgYdTNc382SlWIBd) The Author, 2002, pp. 24–26; Condon, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/150/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922182984&usg=AOvVaw08y1WzgcQ4xacRppD8R7t2) [151–153](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/150/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922183193&usg=AOvVaw2J0OXBHjN1sdzpuQ8l17TU))

March — Harvard University astronomer [Donald H. Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922183523&usg=AOvVaw1MUd5wak7jswX8iy6fpdTG) publishes Flying Saucers, in which he explains all UFO sightings as known phenomena such as mirages and temperature inversions. It is the first book-length argument against UFOs, one of the few published by an academic institution, and the first UFO book by a scientist. ATIC personnel are displeased that Menzel has used a few classified reports supplied to him for an examination of patterns, which he has never produced. However, he has an imaginative vision of what Venus looks like, with “warm seas” in which life teems. (Donald H. Menzel, [Flying Saucers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/dli.ernet.248019/page/n3/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922183912&usg=AOvVaw3FajDJmBAuogWzGAShUxbZ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/dli.ernet.248019/page/n3/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922184059&usg=AOvVaw2hk0rzRVttiBNnx51CGGZ4) Harvard University, 1953; Getty Images, “[Dr. Donald H. Menzel, Harvard Professor and Native Denverite, Refers to His Book,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.gettyimages.co.uk/detail/news-photo/dr-donald-h-menzel-harvard-professor-and-native-denverite-news-photo/162381615&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922184532&usg=AOvVaw3z6Db2esNsZL57ray7LECP)” March 13, 1953; Clark III 742)

March — Gen. [John A. Samford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922184969&usg=AOvVaw2SgEwOi1jtZyHccx3TipoY) is interviewed in See magazine and provides straightforward, factual answers about Project Blue Book, UFOs, and the inadequacy of [Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922185357&usg=AOvVaw0cfzcwbiVWZNr4nntVb6az)’s theories. He claims the view of the Air Force is that “many credible people have seen incredible things.” (Swords 210–211)

March 3 — 1:25 p.m. USAF Capt. [Roderick D. Thompson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/17406215/roderick-dhu-thompson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922185686&usg=AOvVaw0MOJL7glwjbTVjLFbl5B78)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/17406215/roderick-dhu-thompson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922185877&usg=AOvVaw1EkCq6qfLUFdyxv30fPlIA) 3600th Fighter Training Group out of Luke AFB near Glendale, Arizona, is an instructor pilot flying an F-84 at 25,000 feet over Blythe, California. He spots am object 300–500 feet wide leaving a contrail crossing his path from left to right at about 35,000–45,000 feet at about 400 mph. It is visible only by condensation vapor emitted from its manta-ray shaped flat surface. Student pilots flying two F-84s, Lt. Jack

E. Brasher and Lt. Thomas W. Hale, also see the object but do not follow in pursuit. When Thompson turns to pursue it, the object makes a slight dipping turn to the northwest and begins climbing at about 20°. It appears to be very thin and immediately begins to form a heavy condensation trail behind it for roughly 1,000 feet and splits in two. Thompson reaches 30,000 feet and closes to within roughly 5–10 miles to a point over the Colorado River north of Parker Dam on the Arizona border. He takes 151 frames of gun camera film of object with a 16 mm N-9 camera, apparently at 16 fps 1/40 second exposure setting. (NICAP, “[Three F-94 Pilots Encounter Manta-Ray, Gun Camera](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530303luke_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922186369&usg=AOvVaw0oWDF9UPRKCAijOGOuRe02) [Shots](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530303luke_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922186645&usg=AOvVaw2S3bXnqITTPv4fp0znbNU3)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922186967&usg=AOvVaw3h_IGtZSBKVX9Z0W4lWRrG)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922187127&usg=AOvVaw1SqbCLh6wr3Coq2yM58sly) p. 194; Swords 213–214)

March 5 — Brig. Gen. [Woodbury M. Burgess](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49223590/woodbury-m-burgess&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922187458&usg=AOvVaw2Ln7Ua8_9d9w3qQFiptKZG)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49223590/woodbury-m-burgess&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922187663&usg=AOvVaw13drbDQ437675nqYOvW2tp) commander at Ent AFB \[now the US Olympic Training Center\] in Colorado Springs, Colorado, sends a memo to Air Defense Command and the director of intelligence at Ent suggesting that field teams of 4602nd personnel interview UFO witnesses. (Maj. Robert C. Brown, “[Utilisation of](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/530305Hornsby-ADC_letter.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922187932&usg=AOvVaw3yEZVai8219U5bmWyZ0pN0) [4602nd AISS Personnel in Project Blue Book Field Investigations,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/530305Hornsby-ADC_letter.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922188194&usg=AOvVaw1oCvV1hmopWqOFahGdGIUP)” March 5, 1953; Kevin D. Randle, “[UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2011/06/ufo-cover-up-early-days.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922188528&usg=AOvVaw2w53l3trprnKT9zy9whioc) [Coverup: The Early Days,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2011/06/ufo-cover-up-early-days.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922188859&usg=AOvVaw3xQxLlTrAHc7mPE3J8opDc)” A Different Perspective, June 20, 2011)

March 8 — Journalist [Peter H. Wyden](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_H._Wyden&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922189213&usg=AOvVaw0L8HbBNs3LA5_UgcDdm7AU)’s interview with [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922189406&usg=AOvVaw04UyPiwgm8dhk8U3geDXs9) appears in the St. Louis Post-Dispatch. Ruppelt tells him that Project Blue Book “has no evidence of any of these objects being anything other than misinterpretation of known objects…. We can’t say positively because our data isn’t good enough. But we’re not worried.” The lengthy article provides a good overview of Blue Book’s investigations and staff of seven, including Ruppelt’s assistants Lt. [Anderson G. Flues](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.stltoday.com/news/multimedia/look-back-ufo-sightings/image_7b99baf9-07e8-5407-b231-d7d2bd474abe.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922189812&usg=AOvVaw2gqTzAQRWYfXfAIANk8ygD) and Max Futch. (Peter Wyden, “They’re Still Chasing Flying Saucers,” St. Louis Post-Dispatch, March 8, 1953, p. 1G)

March 8 — 9:02 p.m. Physics teacher [Leigh Van Etten](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111058162/leigh-van_etten&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922190440&usg=AOvVaw1Si7ALD1bdPjKaQmA4VJuk), two other teachers, and 10 students at Kents Hill School, Maine, watch a big red ball of fire moving west-northwest for 12 minutes before it disappears beyond the horizon. He estimates it is about 40–60 miles away. (Jennie Zeidman, “I Remember Blue Book,” IUR 16, no. 2 (Mar./Apr. 1991): 10)

March 14 — 11:43 p.m. Lt. Robert J. Wooten is flying a Navy P2V-5 antisubmarine plane over the Sea of Japan northwest of Nishinoshima, Japan, when he encounters an “electrifying display” of groups of 5–10 colored lights, totaling 90–100, slowly moving to the left side of the aircraft at a range of 3–7 miles and maintaining an extremely precise formation. Some of the objects are also tracked on radar. A 1955 RAND report falsely attributes this to an armada of 100 MiG-15 fighter aircraft (actually only 11) that menaced four US Navy Panther jets from the carrier [USS Oriskany](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Oriskany_(CV-34)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922191050&usg=AOvVaw31ziriU-Ljq5ZiUaQiHmM0)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Oriskany_(CV-34)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922191269&usg=AOvVaw0G4y7qYHs7U6VetJrphx3c) but this earlier incident took place on November 18, 1952, resulting in damage to one of the MiGs. (NICAP, “[Groups of Lights / IFF Signals](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530314seajapan_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922191497&usg=AOvVaw12mHCo2hkWCP02zJECPZ0B)”; Clark III 53–59; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922191700&usg=AOvVaw3ZISWcEcZmOR5vobIbqZ-v), p. 195; Swords 214)

March 15 — The International Flying Saucer Bureau declares today World Contact Day and calls upon the UFO occupants to make a public appearance on earth. (Albert K. Bender, FS and the Three Men, Saucerian, 1962)

* * *

March 17 — An FBI agent and two AFOSI officers interview [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922192268&usg=AOvVaw0-lxbHs2R0q9iJcqAx3ogE) and ask him to draft a statement saying that neither the FBI nor Air Force has approved material used in his speeches. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Mar-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922192515&usg=AOvVaw0QT951ElxCEfUz9RaINvQr) [1953, March–July](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Mar-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922192712&usg=AOvVaw1eFFfceAMMCYQDEU7w29gd)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Mar-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922192879&usg=AOvVaw36FUV8fjHwbS1ehNmAPkah) The Author, 1989, pp. 4–5; Clark III 44)

March 18 — Ohio Northern University’s Project A reports that UFOs are usually disc-shaped, silent, and fast-moving. “Our major conclusion to date is that no one explanation fits all sightings, and about 20% of all the sightings definitely fit the category of unnatural phenomena.” (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1953, March–July](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Mar-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922193224&usg=AOvVaw10XhhEz-QXpJmKfSe6Sma2)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Mar-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922193372&usg=AOvVaw2odejxsIbkKSfUx3airTup) The Author, 1989, pp. 15, 18)

March 22 — 2:00 a.m. Sara Shaw and Jan Whitley, who share an isolated one-bedroom cabin in the forest around Tujunga Canyon north of Burbank, California, wake up when an odd light shines through the window. An eerie silence falls over the cabin and neighboring forest. They get out of bed but feel paralyzed. Then suddenly and inexplicably, it is 4:20 a.m. Shaw, who was originally kneeling on the bed, is now sitting on it with her feet on the floor. The two women flee the cabin. As they run, they pass an apparition or “vaporous something” with the “head and shoulders of a long-haired” person. When they return to the cabin two days later, they feel a sense of dread. Shaw can remember nothing more and the two women move apart. In 1975 Shaw watches a UFO documentary that evokes some memories, and she contacts ufologist [Ann Druffel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://copycateffect.blogspot.com/2020/06/ufologist-ann-druffel-dies.html?fbclid%3DIwAR3N-uW1ZAkq5p21hxc11siol67dwjxfSq2vLaTl8v0pExaBh0OeTDuLTyc&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922193855&usg=AOvVaw3yr5pz4auGV8OdKoyiHnvo). During three hypnotic regression sessions—December 5, 1975; February 26, 1976; and October 22, 1978—Shaw recalls her abduction by black-garbed aliens. She undergoes a physical examination and the aliens show her a cure for cancer. (Ann Druffel and D. Scott Rogo, The Tujunga Canyon Contacts, Prentice-Hall, 1980, updated in New American Library, 1989)

March 23 — Gen. [Burgess](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49223590/woodbury-m-burgess&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922194237&usg=AOvVaw16q6MNepvw6vPx_bslmdx7)’s 4602nd AISS plan is approved. It is seen as aiding ATIC and giving AISS personnel valuable experience in field interrogations and cooperating with other agencies (Kevin D. Randle, The Government UFO Files, Visible Ink, 2014, p. 249)

March 24 — The Upshot-Knothole Nancy nuclear test at Nevada Test Site Area 4 sends radioactive fallout on livestock across the region, including those grazing at Papoose Lake, Nevada. Sixteen horses and numerous cows belonging to local farmers, the Stewart brothers, die from acute radiation poisoning. The Army compensates them for the horses, but claim the cows died from Vitamin A deficiency. (Wikipedia, “[Operation Upshot–Knothole](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Upshot%25E2%2580%2593Knothole&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922194620&usg=AOvVaw2_JLsasImpsZZXpdPyoCcP)”; Jacobsen, Area 51, [p. 102](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/102/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922194956&usg=AOvVaw3KzLJd57r_6e7M4mgEUueg))

Spring — After 12:00 noon. RAF Flight Lt. Cyril George Townsend-Withers is asked to test some new ECM radar equipment using an experimental English Electric Canberra aircraft. The jet has been stripped of all removable parts to make it as light as possible. With this modification, he is able to leave RAF Boscombe Down \[now MoD Boscombe Down\] in Wiltshire, England, and soar to 55,000 feet, then a record for the aircraft. Cruising over Salisbury Plain, Townsend-Withers picks up a blip on his screen. It shows an object traveling 5 miles behind him and maintaining a steady course. His immediate reaction is to curse the “anomalous propagation” effects that they have gone to so much trouble to avoid. However, he soon becomes aware that this was an image of something flying right behind them. The science officer goes up to the turret to take a look and sees, glinting in the sun or pouring out a fantastic amount of its own light, a round shape trailing in their wake. Townsend-Withers calls his pilot on the microphone and tells him that he can see an unknown and suggests trying to outpace it. They reach 260 mph but the thing cannot be shaken off, so the pilot executes a sweeping radius turn. As the Canberra comes around from its turn, the object comes into view dead ahead. For half a minute they are on a collision course, swiftly trying to calculate what to do next. The object is round like a thin disc, but with two small tailfins at the rear. It seems to be metallic and enormous, and it is simply sitting there waiting for them to fly right into it.

Suddenly, it flips vertically into the air and climbs upwards at an astonishing rate. Leaving no vapor trail, wake, or detectable sound, the object vanishes within just a couple of seconds. (NICAP, “[Canberra Crew Encounters UFO /](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530000salisburyplaindir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922195617&usg=AOvVaw15VL0iJtqT2_S3wSdv1YO5) [Radar/Visual](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530000salisburyplaindir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922195800&usg=AOvVaw2d_8KvGchIlaj3nNG3MVY-)”; Jenny Randles, “Collision Course,” IUR 27, no. 4 (Winter 2002–2003): 16–18; Jenny Randles, “Scramble, UFO! Part Three, The Team,” Fortean Times 388 (January 2020): 31)

April — [Wilbert B. Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922196228&usg=AOvVaw1PW8Qgotey_8TDa-8KVmsU) is drafting a report on Project Magnet for the Canadian Department of Transport. He writes [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922196486&usg=AOvVaw3S2qUlOoLbWrhinF0W3U2i) that their conclusion will probably be that UFOs are alien vehicles. (Clark III 1078)

April–June — The US Army Chemical Corps’ Dew II project involves the secret release of fluorescent particles (zinc cadmium sulfide) and plant spores (Lycopodium) from an aircraft over St. Louis, Missouri. (Minneapolis, Minnesota, was a previous target.) It only targets black ghetto sections of St. Louis and arranges for local police surveillance “to minimize the possibility of loss of equipment.” The Army reports “much less curiosity and interference” than Minneapolis. Dew II is described in a 1953 Army report that remains classified at the time of a 1997 report by the US National Research Council concerning the zinc cadmium sulfide dispersion program. (Leonard A. Cole, Clouds of Secrecy: The Army’s Germ Warfare Tests over Populated Areas, Rowman & Littlefield, 1988, [pp. 63–65](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/isbn_9780822630012/page/62/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922197437&usg=AOvVaw2j5iVYngHlL2RlIgQK5noo))

* * *

April 12 — 4:10 p.m. Ten round, flat, metallic objects changing formation are observed traveling at a high rate of speed at an estimated altitude of 7,500 feet over Sweetwater, Nevada. No trail, sound, or exhaust are noted. The objects pass under the right nacelle of the observers’ C-47 aircraft, which is en route to Stead AFB \[now Reno Stead Airport\]. The copilot takes control of the aircraft and turns to the right in a tight 300° turn for a better view. The objects are then picked up unassisted by two more members of the crew. The objects are seen in a right turn of a greater radius than that of the C-47 and at a lower altitude. They are observed for approximately 120° of their turn and disappear on a heading of 300°. Observers are unable to estimate the speed of the objects because of the distance and the large turn radius. (NICAP, “[Ten Round Flat Objects Changing Formation](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530412sweetwater_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922198087&usg=AOvVaw06tdKte6fC4umgDP9-GZMn)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922198286&usg=AOvVaw1aAdoVxCt0AJyKyvitYbm1), p. 197)

April 13 — The MKUltra project is launched on the order of CIA Director [Allen Dulles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allen_Dulles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922198528&usg=AOvVaw1V8r7Jg-q-t_0hjZUhVf97) and under the direction of [Sidney](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidney_Gottlieb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922198764&usg=AOvVaw1CSfKIADyKqa5z7jh_XXii) [Gottlieb](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidney_Gottlieb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922198988&usg=AOvVaw1MfFi_SNZeYmiDuSkxm9rY)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidney_Gottlieb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922199124&usg=AOvVaw3sYDWORfscVOl7GuVL5Ujk) Its aim is to develop mind-controlling drugs for use against the Soviet bloc, largely in response to alleged Soviet, Chinese, and North Korean use of mind-control techniques on US prisoners of war in Korea. The project attempts to produce a perfect truth drug for use in interrogating suspected Soviet spies, and generally to explore any other possibilities of mind control. Another MKUltra effort, Subproject 54, is the Navy’s top secret “Perfect Concussion” program, which uses subaural frequency blasts to erase memory. However, the program is never carried out. Because most MKUltra records are deliberately destroyed in 1973 by order of then–CIA director [Richard Helms](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Helms&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922199651&usg=AOvVaw0tMdem0R8bAUn4f-Mh_6qE)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Helms&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922199898&usg=AOvVaw1ukdoXMWhmJsWr7Muz4hOc) it is difficult, if not impossible, for investigators to gain a complete understanding of the more than 150 individually funded research subprojects sponsored by MKUltra and related CIA programs. A cache of some 20,000 documents survive Helms’s purge, as they are incorrectly stored in a financial-records building and discovered following a FOIA request in 1977. These documents are fully investigated during the Senate Hearings of 1977. (Wikipedia, “[Project MKUltnra](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_MKUltra&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922200393&usg=AOvVaw2xLqAivONfZb4MWFnjgT82)”; US Senate Select Committee on Intelligence, Project MKUltra, the CIA’s Program of Research in Behavioral Modification, 95th Congress, 1st Session, August 3, 1977; John D. Marks, [The Search for the “Manchurian Candidate”: The CIA and Mind Control](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/searchformanchur00john&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922201115&usg=AOvVaw0CfyZ9Z2nQEjMMfR2igokE), Times Books, 1978; Jon Ronson, [The Men Who Stare at Goats](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/menwhostareatgoa00rons_0/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922201521&usg=AOvVaw3cXvRrxbxn7wly3KwErP4C)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/menwhostareatgoa00rons_0/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922201785&usg=AOvVaw2Pu6ZYQZG-7OwDyqaP19Bg) Simon & Schuster, 2004; “[Project MK-Ultra: The CIA’s](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://zazenlife.com/2011/12/18/project-mk-ultra-the-c-i-as-experiments-with-mind-control/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922202325&usg=AOvVaw2Z6zjjL8cdlx6RQZ74XZut) [Experiments with Mind Control,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://zazenlife.com/2011/12/18/project-mk-ultra-the-c-i-as-experiments-with-mind-control/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922202704&usg=AOvVaw1CTpFAVVja-c8PHfC66Zw8)” ZazenLife.com, December 2011; Stephen Kinzer, Poisoner in Chief: Sidney Gottlieb and the CIA Search for Mind Control, Henry Holt, 2019)

April 14 — 9:23–11:50 p.m. A Navy P2V Neptune spy plane on an electronic intelligence (ELINT/ferret) mission over the Sea of Japan (about 200 miles southeast of Vladivostok, Russia) is paced and attacked by 10 agile and highly maneuverable UFOs. The encounter takes place with only 400 feet of distance between the aircraft and the sea. The objects make more than “70 aggressive non-firing passes” in “high-speed runs,” many just a few hundred feet directly underneath the Navy aircraft for just over an hour. The UFOs transmit Morse Code light signals (the letter “D”), an unprecedented occurrence in UFO history. The objects are tracked on radar and by the Navy’s ELINT systems (which pick up and analyze radar beams emitted from the objects) for almost two and a half hours. (NICAP, “[Two Lights Flashing Morse Code Letter ‘D’](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/CATEGORIES/10-Nuclear_Connection_Cases/530414sea_of_japan_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922203558&usg=AOvVaw0ctJMqT39WwPi1nJb5SQvS)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922203890&usg=AOvVaw3kt7j5RixlwFjW41E96jM5), p. 198; Clark III 53–59)

April 16 — 3:45 p.m. The crew of a commercial Maritime Central airliner flying at 9,000 feet above Chatham, New Brunswick, watches a metallic disc approach their plane and pass underneath. (Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, pp. 64–67)

April 19 — 1:00 p.m. Four US Army reconnaissance observers (including pilot Lt. Julius T. Morgan, Lt. [James O.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/149287981/james-ollen-rymus&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922204657&usg=AOvVaw1KdDhoipYXkzCZu2YFInsM) [Rymus](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/149287981/james-ollen-rymus&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922205011&usg=AOvVaw0RfCrPQdiW3yWeorUGzH-k)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/149287981/james-ollen-rymus&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922205287&usg=AOvVaw3ORrBBxeQhBcjWWr-BXY-3) and Lt. Jack E. Myers) in two aircraft see a white, rounded, delta-shaped object 5–7 feet in diameter flying at 60–80 mph with a “vibrating” motion over Communist territory in Korea. An official G-2 Intelligence Report says the object is in the Old Baldy (Hill 266) and Pork Chop Hill areas. Radar supposedly tracks them also moving faster than sound (>767 mph). (NICAP, \[[news clippings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/530419korea.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922205659&usg=AOvVaw3FxGkQupDgew0wa3JqYeEq)\]; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922206020&usg=AOvVaw3UQcrbc54Em8W9xS6LVFWN), p. 199; Jennie Zeidman, “I Remember Blue Book,” IUR 16, no. 2 (Mar./Apr. 1991): 9)

April 23 — Gen. [Charles P. Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922206599&usg=AOvVaw0dEC5rW4nOKGXgFM-6ZxPD) becomes deputy director of the CIA. ()

April 23 — 3:00 p.m. Two witnesses in Iberville \[now Saint-Jean-de-Richelieu\], Quebec, see a disc the size of a car approach their house while they are eating dinner. It stops 250 feet above the Richelieu River a bit more than a half-mile away. The man runs outside for a better look and sees that it as a dome and is spinning as it hovers. After 15 seconds it flies to the southwest and disappears. (Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, pp. 65, 68–69, 151)

May — A flawed CAA report states the July 1952 Washington National Airport radar returns were weather targets. (Civil Aviation Authority, [A Preliminary Study of Unidentified Targets Observed on Air Traffic Control](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufon.org/cufon/wash_nat/CAA_Radar_Study.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922207534&usg=AOvVaw0w11-usrCwVBwlfoa8JaX4), Technical Development Report 180, May 1953)

May — CIA Assistant Director [H. Marshall Chadwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922208027&usg=AOvVaw1MkUH6aEOA-gITcq0NTBlu) transfers chief responsibility for keeping abreast of UFOs to OSI’s Physics and Electronic Division. [Todos M. Odarenko](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47075734/todos-michael-odarenko&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922208435&usg=AOvVaw3Nxk9SbshCFSieCmNlf0Bz)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47075734/todos-michael-odarenko&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922208699&usg=AOvVaw1yK30pIjMefVrp5nDHYO33) chief of the division, does not want to take on the problem, saying it requires too much analytic and clerical time. Given the Robertson Panel findings, he proposes to call the project “inactive” and devote only one part-time analyst and a file clerk to maintain a reference file of activities of

* * *

USAF and other agencies on UFOs. (Gerald K. Haines, “[CIA’s Role in the Study of UFOs, 1947–90,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/DOC_0005517742.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922209351&usg=AOvVaw1UucU_ooew5VXCtKY2NzXb)” Studies in Intelligence, 1997, p. 72)

May — The Air Force publishes, under the signatures of Chief of Staff Gen. [Hoyt S. Vandenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Vandenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922209958&usg=AOvVaw2_hBbRrb8bbErMoh7VQNLV) and Air Adjutant General Col. [Kenneth E. Thiebaud](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/54677903/kenneth-e_-thiebaud&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922210348&usg=AOvVaw3MnVUVUxGE9_P63wDYZDOI), Air Force Manual 200-3, titled Handbook for Air Intelligence Officers. It is classified Restricted. Intended as a general guide for air intelligence officers conducting any type of investigation, the 6-page manual’s only illustration is of an Air Force plane accompanied by three flying saucers; the caption is “The Air Technical Intelligence center is responsible for the prevention of technological surprises.” It is discovered by [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922210804&usg=AOvVaw09q0VbMNSs8OVLAp8a42uN) in 1961 because someone forgot to reclassify the manual as Confidential in November 1953 when the Restricted classification is retired. (Department of the Air Force, Handbook for Air Intelligence Officers, Air Force Manual 200-3, May 1953, chapter 9, [pp. 9-1–9-6](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Documents/AFM_200-3.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922211350&usg=AOvVaw18G8dnFc6RpB16n1FfVeTQ); Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, [p. 80](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/80/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922211849&usg=AOvVaw3B8UhtYRdLdv58FV2X5z1m))

May 1 — 11:35 p.m. USAF pilot Capt. R. L. Emberry and radar operator 1Lt J. R. Morin are flying an F-94 interceptor at 24,000 feet about 10 miles south of Goose Bay AFB \[now CFB Goose Bay\], Labrador. Both men and a control tower operator see a white light with a visible afterburner at 10,000 feet. The F-94 pursues it, both climbing to 40,000 feet, but the object climbs out of sight after 30 minutes. (NICAP, “[Unidentified Evades Interception by F-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530501goose_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922212325&usg=AOvVaw08f5pz3eLbEiS6zyvg6GL3) [94](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530501goose_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922212632&usg=AOvVaw0Bhm0Vr9iJroaz2ETR3Gc5)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922212944&usg=AOvVaw01zSo0cEMum1ThsRQc8kmd)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922213181&usg=AOvVaw1Xtb3gijXAuVhSYqR1UmHc) p. 199; Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, p. 262)

May 2 — BOAC Flight 783, a de Havilland Comet 1, crashes in a severe thundersquall six minutes after taking off from Calcutta-Dum Dum \[now Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport\], India, killing all 43 on board.

Witnesses observe the wingless Comet on fire plunging into the village of Jagalgori. A British aviation investigator, J. H. Lett, announces that the plane “collided with a fairly heavy body” and UFO rumors persist for about a year. However, leading investigators suspect structural failure. (Wikipedia, “[de Havilland Comet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/De_Havilland_Comet%23Operational_history&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922214212&usg=AOvVaw1aGKwE8n-YFFT8ROTppvqR)”; Stringfield, Situation Red, Fawcett Crest, 1977, p, 141)

May 4 — 1:50 a.m. A witness sees a football-shaped, metallic object caught in the glare of a rotating beacon near Goose Bay AFB \[now CFB Goose Bay\], Labrador. It is traveling south at high speed and a low altitude, and disappears into low-hanging stratus clouds. She hears a sound “like tins striking together.” ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922215018&usg=AOvVaw2uYscGYZI21zg36qogZFR-)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922215242&usg=AOvVaw1yjWbD0JvFkr0AWRmnElFa) p. 199; Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, p. 262)

May 5 — 9:45 a.m. Chemist Wells Alan Webb is standing in a field near the Vacuum Cooling Company plant, not far from Spain Flying Field and about a mile north of Yuma AFB \[now Marine Corps Air Station Yuma\] near Yuma, Arizona, when he sees a fuzzy-white oblong object at an angle of 45° in the north. He observes it both with the naked eye and with Polaroid glasses with a greenish tint that he uses for cloud observations. It is about one-half the diameter of the full moon. After 5 minutes, the object moves to a position 30° eastward and suddenly becomes circular in appearance, becoming gradually smaller. Three concentric dark rings appear around the object, the largest about six times its diameter when viewed with Polaroid glasses. Webb thinks that the rings are the result of the rotation of polarized light scattered from the atmosphere (Faraday effect). (NICAP, “[Polaroid Glasses Expose](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530505yuma_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922216071&usg=AOvVaw3ylN4fz___UVYT4w0zC5Bt) [Concentric Circles around Disc](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530505yuma_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922216394&usg=AOvVaw0-OVcvX149xdH-JrSntqLb)”; Wells Alan Webb, Mars, the New Frontier: Lowell’s Hypothesis, Fearon, 1956, pp, 126–127; UFOEv, [p. 51](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D63%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922216928&usg=AOvVaw0VrPAFWLD-Cetw7ZowTcWW))

May 10 — 6:08 p.m. Capt. B. L. Jones is flying an Australian National Airways DC-3 just south of Mackay, Queensland.

He radios the local control tower that a “strange object like a lighted glass dome” is maneuvering around his plane. He and his copilot watch the object for about 5 minutes during which time it climbs and dives at a speed of 200–700 mph. Finally, it crosses the path of the aircraft and disappears swiftly to the west. A Mr. W. Overell, the officer in charge at Mackay tower, sees the light climbing from about 4,000–5,000 feet in the west at great speed, although the radar shows no other aircraft in the vicinity. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 52; Swords 377–378)

May 10 — 11:00 p.m. Capt. Bob Jackson is piloting an Australian National Airways DC-3 near Woronora Dam, New South Wales, when he sees an object with an orange-colored light at the tail flash past toward the east near Wollongong. The radar tower at Mascot shows no traffic in the area. About 2 minutes later, the object reappears, makes a complete circle around the airliner, and speeds away toward the coast. (Swords 378)

May 11 — A declassified MKUltra document indicates hypnosis is a major focus. Experimental goals include: the creation of “hypnotically induced anxieties,” “hypnotically increasing ability to learn and recall complex written matter,” studying hypnosis and polygraph examinations, “hypnotically increasing ability to observe and recall complex arrangements of physical objects,” and studying "relationship of personality to susceptibility to hypnosis.” Experiments are conducted with drug-induced hypnosis and with anterograde and retrograde amnesia while under the influence of such drugs. (Wikipedia, “[Project MKUltra](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_MKUltra%23Hypnosis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922218061&usg=AOvVaw2GBJ0uvBqnBjSXpEpQIRKk)”)

May 12 — 3:20 a.m. USAF F-94 pilot Lt. D. C. Rogers and radar operator Lt. J. A. Lane track a radar target about 39 miles northwest of Goose Bay AFB \[now CFB Goose Bay\], Labrador. Rogers attempts to intercept but cannot

* * *

make visual contact. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922218849&usg=AOvVaw0HUMrcyOPXRAwi9IPUxqHA)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922219074&usg=AOvVaw3oheluF6fyIli5sJIiW7hN) p. 199; Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, p. 262)

May 16 — 8:15 p.m. Photographer Herman Charmanne is near Bouffioulx, Belgium, when he hears a strange metallic vibration. Looking up, he sees a long white trail in the wake of an object that shoots off at a great speed. The object, a luminous sphere, stops and hovers, allowing him to take two photos that depict a fried-egg-looking shape with a long tail. Recent analyses indicate that the photos are likely the result of a chemical reaction during the developing process, perhaps a flammable fluid deliberately poured on the image carrier that is then ignited. (Vicente-Juan Ballester Olmos and Wim van Utrecht, [Belgium in UFO Photographs, Volume 1 (1950–1988)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.academia.edu/35133835/BELGIUM_IN_UFO_PHOTOGRAPHS_Volume_1_1950_1988_&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922219874&usg=AOvVaw0a5vMcE55Btm-Q2ukDfcW_)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.academia.edu/35133835/BELGIUM_IN_UFO_PHOTOGRAPHS_Volume_1_1950_1988_&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922220205&usg=AOvVaw1IRaC7IQLxZJBp_oi-1zb-) FOTOCAT Report no. 7, 2017, pp. 12–30)

May 18 — 6:55 p.m. A bright, luminous object is seen over Abadan, Iran. It travels very fast and is visible for 20 minutes.

It is also seen over oil fields in Khuzestan Province. (ClearIntent, [pp. 129–130](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/128/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922220889&usg=AOvVaw0EQH5IDr3wh7FZGXLAJjep))

May 20 — At the junction of Jordan and Marble Creeks in Plumas National Forest, northern California, titanium prospector John Q. Black sees a silvery object, 8 feet in diameter, land on a nearby sand bar. On June 20 the saucer returns, along with a barrel-chested “midget pilot” wearing a “forest-green outfit” and a “peak-billed cap with a cord” around it. The UFO is about 40 feet away, resting on a rock, and has tripod-like landing gear. The pilot fills a rubber-like pail with creek water and goes back inside the craft (which has one small window) after hearing Black step on a stick. The craft takes off at a 45° angle with a hissing sound. Black had seen the same object on March 20, for a total of seven times. Black is alone for each sighting, so his partner John Van Allen cannot corroborate the story. The UFO’s expected return on July 20 does not occur, perhaps because scores of sightseers descend on the Brush Creek area (snack bars are set up so that no one goes hungry during the vigil). (Wallace Kunkel, “The Little Man Who Wasn’t There,” Fate 7, no. 5 (May 1954): 48–52; Clark III 269; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1953-05-20-usa-brushcreek.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922221693&usg=AOvVaw1goQTErG385hlV8qPU1vx4)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1953-05-20-usa-brushcreek.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922222002&usg=AOvVaw24_K4slpOXGdD4GLdqd6bY) December 15, 2006; Curt Collins, “[Flying Saucer Ambush: Brush Creek, CA, 1953,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2017/11/flying-saucer-ambush-brush-creek-ca-1953.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922222434&usg=AOvVaw0Xz2F9PHfdna_ojBi7AeOb)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, November 17, 2017)

May 21 — 10:00 a.m. Eight disc-like objects are observed maneuvering in the sky for an hour or so above Prescott, Arizona, by sportsmen’s club president Bill Beers, post office employee Ray Temple, and O. Ed Olson. Two of the discs are stationary, while the other six discs participate in maneuvers similar to a dogfight. The six swoop around in formation, peel off, and shoot directly up and down in a maneuver that cannot be duplicated by a plane. When they move, they vary from very slow to speeds faster than a jet plane. (Prescott (Ariz.) Evening Courier, May 22, 1953; Nukes 87)

May 21 — Date of alleged UFO crash and retrieval near Kingman, Arizona. “Fritz Werner” \[pseudonym of [Arthur G.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/16956670/arthur-g-stansel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922223267&usg=AOvVaw3tqQBYOso8k95UxJcETDqQ) [Stansel Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/16956670/arthur-g-stansel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922223590&usg=AOvVaw1lPUaRJ0iqxPt7jUNmXuTV)\] claims to have worked on the retrieval. An informant in 1977 tells [Leonard Stringield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922223975&usg=AOvVaw1mql-NlV-Tc7j1bp-qc2G-) that he had seen three alien bodies in a crate at Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio after a UFO crash in Arizona. (Leonard H. Stringfield, “[Retrievals of the Third Kind: Part 2,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201979%2520V%252025%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922224424&usg=AOvVaw0E63bAraumqcS4dC8EqgO2)” Flying Saucer Review 25, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1979): 6–7; Stringfield, Situation Red, Fawcett Crest, 1977, pp. 171–185; Clark III 335–338; Kevin D. Randle, A History of UFO Crashes, Avon, 1995, [pp. 57–68](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/historyofufocras0000rand/page/56/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922225184&usg=AOvVaw2s1QJRg8N8o6NNnPwyWx6O); Good Above, [pp. 398–400](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/398/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922225468&usg=AOvVaw19Glg6Ew1XzXcRia7o6lOc))

May 23 — Radar tracks a target over Cape Province, South Africa, that makes six passes at more than 1,250 mph at 5,000–15,000 feet altitude. (Aimé Michel, The Truth about FS, p. 123; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23radar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922226049&usg=AOvVaw3t16Pxx6_ZEYhDZg5M_ou6) [Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23radar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922226368&usg=AOvVaw0zUrR8gcGJJ9EKIXgIOKx9)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 70–71)

May 26 — 5:10 a.m. D. Beyers, driving 80 miles south of Brandvlei in Northern Cape Province, South Africa, sees a bright yellowish-green light in the clouds, then emerges. The light has the appearance of “burning hydrogen” and emits three streaks that maintain a fixed position with regard to the main light. He watches it for 50 minutes. (ClearIntent, [p. 130](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/130/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922227035&usg=AOvVaw0MF2E_fh330yyl0Qwfiiph))

May 30 — After a small, bright-blue object with a strange irregular motion passes overhead at Palmerston North, New Zealand, numerous filaments of a “substance resembling spider webs, white in color and ashy in texture” float to earth. (“[Palmerston North, New Zealand,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201953%252009%252015%2520-%2520Vol%25202%2520No%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922227606&usg=AOvVaw310KKD1pg1JHxGnPA7vzKk)” APRO Bulletin 2, no. 2 (September 15, 1953): 8; Clark III 124)

May 31 — Project Blue Book issues its Status Report #11. (US Air Force, [Projects Grudge and Blue Book Reports 1–12,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922228350&usg=AOvVaw1rcXnnL6n0Q81ez_JVH1qk)

NICAP, 1968, pp. 199–214)

Summer —Two F-94 jets are scrambled at Ernest Harmon Air Force Base \[now Stephenville International Airport\], near Stephenville, Newfoundland, after base radar picks up an unknown target. One of the pilots gets radar and visual confirmation, then radios that he is going into a steep climb to give chase. The jet crashes into a mountain. The base is supposedly placed on red alert. (Stringfield, Situation Red, Fawcett Crest, 1977, p. 142)

Summer — 10:00 p.m. A family is returning home on Scenic Avenue in Central Point, Oregon, when they see three entities along the side of the road only 6 feet away. They stop the car, and the beings glide across the road and

* * *

disappear into the woods. They are 4 feet high, white, with satiny fur, and resemble very large geese, but with no beaks or wings. (“[No UFO Seen: Just Creatures,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1984-85_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922229678&usg=AOvVaw1wyyqCVdr0hIsd2PbBqV3a)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 5, no. 2 (April/May 1984): 3)

June — Night. An F-94C Starfire with classified electronic gear takes off from Otis AFB \[now Otis Air National Guard Base\] in western Cape Cod, Massachusetts. Piloted by Capt. Suggs and radar operator Lt. Robert Markhoff, the jet takes off in a westerly direction. Shortly after attaining 1,500 feet over the Base Rifle Range, the engine quits functioning and the electrical system fails. The jet’s nose drops and Suggs signals Barkhoff to bail out. Suggs bails out and he and his parachute wind up in a homeowner’s backyard. The jet should have crashed nearby, but neither Markhoff or the airplane can be located, despite months of searching. Although this account comes from M/Sgt [Clarence O. Dargie](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/183719276/clarence-oscar-dargie&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922230432&usg=AOvVaw10o1u5obh84CZeQQdOmQo2)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/183719276/clarence-oscar-dargie&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922230717&usg=AOvVaw2KZE1e4ezNtPINBaj4oFyJ) and investigator [Raymond Fowler](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_E._Fowler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922231066&usg=AOvVaw337bplNd5bcDxmP2hBm9XN) obtains the accident report from Norton AFB \[now San Bernardino International Airport\], California, there appears to be no open record of this incident. The F-94C models, especially at first, have fire-control problems and electrical short circuiting. (Raymond Fowler, UFOs: Interplanetary Visitors, Prentice-Hall, 1974, pp. 287–291; Good Need, [pp. 189–191](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/188/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922231603&usg=AOvVaw2_5MrLnjfAU4JbdF1NG-S1); Bob Pratt, “[Conversations](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://documents.theblackvault.com/documents/MUFON/Pratt/DonaldKeyhoe.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922231978&usg=AOvVaw1A_i_jAflD5aiB5Lf4SibJ) [with Major Donald Keyhoe,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://documents.theblackvault.com/documents/MUFON/Pratt/DonaldKeyhoe.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922232329&usg=AOvVaw39CZDJ8dafZh6M7Vs3rlWg)” Mutual UFO Network; Barry Greenwood, “[Questions on a 1953 Cape Cod](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr08.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922232627&usg=AOvVaw0DxJFDF-rmr1rOvTjeqDDK) [Mystery,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr08.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922232940&usg=AOvVaw07KnO212_rpaT5gkTBaKgR)” UFO Historical Revue, no. 8 (February 2001): 1–3)

June — Secretary of Defense [Charles Erwin Wilson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Erwin_Wilson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922233533&usg=AOvVaw2GLSfRFsakuCoWA5uEPYhl) abolishes the Research and Development Board for the politically motivated reason that suspected communist sympathizer [Robert Oppenheimer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Robert_Oppenheimer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922233934&usg=AOvVaw2bEJSI8We4Gz8_tdRxmbxp) is a sitting member. (Michael Hall and Wendy Connors, “The Research and Development Board: Unanswered Questions,” IUR 26, no. 2 (Summer 2001): 9)

June — Lt. Robert M. Olsson and [J. Allen Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922234607&usg=AOvVaw0AozrijByua3_-2eS-Yeyt) visit [Coral Lorenzen](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://robert-barrow.blogspot.com/2007/05/remembering-coral-lorenzen.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922235055&usg=AOvVaw3pydrZWKvBZYvXrql0bl6h) in Wisconsin and try to convince her that it is in the national interest for her to reduce excitement about UFOs by publishing cases. (Swords 197; Lorenzen, FS Hoax, [pp. 82–83](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/1966CoralLorenzenFlyingSaucersTheStartlingEvidenceOfTheInvasionFromOuterSpacenotOCR/page/n79/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922235538&usg=AOvVaw3Dshj93QfN4yIE6eOdGHpR))

June — [Max B. Miller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Max_B._Miller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922235898&usg=AOvVaw2T2v9grshVOho7vjXkGcWI) publishes the first issue of Saucers, a digest-sized quarterly of Flying Saucers International in Los Angeles, California. It continues until the Fall 1959 issue. ([Saucers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Saucers%2520(Max%2520B%2520Miller)/Saucers%2520vol%25201%2520no%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922236306&usg=AOvVaw1LnFhRKtxXCVX9ik9z8FTE) 1, no. 1 (1953); Clark III 1033)

June 9 — [Sidney Gottlieb](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidney_Gottlieb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922236730&usg=AOvVaw20AlOKOwRXCw4gqsIyWzdY) approves Project MKUltra’s “Subproject 8” on LSD. Experiments include administering LSD to mental patients, prisoners, drug addicts, and prostitutes—“people who could not fight back,” as one agency officer puts it. ()

June 17 — 7:30 a.m. Several witnesses in Galveston, Texas, see a large, cigar-shaped object silently flying in from the Gulf of Mexico. One estimates it to be about 300 feet long and no greater than 150 feet in the air. The object makes a cloud and disappears. (Herbert S. Taylor, “Mystery Clouds and the UFO Connection,” IUR 29, no. 4 (July 2005): 19)

June 24 — 11:30 a.m. A weather observer stationed at remote Simiutaq island, western Greenland, is tracking a weather balloon with a theodolite. He notices a rotating red object flying from southeast to northwest and approaching the balloon, which is at 18,000 feet. The object collides with the balloon, disintegrating it. Afterward, it hovers in a circular motion for 15 seconds and departs into the wind. He watches it another 5 minutes until it is lost to view. (Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, pp. 69–70)

June 24 — Night. A flight of US Navy F2H Banshee jets out of NAS Quonset Point \[now Quonset Point Air National Guard Station\] are on a night training mission over southern Rhode Island when two aircraft in the formation collide in mid-air. The crash occurs at 19,000 feet near or over the Exeter/West Greenwich town lines, and debris is scattered for several miles in all directions. The pilot of one Banshee, Lt. Jg. [Jack Oliver Snipes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/142209158/jack-oliver-snipes&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922238100&usg=AOvVaw3n60rspa-NNvSy6RQflOkN), is killed. An emergency cable sent to the Director of Air Force Intelligence in the Pentagon indicates that “flying objects” are seen by the pilots prior to the accident. Its distribution list includes the fledgling National Security

Agency. (“[Exeter/West Greenwich, Rhode Island: June 24, 1953,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://newenglandaviationhistory.com/exeterwest-greenwich-r-i-june-24-1953/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922238605&usg=AOvVaw3EvSDacIm-UF3FmSLNON4Z)” New England Aviation History, October 2017; Good Above, [pp. 272–273](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/272/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922238977&usg=AOvVaw3KBsL2BAlXhj0eEiWPrSnv)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/272/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922239234&usg=AOvVaw0Tepw5xB3nUr7KnBrqb7Nf) [488](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/488/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922239582&usg=AOvVaw2noZAMKutnpmQsYwrefwyg))

June 30 — 11:45 p.m. An orange-colored, oval object is seen for a period of 20 minutes in the northern sky moving to the southeast by at least 10 personnel of the US 912th Air Control and Warning Squadron stationed at Ramore Air Station radar site \[now CFS Ramore\], 3 miles west of Ramore, Ontario. The first person to see it is A/2c Dean McDonald who comes out of the maintenance room to inspect a power unit that has caused a minor breakdown of the search radar set. He calls two other airmen to witness it. One of the two thinks the object is the moon. The first airman gets hysterical and calls the Charge of Quarters at the Domestic Area three miles to the southwest. At least seven witnesses in that area see the object, and two of them report that the moon is visible and the UFO is distinct and separate. The object soon fades away slowly to the north. (\[[Project Blue Book file](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/1953-06-6385545-Ramore-Ontario-Canada/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922240310&usg=AOvVaw3PbYhRkrysuFou6vEBgQLB)\])

July — The 4602nd AISS has taken over nearly all of Blue Book’s field investigations. (Ruppelt, [p. 232](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/232/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922240884&usg=AOvVaw38I4U3ZHIUwIvnldyY5SM3)) ()

July — Lt. Robert M. Olsson of Project Blue Book sends five supposedly unsolved UFO cases of 1953 to Cal Tech physicist [Howard P. Robertson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_P._Robertson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922241321&usg=AOvVaw317yYk8Cco2AZEqwRE2Wy6) in an effort to see if any change in the Robertson Panel’s conclusions is warranted. One of them is the Sea of Japan ELINT case of April 14. Apparently, Robertson’s mind is not changed. He is now

* * *

heading up the Robertson Committee of the newly formed National Security Agency, tasked with developing better use of intercepted communications and radars in order to provide strategic warning of a military attack by the Soviet Union. (Clark III 55)

July 1 — 1:00 p.m. A cowherd, Maximo Munoz Olivares \[or Hernáiz\], 14, sees a “big balloon” on the ground behind him in Villares del Saz, Cuenca, Spain, after a faint whistling attracts his attention. Shaped like a water jug, the object is metallic. Through an opening come three dwarfs 2 feet tall, with yellow faces, narrow eyes, and oriental features.

They speak in a language he cannot understand. They are dressed in blue and have a sort of flat hat with a visor in front and a metal sheet on their arms. One of them smacks the boy’s face, then they reenter the machine, which glows very brightly, makes a soft whistling sound, and goes off “like a rocket.” Footprints and four holes 2 inches deep, forming a perfect square 13 inches in size, are found by police. Possible hoax. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Mar-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922242262&usg=AOvVaw2MGkd_avjRXXnHlHQhtKDl) [History: 1953, March–July](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Mar-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922242548&usg=AOvVaw0erqAwS9VPJo3VGajP2MLn)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Mar-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922242741&usg=AOvVaw38fAwxiDQMrIqaWt6kTGuZ) The Author, 1989, pp. 92–93; Antonio Ribera, “[The Landing at Villares del Saz,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR-SI%25201966%2520N%25201%252CThe%2520Humanoids.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922243169&usg=AOvVaw3U59SJw-X8yRpGlkrZLd6b)” in Charles Bowen, ed., The Humanoids, special issue of FSR, Oct./Dec. 1966, pp. 28–30; Clark III 270)

July 7 — Evening. An Atlanta, Georgia, barber named Edward Watters buys a monkey from a pet shop, shaves and kills it, cuts off its tail, then takes it with two friends, Tom Wilson and Arnold Payne, to US Highway 78 near Leland, Georgia, and waits for the first car to stop. They tell the driver, who turns out to be Cobb County policeman [Sherley Brown](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/187468612/sherley-eugene-brown&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922243998&usg=AOvVaw09C0uthiED4qfDdXy7pSkb)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/187468612/sherley-eugene-brown&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922244276&usg=AOvVaw1ozAHAt82WQeWWxWMkPFOD) that they had seen a flying saucer and accidentally killed one of its occupants. They bring the dead animal to the Atlanta Constitution office, where reporter Thomas McRae notifies the FBI, which alerts the Air Force at Dobbins AFB \[now Dobbins Air Reserve Base\] in Marietta. The animal is taken to Emory University Hospital in Atlanta, where Anatomy Professor Marion Hines identifies it properly as a shaved Capuchin monkey. Watters admits the hoax and is fined $40 by a judge. (Wikipedia, “[Martian Monkey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martian_Monkey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922244714&usg=AOvVaw0eQXP6pDJmTKEvBI_XhRLv)”; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Mar-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922245030&usg=AOvVaw2C0YzIi93yV8kjZ_akDGOq) [History: 1953, March–July](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Mar-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922245299&usg=AOvVaw0tQZnBD4eN-rqGi8PYts_Z)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Mar-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922245467&usg=AOvVaw1nn1Vr9ujfyfg4lY9b5zoL) The Author, 1989, pp. 96–102; Clark III 593)

July 16 — Lt. Col. William F. Barns attains an official world airspeed record of 716 mph in a North American F-86D Sabre over the Salton Sea, California. (Wikipedia, “[North American F-86D Sabre](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_American_F-86D_Sabre&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922245839&usg=AOvVaw1qi6LXn8NzaFRs0yh-sP-0)”; “[16 July 1953,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.thisdayinaviation.com/tag/william-f-barns/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922246037&usg=AOvVaw1oikTYNwD3e50AHqOMy50V)” This Day in Aviation History, July 16, 2021)

July 19 — 3:00 p.m. After an F-86 has been circling over a particular spot in Oak Ridge, Tennessee, a black object emerges from a high white cloud and takes up its position after the plane has left toward Knoxville. “This object was extremely black in color, having an appearance of a deep black metal exterior with a fine gloss. It did not leave a vapor trail or were there any lights of shine noticed. No sound was heard. The object flew east at a tremendous speed for what appeared to be approximately three miles where it stopped. The object was then joined by two more of these same objects. A formation similar to a spread V was formed and the objects, at a tremendous speed flew in an eastward direction.” The report is made by the Atomic Energy Commission and addressed to Army Adjutant General [William Edward Bergin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Edward_Bergin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922246449&usg=AOvVaw2oWN6I3dpizYmLoGAcbZOd) in Washington, D.C. (NICAP, “[Black Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530719oakridge_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922246684&usg=AOvVaw32VpeF-mltPfhZsqFDaI5L) [Maneuver over Area nr F-86](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530719oakridge_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922246940&usg=AOvVaw16bdRBlJg0I7nBhwsREpY8)”; “[Air Space Violation at Oak Ridge, Tennessee,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/army_docs/army530719.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922247140&usg=AOvVaw2_kOsB7ZBfTNTopSN6AoUz)” July 27, 1953)

July 20 — [Ed Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922247553&usg=AOvVaw1QB2LpHO8xoYJi2KaI_1_L) returns to Project Blue Book as either acting chief or consultant until August 31. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922247803&usg=AOvVaw2J34eeBLjlaMVlTCJ-5k20)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922248003&usg=AOvVaw1FiCmIllE7al_tantx7Uwq) p. 14; Clark III 55)

July 25 — ATIC guide, How to Make FLYOBRPTS, a 68-page manual for officials required to make UFO reports, is published. (Air Technical Intelligence Center, [How to Make FLYOBRPTS,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/FLYOBRPT.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922248356&usg=AOvVaw0JVDmBRoKRKKzJMzn4Er7b) July 26, 1953)

July 26 — 9:39 p.m. At Perrin AFB \[now North Texas Regional Airport\] in Sherman, Texas, ground observers see 7 UFOs, each carrying a bright red light, hovering at 5,000–8,000 feet. They are in a formation of two groups of three, and one trailing, then come together to form the letter “Z.” Then they circle, gain altitude, and fade from sight. Citizens in Sherman and Denison also see the objects. Total duration is 16 minutes. This is classified as a “Vital Intelligence Sighting” and sent to the Air Defense Command, the Secretary of Defense, and the CIA. ([CIRVIS Report](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/foia85.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922248883&usg=AOvVaw2GHMgitO9KIIzx-1ijwKsr)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/foia85.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922249104&usg=AOvVaw32zNmAuXPFqbLTYrQA2HYI) July 26, 1953)

July 30 — Science journalist [John Joseph O’Neill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Joseph_O%2527Neill_(journalist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922249539&usg=AOvVaw2h_6oR_jBBCgw1Ybs4U0Im) observes through a telescope a feature on the western edge of the lunar Mare Crisium that he interprets as a giant natural bridge. The observation is prematurely confirmed by amateur Welsh astronomer [Hugh Percy Wilkins](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_Percy_Wilkins&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922249846&usg=AOvVaw1ZfVn-5hqfYwBnN1zGKqDl)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_Percy_Wilkins&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922250051&usg=AOvVaw3frFDQK1oTGN3mXawXV2xD) Although it turns out to be an illusion, the location is still known as O’Neill’s bridge. When viewing conditions are poor or the telescope’s aperture is small, the feature resembles a bridge joining the tips of the capes Promontorium Lavinium and Promontorium Olivium. If viewing conditions are good and the instrument is large enough, the feature is seen as two small, eroded crater pits. (The Moon Wiki, “[O’Neill’s Bridge](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://the-moon.us/wiki/O%2527Neill%2527s_Bridge&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922250381&usg=AOvVaw2K41yqyxjLwOZXgepLGfS0)”; Andrew May, “The Lost Ruins of the Moon,” Fortean Times 358 (October 2017): 56–57)

July 30–August 1 — A large UFO is seen for three nights over Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks in California.

Park Superintendent [Elvind T. Scoyen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nps.gov/parkhistory/online_books/cabr2/adhip1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922250892&usg=AOvVaw29HnX6COaaMj4KaIoypBXv) and his staff observe it once at close range. On August 1, a squadron of Air Force fighters sees the object streaking downward just before midnight. It stops abruptly then shoots upward. (Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, [pp. 40–41](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/40/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922251361&usg=AOvVaw0gm24ZiOcHUsQCueNqF_CL))

* * *

July 31 — Lt. Robert Olsson leaves Project Blue Book. He later tells [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922251924&usg=AOvVaw27r6RpGZy-UPnW6spGL1pS) his 5-month tenure “was like being president of Antarctica on a nonexpedition year.” He is replaced by Airman 1C Max G. Futch. (Ruppelt, [p. 228](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/228/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922252333&usg=AOvVaw07LUAkx1O7h27n6Ro9Kro4); Clark III 55; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922252569&usg=AOvVaw1z8hFRKJfnkY7H17bPtg9V), p. 14)

July 31 — 7:00 p.m. Five Poles and two Germans see a disc-shaped object about 16 feet in diameter land in a field near a railroad track on Wolin Island, Poland. After several minutes it rises up and flies away at great speed. (Bronislaw Rzepecki, “UFOs and Ufologists in Poland,” IUR 11, no. 2 (Mar./Apr. 1986): 15; Vallée, Magonia, [p. 203](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/passporttomagoni0000vall/page/202/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922253170&usg=AOvVaw3zY1tOLTm-m32Vb6b_hVIQ))

August — [Wilbert B. Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922253550&usg=AOvVaw3ZIYgGNnIrdFKXF-Ky_fna) completes his classified report on Project Magnet for the Canadian Department of Transport, writing that it can be deduced that UFOs are 100 or more feet in diameter, they can travel at speeds of several thousand miles per hour, and can reach high altitudes. “It is difficult to reconcile this performance with the capabilities of our technology \[and\] we are forced to the conclusion that the vehicles are probably extraterrestrial, in spite of our prejudices to the contrary.” The DOT agrees to his proposal to set up an electronic station for a “24-hour watch for flying saucers” in a hut at Shirley’s Bay, off Lake Manitou, Ontario. Equipment includes am ionospheric reactor, electronic sound measurement devices, gamma-ray detector, gravimeter, magnetometer, and radio set. (Clark III 1078–1079)

August 1 — The US Air Force Security Service moves its headquarters from Brooks Air Force Base \[now closed\] to Kelly Air Force Base \[now Kelly Field Annex\], both in San Antonio, Texas. (Wikipedia, “[Air Force Intelligence,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_Force_Intelligence%252C_Surveillance_and_Reconnaissance_Agency&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922254193&usg=AOvVaw1jtMZ3plp3HuTcEdHP5u-M) [Surveillance, and Reconnaissance Agency](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_Force_Intelligence%252C_Surveillance_and_Reconnaissance_Agency&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922254514&usg=AOvVaw0wHzCt4nbk0YhNjDQmslZi)”)

August 5–6 — Around 8:00 p.m. Ground Observer Corps observer Phyllis Killian spots a UFO in Black Hawk, South Dakota. Soon after, radar at Ellsworth AFB near Rapid City tracks a “well-defined, solid, and bright” object. The base scrambles an F-84 and the pilot sees the UFO. Many witnesses see the object accelerate and climb. The F-84 pursues but can reach no closer than 3 miles. Now low on fuel, the F-84 returns, followed by the UFO. Immediately, another F-84 is sent up. Before long, the pilot receives strong radar returns of a target right in front of him. Fear prevails and he breaks off the chase. The UFO goes off the scope, traveling northeast. Reports soon come from Brunswick of a fast-moving, bright blue object, similar to the Rapid City object. It hovers near an air filter center, performing more maneuvers and disappearing after midnight. Before it leaves, three more UFOs are seen at 10,000 feet for three hours. [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922254969&usg=AOvVaw2delWTo8AIna8BZfeN8KKb) personally investigates and calls it “the best” in the USAF files, [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922255209&usg=AOvVaw3npsQT4n0JeCYetjFsNkz3) writes that the “entire incident…has too much of an Alice-in-Wonderland flavor for comfort.” [Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922255506&usg=AOvVaw08RkjISRiqcpI0pCfSpmXZ) blames the star Capella. The official file is several hundred pages long. (NICAP, “[The Rapid City / Ellsworth](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530805ellsworth_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922255757&usg=AOvVaw0XHnfEhojx76x0hbVY77gI) [AFB Incident (RV)](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530805ellsworth_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922255973&usg=AOvVaw3sufWz_RhcMBOwt3VvsG9V)”; Condon, [pp. 132–136](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/132/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922256194&usg=AOvVaw1VjgEA4ClL0sOfXdm62KfM); Ruppelt, [pp. 232–235](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/232/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922256478&usg=AOvVaw3RjiLi_RFmgLPlgBU99fhc); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922256658&usg=AOvVaw1FKcNLGfEkIWGtpCU0Katy)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922256808&usg=AOvVaw1HskBP7sNJ-3xk7mmEVAoF) p. 203; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922257037&usg=AOvVaw3bNkpsBatPVKUdbZkwFLId) [History: 1953, August–December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922257353&usg=AOvVaw0Hwx9SV0Z83uemw-6WC6ae), The Author, 1990, pp. 2–3; Swords 215; Jan Aldrich; Patrick Gross, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/ellsworth53.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922257728&usg=AOvVaw2ag-b51YAol8BGMLYtoU7-) [Ellsworth AFB Radar Multiple Visual Case, 1953](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/ellsworth53.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922257964&usg=AOvVaw3He1Eaju6XgqFbeB-z4EXV)”)

August 6 — 5:00 p.m.–12:00 midnight. An estimated 75 objects with lights are seen by many witnesses on the ground around Naval Air Station Barbers Point \[now Kalaeloa Airport\], Hawaii, from the airport control tower and from the air. Many are also detected by radar. At 9:00 p.m., the crew of a Navy patrol aircraft reports three head-on passes. These close calls alarm the pilot so much he lands immediately. Jet fighters are scrambled and the same night an interceptor pilot sees a “glowing blob” rising rapidly toward him. It comes to a sudden stop just behind his aircraft then accelerates briefly until it is beside him for four more seconds before accelerating away out of sight at several times his own top speed. (Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922258327&usg=AOvVaw2y3Hj05AjeOWZn7CdpIEX6), p. 63; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1953,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922258557&usg=AOvVaw3y7S6Ho8vlVqYv_mXLR1AX) [August–December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922258763&usg=AOvVaw0rPtmU_97COp8rt8rNlsTC)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922258944&usg=AOvVaw01da_D6ktMkLUyynSJ2oB_) The Author, 1990, p. 30)

August 9 — 9:34 p.m. Supervisor Larry E. Towner and other Ground Observer Corps personnel report a glowing disc about 200 feet in diameter over Moscow, Idaho. At 10:10 p.m., the first of two F-86s is scrambled. The object lingers, with other lights seen, until around 5:00 a.m. (NICAP, “[Three F-86’s Chase Disc Spotted by GOC](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530809moscow_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922259296&usg=AOvVaw29HOkyssfWhjPWu3kNEAOE)”; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1953, August–December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922259509&usg=AOvVaw2JGtNhpNQK5UaKl98OCLwP)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922259675&usg=AOvVaw1hCGeL1k-_1xAovI8Z_Sjh) The Author, 1990, pp. 3–4)

August 10 — [Wilbert B. Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922260173&usg=AOvVaw1UVPZHWWB6natKRzfzx1zX) issues another report on Project Magnet, in which he concludes there is a “substantial probability of the real existence of extraterrestrial vehicles” that use a “technology considerably in advance of what we have.” The report is eventually sent to Prime Minister [Louis St. Laurent](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_St._Laurent&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922260543&usg=AOvVaw1KYN0s44nuaB8OYkLRR-rL). (Good Above, [pp. 185](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/184/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922260799&usg=AOvVaw13_5S5KeXDcnLzc3GvjBCU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/184/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922260995&usg=AOvVaw1VPJKBYLbwauzQuEuDYAM3) [187](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/186/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922261219&usg=AOvVaw313lVFxmzb3fS3UhwtS4Fb))

August 12 — The USSR tests its first thermonuclear device, RDS-6s or Joe 4, at the Semipalatinsk Test Site in Kazakhstan. A tenfold increase in explosive power is achieved by a combination of fusion energy and neutron- initiated fission. Scholars dispute the authenticity of RDS-6 as a true thermonuclear device, as it does not manage to produce a yield consistent with a true hydrogen bomb. (Wikipedia, “[Joe 4](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_4&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922261582&usg=AOvVaw00m--v65OwRzuE3dDNvSwN)”)

August 13 — Paramount Pictures’ The War of the Worlds premieres in New York City. It is a modern retelling of [H. G.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H._G._Wells&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922262068&usg=AOvVaw14y22L-T2-QWcnvZTixY5S) [Wells](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H._G._Wells&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922262314&usg=AOvVaw3uA81TRgEBdwt3xyDzmQBB)’s story of an invasion from Mars and features a Northrop YB-49 flying wing dropping an atomic bomb on the invading Martians. The color footage comes from a test flight. The film is produced by [George Pal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Pal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922262606&usg=AOvVaw0SeBqF-4y0geljq3mN3jQb), directed by [Byron Haskin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byron_Haskin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922262880&usg=AOvVaw32dIDemug2SmYl1RFl1H04)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byron_Haskin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922263025&usg=AOvVaw382kgzyi1iStygdOhJEXqA) and stars [Gene Barry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene_Barry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922263258&usg=AOvVaw0Za0sjCWRdeCxyoAFgHTbl) and [Ann Robinson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ann_Robinson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922263535&usg=AOvVaw3C97rFsk_mbLvng1nArhXk)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ann_Robinson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922263706&usg=AOvVaw0QA39GlONhSvHwxVz9u7kE) (Wikipedia, “[The War of the Worlds](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_War_of_the_Worlds_(1953_film)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922263992&usg=AOvVaw1W9QRdkG9MMvInLIgACgUG) [(1953 film)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_War_of_the_Worlds_(1953_film)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922264184&usg=AOvVaw3p8TFEdefVpqsFJyO-koHg)”; Internet Movie Database, “[The War of the Worlds](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0046534/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922264380&usg=AOvVaw2RSocchgRleGY8RM1t-7xy)”)

* * *

August 16 — Flying Saucers International holds the first UFO conference at the Hollywood Hotel in Los Angeles, California, featuring contactee speakers.
