However, [George Van Tassel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Van_Tassel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922264886&usg=AOvVaw11pmgHc4li8OH9tXvaGfdg)’s first Giant Rock Interplanetary Spacecraft Convention launches the same day near Landers, California, for three days with speakers [Frank Scully](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Scully&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922265138&usg=AOvVaw3bTQYz80OL_P-IO4aR-Pue), George Van Tassel, [Orfeo Angelucci](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orfeo_Angelucci&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922265383&usg=AOvVaw2cRfuhQjmx2s_eynAO9oLY), [George Adamski,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922265624&usg=AOvVaw2smlinWksioouavZrz5hHR) and the [Amazing Criswell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Amazing_Criswell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922265936&usg=AOvVaw3ruwJwvppx0OKmalevyrt9). (Story, [p. 91](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/90/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922266133&usg=AOvVaw1vRnGUieGN1nb16w054ZmL) ; Orfeo Angelucci, “[A Release: On Flying Saucers First Convention,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Interplanetary%2520News%2520Digest/Interplanetary%2520News%2520Digest%2520-%2520vol%25201%2520no%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922266598&usg=AOvVaw1l8cMSntthSV2bM9_rv6Rs)” Interplanetary News Digest 1, no. 2 (October 1953): 1; “[Blast from the Past: UFO Conventions from Giant Rock in Landers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.desertsun.com/picture-gallery/news/local/2014/07/25/blast-from-the-past-ufo-conventions-at-giant-rock-in-landers/13146043/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922267039&usg=AOvVaw2laEOWWDoRxDVn3YtC0AbJ)” Palm Springs (Calif.) Desert Sun, July 25, 2014)

August 17?— Lina Ivanova Kravets is in her garden in Shtanivka, Ukraine, when she sees a trio of intruders cutting branches off her apple, plum, and cherry trees. Approaching closer, she sees they are 11-foot-tall entities wearing dark overalls, helmets, and gloves. They claim to be extraterrestrials, converse with her about God and their peaceful home world that is prone to natural disasters and somehow affected by the earth’s wars, and insist they are on a mission to rescue a missing scout team. They then point out a silvery sphere hovering just above the ground with similar tall being standing next to it. Before the lengthy encounter ends, the beings offer Kravets a piece of bread the size of a small coin. Breaking it open, she sees something dark and odorless inside, so she refuses it. The beings then walk to the sphere in a peculiar waddling manner, wave as they enter, and take off in the craft at terrific speed. (Peter Rogerson, “[INTCAT 1953](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://intcat.blogspot.com/2012/08/intcat-1953.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922267563&usg=AOvVaw00mpnnaXZh5JkcVf7kLki2)”; Joshua Cutchin, “The Great Alien Bake-Off,” Fortean Times 332 (November 2015): 44)

August 19 — A small, fast-moving, ricocheting fireball rips a foot-wide hole through a metal billboard at Middlestone Avenue and Front Street in East New Haven, Connecticut. IFSB investigator [August C. Roberts](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.phantomsandmonsters.com/2018/08/the-moon-is-venusian-colony-part-ii.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922268100&usg=AOvVaw3RcT9RegsXpvFKd_amQwlL) and Joseph Barbieri steal a piece of the sign during an investigation by Naval Ordnance personnel. IFSB sends the sample to Col. [Robert B. Emerson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8470193/robert-b_-emerson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922268416&usg=AOvVaw0xUN7Og5gkVrZyNe4_aqHR)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8470193/robert-b_-emerson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922268590&usg=AOvVaw04TOgu4coVf6LWDEwMt2CO) an Army physicist at Louisiana State University in Baton Rouge, who contacts friends at Oak Ridge Laboratory in Tennessee to have it analyzed, but nothing else is heard of this sample. APRO arranges for a separate analysis of the deposits on the sign performed by Anderson Laboratories in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, and the Chicago Spectrographic Service Laboratory. They determine that the fragments consist of copper and copper oxide and are not meteoritic. [Michael D. Swords](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_D._Swords&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922268929&usg=AOvVaw3VpLQi1pWM1G-Y8hDA3mDC) suggests that Roberts’s retrieval of the metal fragments would have attracted the attention of federal officials. (NICAP, “[New Haven Signboard Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/newhaven530819dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922269205&usg=AOvVaw0keYWcBR_8wVpOCWn4SYCW)”; Michael D. Swords, “Tales from the Barker Zone,” IUR 17, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1992): 5–7; Clark III 728–729)

August 20 — 9:05 p.m. The crew of a TB-29 sees a grayish oval object near Castle AFB \[now Castle Airport Aviation and Development Center\], northeast of Atwater, California. The UFO makes four passes at the plane, then dives vertically as if it consists of two objects. (NICAP, “[TB-29 Crew Files CIRVIS Report](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530820castleafb_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922269604&usg=AOvVaw1MYU0bMXhZqdD5yIfoPKHa)”; Sparks, p. 203)

August 21 — Test pilot Lt. Col. [Marion Eugene Carl](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marion_Eugene_Carl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922270116&usg=AOvVaw3OXTO7Pr803kfQTuOOcMET) reaches an unofficial altitude of 83,235 feet in a Douglas D-558-2 Skyrocket. (Wikipedia, “[Marion Eugene Carl](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marion_Eugene_Carl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922270430&usg=AOvVaw1nwJan8QpPyxk64U9XOXCU)”)

August 23 — 12:00 noon. Tom P. Drury, deputy director of the Civilian Aviation Department at Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea, takes 24 frames of 8mm color film of a silvery object that emerges from a cloud and climbs quickly, leaving a vapor trail. The Royal Australian Air Force and USAF intelligence are said to have studied the film, which has since disappeared, with only a few third-generation stills of poor quality remaining. Later researchers suspect a daytime meteor. (NICAP, “[Drury Film / Saucer-Like Object Climbing](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530823australia_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922270728&usg=AOvVaw0iAlqmVkUhZKWFbSNAwJw7)”; Norman Cruttwell, “[The New](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201961%252007%252000%2520-%2520July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922271133&usg=AOvVaw07sDndMim8BgDFrsNq2u73) [Guinea Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201961%252007%252000%2520-%2520July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922271404&usg=AOvVaw0VmAq-ZJ1udabJCl2Zr295)” APRO Bulletin, July 1961, p. 6; Clark III 416–417; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922271648&usg=AOvVaw1w-bRooe3qnopw7j0yO3xy), p. 204; Good Above, [pp. 162–163](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/162/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922271858&usg=AOvVaw2ag0yYMAIxP9bhKSqluesx); Bill Chalker, “[The Drury UFO Film Affair: A Study of a Celebrated Australian Case, Part 1,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.auforn.com/Bill_Chalker_4.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922272054&usg=AOvVaw2Er-eVA2l6zRupey87tUL_)” 2001; Bill Chalker, “[The Drury UFO Film Affair: A Study of a Celebrated Australian Case, Part 2,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.auforn.com/Bill_Chalker_5.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922272294&usg=AOvVaw3tOpKFAAeKjXFVo1BZIEcX)” 2001; Herbert S. Taylor, “Mystery Clouds and the UFO Connection,” IUR 29, no. 4 (July 2005): 17–18; Keith Basterfield and Paul Dean, “[Cold Case Review of the 23 August 1953, Port Moresby Visual Sighting and Colour Movie Film,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/kbcat/kbpddrury.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922272591&usg=AOvVaw1ZuYqJFYDharKgvmHZifwC)” April 2017)

August 24 — Contactee [George Van Tassel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Van_Tassel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922272882&usg=AOvVaw1WzyeEHCWmBOYfNw36ztsk) gets to step, for the first time, inside a flying saucer, when an extraterrestrial named Solganda wakes him up and leads him to a waiting ship, giving him a tour of the interior and a technique for rejuvenating the human body before dropping him off and shooting back into space. (Jody Rosen, “[Welcome](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2014/08/20/style/tmagazine/welcome-to-the-integratron.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922273195&usg=AOvVaw07hRjtao5b2XWqmRmcqKaP) [to the Integratron,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2014/08/20/style/tmagazine/welcome-to-the-integratron.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922273532&usg=AOvVaw2PWwhvcUvrhJjrmBbrvEmv)” New York Times Magazine, August 20, 2014; Lesla Miller Schnur, “[G. W. Van Tassel’s](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thehauntedlibrarian.com/tag/dorris-andre-van-tassel/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922273839&usg=AOvVaw3nNci2RtftPZYmGzXL4nR_) [Integraton,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thehauntedlibrarian.com/tag/dorris-andre-van-tassel/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922274034&usg=AOvVaw0YwmEpl_py8JAoM9BQtIcl)” The Haunted Librarian, August 27, 2021)

August 26 — USAF issues Air Force Regulation 200-2, which tightens UFO reporting and investigating procedures, further restricting the release of UFO information and superseding Air Force Letter 200-5. It directs that all confirmed UFO reports be sent electronically to air force intelligence. Tangible evidence must go to ATIC in Dayton. It also confines UFO investigations to three groups: USAF intelligence at the Pentagon, the 4602nd AISS, and ATIC (although ATIC only gets reports after they go to the 4602nd). Sightings are only to be discussed with “authorized personnel.” Reports by USAF personnel no longer go to Project Blue Book, which is now only a PR front. Some good cases still go there, but far fewer unidentifieds. Only solved cases are to be discussed publicly; those still unidentified are to remain classified at the Restricted level. (“[Unidentified Flying Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/directives/AFR%2520200-2%252C%2520Aug%2520%252026%252C1953.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922274505&usg=AOvVaw072zxDMNnH6vWWVp8y3Zj4) [Reporting,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/directives/AFR%2520200-2%252C%2520Aug%2520%252026%252C1953.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922274875&usg=AOvVaw1LTAJy2LlR-Ms-0XeJ5j2k)” Air Force Regulation 200-2, August 26, 1953; Clark III 918; Swords 198–199)

* * *

August 27 — 9:45 p.m. A USAF pilot, M/Sgt, and others, all on the ground, see a meandering light for 50 minutes at Greenville AFB \[now Mid-Delta Regional Airport\], Mississippi. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922275487&usg=AOvVaw2ItCYSoGM5nP70PoEFe_wv), p. 204)

August 28 — A Ground Observer Corps volunteer watches 14 cigar-shaped UFOs silently moving over San Rafael, California. One appears to be leading the formation at about 200 mph. They are first seen heading west through breaks in the clouds, then turn north and disappear behind clouds. (Good Above, [p. 278](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/278/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922275999&usg=AOvVaw1VltvMFg0ys0ujcDIoQ5nC))

August 31 — [Edward J. Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922276443&usg=AOvVaw3KHBQcFlh5eF15LebwLgmy) leaves Project Blue Book permanently, leaving Max Futch in charge as acting chief through December. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922276843&usg=AOvVaw3AXdMt9IuEK9Pdf7acGXSb)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922277083&usg=AOvVaw0ZsCRrUsMPjnzszVnR-DIO) p. 14; Clark III 55)

September — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922277605&usg=AOvVaw0Qt_HT8qCnhsSbgKBpZzBP)’s account (ghostwritten by [Clara John](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70322188/clara-louise-john&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922277973&usg=AOvVaw02iZ9gw8qUF1G571O73RMx)) of his meeting in the desert with the Venusian named Orthon is appended to an already completed manuscript on modern and historical UFO reports by Irish occultist [Desmond Leslie](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desmond_Leslie&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922278334&usg=AOvVaw0lCu8zkaI16SMOLK01jHw6) and published as Flying Saucers Have Landed. Leslie asserts that the first spaceman (a Venusian) arrived on earth in 18,617,841 B.C. \[in the early Miocene Epoch\] and claims that early UFOs were called vimanas in Sanskrit epics like the Ramayana. He also argues that the Great Pyramid and megalithic structures were built with levitation techniques derived from space people. (Desmond Leslie and George Adamski, [Flying Saucers Have Landed](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucershav00lesl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922279023&usg=AOvVaw2gldI5qZu0POjv56nk1z4R)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucershav00lesl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922279264&usg=AOvVaw3R4zPbLJf_9jAg0TxG9h8H) British Book Centre, 1953; Clark III 40)

September — Airline stewardess [Gloria Lee](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gloria_Lee&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922279775&usg=AOvVaw2k6VoeX0SBXpba9AoNKe5I) of Westchester, California, begins to hear a voice in her head that identifies itself as “J.W.,” a resident of Jupiter. Lee insists on a physical visit. Not long afterward, as she is hanging wash in her backyard, she hears the voice say, “Well, you’ve been wanting to see me.” She looks up and sees “a saucer, big as life, flying toward Santa Monica.” She has other experiences and founds the Cosmon Research Organization to publish and study J.W.’s teachings, much of which resemble philosophy in the 1882 book Oahspe, produced by automatic writing by [John Ballou Newbrough](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://history-computer.com/People/NewbroughBio.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922280426&usg=AOvVaw2zRLNfH9XjDUOPksHhKDmq)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://history-computer.com/People/NewbroughBio.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922280657&usg=AOvVaw25BiOP7x9M9Prouk564tzU) She goes on the contactee lecture circuit. (Clark III 682–683)

September — Genevieve A. Johnston begins publishing the contactee newsletter Interplanetary News Digest in Joshua Tree, California. It continues through spring 1955. ([Interplanetary News Digest](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucershav00lesl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922281277&usg=AOvVaw0ej0Vb30MN1_t859qWW0dI) 1, no. 1 (September 1953))

September — [Gray Barker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gray_Barker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922281743&usg=AOvVaw3SVvzAq0R81NnTWvTgrkn5) starts publishing The Saucerian Bulletin in Clarksburg, West Virginia, which covers UFO reports, monster yarns, contactee tales, and the latest rumors about [Albert K. Bender](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_K._Bender&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922282317&usg=AOvVaw37RJdv2I66Ainu4HiJ949p). It continues through October 1962. ([Saucerian Bulletin](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/Saucerian/1953_09_00_Saucerian_Vol-1%25231(W%25231).pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922282652&usg=AOvVaw3yc8tVQrifAH7SqCPTDVzt) 1, no. 1 (September 1953); Clark III 178)

September 7 — British pilot [Neville Duke](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neville_Duke&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922283126&usg=AOvVaw3ijqOAD5dKKkq_W6iUvS5C) reaches 728 mph in a Hawker Hunter Mk.3 at Littlehampton, England. (Wikipedia, “[Neville Duke](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neville_Duke&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922283398&usg=AOvVaw0rCgnPFVLUy9FaMmdVVuc0)”)

September 7 — 6:30 p.m. Don P. Hollister, a technical writer for Goodyear Aircraft, notices a grayish-blue object heading north directly over his backyard in Cleveland, Ohio, at less than 3,000 feet altitude. It is shaped like an equilateral triangle, but rounded somewhat on the sides and angles. It is rotating on a central axis. The object disappears after 5 seconds. (UFOEv, [p. 70](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D82%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922283772&usg=AOvVaw1vNIONkZWs84WE0cDpalb0))

September 15–19 — Operation Top Hat, a “local field exercise,” takes place at the Army Chemical School \[now the US Army CBRN School\] at Fort McClellan \[now closed\], Alabama. The experiments use Chemical Corps personnel to test decontamination methods for biological and chemical weapons, including sulfur mustard and nerve agents. The personnel are deliberately exposed to these contaminants, are not volunteers, and are not informed of the tests. In a 1975 Pentagon Inspector General’s report, the military maintain that Operation Top Hat is not subject to the guidelines requiring approval because it is a line-of-duty exercise in the Chemical Corps. (Wikipedia, “[Operation Top Hat](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Top_Hat&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922284171&usg=AOvVaw2coT63_MIKprSicrbJH33d)”)

September 26 — British pilot [Mike Lithgow](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Lithgow&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922284452&usg=AOvVaw1mb9YEOgHUkeyr-52lmiyr) attains an official world airspeed record of 736 mph in a Supermarine Swift F 4 at Castel Idris, Tripoli, Libya. (Wikipedia, “[Mike Lithgow](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Lithgow&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922284674&usg=AOvVaw2-jW6RqLWnkbJbMyhPMMXX)”)

September 28 — [Albert K. Bender](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_K._Bender&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922285000&usg=AOvVaw2EIrs4nMNFNWjA9nS2cSMn) confides to [Gray Barker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gray_Barker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922285261&usg=AOvVaw2Ey1ZW2GASJOg2LkrkDjN4) and a few others that three menacing men dressed in black suits have called on him, told him the answer to the UFO mystery, and insisted that he will go to jail if he repeats it. The experience allegedly terrifies him, and he decides to close the International Flying Saucer Bureau. Barker immortalizes the episode in a 1956 book, They Knew Too Much about Flying Saucers, and Bender breaks his long silence in 1962 with Flying Saucers and the Three Men, in which he claims that the visitors are not government agents but monsters from the distant planet Kazik. Even Barker concedes privately that he cannot swallow Bender’s fantastic tale of abduction to the South Pole by monstrous space beings. Bender does little to promote the book and soon moves to Los Angeles and secures an unlisted telephone number. However, the book does reveal Bender’s long-time obsession with science fiction, horror movies, and the occult. (Gray Barker, [They Knew](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/graybarkertheyknewtoomuchaboutflyingsaucers_201910/page/n1/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922285969&usg=AOvVaw0HkLPp-q5nQqwaSEmKTlK6) [Too Much about Flying Saucers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/graybarkertheyknewtoomuchaboutflyingsaucers_201910/page/n1/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922286287&usg=AOvVaw3qcQ5NogYK__AMyIzVlmxI)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/graybarkertheyknewtoomuchaboutflyingsaucers_201910/page/n1/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922286484&usg=AOvVaw3fBXmyMx05E3B3fA-Gzm3o) University Books, 1956; Albert K. Bender, Flying Saucers and the Three Men, Saucerian, 1962; Clark III 189–192, 623; Story, [pp. 50–51](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/50/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922286857&usg=AOvVaw1Z0k1ZZ5LJL1lTiX_dbODr); Michael D. Swords, “Tales from the Barker Zone,” IUR 17, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1992): 6)

September 28 — 7:10 p.m. In Palmdale, California, a UFO appears on an F-94C radarscope for a period of 15 seconds. The object is traveling on a 60° course at an estimated speed of 2,300 mph. It is 4 miles away when first seen and

* * *

compares with a C-47 in size on the radarscope. The F-94 was moving at 345 mph at 21,000 feet. The same or another object is observed visually from another F-94C for six seconds at 7:00 p.m. The object is described as round, orange in color, and traveling on the same course as the first object. (NICAP, “[F-94C Tracks UFO at 200 Knots](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/530928palmdale_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922287365&usg=AOvVaw2FQGb2mJyZMlukuljOshRV)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922287545&usg=AOvVaw2toeAwcNfQJfl3099AZtJ_)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922287672&usg=AOvVaw0vbdqIqDCXLgo3XekaxfyX) p. 204)

Late September — Night. Baltimore, Maryland, astronomer [James C. Bartlett Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Bartlett_pending.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922287950&usg=AOvVaw1TEumi55Feb2nYlqs5KY4w) is observing a transit of the star Fomalhaut when he notices four large lights moving slowly in the sky. He looks at them through binoculars and sees that they are on the noses of two enormous cigar-shaped objects at about 3,000 feet altitude. He can also see an apparent cabin and portholes and he hears a sound like a piston engine. (“[Two Huge UFOs Sighted by](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/005%2520AUG-SEPT%25201958.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922288239&usg=AOvVaw2nXuZk1hNCf0aUvAkX3-sN) [Baltimore Astronomer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/005%2520AUG-SEPT%25201958.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922288438&usg=AOvVaw11A96_OPNVCAYwhlyZ4g66)” UFO Investigator 1, no. 5 (Aug./Sept. 1958): 1, 3)

September 30 — Project Blue Book issues its Status Report #12. (US Air Force, [Projects Grudge and Blue Book Reports](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922289008&usg=AOvVaw1r1rz3XOqJ6GVCPcHkwVqr) [1–12,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922289398&usg=AOvVaw29O50lvpu3LnV72z5KD4kP) NICAP, 1968, pp. 215–235)

Autumn — Dusk. Cecil Tenney is driving near Dutton, Montana, when he sees a cigar-shaped object about 200 feet away. Apparently in trouble, it belches fire and smoke, and after a few minutes he hears an explosion. Balls of fire rain down from the sky. He tells the story to a highway patrol officer at a nearby bar before driving on to Conrad, Montana. That evening a colonel from Great Falls AFB \[now Malmstrom AFB\] calls and tells him to show up at the base in the morning. He is interrogated there for 30 minutes, and on the way out sees soldiers carrying bags that he thinks might contain body parts. (Leonard H. Stringfield, “Retrievals of the Third Kind: A Case Study of Alleged UFOs and Occupants in Military Custody,” MUFON 1978 UFO Symposium Proceedings, Mutual UFO Network, 1978, pp. 77–105; Clark III 342)

October — The final issue of Space Review edited by [Albert K. Bender](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_K._Bender&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922290477&usg=AOvVaw3NNGsRA9eohf23SK-dFsvt) states that UFOs are “no longer a mystery. The source is already known, but any information about this is being withheld by orders from a higher source.” (“[Statement of Importance,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Space%2520Review%2520(Bender)/Space%2520Review%2520-%2520Volume%25202%2520number%25204%2520-%25201953%252010.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922291007&usg=AOvVaw1ORfLkQFaf_zGoKkexSFGH)” Space Review 2, no. 4 (October 1953): 1; Clark III 189)

October 1— [Donald E. Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922291599&usg=AOvVaw3rRJm7TiNpqPZ4tJfo_Jpm)’s Flying Saucers from Outer Space is published by Henry Holt. Excerpts appear in the October 20 issue of Look. His message is that aliens are here, the military knows it, and they are covering it up from the public to avoid panic. He has gotten clearance from [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922292169&usg=AOvVaw18P_w34bnWbFQoMH_pGU9I) and [Chop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/interviews/bios/chop-albert.php&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922292533&usg=AOvVaw02rpkc7uAEAVejjoiw95mQ) to include 51 classified UFO reports from the Air Technical Intelligence Center, which runs Project Blue Book. The Air Force states that Keyhoe is misrepresenting their analyses, so he sends a telegram to USAF Secretary [Harold E. Talbott](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harold_E._Talbott&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922292957&usg=AOvVaw1Sps1XbGDq3bWS8d1BuHWb) and Gen. [Sory Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105625/major-general-sory-smith/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922293339&usg=AOvVaw2UDYH3fX1OvOjzv4KPZU-d)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105625/major-general-sory-smith/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922293579&usg=AOvVaw3C9LhD8QWLr6csYgwkd6xa) saying that if he really misrepresented anything, as a Marine Corps officer he should be disciplined. The Air Force offers no comment. In the book, he takes note of a curious document (never published and now lost) prepared by USAF Col. [William C. Odell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://obits.gazette.com/obituaries/gazette/obituary.aspx?n%3Dwilliam-c-odell%26pid%3D127051838%26fhid%3D6109&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922294011&usg=AOvVaw1FGkeIUjo-XfqIUvGOo9Y_) titled “Planet Earth: Host to Extraterrestrial Life,” in which he speculates on aliens crossing space in search of new planets to live on once their own fails. (Donald E. Keyhoe, [Flying Saucers from Outer Space](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsos/fsos.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922294350&usg=AOvVaw1s-vhu_Ehdy8qA0mndYoaf)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsos/fsos.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922294584&usg=AOvVaw3XA8bPZybrw22agKzO_Xwc) Holt, 1953; Wikipedia, “[Flying Saucers from Outer Space](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flying_Saucers_from_Outer_Space&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922295007&usg=AOvVaw3nej1hIuyA1zai30Ftflrf)”; Keyhoe, [FS](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922295327&usg=AOvVaw3E2Bu2SxdTBOvNtnf5bRe6) [Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922295665&usg=AOvVaw2oqeDXbjS7MaqGJs9LFKcw)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922295944&usg=AOvVaw3xvXi7sP1bGJkIFv1IxQ6l) p. 55; Michael D. Swords, “Colonel Odell and the Invasion of Earth,” IUR 30, no. 3 (May 2006): 3– 6)

October 3 — USN pilot [James B. Verdin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3436976/james-bernard-verdin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922296622&usg=AOvVaw2LS6UFXKaFzzTXpk8SwjIu) reaches 753 mph in a Douglas F4D Skyray over the Salton Sea, California. (Wikipedia, “[Douglas F4D Skyray](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_F4D_Skyray&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922297029&usg=AOvVaw0xdYFmdxPc-Py1EOgUNJRt)”)

October 9 — 3:50 p.m. A UFO is seen at Caulfield, Melbourne, Victoria, discharging a white trail described as “strange shiney filaments” that cover wires and trees. A sample turns out to be a “nylon-like amorphous mass with traces of magnesuim, calcium, boron, and silicon.” It shrinks from 3 inches to one-half inch in an air-tight container. (“[Wispy Threads from Sky,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Australia/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review%2520-%25201966%252011%2520-%2520no%25209%2520UFOIC.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922297644&usg=AOvVaw0SXs-LQfyY9h00Z0f8t3Fq)” Australian Flying Saucer Review (UFOIC), no. 9 (November 1966): 12; Brian Boldman, “Angel Hair Physical Analyses: A Review,” JUFOS 9 (2006): 101; Keith Basterfield, “Angel Hair: An Australian Perspective,” IUR 27, no. 1 (Spring 2002): 6)

October 9 — 4:30 p.m. Three unidentified objects are tracked on radar at RAF Bawdsey \[now Bawdsey Manor\], Suffolk, England, at an altitude of 36,000 feet above the Netherlands. Soon they are tracked flying east to west over the Harwich area. Some jets at RAF Waterbeach \[now Waterbeach Barracks\], Cambridgeshire, are scrambled but can locate nothing. Airmen at Bawdsey can see nothing but four contrails heading north. The objects then reverse and move back across the English Channel at 32,000–34,000 feet. The apparent speed on the approach is 430 mph, increasing to 483 mph on the short leg over the UK and 564 mph on the return. (NICAP, “[Three UFOs Flew over](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/531009unitedkingdom_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922298619&usg=AOvVaw3P-RqaVadqkEERnYtv-or1) [Area, Tracked on Radar](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/531009unitedkingdom_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922298931&usg=AOvVaw2LOoXWWMnThn7nJh1DWstq)”)

October 15 — 10:10 a.m. During the tracking of a Project Grab Bag balloon launch, a 40-foot object leaving a brief vapor trail is seen by three General Mills Aeronautical Lab research engineers ([James A. Winker](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://stratocat.com.ar/stratopedia/25.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922299383&usg=AOvVaw2q2hGN9VPv7byPYkdKH0Ki), [Fletcher L.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/145580122/fletcher-lavallee-bartholomew&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922299714&usg=AOvVaw1yxxk1FZXL9lJmIj0svGNE) [Bartholomew](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/145580122/fletcher-lavallee-bartholomew&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922300080&usg=AOvVaw3-Ot8Qbj4vS8kOp2DmfG2I)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/145580122/fletcher-lavallee-bartholomew&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922300368&usg=AOvVaw0U_jJ0V1esqliNEjvTbWr8) and [Richard J. Reilly](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B088DJMYW4/ref%253Ddbs_a_def_rwt_hsch_vapi_tkin_p1_i0&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922300731&usg=AOvVaw1IV2TqK73S0CHBq-DeUhDG)) near Minneapolis, Minnesota. It is traveling south in horizontal flight at 1,100 mph, moving 10° in nine seconds at about 40,000 ft altitude and 25° elevation. The object goes into a vertical dive for about 10-15 seconds, then glows or flashes in the sun two or three times for 1 second each. It is seen in the

* * *

theodolite as a gray mass. It levels off and the vapor trail stops. (NICAP, “[Project GRAB BAG Sighting](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/531015minneapolis_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922301448&usg=AOvVaw0SoAXh5VgBmPKSz8eoZ7bc)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922301736&usg=AOvVaw1PHa74V-Q0BoL6aoxMvOns)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922301979&usg=AOvVaw0JBlMKYsQ4Bp-HXwcvpMmM) p. 205; Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine eds., 1974, [pp. 71–72](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/70/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922302466&usg=AOvVaw2dRacUB__-8m_LOIMFUSQx); Hynek UFO Report, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/112/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922302910&usg=AOvVaw3igtHU_B1raayEtSptTqLU) [113–114](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/112/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922303186&usg=AOvVaw2_s6ns0tPYKyCMjZLGFBMP))

October 16 — Harvard astronomer [Donald Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922303682&usg=AOvVaw3gmgbWIdPtLCJjekoZfr50) writes to USAF Director of Intelligence Gen. [John A. Samford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922304107&usg=AOvVaw2vUq-sNBwLiiZzFjcX5gLg) that he would like to meet with ATIC officers in Washington, D.C. (Good Above, [p. 278](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/278/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922304521&usg=AOvVaw3pZTblEc_j37y9_9xMr3zi))

October 16 — 4:00–4:30 p.m. Emerson “Slim” F. Morris watches a large, cigar-shaped object as it approaches Brigantine, New Jersey, from over the Atlantic. It releases several smaller objects from both ends. The smaller discs are white, rotating counterclockwise, and rapidly speed away. Before the large object disappears, it emits a blinding ray of light toward the ground that hurts Morris’s eyes. (Herbert S. Taylor, “Satellite Objects: A Further Look,” IUR 29, no. 2 (Summer 2004): 7)

October 19 — 12:10 a.m. Capt. J. L. Kidd is flying an American Airlines DC-6 between Philadelphia and Washington, D.C., when over the Conowingo Dam, Maryland, his copilot sees something gleaming in the moonlight dead ahead and closing rapidly. Kidd blinks on his landing lights and the UFO beams back a blinding light back at the DC-6. Kidd puts the plane into a steep dive. Caught unaware, the passengers are tossed about the cabin, many suffering injuries. Kidd radios Washington National Airport \[now Ronald Reagan International Airport\] to report a near collision and complain about air traffic. Air traffic control reports no known aircraft in his vicinity. (Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922305421&usg=AOvVaw0Cgt7L8zG0gDeki4BgtPWy)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922305701&usg=AOvVaw0CFHPl5zNRARPChZ6ca74H) pp. 60–61; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1953, August–December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922306160&usg=AOvVaw0UnW9yWTgf8xZHNQvoRIDs), The Author, 1990, pp. 34, 38; Good Above, [p. 282](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/282/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922306502&usg=AOvVaw1wZYxBuIz0RQGpZcqeCV3y))

October 20 — The NSA Robertson Committee report is completed and classified top secret. It recommends better and faster use of electronic intelligence in radar activity that might indicate an imminent attack, noting that the Air Force is not cooperating with the Army or Navy on these matters. (Clark III 55–56)

October 22 — [Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922307126&usg=AOvVaw2DnQUgq1jt0k2tfZ5P9J_G) meets with USAF headquarters personnel (including Col. [George E. Perry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1981/03/16/col-george-perry-dies-taught-math-at-lee-high/b4f4157b-12bd-4762-8631-9c06cca74446/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922307581&usg=AOvVaw3E_FBHr9Zs0hCtAlNAsg6V)) and ATIC at the Pentagon. (Good Above, [p. 279](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/278/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922307983&usg=AOvVaw2OuudpYB3WRWrt9NtWn0fF))

October 25 — 8:15–8:30 p.m. Air Force weather observers at Lubbock, Texas, notice a V formation of 5–7 dull white lights sweep north to south. In three seconds, the formation goes from a point overhead to 3° above the horizon where they disappear. Other groups of two or more lights follow at about 5-minute intervals. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1953, August–December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922308571&usg=AOvVaw10Py6IvH1HS8Zy2iHs3xyL)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922308880&usg=AOvVaw0WdJOYLOlKq1BTNip5vvEu) The Author, 1990, pp. 35–36)

October 29 — USAF pilot [Frank Kendall Everest Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Kendall_Everest_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922309465&usg=AOvVaw1_y7RJ5Vtgvz-znggw2vvh) reaches 755 mph in a North American F-100 Super Sabre over the Salton Sea, California. (Wikipedia, “[Frank Kendall Everest Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Kendall_Everest_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922309891&usg=AOvVaw1b4QRTxl25nm8-kAMYwulC)”)

November — Capt. [Charles A. Hardin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49197803/charles-alton-hardin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922310477&usg=AOvVaw1XsKuj-or7SLrkXNYX3J37) takes charge of Project Blue Book. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922310890&usg=AOvVaw1oSXkeZO2AT8o-mR_96ssa)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922311129&usg=AOvVaw01zfkHny_tABSn2VfY0Byq) p. 14)

November — 6:30 p.m. Trygve Jansen and two other witnesses are driving north on the Gamle Mossevei road at the Gjersjøen bridge, Norway, when they see an object rise from behind a hill, swing out over the lake, and move back to the road, circling and following their car. Suddenly it stops and hovers above the road 30 feet in front of them, emitting a green light. Jansen stops, and all three witnesses experience mild electrical shocks until the object rises and disappears. When he returns home, Jansen’s wife points out that the car’s beige paint has turned a bright green. (Carl Olsen, “[Chased by a Flying Saucer!](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1956%252CSep-Oct%252CV%25202%252CN%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922311740&usg=AOvVaw3_eXXeJNxDGhCpgTv1gB8c)” Flying Saucer Review 2, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1956): 16; K. Gösta Rehn, “[Saucer Blocked Road in Norway,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201962%252003%252000%2520-%2520March.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922312374&usg=AOvVaw308D-5bmle9T6WXhfho6Eo)” APRO Bulletin, March 1962, pp. 1, 3)

November 3 — 10:00 a.m. An RAF NF.10 Vampire pilot (Flight Lt. Terry S. Johnson) and navigator (Flying Officer Geoffrey Smythe) flying at 30,000 feet near RAF West Malling \[now closed\], Kent, England, see a star-like light far above them. Suddenly it moves toward them at tremendous speed. They see it as circular and emitting a bright light around its periphery. The duration is 30 seconds. Air Minister [George Ward](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Ward%252C_1st_Viscount_Ward_of_Witley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922313117&usg=AOvVaw0E5yXRLgJHZUBXCOfzr_0s) calls it a “balloon”; when author [Desmond Leslie](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desmond_Leslie&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922313538&usg=AOvVaw3g4NjP0wdLxMPe1BtlWLlw) calls him up to suggest this is incorrect, Ward tells him: “I know it wasn’t a balloon. You know it wasn’t a balloon. But until I’ve got a saucer on the ground in Hyde Park and can charge the public sixpence a go to enter, it must be balloons, otherwise the government would fall and I’d lose my job.” It is possible that this object was a Skyhook balloon launched from Holloman AFB in New Mexico on October 27 that failed to drop into the Atlantic after a 12-hour flight. (Desmond Leslie, “[Politicians and the UFO,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1963%252CMay-Jun%252CV%25209%252CN%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922314311&usg=AOvVaw2ExvSfyfRjDENZ3-Z_qHzN)” Flying Saucer Review 9, no. 3 (May/June 1963): 8–9; Good Above, [pp. 35](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/34/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922314803&usg=AOvVaw3yaUyzfE071nMTLZl4QHdQ), [53](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/52/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922315121&usg=AOvVaw0LGaW0pcBNO_rYYE5ExjqI); Good Need, [p. 154](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/154/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922315330&usg=AOvVaw1z7t-OhtvbcejUkiyDJi_q); UFOFiles2, [pp. 57,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n95/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922315570&usg=AOvVaw024MuZROfZPNY3vVBVuj5q) [62–63](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n101/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922315799&usg=AOvVaw3-UmZbGpKv58xXMS-tM2od); David Clarke, “The Prince and the Saucers,” Fortean Times 406 (June 2021): 18)

November 3 — 2:45 p.m. In Lee, southeast London, a solid target is tracked on radar by the 256th Heavy Anti-Aircraft Regiment moving slowly at a distance of 17 miles. Through a telescope it appears to be a circular white object. The target is tracked for 25 minutes by four aircraft technicians, including Sgt. H. Waller, who says it is about 350–450 feet in diameter and definitely not a balloon. The War Office claims the object is a radiosonde balloon. (NICAP, “[Heavy Anti-Aircraft Regiment Tracks UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/531103londondir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922316351&usg=AOvVaw338PaZGGrgj28ANcljMdCk)”; Good Above, [pp. 35–36](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/34/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922316687&usg=AOvVaw1yrr_sl9d2pURLtS7kUeNt); Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922317059&usg=AOvVaw32bBpAKIG9zphAezzbkuGm), p. 79)

November 5 — President [Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922317566&usg=AOvVaw140TLUJ0RkWMEMGd-ifyn7) issues Executive Order 10501, abolishing the classification of “Restricted.” UFO sightings are unaffected, as meaningful sightings are classified at higher levels. There are now explicit guidelines for the remaining three classification levels to prevent a systematic flood of classified documents coming from the

* * *

Pentagon and other agencies. The Pentagon responds by creating its own “special access” labels to further insulate classified information from outside influence. (“[Executive Order 10501](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://irp.fas.org/offdocs/eo10501.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922318405&usg=AOvVaw1tgQNoq2EyijeYn9uhOqNK)”)

November 16 — A fluffy material streams out of a UFO over the San Fernando Valley, California, and falls to the ground. A reporter who examines it describes it as “dead-white, almost ephemeral in its delicacy and apparently electrically charged.” A similar fall occurs in the same area on February 1, 1954. (Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922318934&usg=AOvVaw2IqRdYhcjYTrg0d6x23omb), pp. 227–228; Clark III 124)

November 19 — Bacteriologist [Frank Olson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Olson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922319438&usg=AOvVaw20d449dpoL93z4HXerQg25) is a leading scientist at the army’s Chemical Corps, Special Operations Division at Fort Detrick, Maryland. SOD supplies the CIA with an array of deadly microbes and chemicals that cannot be detected in an autopsy. It also supplies delivery methods for anthrax. The CIA pays SOD $200,000 a year for these services until 1969. Olson is duped into a meeting with MKUltra Director [Sidney Gottlieb](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidney_Gottlieb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922319904&usg=AOvVaw0zOSbt6GwXylHq1gjNWZlp) at a secluded cabin. Olson has a very bad trip and still hasn’t recovered after several days. (H. P. Albarelli Jr., [A](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/terriblemistake00hpal/page/n3/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922320353&usg=AOvVaw1G7cK5Cw9RFgh7ZzkridF2) [Terrible Mistake: The Murder of Frank Olson and the CIA’s Cold War Experiments](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/terriblemistake00hpal/page/n3/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922320701&usg=AOvVaw3Dip5Q5M3TSm4B_qldlnKp), Trine Day, 2009; Stephen Kinzer, “[The Secret History of Fort Detrick, the CIA’s Base for Mind Control Experiments,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2019/09/15/cia-fort-detrick-stephen-kinzer-228109/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922321215&usg=AOvVaw0ZcVH9C-3SKLS4PAz2EWhb)” Politico Magazine, September 15, 2019)

November 20 — Australian Minister for Air [William McMahon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_McMahon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922321698&usg=AOvVaw2wvxVF_fiH3bjfBFBCYKCW) tells Parliament that all UFO reports “are still being investigated closely and recorded as an aid to further research,” but the RAAF’s approach is a bit more ad hoc. (Swords 377)

November 22 — Navy Capt. [Walter Karig](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Karig&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922322242&usg=AOvVaw2NP4zKZ8oMv0T7ZTY2_ZRW)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Karig&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922322482&usg=AOvVaw0NsSQY7rn0l05rzp-5cTCV) author of the 1947 novel Zotz!, writes “Operation UFO: The Official Truth about Flying Saucers” for The American Weekly newspaper insert. He covers Secretary of the Navy [Kimball](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dan_A._Kimball&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922323126&usg=AOvVaw2KwtAW98hmCKR7q9zMASR6)’s 1952 UFO sighting and the ONR saucer probe. He emphasizes the Air Force’s 20% unexplained rate and does not rule out the extraterrestrial hypothesis. (Walter Karig, “[Operation UFO:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93713891/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922323468&usg=AOvVaw199DMda_RO0wzE0mxs2hf7) [The Official Truth about Flying Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93713929/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922323781&usg=AOvVaw0D5x_XER8lLRkL07nKJkZ-)” American Weekly insert, San Francisco Examiner, November 22, 1953, pp. 4–5; Swords 217)

November 22 — 10:00 p.m. A man who works in the supply transport office of the RAAF Woomera Rocket Range near Woomera, South Australia, sees a green object like a saucer fly to the north between Woocalla and Birthday Siding. It is emitting blue exhaust. Another man driving the same route around 2:00 a.m. about 50 miles from Woomera sees a bluish-green circular object moving north. It is seen again by another man in the same area around 2:30 a.m. A fourth party sees two orange flares dropping from the sky near Pimba at 3:15 a.m. All of the objects are at an altitude of more than 5,000 feet. (Keith Basterfield, “[Listing of Reports from Woomera, South](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/kbcat/kbwoomera.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922324620&usg=AOvVaw2T3mi9dj_y1oCOWxKcD_wn) [Australia,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/kbcat/kbwoomera.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922324966&usg=AOvVaw1fLBtNJvE4JLmTRBJGH7mB)” 2008)

November 23 — Evening. ADC radar detects an unknown object moving at 500 mph over Lake Superior. An F-89C Scorpion interceptor, piloted by Lt. [Felix Moncla Jr.,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Felix_Moncla&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922325430&usg=AOvVaw1xd7P27MgN1yrDB4C12Syf) with radar observer Lt. [Robert L. Wilson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81072331/robert-l_-wilson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922325860&usg=AOvVaw2k1Sh5JlcLE64qCvlhDUp5) in the rear cockpit, is dispatched from Kinross AFB \[now Chippewa County International Airport\], south of Sault Ste. Marie, Michigan. The jet heads toward the target under radar guidance. At 8,000 feet, 160 miles northwest of the Soo Locks, the blips of the F-89 and the UFO merge then fade from the screen. Nothing more is heard from the plane and no trace of it is found. A Pentagon spokesman claims the UFO was an RCAF C-47 that was never closer than 3-4 miles to the F-89, which has crashed for unknown reasons. In 2006, a group of divers claimed to have discovered the F-89 and taken photos on side-scan sonar, but the claim is a hoax. (NICAP, “[UFO Intercept /](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/531123kinrossdir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922326377&usg=AOvVaw0Jdnm9qLMeXABbsMYJswuk) [Missing F-89 Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/531123kinrossdir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922326679&usg=AOvVaw26OztQxkjq3ft2dMJVKS31)”; Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922327068&usg=AOvVaw0_-qZOP0_L8vJeQjZNbbIe)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922327342&usg=AOvVaw0-u290om7jZGpjqCQDW9CZ) pp. 13–23; UFOEv, [pp. 114–115](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D126%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922327775&usg=AOvVaw1rGVDRyio7Q4Sg1GamaH6A); Yurko Bondarchuk, UFO Sightings, Landings, and Abductions, Methuen, 1979, pp. 106–109; Good Above, [p. 273](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/272/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922328284&usg=AOvVaw0FVfExDVGEY1RQ0hZH5Vha); Andrew Griffin, “[Missing! Avoyelles Parish Man’s Disappearance](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/90642412/lt-felix-e-moncla-disappeared-after/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922328664&usg=AOvVaw2Tt-smrweu1hb0rP3QibMd) [Still a Mystery after 50 Years,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/90642479/2nd-half-of-lt-felix-moncla-missing/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922329073&usg=AOvVaw1JOW7A_rnOr0qV6p_7QZxX)” Alexandria (La.) Town Talk, July 20, 2003, pp. E1, E3; Clark III 654–656)

November 24 — The British Parliament discusses the November 3 Lee case and others. [Nigel Birch](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigel_Birch%252C_Baron_Rhyl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922329711&usg=AOvVaw2yOosJbI7wjcBy1cLbeNXM), Parliamentary Secretary to the Ministry of Defence, explains the sightings as experimental weather balloons. MP [George Isaacs](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Isaacs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922330071&usg=AOvVaw3_L0FUtV1sgaV84m-4eUAI) asks, “Will the Minister agree that this story of flying saucers is all ballooney?” (Good Above, [p. 36](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/36/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922330488&usg=AOvVaw3VF9bvDadKpyhfSBuKYGv_))

November 28 — [Frank Olson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Olson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922330945&usg=AOvVaw0Qa-53yEFfNqQq-U8TH2hm) is depressed, incoherent, and uncommunicative after his LSD dose nine days earlier. His CIA contacts take him to a “doctor” in New York City, who prescribes him alcohol. He then plunges to his death from the 10th floor window of the Hotel Statler in New York City. The US government calls it a suicide, the Olson family alleges murder because, especially in the aftermath of his LSD experience, he has become a security risk who might divulge state secrets associated with highly classified CIA programs of which he has direct personal knowledge. A few days before his death, Olson quits his position as acting chief of the Special Operations Division at Camp Detrick \[later Fort Detrick\] in Frederick, Maryland, because of a severe moral crisis concerning the nature of his biological weapons research. Among Olson’s concerns are the development of assassination materials used by the CIA. The CIA’s use of biological warfare materials in covert operations, experimentation with biological weapons in populated areas, collaboration with former Nazi scientists

under Operation Paperclip, LSD mind-control research, and the use of psychoactive drugs during “terminal” interrogations under a program code-named Project ARTICHOKE. Later forensic evidence conflicts with the

* * *

official version of events; when Olson’s body is exhumed in 1994, cranial injuries indicate that Olson was knocked unconscious before he exited the window. The medical examiner terms Olson’s death a “homicide.” (Michael Ignatieff, “[What Did the C.I.A. Do to His Father?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/2001/04/01/magazine/cia-what-did-the-cia-do-to-his-father.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922332571&usg=AOvVaw0ICn6-qx0EivCfgPEdHl1n)” New York Times Magazine, April 1, 2001, pp. 56– 61; H. P. Albarelli Jr., [A Terrible Mistake: The Murder of Frank Olson and the CIA’s Cold War Experiments](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/terriblemistake00hpal/page/n3/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922333090&usg=AOvVaw3nYYqUdtouCmeuBraHdPJW), Trine Day, 2009; Stephen Kinzer, “[The Secret History of Fort Detrick, the CIA’s Base for Mind Control](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2019/09/15/cia-fort-detrick-stephen-kinzer-228109/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922333548&usg=AOvVaw2zY-gnOtx9qrZHbeGavlk1) [Experiments,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2019/09/15/cia-fort-detrick-stephen-kinzer-228109/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922334000&usg=AOvVaw1JqwaoIWZGpQwwLhISY_VN)” Politico Magazine, September 15, 2019)

December — [Wilbert B. Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922334533&usg=AOvVaw2MCDgX3WsaH1iwdrDGpa1p) sets up his Department of Transport observatory at Shirley’s Bay, Ontario. His equipment includes an ionospheric reactor, electronic sound measurement devices, gamma-ray detector, gravimeter, magnetometer, and radio set. (Wikipedia, “[Project Magnet (UFO)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Magnet_(UFO)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922334965&usg=AOvVaw3N2t2C7jJNzZ_XPrBQ6rtO)”; Good Above, [pp. 185–186](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/184/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922335296&usg=AOvVaw2BUCmBhId7t88tXnriYbIE))

December — [Noall Bryce Cornwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/k/KirkwoodGuy/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922335667&usg=AOvVaw1KLg3f9hcHbieX_qPST4TM) (who uses the pseudonyms Mel Noel and Guy Kirkwood) claims to have been stationed at Lowry AFB \[now Wings Over the Rockies Air and Space Museum\] in Denver, Colorado, and engaged in several dogfight-type maneuvers with UFOs involving gun-camera film. His stories are bogus, and later he runs phony investment scams and becomes a contactee who describes meeting pink-haired, platinum- skinned, fish-eating Martians said to be running a Mars-Earth transportation system. (Mel Noel, The Mel Noel Story, Saucerian, 1960; Good Above, [pp. 273–277](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/272/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922336467&usg=AOvVaw3ImU8X3kMigOYBNYgjY6ae); Kevin D. Randle, “[Mel Noel / Guy Kirkwood in the 1960s,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2010/12/mel-noelguy-kirkwood-in-1960s.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922336858&usg=AOvVaw1kn1NPsmSM71iIo9AGtfYZ)” A Different Perspective, December 20, 2010; Adam Gorightly, “[Mel Noel’s Phony Flying Saucer Trip to the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://chasingufosblog.com/2020/04/17/mel-noels-phony-flying-saucer-trip-to-the-stars/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922337268&usg=AOvVaw0TL-eEQxET2vnB-1W-XuTQ) [Stars,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://chasingufosblog.com/2020/04/17/mel-noels-phony-flying-saucer-trip-to-the-stars/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922337633&usg=AOvVaw2T4xMPmtmjs6nwWwmi9NWA)” Chasing UFOs, April 17, 2020)

December — Australian UFO researcher [Edgar Jarrold](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://theozfiles1.rssing.com/chan-25625913/all_p4.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922338172&usg=AOvVaw2PwYTylsaZMxDz0kICP3WV) is visited four times by a mysterious man who swears him to secrecy. What the visitor tells him amazes him “beyond belief,” but he never publicly reveals who the man is. However, it turns out that the man is Gordon Deller, a minor figure in Australian ufology who has some quaint and original theories about the saucers. He believes that UFOs are piloted by etherians from another dimension. He tells Jarrold this, along with some insights into a geological cataclysm and telepathic communication. [Harold](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufoupdateslist.com/1997/oct/m03-020.shtml&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922338671&usg=AOvVaw1bIsaXBWJkBw-8VFjjKtxr) [Fulton](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufoupdateslist.com/1997/oct/m03-020.shtml&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922339018&usg=AOvVaw3CkiPmGA9EfDREsln09gHo)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufoupdateslist.com/1997/oct/m03-020.shtml&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922339270&usg=AOvVaw2l4jIaNK54xuxh50NBat6d) a ufologist from New Zealand, suspects Deller is a nut. However, Jarrold’s obsession with UFOs leads to the breakup of his family and the disintegration of his personal life by 1955. (Clark III 632–633)

December 7 — 9:30 p.m. Pfc Alfred V. De Bonise and Sgt1C James Conley of the 89th Anti-Aircraft Battalion at Fort George G. Meade, Maryland, spot a white object, “shining like a star.” It makes a noise like an artillery shell in flight. It moves erratically and eventually falls out of sight. (Good Above, [p. 280](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/280/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922339853&usg=AOvVaw2GS_a9QnQeDtxm1IJCm1HJ); Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922340214&usg=AOvVaw0KsIuHC5X5-IODPv-0Z-XO) [History: 1953, August–December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922340577&usg=AOvVaw1kFg1PQ_HBoUo2uD4CQVlM), The Author, 1990, p. 60)

December 7 — Radio Moscow proclaims that saucers are “figments of the imagination of western warmongers.” (Frank Edwards, FS Serious Business, Bantam ed., 1966, [p. 156](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersser00edwa/page/n195/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922341271&usg=AOvVaw0namonLkDqezdtV1j08jdF))

December 8 — The CIA reports that UFO sightings have fallen dramatically in 1953, though there are some of “possible scientific intelligence value.” (Jenny Randles, UFO Conspiracy, Cassell, 1987, [p. 45](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoconspiracyfir00rand/page/44/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922341924&usg=AOvVaw1XnBLBAt9ALaa7HBaCEa_2))

December 9 — 3:45 p.m. Charles Huaut sees a luminous, golden, round object poised motionless at a high altitude over Saint-Émilion, Gironde, France. After 10 minutes it noiselessly changes position and assumes the form of several horseshoes enveloped in smoke trails. Then it disappears. (Central Intelligence Agency, “[Sightings of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/DOC_0005516168.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922342450&usg=AOvVaw1bbOtfGLQaYLCyioFbHAiG) [Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/DOC_0005516168.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922342791&usg=AOvVaw2RIn2osKnTtvvrQV2gCy0d)” April 20, 1954, p. 2; ClearIntent, [p. 130](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/130/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922343166&usg=AOvVaw1oYm4kV8_Vefx1qCsf56g_))

December 15 — 2:37 p.m. While flying a Transair Sweden DC-3 in the vicinity of Hässleholm, Skåne, Sweden, pilot [Ulf](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ulf_Christiernsson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922343777&usg=AOvVaw0STZck5Y3P9okyORvk3qMu) [Christiernsson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ulf_Christiernsson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922344135&usg=AOvVaw1CkfdQy3ZJoS4DkMsyA7lJ) and flight mechanic Olle Johansson encounter an “unorthodox, metallic, symmetric, round object” closing in on their aircraft for about 10 seconds. It passes about 1,970 feet under the DC-3 at an altitude of 7,055 feet. Air Force Gen. [Bengt Nordenskiöld](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bengt_Nordenski%25C3%25B6ld&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922344563&usg=AOvVaw2KmDFmk77GPJ3S5FjdZ4uO) calls in reports from all relevant Swedish radar stations to identify the object, and the Defence Research Institute spends many hours reconstructing the event. However, the owner of a local perfume company confessed in late December to releasing 300 hydrogen-filled balloons south of Hässleholm as an advertising promotion around 12:30 p.m. that day. (Swords 365)

December 16 — The British Air Ministry sends orders to all RAF stations saying that UFO reports are to be classified “Restricted” and personnel must not communicate any sighting information to unauthorized persons. Reports must be sent to the air intelligence branch DDI (Tech) that is now responsible for UFO investigations. (UFOFiles2, [pp. 57–60](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n95/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922345321&usg=AOvVaw0q_2v02_3H7FqdBcAMW2I6))

December 16 — 4:58 p.m. Lockheed Skunk Works chief [Clarence L. “Kelly” Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kelly_Johnson_(engineer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922345773&usg=AOvVaw0uN0cNlPe0jr_8RBRaE6oe) and his wife Althea (near Agoura, California) and a Lockheed crew (Rudy Thoren, [Roy Wimmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/18629149/roy-edwin-wimmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922346239&usg=AOvVaw2s4wvLhAIuM4jOYXSBpwGo), and 3 others) flying the WV-2 Warning Star aircraft near Long Beach, California, independently of each other observe a black flying-wing (or ellipse or crescent-shaped) object about 170–230 feet wide flying at about 15,000 ±2,000 feet altitude to the west, hovering about 30–60 miles away. At 5:04 p.m., after four minutes (to the Johnsons) and six minutes (to WV-2 crew) the UFO suddenly takes off in a shallow climb accelerating to approximately earth escape velocity (25,000 mph) to the west over the Pacific. It disappears in 10–13 seconds (to WV-2 crew) or in 90 seconds (to Johnson using 8x binoculars) after reaching 90+

* * *

miles altitude. (NICAP, “[The Lockheed UFO Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/531216agoura_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922346963&usg=AOvVaw2OCwXckw6ZG1M-hVlRu7Sd)”; Joel Carpenter, “The Lockheed UFO Case, 1953,” IUR 26, no. 3 (Fall 2001): 6–9, 33; Joel Carpenter, “[The Lockheed UFO Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/The_Lockheed_UFO_case.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922347432&usg=AOvVaw30W1DtHp6Jar3RUPWxB2IM)” 2001; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922347758&usg=AOvVaw2yBvuwQb4oo1F5pqfE0KWH), p. 206)

December 17 — After the crew of a Swedish airliner reports a wingless circular UFO over Hässleholm, Sweden, the Swedish Armed Forces orders a full-scale investigation. Capt. [Ulf Christiernsson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ulf_Christiernsson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922348281&usg=AOvVaw108A9Gclgy6n1lba_CFe2N) says the object is an “entirely unorthodox, metallic, symmetrical, and circular object.” Later reports claim it is a radiosonde balloon. (UFOEv, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D133%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922348735&usg=AOvVaw2oL7xAa67JwqhTROGZe7io) [121](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D133%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922349140&usg=AOvVaw1ZailiVp3010ZSl-kx4fWL); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922349475&usg=AOvVaw3OjQa4D2AMY_CCmVfAzS3s)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922349703&usg=AOvVaw0aKHri0qNvkntutTRM8n_R) p. 206)

December 17 — A memo from [Todos M. Odarenko](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1975/07/08/archives/dr-todos-m-odarenko.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922350211&usg=AOvVaw3jfeSfUHPeXXzxq38teRug)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1975/07/08/archives/dr-todos-m-odarenko.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922350491&usg=AOvVaw0P3-H27M2E8ohvHtIjEZoH) chief of the CIA/OSI physics and electronics division, condescendingly reviews the status of various government UFO efforts. (Todos M. Odarenko, “[Current Status of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/DOC_0005515979.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922350862&usg=AOvVaw1Mzhav5YgzkdIRQFwkZ8JN) [Unidentified Flying Objects (UFOB) Project,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/DOC_0005515979.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922351205&usg=AOvVaw26kbX9Go_erNFF3Mr-u4RZ)” December 17, 1953)

December 23 — USAF Intelligence Col. [George E. Perry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1981/03/16/col-george-perry-dies-taught-math-at-lee-high/b4f4157b-12bd-4762-8631-9c06cca74446/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922351767&usg=AOvVaw0vzwcjbn-z9XMfjRuDMvCi) writes to Gen. [Woodbury M. Burgess](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49223590/woodbury-m-burgess&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922352223&usg=AOvVaw2fXd_it-1Ov11Wg2CqUlti)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49223590/woodbury-m-burgess&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922352491&usg=AOvVaw29TdHqsjhZptCPCKENVwUr) ADC Deputy for Intelligence at Ent AFB \[now the US Olympic Training Center\] in Colorado Springs, Colorado, recommending that when the 4602nd investigates a UFO sighting and it is not a conventional object, personnel should state “The information on this sighting will be analyzed by the Air Technical Intelligence Center at Dayton, Ohio,” and leave it at that. (Col. George E. Perry, [Letter to Brig. Gen. W. M. Burgess](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/foia20.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922353015&usg=AOvVaw3CAmZp8Zm3uBqd9O0Zki1o)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/foia20.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922353272&usg=AOvVaw0HuolKeXax9JeXhZMWMdSf) December 23, 1953)

December 24 — 8:04 a.m. US Navy Lts. J. B. Howard and L. D. Linhard, flying F9F-2 jet fighters, see 10 silver oval objects flying in formation at 450+ mph, straight and level, over El Cajon, California. (NICAP, “[Navy Lts.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/531224elcajon_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922353769&usg=AOvVaw0TxgdMEcAkXQDe2zeUU1IN)

[Encounter 10 Oval Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/531224elcajon_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922354172&usg=AOvVaw3bujp-V7SEjJseCfVjuDfV)”; Sparks, p. 206)

December 26 — The first of a series of articles in the Washington (D.C.) Times-Herald by Richard Reilly questions the Air Force’s openness about UFOs. (Dolan, [p. 145](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufosnationalsecu00dola/page/145/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922355173&usg=AOvVaw3UXBMYrpZj8GLd2VtG_1F_))

December 29 — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922355420&usg=AOvVaw3QOFJKl6Rix3izXZWmJkiI) has a confrontation with [Delos Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1973/06/02/79859540.html?pageNumber%3D34&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922356417&usg=AOvVaw18Ej4Z0ibVPXjSJsMpapeW), the science editor of the United Press wire service, and a UP executive editor. Smith is preparing a three-part series debunking Keyhoe’s claims because a “certain Air Force general swears your book is a complete fraud.” Forewarned by [Frank Edwards](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Edwards_(writer_and_broadcaster)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922356971&usg=AOvVaw1x5Qco0OXn_kPWiGJT6I10), Keyhoe counters his arguments with documentation. (Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922357317&usg=AOvVaw0uU0NiVEJjzy655OMhN11z)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922357577&usg=AOvVaw2YEO5SfsQnHB-h9QKqwmn3) pp. 85–88)

December 30 — 9:05 p.m. Pfc Norman Viet, on guard duty at the tank park in Marine Corps Base Quantico, Virginia, watches a blinking red light about 18 inches in diameter moving slowly over a tree line about 200 feet away. It soon drops down out of sight. Fifteen minutes later it is seen again, rising up and floating toward the tank shed. Viet says it is completely soundless. At 10:15 p.m. it returns, also witnessed by Sgt. Francis R. Salinder, who alerts the base and a combat team searches the area. At midnight, a red light appears above the search area, spooking a guard. (Wilkins, FS Uncensored, Citadel, 1955, [p. 202](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersunc00wilk/page/202/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922358350&usg=AOvVaw0fW97wxvFN2J0EVOhQ9NKq); Washington (D.C.) Daily News, January 5, 1954; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1953, August–December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922358841&usg=AOvVaw3QBy-3niguvdLpOZK2lMnt)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1953-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922359112&usg=AOvVaw3T5N-nChiU5ukM8Tf_X1W7) The Author, 1990, p. 75)

1954

1954 — [Jim and Coral Lorenzen](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://robert-barrow.blogspot.com/2007/05/remembering-coral-lorenzen.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922360067&usg=AOvVaw2moek3MDxzBNgQ1vPl48rq) move from Wisconsin to Alamogordo, New Mexico, to work as civilian employees at Holloman AFB. (Clark III 50)

1954 — Contactee [George Van Tassel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Van_Tassel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922360565&usg=AOvVaw1vPpZunGwR8AcBeuST_isQ) begins building the Integratron at Giant Rock, California, based on the rejuvenation techniques imparted to him by space aliens from Venus. (Wikipedia, “[Integratron](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integratron&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922361002&usg=AOvVaw1nYtNA1Q0imtLOqPHVgH2P)”; Jody Rosen, “[Welcome to the Integratron,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2014/08/20/style/tmagazine/welcome-to-the-integratron.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922361392&usg=AOvVaw3IVm0pr7Dzh0sPgavgLKBj)” New York Times Magazine, August 20, 2014; Lesla Miller Schnur, “[G. W. Van](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thehauntedlibrarian.com/tag/dorris-andre-van-tassel/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922361891&usg=AOvVaw3-m2T1HHq1XJwjHKQH4133) [Tassel’s Integratron,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thehauntedlibrarian.com/tag/dorris-andre-van-tassel/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922362231&usg=AOvVaw2cBMXG5iEmCEYsgnRA5F0-)” The Haunted Librarian, August 27, 2021)

1954 — An official in the UK Deputy Directorate of Intelligence (Technical) mentions to investigator Ronald N. Russell that the DDI has 15,000 reports on file since 1947 stored in nine drawers in three wooden filing cabinets with Yale locks, doubly secured by a hinged plate locked with a large padlock. (John Pitt, “[‘Tell Us Please, Mr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1956%252CSep-Oct%252CV%25202%252CN%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922362780&usg=AOvVaw2P23EGnWCNAXKmYz2LZaYR)

[Birch,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1956%252CSep-Oct%252CV%25202%252CN%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922363226&usg=AOvVaw1MlwCTizuKbE9g5rklOTa-)” Flying Saucer Review 2, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1956): 10–13; Good Above, [p. 33](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/32/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922363680&usg=AOvVaw2GB_zBZANMUE-ht7tBQQC_))

1954 — A promotional photo of a Martin B-57 Canberra bomber taken near Edwards Air Force Base in California shows a saucer-like object in the upper right portion of the frame. No one actually reports seeing the object, which seems to be trailing the B-57 in flight. NICAP photoanalyst Ralph Rankow points out that the object has dimension, does not appear to be a scratch or rub on the film, and has a pattern of light and shadow consistent with the rest of the photo. (Story, [pp. 36–37](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/36/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922364230&usg=AOvVaw1cSb_ah3Ct3uRYM0k08G0B); Robert A. Schmidt, “[The Strange Case of the B-57 Photographs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR-CH%25201971%2520N%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922364581&usg=AOvVaw1MTfnlDc_lq-nAyZoTARbS)” Flying Saucer Review Case Histories, no. 6 (August 1971): 1–2)

1954 — The powerful Type 80 centimetric radars introduced in the UK this year are plagued by radar “angels” that become a hazard for air traffic controllers. A Fighter Command investigation concludes that most of them are caused by migrating seabirds, and others are the result of “anomalous propagation.” Later computers filter out smaller echoes and increase the strength of those created by aircraft. (David Clarke, “Gremlins and Black Projects,” Fortean Times 291 (August 2012): 26–27)

* * *

1954 — After RCAF pilots fail to intercept several UFOs in Canadian air space, the Defence Research Board sets up a restricted landing field near the Suffield Experimental Station \[now CFB Suffield\], Alberta. All RCAF planes and commercial aircraft are restricted from the area. However, the effort is abandoned after the government determines that UFOs are not a national security risk. The project is kept secret until July 1967 when it is revealed by Defence Minister [Paul Hellyer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Hellyer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922365721&usg=AOvVaw1xSktVLJ1CNAaNDvi1RfYb). (“[UFO Landing Site was 13-Year Secret,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/102277109/the-ottawa-journal/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922366081&usg=AOvVaw34PGxepGJ2pnjaWlZ2UyN0)” Ottawa (Ont.) Journal, July 20, 1967, p. 5)

January — [Ed J. Sullivan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://obscurantist.com/oma/csi-la/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922366723&usg=AOvVaw2qf6WvGQaoSLWiMVK3-xxU)‘s Civilian Saucer Investigation Los Angeles disbands. (“[CSI Conclusions,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/CSI%2520Quarterly/CSI%2520Quarterly%2520-%25201954%2520Winter.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922367145&usg=AOvVaw2aoKnlTSaxkxiPmXAX1rct)” Civilian Saucer Investigation Quarterly Bulletin 1, no. 4 (Winter 1954): 7–9)

January — 5:00 a.m. A strange object streaks across the sky over Harts Range, Northern Territory, Australia, seen and heard by four Native Australians. On the same day, an anonymous photographer is taking photos of Mount Gillen, Northern Territory, when suddenly an enormous (150 feet) round object appears from behind it. It moves high, then drops low. He takes a photo, then it shoots off at high speed to the west. The photo, reproduced in the newspaper, shows a dubious-looking round object on edge with six spokes. (Alice Springs Centralian Advocate, January 15, 1954; Alice Springs Centralian Advocate, February 5, 1954; Keith Basterfield, “[Cold Case: The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufos-scientificresearch.blogspot.com/2012/01/cold-case-mount-gillen-photograph-alice.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922368236&usg=AOvVaw3holDiiFOwaLAuhUErKHv6) [Mount Gillen Photograph, Alice Springs, 1954,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufos-scientificresearch.blogspot.com/2012/01/cold-case-mount-gillen-photograph-alice.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922368661&usg=AOvVaw29Ymhsnra_dRCtolmV4bot)” Unidentified Aerial Phenomena–Scientific Research, January 12, 2012)
