At a point 6 miles west of the city, Scarborough sights 16 unidentified objects in groups of four, dead ahead but at higher altitude, 15° above. He radios Capt. Roy L. Jorgensen, whose jet he has in sight by its contrail. Jorgensen, at a higher altitude, sees the UFOs below his left wing. Just as the two pilots try to box in the UFOs, Scarborough sees them fade from glowing white to orange and disappear, apparently speeding away due north.

Triangulation shows that the UFOs were at about 32,000 feet. (“[4 Jet Fighters Report Race with ‘Saucers’ over](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1954a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922467399&usg=AOvVaw1NTRfx1XIP753b8O3mqsO_)

* * *

[Dallas,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1954a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922467860&usg=AOvVaw3oQatGHq_MxhIwT0jAxL4N)” Dallas (Tex.) Times Herald, May 18, 1954; NICAP, “[Four Navy Fighters Encounter 16 UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/540514dallas_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922468321&usg=AOvVaw3qC3BKB-Hg-j-LwJ4i3EI4)”; UFOEv,

[p. 32](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D44%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922468717&usg=AOvVaw1MzY1-VAfYbdVGuYiKMdAE); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922469027&usg=AOvVaw0SRbsFK9qzJrYoI8KJa5L_)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922469256&usg=AOvVaw0sNtTSuyGLdYaKDj4R3tcY) p. 213)

May 15 — Gen. [Nathan F. Twining](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922469674&usg=AOvVaw2CfFYPVckMXijGfJ-21U1Y)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922469964&usg=AOvVaw2CeYQ6WgQ2iiW8k9HMkrnR) USAF Chief of Staff, speaking at an Armed Forces Day dinner at Amarillo AFB \[now Rick Husband Amarillo International Airport\], Texas, says that the Air Force has the best brains in the country working on the “flying saucer problem.” He adds that about 90% of the reports are pure imagination, with the rest unexplained. (“[Air Force Looks into ‘Saucers,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93824927/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922470353&usg=AOvVaw1DSOjlOMU-mdSArYAhIqmk)” Miami (Fla.) Herald, May 17, 1954, p. 38; Keyhoe, [FS](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922470770&usg=AOvVaw10C5WXjRqzUwr2XYdqM-cE) [Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922471121&usg=AOvVaw0g7WdhN2xTzAC7XzImSGE-)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922471452&usg=AOvVaw3_DQiYdibknuq1HZRfdl5q) pp. 145–146)

May 18 — [Frank Edwards](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Edwards_(writer_and_broadcaster)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922472062&usg=AOvVaw1F20KSpM7G2QHjr9HDKfiW) mentions CRIFO on his radio program, and within a week [Stringfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922472510&usg=AOvVaw0RE3w6aPaX_0JGK2PGURlO) gets 6,000 letters. (Stringfield, Situation Red, Fawcett Crest, 1977, pp. 10–11)

May 20 — FBI officials recommend that Attorney General [Herbert Brownell Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herbert_Brownell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922473287&usg=AOvVaw2l6hypvmkV6VzrPo2XPUcM) authorize FBI break-ins to install bugs during national security investigations. The FBI would seek the Attorney General’s prior approval, as with wiretaps. Brownell concurs, but concludes that he “would be in a much better position to defend the Bureau in the event there should be a technical trespass if he had not heretofore approved it.” His directive empowers the FBI to break into homes and offices and install surveillance microphones without having to notify him or obtain advance approval in each case. The FBI has carte blanche on this until 1965. (Bernie Horowitz, “[Wiretapping and J. Edgar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://unredacted.com/2010/12/20/wiretapping-and-j-edgar-hoover/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922473775&usg=AOvVaw1I9V4w91kX64MprvtcLh1y) [Hoover,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://unredacted.com/2010/12/20/wiretapping-and-j-edgar-hoover/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922474103&usg=AOvVaw3a3ZTfjpCgThF24Kp1X0Gb)” Unredacted, December 20, 2010)

May 24 — 12:25 p.m. While flying on a photographic mapping mission 10 miles west-northwest of Richmond, Indiana, in a B-17, USAF Maj. [Leo N. Brubaker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8793163/leo-nace-brubaker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922474507&usg=AOvVaw0gN7_y9fCSpQuwEkNDzhd8) observes and photographs a bright object below the plane for 45 seconds. The aircraft is flying at an altitude of 18,500 feet at 253 mph. The speed of the object is estimated at 506 mph.

The object travels six miles at that speed. The photos are taken with a USAF T-11 mapping camera. Brubaker denies the object is a sundog. (NICAP, “[B-17 Photographic Mission Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/540524richmond_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922474868&usg=AOvVaw1volRPToTHRXr2ZGsEXK0R)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922475081&usg=AOvVaw37YIBQB52HuiZkH0F-cF1c)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922475310&usg=AOvVaw19koFNR2UpaCne0C-PLsDM) p. 213)

May 28 — Test pilot [Arthur W. Murray](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_W._Murray&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922475659&usg=AOvVaw2ncu2ZJ7YHGBi2PO25GlA4) reaches an unofficial record altitude of 90,440 feet in a Bell X-1A. (Wikipedia, “[Arthur W. Murray](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_W._Murray&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922476041&usg=AOvVaw2RlGhauUzsYlr4KzJN0Qy7)”)

May 29–31 — The first conference of European and North American political, business, finance, academic, and media leaders later to become known as the Bilderberg group, meets at the Hotel de Bilderberg in Oosterbeek, Netherlands. Its agenda, originally to prevent another world war, is now defined as bolstering a consensus around free market Western capitalism and its interests around the globe. The first meeting is initiated by several people, including Polish politician-in-exile [Józef Retinger](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J%25C3%25B3zef_Retinger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922477114&usg=AOvVaw0i3MnuaMoVHrWqbSbgCQMN) who, concerned about the growth of anti-Americanism

in Western Europe, proposes an international conference at which leaders from European countries and the United States would be brought together with the aim of promoting Atlanticism. Retinger approaches [Prince Bernhard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_Bernhard_of_Lippe-Biesterfeld&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922478004&usg=AOvVaw2AmLmmbBnybR5-WSCkYMkv) of the Netherlands who agrees to promote the idea, together with former Belgian prime minister [Paul van Zeeland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_van_Zeeland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922478481&usg=AOvVaw2vMunhl8aEfL60OoAvvwzo) and the then-head of Unilever, [Paul Rykens](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Rykens&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922478947&usg=AOvVaw2jhH1_nTLgsfzFBKRo3EMQ)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Rykens&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922479175&usg=AOvVaw0D7Ck8XXZxNXpEP399pLR1) (Wikipedia, “[Bilderberg meeting](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bilderberg_meeting&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922479461&usg=AOvVaw3EQueFR5k0hmIaliwtnxwz)”)

May 30 — 12:25 a.m. David Reese, [Christopher Muir](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christopher_Muir&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922479964&usg=AOvVaw2l0y0Q2OW-FQSEG1f-gtlx), and four others are at the doorstep of a house in East Malvern, Victoria, Australia, when they see an orange, oval-shaped UFO appear in the sky at close range. The UFO maneuvers in a downward curve and then pulls up. A cloud of yellow smoke and flame is seen at the rear. Three of the witnesses see shapes that look like human-shaped shadows inside the craft. (Bill Chalker, The Oz Files: The Australian UFO Story, Duffy and Snellgrove, 1996; UFO Evidence, “Human Figures Seen in Saucer”; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1954 January–May, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFO_History_Gross/1954_01_05_HistorySN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922480640&usg=AOvVaw1FbiM5_sD8OTtEiJEKZQgd), The Author, 2002, pp. 46–50)

Summer — [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922481281&usg=AOvVaw019jZK9BQYZ5uag2EWT-Jl) spends a few months in Noblesville, Indiana, working at Soulcraft Publications, run by mystic and fascist [William Dudley Pelley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Dudley_Pelley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922481660&usg=AOvVaw0V3VX6X3aCoHIlWKGUHbR3)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Dudley_Pelley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922481866&usg=AOvVaw2LjjLxM7r3koq6VhfJlBdd) Mostly he contributes UFO news for the magazine, but some of Pelley’s anti-Semitic attitudes creep into Williamson’s later writings. (Clark III 1285; Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, pp. 100–103)

Summer — Late night. A young girl in Arbutus, Maryland, wakes up when a bright light shines into her bedroom window. Looking outside, she sees a triangle of brilliant white lights parallel to the ground, illuminating everything, hanging in the air, and pointing directly at her. All of a sudden they are gone. Fort the next two days, she has a fever that forces her to stay home from school. (Michael D. Swords, “Timmerman’s Triangles,” IUR 29, no. 2 (Summer 2004): 17)

June 1 — 9:30–9:40 a.m. TWA pilot Capt. [Charles J. Kratovil](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47885416/charles-joseph-kratovil&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922482585&usg=AOvVaw2hgnIBqVwL9uHfxgqUtdJR)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47885416/charles-joseph-kratovil&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922482796&usg=AOvVaw3bBI7rY8We_Y1Inqohqbvo) copilot W. R. Davis, and flight engineer Harold Raney, on a Paris to New York TWA Constellation heading southwest, spot near Boston, Massachusetts, “a large, white- colored disc-like object” overhead, occasionally losing it behind overlying clouds. Flying into west-southwest headwinds at 300 mph, they conclude it cannot be a balloon, and radio Boston airport control tower, which tells them jets are scrambled. They then see the object at about 10,000 feet higher than their 10,000 feet altitude but cannot close with the object. (NICAP, “[TWA Crew Spot White Disc / Kratovil Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/540601boston_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922483212&usg=AOvVaw2ptx9327Z50KhYV0SOdgXF)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922483487&usg=AOvVaw2VCUCrTkdfMzgydOEcmziY), p. 214; James E.

* * *

McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23balloons&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922483888&usg=AOvVaw0EGR59dI9zuO5O5vxQmVye)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 68–69)

June 1 — The Air Force announces that it only received 87 UFO sightings in January–April. (“[Most ‘Saucers’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93830164/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922484381&usg=AOvVaw0qYF5BzscV-HuDxG2suaA6) [Explainable,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93830164/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922484687&usg=AOvVaw3RfYZ6PXF_nct8aVespdd1)” Traverse City (Mich.) Record-Eagle, June 1, 1954, p. 5)

June 5 — 6:23 p.m. Janette Brown, 16, is standing on Princes Highway (M1) at Dandenong, Victoria, Australia, when she hears a loud drumming noise. A large, dark cylinder, about 30 feet long and 15 feet high with a canopy and window on top and a window at each end, appears above a nearby factory. She shines a flashlight on it, and it whirrs toward her. It hovers about 60 feet away. Her friend, Jeanette Johnston, 13, arrives and watches it before it disappears behind trees. Janette’s wristwatch stops, although it starts running again when it is demagnetized. The case is investigated for the RAAF by University of Melbourne physicist O. H. “Harry” Turner. (UFO Evidence, “[Teenage Girls See Saucer](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ufoevidence.org/cases/case19.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922485396&usg=AOvVaw2IUKPRreoaiLkdhvPKDjVL)”)

June 7–8 — PIO Capt. Robert White at the Pentagon repeats the 87 reports statistic from June 1 and counters that reports are at a three-year-low because of less publicity. [Stringfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922485901&usg=AOvVaw2PJgwinsrmqwwIQe22KF_d)’s colleague, Cincinnati, Ohio, businessman Tom Eickhoff, storms into the office of ATIC Deputy Commander of Intelligence Col. [John O’Mara](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/OMara.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922486258&usg=AOvVaw1RTuNz2br1ZXXpL-_4XtBF) and demands that ATIC press legal action against contactees [Truman Bethurum](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truman_Bethurum&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922486712&usg=AOvVaw2whKTY-5dWsCxni_DDI9x3)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truman_Bethurum&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922487015&usg=AOvVaw2GXcSmLvljGvzQnO96bIxI) [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922487410&usg=AOvVaw3b7Kt5aNBMrvSwAVEPlpYH)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922487680&usg=AOvVaw25R1lhK4ULDm0XJicB6oyz) and [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922488085&usg=AOvVaw2W5UD3hX7P2XHVO20Aaqu9)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922488388&usg=AOvVaw0QzATCrrwmAmI9wdBa2d6a) O’Mara replies that these people are obvious hoaxers and need no special action. But he lets slip that USAF fighters regularly carry movie cameras to take photos of UFOs. Eickhoff says that is a big waste of money if there is nothing to UFOs. O’Mara then states to Stringfield the next day that the Air Force actually receives 700 UFO reports a week, the 87 figure only applies to cases under “special analysis,” over 1,000 leading scientists are working on government UFO projects, the material used by [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922488845&usg=AOvVaw0cOQ_DLm2g3EvpfTUAQh8s) in his book was not cleared through official channels, and the Utah film exists but only shows conventional objects. (Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922489225&usg=AOvVaw2fROsprunaedG0o90mPqMt), pp. 157–160; “[700 ‘Saucer’ Sightings Weekly Reported to Air Force,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/Orbit/ORBIT%2520Volume%2520I%25201954-1955R.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922489603&usg=AOvVaw3ThsZzP5vjGTH0K2eNvYJa)” CRIFO Newsletter 1, no. 4 (July 2, 1954): 1; “[Proof of](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/Orbit/ORBIT%2520Volume%2520I%25201954-1955R.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922490081&usg=AOvVaw2rMnJU5McIGDCjA15Wn99O) [Air Force Cover-Up,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/Orbit/ORBIT%2520Volume%2520I%25201954-1955R.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922490412&usg=AOvVaw3UuZwuquAAdYEwYPO7bPkn)” CRIFO Newsletter 1, no. 4 (July 2, 1954): 1–2; Stringfield, Situation Red, Fawcett Crest, 1977, pp. 85, 167–168; Frank Edwards, FS Serious Business, Bantam ed., 1966, [pp. 137–138](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersser00edwa/page/136/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922491145&usg=AOvVaw1WFyQWZpSS7sxGG_bEVJn7); Frank Edwards, Flying Saucers—Here and Now! Lyle Stuart, 1967, [p. 86](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersher00edwa/page/86/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922491714&usg=AOvVaw026K43FocWuvIk56QQKdWF))

June 8 — Contactee Frances Swan of Eliot, Maine, has been in telepathic contact with Affa, a spaceman from Uranus, since 1954. She manages to impress her next-door neighbor, retired Adm. [Herbert B.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Knowles.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922492382&usg=AOvVaw3RaC-6WxLLAvheKjeN9Yth) [Knowles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1976/03/06/75711948.html?pageNumber%3D23&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922492729&usg=AOvVaw2lEhMnaGrj-N9USO78QpUZ), sufficiently for him to write Rear Adm. [Carl F. Espe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://navy.togetherweserved.com/usn/servlet/tws.webapp.WebApp?cmd%3DShadowBoxProfile%26type%3DPerson%26ID%3D525257&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922493141&usg=AOvVaw1bmGPjh1f9jd_LKLwoOYBR), head of the Office of Naval Intelligence. He encloses some of Affa’s transcribed messages and suggests that ONI try to communicate with Affa through Band CMM-306, repeating the signal M4M4 AFFA. Two ONI officers, Captains John Bromley and [Harry Baltazzi](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/18708343/harry-warner-baltazzi&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922493523&usg=AOvVaw3D12hie3l8gvN68rA9AR9C), visit Swan and through her interview Affa, who agrees to communicate with them by radio on June 10. When that does not happen, Espe writes to Knowles saying that ONI will pursue the matter no further. He turns the letters over to the Navy’s Bureau of Aeronautics. (Clark III 1118)

June 9 — Col. [Frank Milani](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/95411954/frank-milani&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922494007&usg=AOvVaw2xYSZbBxk8FISsEu1q0KEb)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/95411954/frank-milani&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922494265&usg=AOvVaw1aX9NphpXGE0mm6XlXKok_) director of Civil Defense in Baltimore, Maryland, demands that the Air Force ease its restrictions on UFO information and blasts its policy on [Lou Corbin](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/corbin/index.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922494579&usg=AOvVaw3qfypXH2s5JLh1Se-n4UOv)’s radio show. (“A Lot of People Are Upset,” Washington (D.C.) Daily News, June 10, 1954; Project 1947, “[UFO Reports, 1954](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/corbin/1954goc.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922495037&usg=AOvVaw3ZsPOK4m7-fx5eynni1vi4)”)

June 12? — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922495472&usg=AOvVaw28b2mNnwVo_u8tR4jSt0Cq) and [Edwards](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Edwards_(writer_and_broadcaster)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922495872&usg=AOvVaw2NZ68qbfMrjIemcBlQhfQY) find out about the [O’Mara](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/OMara.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922496276&usg=AOvVaw2DgGRGnupfIlWYL5_NgNzr) interview, and Edwards puts it on his radio broadcast, generating more press calls to ATIC. Capt. [Charles A. Hardin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49197803/charles-alton-hardin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922496664&usg=AOvVaw0AYB6QlT-P3ANj6Ebz7pFx)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49197803/charles-alton-hardin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922496923&usg=AOvVaw0elDTrEuCns8roKjW82ooR) head of Blue Book, states that “Colonel O’Mara’s words were misinterpreted. What he meant to say was that if all the sightings were reported to the Air Force, they would total about 700 a week.” (Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922497283&usg=AOvVaw3Qx0ST1DNsDKg2FM1kjh2b)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922497532&usg=AOvVaw1o_5QgMD21WVQMCoCAukMw) pp. 157–160; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1954,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1954-June-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922497938&usg=AOvVaw1roEa-wa4lJlxpsBc8QMHY) [June–August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1954-June-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922498246&usg=AOvVaw0uIqGTQcwp-xeGzw7HmRng)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1954-June-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922498503&usg=AOvVaw23tTQEYSzjSjGxNBK3h-Ub) The Author, 1990, pp. 11–14)

June 12 — 11:30 p.m. [Walter L. Tatspaugh](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65740781/walter-ludlow-tatspaugh&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922498900&usg=AOvVaw0EOodoguNrSl95EC82HZKE) of Hyattsville, Maryland, observes a large bluish-green oval or round object circling and hovering in the sky for at least 45 minutes. The Baltimore GOC Filter Center allegedly tracks an object on radar over Wilmington, Delaware, for an hour. Two F-86D fighters are scrambled but cannot reach it. (NICAP, “[Object Tracked / Jets Scrambled](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/540612baltimore_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922499318&usg=AOvVaw2bila3R-qGt38l2GX9IMZR)”; Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922499618&usg=AOvVaw1G5swDL5bLq2uM3uMi5lMN)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922499886&usg=AOvVaw0aug4peLQ43JWx58j8FMtb) pp. 161–162)

June 14 — A UFO is again tracked over Wilmington, Delaware, flying in a rectangular course at 75,000 feet for more than 2 hours. (Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922500396&usg=AOvVaw2xQkW_TFvbBM8TEVuNNLGf), pp. 161–162; UFOEv, [p. 66](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D78%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922500780&usg=AOvVaw2-_lPpHZpbeELADGC1OQE8))

June 18 — 7:35 p.m. Monsignor [Émile Élie Verhille](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/%25C3%2589mile_%25C3%2589lie_Verhille&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922501264&usg=AOvVaw1eaB2YYYzvBLF0bmjNfzao), Apostolic Vicar of Fort-Rousset \[modern Owando, Republic of the Congo\], reports in the Brazzaville newspaper La Semaine de L’akf that he and others had seen a UFO over Laketi Mission in the Mossaka District. A luminous globe arrives from the north and heads towards Laketi. It suddenly stops, rises and falls, stops again, gyrates, and seems to shake. A noise like that of an airplane engine is heard until the moment when it also stops. Seen through binoculars, the object has a dark mass in the center with light rays of unequal length coming out of it alternately. It goes through its maneuvers for 15 minutes then shoots back over the northern horizon. (ClearIntent, [p. 134](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/134/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922501795&usg=AOvVaw04UGOUxjRSwh-VkbYFOAHO))

June 21 — 1:00 a.m. Near Ridgeway, Ontario, [Guy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/157706195/guy-h_-baker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922502258&usg=AOvVaw3jykLe2ElE5X1-6_h0zZAL) and [Valeria Baker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/157706288/valeria-b_-baker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922502681&usg=AOvVaw0pJvAjacP4upgtJV-bTWmu) see a hovering, domed disc about 40 feet in diameter with several rotating, flashing lights around the rim. They drive to get a closer look. The object crosses

* * *

the road in front of them and lands in a field. The car stalls, and they watch as the lights move around the area. They find a large, brown, circular spot in the pasture where the disc has been resting. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922503416&usg=AOvVaw3EB9_3P9Pg1tLCoOdazsxq), pp. 6–7; Mark Rodeghier, [UFO Reports Involving Vehicle Interference](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/books/UFO_REPORTS_INVOLVING_VEHICLE_INTERFERENCE.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922503785&usg=AOvVaw1MHzpkZM_vZ79oNUUzHUL7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/books/UFO_REPORTS_INVOLVING_VEHICLE_INTERFERENCE.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922504081&usg=AOvVaw3sDrH1yLORCdQ67RLyg2zJ) CUFOS, 1981, p. 2; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1954-June-Aug-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922504490&usg=AOvVaw1XoE9tGUKFFvBEa0ieGEQd) [Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1954 June–August, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1954-June-Aug-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922504883&usg=AOvVaw00QRtr7iRObW_6pCScK6nh), The Author, 2002, pp. 12–13)

June 21 — 8:14 p.m. An unidentified radar blip located over central Vancouver Island, British Columbia, responds to coded IFF Mode 1 signals from the Naselle Air Force Station radar site \[now Fort Stevens Historic Site\] in southwestern Washington State, and instantly transmits back the correct coded responses. The blip is tracked on 3 ground radars at both Naselle and McChord AFB \[now Joint Base Lewis-McChord\] in Tacoma. The UFO splits into two (or consists of two objects in close formation), separates, and outmaneuvers one of two F-86D jet interceptors, both of which also radar-tracked the UFOs. Possible visual sightings of the radar target are called in to sheriff’s offices and news media. The case is forwarded to Project Blue Book, but it does not appear in its files. (NICAP, “[Coded IFF Signal from UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/540622wash_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922505482&usg=AOvVaw2YSssNsD703sZLylCpIZVa)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922505765&usg=AOvVaw2EEC6W75MBl7WpbC7YzC6U)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922506005&usg=AOvVaw1safDZBDm1uNdSMel664Bu) p. 215)

June 23 — 8:00 or 9:00 p.m. Pilot Capt. [Harry Roe Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/137887279/harry-l_-roe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922506498&usg=AOvVaw3FRUYX7jxSFAToKxeiSjj_)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/137887279/harry-l_-roe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922506756&usg=AOvVaw3vl44OLdQPnoTYreJcTAyc) flying an Ohio Air National Guard F-51 Mustang fighter at 240 mph from Dayton to Columbus, Ohio, sees a round white object with no exhaust trailing him in the same position a little above and behind at close range, possibly detected on airborne radar. Roe maneuvers to try to lose it or collide with it, but the UFO remains in relatively the same position until it departs to the southeast. S/Sgt Maynard Harris at Wright-Patterson AFB picks up the plane and the UFO on radar. He scrambles two F-86s in the Columbus area to check it out, but they see nothing. At 10:00 p.m., Maj. Frank J. Gshwandtner and 2nd Lt.

Robert P. Lommori, flying in the Columbus area in an RB-47E aircraft, observe a white object the size of a baseball at 25,000 feet. The object is extremely fast and makes a gradual turn to begin a slight climb. It then flies out of sight. The duration is 30 seconds. (NICAP, “[F-51 Trailed by Object / Lt. Roe Sighting](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/540623columbus_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922507362&usg=AOvVaw0J78_0-VBZoLTARYqbp-_t)”; NICAP, “[Something Follows C-47 and Observed by RB-47 Crew](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/540623columbus2_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922507681&usg=AOvVaw17giC7ZDPoWGFrhEc28mGP)”; Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922508043&usg=AOvVaw2ZaNFnouHxEXQ0gJWdYAV6), pp. 167–168; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922508408&usg=AOvVaw22ElG0PuZP7eUISXSZSM5d), p. 216)

Late June — Some 300 people in West Berlin, Germany, see three silvery UFOs on several occasions. Moving in a zigzag motion and accelerating at high speed. Rudolf Hermes, a director at Tempelhof Airport \[now closed\], says the witnesses describe the objects as “shiny.” (“[Triangle Saucers Reported Seen near Berlin,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/98856881/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922508733&usg=AOvVaw0SElH7WbmTczxvMZd27aSL)” Lancaster (Pa.) Sunday News, July 4, 1954, p. 19)

June 26 — 12:40 a.m. The Atomic Energy Commission’s National Reactor Testing Station near Idaho Falls, Idaho, is suddenly lit up by a blinding glow that explodes in the night sky. Kelly Brooks and A. L. Taylor say the source of the light remains motionless for a few seconds, then shoots upwards at a tremendous speed. (Keyhoe, [FS](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922509398&usg=AOvVaw0dQDYv4P6QqXCkHrPDsSGe) [Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922509695&usg=AOvVaw3Ikh65j6IvQXXDhyLf9hIL)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922509952&usg=AOvVaw14Vdw3KY0RNwJmjJiM3loE) p. 168)

June 26 — Around 7:30 a.m. A metallic blob is seen high in the sky near Columbus, Ohio. According to a newspaper article, a crew of an airliner is asked to investigate; the crew circles under the object while the 60 passengers take a look. Zanesville Radio says at 5:55 a.m. a round, silvery object is detected on an azimuth of 80°. At 5:35 a.m., an Air Force charter flight, No. 46 AF 23-24 to Wilmington, Delaware, flying at 3,000 feet observes an object in the Zanesville, Ohio, area at approximately 18,000 to 20,000 feet. (NICAP, “[Airliner Investigates Strange](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/540626ohio_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922510534&usg=AOvVaw02unCze8wkU2cYI90M8IKb) [Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/540626ohio_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922510853&usg=AOvVaw1-KT_3_WqDoMT1lX_iKUnQ)”)

June 27 — The Obninsk Nuclear Power Plant, at the Institute of Physics and Power Engineering in Obninsk, Kaluga Oblast, Russia, becomes the first grid-connected nuclear power plant in the world. The plan achieves criticality on May 6 and now is set up to provide electrical power to Moscow. (Wikipedia, “[Obninsk Nuclear Power Plant](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Obninsk_Nuclear_Power_Plant&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922511356&usg=AOvVaw0vHiNxgG_lxW7ImPDSfD70)”)

June 29 — 5:03 p.m. A BOAC Stratocruiser leaves New York City bound for London, England. 30 minutes later, Capt. James R. Howard receives directions from Boston Air Traffic Center to hold his position over the Rhode Island coast. Howard circles for 10–12 minutes, after which Boston tells him to detour over Cape Cod, Massachusetts. Around 11:30 p.m. while crossing at 19,000 feet near Sept-Îles, Quebec, Howard, his copilot Lee Boyd, and navigator H. McDonnell see a large cigar-shaped object and six smaller black ovals moving the same speed as his airliner, 265 mph, on a parallel course. The small objects are strung out in a line, changing relative positions but always at the same level. The large object slowly and continually changes shape, “in a way that a swarm of bees might alter its appearance.” They appear opaque, hard-edged, gray in color, with no lights or flames visible.

Goose Bay AFB \[now CFB Goose Bay\], Labrador, orders an F-94 to vector toward the location. Just as Howard is giving the pilot his position, the small objects disappear. McDonnell says they enter the large object. As the F- 94 approaches, the large object dwindles in size and disappears. Howard lands at Goose Bay and is questioned by RCAF and USAF officials (McConnell says they take the flight logs); when he lands in London, the Air Ministry does the same, telling the pilots they viewed a solar eclipse (which took place at 7:00 a.m. on June 30). Howard later hears that there are UFO sightings in Massachusetts while he is in a holding pattern, and he contests in the December 11 issue of Everybody’s Magazine that what he saw was solid, not a mirage. [Gordon Thayer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/t/ThayerGordonD/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922512445&usg=AOvVaw2NJrDkXMpsg5lcU2zRD-QG) of the Colorado project identifies the objects as superior mirages, reflections of the “dark terrain below seen against the

* * *

bright, ‘silvery’ sky to the left of the setting sun,” a “phenomenon so rare that it apparently has never been reported before or since.” [James McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922513098&usg=AOvVaw3f1zC-FLCIQHeqpQzbUxx6) disagrees. In 2010, ufologist [Martin Shough](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/shough.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922513548&usg=AOvVaw2-Q3K64HXh84tmuClfg2er) reexamines the case and concludes that the object might well have been an unusual mirage. (NICAP, “[BOAC Stratocruiser Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/540629boac_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922513993&usg=AOvVaw06mToX3fbCMMBEzLz3FS4i)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922514327&usg=AOvVaw3oApl2WMFpCzOe54ZS5YKr),

p. 216; Clark III 195; Condon, [pp. 139–140](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/138/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922514782&usg=AOvVaw2f3gpr8X_HVXiXer15yr7R); James Howard, “We Were Shadowed from Outer Space,” Everybody’s Weekly, December 11, 1954; John Carnell, “[BOAC’s Flying Jellyfish,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/fate-1954-11_202110/page/16/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922515260&usg=AOvVaw0prmKF90NKl_aivB79P7FE)” Fate 7, no. 11 (November 1954): 16–23; Leonard Cramp, “[Mystery over Labrador,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1955%252CMar-Apr%252CV%25201%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922515736&usg=AOvVaw2LL9xg7NKPnc5_2vk8rvm-)” Flying Saucer Review 1, no. 1 (Spring 1955): 6–8; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23pilots&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922516277&usg=AOvVaw0Uy1S2OYPYTm4-CwWsIvuc)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, p. 46; “[Captain James Howard Reflects on His Sighting of 1954 (BOAC),](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3D6Oq_iWc0HTM&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922516782&usg=AOvVaw1pG-Y-xoyFC16329ts878c)” nutsandbolts ufo YouTube channel, March 7, 2009; Good Above, [pp. 189–191](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/188/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922517163&usg=AOvVaw0YCIYAqykkJ32fBqM7IQ5s); Phillip Robertson, “[Some Considerations on the Seven Isles, Quebec,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/robertson_boac.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922517502&usg=AOvVaw2IwrT8EGrE9P1mPqPAY7_D) [Canada, Case of June 29, 1954,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/robertson_boac.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922517791&usg=AOvVaw187JvIVvdstGnogDWsypO2)” May 31, 1991; Martin Shough, “[Study of an Unusual Phenomenon Observed by](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.martinshough.com/aerialphenomena/BOAC%2520aircrew%2520sighting.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922518168&usg=AOvVaw1KE-mF61f0DE_iAoXz9iA4) [BOAC Aircrew over Labrador, Newfoundland, June 29, 1954,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.martinshough.com/aerialphenomena/BOAC%2520aircrew%2520sighting.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922518543&usg=AOvVaw2ZWug41o8HbnTvkUYdR2Y_)” September 2009; Martin Shough, “[The BOAC](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.caelestia.be/BOAC.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922518863&usg=AOvVaw1aDI3Es9_JrVfxtpcpIf5Z) [Labrador Sighting of June 29, 1954,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.caelestia.be/BOAC.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922519183&usg=AOvVaw2GJ8Wu7SWYg0IjlVce7zq2)” Caelestia, October 31, 2018)

June 30 — 2:17 p.m. Johnny Björnulf and Raun Conradi are aboard one of three Scandinavian Airlines planes flying above the Lifjell plateau, Telemark, Norway, to observe a total solar eclipse. Conradi takes some footage through a window on the north (port) side of one airplane. When developed it shows two small light sources that are fairly obvious window reflections, but media coverage causes much confusion about the circumstances under which the film is shot. (E. Graham, “[Scandinavian Eclipse Expedition Films U.F.O.s,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1956%252CJan-Feb%252CV%25202%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922519914&usg=AOvVaw1wF7LfLXcCo-FbhoyL4GbU)” Flying Saucer Review 2, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1956): 6–7; UFOEv, [p. 5](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D17%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922520393&usg=AOvVaw35GF2NHCWNoA6lIr0_w1B1); Clas Svahn, “[The Björnulf Solar Eclipse Film,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://csblogg.ufo.se/csblogg3/?p%3D5240&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922520702&usg=AOvVaw35Lq8Fn9FsLpE9-D-8dLok)” Clas Svahns Blogg, October 6, 2006)

June 30 — 6:50 p.m. Four civilians and several military personnel at Brookley AFB \[now Mobile Aeroplex at Brookley\] in Mobile, Alabama, see a brilliant silver or white object with short stubby wings approach from the south, circle over Mobile, then depart to the northeast. A radar contact at 6:30 p.m. with a stationary object is evidently unrelated anomalous propagation. (NICAP, “[Object with Short Stubby Wings Tracked on Radar](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/540630mobile_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922521278&usg=AOvVaw02BUUKQY2ko9V0H5u6VdU1)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922521536&usg=AOvVaw2U0-gWytvk8bl9IwA_lmqY), p. 216)

Summer (or Summer 1955) — Evening. Dianne Vezza and two other teen girls are sitting in a backyard in Marietta, Ohio, when they see a star-like light moving at great speed. Suddenly it comes to a dead stop and two other stars speed in and come to an abrupt stop. The three objects form a perfect triangle. An oval object then becomes visible as the starlike objects disappear. Two other oval objects take up the same triangular position with the first. They then begin a light display with wildly colored lights that continues for a few seconds. The lights go out, and each of the objects beams a bright white light to the center of the triangle. The beams meet in the center for a few seconds and then go out. The oval objects disappear and the starlike lights return, but they soon speed off in different directions faster than a jet. The display is completely soundless. (Michael D. Swords, “Another Type of UFO Display,” IUR 30, no. 2 (January 2006): 11)

July — A saucer-buff zine titled Nexus is first published by [James W. Moseley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_W._Moseley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922522502&usg=AOvVaw0q4wveVtSiTAywbZ96m7Wp) in New Jersey. ([Nexus](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/Nexus/1954_07_00_Nexus01.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922522844&usg=AOvVaw0DT7otz2c9mVRUlUcl_ouZ) 1, no. 1 (July 1954); Clark III 1032)

July 2 — 11:05 a.m. An F-94C Starfire takes off from Griffiss AFB \[now Griffiss Business and Technology Park\] in Rome, New York, on an operational training mission. It is only a few miles out when the Griffiss control tower orders the plane diverted to intercept an unidentified aircraft. When Pilot Lt. William E. Atkins cannot find the aircraft, the controller tells him about a second unidentified aircraft, which Atkins identifies as an Air Force C-47. The control tower vectors him back to the first target. Atkins cannot see any aircraft above the cloud cover, so he descends below the clouds. During the descent, a furnace-like heat fills the cockpit and the engine plenum chamber fire warning light goes on. Atkins shuts the engine off, but the light remains on. Atkins and his radar man, Henry F. Coudon \[or Condon\], eject, landing without injury. At 11:27 a.m., the plane crashes into the town of Walesville, west of Utica, striking a building and an auto, killing 4 people, and injuring 5 others. Atkins tells reporters about the heat but clams up under Air Force pressure. The official investigation confirms the fire was caused by a malfunction of the fire detector circuit. There is no evidence of an in-flight fire. [Kevin Randle](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kevin_D._Randle&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922523416&usg=AOvVaw1mnsUu4MzewoL4RUEzhMHV) suspects a balloon is responsible for one of the radar targets, because an apparent balloon is sighted later, from 6:00 to 10:00 p.m., in a 25-square-mile area from Rome to Frankfort, New York. (“[Abandoned Jet Kills 3 in Car,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1954/07/03/84614854.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922523857&usg=AOvVaw1eZ7ClMwYvDMi0-8DDB_36) [1 in House,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1954/07/03/84614854.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922524160&usg=AOvVaw1n3HURpc21pjaldgp2lurK)” New York Times, July 3, 1954, pp. 1, 6; “[Jet Plane Crashes in Flames,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93872663/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922524613&usg=AOvVaw3eQ10z1Zt2XSl_aI1IThZM) [Kills 3 in Auto, One in](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93872710/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922524935&usg=AOvVaw2t3qov0VRCux3uO-1lZ4kS) [House,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93872710/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922525224&usg=AOvVaw1nJG_pwI47vxacxbHRWcrh)” Syracuse (N.Y.) Post-Standard, July 3, 1954, pp. 1, 3; NICAP, “[The Walesville Incident / F-94 Crash](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/540702walesville_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922525670&usg=AOvVaw0-joTYn26FqWpKpw9b2_Mn)”; Kevin D. Randle, “Walesville Revisited,” IUR 25, no. 3 (Fall 2000): 3–5; Frank J. Reid, “Keyhoe’s Context,” IUR 25, no. 3 (Fall 2000): 6–7, 28–29; Kevin D. Randle, “[Walesville UFO Jet Chase,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2009/03/walesville-ufo-jet-chase.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922526309&usg=AOvVaw1NqUpdNwoD0njTQ0oGNUsu)” A Different Perspective, March 28, 2009; Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922526669&usg=AOvVaw1XjMo7aDWXPPgS34eIbmt9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922526944&usg=AOvVaw3wkAPXRD1qCtsP5TtxCdSp) pp. 174–177; Condon, [p. 161](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/160/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922527366&usg=AOvVaw3jNIxjiGNbE4vV2fR9_KVj); Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974,

[pp. 22–23](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/22/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922527942&usg=AOvVaw3cG8OIaTgvbOnXkpNpjbbz); “[‘Balloon’ Excites Utica,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1954/07/03/84615056.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922528281&usg=AOvVaw0X6_9A2Drza2LtPRcVmU4F)” New York Times, July 3, 1954, p. 13)

* * *

July 3 — Nine green spheres hover, speed away at 2,600 mph, and are tracked on radar at 24,000 feet 20 miles north of Albuquerque, New Mexico. (UFOEv, [p. 85](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D97%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922529035&usg=AOvVaw2r0jkPkt7pcZ-JLPhV2_bE))

July 3 — 8:15 a.m. The captain, officers, and 463 passengers of a Dutch ocean liner watch a “greenish-colored, saucer- shaped object about half the size of a full moon” speed across the sky and disappear in clouds. \[same as July 29 entry?\] (Ruppelt, [p. 237](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/236/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922529546&usg=AOvVaw1dGvfkXK_cARv5pKqoU5B8))

July 8 — 9:25 p.m. Amateur astronomer [Harold Hill](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://adsabs.harvard.edu/full/2006JBAA..116..203S&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922530000&usg=AOvVaw3gefRwVWVone630lbCEOvI) is at his observatory in Orrell, Greater Manchester, England, when he sees a bright star in the southern sky that he at first thinks is a supernova. Soon it resolves itself into a bright, metallic globe with a cluster of 15–20 smaller, dimmer objects moving around. Clouds intervene and when they clear, he sees two bright objects, gyrating and flashing and moving slowly around each other. The objects are at a great altitude, because even through binoculars they have “shown no sensible size.” (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-1959-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922530562&usg=AOvVaw3epiygD6V2WfYhPa5X8pjx) [Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: January 1, 1947–December 31, 1959](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-1959-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922530942&usg=AOvVaw06IjdqLbilq4EFljzA_-Y4)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-1959-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922531182&usg=AOvVaw2ixw4TfB4MBdwheONJPibU) The Author, 2003, pp. 80– 81; “An Unusual Sky Phenomenon,” Strolling Astronomer 9 (1955): 48)

July 9 — Die Weltwoche in Zürich, Switzerland, publishes two letters by psychologist [Carl Jung](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Jung&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922531804&usg=AOvVaw3oTVVtqCy8f7nWemzmgZCF), who says he has been interested in UFOs since 1946, but he has difficulty comprehending what they might be, since they seem to have both subjective and objective properties. (Clark III 636–637)

July 11 — UK Air Chief Marshal [Hugh Dowding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_Dowding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922532128&usg=AOvVaw10wglxynkmegevTv62LR8a) states in an article in the London Sunday Telegraph that “I am convinced that these objects do exist and that they are not manufactured by any nation on earth. I can therefore see no alternative to accepting the theory that they come from some extraterrestrial source.” (UFOEv, [p. 122](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D134%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922532555&usg=AOvVaw3D0i12tmR2XRXdAQqxb59M); Good Above, [pp. 47–48](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/46/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922532894&usg=AOvVaw23KTVmJ3iELAitZwdblLE5))

July 14 — A fake memo, supposedly written by or for [Robert Cutler](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Cutler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922533333&usg=AOvVaw2X5km_2gPenmJQSZynAUFN)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Cutler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922533587&usg=AOvVaw0HQqfCBC-qdB5lWx_jt4wF) special assistant to President [Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922533929&usg=AOvVaw3L7g535m0u5ysDzuvJlqYZ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922534205&usg=AOvVaw2izJXVR9JId13Br8HGaeAw) to Gen.

[Nathan Twining](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922534682&usg=AOvVaw0Lt-2Zew6-FZt1tWy5uq8o)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922534974&usg=AOvVaw1vlr3MtIBZ_m5tED_MFaAD) indicates that an MJ-12 briefing should take place at the White House July 16. Cutler is in Europe at the time of the memo, although the memo could have been prepared by NSC Executive Secretary [James](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.arlingtoncemetery.net/jslayjr.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922535359&usg=AOvVaw3_VRb4vOW8vH0sqB5mnBiT)

[S. Lay Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.arlingtoncemetery.net/jslayjr.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922535756&usg=AOvVaw3BqOGvztLP3-WZYn9zvfL7) or his associate, J. Patrick Coyne. (Robert Cutler, “[Memorandum for General Twining: NSC/MJ-12](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://brumac.mysite.com/CutlerTwiningMemo/CutlerTwining.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922536199&usg=AOvVaw3RvAvnsc-z0Kq2Z6daSwHQ) [Special Studies Project,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://brumac.mysite.com/CutlerTwiningMemo/CutlerTwining.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922536567&usg=AOvVaw2cPR3Klvk6Zp7O2GZe9f6o)” July 14, 1954; Northern Ontario UFO Research and Study, “[Majestic-12](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/majestic-12.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922536900&usg=AOvVaw21qDSflIhkApDgVRv1Mhcf)”; Stanton T. Friedman, “MJ-12: The Evidence So Far,” IUR 12, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1987): 14–18; Stanton T. Friedman, Top Secret / MAJIC, Marlowe, 1996, [pp. 86–102](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/topsecretmajic0000frie/page/86/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922537536&usg=AOvVaw3W1pFRHTmM3eTeiBuW4G8o); “[Majestic-12 or ‘MJ-12’ Reference Report,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.archives.gov/research/military/air-force/ufos%23mj12&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922537940&usg=AOvVaw3dYpw1gyq6Dhx14PP7R80d)” US National Archives, September 29, 2020)

July 20 — Two men are chased in their car by a UFO near Oslo, Norway, and stop to observe it. Afterward, one of the witnesses’ watches stops working and the car’s paint changes color. (Vallée, Magonia, [p. 207](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/passporttomagoni0000vall/page/206/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922538548&usg=AOvVaw1h3g4VxtaXO0jDOOJjImZ5))

July 20–21 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922539030&usg=AOvVaw0kDp6pmF6YDdPBRyTdM6hM) visits the Project Blue Book office at Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio to gather information for his upcoming book. He is told that all UFO publicity is handled by a lieutenant colonel in Air Force intelligence. He writes in an August 3 letter to [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922539455&usg=AOvVaw1x_AXikMW9Rqlzc1ehix_R): “They claim to have gotten the unknowns down to about 10% but from what I saw this was just due to a more skeptical attitude. The reports are just as good as the ones we got and their analysis procedures are a hell of a lot worse.” (Donald E. Keyhoe, “[The Captain Ruppelt Letters,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/014%2520OCT%25201961.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922539861&usg=AOvVaw20pttFxMAXd5Cg4Wx99P2j)” UFO Investigator 2, no. 2 (October 1961): 6; Clark III 1023)

July 23 —The US Navy issues a new directive that orders the immediate reporting of UFO sightings (FLYOBRPTs) to the director of AFOSI, ATIC, commanding officer of Eastern ADC, director of Naval Intelligence, commanding officer of the Eastern Sea Frontier, and the commandant of the Potomac River Naval Command. The directive cites JANAP 146, AFR 200-2, OPNAV 3820, and Directive 3820.2 and is intended to plug leaks coming from navy and marine personnel. It is unpublicized but unclassified, so it threatens disclosure of AFR 200-2, which is still classified. USAF begins work on a new version of AFR 200-2 without the “restricted” label. (Keyhoe, [FS](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922540552&usg=AOvVaw17ZYQpzyRNJugGUJbah3VO) [Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922540925&usg=AOvVaw3zDPlefyB6-khUQKtvfGU9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922541190&usg=AOvVaw0qqEeZrASmy7xjyve75Lmx) pp. 188–189, 309–311)

July 24–25 — A security officer at the Naval Bureau of Aeronautics develops a personal interest in the Frances Swan contact case and accepts Adm. [Knowles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1976/03/06/75711948.html?pageNumber%3D23&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922541786&usg=AOvVaw3H-MRKiOBaCasav6uCFWoZ)’s invitation to Eliot, Maine, to visit with Swan. On his return, he gives the FBI a report on his visit. On July 29 an FBI agent interviews him, and on August 9 [J. Edgar Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922542167&usg=AOvVaw3AoVTLgfeZrmCUbMX1vMae) sends an account of the interview to Rear Adm. [Carl F. Espe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://navy.togetherweserved.com/usn/servlet/tws.webapp.WebApp?cmd%3DShadowBoxProfile%26type%3DPerson%26ID%3D525257&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922542605&usg=AOvVaw0oCjJdyd-5Xa3FOPESiyEU) and to the Army’s Assistant Chief of Staff, G-2. Hoover writes, “No further action is being taken in this matter by this Bureau.” (Clark III 1118)

July 25 — Policeman J. H. Flanagan and friends see 6 UFOs over Enkeldoorn \[now Chivhu\], Zimbabwe. Nearly stationary, they are visible for about 20 minutes and disappear when night falls. (ClearIntent, [p. 134](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/134/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922543234&usg=AOvVaw2jrrwQERCy9ud8DPXKdeYg))

July 28 — [Wilbert Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922543685&usg=AOvVaw2KKP0kh79mDQlMb38TVynU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922543929&usg=AOvVaw3p1V9UURyg91nxSPPZ-TXW) at the invitation of retired Navy Adm. [Herbert B. Knowles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1976/03/06/75711948.html?pageNumber%3D23&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922544307&usg=AOvVaw1_UVeApadjcFQZvRIATAYT)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1976/03/06/75711948.html?pageNumber%3D23&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922544604&usg=AOvVaw0VZEjqeHHk-tz9b9i8mBbG) visits contactee Frances Swan in Eliot, Maine, his neighbor. Her two space friends, Affa and Alomar, direct Swan’s hand to draw a series of circles demonstrating the use of magnetic fields in spacecraft propulsion. Smith asks the aliens to communicate by radio at an appointed time a few days later, but the message does not come through. Nevertheless, Smith attempts to decipher the alien charts in hopes of learning how to build a saucer for Canada. (Clark III 1079–1080, 1118)

July 29 — Capt. Jan P. Bos and five officers of the Dutch ocean liner [Groote Beer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Groote_Beer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922545172&usg=AOvVaw18k9VyQr7qHra8iPg-eafn) see a moon-like object rising out of the Atlantic Ocean 90 miles east of Cape Cod, Massachusetts. They watch it through a sextant, allowing them to

* * *

estimate its rate of ascent at a half degree in 2 minutes. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1954, June–August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1954-June-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922545879&usg=AOvVaw2ghad8Kg58bZt4N0kJukgd), The Author, 1990, p. 60)

August — 10:30 p.m. An astronomer sees a bright white disc, 20 times the apparent size of the moon, moving from west to northeast at a high rate of speed over Park Hills, Kentucky. The seemingly solid object is about 100 feet in diameter and flying at an altitude of 500 feet. It disappears abruptly after 3–4 seconds. (“Astronomers and UFO’s: A Survey, Part 2, Sightings,” IUR 2, no. 4 (April 1977): 3)

August 1 — 11:15 p.m. Desmond O’Reilly and others at Templeogue Tennis Club in Dublin, Ireland, watch an object fly over the Dublin Mountains in the direction of Howth. Initially he thinks he is looking at a meteor because he can only see it when it passes by gaps in the clouds. He watches it split into two pieces. (Irish Times, August 5, 1954; Shane Cochrane, “Ireland vs. the Flying Saucers,” Fortean Times 317 (September 2014): 54)

August 1 — 11:30 p.m. P. D. McCormack sees a bluish-white object flying at 1,000 mph at an altitude of 5,000 feet above the Dublin Mountains, Ireland, to the south. The trails seem to “fall away from the object at each side.” Two men fishing in the River Dargle near Powerscourt, County Wicklow, see a rocket-shaped object dropping balls of fire. At 11:35 p.m., on the North Beach in Rush, County Dublin, Mrs. W. Gray and others watch an object “like a bright electric bulb” fly overhead from the mountains and out to sea. Possible meteor. (Irish Times, August 3, 5, 1954; Shane Cochrane, “Ireland vs. the Flying Saucers,” Fortean Times 317 (September 2014): 54)

August 2 — The US Joint Chiefs of Staff direct the establishment of a Continental Air Defense Command. Secretary of Defense [Charles Erwin Wilson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Erwin_Wilson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922547644&usg=AOvVaw2eVSVCjGgaMQOOUvweIddR) announces the command’s formation publicly later in the month to integrate “the air defense capabilities of the three military departments into an air defense system responsible to the control of one military commander.” (Wikipedia, “[Continental Air Defense Command](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continental_Air_Defense_Command&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922548121&usg=AOvVaw25f21FKEv_yOePP1CW-g8X)”)

August 4 — 11:00 p.m.–12:00 midnight. Ten firemen and their chief observe two flying saucers over The Hague, Netherlands. The objects are seen in the clear night air at a high altitude. They move at incredible speed, at times remaining motionless for as long as 30 seconds. They are described as flat ovals with whitish-gray light. All agree that the objects are neither aircraft or balloons. (ClearIntent, [p. 134](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/134/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922548669&usg=AOvVaw2Z7JMcyuN_GMA0ko5HTbBV))

August 6 — A bright white ball shoots across the sky over Santa Fe, New Mexico, leaving a luminous trail that persists for 15 minutes. Meteorite expert [Lincoln LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922549142&usg=AOvVaw08Ob0b3oXH_ejE5xZiZWC6) says it is not a meteor. It apparently disrupts TV signals and aircraft transmissions, but not ham radio. (Wilkins, FS Uncensored, Citadel, 1955, [p. 226](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersunc00wilk/page/226/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922549607&usg=AOvVaw3PApvrpKkPqGG8ca7luJPU))

August 7–8 — One of the first UFO meetings in California is held on the slopes of Palomar Mountain, with lectures by [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922549930&usg=AOvVaw3q7gd2jhg42hkMpxRbQ7pU), [Daniel Fry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_Fry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922550100&usg=AOvVaw034xrNqSSzMiYelO-4Plf9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_Fry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922550327&usg=AOvVaw1415X84Ig8NfafX1Os-tcq) [Truman Bethurum](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truman_Bethurum&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922550521&usg=AOvVaw34CItvde4UOzXdY0eR9rSL)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truman_Bethurum&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922550682&usg=AOvVaw0wBtT8kNr72YbXniaCZ0KE) and [Desmond Leslie](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desmond_Leslie&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922550987&usg=AOvVaw0XMG_br5roT9QuOvnfoQ7l). (“[Palomar Mountain, 1940–1960: From](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/mount-palomar/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922551278&usg=AOvVaw30DU7Eo_MptPjaZWsigX9g) [Obscurity to World Fame,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/mount-palomar/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922551565&usg=AOvVaw1V0vt4J8abUU-C2u6sW2NJ)” The Adamski Case, September 22, 2019)

August 8 — 3:01 p.m. Project Magnet’s only UFO incident of note occurs when the Shirley’s Bay, Ontario, gravimeter indicates a greater deflection in the gravitational field than a conventional object would cause. Heavy clouds obstruct [Wilbert Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922551943&usg=AOvVaw3H80MHK9omxXJSWdplOOCf)’s view of the sky. (Clark III 1079; “[Wilbert B. Smith,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922552255&usg=AOvVaw0qUZNnSEFzXP3AIdFh53L8)” Northern Ontario UFO Research and Study; Good Above, [p. 186](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/186/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922552618&usg=AOvVaw1yx1Ck5wYiNQrVjJ_YRFpz))

August 10 — The Canadian Department of Transport officially folds Project Magnet but permits [Wilbert Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922553065&usg=AOvVaw2POFvsfFiItmNwfG3x7b1t) to continue using its facility on his own time at no expense to the government. Smith continues his work privately until his death in December 1962. (Story, [p. 276](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/276/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922553481&usg=AOvVaw0EzoWeLPzlgXoaesPlPojB))

August 11 — [Frank Edwards](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Edwards_(writer_and_broadcaster)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922554054&usg=AOvVaw26kSMFj2Vh4LF3X3VyegPH) is fired by his sponsor at the Mutual Broadcasting Network, the American Federation of Labor. He had offered to resign on August 7, citing a conflict over the type of material he has been required to report on, including AFL interests and [George Meany](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Meany&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922554500&usg=AOvVaw2k16MQAaxltVSBHY466iI1)’s personal outlook. His UFO reportage may or may not be an issue. (Clark III 435; Frank Edwards, “[The Plot to Silence Me,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/fate-1957-06/page/16/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922554873&usg=AOvVaw1q1Z3LRmoTi92w-z4N0SOH)” Fate 10, no. 6 (June 1957): 17–23)

August 11 — 8:54 p.m. A1C Chase E. Lewis, tower operator at Lawson AFB \[now Lawson Army Airfield\] in Fort Benning, Columbus, Georgia, sees a strange stationary object in the west. It varies in brightness, changing color from white to red to orange to white again, with seemingly high-speed motions. An Army helicopter piloted by WO R. T. Wade is sent to investigate; he locates the object 20 miles west of Lawson at 2,000 feet. Wade abandons the chase due to low fuel after 2 minutes. At 9:05 p.m., two additional tower operators (including A1C William N. Watson) view the object. A second Army helicopter, piloted by U. S. Tarma, is diverted to the object at 9:27 p.m. He sees it, but it disappears at 9:29 p.m. (NICAP, “[Two Helicopters Encounter Venus (CIRVIS)](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/540811lawson_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922555545&usg=AOvVaw3jfojKd6LSPmxFjreo6X2a)”; Good Above, [pp. 284–285](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/284/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922555890&usg=AOvVaw3h8FFaIex_MNg-8d46549z); Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1954, June–August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1954-June-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922556245&usg=AOvVaw0x6LiOMWfNuHD-Jn1X14Qk), The Author, 1990, pp. 77–80; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922556556&usg=AOvVaw09JMthfJGsCziNwjR2Xdfi)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922556790&usg=AOvVaw39B29HGsDyw1yKobMXRqN_) p. 219)

August 11 — 8:55 p.m. P. L. Percharde, electrical engineer and assistant manager of the Moeller Shipwrecker Company, of Okinawa, sees a line of blue lights underneath a blue circle with a black center fly over the SS Docteur Angier off Yoron-Jima, Japan, and climb, illuminating and agitating the clouds. (Patrick Gross, “[Disk Seen from SS](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/drangier54.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922557456&usg=AOvVaw2lxUM1Ku8N6GmT436QMuuY) [Docteur Angier, August 11, 1954](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/drangier54.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922557775&usg=AOvVaw1chOC7BKBAwaHcAbRzQla2)”; Sparks, [p. 219](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922558080&usg=AOvVaw1SICe678uFX2RArCa78L_O))

* * *

August 12 — 2:29 a.m. Four military men on US Army helicopters at Maxwell AFB in Montgomery, Alabama, see a glowing red disc soar around the base tower. There are both ground and air witnesses, as well as radar-visual confirmation. (Good Above, [pp. 284–285](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/284/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922558695&usg=AOvVaw3Lpsj5xleXwzOvxZkaF_th)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/284/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922558977&usg=AOvVaw1yahf0gn_S0BSaYnFSX9xK) [493–494](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/492/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922559332&usg=AOvVaw0aoMzYp0H5FnS7KuftZb_U))

August 12 — An updated version of AFR 200-2 is issued by the Department of the Air Force and declassified by Air Force Chief of Staff [Nathan Twining](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922559763&usg=AOvVaw3YvADsYFbh0hhVbmRYsqVY)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922559992&usg=AOvVaw0GTZdUXMql9vu0VOARsd93) The public can now know that the 4602nd Air Intelligence Service Squadron was brought in to assist ATIC (Blue Book) with preliminary and field UFO investigations, and that USAF considers UFOs to be “any airborne object which by performance, aerodynamic characteristics, or unusual features, does not conform to any presently known aircraft or missile type, or which cannot be positively identified as a familiar object.” It lists the objectives of UFO reporting as: “First as a possible threat to the security of the United States and its forces, and secondly, to determine technical aspects involved.” (Department of the Air Force, “[Unidentified Flying Objects Reporting,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Air_Force_Regulation_200-2%252C_Unidentified_Flying_Objects_Reporting&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922560316&usg=AOvVaw3Ubg85OxNaU1jjh-AyDNqb)” Air Force Regulation 200-2, August 12, 1954; Good Above, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/488/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922560570&usg=AOvVaw1OpYXcH1TPEzE_JB77wKdI) [489–492](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/488/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922560799&usg=AOvVaw3KEPMSgUENsz-jrNH4wGYc))

August 16 — 5:00 p.m. A green ball is seen in the sky over Tananarive \[now Antananarivo\], Madagascar, and disappears behind a hill. It reappears a minute later and flies over the higher part of Tananarive. When the object flies in front of them, some witnesses see a lentil-shaped device with a silvery metallic aspect enveloped in electric luminous gas. According to Jean-Luc Bruneau, inspector general at the Commissariat à l’Energie Atomique, Gen. [Charles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_de_Gaulle&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922561125&usg=AOvVaw0QO-sqMn-EYa9eQB8X6q8G) [de Gaulle](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_de_Gaulle&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922561348&usg=AOvVaw0HvuJlqkKP7G8c9nX1RMRO) is concerned about this sighting and quietly approves having a French study group involved with investigating UFO cases. (“[1954, Tananarive, Madagascar: Multiple Witnesses to UFOs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufocasebook.com/2010/madagascar1954.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922561652&usg=AOvVaw1Gx76mSwH1PiXddmXa04u3)” UFO Casebook, July 30, 2008; Gildas Bourdais, “From GEPAN to SEPRA: Official UFO Studies in France,” IUR 25, no. 4 (Winter 2000–2001): 11; Patrick Gross, “[Tananarive, Madagascar, August 1954](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/tana54.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922562006&usg=AOvVaw3-3cxDSpgiW92EmGjmRSpn)”)

August 20 — Contactee [Dorothy Martin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.chicagomag.com/Chicago-Magazine/The-312/May-2011/Dorothy-Martin-the-Chicagoan-Who-Predicted-the-End-of-the-World-and-Inspired-the-Theory-of-Cognitive-Dissonance/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922562506&usg=AOvVaw2CC4k0wLF1HdbZr4F6VfcT) of Oak Park, Illinois, and Charles and Lilian Laughead of Detroit, Michigan, send out a 7-page press release announcing that a geological disaster will cause great environmental changes in North America and Europe. It warns that December 20 will be the last available date for evacuation, as a great flood will strike on December 21. Martin and her followers hope to board a landed flying saucer before doom falls. (Clark III 718)

August 20 — Morning. Edith Jacobsen, 2, and Åsta Solvang, 32, are on a blueberry-picking trip to Øyfjellet, near Mosjøen, Norway, with their uncle, Halvdan Jacobsen. The two sisters wander off to a fen when suddenly they see a man in the distance. They approach him and he smiles and stretches out his hand, but he only brushes Edith’s palm with it. He has long hair with a natural wave, a dark complexion, and a tight-fitting suit with a wide belt. He begins to talk but they can’t understand him. It does not sound like Norwegian, English, German, Spanish, French, or Russian. He takes out a “little mirror” from a pocket and with something like a pencil draws circles, apparently representing planets. He finally indicates he wants the women to accompany him and he takes them to a landed disc in a clearing. It is gray-blue and looks like two giant pot lids put together. He makes a sign to not come too close, then he opens a hatch on the top, crawls in, and shuts the door. The sisters hear a faint humming and the UFO rises while rotating on its own axis. (Gordon Creighton, “[Mosjøen: An Early Norwegian](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201989%2520V%252034%2520N%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922563071&usg=AOvVaw3xMTjQ2Wlgr9f5P6jt0kH8) [CE-III Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201989%2520V%252034%2520N%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922563436&usg=AOvVaw3ApixrlOp9OxYpNuHaxE6e)” Flying Saucer Review 34, no. 2 (June 1989): 1–7; Clark III 267–268)

August 23 — 1:00 a.m. Businessman [Bernard Miserey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.societe.com/societe/monsieur-bernard-miserey-733641336.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922564057&usg=AOvVaw1x-hGKV6HM4928o7GBlrcf) has just parked his car in a garage at Vernon, Eure, France, when he notices a sudden illumination. He sees an object like an enormous (300 feet long) cigar standing on end, hovering above the north bank of the Seine River about 1,000 feet away. Suddenly from the bottom of the object comes a horizontal disc that drops, slows, and suddenly dives horizontally across the river at him. It vanishes at a high rate of speed toward the southwest. Three other discs follow in sequence. A fifth disc drops much lower than the earlier ones and remains still for an instant, swaying slightly. During this time the cigar has faded and sinks into darkness. The spectacle has lasted 45 minutes. Two police officers and an Army engineer also see the display. (Clark III 293; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1954, June–August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1954-June-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922564478&usg=AOvVaw1M-HxJFfMGDKKRLkCZYx7B)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1954-June-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922564737&usg=AOvVaw2TfKhe1pSWDELEB-wgC6Ef) The Author, 1990, pp. 77–80; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922565034&usg=AOvVaw1dYb-iDeqHZyt_-mAl-2qf)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922565277&usg=AOvVaw2kTJjPPFrzyqVc-NMJz5tl) pp. 85–86; Patrick Gross, “[The 1954 French Flap](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/1954/23aug1954vernon.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922565598&usg=AOvVaw0moc5cqi-8LFUad7LcouZB),” February 2, 2007; Herbert S. Taylor, “Satellite Objects and Cloud Cigars,” IUR 29, no. 1 (Spring 2004): 4–5)

August 26 — 9:35 p.m. Crowds of people in Bray, County Wicklow, Ireland. see an object traveling at great speed over Bray Head. It is a brilliant blue light, traveling at “2,000 miles an hour” toward the sea before changing direction and moving toward Wicklow. (Irish Times, August 27, 1954; Shane Cochrane, “Ireland vs. the Flying Saucers,” Fortean Times 317 (September 2014): 54)

August 28 — 8:30 p.m. Several USAF fighter pilots pursue a triangular formation of 15 objects near Tinker AFB, Oklahoma City, tracked by ground radar. As the jets approach, the formation breaks, changes to a semicircle, and the objects speed up and vanish to the west. (NICAP, “USAF Fighters Report Formation Tracked by Radar”; Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922567031&usg=AOvVaw0OeTUO1J-82VmXk5VGSg82)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922567309&usg=AOvVaw2COScrWLVSFOUbXR6I0kvc) pp. 25–26; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922567676&usg=AOvVaw3xhra9A26FbY8WBUJCj8JI), p. 220)

August 29 — A witness in Mérida, Venezuela, sees a large, intensely yellow, glowing object moving at great speed from west to east. When it reaches the Sierra Nevada de Mérida, it suddenly stops and two disc-shaped blue objects

* * *

emerge from it. All three continue to the east and disappear behind buildings. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story,

Signet, 1969, p. 58)

August 29 — 11:05 p.m. First Officer H. G. Gardner and Engineer J. V. D. Whitisy, flying on a Royal Dutch Airlines DC- 4, see 3–4 dark, lens-shaped objects over Prins Christianssund radio and weather station, Greenland. They veer north and change position in formation. (NICAP, “[Lens-Shaped Objects Veer North](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/540829greenland_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922568681&usg=AOvVaw20AJABaI22ptGrB2XDG2Qi)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922568955&usg=AOvVaw2jWUZAWUCnUQ7OJrj0gzy1), p. 220)

August 31— 7:10 p.m. RAN Lieutenant J. A. “Shamus” O’Farrell is returning to HMAS Albatross Naval Air Station near Nowra, New South Wales, after a night cross-country in a Hawker Sea Fury aircraft. After contacting Nowra, O’Farrell sees a very bright light closing fast at one o’clock. It crosses in front of his aircraft, taking up position on his port beam, where it appears to orbit. A second and similar light is observed at nine o’clock. It passes about a mile in front of the Sea Fury and then turns in the position where the first light was observed.
