Bissell Jr](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_M._Bissell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922730397&usg=AOvVaw3Xkrr73RI18Zb5zmLPlmjN) reviews 50 potential sites with USAF liaison Col. [Osmond J. Ritland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105825/major-general-osmond-j-ritland/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922730800&usg=AOvVaw3xu6Znc1iOaEvNXNtPjkml). None seem to meet the stringent requirements of the program. They reject Johnson’s proposed Site I (Mud Lake?) because it is too close to populated areas. Ritland recalls a “little X-shaped field” just off the eastern side of Groom Lake, Nevada, just outside the AEC nuclear proving ground at Yucca Flat. (Peter W. Merlin, “[Groom Lake Timeline: The First](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://area51specialprojects.com/area51_timeline.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922731205&usg=AOvVaw0XojksDT-CI0mg2_mAZdo0) [Fifty Years,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://area51specialprojects.com/area51_timeline.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922731489&usg=AOvVaw3ccHa8ca4XOeF5giMgbkp2)” Secret Heroes, November 10, 2021)

1955 — Project Rover, a US project to develop a nuclear-thermal rocket, is initiated at the Los Alamos Scientific Laboratory, New Mexico, and runs until January 1973. It begins as an Air Force project to develop a nuclear- powered upper stage for an intercontinental ballistic missile. The project is transferred to NASA in 1958 after the Sputnik crisis. It is managed by the Space Nuclear Propulsion Office, a joint agency of the Atomic Energy

Commission and NASA. Project Rover becomes part of NASA’s Nuclear Engine for Rocket Vehicle Application (NERVA) project and henceforth deals with the research into nuclear rocket reactor design, while NERVA involves the overall development and deployment of nuclear rocket engines and the planning for space missions. (Wikipedia, “[Project Rover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Rover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922733179&usg=AOvVaw1titXRTZLZHDVxsjiDmxHE)”; Wikipedia, “[NERVA](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NERVA&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922733352&usg=AOvVaw08J75ORF1pNjWbgyGQInOV)”; Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 303–312](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/302/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922733621&usg=AOvVaw2COrT1DpXTPpJTXg9697DU))

1955 — The US nuclear stockpile totals 2,422 bombs. (Ryan Crierie, “[U.S. Nuclear Stockpile, 1945–2009](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.alternatewars.com/BBOW/ABC_Weapons/US_Nuclear_Stockpile.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922733938&usg=AOvVaw3n7In21yErRwI9CKL6-xGx)”)

1955 — [Otis T. Carr](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otis_T._Carr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922734185&usg=AOvVaw19yrA3GgSBtqG8bwl9EeeJ) founds OTC Enterprises in Baltimore, Maryland, to advance and supply technology originating from ideas of [Nikola Tesla](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nikola_Tesla&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922734396&usg=AOvVaw1XLf0cG8PeKFBfjtPQr167)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nikola_Tesla&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922734528&usg=AOvVaw1yARWd2u7riyL0QUKB0O5G) Carr claims he met Tesla while working as a night clerk in New York City’s Hotel Pennsylvania, where Tesla was living in the late 1920s. Tesla befriended Carr and revealed to him secrets he was not ready to make public yet. Carr attracts the funding of local businessman [Wilfred C. Gosnell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/711706/wilfred-claude-gosnell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922734916&usg=AOvVaw2rPUWdQLOVgPK6i-wHKIvN). Soon he hires a promotions man named Norman Evans Colton and sends out regular information bulletins to investors. (Clark III 860)

1955 — After selling his share of Fate magazine to [Curtis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://occulthealth.com/fuller-curtis-1912%25E2%2580%25931991/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922735534&usg=AOvVaw3PBzp-Elhl6reGB6XDNqMR) and [Mary Margaret Stiehm Fuller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/ct-xpm-1992-07-21-9203050547-story.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922735986&usg=AOvVaw0-rcFhzywJJzTGwRPZ0xjL)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/ct-xpm-1992-07-21-9203050547-story.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922736290&usg=AOvVaw2nmnmXmbFAZpw4jWF9ZFqO) [Ray Palmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922736617&usg=AOvVaw0iGhQpuTf3n3_BM3KvDfkg) founds a would- be competitor, Mystic (later Search) and several short-lived SF titles. Other Worlds evolves in 1957 into Flying Saucers, a more or less nonfiction magazine that features articles of widely varying credibility and a column of saucer fan-club news. (Clark III 873)

1955 — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922737673&usg=AOvVaw1X8wrlS_HRdHfiRJZhAJ8f)’s Inside the Space Ships, ghostwritten by Adamski follower Charlotte Blodget, is published by Abelard Schuman in the United States and Foster and Scott in Canada. Adamski claims that Orthon arranged for him to be taken on a trip to see the Solar System, including the planet [Venus](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venus&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922738402&usg=AOvVaw3ZJCshxX_7HEj4VwTphGdw)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venus&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922738626&usg=AOvVaw3RFf9uTM3lB3oDD1UquCTi) the location where Orthon said the late Mary Adamski had been reincarnated. He claims that in another voyage he met the 1,000-year-old “elder philosopher of the space people,” who is called “the Master.” Adamski says he and the Master discussed philosophy, religion, and the “Earth’s place in the universe.” Adamski learns that he has been selected by Nordic aliens to bring their message of peace to Earth people and that other humans throughout history have also served as their messengers, including Jesus Christ. Adamski further claims that aliens are peacefully living on Earth, and that he has met with them in bars and restaurants in Southern California. (George Adamski, [Inside the Space](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/insidespaceships00adam/page/n3/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922739367&usg=AOvVaw32yu1HNdVEeqECTUvE7Cqz) [Ships](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/insidespaceships00adam/page/n3/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922739716&usg=AOvVaw3TzdurBu_WjIaCIO76cC3E), Abelard-Schuman, 1955; Clark III 40; Lou Zinsstag and Timothy Good, George Adamski: The Untold Story, Ceti, 1983; David Stupple, “The Man Who Talked with Venusians,” Fate 32, no. 1 (January 1979): 30–39)

January — [George King](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.aetherius.org/dr-george-king/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922740418&usg=AOvVaw1frbodfCzcetvRZjigbU5F) gives the first public demonstration of his contacts with the Cosmic Masters in Caxton Hall, London, England. After mounting the platform, he enters a trance, and Aetherius (the Cosmic Master from Venus) reveals a plan for human peace and enlightenment. (Douglas Curran, In Advance of the Landing: Folk Concepts of Outer Space, Abbeville, 1985, [p. 63](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/inadvanceoflandi00doug/page/62/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922740892&usg=AOvVaw3uNIWwsWe6r1SppZABsf-q))

Early January — [Dorothy Martin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.chicagomag.com/Chicago-Magazine/The-312/May-2011/Dorothy-Martin-the-Chicagoan-Who-Predicted-the-End-of-the-World-and-Inspired-the-Theory-of-Cognitive-Dissonance/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922741308&usg=AOvVaw3yG76-UZe1toSwtza9KiAO) leaves the Chicago area for Prescott, Arizona, home of the like-minded [George Hunt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922741629&usg=AOvVaw1zszMvNcBcr0599ZsRdUdk) [Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922741848&usg=AOvVaw2qdh871df3zOlsHGBge7Tc)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922741989&usg=AOvVaw2pjb4uf4qBSwHlNaHSpnWs) after being threatened with arrest and involuntary commitment. She later founds the Association of Sananda and Sanat Kumara. Under the name Sister Thedra, she continues to practice channeling and participate in contactee groups until her death in 1992. (Clark III 719)

January 3 — 4:00 p.m. Félix Galarraga and Gerardo Izuesta see a red balloon-like object about 7–10 feet in diameter land near Oiartzun, Spain. Galarraga rushes towards it, but the UFO rises and speeds away. From a separate location, brothers Miguel and Martín Arraspio also see the object descend. Possibly another Radio Free Europe balloon

* * *

with leaflets. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1955 January–June](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Jan-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922742654&usg=AOvVaw37ILhDrHL-piZ2Ns4Ca1N9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Jan-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922742866&usg=AOvVaw1piEMYDdLqkIGs8UFcflE6) The Author, 1992, p. 4; Vicente-Juan Ballester Olmos and Juan Carlos Vistorio Uranga, “[Los ovnis de diciembre de](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.academia.edu/16786792/LOS_OVNIS_DE_DICIEMBRE_DE_1954&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922743165&usg=AOvVaw0UWGJ4U7kr2jyZRlGlavKD) [1954,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.academia.edu/16786792/LOS_OVNIS_DE_DICIEMBRE_DE_1954&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922743384&usg=AOvVaw23ihgQbdJvb3QYKrWnIA25)” Academia.edu)

January 7 — The Air Force Information Services Letter warns that service members are talking too much about UFOs. (Ruppelt, [p. 228](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/238/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922743730&usg=AOvVaw1Cw5AVz00VwDvCbloEBXEM))

January 14 — 5:30 p.m. A luminous UFO drops from the sky near Idyllwild, California. Immediately afterwards, a B-47 pilot reports to March AFB \[now March Air Reserve Base\] near Riverside, California, that an “unknown object just hit our wing.” The pilot guides the plane to a landing. No trace of a crashed object can be found. (Keyhoe, [FS](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922744041&usg=AOvVaw34_ha3BoLsr-a6Exo6pNci) [Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922744246&usg=AOvVaw37u8ipSyswbs4ec-IpZPm1)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922744408&usg=AOvVaw3dNvz0yJ7aYTaL2iSdKTmB) pp. 247–248)

January 31 — 2:00 a.m. Peruvian Air Force Commander Guillermo Serpa and Col. Juan Rodriguez Cavero are returning to El Pata Air Force Base near Talara, Peru, by car through the Sechura Desert on the Pan-American Highway 1N when they see a bright light in the sky ahead. The object, a deep red domed disc, draws nearer and Serpa stops the car to observe it. It tilts slightly toward them, making occasional clicking sounds. Several minutes later it accelerates quickly in their direction, changing to a bright orange color then to a bright white as it shoots past them at terrific speed. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs a History: 1955, January–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Jan-Jun-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922744796&usg=AOvVaw0O-jZlQ-F5OcAjD7BH9-re) [June, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Jan-Jun-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922745043&usg=AOvVaw1NeWU6wrYhGW3HquDRuRIr), The Author, 2002, pp. 14–18)

February 1 — 7:55 p.m. Instructor Capt. [Delwyn F. Ritzdorf](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49361425/delwyn-franklin-ritzdorf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922745429&usg=AOvVaw00t0PLkJQIGQkKcbe9T7mv) and aviation cadet Frederick W. Miller are flying a TB-25 bomber-trainer about 20 miles east of Cochise, Arizona, at 13,000 feet and 238 mph when they see a bright round object with red and white hues. It approaches them then hovers off the left wing for 5 minutes about 5° above the horizontal. Radio interference prevents Ritzdorf from reporting the sighting. The object climbs rapidly on a parallel flight track for 3 minutes before pulling away at 500–600 mph and disappearing. (NICAP, “[Huge](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/550101cochise_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922745713&usg=AOvVaw3QZBQAXJ7btqFpftztY43A) [Metallic Disc Paces B-25](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/550101cochise_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922745921&usg=AOvVaw2SXkdnqmeMyxLzNR5f4MO7)”)

February 2 — Aviation inventor [Bill Lear](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Lear&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922746183&usg=AOvVaw3ZYX7VGw13_26tRcoq57Mv), during a press conference in Bogotá, Colombia, states his belief that “flying saucers came from outer space and are piloted by beings of superior intelligence.” He suspects that they might use gravitational fields as propulsion. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Jan-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922746427&usg=AOvVaw3ZO3rwNhOGrKkthLGcMyUL) [1955 January–June](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Jan-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922746617&usg=AOvVaw3kj0shguJhO5mIwj9kBb38)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Jan-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922746808&usg=AOvVaw10Ci3FEJnVn5tkWPihByWM) The Author, 1992, p. 18)

February 2 — 11:15 a.m. A Venezuelan Aeropostal airliner piloted by Captain Dario Celis is flying between Barquisimeto and Valera, Venezuela, at 7,500 feet. Celis and his copilot B. J. Cortes spot a strange, round “apparatus” flying swiftly toward the plane. Rotating counterclockwise, the object shines with a greenish light. Around its center is a red ring or band that emits flashes of brilliant light. Above and below this band are lighted portholes. Hurriedly the pilot cuts in his mike to call the Barquisimeto radio station. After reporting the UFO, he waits for an answer, but the receiver is dead. Later the radio operators state that just as the pilot began his report, communication is cut off. The copilot banks toward the rotating UFO. Instantly the object whirls downward, then levels off, and races away at tremendous speed. (NICAP, “[Plane Encounters Saucer and Radio Goes Dead](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/550202venezuela_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922747259&usg=AOvVaw020qxmHILGSqvDmy27Mo-b)”; Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922747459&usg=AOvVaw1ou6efiLxvQ3xbZGWgewFz), pp. 249–250)

February 6 — Several witnesses in Greymouth, New Zealand, see a dazzling, silvery, cigar-shaped object moving inland at a high speed. Two observers see it consisting of two parts, with the leading part larger than the other. A loud explosion like a thunderclap is heard, causing the earth to tremble slightly. (“[World Roundup,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1955%252CMay-Jun%252CV%25201%252CN%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922747802&usg=AOvVaw2NWabqHUjeXJQajpSLgLNi)” Flying Saucer Review 1, no. 2 (May/June 1955): 8)

February 10 — 9:30 p.m. Many residents of Caracas, Venezuela, see a strange object crossing the sky silently from northeast to southwest. José Agustín Díaz in Altamira clocks its time as 6–8 minutes. It looks like a disc with two bright, pulsating, bluish lights on the underside. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 64)

February 13 — Midnight. A green fireball shoots across east Texas like a “huge electric arc,” passing from Tyler towards Lufkin. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1955 January–June](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Jan-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922748409&usg=AOvVaw3uOWby_f6Ut-jIjLO_GmQm), The Author, 1992, p. 24)

February 15 — ATIC sends a memo to Maj. Joseph A. Cybulski, commander of the 4602nd AISS at Ent AFB \[now the US Olympic Training Center\] in Colorado Springs, Colorado, complaining about the high number of unknowns. It suggests that AISS and ATIC “strive to reach as many case solutions as possible, thereby reducing the percentage of the unknowns to a bare minimum.” As long as there is sufficient information, most cases “will fit to some extent one of the hypotheses.” The probable and possible cases are merged into the “identified” category. (Maj. T. G. Connair Jr., “Evaluation of Unidentified Flying Objects,” February 15, 1955, in CUFON, “[4602d](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/4602smpl7.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922748745&usg=AOvVaw1PXCorPK0gbCVL-t9A3CKP) [AISS Unit History Sampler, Part 7 of 7 Parts](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/4602smpl7.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922748959&usg=AOvVaw2GkqJDpdnwH1McXM469tCy)”)

February 18 — The nuclear Teapot Wasp test takes place at the Nevada Test Site. Ground forces take part in Exercise Desert Rock VI, which includes an armored task force Razor moving to within 3,000 feet of ground zero, under the still-forming mushroom cloud. (Wikipedia, “[Operation Teapot](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Teapot%23Wasp&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922749432&usg=AOvVaw0vNHsWErkttDzrT9Fpv_qw)”)

* * *

February 21 — Early morning. “Cobwebby gray fibers” fall in Horseheads, New York, covering one-half square mile. Some “ragged sheets” are many feet in length. Chemist [Charles B. Rutenber](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/110704304/charles-blackman-rutenber&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922750045&usg=AOvVaw2nahxFPj5_-g36lbNvEaIh) of Elmira College in Elmira, New York, describes it as “badly damaged, slightly radioactive cotton fiber” that might have come from a Nevada atomic test. He concludes it is a “short-staple cotton, possibly lint from waste cotton used in industrial plants.” [John B. Diffenderfer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99576762/john-b-diffenderfer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922750513&usg=AOvVaw2ze-G1ffybPB41ISsEaVZu)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99576762/john-b-diffenderfer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922750790&usg=AOvVaw13oDzwIGxA6QkKfJ6DCWyJ) a chemist at a local Westinghouse laboratory, finds it is 30% carbon, with calcium, silica, aluminum, iron, and 10 other trace elements. He thinks it comes from powdered milk residue, perhaps from the Dairylea milk processing plant in Elmira. But milk plant chemists Louis R. Hermani and Robert L. Mix say the material is composed of “cotton and wool fibers with pieces of fine copper wire mixed in” and looks like it comes from a carpet sweeper bag. (“[Further Tests Made of Fibers Collected in Horseheads Area,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93406826/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922751215&usg=AOvVaw3wv7IKoMijyiVgsS8P1Gr8)” Elmira (N.Y.) Star- Gazette, February 23, 1955, p. 13; Brian Boldman, “Angel Hair Physical Analyses: A Review,” JUFOS 9 (2006): 101–102)

February 23 — 8:30 a.m. Frederick S. Briggs, a bricklayer and former army sergeant employed at Broadlands, Romsey, Hampshire, England, the manor then owned by [Lord Mountbatten](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_Mountbatten%252C_1st_Earl_Mountbatten_of_Burma&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922751996&usg=AOvVaw0MqBnTXVNxG-6zDqHoEhkV), [Prince Philip](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_Philip%252C_Duke_of_Edinburgh&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922752328&usg=AOvVaw2045wxVmzAEUzMZ2Sa6z73)’s uncle, sees a large disc-shaped UFO over a nearby meadow as he is bicycling to work. The object is shaped like a spinning top, metallic, and about 20–30 feet in diameter with portholes around the center. Watching from less than 100 yards away, Briggs estimates that the object is 80 feet above the ground. He sees a humanoid figure dressed in what look like overalls and a helmet descend from the craft on some sort of column with a platform at the bottom. He is then dazzled by a bright blue light from the craft and falls over, unable to move, as if held by a strange force. The UFO then flies off at high speed. Mountbatten takes a personal interest in this incident, interviews Briggs, and searches the area of the meadow over which the UFO is seen. He subsequently has a statement prepared, detailing Briggs’s claims.

This story is written up by [Desmond Leslie](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desmond_Leslie&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922752922&usg=AOvVaw3CjYIiubNYCkq6UXHE1miF) in Flying Saucer Review in 1981. Mountbatten’s signed statement on the incident is held with many of his other private papers at the Broadlands Archive. (Desmond Leslie, “[Did](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201981%2520V%252026%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922753460&usg=AOvVaw22PzwkjG2vyo0F5Q3HyJim) [Flying Saucers Land at Broadlands?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201981%2520V%252026%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922753775&usg=AOvVaw2JLA8g0zt5EY1FN704M2kM)” Flying Saucer Review 26, no. 5 (January 1981): 2–4; Good Above, [pp. 40–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/40/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922754206&usg=AOvVaw0yfbE4K6slMXCD9yIMugvo) [42](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/40/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922754508&usg=AOvVaw0grAAGxbFDTWz31afCEmdt)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/40/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922754749&usg=AOvVaw3oVqyl4eHMVBeUx7-EWYfE) [451–454](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/450/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922755058&usg=AOvVaw3ofAhlRq_rOa-Lpu0i75PA))

March — Technician and businessman [Morris K.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.joshuablubuhs.com/blog/morris-ketchum-jessup-as-a-fortean&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922755599&usg=AOvVaw2UMoYf8jjeuX5luNatrOms) [Jessup](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morris_K._Jessup&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922755904&usg=AOvVaw0AHgbyNJPqcBsmliZvp6CM) publishes The Case for the UFO, the first book to use the relatively new US Air Force term “UFO” instead of flying saucer. He engages in speculation about Fortean phenomena, ancient astronauts, levitating forces to explain megalithic structures, and experiments in ancient times with flight and even space flight. He identifies 1877–1887 as an “Incredible Decade,” in which astronomers observe strange space objects, and meteorologists note strange falls from the sky. He speculates that mysterious disappearances of ship crews might constitute a curiosity among “our space friends” on “what has happened to us since they put us down here.” (Morris K. Jessup, The Case for the UFO, Citadel, 1955; Clark III 634; Story, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/50/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922756598&usg=AOvVaw3Z_FmrlG0BF59nK8gSLjRZ)

[51](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/50/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922756986&usg=AOvVaw2CcNQpThKpKvKr5ZyEeJxp))

March — [James S. Rigberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://richardaguilar.wordpress.com/2014/08/23/in-search-ofjames-s-rigberg-and-the-flying-saucer-news-bookstore-and-prosperity-clinic/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922757529&usg=AOvVaw0m8-S4_NrFt4DiSf_CqjaU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://richardaguilar.wordpress.com/2014/08/23/in-search-ofjames-s-rigberg-and-the-flying-saucer-news-bookstore-and-prosperity-clinic/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922757917&usg=AOvVaw1zIAMmU582yfmRSv4dZDu3) owner of the Flying Saucer Bookstore in New York City, begins publishing Flying Saucer News as the official publication of the Flying Saucer News Club of America, founded in 1953. It is published twice a year until at least May 1982. ([Flying Saucer News](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Flying%2520Saucer%2520News%2520(Rigberg)/Flying%2520Saucer%2520News%2520-%25201955%252003%2520-%2520March.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922758510&usg=AOvVaw2AgW2--0bzfTqUXJ9d5AEn) 1, no. 1 (March 1955))

March — The CIA obtains quantities of Hemophilus pertussis, whooping cough bacteria, from Fort Detrick in Frederick, Maryland. The agency field tests it covertly along Florida’s Gulf Coast. The incidence of whooping cough triples this year, but the CIA’s role remains unknown until 1979. (Bill Richards, “[Report Suggests CIA Involvement in](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/politics/1979/12/17/report-suggests-cia-involvement-in-fla-illnesses/5b10205e-170b-4e38-b64e-2e9bca8f50df/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922759335&usg=AOvVaw1iQg9uYaEr2DjkSDL7Xh3Z) [Fla. Illnesses,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/politics/1979/12/17/report-suggests-cia-involvement-in-fla-illnesses/5b10205e-170b-4e38-b64e-2e9bca8f50df/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922759682&usg=AOvVaw21a_P0eXnLcU47TN4plh9g)” Washington Post, December 17, 1979)

March 1 — The Douglas Aircraft Company is conducting a study of “Unconventional Propulsion Schemes/Systems” for the USAF Air Technical Information Center from 1954 to 1955, headed by [Wolfgang Klemperer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wolfgang_Klemperer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922760097&usg=AOvVaw0iivQiv_kecx33bel7Frsh)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wolfgang_Klemperer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922760262&usg=AOvVaw3WnseJYg0K02YChB1m7t6g) who writes a memo to E. P. Wheaton that says: “Our studies of the possible merit or significance of occasionally appearing publications concerning Unconventional Propulsion Systems have been carefully continuing since the first memo (MTM-622) about the progress to mid-December 1954.” Apparently the project examined some UFO reports (including Willis Sperry’s) and UFO books. (Douglas Aircraft Company, “[Unconventional Propulsion Schemes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rense.com/general96/DouglasDocsPreface.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922760536&usg=AOvVaw2dzFi10E4JrxRp3P86amja)” MTM-622, March 1, 1955; Keith Basterfield, “[Documents Located from that 1955 ‘Secret’ UAP Study by](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufos-scientificresearch.blogspot.com/2019/01/documents-located-from-that-1955-secret.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922760793&usg=AOvVaw38RN1wjy8WRCzLCHu5R7Dm) [Douglas Aircraft Company,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufos-scientificresearch.blogspot.com/2019/01/documents-located-from-that-1955-secret.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922761061&usg=AOvVaw09yP-0uadtHRtQuyTYBARe)” Unidentified Aerial Phenomena—Scientific Research, January 11, 2019)

March 11 — 7:50 p.m. Lawrence Grab and his son see a brilliant flash of light from their home at 714 West Lakeside Street in Madison, Wisconsin, then watch a phosphorescent object speed over the city from southwest to northeast. (“[Season’s First Saucer Flies in at High Speed,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94013731/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922761383&usg=AOvVaw0pZAv0yWXiYIzGj2ku14Bk)” Madison Wisconsin State Journal, March 12, 1955, p. 7)

March 12–13 — [George Van Tassel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Van_Tassel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922761762&usg=AOvVaw0xCftldJ0udmcvn6izx8HX)’s second Giant Rock Interplanetary Spacecraft Convention in the Mojave Desert near Landers, California, attracts a smaller crowd than the first. This time [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922761982&usg=AOvVaw1OX6YzLnWAs66Z45cX2Swp) is in attendance, along with Charles Laughead, [Dorothy Martin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.chicagomag.com/Chicago-Magazine/The-312/May-2011/Dorothy-Martin-the-Chicagoan-Who-Predicted-the-End-of-the-World-and-Inspired-the-Theory-of-Cognitive-Dissonance/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922762298&usg=AOvVaw1AW8keD4NW3k7BxbjxLLbr)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.chicagomag.com/Chicago-Magazine/The-312/May-2011/Dorothy-Martin-the-Chicagoan-Who-Predicted-the-End-of-the-World-and-Inspired-the-Theory-of-Cognitive-Dissonance/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922762585&usg=AOvVaw3wfFh4CWWgu8Iu13EHwWQt) [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922762795&usg=AOvVaw0OUrVwnQoUkEBpPNWuYeXF), [Dana Howard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dana_Howard_(contactee)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922763042&usg=AOvVaw1MAYWfUHOhD6IMfpt3JnDs), [Daniel Fry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_Fry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922763246&usg=AOvVaw2gh5rMVmhAuCJk1qFeN6QJ), [Truman Bethurum](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truman_Bethurum&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922763414&usg=AOvVaw2JMDRkYbbnUFqjM7Ke82LD), and Dick Miller. Retired USAF Project Blue Book head [Edward J. Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922763635&usg=AOvVaw3K0tMebfYPsd6O6Vt1NjU8) is in the audience and writes up a report.
