(Edward J. Ruppelt, “Among the Contactees,” IUR 19, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1994): 3–6, 23–24; Clark III 531; “[Six](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94013959/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922764093&usg=AOvVaw1wclk8ECqBU14xhnVMJPIw) [Claim Rides on](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94013959/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922764296&usg=AOvVaw1bE4TUT9mM7LvSPJmiKYlH) [Interplanetary](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94014068/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922764467&usg=AOvVaw1dyqimyY3Sv7Y_X2v50XE0) [Ships,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94014103/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922764667&usg=AOvVaw13yB77hLZrztrykvDl1TyI)” Los Angeles Times, March 13, 1955, pp. 3, 4)

March 15 — The 4602nd AISS guide to investigating UFOs is complete and gets distributed to appropriate personnel. (4602d AISS, “[UFOB Guide,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://documents.theblackvault.com/documents/ufos/4602HistoryUFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922765032&usg=AOvVaw1_5S4VEBraSn6d1YqXDVvq)” in History of 4602d Air Intelligence Service Squadron, vol. 1, January 1–June 30, 1955, reprinted in CUFON, “[4602d AISS Unit History Sampler, Part 6 of 7 Parts](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/4602smpl6.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922765336&usg=AOvVaw1_dpIXTkMsCe6n_0m8ODQt)”)

March 24 — 2:30 p.m. The pilot of a private Beechcraft plane is flying at 1,500 feet with a student in the Ryukyu Islands, Japan. They see a domed disc with three windows about 900 feet on their left that appears to change color from white to orange and back again. Over the next few minutes, the object flies over, in front of, and under the airplane. When the pilot puts the plane into a dive, the craft stays with it. The plane’s instruments stop working. The pilot makes a steep right turn but the object still paces the plane. When the Beechcraft’s engine begins to stall, the pilot calls Naha Airport on Okinawa, which alerts the US Kadena Air Base. Two jets are scrambled, but by the time they arrive the object is long gone. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 65–66)

March 29? — Early morning. A bus driving past Wright-Patterson AFB near Dayton, Ohio, sees a silver, triangular object hovering above the base for 15 minutes. (“[Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201955%252008%252000%2520-%2520August_%2528underlinings%2529.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922765906&usg=AOvVaw2L4mth5hfaSU_r6PnsJudW)” APRO Bulletin, August 1955, p. 9)

Spring — Flying Saucer Review is launched in London, England, as a small-circulation quarterly, with aviation journalist and former RAF pilot [Derek Dempster](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://hauntedskies.blogspot.com/2012/02/obituary-for-derek-dempster.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922766513&usg=AOvVaw0Tdg5YxX0LK5MaP9tdRkfe) as its first editor. (Denis Montgomery, “[How It All Began: Founding the](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.fsr.org.uk/fsrintroduction.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922766756&usg=AOvVaw2jFhOGxywWO9e1IAFVigDj) [Flying Saucer Review,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.fsr.org.uk/fsrintroduction.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922766955&usg=AOvVaw2tddbyCp2hqJPR0WxyrhLq)” May 5, 2004; [Flying Saucer Review](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1955%252CMar-Apr%252CV%25201%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922767156&usg=AOvVaw2Wr72aCFd5PqXebsv8W6mI) 1, no. 1 (Spring 1955); Clark III 498)

Early April — Pentagon press officer Capt. Robert White writes to [Claude H. Marck Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/204706550/claude-h_-marck&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922767472&usg=AOvVaw3OFYgzTD3RjB51BdNK-3BG)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/204706550/claude-h_-marck&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922767641&usg=AOvVaw2VYl-V6IJOzGebhngo_lkJ) an interested citizen in Colorado, that Dewey Fournet’s motion studies project was a personal endeavor, that the probability of UFOs being spacecraft is “extremely remote,” and that the Air Force does not try to influence public opinion on the matter. (Swords 209–210)

April — U-2 project director [Richard M. Bissell Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_M._Bissell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922767950&usg=AOvVaw2rnlG2l_V8UR4PJa-gLBX5) secures a presidential action adding the Groom Lake area in Nevada to the AEC proving grounds for CIA use. [Kelly Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kelly_Johnson_(engineer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922768176&usg=AOvVaw1R5dsQgsEiMuj6o2edi8pg) meets with CIA officials in Washington, D.C., and discusses progress on Project Aquatone, proposing to use the name “Paradise Ranch” for the new base. (Peter W. Merlin, “[Groom Lake Timeline: The First Fifty Years,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://area51specialprojects.com/area51_timeline.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922768416&usg=AOvVaw1kYgi-4_Yt8IkHIwY7OVjs)” Secret Heroes, November 10, 2021)

April 5 — 9:55–10:15 a.m. Three or four fireballs fall in various places in southern New Mexico. Air Force Sgt. Camilla Saenz is stationed on Sacramento Peak near Cloudcroft when she sees a yellow fireball with a red tail traveling fast from east to west on the south side of the peak. An airplane from Biggs Air Force Base \[now Biggs Army Airfield\] in El Paso, Texas, sees an apparent meteor strike near Weed, New Mexico, but USAF planes comb the area for 2 hours afterward without finding anything. Bill Watson sees a dark object smash into the earth near Oil Center, New Mexico, but he can find no fragments. [Lincoln LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922768770&usg=AOvVaw3GCSqXTW6raPSUX7qiYQKA) reports that heavy shortwave and TV interference accompany the appearance of the fireballs. (“[Fireballs Shower on State,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/image/87916164/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922769018&usg=AOvVaw2qxCyY0nR3CFkNONqoMCtS)” Alamogordo (N.Mex.) Daily News, April 6, 1955, p. 1)

April 5 — Producer [Ivan Tors](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivan_Tors&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922769394&usg=AOvVaw03z3bdjyK86fDPqKuluaeO) debuts Science Fiction Theatre, a science fiction anthology TV series that presents scientifically plausible stories in an unsensational manner. Many episodes deal with UFO or alien themes, including the season opener, “Beyond,” in which a test pilot bails out and loses his plane because he thinks he’s going to crash into a UFO. The program runs 78 episodes through 1957 and is hosted by veteran announcer [Truman Bradley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truman_Bradley_(actor)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922769783&usg=AOvVaw30KH6Gvw2dTBe_QvrvpcMA)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truman_Bradley_(actor)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922769959&usg=AOvVaw1jyvAPlAid5EGuJ7OaFSYb) Each episode opens with Bradley on a laboratory set, sometimes quoting from a recent Scientific American article, and he discusses and demonstrates a scientific principle that plays a role in the story he is introducing. (Internet Movie Database, “[Science Fiction Theatre](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0047767/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922770237&usg=AOvVaw0eTgBlleN4Au04-YfSuYO0)”; Curt Collins, “[The UFO Message of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2019/01/the-ufo-message-of-science-fiction.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922770463&usg=AOvVaw1Cn6X5NW11gc4HYRMNMeTL) [Science](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2019/01/the-ufo-message-of-science-fiction.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922770695&usg=AOvVaw3J8L72Zq9C3ScBk7zFajCO) [Fiction Theatre](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2019/01/the-ufo-message-of-science-fiction.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922770996&usg=AOvVaw3MIQFb4YvRrlvm16KRrQ0a)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2019/01/the-ufo-message-of-science-fiction.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922771223&usg=AOvVaw0vhH--7b1pT8u7T_1d6xgG)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, January 18, 2019)

April 6 — Night. Three unusual green fireballs pass over New Mexico. Radio and TV interference are reported over a wide area. (Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922771613&usg=AOvVaw0Sr--LoRxbpmgh85sXp3bk), pp. 264–265)

April 8 — 9:25 p.m. Three residents of Albuquerque, New Mexico, watch a blue-green fireball streak west over the city. It appears to have a rose-orange tail. (“[Fire Balls Again Seen over City,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94015061/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922772073&usg=AOvVaw0zDkcWXCsjUe_ktaf-bwR7)” Albuquerque Journal, April 9, 1955, p. 1)

April 25 — 1:00–1:30 a.m. Residents and motorists see a brilliant fireball streak across the sky above Council Bluffs, Iowa. State Highway Patrolman John Ebert says the light was as bright as an arc welder. One resident sees the light burst into flame and drop to earth. Witnesses in Nebraska think the fireball descends abut 3 miles southeast of Waverly, Nebraska. (Council Bluffs (Iowa) Nonpareil, April 25, 1955; Nukes 93)

April 30 — A member of the Soviet Academy of Sciences tells a radio audience that UFOs do not exist. (Ruppelt, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/238/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922772598&usg=AOvVaw0nfIAgRLne6bAqKAAlMDWk)

[238–239](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/238/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922772886&usg=AOvVaw14RNVFDcxsLsVmtaCu6l2p))

May — The UK Air Ministry announces that the report in March on a five-year investigation into UFOs by the RAF has been submitted to high-ranking officers, but the results cannot be released publicly for security reasons. MP Maj.

* * *

[Patrick Wall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_Wall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922773393&usg=AOvVaw2hwbCcVjlr_MBhfVgFre_x) asks the Under-Secretary of State for Air [George Ward](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Ward%252C_1st_Viscount_Ward_of_Witley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922773669&usg=AOvVaw3njnUj3ADURj8QjW5rrLjX) to confirm whether or not he would publish a report. Ward replies that only 10% of UFO reports are unidentified and that is because of lack of data. (Derek Dempster, \[[Editorial](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1955%252CMay-Jun%252CV%25201%252CN%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922774133&usg=AOvVaw33STm5YslQIUwlzwdqC0vA)\], Flying Saucer Review 1, no. 2 (May/June 1955): 1; Good Above, [p. 43](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/42/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922774484&usg=AOvVaw2pBogBWsxQ1Ao00dPADQWx); UFOFiles2, [p. 60–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n99/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922774719&usg=AOvVaw2BnRBM-yd2llsk6D1r9-UU)

[61](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n99/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922775062&usg=AOvVaw1OF1rXGcqf11UDiy6jX2LV))

May — 15-year-old Jacques Vallée and his mother see a “gray, metallic disc with a clear bubble on top” hovering above a church in Pontoise, France. (Jacques Vallée, Forbidden Science, North Atlantic, 1992, [pp. 15–16](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/forbiddenscience00vall_0/page/15/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922775437&usg=AOvVaw2gRetul1BoneOU2-VIO2he))

May 4 — A survey team arrives at Groom Lake, Nevada, and lays out a 5,000-foot north to south runway on the southwest corner of the lakebed and designates a site for a base support facility. The “Ranch” initially consists of little more than a few shelters, workshops, and trailer homes in which to house its small team. In a little over three months, the base consists of a single paved runway, three hangars, a control tower, and rudimentary accommodations for test personnel. The few amenities include a movie theater and volleyball court. There is also a mess hall, several wells, and fuel storage tanks. (Wikipedia, “[Area 51](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Area_51&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922775796&usg=AOvVaw1TWBu5t9l_qZlsiJKcXu3Z)”; Peter W. Merlin, “[Groom Lake](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://area51specialprojects.com/area51_timeline.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922776103&usg=AOvVaw3DUB8zu6uIIuFnMZhWDHCC) [Timeline: The First Fifty Years,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://area51specialprojects.com/area51_timeline.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922776304&usg=AOvVaw0RYUZEjsE5WwdpDbMKileE)” Secret Heroes, November 10, 2021)

May 4 — Afternoon. Lt. Col. [Edward J. Stealy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/tampabaytimes/obituary.aspx?n%3Dedward-j-stealy%26pid%3D101444799&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922776582&usg=AOvVaw2yEbyMJfDY_O0On6razbmb)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/tampabaytimes/obituary.aspx?n%3Dedward-j-stealy%26pid%3D101444799&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922776768&usg=AOvVaw0kN0J0vhRyhC7GPJuVvsbk) commander of the 57th Fighter Interceptor Squadron at Keflavík Airfield, Iceland, and 1stLt. Joseph Burt see 10–15 flying objects, 60–70 feet in diameter, at about 25,000 feet. They fly in loose formation for about 4–5 seconds and are traveling at a tremendous rate of speed (perhaps 1,150 mph). (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1955 January–June](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Jan-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922777105&usg=AOvVaw17JvB6SWg4tYPmrEHBok3p), The Author, 1992, pp. 5–58; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922777330&usg=AOvVaw0vzMHrLdmw_ibPwftfSXPA)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922777468&usg=AOvVaw3iKQHYc9wjIYkLzskoNNgi) p. 226; Clark III 376)

May 5— ATIC declassifies Battelle Memorial Institute’s 1951–1954 study of UFOs, completed in March 1954, as Project Blue Book Special Report No. 14 but does not release it until October 25. ([Special Report No. 14: Analysis of](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/pbbsr/BBA-PBSR14.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922777808&usg=AOvVaw1flDQ3Z0ivTUPRqjO4-tsX) [Reports of Unidentified Aerial Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/pbbsr/BBA-PBSR14.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922778044&usg=AOvVaw1gE5idWjFYONvDpVJe_93-), US Air Force, 1955; Clark III 929–932)

May 22 — Journalist [Dorothy Kilgallen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dorothy_Kilgallen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922778363&usg=AOvVaw3phVYxrO4Tc-XMmYD72jGK) writes in the Los Angeles Examiner that “British scientists and airmen” have examined the wreckage of a crashed flying saucer. Her informant is a “British official of Cabinet rank,” who tells her that the “saucers were staffed by small men—probably under four feet tall.” Flying Saucer Review editor [Gordon Creighton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufoinfo.com/news/gordoncreighton.shtml&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922778766&usg=AOvVaw1ialeRCtop3XmThHZqWNbI) later researches this story in detail and thinks Kilgallen’s source is First Sea Lord [Louis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_Mountbatten%252C_1st_Earl_Mountbatten_of_Burma&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922779078&usg=AOvVaw3fV-NGhnhmE6cf3tt0OYl8) [Mountbatten](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_Mountbatten%252C_1st_Earl_Mountbatten_of_Burma&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922779303&usg=AOvVaw014u3QsvUcaO7KGyCRkVwg)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_Mountbatten%252C_1st_Earl_Mountbatten_of_Burma&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922779463&usg=AOvVaw1Iv6XoxClqDygSSIb6OGOw) Some suggest that Kilgallen picked the story up at a cocktail party hosted by Mountbatten. Her story is widely dismissed as a hoax, but other events put her claims in a new light. (“[U.F.O. Crash in Britain?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1955%252CJul-Aug%252CV%25201%252CN%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922779682&usg=AOvVaw2Bp3K3wmOkpoDnI9kZNon6)” Flying Saucer Review 1, no. 3 (July/Aug. 1955): 6; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Jan-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922780003&usg=AOvVaw15j2bZp07uXs8JSW3uKOAR) [UFOs, a History: 1955 January–June](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Jan-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922780259&usg=AOvVaw2doCLfFo2ZOpiuGAaW87Nc), The Author, 1992, p. 69; Good Above, [pp. 43–44](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/42/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922780482&usg=AOvVaw0nXy3PLnHmo_ccUwFTJ2MS))

May 23–26 — At the Fifth AISS Commander’s Conference at Ent AFB \[now the US Olympic Training Center\], Colorado Springs, Colorado, an analysis of UFOs and science fiction is presented that notes: “General public not qualified to evaluate material propounded in science fiction. Absurd and fantastic theories given credence solely on the basis of ignorance.” Also, “Abnormal predisposition to attach belief to the more fanciful aspects of UFOBs, e.g. ‘Flying Saucers’ would tend to negate the source’s reliability as a factual observer.” (“Report of Fifth Commander’s Conference, 23 May to 26 May 1955,” in History of 4602d Air Intelligence Service Squadron, vol. 2, January 1–June 30, 1955, reprinted in CUFON, “[4602d AISS Unit History Sampler, Part 7 of 7 Parts](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/4602smpl7.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922780874&usg=AOvVaw2Wy23pyUSB63-YVCUgXyNq)”)

May 24 — 7:48 p.m. GOC spotter [Charlotte Whitecotton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/141227881/charlotte-whitecotton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922781203&usg=AOvVaw3W8tSmR-fGWUBH7yClU6YZ) and another woman at Loveland, Ohio, watch four UFOs in formation pass low over their enclosure, then zoom to the north. They report the incident to the Columbus Filter Center. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1955 January–June](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Jan-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922781517&usg=AOvVaw0byBw2nLI6yiZBx0aysTQv), The Author, 1992, p. 71; Isabel Davis and Ted Bloecher, [Close Encounter at Kelly and Others of 1955](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Close_Encounter_at_Kelly.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922781927&usg=AOvVaw1MKZdMyUUMphATgMqL42QV), CUFOS, 1978,

pp. 145–146)

May 25 — Around 3:30 a.m. Robert Hunnicut is driving along the Loveland-Madeira Road in the Branch Hill area of Loveland, Ohio. At the Hopewell Road intersection, his headlights illuminate three short figures kneeling next to the road. They are grayish humanoids with a wide slit for a mouth, an indistinct nose, and normal eyes without eyebrows. The heads are hairless with prominent wrinkles on the forehead. They are wearing one-piece grayish garments. One arm seems longer than the other and the upper torso is lopsided. One of the figures is holding a rod emitting blue-white sparks. Hunnicut gets out of the car and walks towards them. They look towards him and there is a 3-minute standoff. Hunnicut goes to the police station and returns with Police Chief John K. Fritz. No trace of anything is found. (Stringfield, [3-0 Blue](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/3-0Blue/InsidesaucerPost3-0Blue.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922782714&usg=AOvVaw3M9baCppbq40nuvgvcFMjp)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/3-0Blue/InsidesaucerPost3-0Blue.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922782994&usg=AOvVaw24ex6i3xdQwicdiR9qnRTs) CRIFO, 1957, pp. 66–68; Stringfield, Situation Red, Fawcett Crest, 1977, pp. 115–116; Isabel Davis and Ted Bloecher, [Close Encounter at Kelly and Others of 1955](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Close_Encounter_at_Kelly.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922783306&usg=AOvVaw3mKSPPru_Wt9baiyHgLKIC), CUFOS, 1978, pp. 138–148; Clark III 270; Rob Ryder, “On the Trail of the Loveland Frogman,” Fortean Times 361 (Christmas 2017): 38–41)

Summer — 12:30 a.m. Dumitru Coca watches a strange object emitting a ring of white sparks at an altitude of 3,000 feet above Hârşeni, Romania. It is blue with white stripes and flying noiselessly at high speed. He watches it for 3 minutes. (Hobana and Weverberh 229–230; Romania 11)

* * *

June — [James W. Moseley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_W._Moseley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922783972&usg=AOvVaw11erU8omzjTSBIcypRBasg) renames Nexus as Saucer News and it becomes a popular bimonthly UFO magazine. (Clark III 1032)

June — Cincinnati, Ohio, businessman Thomas Eickhoff buys a copy of [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922784509&usg=AOvVaw2p4lraOsQBdBca4CFODylZ)’s Inside the Space Ships. Upset with Adamski’s statement that his space contacts can be corroborated, he takes steps to take him to federal court to make him prove his story or face fraud for using the US mail system to sell his book. Eickhoff’s lawyer brings in a government adviser who advises them to drop the lawsuit. Eickhoff’s efforts eventually bring a reply from a lawyer for CIA Director [Allen Dulles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allen_Dulles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922784891&usg=AOvVaw1XkSmdWqPwsr84_RRmHrYa)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allen_Dulles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922785029&usg=AOvVaw1ZVp7c1ZvczlWXkcB2F0Jd) who says the problem is that Adamski could “prevent anyone from testifying in court concerning this book because maximum security exists concerning the subject of UFOs.” The lawyer says he would be subject to a countersuit. (Stringfield, Situation Red, Fawcett Crest, 1977, pp. 169–170; Good Above, [pp. 341–342](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/340/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922785369&usg=AOvVaw0wmVB1wdw4I2FihUyYz7hz))

June 4 — A Boeing RB-47 reconnaissance aircraft of the Air Force Special Security Service (air arm of NSA?) tracks an unknown object visually and by radar for 9 minutes near Melville Sound, Nunavut, Canada. The crew chief describes it as “glistening silver metallic.” The crew obtains gun camera film, but of poor quality. The object speeds off to the north. (Good Above, [p. 285](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/284/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922785808&usg=AOvVaw2soRcufv8pn3NO467uylL2); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922786129&usg=AOvVaw0gIRcpuFEOjLQYa6UTpQSj)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922786326&usg=AOvVaw1fb0R-_ecd0pa9mQO-SvOc) p. 226)

June 5 — 7:30 p.m. François-Gilbert Muyldermans is cycling on a deserted road near Saint-Marc, near Namur, Belgium, when he sees a bright disc moving at a high speed at an altitude of around 4,900 feet. He takes out his camera and snaps a photo. The object descends, then rises again emitting a cloud of white smoke. He takes two more photos. Anomalies in the blurred grain, inconsistencies in orientation, and the circumstances by which the story entered UFO lore suggest a deliberate hoax, perhaps with the help of a journalist. (“[A ‘Classic’ from Belgium,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://bufora.org.uk/documents/BUFORAJournalVolume4No.12MarchApril1976.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922786798&usg=AOvVaw2VbuTql6PS7FYcapCZXIoa)” BUFORA Journal 4, no. 12 (March/April 1976): 12–13; Vicente-Juan Ballester Olmos and Wim van Utrecht, [Belgium in](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.academia.edu/35133835/BELGIUM_IN_UFO_PHOTOGRAPHS_Volume_1_1950_1988_&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922787261&usg=AOvVaw1ObqWqtSGHTgIqC2vd5Txs) [UFO Photographs, Volume 1 (1950–1988)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.academia.edu/35133835/BELGIUM_IN_UFO_PHOTOGRAPHS_Volume_1_1950_1988_&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922787616&usg=AOvVaw3VqDuUEFoy_Rzbn5fSs1ZJ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.academia.edu/35133835/BELGIUM_IN_UFO_PHOTOGRAPHS_Volume_1_1950_1988_&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922787928&usg=AOvVaw14Ix-c06jTpA3_BGnKOuBP) FOTOCAT Report no. 7, 2017, pp. 38–69)

June 7 —An RB-47 en route to Eielson AFB, Fairbanks, Alaska, registers an electronic contact southeast of Banks Island, Northwest Territories, Canada, at 10,500 feet range. The radar return is small and rectangular. (Good Above, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/286/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922788314&usg=AOvVaw3ANwXXkv1SIuDIcXGCSidJ)

[286](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/286/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922788555&usg=AOvVaw0aYuvEFg7DrDTa0QHyRwdf); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922788776&usg=AOvVaw2Mvnb5VAeg1_n556NdPIuu)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922788945&usg=AOvVaw0rlYeBerz0eKbYz6qEpx3s) p. 227)

June 13 — [Frank Edwards](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Edwards_(writer_and_broadcaster)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922789250&usg=AOvVaw3U_quQxPL-m9SbbKY5-bhQ) travels with a TV film producer to the Navy Department at the Pentagon and asks for some unclassified photos of rockets. When the Navy learns that Edwards wants to show them on TV during a panel discussion on UFOs, the office refuses to cooperate. (Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922789502&usg=AOvVaw2LNTbnRBMuWk_epXfuvnMe), p. 269)

June 23 — 12:15 p.m. A Mohawk Airlines DC-3 is cruising at 3,000 feet in good daylight visibility about 15 miles east of Utica, New York, on a heading to Albany. Both pilot and copilot see an object come over the top of the aircraft from behind, an estimated 500 feet above their altitude. They estimate the length of the object at about 150 feet. It is described as “light gray, almost round, with a center line        Beneath the line there were several (at least four)

windows which emitted a bright blue-green light. It was not rotating but went straight. \[The lights\] seemed to change color slightly from greenish to bluish or vice versa \[as the object receded\]. A few minutes after it went out of sight, two other aircraft (one, a Colonial DC-3, the other I did not catch the number) reported that they saw it and wondered if anyone else had seen it. The Albany control tower also reported that they had seen an object go by on Victor-2 \[airway\]. As we approached Albany, we overheard that Boston radar had also tracked an object along Victor-2, passing Boston.” (NICAP, “[150ʹ Object Passes over DC-3 Crew from Behind](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/550623utica_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922789958&usg=AOvVaw317Sb9m4y0ZazMzlWZ41sk)”; Condon, [p. 143](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/142/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922790159&usg=AOvVaw2CVngADfGoCpnxaDjKxuMO))

June 25 — 10:45 p.m. Two civilian and two military witnesses see a yellow, shining sphere with a trail 4–5 times its length over Hillcrest Heights, Maryland. It appears to oscillate in the air, stops, oscillates again, then finally moves away at high speed. It travels nearly overhead and then is lost in the sky at a 45° elevation. It is visible for 7 minutes. (Michael D. Swords, “Air Force UFO Investigations in the Mid-1950s,” IUR 29, no. 3 (Fall 2004): 8– 10)

June 26 — Several civilian and military witnesses in Holt, Florida, see a disc with blinking lights. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922790578&usg=AOvVaw0EBCxAp5XqE7S5PrkXR_43), p. 227; Michael D. Swords, “Air Force UFO Investigations in the Mid-1950s,” IUR 29, no. 3 (Fall 2004): 10; Hynek UFO Report, [p. 45](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/44/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922790936&usg=AOvVaw1aslj_6bVu7hX61aH6BXao))

June 26 — 10:45 p.m. A brilliant round object with a trail 4–5 times its own length approaches National Airport in Washington, D.C., stops, oscillates, and moves off at high speed. Ceiling lights at the airport go out when the object approaches and return to operation when the UFO leaves. Searchlights are trained on the object, but when they catch it in their beams, the searchlights go out. A check with the Silver Hill Observatory in Hillcrest Heights, Maryland, determined that a small weather balloon carrying a magnesium flare was released aboiut the same time as the visual sighting. (Aimé Michel, Straight-Line, p. 236; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922791493&usg=AOvVaw07zGMkwtOx_l_clXe98KXM), p. 21; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Jan-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922791766&usg=AOvVaw0HSgJMJigfdZz2GtGEGgud) [of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1955, January–June](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Jan-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922792007&usg=AOvVaw2aw7w7REHrm2RGWHywcOh8)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Jan-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922792186&usg=AOvVaw0a6DMVHTZD6B6RsbocYtXL) The Author, 1992, pp. 84–85)

June 29 — The Second Hoover Commission presents its final report to Congress on streamlining procedures in the executive branch. Gen. [Mark W. Clark](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_W._Clark&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922792520&usg=AOvVaw2bWQHECdN1UmklLe8aUGMV), heading the commission’s task force on intelligence, notes the CIA’s lack of accountability and recommends establishing an intelligence oversight committee. (Wikipedia, “[Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoover_Commission%23Second_Hoover_Commission&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922792840&usg=AOvVaw1ceFakS_e7O2eoekvJXVu0) [Commission](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoover_Commission%23Second_Hoover_Commission&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922793040&usg=AOvVaw3agBhG2Haf1PNxfsceXd8B)”; Richard A. Best Jr. and Herbert Andrew Boerstling, “[Proposals for Intelligence Reorganization,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://irp.fas.org/congress/1996_rpt/ic21/ic21018.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922793247&usg=AOvVaw1zrtMfVhGH__xajKbjCoUa)

* * *

[1949–1996,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://irp.fas.org/congress/1996_rpt/ic21/ic21018.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922793603&usg=AOvVaw18uuQkgKAKV_h9GmtmvPVV)” Report to the US House Select Committee on Intelligence, Congressional Research Service, February 28, 1996, pp. 9–10)

June 30 — The 4602nd AISS reports that of its 194 preliminary UFO reports for 1955, it has made 23 field investigations and has 25 unsolved reports, or an unknown rate of 13%. Going back to August 12, 1954, and removing cases of insufficient evidence, the percentage of unknowns is lower: 23 unknowns from 306 reports, or about 7.5%. In reality, however, none of these numbers mean much; they reflect the creativity and audacity of the explainers at ADC and ATIC. ()

Late June or early July — Early evening. A 19-year-old Civil Defense worker named Carlos Flannigan is driving a truck across a bridge over the Little Miami River near Loveland, Ohio, when he notices 4 small figures about 3 feet high on the riverbank. A terrible smell hangs over the area. He only watches them for about 10 seconds then immediately drives to police headquarters to report the incident. (Isabel Davis and Ted Bloecher, [Close Encounter](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Close_Encounter_at_Kelly.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922794240&usg=AOvVaw0Mc6qPkqqrLPSkdsyXM2fd) [at Kelly and Others of 1955](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Close_Encounter_at_Kelly.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922794493&usg=AOvVaw0z6Qh7Yk2khOzLPqiGzeks)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Close_Encounter_at_Kelly.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922794641&usg=AOvVaw3laszg7-R1usSavI2BbZJL) CUFOS, 1978, pp. 129–132; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1955-usa-loveland.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922794906&usg=AOvVaw1hPERPyX89gQ43OVsaYnIz)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1955-usa-loveland.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922795061&usg=AOvVaw19kbvDQccbhwFdG8EO1O4j) February 14, 2008)

July — Construction of the Groom Lake base in Nevada is completed and the CIA begins utilizing it, along with the US Air Force, for Project Aquatone, the development of the Lockheed U-2 strategic reconnaissance aircraft, the nation’s first aerial espionage program. It consists of one paved runway, three hangars, a control tower, a makeshift mess hall, and rudimentary accommodations. A movie theater and volleyball court are added. CIA officer Richard Newton is assigned as base commander. Other key organizations are briefed on Area 51’s existence—the National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics, the US Navy, the National Security Agency, and the Defense Intelligence Agency. A small group of four Lockheed test pilots, two dozen Lockheed mechanics and engineers, a handful of CIA officers who double as security guards, and some of Col. [Ritland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105825/major-general-osmond-j-ritland/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922795645&usg=AOvVaw1Fj_70UAsVY5CPQg57blMi)’s staff take up residence. (Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 5](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/4/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922795969&usg=AOvVaw3XAqGqBYeQXvcjcgq1iZ2r)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/4/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922796196&usg=AOvVaw2FYYxv-9ZpHVsQGLoKaReq) [51–53](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/50/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922796510&usg=AOvVaw2ip8ecj1IWeCRPTIph-myN); Peter W. Merlin, “[Groom Lake Timeline: The First Fifty Years,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://area51specialprojects.com/area51_timeline.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922796725&usg=AOvVaw2f3xnZl5GA8aVxJem-51UE)” Secret Heroes, November 10, 2021; “[Pilots of the U-2,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://area51specialprojects.com/u2_pilots.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922797001&usg=AOvVaw1SQzn1pib_tpGg2km3F_sD)” Secret Heroes, November 10, 2021)

July — 2:00 p.m. Col. [William T. Coleman](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.abovetopsecret.com/forum/thread1243564/pg1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922797292&usg=AOvVaw1TN4d8-vSjOTAMm-HdVTOd) is flying a B-25 out of Miami, Florida, with a copilot, flight engineer, a Lockheed test engineer, and a General Motors jet engine technician. As he is moving northward into southern Alabama, he spots at 2 o’clock high what he calls a “craze” in the windshield. He calls the others’ attention to it. He gives chase to it at low altitude over farmland and sees its shadow on the ground, as well as two vortices coming out of the shiny metallic disc that kicks up dust on the ground. When he tries to cut it off at a maximum

speed of 345 mph, the object is gone, leaving behind the vortices on the ground. Duration of the sighting is 10–11 minutes. (NICAP, “[Col. Coleman Case / Chases UFO at Low Altitude](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/5507XXs_alabama_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922797680&usg=AOvVaw0uN7C011Hj0wVpTLjOph-3)”)

July 1 — CRIFO Newsletter becomes CRIFO Orbit. This issue reviews several airplane crashes and disappearances that [Stringfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922798183&usg=AOvVaw2YFab3d7q7lBdlfwwNTme9) thinks might be related to UFO activity. (“[World’s Air Forces, in Joint Operations, Challenge](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/Orbit/ORBIT%2520Volume%2520II%25201955-56R.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922798446&usg=AOvVaw1UmSDLOFDhp8TjHgmoUhGC) [Incursion of UFO’s,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/Orbit/ORBIT%2520Volume%2520II%25201955-56R.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922798685&usg=AOvVaw1g1jeCQW2qG9JtOsltH0Ok)” CRIFO Orbit 2, no. 4 (July 1, 1955): 1– 2; Clark III 460, 1114)

July 3 —3:30 a.m. [Margaret Symmonds](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/46367235/margaret-susan-symmonds&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922799162&usg=AOvVaw0USQYFD2QuyWXssaVSQ9Ed) is driving on US 129 seven miles south of Stockton, Georgia, when four small humanoid figures with caps and huge eyes are caught in the headlights. They seem to be digging a hole in the road with some sticks. She yells and swerves the car, driving past them. The figures seem oblivious. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1955 July–September 15th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-July-Sept-15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922799617&usg=AOvVaw0jnh2jhPZFft0gWScrP_1s), The Author, 1992,

pp. 2–3; Stringfield, [3-0 Blue](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/3-0Blue/InsidesaucerPost3-0Blue.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922800098&usg=AOvVaw2WqgiuPWOFQvrc_477iFk-)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/3-0Blue/InsidesaucerPost3-0Blue.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922800376&usg=AOvVaw0v6Fu4zUQPqFmNGvdjq_rP) CRIFO, 1957, pp. 63–64; Clark III 270; Isabel Davis and Ted Bloecher, [Close](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Close_Encounter_at_Kelly.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922800760&usg=AOvVaw3DHhtpNf9iwu5IaICegbLz) [Encounter at Kelly and Others of 1955](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Close_Encounter_at_Kelly.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922801098&usg=AOvVaw3LLYauHry3Xt6yCcPJzdOK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Close_Encounter_at_Kelly.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922801342&usg=AOvVaw3LiBUqI66mhHwxXq9aiwqQ) CUFOS, 1978, pp. 149–160; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1955-07-03-usa-stockton.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922801758&usg=AOvVaw1Xgf7KUlJxKasSSs4Nu0ev)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1955-07-03-usa-stockton.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922802047&usg=AOvVaw0WB0AkKS-SSseCNp2pRUA-) February 16, 2008)

July 5 — 3:00 a.m. USAF pilot Lt. [Homer H. Speer Jr](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22005282/homer-h-speer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922802596&usg=AOvVaw3duRAazC6mINAu131aoCCv) and copilot Lt. [Paul Daily](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/147844977/paul-bryan-daily&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922803023&usg=AOvVaw3rwIYABlY_vOL5XtZV6ckJ), call sign Archie 29, and pilot Lt. Robert

W. Schneck and copilot Lt. David Cueldner, call sign Archie 91, are flying Boeing KC-97 Stratofreighters at 20,000 feet on a refueling mission off the coast of Newfoundland. They see two bright objects at 20,000 feet, apparently stationary. Ground radar picks up several objects, some in a distant cluster flying erratically. Speer is able to maintain visual contact, calling direction change of the object to the radar site by radio. The objects are tracked on radar for 49 minutes. (NICAP, “[Archie 29 KC-97 Radar Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/550705archie29dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922803571&usg=AOvVaw39DMk-DromnqeqbWKNbG09)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922803880&usg=AOvVaw0FnrdO-tGVhUSx2jq6wgXt)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922804108&usg=AOvVaw0kWu4iXCKba0H3FxzWYg_c) p. 228; Chris Rutkowski and Geoff Dittman, The Canadian UFO Report, Dundurn Press, 2006, pp. 296–297; Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, pp. 263–264)

Late July — A man, a female companion, and two children are picnicking on a Lake Ontario beach in St. Catharines, Ontario, when a silvery disc approaches them rapidly across the water, then hovers above them before heading to another family nearby. It swings back to the original group, “moving like a clock pendulum.” The man flees to his car but finds it will not start. Through the windows of the UFO, just a few feet above the ground, the witnesses see the faces of four pale-faced men with black hoods covering their ears and heads, sitting straight and rigid. The object shoots over the lake, ascends rapidly, and disappears. (Clark III 268)

July 24 — The Groom Lake “Ranch” in Nebada receives it first delivery of U-2s from Burbank, California, in a C-124 Globemaster II cargo plane, accompanied by Lockheed technicians on a Douglas DC-3. Regular Military Air

* * *

Transport Service flights are set up between Area 51 and Lockheed’s offices in Burbank. To preserve secrecy, personnel fly to Nevada on Monday mornings and return to California on Friday evenings. (Wikipedia, “[Area](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Area_51&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922805539&usg=AOvVaw2YnoyV1FsBdc59WZDXsS5o) [51](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Area_51&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922805847&usg=AOvVaw1OCjMMlqdjISPKg56kIokT)”)

July 26 — A brilliant round object with a trail 4–5 times its own length approaches National Airport \[now Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport\] in Washington, D.C., stops, oscillates, and moves off at high speed. Ceiling lights at the airport go out when the object approaches and returns to operation when the UFO departs. (UFOEv, [p. 135](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D147%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922806325&usg=AOvVaw1Y0n71DMDd2TFQSlbpIwgE))

July 29 — President [Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922806660&usg=AOvVaw2IkvbnMkDQdmvUrc85viUJ) announces a program to launch a scientific satellite during the International Geophysical Year. The program will be run by the National Science Foundation and the National Academy of Sciences, with advice coming from the Department of Defense. (Amy Shira Teitel, “[How the Stage Was Set for the Satellite](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.popsci.com/how-stage-was-set-for-satellite-race/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922807002&usg=AOvVaw2t6bhWm1M5g-iKC1my1P-x) [Race,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.popsci.com/how-stage-was-set-for-satellite-race/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922807326&usg=AOvVaw1AcSNTrXHyvIc_u8eMShmx)” Popular Science, January 3, 2016; Amy Shira Teitel, [Breaking the Chains of Gravity: The Story of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/breakingchainsof0000teit/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922807770&usg=AOvVaw0oWZdLl9aV9mabwr0BMbrE) [Spaceflight before NASA](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/breakingchainsof0000teit/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922808112&usg=AOvVaw1XZXtUJzF1r7deQj2IzIFe)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/breakingchainsof0000teit/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922808366&usg=AOvVaw3mnf4D7llq8pzlYFGJwOVN) Bloomsbury Sigma, 2017)

July 29 — 8:30–9:30 p.m. An aircraft engineer and four others notice a “2nd magnitude star” in the vicinity of Saturn at Lake Ronkonkoma on Long Island, New York. The star moves in a perfect circle around Saturn, heads east until it gets to the Moon, where it executes a half-circle pass and disappears. The object then appears 120° away and moves horizontally until it takes an abrupt turn vertically. It disappears again at about 70° above the horizon.

Then it reappears in a straight dive-like descent until it reacquires its original 30° elevation. It proceeds horizontally again, makes an abrupt angular shift again downwards, and is lost in the trees. Through binoculars the object looks spherical and yellowish. (Michael D. Swords, “We Know Where You Live,” IUR 30, no. 2 (January 2006): 8–9; Swords 227)

August — Hundreds of people gather each night at the Black Arch, on the Antrim Coast Road near Larne, County Antrim, Northern Ireland, to watch a mysterious display of lights at sea. The light flashes three or four times in quick succession, then flashes again about 6 minutes later. The Larne police suspect that the lights are flares dropped from aircraft. (Larne Times, August 18, 1955; Shane Cochrane, “Ireland vs. the Flying Saucers,” Fortean Times 317 (September 2014): 54–55)

August — Police from Luzern, Switzerland, investigate a sighting of a shiny metallic disc seen at Waldibrücke and Eschenbach. (“[Forscher findet verschollene UFO-Akten der Schweiz,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://grenzwissenschaft-aktuell.blogspot.com/2013/07/forscher-findet-verschollene-ufo-akten.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922809493&usg=AOvVaw2ve2DvDXuYsrEdVayBwVkS)” Grenzwissenschaft-Aktuell, July 8, 2013; “The Swiss X-Files,” Fortean Times 312 (April 2014): 24)

August 1 — The first test flight of the Lockheed U-2 takes place at Groom Lake, Nevada. During a high-speed-taxi test in the first U-2, Lockheed’s chief test pilot, [Tony LeVier](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_LeVier&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922809965&usg=AOvVaw3Zp5RjfN19qHDeyrJq8_V0)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_LeVier&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922810164&usg=AOvVaw1Otv6NIe4IZydetRIvhPRJ) inadvertently becomes airborne after accelerating the U-2 to 70 knots. He is unable to land the U-2 on his first attempt, and it bounces back into the air, but he manages to successfully bring it down on a second try. Damage to the prototype U-2 is very minor. (Wikipedia, “[Lockheed](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_U-2&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922810497&usg=AOvVaw1J2tOOhrLDuXhhwf4QxojA)

[U-2](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_U-2&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922810846&usg=AOvVaw2S0pCCW1VSpx12kEggy-Sq)”; “[Area 51 and the Accidental Test Flight,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/stories/story/area-51-and-the-accidental-test-flight/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922811166&usg=AOvVaw0J4GC6wyqG87lbQfpHeMCA)” Central Intelligence Agency, August 6, 2015)

August 1 — 8:45 p.m. William M. Sheneman, the owner of a radio/TV store in Willoughby, Ohio, pulls into his driveway and walks across the street to check his mailbox. He sees a red light about 1,000 feet away coming at him at a right angle. He thinks it is a plane about to crash. Then the ground is illuminated with two brilliant lights aimed directly from the object. He runs back into the house as the UFO moves over his garage about 50–100 feet in the air. He sees a big red light at the front and a green light at the rear. Then all the lights turn off and the object moves away over the woods. He and his wife can now see the outline of a dome lit up with tiny lights inside. It hovers there for 5 minutes then moves away. (UFOEv, [p. 114](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D126%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922811742&usg=AOvVaw2gGPo1M4qDzpFMkOL_O34d); Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-July-Sept-15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922812111&usg=AOvVaw2c-drUeBrbaPoIk8oGak-i) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1955 July–September 15th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-July-Sept-15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922812443&usg=AOvVaw1FTcJioScHNv6CmptW3vMM)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-July-Sept-15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922812730&usg=AOvVaw1pz0nFsEOCOdbTeSjSwfe1) The Author, 1992, pp. 31–32; Isabel Davis and Ted Bloecher, [Close Encounter at Kelly and Others of 1955](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Close_Encounter_at_Kelly.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922813071&usg=AOvVaw1JWEWpIORjyo-BC5n8U8Hw)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Close_Encounter_at_Kelly.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922813250&usg=AOvVaw2tLkGoKqLbtkIIZFY4W1gH) CUFOS, 1978, p. 180; Clark III 244–245)

August 2 — [Frederick C. Durant](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.thespacereview.com/article/2856/1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922813697&usg=AOvVaw14Heyp2eqq3TCZYzjnbRMZ) informs the Sixth Congress of the International Astronautical Federation in Copenhagen, Denmark, that President [Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922813974&usg=AOvVaw2jaRJlM6eZ5CDBPOO2rosr) has decided to back the launch of a US scientific satellite during the upcoming International Geophysical Year. Not to be outdone, Soviet delegate [Leonid I. Sedov](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonid_I._Sedov&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922814229&usg=AOvVaw0D9iacgvic2gWh3DDJeoYQ) calls a press conference and announces that Russia can launch an artificial satellite within the next 2 years that will be more sophisticated than the Americans’ efforts. (Amy Shira Teitel, “[How the Stage Was Set for the Satellite Race,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.popsci.com/how-stage-was-set-for-satellite-race/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922814520&usg=AOvVaw1z0lWgxxCFvbQ7gOVBRoxQ)” Popular Science, January 3, 2016; Amy Shira Teitel, [Breaking the Chains of Gravity: The Story of Spaceflight](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/breakingchainsof0000teit/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922814916&usg=AOvVaw2RowArkGM6vTg5zAjRMwd6) [before NASA](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/breakingchainsof0000teit/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922815115&usg=AOvVaw3yjSbZPRHE0c_xOIrmnsaU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/breakingchainsof0000teit/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922815293&usg=AOvVaw3Sc9CHfr7C9jr_vFEsHF0E) Bloomsbury Sigma, 2017)

August 8 — The CIA’s [Todos Odarenko](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1975/07/08/archives/dr-todos-m-odarenko.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922815808&usg=AOvVaw2DZlIHA9ibX7a-zwguU5I8) writes an office memorandum recommending that the CIA should maintain a file of UFO sightings but deny that all investigations are inactive, and separate explainable UFOs from unidentifiable reports. (Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 75–76](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/74/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922816337&usg=AOvVaw1rkHqCuDUflUHD0dWfyRzO))

August 11 — 9:30 p.m. A witness in Cairo, Illinois, sees a triangular-shaped UFO low on the horizon above the trees, heading silently north and slightly west. Its front end is dark, its middle section bluish green, and its end very bright. (“[Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201955%252008%252000%2520-%2520August_%2528underlinings%2529.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922816961&usg=AOvVaw1p-W125aQyMrKasMhkB1oI)” APRO Bulletin, August 1955, p. 9)

* * *

August 16 — Early morning. Truck driver Ernest Suddard and his 13-year-old son are returning home to Bradford, West Yorks, England, when their headlights light up a small figure in the street. It is 4 feet tall, dressed in skin-tight black clothes, and is hopping forward in a series of jerky movements. A circular, silvery object, perforated with holes, appears on the figure’s chest just below its throat. It approaches the truck then turns away abruptly into a passage. Suddard alerts the police, but they find nothing. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-July-Sept-15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922817773&usg=AOvVaw0DBXc_8Hm_R0NyKQ-Dlhe3) [UFOs, a History: 1955 July–September 15th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-July-Sept-15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922818136&usg=AOvVaw1iZyOXGBbQwgOLfCBBtKQs)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-July-Sept-15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922818420&usg=AOvVaw03sTh14EpIIZijn4E7pbbw) The Author, 1992, p. 50; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1955-08-16-uk-bradford.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922818777&usg=AOvVaw0ws3ob-OanKef5iD2Jgqkk)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1955-08-16-uk-bradford.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922819074&usg=AOvVaw1SzDc8hI1lIkPiQ2X402_z) February 19, 2008)

August 16 — 3:55 p.m. Mechanic Hugh Saunders sees a silver object above a white cloudbank above Cave Hill in Belfast, Northern Ireland. It is flat and moves swiftly. (Belfast Telegraph, August 17, 1955; Shane Cochrane, “Ireland vs. the Flying Saucers,” Fortean Times 317 (September 2014): 55)

August 19 — 2:00 p.m. A “shining, glittering ball” zigzags across the sky over Lisburn, Northern Ireland. It is seen by many people for about 10 minutes. Jeffrey Moore, 17, says it looks like a steel ball at first, then as it gets closer it appears “cross-shaped.” It moves in a variety of directions before disappearing into the clouds. (Belfast Telegraph, August 20, 1955; Shane Cochrane, “Ireland vs. the Flying Saucers,” Fortean Times 317 (September 2014): 55)

August 20 — Pilot [Horace A. Hanes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/19085768/horace-a-hanes&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922820293&usg=AOvVaw3Zw-8OCv8dVu6QRNDtHknU) attains an airspeed record of 822 mph in a North American F-100C Super Sabre at Palmdale, California. (Wikipedia, “[North American F-100 Super Sabre](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_American_F-100_Super_Sabre&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922820726&usg=AOvVaw3EehPlKeBCXyNPbYmxG9ZC)”)

August 20 — 10:45 p.m. The president of a small Canadian air service and his nightwatchman are checking their seaplanes in their dock at Kenora, Ontario, when they see an object “shaped like two saucers with their open tops touching, one above the other” streaking toward them from the west. It is silvery-white in color and sending out rays from its surface or sparkling “as if some electric force or very hot air was flowing from all the surfaces.” It tilts on its side about 600 feet from them, then straightens out with the flat side parallel with the ground and hovers about 225 feet from them and 40 feet above the surface of the lake. It is completely silent and looks to be only 4–5 feet across. (J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 111–112](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/110/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922821487&usg=AOvVaw0YEE12i8aq5fDCx3PviaE9))

August 21–22 — About 7:00 p.m. Billy Ray Taylor goes into the backyard of the Elmer “Lucky” Sutton farmhouse 7 miles north of Hopkinsville, Kentucky, and sees a bright object come from the south-southwest, pass over, and descend into a gully about 500 feet north and about 35-40 feet lower elevation. [Glennie Lankford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10354868/glennie-mae-lankford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922822035&usg=AOvVaw06CH1TF1LsdgNOcCHU9_04) and 6 other adults (Elmer Sutton, Vera Sutton, John Charley Sutton, Alene Sutton, June Taylor, O. P. Baker) plus 3 children (Charlton, Lonnie, and Mary Lankford), see several gremlin-like creatures float down from trees and approach the house from the dark. They are about 3 feet high with roundish heads, elephantine ears, slit-like mouths extending ear to ear, huge and wide-set eyes, no visible necks, and long arms ending in clawed hands. They wear glowing silver clothing. When they run, they drop on all fours. When one of them approaches the house, Sutton and Taylor fire shotguns through the window screen, scoring a direct hit. The creature is knocked over, but gets up and scuttles off. Taylor walks out the door and one of the creatures grabs at his head. This activity continues the greater part of the night and includes heavy gunfire at times. Sutton fires point blank at it, knocking it from the roof, but it just “floats down.” At about 11:00 p.m. they run out of ammunition, and the entire group flees in terror in two cars and drives at high speed into Hopkinsville to report the incident to the police. A state patrolman leaves the Shady Oaks restaurant 3 miles north of Hopkinsville in a car to respond to the call and sees several meteor- like objects streaking over him sounding like artillery fire. He sees two in a series looking like meteors coming from the southwest, headed towards Kelly from the direction of Fort Campbell, a US Army installation. City, county, state, and military police and reporters drive out to the Sutton farm to investigate from 11:30 p.m. to 2:00

a.m. The UFO entities return at about 2:30 a.m. Glennie Lankford is trying to get to sleep when she sees one outside her window stretching its claw-like hands up to the screen. Elmer Sutton again shoots at them without effect. The last one is seen at about 5:15 a.m. Clark writes that investigations by “police, Air Force officers from nearby Fort Campbell, and civilian ufologists found no evidence of a hoax”; however, [Brian Dunning](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brian_Dunning_(author)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922822861&usg=AOvVaw2mE1E5QBSkk4jo-cjswZIm) reports that “the claim that Air Force investigators showed up the next day at Mrs. Lankford’s house has been published a number of times by later authors, but I could find no corroborating evidence of this.” Dunning also observes that “the four military police who accompanied the police officers on the night of the event were from an Army base, not an Air Force base.” Skeptic [Joe Nickell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Nickell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922823137&usg=AOvVaw0IOU3emKSn1u6aR0XW4Cgg) notes that the family could have misidentified great horned owls, which are nocturnal, fly silently, have yellow eyes, and aggressively defend their nests. He thinks Taylor and Sutton were drinking heavily. Meteor sightings also occurred at the time that could explain Billy Ray Taylor’s claim that he saw “a bright light streak across the sky and disappear beyond a tree line some distance from the house.” (Wikipedia, “[Kelly–Hopkinsville encounter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kelly%25E2%2580%2593Hopkinsville_encounter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922823618&usg=AOvVaw1g1JvwqT2ovKbxrb1_bbsq)”; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-July-Sept-15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922824004&usg=AOvVaw3YWQ05_Rqwa_narKhM4Dpb) [UFOs, a History: 1955 July–September 15th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-July-Sept-15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922824362&usg=AOvVaw20p5UqFevrz_1gwlpG2R22)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-July-Sept-15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922824629&usg=AOvVaw3kAUrVCRNWAwpnUa1rdGGK) The Author, 1992, pp. 54–75; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-July-Sept-15-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922825029&usg=AOvVaw1LxEUyZNYHKMjyGHat-35x) [of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1955 July–September 15th, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-July-Sept-15-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922825391&usg=AOvVaw1KPVT03AEJKIQ2FCc2FmsT)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-July-Sept-15-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922825654&usg=AOvVaw1uBWVRHD_8D-AXk-H-WUGs) The Author, 2002, pp. 18– 36; J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 172–178](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/172/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922825978&usg=AOvVaw11M6bOy5DT5cCL98OjTcp9); Story, [pp. 190–192](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/190/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922826261&usg=AOvVaw3D5iXEisZRlmRzV-bl5h5C); Clark III 642–

643; Isabel Davis and Ted Bloecher, Close Encounter at Kelly and Others of 1955, CUFOS, 1978; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922826931&usg=AOvVaw1-5MBfaXp9h6kS0i4_JuQn)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922827141&usg=AOvVaw1RVzvkVMfcyrcDWIC0D0uB) p. 230; “The Close Encounter of the Third Kind at Kelly Re-examined,” IUR 3, no. 5 (May 1978): 4–6; Kim Hansen, “UFO Casebook,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, pp. 53–56; Joe Nickell, “[Siege of ‘Little Green Men’:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://skepticalinquirer.org/2006/11/siege-of-little-green-men-the-1955-kelly-kentucky-incident/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922827793&usg=AOvVaw3PPQNsbwWTmFthhkzXtJLO) [The 1955 Kelly, Kentucky, Incident,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://skepticalinquirer.org/2006/11/siege-of-little-green-men-the-1955-kelly-kentucky-incident/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922828189&usg=AOvVaw1gqxFSJ5x-6UVmFpQfNX42)” Skeptical Inquirer 30, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 2006); Brian Dunning, “[The Kelly-](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://skeptoid.com/episodes/4331&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922828621&usg=AOvVaw3U5lV1lKC3-8yBO1s7C4YN) [Hopkinsville Encounter,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://skeptoid.com/episodes/4331&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922828936&usg=AOvVaw334qj9HcJkF_QVvdHLZ0G1)” Skeptoid podcast no. 331, October 9, 2012; Patrick Gross, “[The Kelly-Hopkinsville](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/kelly55.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922829289&usg=AOvVaw0dZ9fS1l9Ud3YMwjcgFiaa) [Case, 1955](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/kelly55.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922829604&usg=AOvVaw3OyI3DRacvlYUg9EcKUb-Y)”)

August 23–24 — 11:50 p.m. Personnel at the Ground Observer Corps tower in Hamilton County, Ohio, notice three white spheres between Columbus and Cincinnati. Tracking the UFOs on radar, they notify SAC at Lockbourne AFB \[now Rickenbacker Air National Guard Base\], which scrambles jets to investigate. The UFO approaches the tower and hovers in pendulum-like motions directly above it. The interceptors give chase, but the UFO disappears at an incredible speed. The Greater Cincinnati Airport also tracks unidentified blips on radar. To his surprise, [Stringfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922830216&usg=AOvVaw0QNKi4ruGpnA5MDAO3vW4M) obtains clearance to write about these sightings in CRIFO Orbit. But when he tries to interest the Cincinnati newspapers, they are not interested. A Wright-Patterson AFB spokesperson denies the incident to the press and claims to know nothing about Stringfield’s relationship with ADC. (Stringfield, Situation Red, Fawcett Crest, 1977, pp. 12–14; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922830697&usg=AOvVaw0b4-wA9iPlpSJYSLprTkfk)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922830859&usg=AOvVaw1KOs0Xpuzw-0_Igw1-i1iY) p. 230; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-July-Sept-15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922831071&usg=AOvVaw2O4ayypKxcbgOymNtZ2eX-) [1955 July–September 15th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-July-Sept-15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922831374&usg=AOvVaw1sGO2gijCn82oulFrWVYrF), The Author, 1992, p. 75)

August 25 — 8:30 p.m. Mrs. Lloyd Wright and Mrs. Lester Parsons of Bedford, Indiana, see a huge white object with a black streak down the center. The object seems to expand and contract regularly as it hovers over Mrs. Parsons’s home. The houselights appear to dim and pulsate in rhythm with the object. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922831927&usg=AOvVaw26gigUvcT64l4FI0ypVf87), p. 114)

August 29 — RAF pilot [Walter Gibb](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Gibb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922832305&usg=AOvVaw2Y-v8rx5hX9ZsROULTMdmW) reaches an official record altitude of 65,876 feet in an English Electric Canberra B.2 turbojet. (Wikipedia, “[Walter Gibb](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Gibb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922832684&usg=AOvVaw02Ig-vbJfY-BDBROSObF8g)”)

August 30 — 9:30 a.m. Pedro Navarro, 25, takes a photograph of some swirling storm clouds over Dudignac, Buenos Aires province, Argentina. When he develops them, he notes that the disturbance looks more like a giant disc. The newspapers reproduce enhanced versions of the photo, but it is never critically analyzed until several decades later. The best guess is that the photo shows a round cloud. (Vicente-Juan Ballester-Olmos, “[Exigesis of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://fotocat.blogspot.com/2021_12_26_archive.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922833183&usg=AOvVaw0izpGwSpBBW4bgS-m4cRQf) [Dudignac Saucer of 1955,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://fotocat.blogspot.com/2021_12_26_archive.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922833464&usg=AOvVaw0BKhe6hytYg5YepA6wXlTK)” UFO FOTOCAT Blog, December 26, 2021; Vicente-Juan Ballester Olmos, “[Exegesis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.academia.edu/69431110/Exegesis_of_the_Dudignac_Saucer_of_1955&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922833837&usg=AOvVaw025LLtvgJ50WTNUqA8bm-p) [of the Dudignac Saucer of 1955,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.academia.edu/69431110/Exegesis_of_the_Dudignac_Saucer_of_1955&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922834205&usg=AOvVaw3QLSCIBRx_XJcOKN3M8je7)” January 2022)

September — Austrian Countess [Zoe Wassilko von Serecki](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zoe_Wassilko_von_Serecki&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922834746&usg=AOvVaw14RTzM7EfB5GIPQxD4ODYz) writes an article for American Astrology in which she conceives of UFOs as living animals that inhabit the ionosphere and are attracted to electrical sources. (Zoë Wassilko-Serecki, “Startling Theory on Flying Saucers,” American Astrology 23 (September 1955): 2–5; Clark III 1099–1100)

September — Day. Several witnesses see four silver discs flying in formation over Lima, Ohio. (Michael D. Swords, “The Timmerman Files,” IUR 26, no. 4 (Winter 2001–2002): 13)

September 2–4 — 9:05 p.m. [Eddy Geddes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/17944025/eddy-stewart-geddes&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922835851&usg=AOvVaw2GOSg-WPQGsE3jQN-Ov6cz) notices a fireball as he is driving to Kalispell, Montana, from Whitefish. He stops at a Ground Observer post and notifies the women stationed there. Jets are scrambled from Malmstrom AFB in Great Falls and arrive shortly after midnight, long after the object is gone, but another fireball is apparently seen later. The same scenario occurs on September 4 when five F-94C Starfire jets (as well as other aircraft from Great Falls and Spokane, Washington, are sent to the Kalispell area. (“[Air Force Jets Called in Search for](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/98864723/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922836281&usg=AOvVaw2bR_QYj3MCJorr7iLqZC5j) [‘Fireball’ over Kalispell,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/98864723/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922836572&usg=AOvVaw1WJz_MTUeGQKobwItptm2-)” The Missoulian, September 5, 1955, p. 7; “[Recent Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201956%252009%252015%2520-%2520Sept_%2528AFU%2529.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922837078&usg=AOvVaw1FaGlZ3LGlKWSenwqR71Yb)” APRO Bulletin, September 15, 1956, p. 19)

September 8 — Test pilot [Ray J. Goudey](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://m.roadrunnersinternationale.com/obits/goudey.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922837628&usg=AOvVaw3Dlkxdo8nEelkXgugze8fc) reaches an altitude of 65,000 feet in a Lockheed U-2 at Groom Lake, Nevada, a feat not revealed until declassification in 1998. “From where I was up above Nevada I could see the Pacific Ocean, which was 300 miles away.” (Wikipedia, “[Lockheed U-2](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_U-2&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922838033&usg=AOvVaw1FDx1uLuqflDJIKNIv6NLy)”)

September 9 — Capt. Hugh McKenzie of the Air Defense Command in Columbus, Ohio, contacts UFO researcher [Leonard Stringfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922838517&usg=AOvVaw1OpVI9GkkLPARtxt9632Tn) in Cincinnati and asks for CRIFO’s cooperation in providing them with new UFO reports. He also says that Ground Observer Corps in southwestern Ohio is to report UFO activity to CRIFO for screening.

Screened reports are then to be forwarded to the ADC filter center using the code “Fox Trot Kilo 3-0 Blue.” All expenses will be reimbursed by the Air Force. (Stringfield, Situation Red, Fawcett Crest, 1977, p. 11; Clark III 1114)

September 20 — In response to a September 13 letter from Rep. [Gordon H. Scherer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gordon_H._Scherer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922839362&usg=AOvVaw15-860agkbKQ8Pb1veHAb4) (R-Ohio) about the contactee claims of [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922839732&usg=AOvVaw2yruehKcln8yQjjZLQoP7u)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922839967&usg=AOvVaw0vp_rCfc-SbVH5hf4dIBtS) CIA Director [Allen Dulles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allen_Dulles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922840254&usg=AOvVaw0VoGkx22U_aiB3VIjAK2ES) replies that the “CIA shall have no police, subpoena, law- enforcement powers, or internal-security functions” over mail fraud related to UFOs. (Allen W. Dulles, [Letter to](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP80R01731R001600090043-3.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922840694&usg=AOvVaw1rNoEI1fWCWBRSiHHJ3J0e) [Gordon H. Scherer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP80R01731R001600090043-3.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922841050&usg=AOvVaw2jMuc6gP1AuSkzMzyiIikA) September 20, 1955)

* * *

October — President [Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922841651&usg=AOvVaw2SVmTG1a_NGFlErUHvHps1) gives the CIA control over the U-2 spy plane program and Area 51. (Jacobsen, Area 51,

[p. 58](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/58/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922842186&usg=AOvVaw3D5RSqohSoQF3b3ZGM3-4T))

October — 8:00 p.m. A student at St. Joseph’s Minor Seminary in Peterborough, New Hampshire, sees four glowing, bluish-white objects to the southwest. One appears to be on the ground with 3–4 figures beside it. He goes into the recreation room to find more witnesses. When they go outside, the objects are slowly moving above the school building toward the northeast. (“[New Hampshire,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1985_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V6.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922842732&usg=AOvVaw1Ux5hncSOxvyEqxbPFOijt)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 6, no. 2 (April/May 1985): 4–5)

October 3 — A B-47 from Davis-Monthan AFB in Tucson, Arizona, crashes northwest of Lovington, New Mexico. The lone survivor, 2nd Lt. William Daniel Borggen, says the plane is flying at 15,000 feet when three instruments go out after it breaks away from a refueling plane in a pre-dawn flight. The crew drops 5,000 feet, then the bomber hits something and crashes. (“[B-47 Crash Is Probed,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94020580/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922843376&usg=AOvVaw0R8GyBonUZanoeo13unFQO)” Clovis (N.Mex.) News-Journal, October 3, 1955, pp. 1-2)

October 4 — 7:10 p.m. Senator [Richard B. Russell Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Russell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922843867&usg=AOvVaw3nF1QGT5sjYOjCX5NToh7x) (D-Ga.), chairman of the Armed Services Committee, on a trip to the USSR, is on a Soviet train near Baku, Azerbaijan, when he spots a disc-shaped craft taking off near the tracks. Russell sees the “first flying disc ascend and pass over the train” and goes “rushing in to get Mr. Efron \[Reuben Efron, his interpreter\] and Col. Hathaway \[Col. E. U. Hathaway, his aide\] to see it,” the report says. “Col.

Hathaway stated that he got to the window with the Senator in time to see the first \[UFO\], while Mr. Efron said that he got only a short glimpse of the first. However, all three saw the second disc and all agreed that they saw the same round, disc-shaped craft…as the first.” A fourth witness is unidentified. “One disc ascended almost vertically, at a relatively slow speed, with its outer surface revolving slowly to the right, to an altitude of about 6,000 feet, where its speed then increased sharply as it headed north,” the report states. “The second flying disc was seen performing the same actions about one minute later. The take-off area was about 1–2 miles south of the rail line.” The Air Force report is written by Lieut. Col. Thomas Ryan, who interviews Russell’s companions in Prague, Czechoslovakia \[now Czech Republic\], on October 13, after they arrive there from Russia shortly after the sighting. The report remains Top Secret until April 30, 1959, and Secret until March 1985 when [Stanton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanton_T._Friedman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922844477&usg=AOvVaw09-Vep7rrGMtCkL7ImcTJu) [Friedman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanton_T._Friedman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922844664&usg=AOvVaw0k6zObJqvrV2jo7L8n3Jou) manages to get it declassified following a FOIA request.
