October 25 — Project Blue Book Special Report No. 14 is released, months after it is completed by analysts at Battelle Memorial Institute in Columbus, Ohio, using cases supplied by the Air Force and tabulated on IBM punch cards. The original report by Battelle is about 300 pages, but the Air Force distills this down to 100. It is accompanied by a press release in which Secretary of the Air Force [Donald A. Quarles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_A._Quarles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922854454&usg=AOvVaw2oXbeuQZbBWTjk6KN_5FES) states: “On the basis of this study we believe that no objects such as those popularly described as flying saucers have overflown the United States.” (At the same time, Quarles states that the Air Force is working on radical new aircraft that “are sure to be mistaken for flying saucers.”) Only 100 copies are printed initially, but scientist [Leon Davidson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leon_Davidson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922854886&usg=AOvVaw3rHbE9U1YZmNeRqFth0ZPN) prints and sells copies of it beginning in 1956, along with his analysis and commentary. The report includes 3,201 reported UFO sightings.

Battelle employs four scientific analysts, who divide cases into knowns, unknowns, and a third category of insufficient information. They also break down knowns and unknowns into four categories of quality, from excellent to poor. For a case to be called identified, two analysts must independently agree on a solution; for a case to be called unidentified, all four analysts must agree. A report classified as unidentified is defined as: “Those reports of sightings wherein the description of the object and its maneuvers could not be fitted to the pattern of any known object or phenomenon.” Out of 3,201 cases, 69% are judged to be identified, 22%

* * *

are unidentified, and 9% have insufficient information to make a determination. The report further breaks these results down based on whether the identification is considered certain or merely doubtful. For example, in both the astronomical and aircraft IFO categories, 12% are considered certain and 9% are doubtful. Overall, of the 69% listed as IFOs, 42% are thought to be solved with certainty, while 27% are still considered doubtful. In addition, if a case is lacking in adequate data, it is placed in the insufficient information category, separate from both IFOs and UFOs. A key feature is to statistically compare IFOs and UFOs by six characteristics: color, number of objects, shape, duration, speed, and brightness. If there are no significant differences, the two classes are probably the same, the UFOs then representing merely a failure to properly identify prosaic phenomena that can already account for IFOs. On the other hand, if the differences are statistically significant, this suggests IFOs and UFOs are indeed distinctly different phenomena. In the initial results, all characteristics except brightness test significant at less or much less than 1% (brightness is greater than 5%). By removing astronomical sightings from the knowns and redoing the test, just two categories, number and speed, are significant at less than 1%, the remainder having results between 3% and 5%. This indicates that there is a statistically significant difference between the characteristics ascribed to UFOs and IFOs, but perhaps not as significant as the initial results suggested. For two characteristics, brightness and speed, the significance actually increases with the revised test. [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922856052&usg=AOvVaw20sLUP8K7Lmy-c_xccHZxx) later calls the Battelle report a “shamefully biased interpretation of statistics to support a preconceived notion.” [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922856451&usg=AOvVaw1NVBe4z3qRrASdyNk8d5zL) asks [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922856810&usg=AOvVaw3Mas6PIC9WTwTPukSMdvn9) what he thinks. Ruppelt says the report “was a shock to me. I was the one that had the IBM system tried out. It didn’t prove a thing, and I had written it off as worthless before I left the project… also this report was drawn up in 1953, yet the Air Force released it as the latest hot dope in October, 1955.” The Air Force releases a second edition, with a new preface and an addendum that brings the subject up to date, in July 1957. In the 1990s, after interviewing three men (Art Westerman, [Perry Rieppel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/star-gazette/obituary.aspx?n%3Dperry-rieppel%26pid%3D87901417&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922857404&usg=AOvVaw21DPEcNMutS2prvfBDt906)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/star-gazette/obituary.aspx?n%3Dperry-rieppel%26pid%3D87901417&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922857706&usg=AOvVaw1cvdgc2e74T6qTp2b8SfBY) and William T. Reid) who had participated in the Battelle project, [Mark Rodeghier](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/mark_rodeghier.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922858046&usg=AOvVaw0zo_zpKcsdAQBcwxdIYVJs) and [Jennie Zeidman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/name/jennie-zeidman-obituary?pid%3D195927848&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922858438&usg=AOvVaw0gk6Z0SpN9AbPDGjubIJoa) of the Center for UFO Studies conclude that the engineering mindset at Battelle had caused a disconnect between its data and its conclusions. Because the project cannot reverse engineer a UFO from the reports (because of faulty witness testimony, multicausal UFOs, etc.), the engineers conclude that a structured craft does not exist. (Wikipedia, “[Identification studies of UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Identification_studies_of_UFOs%23Project_Blue_Book_Special_Report_No._14&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922858960&usg=AOvVaw1L2bJeNk8DQ5abvd6dUN7P)”; Wikipedia, “[Project Blue Book](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Blue_Book%23Project_Blue_Book_Special_Report_No._14&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922859332&usg=AOvVaw1IKK8B4OzdvXQ9gVpe1t2q)”; US Air Force Air Technical Intelligence Center, [Special Report No. 14; Analysis of Reports](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.academia.edu/49680297/Project_Blue_Book_Special_Report_14&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922859686&usg=AOvVaw3w5jr8iC4rSg67aWe3hLSp) [of Unidentified Flying Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.academia.edu/49680297/Project_Blue_Book_Special_Report_14&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922860057&usg=AOvVaw3jGOJjRMN6AG4NTXdxsEtj), May 5, 1955; Leon Davidson, [Flying Saucers: An Analysis of Project Blue Book](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Air_Force_Project_Blue_Book_Special_Report_14R.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922860479&usg=AOvVaw0y0HmSHviMBLl4F0KYwODm) [Special Report No. 14](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Air_Force_Project_Blue_Book_Special_Report_14R.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922860797&usg=AOvVaw1SlYvgpih0aa_gUoe5M_xI), \[1956\], 3d ed., Ramsey-Wallace, 1966; “[Plan Radical New Aircraft,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/3391549/the-news-herald/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922861285&usg=AOvVaw3qub6C-Coo2_OCFH1qmqIJ)” Franklin (Pa.)

News-Herald, October 26, 1955, p. 1; Clark III 929–932; Jacobs, UFO Controversy in America, Signet ed., 1976,

[pp. 123–126](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/56/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922862023&usg=AOvVaw29b_0UbSjDLNxHhY4CRlJ7); Keyhoe, FSTS, p. 770; Jennie Zeidman, “I Remember Blue Book,” IUR 16, no. 2 (Mar./Apr. 1991): 7–8; Jennie Zeidman and Mark Rodeghier, “The Pentacle Letter and the Battelle UFO Project,” IUR 18, no. 3 (May/June 1993): 4–12, 19–21; Joel Carpenter, “[The Senator, the Saucer, and](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/pdfs/the_senator.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922862500&usg=AOvVaw0URP57D4ponKnn9EYG57UH) [Special Report](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/pdfs/the_senator.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922862657&usg=AOvVaw0xryadB0s0MHRceZ4Q_ixC) [14,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/pdfs/the_senator.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922862804&usg=AOvVaw12Ntx-ujHwqd5Lg50amwkY)” IUR 25, no. 1 (Spring 2000): 3, 9; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1955 September](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Sept-15-Dec-31.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922863117&usg=AOvVaw0_vSDJt5pUBMDRGLBo9Fq3) [15th–December 31st](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Sept-15-Dec-31.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922863336&usg=AOvVaw2iI8mhOV2nKpCogsC4Dr-m)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1955-Sept-15-Dec-31.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922863585&usg=AOvVaw2EN1cc9Whjz1Gg-KDBhevj) The Author, 1993, pp. 30–63; Swords 220–224, 239–241)

October 25 — A mysterious object passes over Serbia and is seen throughout the country. [Milorad B. Protić](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milorad_B._Proti%25C4%2587&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922864093&usg=AOvVaw3Ufn6_ARu47jJVwMkVBoF6) and other astronomers at Belgrade Observatory track the object and determine that it is not a meteor. October 27 — Afternoon. [Hosea D. Lambeth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/204660895/hosea-dewood-lambeth&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922864718&usg=AOvVaw3vfSCRrpURqOw7ZgzgJ84c), principal of Whitsett Elementary School, North Carolina, and about 100 students watch 10 objects like “steel balls” dart through the sky for 25 minutes. November 1 — 8:06 p.m. A flying light paces New Zealand National Airways DC-3 Flight 108 west of Waitara, New Zealand, at 8,000 feet for about 5 minutes. Capt. [William T. Rainbow](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/212072634/wiliam-thomas-rainbow&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922867093&usg=AOvVaw1xzG1YOsaWLejS-QTEyvhi) and Copilot [Stanley G. Trounce](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/232262515/stanley-grant-trounce&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922867365&usg=AOvVaw09FtOT86oGEK0TSbyYaj2N) spot the object behind them flying along the coast on a parallel course. Changing color from white to yellow to gold to red, it overtakes the aircraft and flies alongside it for 15 miles, then picks up speed and disappears into the distance ahead. Rainbow estimates it is traveling at 850 mph. (UFOEv, [p. 125](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D137%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922867729&usg=AOvVaw3MYE8q4x4MYbrE4CbExTot); “[1955: ‘Flying Light’ Seen by](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufocusnz.org.nz/1955-flying-light-seen-by-nac-capt-and-crew/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922868080&usg=AOvVaw1WZOnJVEt6oXkYJhIqM71O) [NAC Captain and Crew,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufocusnz.org.nz/1955-flying-light-seen-by-nac-capt-and-crew/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922868339&usg=AOvVaw2B6RaW9PjC7L-IQlekIQQD)” Ufocus.nz, June 15, 2021)

November 20 — 5:20 p.m. Operations Officer Capt. [Edward G. Denkler Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/574396/edward-george-denkler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922868673&usg=AOvVaw0X_3Em6ZuHubspU_P19PRW) and 5 men of the USAF 663rd AC&W Squadron see two oblong, bright orange, semi-transparent objects fly erratically at terrific speed toward and away from each other, over Lake City \[now Rocky Top\], Tennessee. (NICAP, “[Seven Witnesses Observe Maneuvering](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/551120lakecity_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922869081&usg=AOvVaw2tKA2bzJhNQDVl4eHHCPGj) [Objects near Oak Ridge Plant](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/551120lakecity_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922869296&usg=AOvVaw003jKJdF4kijKRjFU8Jlub)”; Sparks, p. 232)

November 22 — The first Soviet test of a true thermonuclear bomb takes place at the Semipalatinsk Test Site in Kazakhstan. (Wikipedia, “[RDS-37](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RDS-37&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922870186&usg=AOvVaw2maBuhhmbl4sykLv8sbZcQ)”)

November 30–December 2 — The New York Herald Tribune and Miami Herald publish two articles by aviation journalist [Ansel Talbert](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ansel_Talbert&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922870851&usg=AOvVaw1U_gWqCL96XdcSe3aImhQk) in which he lists the names of aerospace firms conducting gravity-control propulsion research, including Glenn L. Martin Company, Convair, Bell Aircraft, Lear Inc., Clarke Electronics, and Sperry Gyroscope Division. The Gravity Research Group indicates these companies have constructed “rigs” to improve the performance of [Thomas Townsend Brown](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Townsend_Brown&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922871142&usg=AOvVaw1wfws9oJSLb9cREPrFCmca)’s gravitators through attempts to develop materials with high dielectric constants. Articles about the gravity propulsion research by the aerospace firms cease after 1974. Follow-up studies on Brown’s work and other claims are conducted by [R. L. Talley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scirp.org/(S(351jmbntvnsjt1aadkozje))/reference/referencespapers.aspx?referenceid%3D916159&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922871507&usg=AOvVaw0Lx3MqrGWhazIIhK_b8WfK) in 1990 and 2013 US Air Force studies, NASA scientist [Jonathan W. Campbell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nasa.gov/centers/marshall/news/news/releases/2003/03-132.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922871909&usg=AOvVaw1KhfTMqWBftAnTddW8Zmgp) in a 2003 experiment, and [Martin Tajmar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_Tajmar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922872251&usg=AOvVaw0ZU3-vTUmmCVewras06ctc) in a 2004 paper. They find that no thrust can be observed in a vacuum and that Brown’s and other [ion-lifter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ionocraft&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922872586&usg=AOvVaw18CjrzxIW5a6olJs2BbBA8) devices produce thrust along their axis regardless of the direction of gravity—consistent with electrohydrodynamic effects. (Wikipedia, “[United](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_gravity_control_propulsion_research%23Aerospace_Research_Laboratories_.28ARL.29&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922873192&usg=AOvVaw0z1QIoKVr_424BTzV1Luzk) [States gravity control propulsion research](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_gravity_control_propulsion_research%23Aerospace_Research_Laboratories_.28ARL.29&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922873566&usg=AOvVaw1pgte9V1ypUFXu1d8rqfAM)”; Wikipedia, “[Anti-gravity](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anti-gravity%23Thomas_Townsend_Brown%2527s_gravitator&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922873905&usg=AOvVaw3WIxCHywib-QFz4fkHPg4R)”; Ansel E. Talbert, “[Scientists Taking First](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94024431/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922874100&usg=AOvVaw3HiHYcWaOeOVwQ8u2qNHh0) [Steps](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94024431/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922874290&usg=AOvVaw1WbuuGItbjsP1uP0h8ZJbO) [in Assault on Gravity Barrier,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94024450/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922874559&usg=AOvVaw3r2b9ddgA7u6I3Ne04ntVh)” Miami Herald, November 30, 1955, pp. 1–2; Ansel E. Talbert, “[Future](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94024507/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922874839&usg=AOvVaw0bybMy4pKg3nfakI8EY9dn) [Planes May Defy Gravity and Air Lift in Space Travels,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94024507/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922875019&usg=AOvVaw1WKhcXrdz45zqA9p18PzHU)” Miami Herald, December 2, 1955, p. 8)

December 11 — 9:00 p.m. Near Jacksonville, Florida, two airline pilots and ground observers see a fast-maneuvering, orange-red, round object, with ground radar tracking. Two USN jets on a practice night-flying mission are vectored to the object by a Naval Air Station Jacksonville controller. On approach the object suddenly rises up to 30,000 feet then dives back down in a circle, buzzing the jets. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922875548&usg=AOvVaw1UBoZdCuYw1ZBAOPdrwZb0), p. 232)

1956

1956 — French ufologist [Aimé Michel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aim%25C3%25A9_Michel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922876029&usg=AOvVaw1iMttVJ5HML58prhafN7hR) publishes The Truth about Flying Saucers, one of the best early books on UFOs, originally published in French in 1954. (Aimé Michel, The Truth about Flying Saucers, Criterion, 1956; “[First](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://pelicanist.blogspot.com/2012/02/first-read-aime-michels-truth-about.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922876440&usg=AOvVaw1wPtBG8XDF-soPw7HF8z9y) [Read: Aimé Michel’s ‘The Truth about Flying Saucers,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://pelicanist.blogspot.com/2012/02/first-read-aime-michels-truth-about.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922876661&usg=AOvVaw0DXrf7wFZC2e9YoRvFOeSA)” Magonia, February 25, 2012)

1956 — [Gray Barker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gray_Barker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922876935&usg=AOvVaw1pro1nBELJ1kZyXAkOTHI4) publishes They Knew Too Much about Flying Saucers, a bestselling book about the supposed [Albert](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_K._Bender&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922877209&usg=AOvVaw0LDkPnfa1dKgOPtCRx5w8N)

[K. Bender](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_K._Bender&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922877409&usg=AOvVaw2QJwfMPMuGbmdT4tC2S6Vx) mystery and his encounter with three men in black. (Gray Barker, [They Knew Too Much about Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/graybarkertheyknewtoomuchaboutflyingsaucers_201910/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922877717&usg=AOvVaw1Uu8errnG2auanJKLmDt6m) [Saucers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/graybarkertheyknewtoomuchaboutflyingsaucers_201910/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922877958&usg=AOvVaw0sFFfU_Me423w55tbZW8wx)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/graybarkertheyknewtoomuchaboutflyingsaucers_201910/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922878122&usg=AOvVaw3XQNPDe8xkrXI0q-9qvPKA) University Books, 1956; Clark III 178, 190; David Halperin, “[‘They Knew Too Much’: The Book That](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://mshorror.com/they-knew-too-much-the-book-that-almost-scared-me-under-my-bed/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922878371&usg=AOvVaw38p6sSZkwgotZbuAQT7rfz) [(Almost) Scared Me under My Bed,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://mshorror.com/they-knew-too-much-the-book-that-almost-scared-me-under-my-bed/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922878564&usg=AOvVaw2GOTi1M-YMyKiSBWOgyRGH)” Ms.Horror.com, March 16, 2017)

1956 — [Morris K. Jessup](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morris_K._Jessup&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922878862&usg=AOvVaw1HDaJnOME0_4-T0MKB4cC2) publishes The UFO Annual, an anthology of newspaper and magazine articles about UFOs, and UFO and the Bible, the first book-length attempt to connect biblical miracles with space visitors. Jessup is the first writer to use the term “ufology” in his introduction (dated December 31, 1955). (Morris K. Jessup, The UFO Annual, Citadel, 1956; Clark III 106, 634–635)

1956 — Soviet polar aviator [Valentin Akkuratov](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.peoples.ru/military/aviation/valentin_akkuratov/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922879401&usg=AOvVaw0t5IETg8A3eHF39HAw-oAG) is flying a Tupolev Tu-4 aircraft near Cape Morris Jesup, Greenland, performing strategic ice reconnaissance. Dropping down below the clouds, he sees an unknown object moving on the port side parallel to his course. It looks like a “large pearl-colored lens with wavy, pulsating edges.” Thinking it is a US aircraft, Akkuratov heads back into the clouds. After flying for 40 minutes to the southeast, the cloud cover ends and Akkuratov encounters it again. He decides to approach the object, which changes course and paces the airplane at the same speed. After 15–18 minutes, the UFO sharply alters course, speeds ahead, and rises quickly until it disappears. (Felix Ziegel, “[Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Duc1.31210023618901%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D103%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922879740&usg=AOvVaw3HCMsMoahs3XAOgutRjBbb)” Soviet Life, no. 137 (February 1968): 27– 29; Good Above, [pp. 226–227](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/226/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922880059&usg=AOvVaw3qXwWT-3DNSIEd_gIeAQ8w))

1956 — Fishermen at lake Ozero Blagodati, Primorsky Krai, Russia, allegedly see an enormous silvery object with an apparent diameter of 4,900 feet rapidly flying above them at 1,960 feet. It resembles a hat with red portholes around its rim and is accompanied by loud grinding sounds and black smoke. The object emits numerous thin metal threads resembling horse hairs that the fishermen pick up the next day. The object crashes into the Sea of Japan. (Stonehill and Mantle, Russia’s USO Secrets, Flying Disk, 2020, pp. 113–114)

1956 or 1957 — 7:45 p.m. W. J. Kyncy is aboard the destroyer [USS](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Maddox_(DD-731)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922880548&usg=AOvVaw0O33idzV3FhM9d-DRUHr3V) [Maddox](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Maddox_(DD-731)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922880690&usg=AOvVaw04wEpjuclyXZgTmgMlvqhx) in the North Pacific between Midway Island and Japan. He and some 30 other sailors on the stern see a steady orange light coming toward them at about 50 mph. It stops for 2 minutes about 1,300 feet away at about 400 feet altitude. It begins moving again at 35 mph then blinks out after 5–10 seconds. (“[Correspondence,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1982-83_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V3.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922881002&usg=AOvVaw2n-yy5X_ak4bcH-70NquN_)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 3, no. 4 (Aug./Sept. 1982): 6)

January — The US Army Chemical Corps begins classified human experiments at its Edgewood Arsenal facility at the Aberdeen Proving Ground, Maryland. The Medical Research Volunteer Program (1956–1975) is driven by

* * *

intelligence requirements and the need for new and more effective interrogation techniques. Overall, about 7,000 soldiers take part in these experiments that involve exposure to more than 250 different chemicals. Some of the volunteers exhibit symptoms at the time of exposure to these agents but long-term follow-up is not planned as part of the Department of Defense studies. The experiments are abruptly terminated by the Army in late 1975 amid an atmosphere of scandal and recrimination as lawmakers accuse researchers of questionable ethics. Many official government reports and civilian lawsuits follow in the wake of the controversy. The chemical agents include VX, sarin, mustard gas, atropine, scopolamine, 2-PAM chloride, LSD, PCP, cannabinoids, riot control agents, alcohol, and caffeine. (Wikipedia, “[Edgewood Arsenal human experiments](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edgewood_Arsenal_human_experiments&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922881622&usg=AOvVaw3RicbDe0RqZDswXzzwY7kE)”)

January — [Edward J. Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922881955&usg=AOvVaw0sW7ytaX8nPs98CRFWJrIV)’s Report on Unidentified Flying Objects is published. His candid opinions about UFOs contradict many of the positions taken on UFOs by the Air Force. He has personally seen the Estimate of the Situation, he confirms the existence of [Fournet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/ufochop2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922882240&usg=AOvVaw1jWTifi2ve-DUVoJCdTO1x)’s motion study, and he first describes the basic contours of the Robertson Panel. (Edward J. Ruppelt, [The Report on Unidentified Flying Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922882439&usg=AOvVaw1Dq6vNshANioroTekLkUBR)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922882584&usg=AOvVaw2SHuYXSkMLU0xeH4AMBYrz) Doubleday, 1956; Michael D. Swords, \[Review\], JUFOS 3 (1991): 179–183)

January 9 — The CIA’s Applied Science Division takes on the job of holding UFO reports. (ClearIntent, [p. 135](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/134/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922883081&usg=AOvVaw1msrzcIMLnt-bNfFwtWuVG))

January 13 — UFO researcher [Morris K. Jessup](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morris_K._Jessup&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922883371&usg=AOvVaw1W-K-lDa-uy5J9l65MS4jp) receives a letter from someone in New Kensington, Pennsylvania, who calls himself [Carlos Miguel Allende](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.de173.com/carlos-miguel-allende-carl-allen/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922883699&usg=AOvVaw2MIdiEiowVtm-ak4EnTQ0O) \[a pseudonym of Carl Allen\], who alludes to a US Navy experiment to make a destroyer invisible in October 1943 \[the bogus Philadelphia Experiment\]. He writes another letter postmarked May 25 that suggests hypnosis or truth serum might bring out more details. (Wikipedia, “[Philadelphia](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philadelphia_Experiment%23Origins_of_the_story&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922884057&usg=AOvVaw1XlXjnJ-48_tBtba4L8XOf) [Experiment](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philadelphia_Experiment%23Origins_of_the_story&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922884269&usg=AOvVaw0BWSF4AthG5W78Vj9excub)”; Clark III 95; Andrew H. Hochheimer, “[The Carl Allen Letters,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.de173.com/carl-allen/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922884476&usg=AOvVaw3ueH9xGebwqG7QJr4-bZHd)” The Philadelphia Experiment from A–Z, January 31, 2001)

January 15 — An object the apparent size of a washtub is seen falling into the sea 150 feet offshore Busan, South Korea, by large numbers of townspeople. The glow continues for an hour and a half before the object sinks. Korean and American military authorities are alerted. Military Police Cpl. Ben Elliot observes the glow, which resembles burning alcohol or benzene. (Samuel Norman, “Recent UFOs over Japan,” Fate 9, no. 6 (June 1956): 22–24)

January 22 — [Jonathan N. Leonard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1975/05/16/archives/jonathan-n-leonard-dies-at-71-author-and-time-science-editor.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922885054&usg=AOvVaw2tgmKbeF5_jdmAUjYzrE04) reviews [Harold T. Wilkins](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harold_T._Wilkins&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922885425&usg=AOvVaw3RGPlWJWH7YiJ9DF_btuZU)’s Flying Saucers Uncensored, [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922885714&usg=AOvVaw2vwabWaOj2NbgYTHhI9bFI)’s Flying Saucer Conspiracy, and [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922886015&usg=AOvVaw3pzD3bGMHYxhqmyCnCSXRM)’s Report on UFOs in the New York Times. He calls Wilkins a mystic, Keyhoe “repetitious and unconvincing,” and Ruppelt (most unfairly) “the longest and dullest of the current crop of saucer books.” (Jonathan N. Leonard, “[Visitors from Space,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1956/01/22/90749911.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922886381&usg=AOvVaw0obQ9NlEU_4yS9B5b1mGr-)” New York Times Book Review, January 22, 1956, p. 25)

January 31 — 3:24 p.m. Kentucky National Guard pilot Lt. Col. [Lee J. Merkel](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports2/Merkel%2520Lee%2520J.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922886716&usg=AOvVaw2COh8V8avJMvmfHcCWkitn) is flying an F-51 Mustang out of Standiford Field \[now Louisville International Airport\] in Louisville, Kentucky, on a maintenance test flight. His aircraft crashes 10 miles north of Bedford, Indiana, following some confusing information from various sources about an unknown radar target or visual observation in the vicinity. (ClearIntent, [pp. 62–63](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/62/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922887060&usg=AOvVaw2aCgkGKXZ9Jjuqg485QcxV); Good Need, [pp. 215–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/214/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922887282&usg=AOvVaw3sqnKsLR0J7Fjt1EZPR-1p) [216](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/214/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922887482&usg=AOvVaw33UkwUTr2XvsDMX0SlUG1W))

February 9 — 1:30 a.m. Patrolmen Marvin Poer and John Freeland see a ball of fire plunge behind the breakwater at Redondo Beach, California. It bobs on the water’s surface before sinking into 15 feet of water some 300 feet off the shore. Five county lifeguards row out to look for it and retrieve a US Army Signal Corps battery light that was dropped from an airplane. (“[Sea Cools Mystery of Hot Disk,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/100118264/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922887848&usg=AOvVaw1ELKkqWjds3asTkZvUzMnj)” Los Angeles (Calif.) Mirror-News, February 9, 1956, p. 8; “[Sea-Saucer or Searchlight?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/Orbit/ORBIT%2520Volume%2520II%25201955-56R.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922888101&usg=AOvVaw3cwPHFuFcYa1mTjO-Vdtmk)” CRIFO Orbit 2, no. 12 (March 2, 1956): 4)

February 9 — In a memo, “Responsibility for Unidentified Flying Objects,” the CIA’s Applied Science Division retains files for incoming raw reports that might provide information on foreign weapons R&D. Other (more significant?) reports are forwarded to the Fundamental Sciences Area for review of information on foreign science developments. Still others are to be destroyed. (ClearIntent, [pp. 135–136](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/134/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922888534&usg=AOvVaw2hm2Npg1LnvesM-SNcQGUv))

February 12 — 10:55 p.m. Two F-89D fighters flying at 20,000 feet, one crewed by pilot Bowen and radar observer Crawford, suddenly see a green and red object 40 miles southeast of Goose Bay AFB \[now CFB Goose Bay\], Labrador. It rapidly circles thir jet, and the other fighter tracks it on radar but cannot see it visually. About 15 minutes later, operators at Goose Bay paint a stationary target about 40 miles southwest of the base. The two pilots vectot toward the object and obtain radar contact, but it vanishes when they get within 8 miles. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922888883&usg=AOvVaw0mQf35bJcmBlG4SM6U-9xH), p. 233; Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, p. 262)

February 17 — 10:50 p.m. Air traffic controllers at Orly Airport, Paris, France, see a target appear on their radar screens that is twice the size of a conventional aircraft. It cruises around, hovers, and accelerates at fantastic speeds, and is tracked for a total of 4 hours. When it first appears on radar it is directly above Gometz-le-Châtel, Seine et Oise, and 30 seconds later it is 19 miles away, having moved at nearly 2,500 mph. A second, smaller target appears, identified as an Air France DC-3 airliner flying over the Les Mureaux military base, Yvelines, at 4,500 feet (800 feet lower than the UFO). Orly radios the pilot to alert him to the unidentified target. Radio Officer Beaupertuis sees the object through a window on the starboard side of the plane—enormous in size, indistinct in outline, and

* * *

lit in some areas with a red glow. Capt. Michel Desavoye confirms the sighting, saying he and the crew watch the object for 30 seconds and are certain it is no civil airliner. The sighting duration is nearly 3 hours. (NICAP, “[Large UFO Tracked on Ground Radar](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/560218parisdir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922889678&usg=AOvVaw0IVwhbafNVB_Srvb4kBthc)”; “[A Saucer Shows Up over Paris and Creates a Stir in a Radar Room and](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1956%252CMar-Apr%252CV%25202%252CN%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922889935&usg=AOvVaw3QQQiTSJ0UsDgsHeYFT3j2) [a Cockpit,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1956%252CMar-Apr%252CV%25202%252CN%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922890259&usg=AOvVaw3_uDzN6AJP4btOJM33mCtZ)” Flying Saucer Review 2, no. 2 (March/April 1956): 3; Patrick Gross, “[Orly Airport, France, February](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/orly1956.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922890627&usg=AOvVaw0OcK7LXOHSCv6pchkwjJBY) [1956](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/orly1956.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922890812&usg=AOvVaw10CA6XeVLUInAzf8vP45ue)”)

February 18 — [Stringfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922891228&usg=AOvVaw2Q6DWWkZQp_9SFyyfiYLJr) receives a letter from [Lord Hugh Dowding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_Dowding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922891541&usg=AOvVaw3xezEENdMZ0BZy3UfhRRHI) that says he doesn’t think there is an official “British attitude to UFOs.” (Stringfield, Situation Red, Fawcett Crest, 1977, p. 165)

March — Mechanix Illustrated publishes a story on the Avro Canada MX-1794 (Y-2, or Silver Bug) vertical take-off gyroplane under development by the US Air Force. The cover proclaims, “U.S. Air Force Reveals Our Flying Saucer.” Through 1958, Avro spends $2.5 million and the USAF $5.4 million funding the project. Numerous models are built, and wind-tunnel testing is undertaken at MIT and Wright-Patterson AFB. The design includes eight Armstrong Siddeley Viper turbojet engines, a very large center rotor/impeller with Lundstrom compressor turbines, with the cockpit mounted in the top center. Control is achieved through eight small exhausts at the outer edge, directed either through the top or bottom, in addition to the main turbine exhaust through the bottom center of the craft. A multiengine test rig is built and tested in 1956, resulting in powerful thrust, a great deal of noise, and vibrations. In 1957, the USAF provides additional funding to extend the project, by then highly classified and designated as Weapon System 606A. The concept developed is for a circular-winged, supersonic aircraft. Over 1,000 hours of wind-tunnel testing are performed. Drawings developed by Avro show an aircraft that appears to be a merging of a flying saucer with more conventional fuselage shapes—a tailless aircraft with circular wings. (Wikipedia, “[Avro Canada](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avro_Canada%23Supersonic_Avrodynes&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922892599&usg=AOvVaw1K-nqqCcFP8zIcOuoFjsN0)”; Willy Ley, “[How the Flying Saucer Works,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/Mechanix%2520Illustrated/1956%252003%252000_Mechanix%2520Illustrated_Willy%2520Ley.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922893075&usg=AOvVaw1xV_umUCDyhVy6LeSQxbHP)” Mechanix Illustrated 52 (March 1956): 78–81; Good Need, [p. 215](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/214/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922893481&usg=AOvVaw085Bn390GBm6om2FXep2Iv); Charles Mandel, “[A Saucer from Mars? Nope, Canada,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.wired.com/2001/07/a-saucer-from-mars-nope-canada/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922893697&usg=AOvVaw29FZXw2pjYgWMBaIsxlvFd)” Wired, July 5, 2001)

(Wikipedia, “[Peter Twiss](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Twiss&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922894253&usg=AOvVaw341l46fyFbOYuSmrS_jiXE)”)

March 16 — [Stringfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922894627&usg=AOvVaw3O5d-NWWCdUDOcHEEPmigB) receives a letter from Gen. Spring — The Flying Saucer Discussion Group begins meeting on a more-or-less monthly basis at the YWCA in Washington, D.C. It is begun by Mrs. [Walton C. “Clara” John](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70322188/clara-louise-john&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922896600&usg=AOvVaw1No_nAg99nOf0GSv82DBWm)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70322188/clara-louise-john&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922896776&usg=AOvVaw2DwF2wPibuQZnW_3lCjGsb) the publisher of a mimeographed zine called The Little Listening Post, which often covers UFOs. (“[‘Toward a Broader Understanding…’: The Story of How](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/067%2520OCTOBER%25201971.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922897083&usg=AOvVaw3ht9EBRyZnQLSmnA-00V99) [NICAP Began,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/067%2520OCTOBER%25201971.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922897290&usg=AOvVaw3Ta2ECOuk6SklcIyROVjWC)” UFO Investigator, October 1971, p. 2)

[Charles Hardin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49197803/charles-alton-hardin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922897900&usg=AOvVaw3O-46YUAhJ9GlJ9N7nRf5l) as director of Project Blue Book. April — An annotated copy of the paperback edition of [Morris K. Jessup](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morris_K._Jessup&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922898360&usg=AOvVaw3_nmZ0hCHGR9uLlDwYSO8c)’s The Case for the UFO (1955) is sent in a manila envelope from Seminole, Texas, to Adm. [Frederick R. Furth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49185633/frederick-r-furth&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922898608&usg=AOvVaw0aqpu37kt9Y-FvVkdZsYTQ), chief of the Office of Naval Research. The annotations are written in three different colors of ink, apparently by three persons, A, B, and Jemi, who claim to know a great deal about the UFO intelligences. They mention space people, underwater cities, force fields, and much more. The book falls into the possession of Maj. [Darrell L. Ritter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/191296509/darrell-lloyd-ritter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922898924&usg=AOvVaw0FVyZocdA9X6SeHnqVK48A)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/191296509/darrell-lloyd-ritter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922899132&usg=AOvVaw2-1cVsJC5P4SrunONRq34M) USMC aeronautical project officer at ONR, who brings it to the attention of ONR Capt. Sidney Sherby and ONR Projects Officer Cmdr. [George W.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49206910/george-w-hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922899369&usg=AOvVaw0Kme6oEBLUaAVUs0qUAy78) [Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufoexplorations.com/us-navy-commander-reveals-roswell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922899593&usg=AOvVaw1gqsFj9CFsdleolSIfqZUK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufoexplorations.com/us-navy-commander-reveals-roswell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922899837&usg=AOvVaw0I6aJzs5DlJ159Fxp5s5Z4) who become interested and get permission (as long as it does not involve official naval personnel) to send the copy to the Varo Manufacturing Company, in Garland, Texas, which has contracts with the military.

Varo publishes 25 spiral-bound copies of the book in black and red ink, which shows the annotations. Meanwhile, Jessup has been receiving at least two strange letters (January 13 and May 25, 1956) from someone calling himself [Carlos Miguel Allende](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.de173.com/carlos-miguel-allende-carl-allen/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922900379&usg=AOvVaw1-Bl2fe3cDv0tdnz-e0Tcu)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.de173.com/carlos-miguel-allende-carl-allen/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922900643&usg=AOvVaw2IdYXh6P4oBI-XBpdyh_6M) which claim that as a result of a strange experiment at sea utilizing principles of Einstein’s Field Theory, a destroyer (identified by some as the [USS Eldridge](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Eldridge&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922900997&usg=AOvVaw1_hSyFc89hQAeWUzFJIQlc) and others by the [USS Engstrom](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Engstrom&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922901383&usg=AOvVaw2zSqDFQBOXeLC8s9_EGSV4), which were not in the Philadelphia Navy Yard at the time) and all its crew became invisible in October 1943, but the sailors showed side effects. Allende says he has witnessed all of this. Sherby talks to Jessup about the Varo edition; Jessup isn’t much interested but tells him about the Allende letters, which talk about the same things as the annotations and are obviously written by the same person. [Gray Barker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gray_Barker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922901801&usg=AOvVaw0DJhCg4APkUmNOOIPGAgYB)’s Saucerian Press publishes the Varo edition in July 1972. Sometime in the 1970s, Carlos Allende appears at APRO headquarters and confesses that the whole annotations thing was a hoax, but he surfaces a few years later saying that the CIA coerced him into saying it was a hoax. In the late 1970s, [Robert A. Goerman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://robertgoerman.wixsite.com/paranormal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922902206&usg=AOvVaw0rGVEzjSpgwPsnzXKrt2eo) identifies Allende as Carl Allen, who lives near him in Pennsylvania. In the October 1980 issue of Fate, Goerman explains the entire mess, saying that Allen had written all three of the annotation types. [Bill Moore](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Moore_(ufologist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922902737&usg=AOvVaw1qMTq3VtRwGMMWeLsRM3Do) and [Charles Berlitz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Berlitz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922903120&usg=AOvVaw0JXkLu0nchoWuxc_Eb7Ywe) take the whole thing seriously enough to write The Philadelphia Experiment in 1979, which links the force fields back to [T. Townsend Brown](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Townsend_Brown&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922903614&usg=AOvVaw03sdHoBxC1Aha5DlQUYmvv), later the founder of NICAP. (Morris K. Jessup, The Case for the UFO, [annotated Varo ed.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/THECASEFORTHEUFOVaroEditionM.K.Jessup/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922903978&usg=AOvVaw1JqT1BQCmhK7suEIoASweX), Saucerian, 1972; Wikipedia, “[Philadelphia Experiment](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philadelphia_Experiment&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922904227&usg=AOvVaw1Qkx4h4eun_DSg5BrFQ224)”; Ivan T. Sanderson, “[Jessup and the Allende Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Pursuit%2520-%2520SITU%2520(Sanderson)/Pursuit%2520-%2520No%252004%2520-%2520Vol%252001%2520No%25204%2520-%25201968.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922904500&usg=AOvVaw2UOTbvmYuD8-1Ba7Zr4Cf3)” Pursuit 1, no. 4 (September 30,

April 3 — CIA agent [Joseph Bryan III](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.encyclopediavirginia.org/Bryan_Joseph_III_1904-1993&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922906184&usg=AOvVaw13_85oNwHkCudBRz1HPaHd) writes to [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922906382&usg=AOvVaw3nVopIYtQlO5CACChZi9CU), saying that while he served as special assistant to Air Force Secretary [Thomas Finletter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_K._Finletter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922906570&usg=AOvVaw2qW3XL0xgqFMSXQ9Dl6Wcz)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_K._Finletter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922906714&usg=AOvVaw1awi3wQRslQh7VWjHcgL8-) he tried to “have him prepare a statement for release when communication was established with a saucer.” Finletter declines to do so. They fly over the North Pole and into Siberia, probing for electronic intelligence. (Wikipedia, “[Project HOMERUN](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_HOMERUN&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922908968&usg=AOvVaw2n0qx_xKGt0IPj7dcNaPJV)”; R. April 7 — [Elizabeth Klarer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elizabeth_Klarer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922910017&usg=AOvVaw3d5DznqHYqrsNqRZy844R_) returns to Flying Saucer Hill southwest of Rosetta, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa, drawn by a strange compulsion. The spaceship is waiting for her, and Akon takes her in his hands and says, “Not afraid this time?” He leads her on board the craft, which she learns also carries a second alien, who looks much like Akon except he is darker and more muscular. As the ship first rises into space, Akon says he has been watching her for some time. He lets her look at the earth below through a viewing lens that also has x-ray capability. The saucer goes to a “mother ship” filled with friendly space people. At one point a huge video image projected on the wall allows her to view scenes from their home planet, Meton, in the Alpha Centauri system. They serve her a vegetarian meal. Klarer and Akon begin a lifelong romantic attachment that includes sexual activity. (“[Landing in](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1956%252CNov-Dec%252CV%25202%252CN%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922910615&usg=AOvVaw24LkDKAktBRx3Q4gQ5Io6A) [South Africa,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1956%252CNov-Dec%252CV%25202%252CN%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922910975&usg=AOvVaw0KXHBAWbiwalz9-Tjt6inp)” Flying Saucer Review 2, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1956): 2–5; Elizabeth Klarer, [Beyond the Light Barrier](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/beyond-the-light-barrier&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922911295&usg=AOvVaw0xiviRBxJmPN1dbq4tgfFR), Howard Timmins, 1980; Clark III 657; Paul Seaburn, “[Woman from Earth Claimed to Have Already Been to](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://mysteriousuniverse.org/2016/08/woman-from-earth-claimed-to-have-already-been-to-proxima-b/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922911595&usg=AOvVaw1QsjI2aSeem3J7jGdX1Iyd) [Proxima b,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://mysteriousuniverse.org/2016/08/woman-from-earth-claimed-to-have-already-been-to-proxima-b/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922911842&usg=AOvVaw3fld6B45KCJW96oofoSHHV)” Mysterious Universe, August 31, 2016)

April 8 — 10:15 p.m. Capt. [Raymond E. Ryan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62514778/raymond-e-ryan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922912312&usg=AOvVaw23ANCKXnmPU_qvCsop3sAe)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62514778/raymond-e-ryan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922912531&usg=AOvVaw1RSOPGrloWiQKocXZJCx1h) First Officer William Neff, flight attendant Phyllis Reynolds, and many passengers take off on American Airlines Flight 715 from Albany, New York, heading north then nearly due west at 260 mph and 6,000 feet north of Schenectady, when a brilliant white light about 2–3 miles away is spotted about 90° to the left appearing like an airliner heading in to land at Albany. The white light moves about 90° to dead ahead position about 8–10 miles away at high speed, estimated at about 800–1,000 mph, where it changes color to orange and seems to block the airliner’s path or risk collision. It disappears briefly and reappears as an orange light again but standing still ahead of the airliner to the west. The Convair airliner contacts Griffiss AFB \[now Griffiss International Airport\], Rome, New York, where controllers ask Ryan to turn his lights off and on to help identify aircraft. He is told the airliner is seen and the orange UFO are to the south. The airliner is ordered to maintain course to follow the UFO to the west, skipping its scheduled landing at Syracuse after nearly 30 minutes of following the object. The promised fighter jet interception is never seen. The object disappears at high speed to the northwest towards Oswego, New York. (NICAP, “[Air Force Requests Plane Loaded with Passengers to Chase UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/560408ryan_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922912951&usg=AOvVaw2S2gpPVlMrldLb0VnWhVSM)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922913245&usg=AOvVaw26R5aTtH3TPRS0Qrk3MSVK),

p. 236; “[Cover-Up Suspected in Reported Air–UFO Chase,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/003%2520JANUARY%25201958.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922913669&usg=AOvVaw2C5nRkYxcWrLOpY7HL3sEU)” UFO Investigator 1, no. 3 (January 1958): 10–12;

UFOEv, [p. 117](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D129%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922914232&usg=AOvVaw2QUqksvdN4gHLvfDJZJXsK))

April 16 — An interview with [Ryan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62514778/raymond-e-ryan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922914681&usg=AOvVaw3DjYthUpBAeDPFlqY-DJFi) and Neff is taped on the TV show Meet the Millers. They claim that Griffiss AFB “asked us our next point of landing and to identify the aircraft. I told them Syracuse and identified the flight number. Then they told us: ‘Abandon that next landiat-postcardat-postcardng temporarily. Maintain your course and altitude. We’re sending two jets to intercept the object.’” About the UFO, Ryan says, “This was absolutely real. I’m convinced there was something fantastic up there.” [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922915290&usg=AOvVaw2z3bE4klv0ORUBJWOBEjx0) obtains a copy of the tape. (NICAP, \[[transcript of](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/chase2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922915725&usg=AOvVaw1sYTcXbI2YCeFVGYiuaLX-) [Meet the Millers](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/chase2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922915979&usg=AOvVaw1DzGoRRDEH8vogPyNxPjmJ) [program,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/chase2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922916215&usg=AOvVaw2t3Uu5mJZbmpiRbEUur9nx) April 16, 1956\])

April 28 — At the third Giant Rock Interplanetary Spacecraft Convention near Landers, California, contactee Dick Miller plays tape recordings allegedly made by Mon-Ka, a Martian, in which he asks Los Angeles radio stations to shut down for two minutes at 10:30 p.m. on November 7, 1956, so that Mon-Ka can speak from his spacecraft. As a publicity gimmick, two radio stations (KATY \[now KYNS\] of San Luis Obispo and KBIA of Los Angeles) go off

* * *

the air at that time, and KTTV in Los Angeles sends up an airplane to watch for the approaching spacecraft. Nothing happens. (Clark III 531, 766–767)

May 1 — USAF Gen. [Joe W. Kelly](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_W._Kelly&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922917169&usg=AOvVaw1QuG3avGZDNn9_kIc-PscY) writes to Sen. [Harry F. Byrd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_F._Byrd&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922917522&usg=AOvVaw2b2dBaFfc21T-lsO4e3k9q) (D-Va.) that there is a “total lack of evidence that \[UFOs\] are interplanetary vehicles.” (“[How about Those Three Secret Reports, General Kelly?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/CSI_NY/CSI_NY_%252317.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922917923&usg=AOvVaw2lOutIxdGhRt4DLtuNRIx7)” CSI News Letter, no. 5 (September 21, 1956): 1)

May 1 — Air Force Manual section 190-4 goes into effect. It affects all USAF official press releases, statements to Congress and the public, and publications about UFOs. It requires the Secretary of the Air Force Office of Information to “delete all evidence of UFO reality and intelligent control, which would, of course, contradict the Air Force stand that UFOs do not exist.” NICAP is made aware of the regulation in 1962 when former USAF information spokesman Maj. [William T. Coleman](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.abovetopsecret.com/forum/thread1243564/pg1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922918555&usg=AOvVaw1exPSRDO5u6-2K1kV2t-NR) admits to a NICAP member that Maj. [Lawrence J. Tacker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30450384/lawrence-j-tacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922918845&usg=AOvVaw30JhqExGS7DMzjhtc77HSn)’s book Flying Saucers and the US Air Force was reviewed under AFM 190-4. (“[Air Force Reveals Censorship](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/016%2520MAR-%2520JUL%25201962.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922919130&usg=AOvVaw3kFtXs7ovnCKKgndWKMht5) [Controls,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/016%2520MAR-%2520JUL%25201962.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922919370&usg=AOvVaw3EO8Fr4mfKoOLoW91nQe63)” UFO Investigator 2, no. 4 (July 1962): 1)

May 1 — 7:55 p.m. Koto Ward, a factory worker, along with many others, see a large bright object flying low over the rooftops in Tokyo, Japan. Turuko Kurihara, in a different location, sees a greenish object at 7:59 p.m. The object makes no noise but causes severe distortion on the TV sets in the area. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922919963&usg=AOvVaw0-yypv-dfEFdAosQ0UQ7aQ), p. 103)

May 3 — Hollywood producer [Clarence Greene](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clarence_Greene&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922920406&usg=AOvVaw0LNd3TPsJ8pRp-QN54XH93) releases a semi-documentary about the UFO phenomenon in the US,

U.F.O. [Edward J. Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922920936&usg=AOvVaw0XyJrdL2Hi7rEn0oGnq5Kx)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922921202&usg=AOvVaw3HcVXbJVz10NVcEV0tDvQV) [Dewey Fournet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/ufochop2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922921493&usg=AOvVaw3_90AdRj4WxwCKBE47H6ZF), and [Albert M. Chop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/interviews/bios/chop-albert.php&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922921794&usg=AOvVaw07DW_xwjtfDiJgdY8yMbzr) assist in the production. The principal character is Chop, played by Los Angeles Examiner journalist [Tom Towers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1898817/bio&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922922307&usg=AOvVaw0uROSeuiFQf7MhBHoOXIrP), and examines his career going from skeptical USAF public information officer to Pentagon UFO press spokesman. The film uses only one professional actor, [Harry Morgan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Morgan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922922662&usg=AOvVaw2hZ0pPs9tcUVMXajiHs-Lg)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Morgan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922922932&usg=AOvVaw2AdVkAjY-8paoE8kbrG63o) in a voiceover part. UFO witnesses Delbert Newhouse, [Nicholas Mariana](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.theufochronicles.com/2006/05/marianas-ufo-film-one-of-best-produced.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922923335&usg=AOvVaw3GFtZBPvRd8jIV-wGZx09v)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.theufochronicles.com/2006/05/marianas-ufo-film-one-of-best-produced.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922923637&usg=AOvVaw1TY6vdK-5np5upwEUkXJk3) and [Willis Sperry](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/500529_Willis_T.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922923984&usg=AOvVaw2xtqq77c1aKta7kommlAhb) play themselves, and Los Angeles policemen stand in for Ruppelt, Fournet, and Gen [William Garland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107003/brigadier-general-william-m-garland/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922924474&usg=AOvVaw2-X7-q2jz0Hb77dMo90G0J). The Air Force carefully monitors its reception and readies itself to counter the film’s impact. The documentary analyzes two famous pieces of UFO footage: the Montana film of 1950 and the 1952 UFO Utah film (both shown for the first time in public). It concludes with the famous 1952 Washington, D.C., UFO incident, in which Chop played a central role, and recreates his experiences. At the end of the documentary, Chop states his belief that UFOs are a real, physical phenomenon of unknown origin. (Wikipedia, “[UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFO_(1956_film)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922924927&usg=AOvVaw2sPtGuLkZTs6v99ms2mhyb) [(1956 film)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFO_(1956_film)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922925182&usg=AOvVaw1R5GG7UIY8nk7AozgFe27B)”; Internet Movie Database, “[Unidentified Flying Objects: The True Story of Flying Saucers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0131627/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922925515&usg=AOvVaw2mz8x4DaM6MIxMotOqNiLe)”; Robert Barrow, “Unidentified Flying Objects, Accidental Epic,” IUR 30, no. 2 (January 2006): 3–6; Robert Barrow, “Tom Towers: The Other Al Chop,” IUR 30, no. 4 (August 2006): 17–19; Clark III 1188–1189; Swords 222; Curt Collins, “[Project Blue Book:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2018/08/project-blue-book-ufo-motion-picture.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922926358&usg=AOvVaw1sgohJnkXDHKlKp6ddkhyj) [UFO,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2018/08/project-blue-book-ufo-motion-picture.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922926688&usg=AOvVaw3bmDGklNd83uyQylbKgWwf) [the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2018/08/project-blue-book-ufo-motion-picture.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922927037&usg=AOvVaw2Loi3nGvi4ng0HT_VM5AoQ) [Motion Picture,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2018/08/project-blue-book-ufo-motion-picture.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922927288&usg=AOvVaw0bhlDtuqfiM-iAizVhGHM_)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, August 24, 2018)

May 4 — 9:30 p.m. Rev. Charles Burmeister, an amateur astronomer, sees five “orange blobs” flying in a U-shape formation east to west at high speed over Marinette, Wisconsin. His son joins him to watch. One more object passes in the same flight path, then a group of six, then one more, followed by another. Blue Book classes the sighting as meteors without even consulting [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922927594&usg=AOvVaw1v0higfw-plsCY-eigJp27)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922927771&usg=AOvVaw2LvWgmqKu-dxg1sqaytHi6) who later says that meteors do not fly in formation. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1955 May–July](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1956-May-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922928086&usg=AOvVaw1gwZReGW8yEJpLjk4d8BKv), The Author, 1993, pp. 2–7; Swords 229–230)

May 22 — 11:05 p.m. USAF 1st Lt. Earl D. Holwadel and 1st Lt. Curtis Carley are piloting a T-33 jet at 18,000 feet 58 miles northwest of Monroe, Louisiana, when they see a bright light due east. They see it again in the east at 11:15

p.m. Holwadel banks right to the southeast somewhat behind the object, which is now a great distance away. The object suddenly comes straight at them at high speed, passing in front of the T-33 at about 225 feet away. It flashes an intensely bright white light from a “greenhouse-shaped dome” or cockpit window at its front end that lights up the canopy of the T-33. The object is about 30-40 feet long, elliptical in shape, shorter than a C-47 but wider, a small steady red running light in the center, with no wings, only stubby protrusions extending 3-4 feet and 25 feet long on each side. The bottom surface is like steel with ribs extending down 2–4 feet with a wave-like appearance. It moves away then returns at high speed on a westerly course with “fantastic” maneuverability. It never changes

flight attitude at any time. (NICAP, “[Elliptical Object Comes Straight at T-33](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/560522monroe_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922929041&usg=AOvVaw2h9pAP0Orm9bpPYcf-s2V9)”; Walter N. Webb, “Inside Building 263: A Visit to Blue Book, 1956,” IUR 17, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1992): cover, 5; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922929521&usg=AOvVaw0mb-sGPRiAi8l9TyOafyQg)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922929748&usg=AOvVaw2EsWQ0TmYfgcgo3lYw6IVo) p. 237)

Summer? — [Morris K. Jessup](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morris_K._Jessup&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922930201&usg=AOvVaw2YhVCytI1hv9B_T8UUdiZ0) is invited to the Office of Naval Research to examine the mysteriously annotated version of his The Case for the UFO. He becomes convinced that his correspondent [Carl Allen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.de173.com/carlos-miguel-allende-carl-allen/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922930543&usg=AOvVaw0MNvh-fZGL4TlFRWmwS-iv) has written all or most of it. Capt. Sidney Sherby and Cmdr. [Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufoexplorations.com/us-navy-commander-reveals-roswell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922930786&usg=AOvVaw2p6t0I0U1omlHKxeeQUHtK) ask for the Allen letters and these are included in a special printing of the annotated book by the Varo Publishing Company of Garland, Texas. In 1969, Allen confesses to APRO that he had written the annotations, but he retracts the confession later. (Clark III 95–97; Andrew H. Hochheimer, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.de173.com/the-varo-edition/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922931152&usg=AOvVaw2U3-JmAWcK-uJqkliE9Jk_) [Varo Edition,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.de173.com/the-varo-edition/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922931411&usg=AOvVaw3Xmqg6bj0QyatTmClcv4AT)” The Philadelphia Experiment from A–Z, December 13, 2016).

Summer — 11:30 p.m. A cigar-shaped UFO with lighted portholes is seen by two witnesses in the southwest part of Springfield, Illinois. The car driven by one of the witnesses quits, and the UFO seems to affect the traffic lights as

* * *

well. The object looks slightly smaller than a blimp. After about 30 seconds it moves straight up and disappears. (Michael D. Swords, “The Timmerman Files,” IUR 26, no. 4 (Winter 2001–2002): 14, 30)

June (or June 1957) — RNZAF Airman Derek Mansell is a passenger in a Bristol 170 Freighter Mk 31M near Wellington, New Zealand, when the aircraft encounters severe turbulence and its compass and other instruments spin wildly. All communications fail and the engine spurts intermittently for 25 minutes before everything returns to normal. When the Freighter lands at RNZAF Base Ohakea near Bulls, the pilot of a Douglas C-47 Dakota lands and asks them whether they had seen a huge metallic disc about 250 feet in diameter with a blue light on top and a red light on the bottom, which he had observed just above the Freighter pacing it. The Dakota crew apparently took photos, but these have not turned up. After a two-hour debriefing, both crews are told never to discuss the matter. (Good Above, [pp. 432–433](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/432/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922932380&usg=AOvVaw0eutzXpuBhbfW8EjJcMeJR))

June — 10:00 p.m. Two women are driving north toward New Hampshire, Ohio, when a bright light approaches them from a small wooded area. They stop their car to look at it. The light is attached to a large rectangular object resembling a railroad box car that settles near the ground at the edge of the highway opposite to them about 30 feet away. Suddenly the side of the object facing them lights up from inside with a pale green light and they can see three small entities. One is standing next to a console “operating some kind of controls,” and the two others are also active. For 5 minutes, they appear to be observing the women. The entities have dark hair on their heads and arms and are wearing short-sleeved smocks. The object moves up and away toward the southwest and disappears. (“[Unreported 1956 CEIII Discovered in Ohio,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1982-83_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V3.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922932793&usg=AOvVaw3RKnX2HnUSiuE41eY18lBF)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 3, no. 3 (June/July 1982): 4–5)

June 13 — Earth vs. the Flying Saucers, an American black-and-white science fiction film from Columbia Pictures, produced by [Charles H. Schneer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_H._Schneer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922933384&usg=AOvVaw1W3N5LzGM2EYw48fsZcbHQ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_H._Schneer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922933528&usg=AOvVaw3q5pYYocKlEq3dRWn8ns3k) directed by [Fred F. Sears](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_F._Sears&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922933744&usg=AOvVaw2Zb-73_myW5bZr4UIzqYQX), starring [Hugh Marlowe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_Marlowe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922934019&usg=AOvVaw2MuRfp8Mvr1iHR-ywkqu7d) and [Joan Taylor](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joan_Taylor&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922934382&usg=AOvVaw0bAmy2DVhg5x6o78zXPYF1), and with special effects by [Ray Harryhausen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ray_Harryhausen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922934694&usg=AOvVaw3bzVDynWT3Oadfmn6_yWj8)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ray_Harryhausen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922934964&usg=AOvVaw1k4JK1WSu_mzb4E-l7ntZw) is released in Los Angeles. The film’s storyline is suggested by [Donald E.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922935293&usg=AOvVaw3egU3pOHObwIpr22XcO6AY) [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922935610&usg=AOvVaw2iFquidMop1cCPA5Ht7_s7)’s nonfiction Flying Saucers from Outer Space (1953), but bears little resemblance to the content. Keyhoe has sold the rights to Clover Productions in Hollywood. (Wikipedia, “[Earth vs. the Flying Saucers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earth_vs._the_Flying_Saucers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922936112&usg=AOvVaw1QRyiJeSTwXrx1DIKozubx)”; Internet Movie Database, “[Earth vs. the Flying Saucers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0049169/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922936440&usg=AOvVaw3KRGVCOcPXKgL9XMQpbcRm)”; Clark III 434)

June 14 — [Walter N. Webb](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Webb.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922936979&usg=AOvVaw1qBQwVYlZR3o0K2A1tmpBE) visits and interviews Project Blue Book head Capt. [George T. Gregory](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/158570232/george-thurston-gregory&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922937396&usg=AOvVaw14cy9w4psVg-lKIBncD7M9) at Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohiob . (Walter N. Webb, “Inside Building 263: A Visit to Blue Book, 1956,” IUR 17, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1992): 3–5)

June 25 — ATIC’s Col. [John Eriksen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/132078491/john-gordon-eriksen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922938093&usg=AOvVaw0RJXitGvRUxMTNn5Qjc1MV), writing for Secretary of the Air Force [Donald A. Quarles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_A._Quarles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922938415&usg=AOvVaw2VMZ8H-yVde5ePN3iFAWKG), replies to a query from Rep. [John E. Moss](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_E._Moss&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922938716&usg=AOvVaw0BUNm9WONla1XgvirVDVyr) (D-Calif.), explaining why USAF is not handing out multiple copies of Blue Book Special Report no. 14 and that it does not intend to withhold UFO information from the public. (Swords 223)

The Laugheads are convinced that Puharich and Hurkos are space people come to assist them, based on the channelings of their associate [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922943327&usg=AOvVaw22w77eynE3_xXUYuKnQwNZ) (although they do not name him). July 4 — Pilot [Hervey Stockman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/news-information/featured-story-archive/2010-featured-story-archive/agency-u-2-pilots-hervey-stockman.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922944630&usg=AOvVaw0CTbf5YN8sYp1z4avA4hEA) makes the first of eight U-2 flights over Soviet Russia, Mission 2013. He flies from Wiesbaden over East Germany and Poland before crossing the Soviet border near Grodno, Belarus, then over bomber bases at Minsk, Belarus; Leningrad \[now St. Petersburg\], Russia; and the Baltic states. The mission is tracked by Soviet radar; a number of MiG fighters unsuccessfully try to intercept the U-2. (Spyflight, “Lockheed U-2”; Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 86–88](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/86/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922945418&usg=AOvVaw1kS3o28WENrW9u2gsEDD1w))

July 9 — One early U-2 mission, Mission 2020, flown by [Martin Knutson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_Knutson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922945864&usg=AOvVaw3yM4DJY831GoktkSzMFUgq), flies over Engels-2 airfield, near Saratov, Russia, and photographs 20 M-4 Bison bombers on the ramp. Multiplying by the number of Soviet bomber bases, the intelligence suggests the Soviets are already well on their way to deploying hundreds of aircraft. Ironically, the U-2 has actually photographed the entire Bison fleet; there is no bomber at any of the other bases. Similar missions over the next year finally prove that. At least in official circles, the bomber gap is disproven. (Spyflight, “Lockheed U-2”)

It cannot be identified, although six scientists rule out wool, cotton, feathers,

July 16 — 7:00 p.m. Lawyer (or law professor) João de Freitas Guimarães is taking a walk on the beach at Caraguatatuba, São Paulo, Brazil, when he observes a hat-shaped, luminous object leave the sea between São Sebastião and Ilhabela and land only a few yards away from him. A door opens, a metallic stairway emerges, and two tall, human-looking men with long, fair hair emerge wearing green jumpsuits. Through gestures, they encourage him to enter the craft. Inside, the saucer takes off and the crew communicate with him telepathically, telling him about a radiation protection system that exists around the ship and that they have left the atmosphere. They are supposedly from Venus. His alleged trip lasts an hour. When he returns, his watch no longer works. (Luiz do Rosário Real, “[Caso Dr. Freitas Guimarães,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://querepublicaeessa.an.gov.br/images/Ovni/BR_DFANBSB_ARX_0_0_0006_d0001de0001.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922947339&usg=AOvVaw36HCv20lC4NYlzdrPq2J41)” April 1976; Clark III 548–549; Vallée, Magonia, [pp. 257–258](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/passporttomagoni0000vall/page/256/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922947752&usg=AOvVaw15f1R08BSoYiNIWEbLUGwp); Equipe UFO, “[João de Freitas Guimarães, o advogado que passeou em um UFO,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufo.com.br/artigos/joao-de-freitas-guimaraes-o-advogado-que-passeou-em-um-ufo.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922948131&usg=AOvVaw3mLKF_HlVF7e4CjDvD2NjQ)” Portal UFO, October 1, 2013; Brazil 32–35)

July 22 — 11:00 a.m. USAF Maj. [Merwin Stenvers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/1220372/merwin-mauritz-stenvers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922953371&usg=AOvVaw2s-IzJPGy4TkJTdVip7sGD) is flying at 16,000 feet over Pixley, California, in a Convair C-131D and is suddenly staggered and knocked to the right by a terrific blow. They dart about the sky “like fish in a tank,” come together, hover, and separate at great speed, disappearing from sight. He manages to take several photos, one of which shows two objects, one a nearly perfect oval, the other blurred. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 73)

August — FBI Director [J. Edgar Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922959424&usg=AOvVaw32YbN_RLE3ZPCEyaH3f5Jz) launches COINTELPRO (counter-intelligence programs). These are employed against American dissidents and their organizations; the first one targets the American Communist Party. Typical methods are anonymous or fictitious letters, false defamatory or threatening information, forged signatures, and other disinformation. The FBI blackmails insiders to spread false rumors or promote factionalism. It creates bogus organizations to attack or disrupt a bona fide group, and instigates hostile actions through third parties, such as employers, elected officials, and the media. It enables the FBI to investigate any political organization on the pretext of checking for Communists, including the NAACP, women’s rights groups, and gay rights groups. These programs prompt nearly 330,000 FBI investigations and create a Security Index of over 200,000 dangerous Americans to be detained in the event of war. Documents relating to these programs are marked “Do not file,” offering no clues that they exist. (Wikipedia, “[COINTELPRO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COINTELPRO&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922959952&usg=AOvVaw0jsGcsgnWKpfHucvN-l_zz)”)

Cahn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/27512833/john-p_-cahn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922960410&usg=AOvVaw2OZ4414ZY621bawjMYBfBY) publishes a second article in True on the [Scully](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Scully&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922960896&usg=AOvVaw3HvPxDQ_Zr3mwAGs8haIL0) hoax. True, August 1956, pp. 36–37, 69–72)

August — [George King](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.aetherius.org/dr-george-king/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922961976&usg=AOvVaw3W00soblpW53k8diyG4f0c) forms the Aetherius Society in London, England, as the result of what King claims are contacts with extraterrestrial intelligences, whom he refers to as “Cosmic Masters.” The main goal of the believer is to cooperate with these Cosmic Masters to help humanity solve its current earthly problems and advance into the New Age.
