August — Late night. Two young men are camping near Newark, Ohio, when they see five bright lights in a rigid V- formation. They fly in erratic, sharp-turning patterns for about 5 minutes, including sharp 30° turns. One man takes a photo. They report the sighting to the newspapers and the Air Force, but a USAF officer confiscate both the print and the negatives; the newspaper’s copies are also taken. (Michael D. Swords, “Timmerman’s Triangles,” IUR 29, no. 2 (Summer 2004): 16)

August 3 — A press leak from the Air Force Association reveals that proposals for two types of UFO-detecting satellites are under development. A television subsystem is cancelled as impractical, but an infrared subsystem requires much lower data transmission rates. Lockheed has signed an Air Force contract. The CIA’s [Richard M. Bissell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_M._Bissell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922963704&usg=AOvVaw2_9ZYY3fY4H4RzLMF4mj22) later reveals that the CIA Office of Scientific Intelligence Deputy Director Gen. [Philip G. Strong](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1971/11/25/archives/gen-philip-strong-expert-on-u2-dies.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922963997&usg=AOvVaw3eeaSj3reN7kzY9kcjukBL) has been pushing the Air Force to develop an infrared tracking satellite. The infrared system actually begins as planned in 1968, with initial operational status in 1970. (Clark III 813, 1032)

August 13–14 — 9:30 p.m. A radar-visual UFO sighting begins at RAF Bentwaters \[now Bentwaters Parks\], Suffolk, England. A blip traveling approximately 4,000–8,000 mph on an east-west course is picked up on radar. It moves in a straight line to a position about 15 miles northwest of Bentwaters. Within a few minutes, about a dozen normal targets are spotted 8 miles southwest, moving northeast at about 100 mph. In front of the targets are three objects in a triangular formation, about 1,000 feet apart. All the targets then appear to converge into one extremely large target (several times the size of a B-36), which continues moving to the northeast, then stops for a few minutes, then resumes, and is lost to radar. The entire sighting up to this point takes 25 minutes. Five minutes later, another solid target appears, flying east to west at 4,000 mph or more, then vanishes when it moves out of range. A T-33 trainer from the 512th Fighter Interceptor Squadron crewed by 1st Lts. Charles Metz and Andrew Rowe is sent to investigate the radar contacts, but sees nothing. No visual sightings of the objects are made from Bentwaters in this period, with the exception of a single amber star-like object which was subsequently identified as probably being Mars. At 10:55 p.m., another target is picked up 30 miles to the east, traveling west at 2,000–4,000 mph. It passes directly overhead and is seen as a white light by both air (a C-47 at 4,000 feet reports it passed underneath him) and ground observers. Bentwaters notifies RAF Lakenheath, also in Suffolk, about what is going on, and Lakenheath personnel see a luminous object stop, then zoom off to the east. Also, two white lights are seen joining from different directions, which are tracked on two screens at Lakenheath. According to T/Sgt. Forrest Perkins, watch supervisor at the Lakenheath radar center, at midnight Lakenheath notifies RAF Neatishead, Norfolk, that a strange object is buzzing the base. A de Havilland Venom night fighter is scrambled, directed by Neatishead radar controller Flight Lt. Freddie H. C. Wimbledon. Perkins and Wimbledon claim the jets are sent up around midnight, but the crews think it is at 2:00 a.m. The Venom, crewed by Flight Officers David Chambers and John Brady from 23 Squadron at RAF Waterbeach \[now closed\] in Cambridgeshire, finds the object on radar north of Cambridge and sees it as a bright white light, which then disappears. The navigator says it is the “clearest target I have ever seen on radar.” The object, however, is behind the plane and stays there for some time, despite climbs,

* * *

dives, and circling. Ground radar operators say that the object is glued right behind the fighter. After 10 minutes, the fighter heads back. The UFO follows briefly, then stops and hovers. Another Venom, crewed by Flight Officers Ian Fraser-Ker and Ivan Logan, is scrambled at 2:40 a.m. but experiences engine problems and aborts. Ministry of Defence officer Ralph Noyes says that one of the Venom pilots has taken a gun-camera film, which was later shown at a briefing in Whitehall. The object is tracked on two radars, leaving the area at 600 mph. The encounter is classified until 1969, when it is analyzed by the Colorado project. [Gordon Thayer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/t/ThayerGordonD/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922964939&usg=AOvVaw0_op8Oj57Zx2IOU9FbjOhF) suggests that the “apparently rational, intelligent behavior of the UFO suggests a mechanical device of unknown origin as the most probable explanation of this sighting.” A later investigation is conducted by [David Clarke](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Clarke_(journalist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922965205&usg=AOvVaw0SZigLBjVP41GxwS7ViMHh)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Clarke_(journalist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922965399&usg=AOvVaw3gFSsPW9DEVdbKPzpYHADF) [Andy Roberts](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.uk-ufo.org/condign/bioar.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922965681&usg=AOvVaw2NiPNmqECrWDc02UiVWGvY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.uk-ufo.org/condign/bioar.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922965935&usg=AOvVaw00iG040Z58wOeYiAbcqM60) and [Jenny Randles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jenny_Randles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922966154&usg=AOvVaw3U93qm-OKpbys2iMLNq4dI)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jenny_Randles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922966328&usg=AOvVaw1h2sR_Vv36utAsQ2p2xOPa) In contrast to the reports given in the original classified teleprinter message (from 3910th Air Base Group to ADC at Ent AFB, now the US Olympic Training Center) three days after the event and in the accounts of both Wimbledon and Perkins, the air crews now state that the radar contacts were unimpressive and that no “tail-chase” or action on the part of the target occurred. They also assert no visual contacts were made. Chambers and Brady comment that “my feeling is that there was nothing there, it was some sort of mistake,” while Ivan Logan, the second Venom’s navigator, states that “all we saw was a blip which rather indicated a stationary target.” At the time 23 Squadron decides that the radar contact had, if anything, been with a weather balloon. [Martin Shough](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/shough.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922966578&usg=AOvVaw2qsS448pJQBuqo3GMajaaO) concludes that there are actually several incidents at different times and places and that the relationship between each is unclear. (Wikipedia, “[Lakenheath-Bentwaters incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lakenheath-Bentwaters_incident&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922966851&usg=AOvVaw2CBtWkidgrAJf1MyImMtBU)”; NICAP, “[Several Incidents of R/V at Bentwaters](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/560813bentwaters_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922967054&usg=AOvVaw1k8Cqyuum1lRieUFebfPM_)”; Center for UFO Studies, \[[case documents 1](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/cases/1956_08_13-14_GB_SFK_Bentwaters-Lakenheath-RAFs_CUFOS_MultiWit_RVar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922967281&usg=AOvVaw3myJL6aOrVduFwj_ZzgJgN)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/cases/1956_08_13-14_GB_SFK_Bentwaters-Lakenheath-RAFs_CUFOS_MultiWit_RVar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922967467&usg=AOvVaw2iXi09Dy4BhmidmIjwRXhs) [case documents 2](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/cases/1956_08_13-14_GB_SFK_Bentwaters-Lakenheath-RAFs_CUFOS_MultiWit_RVbr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922967692&usg=AOvVaw3UF4iBV3bWgCpjg1K7Paoc), [case documents 3](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/cases/1956_08_13-14_GB_SFK_Bentwaters-Lakenheath-RAFs_CUFOS_MultiWit_RVcr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922967970&usg=AOvVaw3i4_iWMHwEenq31YLTjvbf)\]; Condon, [pp. 163–164](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/162/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922968195&usg=AOvVaw2W4y_ca4li_gofTn9RSyAD)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/162/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922968387&usg=AOvVaw0ZTg1nmOJBb-jVj9EiuI8r) [248–256](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/162/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922968590&usg=AOvVaw0t8mqHUrcw4C1ba_nMp1CK); James E. Carpenter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/169807294/edison-fredrick-carpenter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922972809&usg=AOvVaw1Caz1_Buskf16R_tShSmM6) observes a formation of five flat, circular, pinkish UFOs over Boulder City, Nevada. Bissell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_M._Bissell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922974291&usg=AOvVaw0QWqPo9LdY9jueeNeLxAWm) assembles a group of advisers to begin work on solving the problem of Soviets tracking the U-2 flights. Land](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edwin_H._Land&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922974598&usg=AOvVaw1NJ6MWerZ1bmVPj-I7VArY), [Edward Mills Purcell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Mills_Purcell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922974895&usg=AOvVaw2TrBEuJwwc2bjmV1dl5Xvs)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Mills_Purcell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922975104&usg=AOvVaw3_Yn-B35v9okxPO-EMb-wS) and [Kelly Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kelly_Johnson_(engineer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922975431&usg=AOvVaw0jqSr2sYNR8fcfHA5MhTnV)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kelly_Johnson_(engineer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922975688&usg=AOvVaw0MOhcSZ9aQ3uoNtYwaBUBr) They look into radar-absorbing paint. August 22 — 3:40 p.m. A man named Sheetz and another civilian in a car chases a 50-foot, black, bell-shaped object bearing two bright, white lights at the top several miles east of Naval Air Station Cecil Field, near Jacksonville, Florida. Their engine stalls when the object hovers 10 feet away. The underside resembles a disc with fins. When a jet takes off from the airfield, the object shoots out of sight almost instantly. The car battery is completely dead. Noise from the object compares to a helicopter, but there is no helicopter in the area. (NICAP, “[Car Chases Bell-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570827cecil_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922976600&usg=AOvVaw1RGihgoKQB18PkBUzppTf3) [Shaped Object, Engine Stalls](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570827cecil_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922976928&usg=AOvVaw2RcX2jSFdAcNLzogMmPXOE)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922977231&usg=AOvVaw1U5LkmWh0IEW66xK-BhUNQ), p. 246)

August 22 — 8:50–11:59 p.m. Radars on the island of Bornholm, Denmark, first report 2–3 objects on an easterly heading at 800 mph. Approximately 2 hours later, four objects appear and orbit over the location. About 90 minutes later, the tracks fade. (NICAP, “[Objects Orbiting Location and Tracked on Radar](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/560822bornholm_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922977713&usg=AOvVaw3-O2GKmB107xMKouIJsvII)”)

August 27 — 7:20 p.m. Royal Canadian Air Force pilot [Robert James “Chick” Childerhose](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.sf-encyclopedia.com/entry/childerhose_r_j_chick&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922978192&usg=AOvVaw2tk-oxnCFUogPHvG4NgV3b) is flying nearly due west over the Canadian Rockies near Fort Macleod, Alberta. He is flying at 36,000 feet in the second position (far left side) of a formation of four F-86 Sabre jet aircraft. While approaching a large thunderhead (cumulonimbus) at a ground speed of about 460 mph, he sees at a much lower altitude a “bright light which was sharply defined and disc- shaped” or “like a shiny silver dollar sitting horizontal.” He takes a color photo. An analysis suggests that it would have been radiating in excess of a gigawatt of power within the spectral range of the film. (NICAP, “[RCAF Pilot](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/560827alberta_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922978672&usg=AOvVaw21rotBw4FJBWPjpXduBaDY) [Photographs Object Radiating Power](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/560827alberta_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922979038&usg=AOvVaw3KOgjYIoTDIRzeHWN4oAoS)”; Jacques Vallée, “[Estimates of Power Optical Output in Six Cases of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scientificexploration.org/docs/12/jse_12_3_vallee_1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922979435&usg=AOvVaw2Rp_JWmMJU0GtBaImk-WIJ) [Unexplained Aerial Objects with Defined Luminosity Characteristics,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scientificexploration.org/docs/12/jse_12_3_vallee_1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922979804&usg=AOvVaw1KmpQan4_NdQFEV2aNOQVx)” Journal of Scientific Exploration 12, no. 3 (1998): 346–348; Richard F. Haines, “Analysis of Photograph of a High-Speed Ball of Light,” JUFOS 8 (2003): 27–48; Chris Rutkowski and Geoff Dittman, The Canadian UFO Report, Dundurn Press, 2006, pp. 68–69)

August 28 — 11:30 p.m. León Febres, Miguel Talavera, Jesús Prada, and Tomás Hernández are returning home in Calabozo, Venezuela, when the ground around them is lit up by a bright white light. Looking up, they see a large disc hovering silently. Several smaller objects emerge from the large disc, leaving behind a wake of

* * *

phosphorescent smoke that dissipates quickly. The whole group flies off to the west in a V formation with the large object in the lead. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 74)

August 29 — [T. Townsend Brown](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Townsend_Brown&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922981324&usg=AOvVaw1VgMq51c5sISy-2xbNDLti) files incorporation papers for a new UFO group, the National Investigations Committee on Aerial Phenomena in Washington, D.C. (“[‘Toward a Broader Understanding…’: The Story of How](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/067%2520OCTOBER%25201971.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922981804&usg=AOvVaw3Zksiek-lWDBJd8myoekZc) [NICAP Began,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/067%2520OCTOBER%25201971.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922982242&usg=AOvVaw3iVev6E0CGP6JfiyqVvuv5)” UFO Investigator, October 1971, pp. 2–3; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1956-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922982582&usg=AOvVaw2DtgcRa6Jwapcy75Os7XTr) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1956 August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1956-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922982807&usg=AOvVaw3NcJwOANhI_9QbKbMRhNVk)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1956-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922982981&usg=AOvVaw1j41h_SdRUOYH7ctHkDref) The Author, 1994, pp. 46–56, 82, 85; Clark III 792)

August 30 — Day. Two RAF Gloster Javelin interceptors, one piloted by E. H. “Wilbur” Wright, are flying west over the English Channel south of the Isle of Wight, England, when one of the navigators obtains a radar return at 19 miles distance (later calculations indicate it has a diameter of 600 feet). The pilots get permission to abandon their test exercise and investigate the object. Wright turns north toward the object on his right wing, but it has apparently slowed down and is maintaining its position. The second Javelin pilot has caught up from behind and confirms radar and visual sightings. The two aircraft bank steeply so the object is at 15 miles dead ahead on the radar screen They close the distance to 10 miles and see that the object has a metallic gray appearance. At 8 miles distance, the object suddenly climbs vertically too fast for radar to track (estimated at 18,000 mph) and vanishes. After landing at RAF Odiham in Hampshire, the crews are told that ground radar at RAF Sopley \[now closed\] has tracked the object. They are ordered not to speak about the event. (Jenny Randles, “Scramble, UFO!” Fortean Times 386 (December 2019): 26–27)

September — The General Physics Laboratory of the Aeronautical Research Laboratories (ARL) at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, Dayton, Ohio, launches an intense program to coordinate research into gravitational and unified field theories with the hiring of [Joshua N. Goldberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joshua_N._Goldberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922984010&usg=AOvVaw34EA6C0fuHlsZnMbmoklqF). The precise rationale for creating the program and justifying its budgets and personnel may never be determined. Neither Goldberg nor USAF Deputy for Scientific and Technical Information [Walter Blados](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/197955958/walter-roman-blados&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922984411&usg=AOvVaw1GGRHmusdd24Kg4dlKwMqC) can locate the founding documents. [Roy Kerr](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roy_Kerr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922984740&usg=AOvVaw0__OGB9ts3_PCsZCoh1eF0)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roy_Kerr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922984952&usg=AOvVaw08ymdySypQZlVLtDKHZNc7) a former ARL scientist, says the antigravity propulsion purpose of ARL was “rubbish” and that “The only real use that the USAF made of us was when some crackpot sent them a proposal for antigravity or for converting rotary motion inside a spaceship to a translational driving system.” (Wikipedia, “[United States gravity control propulsion research](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_gravity_control_propulsion_research%23Aerospace_Research_Laboratories_.28ARL.29&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922985352&usg=AOvVaw292rg3BOaO7ab2n4QDnV3H)”)

September — Just before 8:00 a.m. A domed, disc-shaped craft allegedly lands within White Sands Proving Ground, New Mexico, just 150 feet away from US Highway 70. Radios and ignition systems of passing cars go dead, as witnesses—including two USAF colonels, two sergeants, and dozens of base personnel—observe the object as it takes off with a whirring sound. All personnel at Holloman AFB are assembled in a hangar, debriefed, and sworn to secrecy. (Ralph and Judy Blum, Beyond Earth: Man’s Contact with UFOs, Bantam, 1974; Good Need, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/218/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922986017&usg=AOvVaw1gEiLxz_u06yvoaImu0oVW)

[219–220](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/218/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922986330&usg=AOvVaw04VdIuMDxHs-o7Hn8hUPF4))

September 4 — Several fireball-like objects fly over Copenhagen, Denmark, tracked by radar at about 1,800 mph. (UFOEv, [p. 79](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D91%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922986690&usg=AOvVaw1UPme1z3AsZomE43XJWS6I))

September 7 — 12:30 p.m. Thomas J. and Maud Hutchinson watch an object drop out of low clouds and land in the middle of a bog at The Loup (near Moneymore), County Derry, Northern Ireland. They wade 600 feet into the bog until they come upon the small (3 feet high, 18 inches in diameter), red, rubbery, motionless object. There are 3 white stripes around the middle and it is pointed at both ends. Hutchinson kicks the object, which rolls over then resumes its upright position. He picks it up and is surprised at its lightness (estimated 2 pounds); the top is spinning while the bottom (a small, saucer-shaped base) remains stationary. It appears to be made of canvas-like material. They try to take it back with them, but Thomas has to put it down to negotiate a hedge, and the object takes off and disappears. (“[Irishman Caught a ‘Saucer,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94205175/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922987138&usg=AOvVaw2F2JU37V60GhDDMU7tIWvd)” The Guardian (UK), September 8, 1956, p. 10; Desmond Leslie, “[The Strangest UFO Case of All,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1956%252CSep-Oct%252CV%25202%252CN%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922987504&usg=AOvVaw06d6E77gdhdmt0dhLs_gpH)” Flying Saucer Review 2, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1956): 2–4; Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 74–76; Clark III 328)

September 7 — Test pilot [Iven Carl Kincheloe Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iven_Carl_Kincheloe_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922987966&usg=AOvVaw38O0nnTwSJ0lsLyC2bn_0O) reaches an altitude of 126,283 feet in the Bell X-2. (Wikipedia, “[Iven](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iven_Carl_Kincheloe_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922988237&usg=AOvVaw3yGjjJOZ6QCES5UUqufmm7) [Carl Kincheloe Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iven_Carl_Kincheloe_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922988429&usg=AOvVaw1-QzcaPXpLWKlAC1Q3iW8z)”)

September 8 — 9:30 p.m. Frank C. Clark is observing Mars with a 12.5-inch reflector in Las Cruces, New Mexico, when he sees a faint starlike object passing in a direction opposite to the apparent drift of Mars. It is visible for 10 seconds before passing out of the field. Clark moves the telescope and is able to see it again for another 10 seconds. It is a yellowish color. (Frank C. Clark, “[An Observation of an Unidentified Celestial Object,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.the1963aristarchusevents.com/JALPO_Vols__10-14.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922988757&usg=AOvVaw2I9eP8cboGNbjFGCo88s9Q)” The Strolling Astronomer 10 (May/June 1956): 67–68)

September 11 — The Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory officially launches Operation Moonwatch, an effort to enlist amateur astronomers in tracking an artificial satellite that the US intends to launch during the International Geophysical Year. The announcement is made at a news conference by [Armand Spitz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armand_Spitz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922989185&usg=AOvVaw1sybg_aPxd6wWMNlcBmkW7), coordinator of visual satellite observations. The program is largely the brainchild of Harvard University’s [Fred Whipple](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_Lawrence_Whipple&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922989375&usg=AOvVaw0YbiOR6Gex1r7FV7aSDKxG), who recruits [J.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922989569&usg=AOvVaw3_DQGku9yc3sgWi7a8rwcq) [Allen Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922989782&usg=AOvVaw2M0Y3cvIPBBllbVcTR714k) as assistant director to help with the central operation. Until professionally manned optical tracking

* * *

stations (using Baker-Nunn camera-telescopes) come online in 1958, this network of amateur scientists and other interested citizens plays a critical role in providing crucial information on the world’s first satellites. The team records some 36 UFO reports from 1957 to 1966. The program is discontinued in 1975. (Wikipedia, “[Operation](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Moonwatch&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922990376&usg=AOvVaw0AA9-KWCf37aqaoKcJp5-F) [Moonwatch](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Moonwatch&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922990576&usg=AOvVaw2lw0oJC7GjljmRH8mibPOi)”; Walter N. Webb, “Allen Hynek As I Knew Him,” IUR 18, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1993): 4–5; Michael D. Swords, “Gazing at the Moons,” IUR 32, no. 4 (October 2009): 9–16, 24; Center for UFO Studies, “[Moonwatch](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Moonwatch_Mystery_Satellites/1958-1962_Moonwatch_Mystery_Satellites.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922990991&usg=AOvVaw2TvzbXLKEtdkn5R_NMRl2F) [Mystery Satellites, 1958–1962](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Moonwatch_Mystery_Satellites/1958-1962_Moonwatch_Mystery_Satellites.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922991229&usg=AOvVaw3le0e_Hzj7xXXkYIg_mxv7)”)

September 15 — About 6:30 a.m. A married couple is driving in Salem, Indiana, when they notice a saucer hovering about 100 feet away in a field by the road. They stop the car and get out for a better look. The object is gunmetal gray in color and looks like two shallow bowls with a dark gap between them. Wisps of smoke are coming from the gap. The object looks as large as the town’s courthouse. It begins undulating as it hovers. After 5 minutes, it tips over on its edge and vanishes. (NICAP case file)

September 22 — 7:50 p.m. An amateur astronomer in Williston, North Dakota, sees a dull-metallic, elliptical object the size of a small plane, oscillating side to side as it moves at 150 mph above the Missouri River. (Williston (N.Dak.) Plains Register, September 22, 1956; Richard F. Haines and Franklin Carter, “[A 1956 Military Aircraft–UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/IURhaines1956.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922991697&usg=AOvVaw2qWJ1nDAZ6OK4MxRHwZTdO) [Close Encounter,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/IURhaines1956.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922991911&usg=AOvVaw2QzkHuQEyHMBVSOUaNdgTS)” IUR 25, no. 1 (Spring 2000): 25)

September 25 — [Leonard Stringfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922992334&usg=AOvVaw1lJaKL0sRe0Lm9saWiUt9d)’s wife [Adelia](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/200546241/adelia_dell_-stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922992542&usg=AOvVaw1iIjkKBtGLcKtPdcrpPkAA) observes several white tufts of angel’s hair floating down in the front yard of their home in Cincinnati, Ohio. She places it in an airtight jar. After the Stringfields contact the Air Force, M/Sgt Oliver D. Hill retrieves the sample on October 12. Analysis was done by C. G. Cocks and L. Leatherland, who find that the fibers are “multifilament bundles” that are characteristic of “regenerated cellulose fibers, either viscose or cuprammonium rayon,” perhaps from a defective filter. (Brian Boldman, “Angel Hair Physical Analyses: A Review,” JUFOS 9 (2006): 102–103)

Fall — More than 30 pilots, navigators, and flight engineers are on their way home from special duty in Europe on a US Navy Super Constellation transport. When they are about 50 miles northeast of Gander, Newfoundland, the pilot notices a cluster of lights beneath the aircraft. Suddenly, the lights dim and spread out, the largest light ascending on an apparent collision course with the transport. As it reaches the plane’s altitude, it tilts, shoots to one side, and paces them at a distance of 300 feet. It is a huge metallic disc, 30 feet thick at the center and 350–400 feet wide, with a blurry glow around the rim. Gradually it pulls ahead, tilts upward, accelerates, and zooms away in 5–8 seconds. Gander Airport confirms that it had a radar target near them. (Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 16–19; Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, pp. 78–84; Yurko Bondarchuk, UFO Sightings, Landings, and Abductions, Methuen, 1979, pp. 104–106)

Fall — A man in Falls City, Nebraska, sees a winged human with a demonic face that approaches him from three blocks away. It is about 8–9 feet tall and approaches him closely, hovering in the air about 25 feet away. As it passes over him, the man feels numb and paralyzed. The episode haunts him for the next 23 years when he talks to an investigator. (Clark III 778)

Fall or winter — Shortly after 12:00 noon. An Air Force Convair RB-36H of the 28th Strategic Reconnaissance Wing based at Ellsworth AFB, Rapid City, South Dakota, captained by Lt. C. Lenny Marquis, is flying in northern South Dakota at 423 mph when one of the crew sees a metallic disc 100 feet in diameter fly toward the airplane from the left and take up a fixed position on the left wing less than 300 feet away. Other crew members rush to the portholes to take photos. The object has a low dome at the top with three round openings or light sources. The bottom is nearly flat. Its narrow vertical sides are populated by many separate light sources, each a different color. The rest of the disc is a “light golden” hue. After 5–8 minutes, the object suddenly accelerates in parallel with the B-36 and then rises about 30° above the horizontal. The peripheral lights become brighter and turn greenish as it speeds out of sight in several seconds. Both inflight and ground radars detect the object. Substitute navigator Lt. Jimmie Lloyd says the crew turned in all photos, logs, and equipment to an intelligence unit after landing. (Richard F. Haines and Franklin Carter, “[A 1956 Military Aircraft–UFO Close Encounter,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/IURhaines1956.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922993850&usg=AOvVaw0ywftP0VSZJUDt27nnM0eJ)” IUR 25, no. 1 (Spring 2000): 22–25)

October — Karl L. Veit founds the Deutsche UFO/IFO-Studiengemeinschaft in Wiesbaden, Germany, which publishes the newspaper-format UFO-Nachrichten. (“[60 Jahre](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufo-nachrichten.net/ufo-nachrichten/jubilaeum.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922994353&usg=AOvVaw0ffnqMAAj1eFvBX-s1heUL) [UFO-Nachrichten,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufo-nachrichten.net/ufo-nachrichten/jubilaeum.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922994520&usg=AOvVaw2FqPkAv6Y98855K8NhepKI)” 2016)

October 2 — 3:45 a.m. Harry J. Sturdevant is on duty as a night watchman at Herbert Elkin and Company, a construction firm in Trenton, New Jersey. He sees a cigar-shaped object some 60–100 feet long and 15 feet in diameter swiftly descending toward him. Emitting a red glow, the object is making a hissing noise like steam and generating a foul odor. It swoops past him and vanishes. He loses his sense of taste and smell, possibly permanently. His face is burned to the point where he cannot shave for two weeks. He begins to lose hearing in his right ear. When he returns to work the next day, he finds leaves on the ground that have burned up like tissue paper. Sturdevant applies for workmen’s compensation from the state for his medical expenses. An adjudicator awards him the

* * *

money based on the fact that he may have only thought he saw something, but was injured when he went to investigate it, which his job required. (Emil Sloboda, “He Collected on a Flying Saucer,” Fate 10, no. 6 (June 1957): 66–69; Donald E. Keyhoe and Gordon I. R. Lore Jr., [Strange Effects from UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922995138&usg=AOvVaw3a5y0qxQ0wb5_Gb0Kz7tIK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922995332&usg=AOvVaw02b0d438NAdsng4R3KgkPj) NICAP, 1969, p. 7)

October 7 — 10:45 p.m. UFO reports by police and civilians around Merced, California, reach Castle AFB \[now Castle Airport Aviation and Development Center\] and a lighted elliptical object about 100–120 feet in diameter is seen by the tower. Two interceptors are scrambled. The object ducks under and above a narrow cloud bank. The pilots can see it from various angles and as close as a few hundred yards. It appears to be a flattened circular shape. The pilots decide to fly one above and one below the overcast. Ground radar picks up the planes but not the UFO. One pilot breaks off to return but sees that the UFO is now chasing his buddy’s plane. Several officers arrive from another base to debrief the pilots and they appear very knowledgeable about UFOs. They seek “confirmation, not information” and tell the pilots not to discuss the sighting at all. Citizen witnesses are told the pilots were chasing ducks or geese. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1956 November–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1956-Nov-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922995972&usg=AOvVaw0SbXdLUMOgd5qVRODPgCfQ) [December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1956-Nov-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922996229&usg=AOvVaw08xNaukQXp9vwUFa2CrWGw), The Author, 1994, pp. 52, 59; Richard H. Hall, Uninvited Guests, Aurora, 1988, pp. 242–244; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922996556&usg=AOvVaw3UuPlL4O6pAjHI0P8QDkSO),

p. 239)

Townsend Brown](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Brown.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922996900&usg=AOvVaw2at-lweDS62MSbjiS0Z3Sm) (founder), [Frank Edwards](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Edwards_(writer_and_broadcaster)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889922997199&usg=AOvVaw2_Wv5FGx8ZhKn-FDLrfwDX), Leon C. [Robert B. Gen. [Thomas B.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10755048/thomas-benton-catron&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923001186&usg=AOvVaw3pzvY14rldZ-xtpQcOqKzg) Catron. Gladys Rose Hackett and Margaret Naylor are hired to do secretarial work, and [Martin H. Heflin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1972/04/28/archives/martin-heflin-rites.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923002048&usg=AOvVaw13gf4xgs0ouh1uHjoKDfhG) is hired as public relations specialist. p. 3; Clark III 792; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1956 September–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1956-Sept-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923002867&usg=AOvVaw0BMxAudGDovlR0Px92owVf) [October](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1956-Sept-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923003081&usg=AOvVaw1ri4GAvgS49_vclrmsoAWs)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1956-Sept-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923003351&usg=AOvVaw1ejVuS6itAsT46M9fyKzO_) The Author, 1994, pp. 77–78)

October 29 — [Howard Menger](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_Menger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923003673&usg=AOvVaw26886I6PTrHUA5w2BTp52T), a sign painter from High Bridge, New Jersey, goes public on the [Long John Nebel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_John_Nebel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923003905&usg=AOvVaw1nD6w7NPaxMRxjwxz1GB2H) show on WOR-AM in New York City with a story of his contacts with “Aryan-type” Venusians in spaceships. Menger reports that his contacts started in childhood, when he experienced flashbacks of life on another world and sightings of flying discs. In 1932 he met a beautiful blonde woman who could read his mind, and in 1946 he again sees her stepping out of a flying saucer. She is supposedly 500 years old, although she looks 25. Many contacts follow. (Clark III 738)

November 4 — NICAP issues its first news release. [T. Townsend Brown](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Brown.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923004419&usg=AOvVaw31CyPstdAgz3UuSXykZ_rl) emphasizes the group’s “growing membership of responsible citizens from every walk of life and profession” and stresses that “there does exist more than enough evidence of certain and obvious aerial phenomena to justify independent evaluation.” (NICAP, “[Project](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/NICAP_Selected_Documents/Press%2520Releases%2520%2526%2520Clippings/1956_11_04_NewsRelease_1.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923004742&usg=AOvVaw1fA9vsiQcsgKZ6CTzMLGBG) [Skylight,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/NICAP_Selected_Documents/Press%2520Releases%2520%2526%2520Clippings/1956_11_04_NewsRelease_2.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923005078&usg=AOvVaw3PflZWWy3TdaPMwfLE38yy)” November 4, 1956)

November 11 — 10:00 p.m. Stig Ekberg and Harry Sjöberg are building a house on the island of Väddö, about 56 miles northwest of Stockholm, Sweden. Ekberg is driving his Ford V8 pickup when they see a bright flying object with the shape of a flattened sphere 24 feet wide and 9 feet high approaching from the east. It moves about a half mile in front of them at an altitude of 300 feet. As it makes a sharp turn toward them, the truck engine sputters and dies and the headlights go out. The object starts “slowly gliding down,” rocks back and forth, and comes to a stop in the middle of the road, about 300 feet in front of them, 3 feet above the ground. The object illuminates the surrounding landscape with such a tremendous amount of light that a nearby barn is clearly visible. The air smells of ozone and smoldering insulation. After about 10 minutes the object gets brighter, lifts off the ground, moves to the left and up, makes a sudden turn, and speeds away in the direction it had come. Ekberg restarts the truck and the headlights come back on. Seeing that the grass at the landing site is flattened, they investigate further and find a shiny rock that is hot to the touch. It is a heavy, three-sided piece of metal about the size of a matchbox. After several unsuccessful attempts to have the sample studied, it is taken to the Saab aircraft company where Sven Schalin conducts a thorough analysis. Other tests are later run in laboratories in Sweden, Denmark, and Germany. The general conclusion is that the rock is composed of tungsten carbide and cobalt, consistent with manufactured products. (Jacques Vallée, “[Physical Analyses in Ten Cases of Unexplained Aerial Objects with Material](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scientificexploration.org/docs/12/jse_12_3_vallee_2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923005786&usg=AOvVaw0MuYJGqeIBfp-KcFfLGvf6) [Samples,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scientificexploration.org/docs/12/jse_12_3_vallee_2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923006191&usg=AOvVaw21aN3fHhGvKkMjLTHZj96y)” Journal of Scientific Exploration 12, no. 3 (1998): 365–366)

November 14 — 10:10 p.m. Captain [William Joseph Hull](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/166663770/willam-j_-hull&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923006771&usg=AOvVaw2-mRWjvUwZ1HpzcuP63Pg9) and his copilot Peter H. Macintosh are flying Capital Airlines Flight 77 from New York City to Mobile, Alabama. While approximately above Jackson, Alabama, they see something like a brilliant meteor flash by the aircraft. The object stops, hovers, and engages in a range of acrobatics (crazy gyrations, lazy 8’s, square chandeliers) for several minutes before shooting out over the Gulf of Mexico at “fantastic speed.” (Sign Historical Group, “[Captain Joe Hull’s UFO Sighting](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/articles/nash_hull_letters.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923007276&usg=AOvVaw1SVLLjOGgvaUt2pzvoJKRm)”; Condon, [pp. 127–129](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/126/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923007614&usg=AOvVaw2U_FcAucpU1z_NWTI4zin3); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923007916&usg=AOvVaw0WjByMek7yDSFXKX6bhXhZ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923008122&usg=AOvVaw3x4b-KG-4QWZ11dKCMuDn-) p. 240; Swords 230–231)

* * *

November 16 — Morning. Telephones and an automatic railroad block mechanism in Lemmon, South Dakota, fail to operate as a glowing red object about 3 feet in diameter flies over the railroad yards. (Mobridge (S.Dak.) Tribune, November 22, 1956; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923008728&usg=AOvVaw0zVznGviLOo7NYlKErY7Jn)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923009015&usg=AOvVaw1KEDoWmkzK84P5sut0z6GH) pp. 21–22; Richard F. Haines and Franklin Carter, “[A 1956 Military Aircraft–](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/IURhaines1956.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923009381&usg=AOvVaw14R6hhHXs2SsrbE8k4muDm) [UFO Close Encounter,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/IURhaines1956.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923009677&usg=AOvVaw05fLjr70lCBnhLxjiZpXO0)” IUR 25, no. 1 (Spring 2000): 25)

November 21 — 8:23 p.m. A customs officer named Ueda and a maritime safety officer named Kume are walking along Number 1 Pier, Kobe, Japan, when they hear an explosion. They see something resembling fireworks on the bay and watch as two whirling balls of fire submerge. (Sanderson, [InvRes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scribd.com/document/429706119/Invisible-Residents-The-Reality-of-Underwater-UFOs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923010164&usg=AOvVaw30sa6Y5hGZpl8ZDiaxs8OU), p. 46)

November 25 — 4:30 a.m. Police radio at Hot Springs, South Dakota, picks up transmissions made by a jet interceptor from the 54th Fighter Interceptor Squadron at Ellsworth AFB in Rapid City that makes three passes at a brilliantly lit UFO bobbing up and down in the sky. On the third pass, the pilot reports that the object registers on his radar. It is rumored that a blip is picked up on ground radar by the 740th Aircraft Control and Warning Squadron. A sheriff and deputy at Rapid City watch a green stationary UFO with a flashing red light for 30 minutes; an upward-shining white light appears at intervals. (NICAP, “[Gnd/Air/Visual, Jets Scrambled](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/561124pierre_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923010493&usg=AOvVaw16kVxCPdAEBvra06qZllBs)”; “[‘Saucers’ Stir](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94021254/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923010709&usg=AOvVaw3OChGwpZfxP41y1huzObmO) [Speculation,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94021254/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923010905&usg=AOvVaw2KnDyJHh7KSALXME_BfAdK)” Rapid City (S.Dak.) Daily Journal, November 26, 1956, p. 1; “[Hills Residents](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94021274/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923011204&usg=AOvVaw0ed8_tjRQVoOCzfocjA6Ly) [Tell of Shining](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94021296/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923011435&usg=AOvVaw0KCE_l3kROvdV3BPxCLdni) [Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94021296/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923011612&usg=AOvVaw2xFsZJvMT-fI0BYToefDMb)” Rapid City (S.Dak.) Daily Journal, November 26, 1956, pp. 1, 7; Pierre (S.Dak.) Capitol Journal, November 26, 1956; UFOEv, [pp. 22](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D34%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923011985&usg=AOvVaw1fO_um7NwFIKkSO9UIZdMu)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D34%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923012153&usg=AOvVaw3gv2xlDNoMCVAdtmaKX-_F) [79](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D91%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923012353&usg=AOvVaw0mznvF0l39B3N0QcBMNRAu); Richard F. Haines and Franklin Carter, “[A 1956 Military Aircraft–UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/IURhaines1956.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923012555&usg=AOvVaw3E1rBPcQOXUaMrwi7Lyakd) [Close Encounter,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/IURhaines1956.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923012849&usg=AOvVaw1Q6cgBu3y87MdBkexAqmRz)” IUR 25, no. 1 (Spring 2000): 25)

December — Chemical engineer [Leon Davidson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leon_Davidson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923013543&usg=AOvVaw02XaZcd426jBBgk5A7ImqS) begins to distribute privately printed copies of Project Blue Book Special Report No. 14, together with his analysis and commentary. He has become convinced that UFOs are secret devices developed by the US government and that Special Report No. 14 is a clever attempt to hide the fact.

Mostly, however, he focuses on discrepancies in the Air Force’s public announcements and the actual data in the report. Davidson publishes further editions in October 1957, July 1966, January 1971, and 1976. (Leon Davidson, [Flying Saucers: An Analysis of Project Blue Book Special Report No. 14](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Air_Force_Project_Blue_Book_Special_Report_14R.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923014477&usg=AOvVaw2gCDOs4gCMMQSkbvKyF6jK), \[1956\], 3d ed., Ramsey-Wallace, 1966; Clark III 930)

December 1 — 12:20 a.m. A round object, red to orange in color, is observed moving at approximately 1,000 foot above Valley City, North Dakota. It moves rapidly up, down, sideways, and hovers. A police car approaches it, but the car loses radio contact with the station. Valley City also loses contact with Jamestown, South Dakota. All radio contact returns after the object leaves the area. (NICAP, \[[Blue Book file](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/561201valleycity_docs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923015093&usg=AOvVaw3BcElNqiTykyQIZndPnHWV)\])

December 2 — [Dorothy Martin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.chicagomag.com/Chicago-Magazine/The-312/May-2011/Dorothy-Martin-the-Chicagoan-Who-Predicted-the-End-of-the-World-and-Inspired-the-Theory-of-Cognitive-Dissonance/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923015709&usg=AOvVaw0-bvc4EO2M10FtHMAf69g0) sets off from Prescott, Arizona, with the Laugheads, ufologist brothers [Ray](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/magazine/tireless-tracker-rewrote-the-book-on-dinosaurs-in-maryland/2012/04/17/gIQARzRcTT_story.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923016330&usg=AOvVaw1JRlMDp4vwsEfrc92W-xFu) and [Rex G.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://archived.parapsych.org/psiexplorer/rexstanford.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923016725&usg=AOvVaw0E6RRqQ146Kh7RctG1zcML) [Stanford](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://archived.parapsych.org/psiexplorer/rexstanford.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923017070&usg=AOvVaw2bhKD-HEF4ISxWZ5USls-A), and [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923017425&usg=AOvVaw2FuWH3xYc_JevhNjz0vFUd), his wife Betty, and toddler son Mark. They are acting in response to a series of Williamson channelings that had begun April 18 when Lord Aramu-Muru announced that “those we have commissioned” are to establish a priory of the Brotherhood of the Seven Rays “in a remote area of another country to the south.” After spending some time in Mexico, they head for Moyobamba, Peru, under the direction of their spirit masters. The Laugheads (who apparently were in Mexico in July) and Stanfords leave around this time. After a while, those remaining move to the Valley of Pariahuanca east of Lima, Peru, and set up the Outer Retreat of the Monastery of the Seven Rays, which has some cult-like attributes. There they attract new members, including Williamson’s later coauthor John McCoy. Williamson devotes himself for several years to paranormally guided archaeological expeditions. (Clark III 719–720, 1286; Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, pp. 105–115)

December 10 — 2:00 p.m. A US Air Force pilot sees a silver object with a “straight wing, having engine rods or large wing pods \[or\] intakes” flying at 56,000–62,000 feet for 15 minutes at Victoria, Texas. The pilot’s description is a dead ringer for a secret U-2 aircraft, which is what Blue Book suspects. (Mark Rodeghier, “The U-2 Spy Plane and Blue Book: Another Look,” IUR 27, no. 3 (Fall 2002): 20–21)

December 13 — Capt. Karl Hars Dersson and the crew of the Danish ship [Dorthe Maersk](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.shipsnostalgia.com/gallery/showphoto.php/photo/396230/cat/503&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923018436&usg=AOvVaw0Cj52Q3WfH98TSXwac6wgP) view an intensely bright fireball giving off weird flashes of light for 2–3 minutes north of Isla La Orchila, Venezuela. It explodes on hitting the water. Afterwards, the surface of the sea shimmers with various colors and is disturbed for 5 minutes. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1956 November–December, Supplemental](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1956-Nov-Dec-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923018780&usg=AOvVaw2uSa4aXNC6SJW5GSnX33Hg) [Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1956-Nov-Dec-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923019122&usg=AOvVaw3iuciU1o-QtMijjTmOvv8C)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1956-Nov-Dec-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923019385&usg=AOvVaw1WUgv23e1wuDMXoZy_9aW7) The Author, 2003, pp. 39–40)

December 15 — 11:00 a.m. While out gathering Christmas greens near Derry, New Hampshire, A. G. Horne looks up and sees a 2-foot tall green dwarf with a high-domed head, floppy ears, a face like a bloodhound, and lidless eyes like a snake. His skin hangs in folds like an elephant’s. After a few minutes, the being “started for me with a kind of screeching sound,” and Horne flees. (Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT Index 1956](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1956.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923019927&usg=AOvVaw0inTYrMwKmqEZ1lAqI99cx)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1956.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923020185&usg=AOvVaw1PFWm66Jv6psEJDHNCr1Y_) p. 23; Clark III 271)

December 17 — 4:20 p.m. Near Itazuke Air Base \[now Fukuoka Airport\] in Fukuoka, Japan, a USAF pilot flying an F- 86D interceptor picks up a large blip on airborne radar. The pilot sees a tan object, round on top, at 9.2 miles and closes to within 5.7 miles. The object starts to pull away from the fighter and at 13.8 miles all radar disappears.

* * *

The pilot estimates its speed as 1,700–2,000 mph. Both the pilot and his wingman report interference resembling ECM (radar jamming). (NICAP, “[Radar/Visual from F-86](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/561217itazuke_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923020931&usg=AOvVaw2QmL9o6bOSAV6d659hUowy)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923021265&usg=AOvVaw1rPFNS-0TDvjQDRkHh_cHn), p. 240; “Jet Planes Chased Big Flying Object,” Auckland (N.Z.) Star, October 4, 1957; “[Jet Chase of Large Circular Object Investigated by Far East Air](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/002%2520AUG-SEPT%25201957.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923021789&usg=AOvVaw0JXDCy9ZChOnsF7ECEAx5c) [Force,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/002%2520AUG-SEPT%25201957.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923022191&usg=AOvVaw2mifWmQ_a5BPSpUcxRHgPp)” UFO Investigator 1, no. 2 (Aug./Sept. 1957): 1–2; Richard Hall, “Radar/Visual UFOs and Air Force Debunking,” IUR 18, no. 3 (May/June 1993): 15–16)

December 17 — Night. Marie Carow goes outside her home in Conashaugh, Pennsylvania, with a flashlight and discovers two little men, 3.5 and 3 feet tall, standing motionless in her back lawn. Both wear helmets and snug-fitting suits of silvery material. Carow shines the light on them for 3 minutes, then runs back to tell her husband. 15 minutes later, they are gone. (Berthold Eric Schwarz, “[UFO Occupants: Fact or Fantasy?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201969%2520V%252015%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923023085&usg=AOvVaw0d8VOHv-R7cOeJFHWfzOXR)” Flying Saucer Review 15, no. 5 (Sept./Oct, 1969): 16–18; Clark III 269; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1956-12-17-usa-conashaugh.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923023616&usg=AOvVaw0tjLlAPmWwdIWkTEk0tgfP)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1956-12-17-usa-conashaugh.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923023922&usg=AOvVaw1-2ZdS0pZdaFYyW2DKJVWK) October 18, 2007)

1957

1957 — [Morris K. Jessup](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morris_K._Jessup&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923024766&usg=AOvVaw0Ac6dyjRq7JDsCQDBvu3NU) publishes The Expanding Case for the UFO, which argues that human “little people” (like the pygmy peoples of the Congo basin) were “planted” from UFOs thousands of years ago. Citing reports of anomalous lights on the moon, Jessup speculates that the pygmy races either colonized the moon or came to the Earth from there. They are the remnants of an advanced civilization that developed levitation, teleportation, and space flight, but had to leave Earth when Atlantis and Mu were sinking into the oceans. (Morris K. Jessup, [The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/TheExpandingCaseForTheUFO/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923025412&usg=AOvVaw3rYwqsozkYvwGSUnDZ1Nzv) [Expanding Case for the UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/TheExpandingCaseForTheUFO/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923025783&usg=AOvVaw3y7pkbF1Z1uaUNo7I9JG-6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/TheExpandingCaseForTheUFO/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923026093&usg=AOvVaw3qm0qZYsQInUGmEh40CqrG) Citadel, 1957; Clark III 106–107, 635; Jerome Clark, “Vimanas Have Landed: Ancient Astronautics in Ufology,” IUR 22, no. 3 (Fall 1997): 26)

1957 — Metaphysical author [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923026843&usg=AOvVaw0GmT_qpNYg5UVI73TVZrQ6) writes Other Tongues—Other Flesh (although it bears a copyright date of 1953), the first of three books that set forth an alternative occult history shaped by Atlantis, Lemuria, reincarnation, and space people—both benign and malevolent. He writes that space people first arrived 1 billion years ago \[prior to the earliest known multicellular life on land\], were 12 feet tall, and built an underground city beneath Lake Titicaca, Peru. Migrants from the “Sirius system” arrive during the Miocene Epoch \[23–5 million years ago\] looking for terrestrial bodies to inhabit—they select the evolving apes. The next visitation took place in Arizona in 10,000 B.C. \[the beginning of the Neolithic Revolution\] when Venusians land and interact with the Lemurians. Records documenting earth’s unknown history are hidden in various inaccessible places (“secret places of the lion”) around the globe. Williamson’s book Secret Places of the Lion follows in 1958 and Road in the Sky in 1959. These are among the first ancient astronaut books. In the latter book, Williamson claims that the Hopi’s ancestors are Martians, while their neighbors the Navajo are from Maldek, the planet whose destruction formed the asteroid belt. (George Hunt Williamson, [Other Tongues—Other Flesh](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://dl.lilibook.ir/2016/03/Other-Tongues-Other-Flesh.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923027836&usg=AOvVaw0aSUK26_YNpNEQJzwsLPvb), Amherst, \[1957\]; George Hunt Williamson, [Secret Places of the Lion](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/secretplacesofli0000will/page/n3/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923028279&usg=AOvVaw1H0035tU4ok3AnwTVQoo8r)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/secretplacesofli0000will/page/n3/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923028546&usg=AOvVaw3tBjtkVU0Qkh0NZz8kvBr8) Destiny Books ed., 1996; Clark III 104–106, 1286; Jerome Clark, “Vimanas Have Landed: Ancient Astronautics in Ufology,” IUR 22, no. 3 (Fall 1997): 23–26; Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, pp. 113–120, 235–243)

1957 — New Jersey contactee [Howard Menger](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_Menger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923029392&usg=AOvVaw1abLrCtFnomKw8FBi9shGX) releases an album of “Authentic Music from Another Planet,” featuring a narrative by Menger and bland piano music written by his wife [Connie](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/tcpalm/obituary.aspx?n%3Dconstance-v-menger%26pid%3D186951650&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923029853&usg=AOvVaw23xUDFZMF2vCPOiOdMn5Hv) (under her nom de plume Marla Baxter, sister of the blonde spacewoman he had met in 1946). (Discogs, “[Authentic Music from Another Planet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.discogs.com/release/3138492-Howard-Menger-Authentic-Music-From-Another-Planet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923030328&usg=AOvVaw313UgAB8PHp1G9H7091Zct)”; “[Authentic Music from Another Planet by Howard Menger,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3Dh9LTUAMM0V0&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923030652&usg=AOvVaw2owBzTs7Esh2qYo0PsMii8)” Libertad450 YouTube channel, February 22, 2016)

1957 — [Otis T. Carr](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otis_T._Carr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923031116&usg=AOvVaw2g1kRNOFJAEq2tmht2bF8K) announces his invention of a fourth-dimensional space vehicle, a Circular-Foil Spacecraft powered by an Utron Electric Accumulator that makes use of the “free energy of the universe.” (Clark III 860)

1957 — Ground Saucer Watch is established in Phoenix, Arizona, by Ted Starrett. William H. Spaulding is the Western Division Director, with James A. Spaulding as the Eastern Division Director in Cleveland, Ohio. It publishes Ground Saucer Watch Bulletin from 1976 to 1982. By 1979, GSW has analyzed nearly 700 UFO photographs and films, of which they verify 38 as bona fide. (Margaret Sachs, The UFO Encyclopedia, Putnam, 1980, [p, 132](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoencyclopedia00marg/page/131/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923031975&usg=AOvVaw2FAByuC398sqkqFsS5qVEn))

1957 — [George Fawcett](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.gastongazette.com/article/20130123/News/301239944&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923032460&usg=AOvVaw1kYZHJ4vjiRV4rSJnA_-jp) founds the New England UFO Study Group in Marlborough, Massachusetts. It publishes the

New England UFO Newsletter from 1976 to 1982. ()

1957 — [Hayden C. Hewes](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cryptozoonews.com/hewes-obit/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923033140&usg=AOvVaw34TOmC94Z-5P26uN3BObUn) founds the International UFO Bureau in Edmond, Oklahoma. It publishes the Interplanetary Intelligence Report from 1965 to 1966. ()

1957 — Engineer Pantelimon Mizof and others see an object in the Bucegi Mountains, Romania, pass over them silently and land. Some of them approach to get a better look, but when they are 150 feet away, it takes off suddenly. (Hobana and Weverbergh 158–159)

1957 — The Victorian branch of the Australian Flying Saucer Research Society becomes a separate organization, the Victorian UFO Research Society. It publishes the Australian UFO Bulletin from 1957 to September 2007, edited

by Les Bristol. January — Contactee [Gabriel Green](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_Green&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923036940&usg=AOvVaw1xLAgwRu30XfCGAi8dja5r) establishes the Los Angeles Interplanetary Study Groups, which in 1959 evolves into Amalgamated Flying Saucer Clubs of America in Los Angeles, California. It assumes that UFOs are piloted by friendly extraterrestrials. Around the same time, Green announces his meeting with flying saucer crewmen from the hitherto unknown planet Korendor, orbiting the triple star Alpha Centauri. At its peak, AFSCA has more than 5,000 members. (Wikipedia, “[Gabriel Green](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_Green&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923037625&usg=AOvVaw3moBsGuC1JICBa2-tlhrng)”; Clark III 99; [Thy Kingdom Come](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Thy%2520Kingdom%2520Come%2520(Gabriel%2520Green)/Thy%2520Kingdom%2520Come%2520-%2520No%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923038049&usg=AOvVaw23wr38cgfnAjaio6WouPpf), no. 4 (April/May 1957))

January — [Norbert F. Gariety](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10841839/norbert-f_-gariety&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923038625&usg=AOvVaw01PlAscSxZcGOGj6OIZXwL) begins publishing S.P.A.C.E. (Saucer Phenomena and Celestial Enigma), a monthly newsletter, in Coral Gables, Florida. It continues until January 1963. ([S.P.A.C.E.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/SPACE_Gariety/1957_SPACE_Gariety.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923039169&usg=AOvVaw36rXmtsQWowpWbrjti2NHF), no. 1 (January 1957)

January 1 — Shortly before 12:00 midnight. Herbert Naderson and his wife and sons are driving northeast to their home in Ashby, Minnesota, when they see a triangular object traveling slowly at a high altitude. They watch it for 45 minutes. (Fergus Falls (Minn.) Daily Journal, January 3, 1957; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Jan-Mar-22.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923039811&usg=AOvVaw2IL8NldoArlZi1EYxPPSll) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957 January–March 22nd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Jan-Mar-22.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923040179&usg=AOvVaw1Gt08q9kXBcAoL_L9PP89t)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Jan-Mar-22.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923040450&usg=AOvVaw0A_Ihzqu7-lRYRRztOggAe) The Author, 1995, p. 2)

January 14–16 — [T. Townsend Brown](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Townsend_Brown&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923040940&usg=AOvVaw254NqE_jNQ7YvlriXWRr9G) has proven so financially inept that the NICAP board asks him to step down.

[Delmer S. Fahrney](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/130744428/delmer-stater-fahrney&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923041379&usg=AOvVaw39GCs-Lkng_zw6FgnJqQ4N) replaces him as board chairman, [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923041598&usg=AOvVaw0HpYxbAEoeSv6r6xypJ1tX) steps in as director, and Fahrney convenes a press conference in which he announces that UFOs are under intelligent control, but that they are not American or Soviet aircraft. [Stringfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923041867&usg=AOvVaw3WNeIKLj-cW7wBIekkZKwJ) is made public relations adviser. (T. Townsend Brown, [Letter to NICAP Board of](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/NICAP_Selected_Documents/NICAP%2520Founding/1957_01_16_Brown_Keyhoe.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923042170&usg=AOvVaw3QRtQhfKFp2F6qAWFt7Gns) [Governors](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/NICAP_Selected_Documents/NICAP%2520Founding/1957_01_16_Brown_Keyhoe.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923042474&usg=AOvVaw3SdMgzdJOnWR-dvEq5l0f2)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/NICAP_Selected_Documents/NICAP%2520Founding/1957_01_16_Brown_Keyhoe.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923042717&usg=AOvVaw11Z45qZQwotdjNV0PcUbX-) January 16, 1957; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Jan-Mar-22.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923043007&usg=AOvVaw0FfLT3QmW__Llx7nNWsjBR) [January–March 22nd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Jan-Mar-22.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923043211&usg=AOvVaw2SROiMEphsCrSQhJa6hmwS)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Jan-Mar-22.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923043363&usg=AOvVaw0b7zaUusWqHoR8_P9fJU3V) The Author, 1995, pp. 14–20; “[High Speed Objects Reported in the Sky,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1957/01/17/87258098.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923043587&usg=AOvVaw2xAnesm_6B5U35HAgpH8cz)” New York Times, January 17, 1957, p. 31; Stringfield, Situation Red, Fawcett Crest, 1977, p. 15; Clark III 792)

January 16 — 8:00 p.m. The crews of two Air Force B-25s are flying about 90 miles north of Sweetwater, Texas, when they see a round white object make rapid maneuvers. Pilot Lt. Col. [Howard T. Wright](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49339109/howard-t-wright&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923044061&usg=AOvVaw2RoDj4e97PA8CN_VY-PWz4) notes that his radio compass starts pointing directly toward the object, following its movements. The entire object begins blinking on and off. When the aircraft gets within range of Lubbock, Texas, the object flies off on a straight-line course in about 12 seconds. One of the B-25s refuels and is sent on a 4-hour search of the vicinity with no results. (NICAP, “[Object Maneuvers near B-25’s / EME](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570116ftworth_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923044317&usg=AOvVaw0VNu-j8Uz-zM4W0AFLAt53)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923044492&usg=AOvVaw138Es7xBtKQ6BhcIzAbaP1), p. 241; Swords 244–245)

January 21 — 10:45 a.m. Near Kagnew Station \[now closed\], Asmara, Eritrea, five enlisted men of the US Army’s 4th Detachment of the Second Signal Service Battalion (M/Sgt Billy J. Woodruff, Sgt. Frank Haverly, SP2 Robert O. Clewell, SP2 George R. Dean, and SP3 Gerald L. Fennell) watch a large, shiny, metal sphere hovering at about 2,000 feet. It suddenly disappears but reappears later for a few minutes, then disappears again. Later in the day, Woodruff and Capt. Jesse M. Strong see two brownish, disc-shaped objects maneuvering in formation at a high altitude. One breaks away from the other, moving at high speed. (UFOEv, [p. 29](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D41%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923044870&usg=AOvVaw0tRzMY329Js4hgwZG1yEdM))

January 27 — Former CIA director Rear Adm. [Roscoe H. Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923045177&usg=AOvVaw0MuQvkWrcFViIilVLYs6Ms) joins NICAP’s board of directors. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957 January–March 22nd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Jan-Mar-22.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923045431&usg=AOvVaw1BRXKgOu89TWg3SLlaR030), The Author, 1995,

p. 31)

January 31 — US Army Order number 30-13, “Sightings of Unconventional Aircraft,” stipulates that personnel involved in sightings must “not discuss or disseminate such information to persons or agencies other than their superior officer(s) and other personnel authorized by the Acting Chief of Staff, G-2, this headquarters,” by order of Col. [Charles L. Olin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/83339384/charles-l-olin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923045807&usg=AOvVaw1AVnF6CUCmIx2Awa4EpcgJ)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/83339384/charles-l-olin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923046002&usg=AOvVaw1YFjm9DpGcxQv7-Me8_0VL) (“[Air Force Sees Plenty: Tells Nothing,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/CSI_NY/CSI_NY_%252320.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923046196&usg=AOvVaw2tn6PYhiVeNaBc2ZOMqWPb)” CSI News Letter, no. 8 (July 25, 1957): 7–8)

February — Project MKUltra chief [Sidney Gottlieb](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidney_Gottlieb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923046643&usg=AOvVaw1ctaNzIAc_KhjUsLGlNxVL) organizes field trials of psilocybin for injection into 9 black inmates at the Addiction Center in Lexington, Kentucky. [Allen Dulles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allen_Dulles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923047021&usg=AOvVaw212ajQFRzNOuJc-mgHHge6) approves psychiatrist [Donald Ewen Cameron](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Ewen_Cameron%23MKULTRA_Subproject_68&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923047415&usg=AOvVaw1GP61TofBw_IDPjKQavizo)’s application for mind-control experiments to be administered at the Allan Memorial Institute of McGill University in Montreal, funded through the Society for the Investigation of Human Ecology, a CIA cutout organization.

Cameron does not know that the money originates from the CIA. In addition to LSD, Cameron experiments with various paralytic drugs, electroconvulsive therapy at 30–40 times the normal power, and sensory deprivation in a “sleep room.” This is a dimly lit dormitory of about 20 beds, which the nurses call “The Zombie Room.” His “psychic driving” experiments consist of putting subjects into drug-induced comas for weeks at a time (up to three months in one case) while playing tape loops of noise or simple repetitive statements. His experiments are typically carried out on patients who have entered the institute for minor problems such as anxiety disorders and postpartum depression, many of whom suffer permanently from his actions. His treatments result in victims’ incontinence, amnesia, forgetting how to talk, forgetting their parents, and thinking their interrogators are their

* * *

parents. The Canadian government is apparently unaware of these activities. [Naomi Klein](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naomi_Klein&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923048014&usg=AOvVaw10W5lEeppiH-1aUO0pmXf9) argues that Cameron’s research and his contribution to the MKUltra project is actually not about mind control and brainwashing, but about designing “a scientifically based system for extracting information from ‘resistant sources.’ In other words, torture.” (Gordon Thomas, [Journey into Madness: The True Story of Secret CIA Mind Control and Medical](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/journeyintomadne0000thom&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923048310&usg=AOvVaw19kPnqV9eOzwPmJ6vVuaka) [Abuse](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/journeyintomadne0000thom&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923048485&usg=AOvVaw2ZvhCjfk5AltgdNOdvEL7d)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/journeyintomadne0000thom&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923048621&usg=AOvVaw2ttOB9rlRu1y8RgGHNj15d) Bantam, 1989; Anne Collins, In the Sleep Room: The Story of the CIA Brainwashing Experiments in Canada, Lester & Orpen Dennys, 1988; John D. Marks, [The Search for the “Manchurian Candidate”: The CIA](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/searchformanchur00john&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923049024&usg=AOvVaw1lMpPKFDuYUKTlCWD19ZM0) [and Mind Control](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/searchformanchur00john&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923049252&usg=AOvVaw30WILBOqAA8kfesB4zCu_H)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/searchformanchur00john&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923049474&usg=AOvVaw3C8bek-LcBpYTNDba6s8fq) Times Books, 1978; Naomi Klein, [The Shock Doctrine: The Rise of Disaster Capitalism](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/shockdoctriner00unse/page/n11/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923049786&usg=AOvVaw13V53p-6f-m-YG_FrrWzbw)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/shockdoctriner00unse/page/n11/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923050055&usg=AOvVaw2TSIuqyp2AAOewd5XY8wix) Picador, 2008; Jim Keith, [Mind Control, World Control: The Encyclopedia of Mind Control](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/JimKeithMindControlWorldControlTheEncyclopediaOfMindControl/page/n9/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923050481&usg=AOvVaw3eD7Ya0rVYhBoD-8XqF_ZC), 2014)

February 13 — 2:30 a.m. The USAF operations director and three tower controllers at two radar sites within Lincoln AFB \[now Lincoln Airport, Nebraska\], the GCA and NCOIC, track several targets flying behind an airliner at a distance of 5–6 miles and traveling twice as fast. There is no IFF response. The objects hover and move at high speed. One splits into two objects, another executes an 180° turn. The radar blips are the size of a B-47. (NICAP, “[Radar/Visual at Lincoln AFB](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570213lincolnAFBdir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923050914&usg=AOvVaw1BRazBGjfUvchrs-yG8udV)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923051107&usg=AOvVaw3-rwT5MaiHc3vUXyTYKr2P), p. 241; J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/96/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923051373&usg=AOvVaw2xahawqdsK70jm75Yd3cGd) [96–97](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/96/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923051652&usg=AOvVaw1mx5koiduIoOZ5dNt6AnVn))

February 13 — 9:40 p.m. Amateur astronomer Steve Papina is walking south in Placerville, California, when he notices off to his left the ionized track of what he takes to be a meteor. It is about 20° above the eastern horizon, rising at a 70° angle. The trail begins widening at about 35° above the horizon and veers in a westerly direction. Suddenly a black disc appears directly in front of the trail, whose diameter is approximately the width of the trail and the size of a nickel held at a distance of 5 feet. Its surface is not smooth but crisscrossed with grooves. It continues to move from east to west and acquires a white, dusty appearance before speeding directly away from Papina at high speed. (“[ALPO Refers Sighting to APRO,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201957%252007%252000%2520-%2520July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923052197&usg=AOvVaw0SNZu9JaH0B43oKqySvWbd)” APRO Bulletin, July 1957, p. 3)

February 15 — 10:00 p.m. A large, circular object is seen by independent witnesses in Wardle, Lancashire, England.

Shortly afterward, a commercial aircraft is seen following the same course as the UFO and displaying unusually powerful lights. Later, at a point along the flight path, a small radio transmitter like those attached to balloons is found, then another piece of meteorological equipment in another spot. In the House of Commons, MP [Tony](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_Leavey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923052649&usg=AOvVaw0JqpJcYQjziEvj2t6NBOk5) [Leavey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_Leavey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923052860&usg=AOvVaw29RuaLNZ5PLaJKerRSTQcv) asks the Secretary of State for Air for an explanation. On March 20, Under-Secretary of State for Air [Ian](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ian_Orr-Ewing%252C_Baron_Orr-Ewing&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923053188&usg=AOvVaw3V3oe9EnIXZnSCVVy3HtzC) [Orr-Ewing](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ian_Orr-Ewing%252C_Baron_Orr-Ewing&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923053404&usg=AOvVaw3hLSI3zU0ThqyN42X_IOW_) responds, saying that the objects were toy balloons illuminated by a flashlight bulb released by Neil Robinson, a laundry mechanic from Rochdale. But on April 17, the Air Ministry sends an investigator to interview the witnesses and tells them not to talk about the sighting. Robinson says he has no idea how to launch a balloon, but there is some evidence that he has considerable technical know-how and a penchant for pranks. (Clifford Thornton, “[The Wardle Mystery,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1957%252CMay-Jun%252CV%25203%252CN%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923053864&usg=AOvVaw0GkkruaaTXYq2bNxuuZcJR)” Flying Saucer Review 3, no. 3 (May/June 1957): 4; Geoffrey Norris, “[Something in the Sky,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520Kingdom/RAF%2520Flying%2520Review/1957%252007%252000%2520_Royal%2520Air%2520Force%2520Flying%2520Review.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923054231&usg=AOvVaw1ihiKpYFJu4pWavVZhBtfr)” Royal Air Force Flying Review, July 1957, pp. 14–16, 46; Good Above, [pp. 46–47](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/46/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923054578&usg=AOvVaw2r38YuHVO783AHFiLKMCjO); David Clarke, “The Wardle ‘Thing,’” Fortean Times 196 (June 2005): 40–41)

February 19 — In testimony before the House Appropriations Committee, National Advisory Committee on Aeronautics officials [Hugh Latimer Dryden](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_Latimer_Dryden&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923055169&usg=AOvVaw38tlu1c_tXA2jOnzrIlKul) and [Jimmy Doolittle](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimmy_Doolittle&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923055420&usg=AOvVaw3AZs1Ze4gV2U-zncFmrrGD) are asked about UFOs. They “flatly denied the existence of such space vehicles.” When asked why they don’t speak out more often, they remark that they “cannot compete with the science-fiction people.” (US House Appropriations Committee, Hearings, Independent Offices Appropriations for 1958, National Advisory Committee on Aeronautics, February 19, 1957, [pp. 1417–1419](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/books/edition/Hearings/Sk7VAAAAMAAJ?hl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26pg%3DPA1417%26printsec%3Dfrontcover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923055858&usg=AOvVaw0ZTivr2l7Nx-NGhVHxO-uV))
