February 26 — UK Air Chief Marshal [Hugh Dowding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_Dowding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923056258&usg=AOvVaw3vyYUeI3ND62kj3dSCZaaM) writes to retired Italian diplomat [Alberto Perego](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-mission/global-reach/alberto-perego/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923056576&usg=AOvVaw2OFe_FEc5nvrROZMIy2_mK) that he is most interested in “accounts of intelligible contacts between human beings and the occupants of interplanetary ships.” (Good Above, [p. 48](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/48/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923056926&usg=AOvVaw3HdAooMH113STQ72B31vsJ))

March 1 — [Leonard H. Stringfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923057292&usg=AOvVaw0ZHjfWlbzxHpBAevJ5HDSD) publishes the final issue of CRIFO Orbit. ([CRIFO Orbit](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/Orbit/ORBIT_Volume_III_1956-57_S.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923057601&usg=AOvVaw1ejkex7PCO-9CwWoUqs6Zc) 3, no. 12 (March 1, 1957); Clark III 1114)

March 6 — 2:00 p.m. Hearing the family dogs barking in the backyard, a Mrs. Martin who lives on Hope Road near Great Meadows, New Jersey, looks outside and sees the dogs looking at a white hovering object that looks like a “huge derby hat” about 50 feet in diameter. It is rocking slightly in the air and makes a low, rumbling sound. Beneath it are “streamers or lines” that “twinkle like the fragile strands” of Christmas tinsel. (Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 150–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/150/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923058012&usg=AOvVaw1d_hkMrJmD81iJaD1QTMIm) [154](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/150/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923058201&usg=AOvVaw1D2N4r4ZESqkOel8eViDz0); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923058365&usg=AOvVaw0_G0JJ59lg3qcnRBd6BZgY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923058495&usg=AOvVaw2bGs6yFBOVpsXEXtdWPkWQ) p. 241)

March 8 — A pilot watches a UFO from the ground at Baudette, Minnesota. It is circular, 15–18 feet in diameter, and its odd glow shines on the snow-covered ground. It is flying so low that it seems to suck the loose snow up under it as it passes. (Keyhoe, FSTS, p. 56; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Jan-Mar-22.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923058789&usg=AOvVaw1w8Tji9gq2EoAlo9ngRYAn) [1957 January–March 22nd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Jan-Mar-22.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923059032&usg=AOvVaw0AFaD-OMMcdpx5Ti0Mn1A8)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Jan-Mar-22.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923059279&usg=AOvVaw0Fh6NmSRbtGNmFAsCzBIL_) The Author, 1995, p. 74)

March 8 — 9:45 p.m. Victor Hancock and Guy Miller are flying a DC-3 owned by the Tennessee Gas Transmission Company above Pasadena, Texas, when they see a UFO bearing three brilliant white lights. After the UFO speeds by the aircraft, it slows down. When the DC-3 catches up, it speeds ahead. This cat-and-mouse chase continues

* * *

for some 10 minutes. (NICAP, “[UFO Maneuvers near DC-3](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570308pasadena_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923060081&usg=AOvVaw1DcNYL2rdZ7pGMDn35DK8m)”; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Jan-Mar-22.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923060431&usg=AOvVaw3086XZ5wVUKWFmqlrL05Xr) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957 January–March 22nd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Jan-Mar-22.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923060772&usg=AOvVaw2od-aRH-1znQC938dZpsaF)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Jan-Mar-22.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923061049&usg=AOvVaw2fntoHlSMJ290jjxtBBB0c) The Author, 1995, pp. 68–69)

March 9 — 4:33 a.m. Capt. [Matthew A. Van Winkle](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/155966765/matthew-armstrong-van_winkle&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923061592&usg=AOvVaw02dffbaLOJG9uQV3NebgPK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/155966765/matthew-armstrong-van_winkle&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923061884&usg=AOvVaw39_vxSgeuic8SmXeEkdoDz) piloting a Pan American World Airways DC-6A airliner at a point over the Atlantic Ocean approximately 350 miles northeast of Jacksonville, Florida, observes a “burning greenish white round object” to the right of the aircraft that appears to be on a collision course. Van Winkle pulls the plane upward in a climb to avoid the object. This sudden maneuver causes four of the passengers to be thrown out of their seats, resulting in injuries. Copilot Dion W. Taylor and Flight Engineer John Washuta also observe the object. Washuta says the UFO is a high-intensity light that appears to stand still for approximately four seconds until it is lost to sight during the evasive action. [Ed Perry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://clipperpioneers.com/2015-obituaries/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923062300&usg=AOvVaw19Fjoqvqxct1qxpooYe-om)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://clipperpioneers.com/2015-obituaries/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923062531&usg=AOvVaw1gDte5MjVRo7Fo-UMvse0N) piloting Pan Am Flight 269 about 175 miles behind him, also sees it. Miami Air Traffic Control sends a flash message to the Civil Aeronautics Board describing the incident: “Pilot took evasive action, object appeared to have a brilliant greenish-white center with an outer ring which reflected the glow from the center. … Above description fits with what seven other flights saw…. Miami reports no missile activity…. Original reports of jet activity discounted.” The Air Force quickly explains the sighting as a meteor, but the CAB declares it unexplained after a thorough investigation. (NICAP, “[DC6-A Crew](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570309jacksonville_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923062978&usg=AOvVaw38bklpZciq7RlcZasMNzoh) [Take Evasive Action](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570309jacksonville_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923063282&usg=AOvVaw17zMqYU_RKRUwAnYhoZtly)”; Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 54–56; Swords 245–246; Frank Edwards, FS Serious Business, Bantam ed., 1966, [pp. 38–39](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersser00edwa/page/38/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923063710&usg=AOvVaw34wKFGSXx-CZ0WQvMlVXQc); Good Above, [pp. 282–283](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/282/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923064026&usg=AOvVaw1j0HzVjcXnFCf2UA8xvnAL))

March 22–23 — Mrs. Robert Beaudoin, the wife of an [Air Force officer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.fidler-isburgfuneralchapels.com/obituary/robert-beaudoin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923064464&usg=AOvVaw1LXRvs1Wcv2naQz9d8VHzI), along with her 17-year-old daughter Carol Litten, sees a series of unusual lights at 11:15 p.m. northeast of Camarillo, California. First they see a large, soundless, and pulsing light, with something like a pole on top, making fast and erratic motions. She calls a military friend and then 1st Lt. [Leonard E. Ott](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/107037003/leonard-edwin-ott&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923064841&usg=AOvVaw3OK18KFa3Sxc2w3_Gw6_m9) at nearby Oxnard AFB \[now Camarillo Airport\]. At 12:30 a.m., they see a green object accompanied by two smaller red lights below the horizon of the Los Palos Hills. The green object seems to be hovering over the North American Rocketdyne plant in the Simi Hills. At this time both the green object and the red objects seem to jump around, and the two red objects are zooming past the green object at tremendous velocities. Ott inquires about radar and a Lt. Martin tells him that radar is detecting a stationary object in the same area. The sheriff’s office is contacted, and they send a patrol car. Deputy Sheriffs Segura and Rausch confirm Beaudoin’s report, with the exception that by that time there are five red objects flying well below the green one. All are in motion and constantly changing altitude. Radar calls Ott back and says they have a scramble underway and they will have the aircraft check the area upon their return. Upon the arrival of the interceptors from Oxnard the red objects join the green object and speed away up and to the east. The aircraft are unsuccessful and return to base. At this time two Navy aircraft are sent to the area. Somehow, between the time of this report to Oxnard and the later Air Force investigation by the 4602nd, these red objects are changed, on the report, to stars and the moon above. This happens despite the witness stating that the red lights were below the hills on the horizon. To deal with that, the Air Force adds the theory that a temperature inversion caused light to bend the images of the stars, or, alternatively, the witness saw lights on a barn. Beaudoin herself is judged hysterical due to her pregnancy. The Air Force’s explanation is completed without anyone bothering to interview the teenage daughter or taking anything associated with the airbase into account (for example, the radar returns). (NICAP, “[Objects Seen, Radar Tracked, Jets Scrambled](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570323oxnardafb_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923065462&usg=AOvVaw2yjW8DVD_G350INohbcNjF)”; Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 58–61; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 53–54](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/52/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923065737&usg=AOvVaw2FJ_lC3mtQwszjp4FrdDLX); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923065938&usg=AOvVaw1rfHxGFV85_OtbVTy46DTv)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923066077&usg=AOvVaw1efmhs9m9Yt1yoc0ip7lQa) p. 242; Swords 246–247)

March 23 — Agriculturist Luis Petriera, along with several others, watches a glowing object plunge into Lake Maracaibo, Venezuela. No planes are missing. Officials drag the lake but find nothing. (“[Report from Venezuela,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201957%252007%252000%2520-%2520July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923066414&usg=AOvVaw2jadEuiU586_G89NWzXJ1n)” APRO Bulletin, July 1957, p. 10)

March 28 — AEC physician and Navy Capt. [Charles Wesley Shilling](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Wesley_Shilling&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923066913&usg=AOvVaw2cDgp3chzTm7TBBUJUPLCu) releases a press statement saying that “excessively hot baths can be as damaging to the human sex glands as radioactive fallout in the amount received in the last five years from the testing of atomic weapons.” It is intended to counter the antinuclear activism of biochemist [Linus](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linus_Pauling&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923067197&usg=AOvVaw0gZ7unlgWQh8rzPdcpNa0B) [Pauling](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linus_Pauling&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923067421&usg=AOvVaw0TPpF9HraKFpRm4QBrzUGw)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linus_Pauling&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923067585&usg=AOvVaw0ivX5Spo-K4JRHEBOnz9ap) (“[Says Hot Baths As Bad for Sex Glands As Fallout,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94239912/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923067837&usg=AOvVaw1HAMInmVGe5EW3OxPHd_FJ)” Newport (R.I.) Daily News, March 29, 1957, p. 2)

Early April — USAF Brig. Gen. Arno H. Leuhman, director of Air Force information, tells the press that “There’s no valid evidence that there are flying saucers.” (“[AF Intelligence Chief Visits Here,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94240280/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923068328&usg=AOvVaw2j25I_u4ChaNrMLTNlTr-V)” Miami (Fla.) News, April 14, 1957, p. 12A)

April — 7:30 a.m. An anonymous resident of Córdoba, Argentina, is motorcycling to Rio Ceballos when his engine stops.

He sees a large UFO hovering nearby, from which a human-like occupant emerges. He entices the man to enter the UFO with him. Inside, he sees 5–6 screens and intricate equipment, at each of which a similar occupant is seated. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957 March 23rd–May 25th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Mar-23-May-25.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923068858&usg=AOvVaw3nq2v83DeYa-js_VWN6xnI)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Mar-23-May-25.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923069073&usg=AOvVaw2Ufu5WrL7pgOpU_OqWqeVo) The Author, 1995, pp. 63–64)

April 4 — Pilot [Robert L. Sieker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/38254200/robert-lee-sieker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923069416&usg=AOvVaw3QuLXh_-BQCxi6JbmqtTe9) takes a U-2 covered in radar-deflecting paint for a test run out of Area 51 and flies almost 90 miles without incident when suddenly the paint causes the aircraft to overheat, spin out of control, and

* * *

crash near Pioche, Nevada. Sieker ejects but is killed when a piece of metal hits him in the head. (Aviation Safety Network, “[Wikibase Occurrence #155905](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://aviation-safety.net/wikibase/155905&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923069956&usg=AOvVaw1HPSVjJLAVoycxwuPgIhav)”)

April 4 — Five unusual radar contacts are detected simultaneously on three tracking radars of the Bombing Trials Unit based at RAF West Freugh \[now MOD West Freugh\], southeast of Stranraer, Scotland, and followed for 36 minutes. The three radars are located at two different sites near Luce Bay, Wigtownshire, Scotland. The object flashes across the sky at 60,000 feet, dives to 14,000 feet, circles, and speeds away. Wing Commander Walter Whitworth, in command at West Freugh, is ordered to say nothing about the object. (NICAP, “[Three Radars](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570404scotland_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923070385&usg=AOvVaw2GMQxLw4bXlqHWGMXlol8J) [Track Maneuvering UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570404scotland_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923070666&usg=AOvVaw1Z8sqSNmbt_52AAOMXaWqO)”; Good Above, [pp. 48–49](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/48/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923070906&usg=AOvVaw3W04yNteAGqdJaPhgb1pUd); UFOFiles2, [pp. 51–53](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n87/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923071210&usg=AOvVaw1EoG_64EassuJ4BJFjbboY); Martin Shough, “[Study of Unusual](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.martinshough.com/aerialphenomena/westfreugh.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923071481&usg=AOvVaw17Za2wH5A_o7YHQfNWSuBU) [Radar Observations near RAF West Freugh, Wigtownshire, SW Scotland, April 4, 1957,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.martinshough.com/aerialphenomena/westfreugh.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923071741&usg=AOvVaw1KCk9LyB92WbVFAbWp42N4)” March 2010; Patrick Gross, “[The West Freugh Incident, 1957](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/westfreugh57.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923072039&usg=AOvVaw2V6XIMdWClhCJT9H8JWQoY)”)

April 8 — USAF Maj. Gen. [Joe W. Kelly](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_W._Kelly&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923072374&usg=AOvVaw2PlrSPYAZL7Dvv4mErBiYF) answers a question from Rep. [Lee Metcalf](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lee_Metcalf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923072688&usg=AOvVaw3DZVa4rqLBznYl8Mma5B0-) (D-Mont.) and denies that the Air Force has muzzled pilots. “Answers are provided on any unidentified flying objects which have attracted national attention.” He admits that interceptors are still sent up “as a matter of security.” (Keyhoe, FSTS)

April 10 — [Delmer S. Fahrney](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/130744428/delmer-stater-fahrney&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923073226&usg=AOvVaw2xOw0p5858qY_WJZys35n6) leaves NICAP’s board of directors for urgent and personal reasons, partially because his [wife](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/130744427/agnes-whiting-fahrney&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923073577&usg=AOvVaw0yeOQy-ByD88kgNKR5t7vs) is seriously ill, but also because of the ridicule generated by his peers in the military. (Clark III 792–793)

April 14 — 3:00 p.m. Marie Garcin and Julia Rami are walking along road D24 a half-mile east of Vins-sur-Caramy, Var, France, when they hear a deafening noise and see a 5-foot-tall, 3-foot-wide, metallic, top-shaped object covered with vibrating sharp spines that is landing near a road sign. The sign starts to vibrate loudly, then the object hops over the road at a height of about 15–30 feet. Another witness, Jules Boglio, is about 1,000 feet away and sees the object land a second time in the adjoining road, then jump over another road sign which then vibrates loudly. Two other witnesses see the object at a much greater distance. (NICAP, “[Top-Shaped Object Hovers at 300](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570414france_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923074092&usg=AOvVaw07BmxdfFnXaUL8ULaoYeA6)”; Jimmy Guieu, “[Vins-sur-Caramy (Var), 14 avril 1957,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/France/Ouranos/Ouranos%2520-%2520No%252021%2520-%25203e%2520trim%25201957.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923074406&usg=AOvVaw233zvtiOrfa-TEZsoFGYxu)” Ouranos, no. 21 (1957): 50–52; Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 145–146; J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 154–156](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/154/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923074924&usg=AOvVaw1s9VDhsu6RreGFr6RVRnzk))

April 19 — 11:52 a.m. Two metallic discs are seen entering the Pacific Ocean about 300 miles southeast of Tokyo, Japan, by Japanese fisherman aboard the Kitsukawa Maru. A violent turbulence disturbs the ocean after they submerge. The objects are 30 feet long and wingless. (NICAP, “[Two Discs Enter Pacific](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570419pacific_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923075449&usg=AOvVaw2jNXBxconM8nl1TDhRLhfO)”)

April 24 — 6:27 a.m. Project 57 is an open-air nuclear “dirty-bomb” test conducted in Area 13 at the Nellis Air Force Range, Nevada. The high explosives of a nuclear weapon are detonated asymmetrically to simulate an accidental detonation of an XW-25 warhead in an airplane crash. The purpose of the test is to verify that no yield would result, as well as study the extent of plutonium contamination. Some 4,000 galvanized steel pans sprayed with tacky resin are set up around a 10-by-16-square-mile block of land to capture plutonium samples. Some 68 air- sampler stations equipped with micropore paper are spread over 70 square miles. Mock-ups of sidewalks, curbs, and asphalt are set up in the desert; cars and trucks are added; giant air-sampling balloons are tethered in place; 9 burros, 109 beagles, 10 sheep, and 31 white rats are put in cages. Afterward, the contaminated area is fenced off and the contaminated equipment buried in place. Data from the test confirms that plutonium has a 24,000-year half-life; many of the test animals are killed, but security guard [Richard Mingus](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Mingus&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923076191&usg=AOvVaw1X5ZMNFKWuq5TiVV1w4K2-) manages not to inhale any particles. A radiological survey team detects alpha radiation, but no serious beta or gamma radiation. In 1981, the US Department of Energy decontaminates and decommissions the site. Hundreds of thousands of cubic yards of soil and debris are removed from Area 13 and disposed of in a waste facility at the Nevada Test Site. (Wikipedia, “[Project 57](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_57&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923076667&usg=AOvVaw2LZUbyv3dh0v4gWYkzpytO)”; Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 100–116](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/100/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923077133&usg=AOvVaw3dGNQqETJZ7r_fHZBFZoAS))

Late spring — Between 6:30 and 7:00 p.m. Airman 2nd Class Wallace Fowler is sitting on the front steps of his barracks at Ellsworth AFB near Rapid City, South Dakota, when a silver domed disc with portholes appears directly above him. Shadows are moving behind the portholes. The UFO is motionless and the size of a house. After about 2–3 minutes it takes off straight up at high speed. Many others on the base have seen the object as well, and jets are scrambled. The UFO maneuvers around the jets as if toying with them. One of the pursuing jets allegedly goes missing and the wreckage is never found. (Good Need, [pp. 218–219](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/218/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923077768&usg=AOvVaw2XL1-idzioAok0GuIXGaNY))

May — NICAP is fed a phony UFO crash story in the Everglades, Florida, by an Associated Press employee who is a “former Signal Corps engineer” with possible ties to the NSA. He admits faking the story but refuses to give any motive. (Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 64–68)

May — 4:50 a.m. A truck driver pulls over at the edge of the disused RAF Winkleigh Airfield \[now the site of the West of England Transport Collection\], Devon, England, to drink some coffee. He notices an object like a metallic, fluorescent-blue submarine with tail fins sitting at the end of the runway. It is about the size of an airliner. He watches it a while, then gets out of the truck and approaches it. He has the object in sight a total of 10–15 minutes and realizes it is hovering just above the ground. When he is 600 feet away, he encounters a type of force field that prevents him from approaching. The object then rises straight up into the sky to about 1,200 feet and shoots

* * *

off to the north. The force field disappears. (Ron Toth, “[UFO Landing at War-time Aerodrome,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520Kingdom/Pegasus%2520(SIGAP)/Pegasus%2520-%2520Vol%252002%2520No%25203%2520May-June%25201970.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923078787&usg=AOvVaw0_JdtjBlX6cg8Uw2ZyezEI)” Pegasus 2, no. 3 (May-June 1970): 2–4)

May — 6:00 a.m. Frances Stichler is working in her barn in Milford, Pennsylvania, when she hears a whirring sound and sees a bowl-shaped object approaching at a height of 15 feet. It is 15 feet in diameter with a rim about 3 feet wide. It hovers with one side tilted toward her 50 feet away. Its lone occupant, a helmeted figure with a long, olive- colored face and a shiny, light gray suit, gazes at her with a quizzical expression on his tanned face. It is sitting on the far rim with feet and legs hidden by the lower part of the object. Inside the open vehicle, she can see levers.

After a minute, the object takes off to the southwest making a spinning sound. Her chickens do not seem disturbed by any of this. (Berthold Eric Schwarz, “[UFO Occupants: Fact or Fantasy?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201969%2520V%252015%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923079573&usg=AOvVaw0eVJjYwI-RXO5zw4DbEacy)” Flying Saucer Review 15, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1969): 14–15; Clark III 268; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-May-24-July-31.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923080038&usg=AOvVaw2SGkmiNpLeC3H7SRLvS9SI) [History: 1957 May 24th–July 31st](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-May-24-July-31.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923080366&usg=AOvVaw3Kb07f9KzLYX8BQDQKzix0), The Author, 1996, p. 10; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1957-05-usa-milford.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923080706&usg=AOvVaw3hQJWx7zCQY2idDXpuBHmB)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1957-05-usa-milford.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923080889&usg=AOvVaw3JXSwLQJ_T98oUrmiHLcu4) December 17, 2006)

May? — 3:45 p.m. Two men in Orlando, Florida, see an oval object emerge from a larger cigar-shaped UFO about 75– 100 feet long. (Herbert S. Taylor, “Satellite Objects: A Further Look,” IUR 29, no. 2 (Summer 2004): 7, 25)

May 1 — 7:00 a.m. A man driving a motorcycle about 9 miles from Pajas Blancas International Airport in Córdoba, Argentina, sees a UFO shortly after his engine fails. It is 65 feet in diameter and 16 feet thick, hovering about 50 feet above the ground. He hides in a ditch and sees the craft come down, making a sound similar to air escaping from a valve. A lift descends from its base almost to the ground. In it is a man of average height who makes friendly gestures. He is dressed in a plastic diving suit. The witness enters the machine and sees several people inside seated in front of instrument panels, lit by an extraordinary light. He is then escorted out, and the disc rises to the northwest. During the next hour, there are 6 other sightings made by independent witnesses. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957 March 23rd–May 25th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Mar-23-May-25.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923081411&usg=AOvVaw0lLucF3VQvPZBv3xC5HZyO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Mar-23-May-25.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923081566&usg=AOvVaw3ijhW3aUvMCbqcGdfOKKbM) The Author, 1995,

pp. 61–64; Mark Cashman, “Behavioral Classification System for UFO Occupants,” IUR 24, no. 1 (Spring 1999): 19)

May 2— 6:55–7:20 a.m. Frank E. Baker, supervisor of civilian camera operators at Edwards AFB, California, sends the standard two-man crews out to their Askania tracking telescopes for their daily shifts. Veterans James D. Bittick and [John R. Gettys Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/132228244/john-robert-gettys&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923082019&usg=AOvVaw2pFPHBYLT40yoJqftSPHZl) are in their pickup expecting a normal day. As they approach their station in the Mojave Desert, they see a bright object in the sky. It is initially at about a 45° elevation and seems to be hovering. They need to get permission from Baker to photograph anything, so they call it in, begin readying the scope, load the film, and wait for the okay. Gettys says the base of the object has a circular appearance when high in the sky.

Baker gives them his approval and they begin filming, each viewing the object through spotting scopes while the film rolls. They shoot about 100 feet then stop. During filming, the object moves from 1 mile away to 5 miles.

What they see is a disc-shaped object with a low dome on top. They contact the base, which scrambles two jets, but they are too late. After they turn the film in, three officers show up and interrogate them. Future astronaut [Gordon Cooper](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gordon_Cooper&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923082414&usg=AOvVaw0YRdcd6L-OBUeEyn2TDXOc) claims he was there that day, involved with the tracking. (NICAP, “[Edwards AFB](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570502edwardsafb_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923082631&usg=AOvVaw01rDaKhCvULEIovuNqSr8x) [Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/570502edwards_continued.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923082806&usg=AOvVaw1GMj0gsuHDmwZKVfqK-r53)”; “[Unidentified Flying Object Filmed, Studied,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94247945/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923083011&usg=AOvVaw1XtulXx4hM1PyktCrI6-lb)” Miami (Fla.) News, May 12, 1957, p. 2; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23photo&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923083279&usg=AOvVaw3Xo-Hv39vtzWO7aKkba_SW)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 75–76; Michael D. Swords, “As Great an Enigma As the UFOs Themselves,” IUR 30, no. 1 (October 2005): 10–12; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923083636&usg=AOvVaw1nleMhhDDen_A1m5cqQwl5), p. 243; “[Astronaut Gordon Cooper Talks about UFOs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DdvPR8T1o3Dc&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923083848&usg=AOvVaw22w6erOM82QtAIWL99Sz6O)” Elhardt YouTube channel, December 27, 2007; Swords 247–248; Gordon Cooper and Bruce Henderson, Leap of Faith: An Astronaut’s Journey into the Unknown, HarperTorch, 2000, pp. 83–86; Good Need, [pp. 220–222](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/220/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923084114&usg=AOvVaw1HIoIEkoNibzIBcpl229UE))

May 10 — After 10:45 p.m. At Beaucourt-sur-l’Ancre, Somme, France, a 29-year-old Hungarian refugee named Fekete is cycling when he is “dazzled by a strange projectile.” He sees four men 4–5 feet tall approaching him in a threatening manner. One of them carries a bright light which prevents him from seeing much detail. He flees on his cycle to a nearby home, where others look out and see the occupants 300 feet away. The UFO is emitting red and white (or yellow) rays of light alternatively. They watch for about 20 minutes until 11:15 p.m. when the UFO takes off at a 45° angle. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957 March](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Mar-23-May-25.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923084474&usg=AOvVaw3Ao2V5mHgPbeZNpKFxzz6G) [23rd–May 25th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Mar-23-May-25.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923084664&usg=AOvVaw0Z_NT8uqr7zaPVG_CfdGlz)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Mar-23-May-25.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923084841&usg=AOvVaw0m0x1LFxpEAjvMH6A5yPDC) The Author, 1995, pp. 69–72)

May 11 — While attending the Giant Rock Interplanetary Spacecraft Convention in the Mojave Desert near Landers, California, [Wayne Sulo Aho](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wayne_Sulo_Aho&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923085136&usg=AOvVaw35OIQ7rX8DZGOJroW4jfd7) goes for a walk and sees a “majestic egg-shaped light.” He directs a telepathic message to it, and the UFO lands 2 miles away. He begins receiving subtle psychic messages on his earthly mission. That night, Aho undergoes a “cosmic initiation.” (Clark III 59; Wayne S. Aho, Mojave Desert Experience, May 11, 1957, New Age, 1972)

May 20? (or 1956?) — Near 12:00 midnight. USAF Lt. Milton Torres is flying F-86D Sabre fighters with the 406th Bomber Wing based at RAF Manston \[now closed\], Kent, England. He receives an order from an RAF controller, who is tracking an unidentified target from Kelvedon Hatch Secret Nuclear Bunker \[now closed\] in Essex, to go

* * *

up with a wingman to 32,000 feet over East Anglia in pursuit. Over the radio he receives an order to fire a salvo of rockets at the target; the order is so unusual that Torres seeks authentication before firing. Torres locates the large target on his aircraft radar, but when he closes in on it, it shoots away at tremendous speed, disappearing from the radar screens. The target might be explained by a secret CIA-MoD experiment, codenamed [Palladium](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_Intelligence_Agency_Directorate_of_Science_%2526_Technology%23ELINT&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923085766&usg=AOvVaw0Jb2TEjN5q0rT2V4jmw1lj)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_Intelligence_Agency_Directorate_of_Science_%2526_Technology%23ELINT&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923085976&usg=AOvVaw1tDKgO3e-okrL7WdHq7yF-) to simulate an aircraft blip on Soviet radar screens. On his return to base, Torres is debriefed by a secret service agent and told his mission is top secret. (NICAP, “[Milton Torres / Intercept Mission](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570520eastanglia_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923086206&usg=AOvVaw2C-IiNzIDtw9n6rhlC0OVz)”; UFOFiles2, [pp. 69–72](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n117/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923086417&usg=AOvVaw3TzdyEL65rJAn89BoZvArX); David Clarke, “Intercept and Destroy,” Fortean Times 242 (December 2008): 34–35; Paul Crickmore, “[Project](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://aviationtrivia.blogspot.com/2011/01/project-palladium-testing-soviet-radars.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923086690&usg=AOvVaw0VAUzdiZ3J7nBXilP7vCLt) [Palladium: Testing Soviet Radars,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://aviationtrivia.blogspot.com/2011/01/project-palladium-testing-soviet-radars.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923086915&usg=AOvVaw1PWrSQKmiyyhQt5BiFeLvr)” Tails Through Time, January 3, 2011; Curt Collins, “[Area 51, the CIA, and](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.blueblurrylines.com/2014/01/area-51-cia-and-cold-war-ufos-td-barnes.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923087129&usg=AOvVaw3wllgAPi7ygKzAKGQsPKml) [Cold War UFOS: T. D. Barnes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.blueblurrylines.com/2014/01/area-51-cia-and-cold-war-ufos-td-barnes.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923087433&usg=AOvVaw0v5JBLxLyyfaMO-ah-B0cI)” Blue Blurry Lines, January 9, 2014)

May 26 — An article in the UK Empire News on “Flying Saucer Clubs Probe: Peace Messages ‘from Outer Space’” reveals that [George King](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.aetherius.org/dr-george-king/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923087925&usg=AOvVaw06TfkJYwQkj_658B9n_RJ6)’s Aetherius Society has been publishing channeled messages in its Cosmic Voice newsletter that are antiwar and anti-nuclear. It attracts the attention of Scotland Yard’s Special Branch, thanks to an informant on the newspaper. King writes to explain that his group is religious and not political. A Special Branch officer visits King in his home in London, England, on May 31, and the group’s writings and activities are watched for at least the next two years. (Kremlin 121–126)

May 28 — Boltzmann, the first of 29 nuclear tests in Operation Plumbbob, takes place at the Nevada Test Site. At 12 kilotons, it is about the same size as the Hiroshima bomb and causes Area 51 personnel 11 miles away to be temporarily evacuated. Another test blast buckles aircraft hangar doors in Area 51, shatters windows in the mess hall, and breaks a dormitory ventilator panel. The Plumbbob tests continue until October 7, 1957. While

most tests contribute to the development of warheads for intercontinental and intermediate range missiles, they also test air defense and anti-submarine warheads with small yields. (Wikipedia, “[Operation Plumbbob](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Plumbbob&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923089279&usg=AOvVaw0ZFeLjfgxZJoFHbc-NEEz_)”)

May 31 — 7:17 a.m. A British airliner is flying over Kent, two miles south of Rochester, England, when both the captain and first officer see a brilliant light approaching them. All radio communications cut out. The UFO blinks out and the radio equipment goes back into operation. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923089691&usg=AOvVaw2SQzaMjFkk_V-GmRxadrmc)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923089900&usg=AOvVaw0UvsQlXv0Qj68kuJ-YKp7N) pp. 122–123; Good Above, [p. 50](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/50/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923090091&usg=AOvVaw2E6xfXuGl6M7Rs5RGYww7z))

June 3 — 9:35 p.m. Shortly after takeoff from Shreveport (Louisiana) Airport, Capt. Lynn Kern and Flight Officer [Abbey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/203353809/abbey-zimmerman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923090473&usg=AOvVaw3BHxBM1MPuVHjN1rCokTII) [Zimmerman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/203353809/abbey-zimmerman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923090712&usg=AOvVaw3w0hyMRnzj1mURsrIH0DlC)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/203353809/abbey-zimmerman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923090908&usg=AOvVaw0piz_BXncx82fMs3oNjDqz) flying Trans-Texas Airlines Flight 103, are told by the control tower that a small light is visible nearby. They see the star-like, blue-green object at about 400 feet altitude. It then climbs rapidly to 1,000 feet and parallels the airliner at a higher altitude and about a half-mile away. Kern flashes his landing lights, and the object responds with a beam of light. A second blue-green, pulsating object joins the first on the opposite side of the airliner (then at 9,000 feet). A crew from the air tower confirms that it has both objects on radar and visually through binoculars. The objects head south, climbing to about 10,000 feet, and follow the airliner to Converse, Louisiana, where the pilot queries ADC radar site, England AFB \[now Alexandria International Airport\], which confirms the two targets in the airliner’s vicinity. The objects disappear from sight in a cloud deck to the southwest. (NICAP, “[Flight 103 & 2 UFOs Tracked on Radar](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570603shreveport_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923091307&usg=AOvVaw3DBSMimCU2FDmpFxq2GWtB)”; [Sparks,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923091562&usg=AOvVaw3tVeFKOf4EDyEz-l8W7RgG) p. 244; J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 94–96](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/94/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923091902&usg=AOvVaw3-xQM-DlEO8PmRnhqmyt9n))

June 5 — AEC Commissioner [Willard Libby](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Willard_Libby&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923092336&usg=AOvVaw22ntowK5h1wI7OG6MQmRVs) tells Congress that nuclear weapons testing is a “small risk” that must be measured against the “risk of annihilation.” (“[Bomb Testing Is Viewed As Risk to Be Compared with](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94249283/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923092569&usg=AOvVaw02uw8eDWCqNQAj1V0t3Nwf) [Annihilation,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94249283/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923092750&usg=AOvVaw2wup45YuZ2jb3PzlE91uvX)” Spokane (Wash.) Chronicle, June 5, 1957, p. 2)

June 11 — CIA operative [Wallace R. Lampshire](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/46087129/wallace-r-lampshire&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923093128&usg=AOvVaw3j2BPfXHgEeG78h_Mzwbc2) sends a memo to CIA operative [Richard M. Bissell Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_M._Bissell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923093354&usg=AOvVaw0Qc_LJJ4zBa_wo-y-PF1Fz), explaining that the agency’s involvement with UFOs is passive, handing off reports to its geophysics or former weapons units. Lampshire has talked with Gen. [Philip J. Strong](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1971/11/25/archives/gen-philip-strong-expert-on-u2-dies.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923093568&usg=AOvVaw11fgUFapET9mEqvdv4-x0c)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1971/11/25/archives/gen-philip-strong-expert-on-u2-dies.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923093782&usg=AOvVaw2BOYAZy2HPuM_ZrwRjX4Ek) who knows of no Soviet technology that might be responsible for UFOs. (Swords 264–265)

June 15 — A report in the UK weekly newspaper Reynold’s News claims that the Air Ministry conducts top secret UFO research in Room 801 of one of its offices on Northumberland Avenue, London, England. A ministry spokesman is quoted as saying the room has “something like 10,000 sightings” on file and a large map of the British Isles with thousands of colored pins representing sightings. Flying Saucer Review editor [Gordon Creighton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufoinfo.com/news/gordoncreighton.shtml&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923094272&usg=AOvVaw23_fOKKLbWnhfrzhlLRiSl) says the office belongs to the Deputy Directorate of Intelligence (Technical), which employs UFO researchers full-time. (Good Above, [p. 49](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/48/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923094582&usg=AOvVaw049RlDz-fhiYYUhgtuc8zr))

June 15 — 5:06 p.m. George Marsden watches a Saturn-shaped UFO with portholes through a telescope at Mawdesley, Lancashire, England. (UFOEv, [p. 146](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D158%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923094914&usg=AOvVaw2R2az0ae0TEvEAfYu7U3Qn); Center for UFO Studies, \[[case documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1957_06_15_GB_LAN_Mawdesley_NICAP_Marsden.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923095230&usg=AOvVaw0iSDvyhAjuxKJsoC_lZvSi)\])

June 18 — 8:00 p.m. Captain C. G. Wertz and the crew of the Matson freighter Hawaiian Fisherman see two brightly lit objects off the port beam as they are steaming 150 miles off San Francisco, California. A third object joins them at 8:15. They appear as small moons, giving off a cold, white, unchanging light. The three move off in a V formation and pace the ship for a short time. The lights continue their controlled flight as dusk turns to night. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 78)

* * *

June 20 — Mysterious radar echoes begin turning up on Bluff Hill, near Invercargill, New Zealand, for several months. The targets are visible from several minutes up to an hour and are located somewhere in the ionosphere. [Michael](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://adsabs.harvard.edu/full/2004JBAA..114...47G&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923096135&usg=AOvVaw1rm-0O5rnNlJ1UEVm4HXhi) [Gadsden](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://adsabs.harvard.edu/full/2004JBAA..114...47G&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923096384&usg=AOvVaw2ev6E7FPPbcElm-aSkHfcw) of the Imperial College in London is in New Zealand for the International Geophysical Year and he says the targets’ movements are unusual and suspects that ionized particles are the cause. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 81–82)

Summer — [P. Craig Phillips](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.researchgate.net/publication/306354070_P_Craig_Phillips_Aquarist_Author_and_Artist_1922-2009&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923097039&usg=AOvVaw2mYl-CQHHr8L3EB4Tmj_Sg)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.researchgate.net/publication/306354070_P_Craig_Phillips_Aquarist_Author_and_Artist_1922-2009&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923097321&usg=AOvVaw25glM4lL4QtcnZs2zYTBWn) curator of the Miami Seaquarium, and two other scientists witness a fall of angel hair for two hours as they are sailing northward toward the Florida Keys. Assuming them to be cobwebs from migrating airborne spiders, Phillips takes some samples and puts them in a mason jar. But when he uncaps the jar later in his office, no trace of the material is found, which is uncharacteristic of spider web. (UFOEv, [pp. 99–100](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D111%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923097592&usg=AOvVaw3KkVXZ_m8l0hg3JrByOYOL); Brian Boldman, “An Analysis of Angel Hair, 1947–2000,” IUR 26, no. 3 (Fall 2001): 15)

Summer — Early morning. Contactee [Trevor Constable](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trevor_James_Constable&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923097979&usg=AOvVaw1QeFbzaESuYzPd9hUnYfPW) and an associate named James Woods take many infrared photos of the desert sky over southern California. When developed, the film reveals a variety of shapes from vague blobs and amoeba-like forms to clearly defined discs. Constable calls them “critters” and thinks they are some kind of life form invisible to the naked eye. (Clark III 1102; Trevor James \[Constable\], They Live in the Sky, New Age, 1958)

Summer — Allan Haney and some friends “on a number of occasions” climb onto someone’s roof in Levelland, Texas, to watch 3–4 objects hovering over Reese AFB \[now Reese Technology Center\] in Lubbock, 26 miles to the east. (Donald R. Burleson, “Levelland, Texas, 1957: Case Reopened,” IUR 28, no. 1 (Spring 2003): 5)

July — The Air Defense Command disbands the 4602nd AISS and reassigns UFO investigative duties to the 1127th Field Activities Group of the 1006th AISS at Norton AFB \[San Bernardino International Airport\], California. Soon afterwards, the Air Force reduces funds for the unit, impairing its investigative ability. (Clark III 919)

July — NICAP publishes the first issue of The UFO Investigator. ([UFO Investigator](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/001%2520JULY%25201957.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923098735&usg=AOvVaw1IGmZVykT6Ri62ryXtaOdY) 1, no. 1 (July 1957); Clark III 793)

July — NICAP learns that the US Senate Subcommittee on Investigations is considering hearings on UFOs and wants its assistance. [Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923099206&usg=AOvVaw2CbhBaGRc21XkHDX-N0ir4) suggests withholding the best cases, at least initially. [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923099576&usg=AOvVaw2WpXVwa0uw0H72jW5pHR5A) asks [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923099964&usg=AOvVaw2iiRjrF47Cd1XcvyXCb-Za), who is now an engineer with Northrup Aircraft, to join the NICAP board at a rehearsal for the I’ve Got a Secret Show on which he is appearing. Ruppelt considers it an honor. (Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 70–79)

July 5 — During the 74-kiloton Plumbbob Hood nuclear test at the Nevada Test Site, the Marine Corps conducts a tactical maneuver involving the use of a helicopter airlift, tactical air support, and an amphibian tractor called the LVTP5. Despite the AEC’s assurance that no thermonuclear devices are being tested, Hood is thermonuclear and is the largest atmospheric test in the continental US. All Area 51 personnel are evacuated prior to the blast, but the military neglects to secure the sensitive information in the buildings with security guards. Seventy anesthetized Chester White pigs in military uniforms (as test fabrics) are placed in cages a short distance from ground zero.

Several types of wood houses are constructed to see how each handles the blast. The Mosler Safe Company sponsors the construction of a steel vault to withstand the blast. Some 100 soldiers, lying in trenches, are stationed to gauge the psychological impact of the bomb. The flash is visible from Canada to Mexico and 800 miles out in the Pacific. The blast wave reaches Los Angeles 25 minutes later. Afterwards, security guard [Richard Mingus](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Mingus&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923100914&usg=AOvVaw2RLz4IoL6CrfCrxBn2wTQ-) has to drive through a highly radioactive ground zero to reach the buildings at Area 51 ten miles away. Area 51 remains an evacuated ghost town until the summer of 1959. (Wikipedia, “[Desert Rock exercises](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desert_Rock_exercises&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923101289&usg=AOvVaw0a9oCC89V9dry2dRjsbr6g)”; Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 119–123](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/118/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923101716&usg=AOvVaw1085lps1A0x8Z3DOXMqgpC))

July 10 — [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923102225&usg=AOvVaw1tp4K67fP-SuGJfsjC6DnZ), exploring in Peru from his base at the Monastery of the Seven Rays and spurred by his own channelings, rediscovers a wall of petroglyphs \[now known as the Petroglyphs of Pusharo, in the Manú National Park\] in an area northeast of Cuzco called Cadena del Pantiacolla. (George Hunt Williamson, “[Project](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1957%252CNov-Dic%252CV%25203%252CN%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923102617&usg=AOvVaw06fGxMLqckMNDbShe0l2T4) [Scroll,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1957%252CNov-Dic%252CV%25203%252CN%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923102962&usg=AOvVaw0tHVsVRjUPXTDDbYDa1WrO)” Flying Saucer Review 3, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1957): 18–19; George Hunt Williamson, Road in the Sky, Neville Spearman, 1959; Brother Philip \[Williamson\], Secret of the Andes, Neville Spearman, 1961; Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, pp. 97–98, 109–115)

Mid-July — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923103883&usg=AOvVaw15eBHf9ds4IkEn-dO5SYhj) meets with US Rep. [James C. Healey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_C._Healey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923104258&usg=AOvVaw1GwxHEf1tpEy4C7snj45-q) (D-N.Y.) regarding USAF secrecy about UFOs. He shows Healey the 1949 Grudge report and apparently convinces him that the Air Force’s explanations for the 24 cases are “sheer speculation” or “deliberately fitted.” He also presents him Gen. [Joe W. Kelly](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_W._Kelly&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923104585&usg=AOvVaw0EAuiaTbkhTP9NG3lWhj0Y)’s April 8 letter to [Lee](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lee_Metcalf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923104779&usg=AOvVaw0J4lT3AcV_YVljMW3o7W_E) [Metcalf](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lee_Metcalf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923105061&usg=AOvVaw2OCfyc5evTknuB6cOvrnr1)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lee_Metcalf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923105297&usg=AOvVaw0kDeAQTeMgtEBg_BOjsGxs) indicating serious interest in UFOs. (Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 81–82, 91, 96)

July 16 — 1:56 p.m. 1st Lt. Clifford E. Pocock, scope operator A2C Walter Lyons, and control technician A1C Armand Therrien at Las Vegas Air Force Station \[now closed\] at Angel Peak, Nevada, are using the FPS-3A L-band search radar and track an inbound target at about 6,200 mph when it “stopped abruptly” and “remained stationary” for 12 seconds to the east-northeast 85 miles away to the north of Grand Canyon in Arizona. Then it heads outbound at about 7,000 mph before disappearing at the radar’s maximum range at 224 miles (near Marble

* * *

Canyon, Arizona). The target responds to encrypted military IFF transponder signals and transmits encrypted responses. (NICAP, “[6200 MPH Target Hovers near Grand Canyon](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570716lasvegas_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923106060&usg=AOvVaw2fFzaq7ZcAexvEDywUP-HZ)”; Sparks, p. 244)

July 17 — Before dawn. The crew of a USAF RB-47 reconnaissance aircraft is flying out of Forbes Field \[now Topeka Regional Airport\], Kansas, on an electronic warfare training flight over Mississippi, Louisiana, and Texas. The RB-47 is carrying a 6-man crew, of whom three are electronic warfare officers manning ECM gear in the aft portion of the aircraft. Their names are Lewis Dormon Chase, pilot; [James H. McCoid](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/71416736/james-harvey-mccoid&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923106915&usg=AOvVaw1HwnOMTCF0hVlfqsSTj4bc), copilot; Thomas H. Hanley, navigator; John J. Provenzano, No. 1 monitor; Frank B. McClure, No. 2 monitor; and [Walter A.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/40906934/walter-alex-tuchscherer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923107272&usg=AOvVaw2ZNI6perVe_AT0QjjO4kfj) [Tuchscherer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/40906934/walter-alex-tuchscherer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923107595&usg=AOvVaw0jK8U7an4mkmKeeTVlhs83)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/40906934/walter-alex-tuchscherer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923107886&usg=AOvVaw0NYde0xYxST6ECvGk_qlH-) No. 3 monitor. The crew detects on its Electronic Intelligence (ELINT) equipment an airborne radar source that mimics some but not all of the signal characteristics of a common air defense ground radar. Aircraft normally do not carry such high-powered radars. As the key ELINT officer on the RB-47 puts it, “an antenna bigger than the airplane” would be required to emit as strong a signal as he detected from the UFO. Because the UFO signal appears to have comparable or greater received signal strength than the one-megawatt ground radar beam and the UFOs distance is about 5 times closer than the ground radar, a crude estimate of the UFO radar power output using the inverse-square law would be about 40 kilowatts. The maneuvering radar signal coincides in location with a bright UFO. At times the signal moves ahead of the RB-47, then circles around as if airborne, highly maneuverable, and flying faster than the RB-47. The 55th Strategic Reconnaissance Wing Intelligence report states that the Wing’s director of intelligence “has no doubt the electronic D/F’s coincided exactly with visual observations by a/c numerous times thus indicating positively the object being the signal source.” An air defense radar station near Dallas, Texas, reportedly confirms tracking a UFO at the same location reported by the RB-47 crew but later tries to deny it in an unclassified message to ATIC. The UFO is reportedly tracked by the RB-47’s airborne navigation radar as well, though the crew has differing recollections on this point. Twice the UFO blinks out visually when pursued by the RB-47. At the same time the strange signal disappears, either that, or the ground radar site and the RB-47 onboard radar loses the object from their scopes. At least once, the UFO suddenly reappears visually at about the same time the ground radar regains tracking of the object. The main part of the incident occupies 30 minutes over the Fort Worth, Texas, area from 5:30–6:00 a.m. Some earlier ELINT and visual incidents are noted as early as about 4:30 a.m., but they catch the crew off guard, and consequently reports at the time and later recollections have had to be carefully reconstructed. The UFO may have trailed the RB-47 up to 6:40 a.m. following the main events, for a total duration of possibly more than 126 minutes. The RB

\-47 incident is the first conclusive instrumented proof for the existence of UFOs. Calibrations of the RB-47’s electronic measurements provide an irrefutable case. When the Colorado Project scientists asked the Air Force for the Blue Book file on the RB-47 case, the file could not be found. Ultimately, the case was put together by better file searching at Blue Book, [James E. McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923108651&usg=AOvVaw0rj3N1m-TZtsmS_P9G3TMt)’s success at locating several crew members and interviewing them, and FOIA searches that located more of the lost documents. Particularly in the [George T. Gregory](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/158570232/george-thurston-gregory&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923108911&usg=AOvVaw2gMTR-pCC27FFOsnnwFBqb) years at ATIC, this sort of rejection of the need to clarify almost any significant aspect of a UFO case was constant. If we did not know, from our earlier information, what Captain Gregory understood to be his duty as chief of Blue Book, we would label this as reckless and incompetent. Colorado project investigator [Gordon Thayer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/t/ThayerGordonD/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923109166&usg=AOvVaw3yFHImXc0zLiFTDfLZYCfa) declares the case unexplained, and later describes the official USAF explanation (airliner) as “literally ridiculous.” [Brad](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Brad_Sparks.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923109401&usg=AOvVaw0NrfV955_j84QFlb5-SyaZ) [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Brad_Sparks.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923109576&usg=AOvVaw3P-GkNfzSbpNefU4cPSaeG) sums it up in 1998 (and in 2018): “This case certainly now ranks as among the best documented unexplained UFO incidents in history, and it has the potential for further revealing disclosures if records of an extremely highly classified investigation can be found and released. All of the UFO observations by multiple visual observers, multiple ELINT receivers, and multiple radar sets, as well as the serendipitous calibrations of the UFO signals against the separately identifiable Duncanville radar signals, provide a unique, tight, interlocking web of intricately fitted evidence.” (NICAP, “[RB-47 Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570717RB47_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923109882&usg=AOvVaw0h9TbCiMdfkb0uKWVD1cRd)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923110061&usg=AOvVaw3LzliLpNPogF119bA2cnY2)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923110242&usg=AOvVaw0mcdfBizXyxKQ1FgkF7mk8) p. 244; Condon, [pp. 56,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/56/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923110436&usg=AOvVaw3a3YeoYgE-uo1HRY74zr85) [136–139,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/136/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923110631&usg=AOvVaw2WF_RY6UVoj5GJkmakulsC) [260–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/260/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923110910&usg=AOvVaw1UQVCRvCeTpMc2Ytwru149) [266](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/260/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923111227&usg=AOvVaw0xy99evqywkDFaBcnRA6Dq); James E. McDonald, “[The 1957 Gulf Coast RB-47 Incident,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923111504&usg=AOvVaw20yjYHuHnU8R_bJ9gMr47A)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 3 (May/June 1970): 2–6; Gert Herb, “A Rebuttal to Philip J. Klass’s Analysis of the RB-47 Incident of July 17, 1957,” CUFOS Bulletin, Summer 1977, pp. 3–10; Philip J. Klass, \[response to Gert Herb\], CUFOS Bulletin, Fall 1977, pp. 7–10; Gert Herb, “Gert Herb Replies,” CUFOS Bulletin, Fall 1977, pp. 9–10; Swords 248–249; Loren E. Gross, [The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-May-24-July-31.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923112347&usg=AOvVaw3RkntyS3xybcuHCdPKfXWA) [Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957 May 24th–July 31st](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-May-24-July-31.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923112714&usg=AOvVaw3dOUf3UE1bNeMuInT59YTf)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-May-24-July-31.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923113018&usg=AOvVaw1-9tKLMyhM8doAQRDQ_53q) The Author, 1996, pp. 64–71; Center for UFO Studies, \[[case interviews](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/cases/1957_07_17_US_MI-LA-TX-OK_AirCraft-RB-47_McDonald_Chase-McCoid-Hanley-Provensano-McClure-Tuchscherer.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923113608&usg=AOvVaw02coSpnZaBanblrAFVq5AO)\]; Center for UFO Studies, \[[case documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/cases/1957_07_17_US_MI-LA-TX-OK_AirCraft-RB-47_NICAP_Chase-McCoid-Hanley-Provensano-McClure-Tuchscherer.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923114073&usg=AOvVaw3M1xIyXwmBBjpe-OONyuuq)\]; Center for UFO Studies, \[more case documents\]; UFOs Yes, 126–127; Clark III 953–999)

July 17 — Flight 655 en route from Dallas to Los Angeles, piloted by Capt. Ed Bachner, has a near collision with an object “at least the size of a B-47” over the salt flats some 100 miles east of El Paso, Texas. Bachner puts the plane into a dive and the object passes only 50 feet above them. Two passengers suffer slight injuries and are taken to the hospital on landing. No known aircraft are in the vicinity. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 79; Good Above, [p. 283](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/282/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923114870&usg=AOvVaw1pC0GmAjtKA6He1chRju79))

* * *

July 18 — 10:46 p.m. Capt. Claiborne F. Bickham and a radar crew at Mount Lemmon Air Force Station \[now closed\] northeast of Tucson, Arizona, using both MPS-7 L-band search and MPS-14 S-band height-finder radars, track a stationary target at 42,000 feet to the northwest about 82 miles away south of Chandler. The target responds to encrypted military IFF Mode 3 transponder signals and transmits encrypted responses that result in “normal Mode 3 paint” on radar scopes. A very slight strobe comes from the object that appears like ECM jamming. (NICAP, “[Ground Radar Track Responds to IFF Mode 3](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570718MtLemmon_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923115500&usg=AOvVaw3eWwCT-4Y7rHwLsTiH3hrq)”; Sparks, p. 245)

July 19 — The Plumbbob John nuclear test at Yucca Flats, Nevada, is the only test of the Air Force’s AIR-2 Genie missile with a nuclear warhead. On the ground, the Air Force carries out a public relations event by having five Air Force officers and a videographer stand under ground zero of the blast, which takes place at between 18,500 and 20,000 feet altitude, with the idea of demonstrating the possibility of the use of the weapon over civilian populations without ill effects. (Wikipedia, “[Operation Plumbbob](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Plumbbob&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923116855&usg=AOvVaw3KVbSk6BKM560tmGuZM-y9)”)

July 22 — Night. Capt. G. M. Schemel, the pilot of a TWA Constellation aircraft, is flying at 18,000 feet near Amarillo, Texas, when a big red and green light bears down on his plane in a collision course. He puts the aircraft into a dive and the object passes above him. Schemel has to make an unscheduled landing at Amarillo to hospitalize one passenger who is injured during the maneuver. (“[Kenosha Pilot Tells of Mysterious Object,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/100127421/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923117395&usg=AOvVaw0KuLuQ1xvQhIXXi5resOo7)” Kenosha (Wis.) News, July 24, 1957, p. 1)

July 24 — Russian antiaircraft batteries on the Kuril Islands, Sakhalin Oblast, Russia, in the Pacific Ocean open fire on luminous, fast-moving UFOs. No hits are made. The US claims it has no aircraft in the area. However, at 10:00 a.m., two USAF pilots flying F-86s are scrambled to intercept a disc-shaped object over the Nemuro Strait, north of Hokkaido, Japan, that is tracked by ground radar and seen by ground witnesses. (Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, [p. 42](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/42/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923117995&usg=AOvVaw1Mtvuf_k0N0I58FClcziGV); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923118179&usg=AOvVaw1gwym1cVAa1ID43SmtEY4K), p. 245)

July 24 — White Sands Missile Flight Safety Director [Nathan Wagner](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.wsmr-history.org/HallOfFame52.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923118425&usg=AOvVaw1nBgh56qjMESNkbqKl2g3q) is driving with his wife [Alma](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/106431664/alma-s_-wagner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923118642&usg=AOvVaw24P56EDs-_AJyOuxEm0KNv) south of Las Cruces, New Mexico, when they see a large, fast object at high altitude moving east toward the Organ Mountains. They watch it for 30 seconds until it disappears. (“[Space Vehicles Sighted?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/100129577/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923118954&usg=AOvVaw1jK-D0Wj9cJbacVIY3r_uR)” El Paso (Tex.) Times, July 30, 1957, p. 1; NICAP, “[Missile Safety Chief Says Object Unknown](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570724lascruces_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923119233&usg=AOvVaw1AE35h9ZIDULM0_kG0qHSW)”)

July 25 — 4:00 a.m. Several workers are taking a break at the Daye Steel Plant in Huangshi, Hubei, China, when they hear a humming sound. They notice a bright spot in the clear sky that is increasing in apparent size. As it comes closer, it is seen as a circular plate giving off a dazzling white light and leaving a white trail. It flies above the observers at an altitude of 3,300 feet and produces a whistling sound that is louder than a jet. As the object approaches the witnesses, the low pitch changes to a high pitch. (Wendelle Stevens and Paul Dong, UFOs over Modern China, UFO Photo Archives, 1983)

July 28 — A Douglas Aircraft Company employee named Edward K. Current Jr. makes an emergency landing on the former U-2 airstrip at Groom Lake, Nevada. He claims he has been on a cross-country training flight when he became lost and ran low on fuel. The area is still evacuated for nuclear testing. (Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 125–126](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/124/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923120000&usg=AOvVaw0PJzf1xLLtb31HgxUC3i1S); T. D. Barnes, “[False Emergency Landings at Groom Lake,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://roadrunnersinternationale.com/coldwarstories/gl_emergencies.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923120394&usg=AOvVaw0RHFSx6YR7w73cgYWAB9xn)” Roadrunners Internationale, November 22, 2021)

July 30 — 10:30 a.m. Jack Stephenson is walking his dog four miles south of Galt, Ontario, when he sees an aluminum- colored object with a dome. It circles, stops, and hovers, then lands in a gulley surrounded by woods. He watches it for 45 minutes as it hovers about 2 feet off the ground. It finally takes off at a 45° angle to avoid a power line, then shoots away. Local residents examine the area and find burned patches on the ground and small tree limbs that are broken. There are four burned or charred areas, each about 1 foot 3 inches in diameter, forming a four- sided figure with these measurements: 20 feet x 20 feet x 6.5 feet x 11.5 feet. Two large three-toed prints are also found, but the relationship of the prints to the object is unknown. (“[Boy Reports ‘Saucer,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/96057701/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923120994&usg=AOvVaw2ZJlbr4krzWcYzKuKCZQna)” Brantford (Ont.) Expositor, August 3, 1957, p. 1; “[Says He Saw Flying Saucer for 45 Minutes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://redstarfilms.blogspot.com/2015/03/galt-ontario-ufo-sighting-1957.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923121518&usg=AOvVaw2MkwrcmXLYRpqaz_PgDS-1)” Milk River (Alberta) Review, August 25, 1957; Donald E. Keyhoe and Gordon I. R. Lore Jr., [Strange Effects from UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923122071&usg=AOvVaw21dvvQQFNFJgkPYjFOOemx)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923122405&usg=AOvVaw3K39RKIjoRDnHf9gaAGb2i) NICAP, 1969, pp.

51–53)

August — Radar technician [Edward Lovick Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/182829326/edward-lovick&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923123179&usg=AOvVaw16yrFJKFg3R4SWdEZ6wyFQ) begins work at Lockheed’s secret Advanced Development Projects facility (the Skunk Works) in Burbank, California. His first assignment is to investigate radar-deflecting technology for the U-2 aircraft. (Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 126–127](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/126/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923123685&usg=AOvVaw2Ab0JNRZTChZrOBUS9cPPy))

August — Night. A young woman is driving home after work in Peru, Indiana, and notices people standing along the road looking at the sky. She stops, and they point to a large black object hovering above some nearby trees at about 100 feet. It is about 1,000 feet long and has a “soft delta” shape with rounded corners and window-like lighted areas underneath. There seems to be movement within the lighted areas. In the middle of the bottom is a round area that looks like it might be the outline of an entryway. It moves slowly away, making a noise like a quiet vacuum cleaner. (Michael D. Swords, “Timmerman’s Triangles,” IUR 29, no. 2 (Summer 2004): 16)

* * *

August 1 — The North American Air Defense Command is announced by the US Joint Chiefs of Staff. (Wikipedia, “[North American Aerospace Defense Command](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_American_Aerospace_Defense_Command&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923124431&usg=AOvVaw31IdgOSe8wwR4pPH734M7E)”)

August 3 — 7:45 p.m. 1st Lt. Robert J. Springer Jr., T/Sgt. [Herman L. Giles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/146765909/herman-low_rance-giles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923124743&usg=AOvVaw3hySPhc6NiePl0aVHsrXkk), and 16 other air crewmen, while on routine Airborne Operations Center radar early warning patrol over the Pacific Ocean about 175 miles southwest of San Francisco, California, aboard an RC-121D aircraft, detect a radar target on IFF Mode 2 transponder only. At 7:56 p.m., the IFF target becomes a direct radar “skinpaint.” At 8:02 p.m., the IFF equipment APX-6/APX-7 is turned off, but the target is still tracked on airborne radar. At 8:15 p.m., the target is at a 2 o’clock position 10 miles away when the aircraft starts a right turn to reverse course, putting the target dead ahead. It suddenly takes off to the northwest at very high speed, disappearing 58 miles away. Radar contact is regained at 8:18 p.m. as the target is tracked moving right to left, crossing in front of the aircraft again, and closing distance to 8 miles at 11 o’clock. At 8:20 p.m., the target turns to head on a parallel path. The crew loses contact at 8:24 p.m., 15 miles behind the plane. No visual confirmation. (NICAP, “[RC-121D Has IFF Radar Targets](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570803sanfrancisco_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923125042&usg=AOvVaw0VapKKyrOGVv17mejfFU_i)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923125253&usg=AOvVaw2rytmGkxAFy_d6bYLy3KTO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923125399&usg=AOvVaw2SGTtpN_56zmAkEsj8bwR3) p. 246)

August 4 — An Italian Air Force noncommissioned officer on duty in the control tower at Naples International Airport, Italy, and about 30 other witnesses see a number of luminous, disc-shaped objects passing above them. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 80)

August 5 — 10:00 p.m. Policeman Ernst W. Akerberg and his wife Karin are at their summer cottage on the island of Gotland, Sweden, in the Baltic Sea when they see a disc-shaped object heading toward them from the sea. When it reaches the shore about 600 feet away, the object changes course and executes a sharp turn at less than 90° of arc and turns on its edge, swaying briefly. The disc moves toward the southeast and makes another sharp turn just over a half-mile away, again turning on its edge and fluttering before passing out of view. A second, smaller object approaches and goes through the same maneuvers. Air currents from both objects make the water surface ripple and the treetops swing. Estimated to be about 80 feet in diameter, the objects seem to be made of shining metal, and the upper part rotates slowly over the lower part. Both objects have a kind of tube with two red lights. They are silent except for a hollow clicking sound. (Story, [pp. 152–153](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/152/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923126321&usg=AOvVaw1v7RXFmzxXF-m6C0gnr6H5); Clas Svahn, “[1957 Diskusarna svängde](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufo.se/index.php/svenska-rapporter/1294-diskusarna-svangde-framfor-polismannen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923126713&usg=AOvVaw1wXysOTaIe9J9_1XT4fK-J) [framför polismannen,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufo.se/index.php/svenska-rapporter/1294-diskusarna-svangde-framfor-polismannen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923127120&usg=AOvVaw0lWSKeLBUO4w1VuahWo2Ut)” Riksorganisationen UFO-Sverige)

August 14 — 8:55 p.m. Varig Airlines pilot Capt. Jorgé Campos Araujo and First Officer Edgar Onofre Soares observe a domed disc pacing their C-47 cargo plane at 6,300 feet over Joinville, Santa Catarina, Brazil. The UFO speeds up and crosses just in front of them, hovers briefly, then dives into the undercast at 5,700 feet. When the object hovers, it affects the engines, which cough and wheeze, and dims the cabin lights. (UFOEv, [p. 120](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D133%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923127705&usg=AOvVaw21EkYreqzsWqMdbGyj2YsV); Olavo T. Fontes, “[Top Secret Report Unveiled,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201959%252009%252000%2520-%2520September.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923128166&usg=AOvVaw0ByZPi82fCLrNqDotiYbWR)” APRO Bulletin, September 1959, pp. 1, 5; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923128609&usg=AOvVaw1PzOaXHmCq85mgRVb564Jl), pp. 123–127; Loren

E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957 August–September, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Aug-Sept-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923129117&usg=AOvVaw24bT70TzlGNN-1vcqmBEJ3)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Aug-Sept-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923129385&usg=AOvVaw1VnokfZyAZYr9Kp_MKEYkc)

The Author, 2003, pp. 11–13; Lorenzen, FS Hoax, [pp. 153–155](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/1966CoralLorenzenFlyingSaucersTheStartlingEvidenceOfTheInvasionFromOuterSpacenotOCR/page/n159/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923129985&usg=AOvVaw3ObVcdtFQ72dke7dVIGrBA))

August 20 — 11:28 a.m. Shinichi Takeda takes a photo of a silvery disc near Enoshima Beach, Kanagawa, Japan. The object is also seen by his sister, who calls his attention to it. It gives off a brilliant glow at an estimated altitude of 3,000–4,000 feet, traveling north to south. The object makes a 90° left turn, speeds up, and disappears in the clouds. The photo shows capsule-shaped image near bank of cumulus clouds. A few minutes later, 15 people on the beach report a similar object that passes over at high speed. (NICAP, “[Capsule-Shaped Object in Clouds /](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570820japan_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923130421&usg=AOvVaw0Kb8KEuXo4BfbLmi0ccquH) [Takeda Photo](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570820japan_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923130701&usg=AOvVaw0gyDUAQbpJyJscrjBkqVmL)”)

August 20 or 22 — A member of the Argentine Air Force guarding a downed aircraft is in a tent near Quilinos, Córdoba, Argentina, when he hears a high-pitched hum. Dashing out, he sees a disc slowly descending, making the grass and plants flutter wildly. Reaching for his revolver, he feels that something is preventing him from drawing his weapon, which seems glued in his holster. A voice from the disc tells him in Spanish that spacecraft have a base in the Salta region and that they are here to warn about nuclear energy. The craft rises vertically and speeds off to the north. Probable hoax. (“[UFO Bases in South America?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CJul-Aug%252CV%252011%252CN%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923131305&usg=AOvVaw0CEIL1jgtZJzj6Grqpz2bH)” Flying Saucer Review 11, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1965): 30– 31; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1957-08-20-argentina-quilino.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923131634&usg=AOvVaw3Qt4aee1EtnOri7r4NuPH1)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1957-08-20-argentina-quilino.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923131799&usg=AOvVaw1a4Jy1go4b74gE03y23zTC) December 8, 2006)

August 22 — 3:40 p.m. A couple named Sheetz in a car at Naval Air Station Cecil \[now Cecil Airport\] in Jacksonville, Florida, chase a 50-foot, black, rotating, bell-shaped object bearing two bright white lights at the top. Their engine stalls when object hovers 10 feet away. Its underside resembles a disc with fins. When a jet takes off from the airfield, the object goes out of sight almost instantly. The car battery is completely dead. Noise from the object is compared to a helicopter, although there are no helicopters in the area.
