(NICAP, “[Car Chases Bell-Shaped Object,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570827cecil_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923132221&usg=AOvVaw3jmZYsr_-lOqHNiTYYz3cQ) [Engine Stalls](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570827cecil_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923132402&usg=AOvVaw2fHWWs2Hx5VWUSSnQfejUL)”; Mark Rodeghier, [UFO Reports Involving Vehicle Interference](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/books/UFO_REPORTS_INVOLVING_VEHICLE_INTERFERENCE.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923132726&usg=AOvVaw1SzGoo0n32M84TaYLxFaFg)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/books/UFO_REPORTS_INVOLVING_VEHICLE_INTERFERENCE.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923133030&usg=AOvVaw1jqS402O4nLIvZYU8Kusk3) CUFOS, 1981, p. 7)

August 27 — Russia makes the first successful long flight of an ICBM, the R-7 Semyorka, from the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan. The dummy warhead lands in the Pacific Ocean. (Wikipedia, “[R-7 Semyorka](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R-7_Semyorka&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923133595&usg=AOvVaw0-7x6St7dzgKBRWL3QL3xK)”)

August 30 — Night. A Capital Airlines pilot is flying a Viscount at 12,000 feet approaching Norfolk, Virginia, with a Northeast Airlines DC-6 directly above on the same heading at 20,000 feet. The Viscount pilot sees a brilliant object that “flew fast and then abruptly halted 20 miles in front of us at 60,000 feet altitude.” The Northeast pilot

* * *

tries to acquire the object on radar. With the antenna at 0° elevation, nothing is detected, but with the antenna elevated to 15° he acquires “an excellent blip right where I told him to look for the object.” According to the Viscount pilot, the object “dissolved right in front of my eyes, and the crew above lost it from the scope at the same time. They said it just faded away.” The entire incident lasts several minutes. (NICAP, “[Two Aircraft](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570830chesapeake_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923134240&usg=AOvVaw0XdrVnEnq9jlANWVC05lAN) [Observe Object / Excellent Blip on Radar](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570830chesapeake_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923134462&usg=AOvVaw0e4RNMwAQAsZ8kuApD_3KY)”; Condon, [pp. 128–129](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/128/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923134764&usg=AOvVaw0QXJpf7X_WSqb4gl3VR9M_))

August 31 — After nuclear test Plumbbob Smokey, Army troops conduct an airlift assault. (Wikipedia, “[Desert Rock](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desert_Rock_exercises&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923135146&usg=AOvVaw0NH3VipfHn7TDmlUnwlgMC) [exercises](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desert_Rock_exercises&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923135414&usg=AOvVaw2fk8CHU4yvUChBPcjdwqrW)”)

August 31 — Sen. [Barry Goldwater](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barry_Goldwater&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923135873&usg=AOvVaw1xM12hkbYzhfyWpYIP8QZp) (R-Ariz.) sends a letter to a constituent about UFOs, saying, “I, frankly, feel that there is a great deal to this.” (UFOEv, [p. 173](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D185%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923136321&usg=AOvVaw3k8J6YRSr1peXTEnCKQg0K))

September — Soviet defector [Nikolai Khokhlov](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nikolai_Khokhlov&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923136871&usg=AOvVaw0up1yYfd0DOR7MYcDmGqOk) suffers a sudden and severe illness while attending an anti-Communist meeting in Frankfurt, Germany. He is treated for thallium poisoning and survives. This case is often claimed to be the first radiological attack by the KGB, especially when compared to the poisoning of [Alexander Litvinenko](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexander_Litvinenko&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923137305&usg=AOvVaw1ieN_V_1OBEGUF49nn5wNW) in 2006, although it remains unclear what isotope was used, if any. Former KGB officer Stanislav Lekarev claims, however, that Khokhlov is poisoned by radioactive polonium (not thallium), exactly as Litvinenko is later.

Litvinenko’s poisoning is also initially mistaken for thallium. A unique mechanism for administering poison is described by a knowledgeable source at the time as a pneumatically operated poison ice “atomizer” that leaves no wound or other evidence of the cause of death. (Wikipedia, “[Nikolai Khokhlov](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nikolai_Khokhlov%23Poisoning_by_thallium&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923137948&usg=AOvVaw06g1zQgTYZu2XtKOmC9vlb)”; Andy Wright, “[The Russian Spy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atlasobscura.com/articles/nikolai-khokhlov-kgb-paranormal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923138339&usg=AOvVaw3l1ChA0sqJDhHDS6ztW7FY) [Who Convinced America to Take ESP Seriously,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atlasobscura.com/articles/nikolai-khokhlov-kgb-paranormal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923138710&usg=AOvVaw1tAE039GVyH7tMuDxutigN)” Atlas Obscura, January 13, 2017; Christopher Andrew and Vasili Mitrokhin, [The Sword and the Shield: The Mitrokhin Archive and the Secret History of the KGB](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/swordshieldmitro0000andr_q5i4/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923139122&usg=AOvVaw2px4lIYoo9M0mvKeWOQ2EL)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/swordshieldmitro0000andr_q5i4/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923139400&usg=AOvVaw0fqevIAkOAAb6pg490kZ7o) Basic Books, 1999; David Kurlander, “[Ending in a Fall: America’s Response to the Poisoning of Soviet Defector](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://cafe.com/article/ending-in-a-fall-americas-response-to-the-poisoning-of-soviet-defector-nikolai-khokhlov/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923139859&usg=AOvVaw0HW8GK_Y23MG8Mw0mSPPf7) [Nikolai Khokhlov,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://cafe.com/article/ending-in-a-fall-americas-response-to-the-poisoning-of-soviet-defector-nikolai-khokhlov/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923140125&usg=AOvVaw3Xq5h6XDd-JHg8Ypj7X_dz)” Café, September 3, 2020)

Early September — Several people fishing near Ubatuba, São Paulo, Brazil, watch a disc dive down from the sky and explode, showering the area with flaming fragments. One of the witnesses writes an anonymous letter and sends three pieces to O Globo, but no witnesses to the event have ever come forward. APRO representative [Olavo T.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201968%252005%252000%2520-%2520May-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923140550&usg=AOvVaw27o2GcH1l9_lGE5EaO_WMg) [Fontes](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201968%252005%252000%2520-%2520May-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923140795&usg=AOvVaw0BFK6Sn8pkHGNi5Jm_zY4S) examines the fragments, which are dull gray, irregular, and strongly oxidized. One sample is shot through with microscopic cracks and shows a fissure running through two-thirds of its length. All three have whitish smears of a powdery substance like cinders. Fontes takes one sample to the Mineral Production Laboratory of the Ministry of Agriculture for analysis, which shows it to be “magnesium of a high degree of purity.” Chemist Luisa Maria A. Barbosa, who conducts a spectrographic analysis, says that not even trace elements are apparent. Fontes also has it analyzed by chemist Elson Teixeira and the Brazilian Army. The Laboratory of Crystallography conducts some X-ray diffraction work. All conclude that the material is pure magnesium, while one gives it a density of 1.866 (normal magnesium is 1.741). APRO sends a second fragment to the US Air Force, which accidentally destroys it. The third sample is sent to the Colorado Project in February 1968. [Roy Craig](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.iowastatedaily.com/news/ufo-investigator-isu-alumnus-dead/article_d3e1f4e4-28e6-5600-bff7-846c287c3b6b.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923141306&usg=AOvVaw0siTP-mDlSgn_gERszZm9H) runs tests on it at the Alcohol and Tobacco Tax Division of the IRS in Washington and Dow Chemical’s Metallurgical Laboratory. Both determine that the level of purity is not as high as was determined in 1957 (although this is now seen as a major misrepresentation of the actual results). APRO does two further tests with University of Arizona metallurgical engineer Walter A. Walker and Robert W. Johnson of the Materials Research Corporation at Orangeburg, New Jersey. Walker and Johnson both find that the sample “had undergone a directional crystal growth type of manufacture.” Walker concludes that the material was likely exposed to the earth’s atmosphere at elevated temperatures. Researchers [Brad Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Brad_Sparks.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923141750&usg=AOvVaw0okFPaumfdx72Dv4nmrFsM) and [Michael Swords](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_D._Swords&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923142097&usg=AOvVaw2G-utlQQLjIOlTx3OYwNR7) examine Roy Craig’s [archived original](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://legacy.lib.utexas.edu/taro/tamucush/00151/tamu-00151.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923142470&usg=AOvVaw2FGMlwx3RbuMjg0WbMu3Ah) [notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://legacy.lib.utexas.edu/taro/tamucush/00151/tamu-00151.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923142777&usg=AOvVaw3_L1KUjjgHOhES7du7dcaY) from the Colorado Project and find that the team had covered up the fact that an abnormal concentration of magnesium isotope Mg-26 had indeed been found and knowingly misrepresented the sample to APRO as “essentially the same as terrestrial magnesium,” blaming them for cherry-picking the Brazilian lab results. [Peter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_A._Sturrock&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923143266&usg=AOvVaw0xPiksjvLc9y1n-8F1I6GG)

[A. Sturrock](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_A._Sturrock&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923143591&usg=AOvVaw3O4sNb-a_Krlpcug1Rl6Zl) acquires the remnant of the samples from APRO and performs further analysis on two of them in 1997. In 2018, Michael Swords and [Robert Powell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufocongress.com/robert-powell-2/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923143851&usg=AOvVaw0HQr857I5jIjE7ccAWtd_9) borrow one Ubatuba sample from Sturrock and arrange for further tests at an accredited lab, finding variations well outside the normal range for magnesium, strontium, copper, and barium. (NICAP, “[The Ubatuba Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/5709XXubatuba_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923144145&usg=AOvVaw3DUZOuMuwG9VYKAVyZBx1k)”; “[Physical Evidence,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201960%252003%252000%2520-%2520March.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923144391&usg=AOvVaw1yJGfvMA8OIjhgEZ_Wkbbf)” APRO Bulletin, March 1960, pp. 1, 3; Olavo T. Fontes, “[A Report on the Investigation of Magnesium Samples from a UFO Explosion over the Sea in](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/ubatubatd.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923144678&usg=AOvVaw3l9KtpSxGRupRAFBzhAa2G) [the Ubatuba Region of Brazil,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/ubatubatd.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923144869&usg=AOvVaw2lDW5kVhj6--mAjhLiS8bP)” 1962; Lorenzen, FS Hoax, [pp. 104–145](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/1966CoralLorenzenFlyingSaucersTheStartlingEvidenceOfTheInvasionFromOuterSpacenotOCR/page/n101/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923145140&usg=AOvVaw0aZiTyzK_V_txB9wZ3u-Nh); Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 212–216; Condon, [pp. 94–97](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/94/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923145410&usg=AOvVaw0I0iCtFQHuGAteAJTC_QK3), [257–260](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/256/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923145600&usg=AOvVaw3nzdxWwCGEewLSANX2sLBX); Michael D. September — 3:00 p.m. Hélio Penteado and his foreman Zaca Sabiá are repairing a fence on Penteado’s farm in Campinas, São Paulo, Brazil, when Sabiá’s dog begins growling at something in the mint field. They hear a loud, irritating sound and see a disc about 50 feet wide landing in the field and supported by three legs with spheres on the end that pierce the ground. Penteado goes closer to investigate and sees two beings about 4 feet tall leave the UFO wearing green coveralls. They seem to float along the ground and take a vessel from under the craft. One of them is carrying something like a gun or flamethrower. They pass through a fence on the way to a river. After 10 minutes the beings return with the vessel apparently full of river water. The entity with the flamethrower shoots it at a jacaranda tree and a eucalyptus tree, damaging their trunks. They reenter the object via the dome, which takes off toward the city. Back at his barn, Penteado notices that all his metallic tools are stacked in a cone, the birds are dead, his monkey is agitated, and his watch has stopped working. The same day, people observe a UFO over a hospital on the Avenida Julio Mesqita, where the object dumps two drops of liquid metal that falls in the street.

The UFO goes so low that it hits the corner of a parked truck. An analysis of the metal by an unnamed organization (possibly the Brazilian Air Force) shows that the metal is high in magnesium. Penteado later goes to the landing site and takes plaster casts of the footprints, which he sends to the Agronomy Institute of Campinas. (“[Caso do disco proximo de Campinas,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Brazil/SBEDV/SBEDV%2520-%2520No%2520014%2520-%25201960.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923148058&usg=AOvVaw0OoMIzXxkeuLP5bnvmi3GC)” Boletim SBEDV, no. 14 (March 1, 1960): 1–3; Brazil 35–37)

September 2 — After the Plumbbob Galileo nuclear shot at the Nevada Test Site, Army troops are tested to determine their psychological reactions to witnessing the nuclear detonation. (Wikipedia, “[Desert Rock exercises](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desert_Rock_exercises&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923148438&usg=AOvVaw2QOwQHrAKB9xj4guj3XOdk)”)

September 4 — Four Portuguese jet fighter-bombers under the command of Capt. [José Lemos Ferreira](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%25C3%25A9_Lemos_Ferreira&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923148727&usg=AOvVaw0U39KZvxAEdA7215SfWsv6) are flying at night at 24,600 feet between Ota, Portugal, and Granada, Spain. Near Granada they turn to head to Portalegre, Portugal. At this point, Ferreira notices a UFO like a bright star with a scintillating, colored nucleus that changes from deep green to blue. The object suddenly grows to 5 or 6 times its original size, then shrinks to a barely visible yellow point. These changes repeat several times, possibly due to changes in position. The UFO maintains its position 90° to the left of the squadron. Suddenly a small circle of yellow light emerges from the object and three smaller yellow objects appear, maneuver, then disappear. (NICAP, “[Portuguese Air Force Jets Have 40-Min. Encounter /](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570904portugal_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923149032&usg=AOvVaw3nyTsOhEf-NEbntM9aVgD-) [E-M](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570904portugal_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923149244&usg=AOvVaw0O6SRjDyqkrl-sGKr_Nxg7)”; Marciano Alves, “[Air Force Pilots Spend 40 Minutes with Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CMay-Jun%252CV%25204%252CN%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923149511&usg=AOvVaw1BKTAlo-fAk453QCt-GsjV)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 3 (May/June 1958): 2–3; Good Above, [pp. 147–148](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/146/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923149799&usg=AOvVaw3HqVnBW-CBm9c-dfn1YsZ5); Kean, [p. 50](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/isbn_9780307716842/page/50/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923150049&usg=AOvVaw2dhYzl-BDI4xjVntceBGgy))

September 12 — NORAD’s command headquarters is established at Ent Air Force Base in Colorado Springs, Colorado. Canada and the United States agree that the NORAD commander will always be a US officer, with a Canadian vice commander, and Canada “agreed the command’s primary purpose would be…early warning and defense for SAC’s retaliatory forces.” Every continental US military radar UFO case in the Blue Book files from now on is a NORAD case because the subordinate USAF Air Defense Command belongs to NORAD. (Clark III 801; Wikipedia, “[North American Aerospace Defense Command](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_American_Aerospace_Defense_Command&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923150562&usg=AOvVaw1_Yir_9m8yOePUxdkPXnIy)”)

September 16 — ATIC briefs [Howard P. Robertson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_P._Robertson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923150807&usg=AOvVaw2ba6RY0kUlQL2Dhy7LmXCS)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_P._Robertson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923150987&usg=AOvVaw0O8zGMLjkR0EugSqB_C9QF) now chairman of the Defense Science Board, on Project Blue Book, presumably because he wants to find out how the Air Force is implementing the recommendations of the 1953 Robertson Panel. The briefing book (including Special Report no. 14 as well as reports on [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923151389&usg=AOvVaw2or9_9GWwGYo3WuMcZlM0T) and the UFO movie) is delivered by the Pentagon’s Maj. James F. Byrne. (Swords 265–266)

September 19 — The Plumbbob Rainier nuclear shot at the Nevada Test Site is the first fully contained underground nuclear test, meaning that no fission products are vented into the atmosphere. This test of 1.7 kilotons can be detected around the world by seismologists using ordinary seismic instruments. (Wikipedia, “[Operation](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Plumbbob&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923151930&usg=AOvVaw0m_aKnDmuBHISUZ_mDEROu) [Plumbbob](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Plumbbob&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923152155&usg=AOvVaw2efeX3_9_knFUacpyvYeuU)”)

September 20 — 3:05 p.m. A national defense alert is called when the first of two or three supersonic objects, varying in speed for the next 30 minutes from 800 to 12,000 mph and varying in altitude from 50,000 to 135,000 feet, is picked up over the Atlantic by NORAD radar at Montauk, New York. A second (or same) UFO heads straight toward SAC headquarters in Omaha, Nebraska, in what is perceived as a threat trajectory potentially aiming for a nuclear knockout kill of the entire US nuclear force. At 3:10 p.m., interception is attempted by two F-102 jets from Kinross AFB \[now Chippewa County International Airport\] south of Sault Ste. Marie, Michigan, and later from Truax AFB \[now Truax Field Air National Guard Base\] northeast of Madison, Wisconsin. At 3:24 p.m., another UFO joins the first on a similar trajectory 150 miles behind. It passes over Ontario, Michigan, Illinois, and Iowa. The UFO sends radio replies to IFF interrogation signals, on different frequencies, confirming its location on the radar plots and making it impossible to explain as a malfunction or interference. Interception is impossible at these speeds and altitudes. SAC goes on high alert and apparently launches nuclear bombers toward

* * *

Russia, but the alert is called off when the UFOs disappear. NORAD triggers a White House alert. High-level meetings of CIA and USAF intelligence, and the Intelligence Advisory Committee meet in executive session. The CIA Director of the Office of Scientific Intelligence, [Herbert Scoville Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://scoville.org/herbert-scoville-jr/biography/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923152670&usg=AOvVaw1OScs9C00NWPBQJzxZWk_v)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://scoville.org/herbert-scoville-jr/biography/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923152874&usg=AOvVaw0Yv9NPbJEYaCIVLS_coHSz) suggests that the object might be a maneuverable Soviet cruise missile, but that is not yet in the Soviet inventory. President [Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923153074&usg=AOvVaw0jcipnKg6DOtXYhozUmnaI) is briefed multiple times. One year later, NORAD still cannot identify any malfunction that could possibly make the radar targets agree with the IFF signals. (NICAP, “[Multiple Radars Track 4,500 MPH Target](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/570920montauk_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923153317&usg=AOvVaw23in3p4HVgwTcRI14eBB0n)”; Clark III 802–804, 814– 824; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923153490&usg=AOvVaw28do7KDfvc0pqN8qLEwjKA)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923153614&usg=AOvVaw0LTpRks85sB1a3n_063AQ8) pp. 249–250; Swords 266–267)

September 29 — 4:20 p.m. A nuclear waste storage tank explodes spontaneously at the Mayak plutonium production site (Chelyabinsk-40) for nuclear weapons and fuel reprocessing at Ozyorsk, Chelyabinsk Oblast, Russia. It launches a kilometer-tall pillar of dust and smoke into the sky. Gray radioactive ash and debris settles over the industrial zone. There are no immediate fatalities, though up to 200+ additional cancer deaths perhaps ensue from the radioactive contamination of some 20,000 square miles; 270,000 people are exposed to dangerous radiation levels. Over 30 small communities are removed from Soviet maps between 1958 and 1991. (Wikipedia, “[Kyshtym disaster](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyshtym_disaster&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923153978&usg=AOvVaw3yUkCciqjFK5YuJcRryoFr)”)

October — [Leonard H. Stringfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923154267&usg=AOvVaw2ssLfs_fWVuphtJkp1gKoX) privately publishes Inside Saucer Post…3-0 Blue that summarizes his early years as a UFO investigator and as director of Civilian Research, Interplanetary Flying Objects. (Leonard H. Stringfield, [Inside Saucer Post…3-0 Blue](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/3-0Blue/InsidesaucerPost3-0Blue.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923154606&usg=AOvVaw1_TKBGdpXWuElj5OrDqzWY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/3-0Blue/InsidesaucerPost3-0Blue.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923154762&usg=AOvVaw3aspxPkiI7SeI2OpKS-ckw) The Author, 1957)

October — 10:00 p.m. Mrs. James Masterson and her sister Bernice Childers while driving see a reddish-orange disc, 30 feet in diameter, just above the treetops in Allen Park, Michigan. They chase it for a block or two before it streaks off. One of the women sees two figures wearing white Navy uniforms in a window on the lower section. (Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT Index 1957](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1957.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923155121&usg=AOvVaw3QRVp9DdTnk1tREWnBGS4Z)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1957.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923155261&usg=AOvVaw0CHB4p8RpgYhXdWkym6RH8) p. 17; Clark III 268)

October 4 — The USSR launches the first artificial earth satellite, [Sputnik 1](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sputnik_1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923155522&usg=AOvVaw1nZRMmzezF1hthmHyw-RHI), which transmits radio pulses for 21 days. Some 4% of Americans claim to have seen Sputnik in orbit. However, what most are actually seeing is the 100- foot-long R-7 rocket core stage, outfitted with reflective panels that make it a first magnitude object, trailing 600 miles behind the 22-inch satellite until October 26 when the batteries run out. The satellite is barely visible at sixth magnitude. (Wikipedia, “[Sputnik 1](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sputnik_1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923155722&usg=AOvVaw0QiGtrmPcl6dASCF69FBH9)”; Walter N. Webb, “Allen Hynek As I Knew Him,” IUR 18, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1993): 7)

October 4 — 10:00 a.m. A tadpole-like UFO is seen at Ichinoseki, Iwate Prefecture, Japan. Afterwards, material like spider web falls in great profusion around Saguramachi Middle School for about 2 hours. Chemical analysis reveals that it is organic, dissolvable in hydrochloric acid, and burns. The crystal structure is different from spider web. (“[Angel Hair,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CJan-Feb%252CV%25204%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923156138&usg=AOvVaw30hHCMUt-QuUdD1MFDngtg)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1958): 21; Robert N. Webster, “Things That Fall from UFO’s,” Fate 11, no. 10 (October 1958): 26; George M. Eberhart, “Postcards with a UFO Theme,” IUR 29, no. 2 (Summer 2004): 21; Brian Boldman, “Angel Hair Physical Analyses: A Review,” JUFOS 9 (2006): 103;

Clark III 124–125)

October 5 — 11:00 p.m. [Antonio Villas-Boas](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant%25C3%25B4nio_Villas_Boas&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923156974&usg=AOvVaw2RWt0VLL9X-YDQilTi1qyx) gets up from bed on his family’s farm near São Francisco de Sales, Minas Gerais, Brazil, to open a window and notices a silvery reflection over the corral. After a short time, it moves towards the window. He and his brother watch as an object approaches and lights up the room. It disappears. (Clark III 1226)

October 6 — 4:15 p.m. Amateur astronomer [Earl Sydow](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/67773739/earl-charles-sydow&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923157422&usg=AOvVaw0LKGJVqQ73gAcuOUPSZXY0) spots a bright object with the magnitude of the planet Venus through his telescope over Tucson, Arizona. Six other observers also watch the object, which measures approximately 3 minutes in diameter along its major axis and 1 minute along its minor axis. Smaller flat-white or silver-white objects, as many as 6–10, seem to emerge from the primary object as observations continue. The smaller objects are apparently short traces of light at some times and semi-wedge-shaped at other times. The smaller objects disappear from the field of the telescope until only the original object is visible, and it disappears as if moving directly away. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 80)

October 8 — Day. Four Fijians in a punt with an outboard motor off Nabouwalu, Viti Levu, Fiji, see a white, circular object, which is hovering about 20 feet above the ocean. They approach it. It appears to be revolving, and they can see the figure of a man standing on the outside. The figure shines a blinding light at their boat, which makes them feel dazed and weak. As they draw closer, the figure disappears and the object rises rapidly upward, disappearing straight up. R. O. Aveling, an official of the Seventh-Day Adventist Church, sees a similar object at the same time but at a different location. It is hovering at about 5,000 feet and swinging in a balloon-like fashion. Its color varies from bright white to deep, flashing red. (“[Fiji Reports Sighting Object Like Texas Saucer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/100135693/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923158057&usg=AOvVaw0Drk3EF2sIeUwFnsPNCJlU)” Honolulu (Hawaii) Advertiser, November 5, 1957, p. 1; “[Strange Object Seen in South Pacific Skies,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95889466/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923158319&usg=AOvVaw3cm-t5MsZF6maWpN1S2cfv)” Long Beach (Calif.) Press- Telegram, November 5, 1957, p. 3; Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 81; Loren E. Gross, [The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Oct-1-Nov-2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923158660&usg=AOvVaw0N-oEOg0yX_Cjg7UfO1xeZ)

* * *

[Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History, 1957, October 1st–November 2nd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Oct-1-Nov-2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923159001&usg=AOvVaw2me_HJhCDhatzhXVWdoLiB), The Author, 1997, p. 19; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1957-10-08-fiji-nabouwalu.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923159234&usg=AOvVaw3WMxCTs77LveVhfAzHDGdZ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1957-10-08-fiji-nabouwalu.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923159394&usg=AOvVaw2tYJe3zcw-AO2qIYie-Ht8) February 16, 2007)

October 9 — Evening. Fire ignites Windscale Pile Number One, an air-cooled, graphite-moderated, uranium-fueled reactor used for plutonium and isotope production at the Windscale facility \[now Sellafield\] in Cumbria, England. It burns for three days, and there is a release of radioactive iodine that spreads across the UK, contaminating surrounding dairy farms, as well as the rest of Europe. (Wikipedia, “[Windscale fire](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windscale_fire&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923159679&usg=AOvVaw3X3ZzophRNDc5xGsdqsfgL)”)

October 9 — Night. Radio station CKOV in Kelowna, British Columbia, after reports on Sputnik, rebroadcasts [Orson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orson_Welles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923159969&usg=AOvVaw34yoaiTUHW4RzN8mtzXeDs) [Welles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orson_Welles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923160261&usg=AOvVaw2W3xGVhG1EveBHALYyaGWe)’s 1938 War of the Worlds radio drama. Some 60 phone calls come in from listeners who think that Russians have landed in North America. (“[Welles, ‘Moon,’ Terrify Town,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94391410/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923160680&usg=AOvVaw0w91DGy56uaFB0WwumFEMR)” Windsor (Ont.) Star, October 10, 1957, p. 28)

October 9 — 7:24 p.m. The tower operator at Naval Air Station South Weymouth \[now the Shea Field Naval Aviation Historical Museum\], Massachusetts, sights a constant, conical, greenish-blue object with a phosphorescent glow through binoculars. In sight approximately 90 seconds, the observer sees no navigation lights. It is traveling faster than a jet plane on a track from northeast to south-southwest. The object comes out of the horizon and toward the end of its path makes three “crazy” gyrations then vanishes, possibly behind cloud cover. The object has no trail like a meteor. (Walter N. Webb, “Allen Hynek As I Knew Him,” IUR 18, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1993): 7)

October 10 — 4:00 a.m. A huge fireball plunges from the sky near Myton, Utah, just missing a US Navy DC-6 transport plane out of NAS Alameda \[now closed\], California, with 36 persons aboard. Pilot Lt. Cmdr. W. F. Norris reports the incident to Salt Lake City Airport. (“[Big Fireball Perils Plane,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94391673/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923161753&usg=AOvVaw0Qu4vJRuhWJEUzppVy0eBv)” Oakland (Calif.) Tribune, October 10, 1957, p. 1)

October 10 — The coffee truck driven by Miguel Espanhol Navarrete and his driver stalls northwest of Ceres near Quebra Coco, Goiás, Brazil, as a UFO lands nearby. They see an intense light as they begin a steep ascent, and then realize that the flying object appears to be more than 600 feet long. It lights up the entire area, even though it is gliding at a great height. The driver panics and tries to speed away, but the truck’s engine stalls as the object approaches and flies over the vehicle about 130 feet away. The object is about 3 feet in diameter by 40 inches high and is unevenly oval, with the upper section greater than the lower section. It looks like two superimposed plates separated by a strip 65 feet thick. When it is at an altitude of 20 feet, the UFO stops in the air and its light goes out. It lands, a door opens, and seven apparently human people come out dressed in luminous suits. Then the crew reenters the UFO and takes off, stopping at about 1,650 feet altitude. At that moment a smaller object detaches itself from the larger one and flies north. The larger object follows in a southeasterly direction. Navarrete is interviewed by Judge Gabriel Barbosa de Andrade, then-Secretary of the Interior and justice of the State of Goiás; Joaquim Neves Pereira; and Antenor Gomes, then-Secretary of Public Security for Goiás. (Lorenzen, Occupants, Signet, 1967, [pp. 192–193](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsauceroccu00lore/page/196/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923162743&usg=AOvVaw0U1zhJ-ooz4Gj2eiTG2ijC); Clark III 230; “[Caso Ceres,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.fenomenum.com.br/ufo/casuistica/1950/ceres&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923163098&usg=AOvVaw1WA8ssXxi4Wstxz453Ahsb)” Portal Fenomenum, June 15, 2016; Patrick

Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1957-10-10-brazil-quebracoco.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923163571&usg=AOvVaw173b_R9YVxo1IbGayRVBi-)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1957-10-10-brazil-quebracoco.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923163856&usg=AOvVaw2YR8542FsNvPcVCHDvtGcZ) October 17, 2006; Brazil 40–41)

October 12 — 9:15 p.m. Many witnesses see a luminous oval object pass over Ciudad Bolivar, Venezuela, at great speed. The same or a similar object is seen at Coro at 9:25 p.m. and at Trujillo at 12:00 midnight. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 82)

October 14 — 7:00 p.m. The Naval Air Station North Island tower in San Diego, California, directs a Navy S2F-1Tracker anti-submarine aircraft toward a bright light over Point Loma. The aircraft, piloted by Lt. [Allen L. Ries](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/199036061/allen-louis-ries&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923164579&usg=AOvVaw0F2E1a1UuH_-sCoNlFdF_t), tracks the UFO on airborne radar at some points suddenly moving at 1,700 mph average speed (3,500 mph at peak) and 1,100 mph average relative to the aircraft’s (peak 2,200 mph). Radar indicates the object is about 12 miles ahead. After 3 minutes the aircraft loses the object visually and on radar. Blue Book explains this as the star Arcturus, which is in the wrong direction in the sky, then changes the explanation to a balloon. (NICAP, \[[Blue Book](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs2/571014-North%2520Island%2520NAS%2520Navy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923164974&usg=AOvVaw2Bm4eQnQh5WJQw3JUbtTPC) [documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs2/571014-North%2520Island%2520NAS%2520Navy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923165282&usg=AOvVaw34rPuvYo-4zXo8E5aanksp)\]; Clark III 389–390)

October 14 — Around 9:30 p.m. [Antonio Villas-Boas](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant%25C3%25B4nio_Villas_Boas&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923165696&usg=AOvVaw1BqpRDnFlDbYBaRD5Vpmcz) and another brother are plowing and see a bright object hovering 300 feet in the air. He approaches it, but it evades him and disappears. (Clark III 1226–1227)

October 15 — Afternoon. Robert Moudy sees a glowing object hovering above his combine in Franklin County, Indiana, at about 1,500 feet. It appears to be silver and platter-shaped, perhaps 12 feet in diameter, with a pink flame coming from its base. It makes a loud whirring noise as it hovers. When it starts ascending at a 22° angle, its color changes from pink to light blue and the combine stops working. He notices two stalled cars on a nearby road. (“[Indiana Farmer Says ‘Whatsit’ Was Overhead,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99758833/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923166296&usg=AOvVaw3gAj3loG-oXDug94EM1s-O)” Indianapolis News, November 5, 1957, p. 17)

October 16 — 1:00 a.m. [Antonio Villas-Boas](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant%25C3%25B4nio_Villas_Boas&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923166849&usg=AOvVaw0oq9TrsZUD-K7CA9CKB-6U) is plowing alone near São Francisco de Sales, Minas Gerais, Brazil, when a red, egg-shaped object appears above him. His tractor motor and lights fail. It lands nearby and something grabs him as he tries to run away. Three small figures bring him into the object, where he is subjected to tests and made to have sex twice with an odd-looking woman. Afterwards, she points to her belly then points to the sky. Then he is given a tour of the craft and taken outside again around 5:30 a.m. (“[The A.V.B. Contact Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Brazil/SBEDV/SBEDV%2520-%2520No%2520026-27%2520-%25201962.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923167226&usg=AOvVaw1FhcbbfrK2yQZSaUhjNoOk)” Boletim

SBEDV, no. 26/27 (Apr./July 1962): 7–9; Gordon Creighton, “[The Most Amazing Case of All, Part 1: A Brazilian](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CJan-Feb%252CV%252011%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923167698&usg=AOvVaw3e8Uapcl8qA8i2WhdcuEOW) [Farmer’s Story,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CJan-Feb%252CV%252011%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923167948&usg=AOvVaw1ZK5bv_QAhknTNBu5Q5Rqd)” Flying Saucer Review 11, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1965): 13–17; Gordon Creighton, “[Even More Amazing…Part](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923169550&usg=AOvVaw2vrlahvqr6-JXYaLRkAbcb) [2: The A.V.B. Fontes, “[Even More Amazing…Part V,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201967%2520V%252013%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923170741&usg=AOvVaw14mZL07ct4rSYWacpqvqRo)” Flying Saucer Review 13, no. 3 (May/June 1967): 22–25; Gordon Creighton, “[Even More Amazing…Part VI: The Medical Report,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201968%2520V%252014%2520N%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923171038&usg=AOvVaw3tyUWWFtsU_yLnkvKYKJn1)” Flying Saucer Review 14, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1968): 18–20; Lorenzen, Occupants, Signet, 1967, [pp. 42–72](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsauceroccu00lore/page/42/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923171394&usg=AOvVaw0x_3skzqzZUZWJ5QdKUjTe); “Brazil: New Light on a Sexual Abduction,” IUR/Probe, Sept.

1980, p. 79; Kim Hansen, “UFO Casebook,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, pp. 56–59; Brazil 41–47; Clark III 1227–1229; Mark Cashman, “Behavioral Classification System for UFO Occupants,” IUR 24, no. 1 (Spring 1999): 19)

October 16 — Day. Nurse Ella Louise Fortune is driving north of Tularosa, New Mexico, when she sees a brilliant-white, elliptical object hovering in a deep-blue sky. It seems to have a faint exhaust trail at one edge. She stops her car and snaps a 35mm Kodachrome photo. Analysts generally agree this is a bright lenticular cloud with a trail of ice crystals. (Walter N. Webb, “The Fortune Photo Revisited,” IUR 18, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1993): 14–15)

October 16 — Evening. Former Australian Air Marshal [George Jones](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Jones_(RAAF_officer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923172138&usg=AOvVaw3bowLI7iaKFAqr4h3tx3la) and his wife see a round object like a “flying balloon” moving silently at the speed of a jet over their home in Mentone, Victoria, Australia. It moves from south to north at an altitude of 1,000–1,500 feet. (George Jones, “[Former Air Chief Sees Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CMay-Jun%252CV%25204%252CN%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923172421&usg=AOvVaw2bc875lVwiYmKBYTI5wSb3)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 3 (May/June 1958): 6)

October 21 — 9:18 p.m. Flying Officer D. W. Sweeney is flying a Meteor jet at 28,000 feet on a training exercise from RAF North Luffenham \[now St. George’s Barracks\] when he nearly collides with an unidentified object over RAF Gaydon \[now closed\], North Warwickshire, England. After taking evasive action, Sweeney tries to approach the object, whereupon its six lights go out and it disappears. The UFO is tracked on radar at RAF Langtoft \[now closed\] in South Kesteven. (“[UFO over British A-Bomber Base: Air Ministry Baffled,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CJan-Feb%252CV%25204%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923172897&usg=AOvVaw1HimF6OfVbuLknxnRMFT05)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1958): 6; Good Above, [pp. 50–51](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/50/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923173180&usg=AOvVaw0HgqW9X0lcNvN9l4ZkQCej))

October 22 — The US Continental Army Command sends a memo to the Army Chief of Research and Development indicating its interest in the flying saucer concept and requesting initiation of a feasibility study of a “manned flying saucer.” (Richard P. Weinert, History of Army Aviation, 1950–1962, US Army Training and Doctrine Command, November 1976, [pp. 220–221](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/DTIC_ADA236573/page/n225/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923173539&usg=AOvVaw1sPjTRtRGzy_EgwoLBpdNr))

October 25 — On a farm near Petrópolis, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, a housekeeper (pseudonym = Anazia Maria) is taking care of a family member who is dying of stomach cancer. She claims that two diminutive, long-haired beings emerge from a landed UFO, come inside the house, examine the girl for an hour with a device that looks like a flashlight, communicate telepathically to the family, cure the girl, and leave behind some medication to give her. (Olavo T. Fontes, “[Dying Girl Saved by Humanoid Surgeons,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201967%2520V%252013%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923173865&usg=AOvVaw0DrJbZAIBE3U4Mtomsexxt)” Flying Saucer Review 13, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1967): 5–6)

October 30 — 9:00 p.m. Hugh Pulju and Shirley Moyer are driving 10 miles north of Casper, Wyoming, when a round, shiny object appears in the road about 250 feet ahead. Pulju tries to turn around, but the engine keeps stalling. It works well once he reaches a main highway. (“[‘Mystery Object’ Is Reported Here,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/100197994/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923174313&usg=AOvVaw1nwlMvmlUni8OAurCIU54P)” Casper (Wyo.) Tribune- Herald, November 5, 1957, p. 1; Aimé Michel, Straight-Line, pp. 237–238; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923174679&usg=AOvVaw08QxDSRORfO1MwxaMWNJui), p. 24)

October 31 — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923175004&usg=AOvVaw0r7_V9bbOk9khzO_C1QubZ) meets with Rep. [James C. Healey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_C._Healey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923175291&usg=AOvVaw0Q83dXsV17Wrm2V-and1XC) again, who tells him the Air Force has “made a strong attempt to disprove your claims.” (Keyhoe, FSTS, p. 113)

October 31 — A businessman and his wife at Longchaumois, Jura, France, see a large lighted object with openings. It hovers close to the ground and takes off with a great increase in brightness, silently, at high speed. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957, October 1st–November 2nd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Oct-1-Nov-2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923175632&usg=AOvVaw35qWYB7GlE7skdxG-M5amS), The Author, 1997, p. 83)

October 31 — 8:00 p.m. Barbara Jean Stokes, her husband Paul, and another couple are driving in Lumberton, North Carolina, when they spot an object about 200 feet long in the sky. Suddenly the object rises straight up and flames. As this happens, the car stalls until the object disappears a few seconds later. (“[Woman Says She Saw](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99760268/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923175949&usg=AOvVaw3BuDEFYyb3bNY27mZS73uP) [Ball of Fire on Road,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99760268/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923176197&usg=AOvVaw1-51SP86OHFe-p4NTu7ibo)” Charlotte (N.C.) Observer, November 5, 1957, p. 1)

Late October — Late one afternoon, a British RAF team is planning to return home from the Maralinga, South Australia, nuclear test site where the Operation Antler series of blasts have occurred (September 14, 25, October 9). They go outside and see a silvery-blue, metallic UFO with a flat base and a dome on top. Several squarish portholes are

* * *

visible around the center. The object tilts at 45° and hovers. After 15 minutes, the UFO shoots up out of sight without a sound. One of the witnesses is Derek Murray, later a Home Office photographer. (Bill Chalker, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201986%2520V%252031%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923176720&usg=AOvVaw2cYreCN_LgEp2FD5gqoMx-) [UFO Connection: Startling Implications for Australia’s North West Cape, and for Australia’s Security,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201986%2520V%252031%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923176959&usg=AOvVaw0JCkY-gQld2K3-hX6a95z4)” Flying Saucer Review 31, no. 5 (July 1986): 18–19; Jenny Randles, UFO Conspiracy, Cassell, 1987, [pp. 94–95](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoconspiracyfir00rand/page/94/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923177310&usg=AOvVaw09HGYzhPRWx4zMxVJEg55X); Good

November 1 — 9:15 a.m. More than 50 workers at the Luipaardsvlei mine near Krugersdorp, Gauteng, South Africa, watch two UFOs hanging motionless in the air at a great height until the afternoon. A Sabre jet from the South African Air Force is sent up to investigate. It climbs to 45,000 feet, but the objects are still above it. One of the witnesses is Maj. G. Ogilvie-Watson, from an ACF squadron at Pretoria. They move off at great speed. (“[Jet](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CJan-Feb%252CV%25204%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923179213&usg=AOvVaw2Y3Tt06KXTw5d2wXmazpga) [Unable to Reach UFO,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CJan-Feb%252CV%25204%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923179422&usg=AOvVaw36gMi28xHLUzNvpdkewxg3)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1958): 2; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Oct-1-Nov-2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923179697&usg=AOvVaw0W8tPvBPlkMiS6Jv-LsV_x) [of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957, October 1st–November 2nd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Oct-1-Nov-2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923179917&usg=AOvVaw069kaMkOa20fPKxJ3AyRfA), The Author, 1997, p. 85)

November 2 — 3:30 a.m. Three miles west of Canadian, Texas, S/Sgt. [Alfred A. Calvin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/19806662/alfred-a_-calvin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923180224&usg=AOvVaw0zXVxhVJay2yAmEJqyttPC) and a civilian witness see a submarine-shaped object, red and white, about 40–60 feet long and about 10 feet high, at ground level. November 2 — 8:30 p.m. A witness is driving between Seminole and Seagraves, Texas, on US Highway 62 when he sees lights on the road ahead. As he approaches them, his headlights go out and his engine dies. A few seconds later, the lights rise into the air and disappear. (Hobbs (N.Mex.) News-Sun, November 5, 1957; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923181398&usg=AOvVaw0_PlZAPIRRvf9i7RHmpBzJ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923181593&usg=AOvVaw3orb3mZsDEmH5K8lrHJvHX) p. 25)

November 2 — 10:50 p.m. Farmhand and veteran [Pedro Saucedo](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/195253400/pedro-hernandez-saucedo&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923181980&usg=AOvVaw3EEhepG4MlxL22qHXAg_0h) and Joe Salaz are driving four miles west of Levelland, Texas, on Route 116 \[now 114\] south of Pettit (near its intersection with Five Mile Road). They see a flash of light to the right of the road. Then a 200-foot-long, 6-foot-wide blue rocket-shaped object, with yellow flame and white smoke coming from the rear, rises up out of the field, heads straight toward their truck, passes directly overhead at about 200 feet with a loud thundering roar, a rush of wind, and great heat. Their truck engine dies and the headlights to go out. The UFO disappears in the east towards Levelland. The lights come back on spontaneously and the engine restarts. A frightened Saucedo calls the occurrence in to Patrolman A. J. Fowler of the Levelland sheriff’s office. At Pettit, Texas, the same night, two grain combines, each with two engines, fail as a UFO passes overhead. The Air Force calls the Levelland sightings ball lightning or St. Elmo’s fire, even though there are no electrical storms in the area. [Donald Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923182323&usg=AOvVaw1-7iukLfofkDfa6lkWj6XL) calls it a mirage. (Wikipedia, “[Levelland UFO case](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Levelland_UFO_case&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923182534&usg=AOvVaw1BuBLoB_l4Q4Ro7FUv8Wao)”; NICAP, “[The Levelland Sightings / Saucedo](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571102levelland_saucedo_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923182719&usg=AOvVaw2Lz3KkgYwOt2wU0pZBajF0)”; “[Whatnik Sidelines Sputnik,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99448190/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923182982&usg=AOvVaw1ZssxgWcZG8L32L5kX9aaA) [Woofnik,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99448293/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923183165&usg=AOvVaw2Awb3pnRmzkisy02jS4JSm)” Fort Worth (Tex.) Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 141–142](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/140/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923184897&usg=AOvVaw1St1JvlSEssJH0WhtvA8GQ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/140/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923185045&usg=AOvVaw22anW5QTv86BnmLesp1Sw9) [146–147](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/146/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923185231&usg=AOvVaw22H6G4sIZLqk3fI5Qewx1B); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923185410&usg=AOvVaw2pfc5n7dWS51r-vCtpZf71)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923185538&usg=AOvVaw0rWUwCIt6xuiNqjFkF-OhX) p. 253; Walter N. November 2 — 11:55 p.m. Two married couples driving near Shallowater, Texas, see a flash of orange light in the southwestern sky. The headlights and radio of their car fail for three seconds as they see the light. The car motor is not affected. November 2 — About midnight. Jim Wheeler sees a 200-foot-long, egg-shaped, brightly lit object on Route 114 four miles east of Levelland, Texas. As he gets close to it, his engine and lights cease functioning. He gets out of his car as the light ascends; its lights blink out, and his engine and lights resume functioning. November 3 — 12:05 a.m. Texas Tech college student Newell H. Wright is driving west one mile west of Smyer, Texas, when the ammeter gauge on his car dashboard starts fluctuating widely. The car motor gradually goes out then the headlights and radio die. He gets out to check and sees a white or aluminum-colored, oval-shaped object flat on the bottom like a loaf of bread, with a bluish-green tint, about 75–125 feet long. After a few minutes, the object suddenly rises up from the road ahead and ascends almost vertically at great speed slightly to the north, disappearing in seconds. Afterward the car can start again. (NICAP, “[Oval-Shaped Object & EME on Ammeter](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571103levelland_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923188780&usg=AOvVaw3xdt2esxjiSm1eotpbfu99)”; UFOEv, [p. 168](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D180%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923189003&usg=AOvVaw0OUqkfiUGrwDMqLGRKMLiO); [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923189224&usg=AOvVaw2XOrf-UwSiBi1MltQTWHEg)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923189394&usg=AOvVaw0UB7La6zbE1GhaPEAO2sZB) pp. 28–29; J. p. 254; Donald R. Burleson, “Levelland, Texas, 1957: Case Reopened,” IUR 28, no. 1 (Spring 2003): 4; Swords

(UFOEv, [p. 168](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D180%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923190365&usg=AOvVaw0yZFjaECC4eI-0uMiAz033); [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923190591&usg=AOvVaw3jZL1EvoI875noMPd2rD47), pp. 29–30; J. Burleson, “Levelland, Texas, 1957: Case Reopened,” IUR 28, no. 1 (Spring 2003): 4; Randle, Levelland, 2021, p. 17)

November 3 — 12:45 a.m. Ronald Martin is on Highway 116 near Smyer, Texas, when he sees a glowing red UFO land ahead of his truck, then turn to bluish-green. The truck’s electrical system fails. When the UFO takes off, it turns reddish again. (UFOEv, [p. 168](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D180%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923191452&usg=AOvVaw0XNs10Y4rD-MfJbWSDrVCk); [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923191665&usg=AOvVaw1l64aMASxE3JKd7L5-5pxl)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923191858&usg=AOvVaw1gopvbvEOxFAqpA6zdDAQ7) pp. 30–31; J. November 3 — 1:15 a.m. James Long is 5 miles northwest of Levelland, Texas, on a farm-to-market road. The object rises quickly and speeds away. (UFOEv, [p. 168](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D180%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923193574&usg=AOvVaw2z21ezhp6yVEeAUkuz8cd5); [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923193803&usg=AOvVaw1rFy2lJAvksKNLUvWw6DI6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923194009&usg=AOvVaw1Air691Uwjf46_sApeNM84) p. 31; J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 144–145](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/144/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923194403&usg=AOvVaw21oUXENTT9rl1R-zEOkxCZ); Randle, Levelland, 2021, p. 19)

November 3 — 1:30 a.m. Near the same spot as James Long, Hockley County (Texas) Sheriff [Weir Clem](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21861246/weir-sam-clem&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923194798&usg=AOvVaw1OY6wNsUK-nqcjaBhuF8nb) and Pat McCullough see a flash of light “like a brilliant red sunset” 300–400 yards to the south of them, lighting up the pavement. (UFOEv, [p. 168](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D180%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923195068&usg=AOvVaw16wbDIKI9VmXNgNfAG5GB6); [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923195285&usg=AOvVaw0Uh8PM--3082u4bSbpgYf4)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923195463&usg=AOvVaw03atLhJO5k2iiC_EGMRctv) pp. 31–32; J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/144/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923195730&usg=AOvVaw3oAlIu88Vlmv5no4W3jBbL) [145–146](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/144/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923195935&usg=AOvVaw2x4sc-TL5qHAk10MwfQIiY); Donald R. Burleson, “Levelland, Texas, 1957: Case Reopened,” IUR 28, no. 1 (Spring 2003): 4;

Randle, Levelland, 2021, pp. 19–21, 170–181, 218–219)

November 3 — About 3:00 a.m. Two MPs at White Sands Missile Test Range, New Mexico, Cpl. Glenn H. Toy and Pfc. James E. Wilbanks are making rounds in their jeep when they notice a bright object high in the sky. It drops down to about 150 feet and the light goes out. A few minutes later the light goes on again and it drops to the ground in a bunker area 3 miles away and goes out. The UFO is egg-shaped and about 225–300 feet in diameter. (NICAP, “[Three MPs Report Object over White Sands Base](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571103whitesands_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923196423&usg=AOvVaw3iiX1AGlfsgRer1e5fGkuR)”; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923196664&usg=AOvVaw1nLPEBgSiUj6C6k-k7xrEK), pp. 37–38; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-3-5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923196963&usg=AOvVaw2jUiG3HXYnXjU99_XiMkz3) [the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957 November 3rd–5th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-3-5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923197198&usg=AOvVaw1vTZuiPnUsw70AIY_CsReE), The Author, 1997, p. 6; UFOEv, [p. 169](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D181%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923197514&usg=AOvVaw2GwK2uQdWjn0XPRSJJHSJN); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923197690&usg=AOvVaw3ocK6Uu4Qk7JB1pttvROSp), p.

254; Swords 259; Randle, Levelland, 2021, pp. 23–27)

November 3 — 7:00 p.m. Edna Ireland is driving with two friends near Sibbald, Alberta, when a blinking light appears in the sky and passes nearly above the car toward the northwest. Their engine coughs and the headlights flicker. (Winnipeg (Man.) Tribune, November 7, 1957; Aimé Michel, Straight-Line, p. 239; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923198289&usg=AOvVaw0QoWU4FhMp5YmBEmVYeHiq), pp. 42–43)

November 3 — 8:00 p.m. Army Specialist 3rd Class [Henry R. Barlow](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/325380/henry-r-barlow&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923198540&usg=AOvVaw2LfMjWEFc_G5pxUGdu_r5-) and Specialist 3rd Class Forest R. Oakes, Army Garrison Detachment 5, are in a jeep patrol driving west near the site of the first A-bomb explosion, Trinity Site, in White Sands Proving Ground, New Mexico. They see a pulsating red light thar turns to white, possibly 200– 300 feet in size and 4–5 miles away. It brightens and dims then sometimes goes out, rising in the sky from the ground or from about 50 feet over the bunker up to about 45° elevation until it looks like a star or point source. They watch it for 25 minutes before it disappears. Possibly Venus in the southwest, which sets at about 8:30 p.m. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923198833&usg=AOvVaw0mHy0QnS8M8bxpRnVmrUer)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923198973&usg=AOvVaw2qC871MlC9ltj59Irridva) p. 254; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923199378&usg=AOvVaw0oMXwkJ2S2SdnTer9gjJ-C), p. 38; Randle, Levelland, 2021,pp. 27–31)

November 3 — The USSR launches [Sputnik 2](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sputnik_2&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923199935&usg=AOvVaw3A1gf5GjNN_1SAvY50E8vj) carrying Laika the dog. (Wikipedia, “[Sputnik 2](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sputnik_2&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923200295&usg=AOvVaw0GVv7rx3RyEqCJHtlYOWqF)”)

November 4 — Portuguese Air Force Capt. Lenos Ferreira is conducting a training mission at the head of three jet fighters over Grenada, Spain, when he observes a luminous object changing color from an intense green to bright red. The object maintains a constant altitude while oscillating. Ferreira orders a change of course toward Córdoba, but the object follows his group for 40 minutes, dropping four smaller objects that also accompany the jets. Suddenly the objects go into a dive and disappear. (Patrick Gross, “[UFO Chasing Jet Fighter Squadron, Lisbon, 1957](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/lisboa57.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923200796&usg=AOvVaw2rjeAYrk-QuSCJ12iL4BIB)”)

November 4 — After 12:00 midnight. A young couple are returning to Amarillo, Texas, from Palo Duro Canyon when they see a glowing object in the middle of the road, surrounded by fog. As they drive closer and enter the fog, the car engine and battery die. Another car has to push them into town to get the battery recharged. (Amarillo (Tex.) Daily News, November 4, 1957; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923201598&usg=AOvVaw2UjxiCHcWdmL_H9Uq8zCWp)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923201931&usg=AOvVaw3H3OLf-sJAiRQWmovkRcD4) pp. 43–44)

November 4 — 1:30 a.m. Chief Pilot Captain Jean Vincent de Beyssac and his copilot are flying a Varig Airlines C-46 cargo plane from Porto Alegre to São Paulo, Brazil. They are near Araranguá, Santa Catarina, when de Beyssac notices a red light on his left. It seems to be getting bigger, so he banks towards it out of curiosity. The light gets much bigger then begins to glow more brilliantly. The pilot and copilot smell smoke and, as they are looking for the source, the light disappears. De Beyssac returns to Porto Alegre. It turns out that the right engine’s magneto (or generator), automatic direction finder, and the radio (both receiver and transmitter) have burnt out, allegedly simultaneously. (NICAP, “[Aircraft Encounters UFO / ADF, etc. Affected](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571104brazil_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923202498&usg=AOvVaw0GQKWOrVcPRnuZHY4YICQI)”; Olavo T. Fontes, “[Top Secret Report](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201959%252009%252000%2520-%2520September.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923202934&usg=AOvVaw2faMsnj8jpJOMPasw8iIEv) [Unveiled,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201959%252009%252000%2520-%2520September.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923203359&usg=AOvVaw2X8nFnldVFf9yAFXvChqwc)” APRO Bulletin, September 1959, pp. 5–6; Lorenzen, FS Hoax, [p. 155](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/1966CoralLorenzenFlyingSaucersTheStartlingEvidenceOfTheInvasionFromOuterSpacenotOCR/page/n159/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923203995&usg=AOvVaw15dwuvu2b_BqSCavDTWKos); [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923204418&usg=AOvVaw2-rOO34lv46ZHX_Rtu4U2_), pp. 126–127; Patrick Gross, “[UFO / Aircraft Close Encounter in Brazil, 1957](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/varig57.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923204762&usg=AOvVaw3IrSH2Mc1gIq8Hq3XKV0Kp)”)

November 4 — 2:00 a.m. Two sentries at the Fortaleza de Itaipu in Praia Grande, São Paulo, Brazil, watch an orange object approaching the fort. It holds its course until it is directly above them. Its diameter is at least as large as the wingspan of a DC-3 and scarcely 300 feet away. Suddenly there is a strange buzzing noise and the men feel a wave of glowing heat. One of them collapses on the spot, but the other succeeds in reaching safety in the shadow of the gun emplacements. His shouts of alarm rouse his comrades inside the fort, where the lights suddenly go out. In the meantime, the emergency power is switched on but immediately gives out. Only a few minutes after the alarm, two other men are out of the fort and at their sides. They too see the UFO, which is now heading out to sea. It leaves a luminous trail as it shoots away across the Atlantic. The two sentries are taken to a hospital in Rio de Janeiro. They suffer second and third-degree burns on large areas of their body, chiefly in areas covered by clothing. Afterwards, Brazilian Army and USAF personnel, along with investigators of the Brazilian Air Force, fly to the fort to interview them. There is some reason to think that [Olavo T. Fontes](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201968%252005%252000%2520-%2520May-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923205504&usg=AOvVaw2cr_QFDWEPI7c8kg9c-8-_) made this case up, as no first- hand witnesses to the event have come forward. (NICAP, “[Fort Itaipu Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571103itaipu_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923205923&usg=AOvVaw2oA10GJ8YVZBFaytAyshc8)”; Wikipedia, “[Caso do Forte de](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caso_do_Forte_de_Itaipu&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923206245&usg=AOvVaw24p1CwiefvnMR7CmiBZQwP) [Itaipu](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caso_do_Forte_de_Itaipu&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923206568&usg=AOvVaw1ZpWOGyB6BVKLQnrMLSRGD)”; Olavo T. Fontes, “[Top Secret Report Unveiled,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201959%252009%252000%2520-%2520September.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923206996&usg=AOvVaw0sjppVngO1r7mLasGoQwqq)” APRO Bulletin, September 1959, pp. 6–7; Jules Lemaître, “[A Strange Story from Brazil,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1960%252CJan-Feb%252CV%25206%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923207510&usg=AOvVaw0PAJ5NwT7bgo1GGPYdBndH)” Flying Saucer Review 6, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1960): 9–11; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923208049&usg=AOvVaw1w_c3kHdG8nAwhUrMPBt2q), pp.

135–140; Kevin D. Randle, “[Fort Itaipu and Footnotes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/fort-itaipu-and-footnotes.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923208563&usg=AOvVaw20Q-FwmH2vIVfslMy12ziN)” A Different Perspective, October 12, 2014; Kevin D. Randle, “[Fort Itaipu and Olavo Fontes Revisited,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2016/06/fort-itaipu-and-olavo-fontes-revisited.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923208980&usg=AOvVaw2ieEoReF_UFJdVTpKAIbqq)” A Different Perspective, June 15, 2016; Clark 537)

November 4 — 3:12 a.m. At Elmwood Park, Illinois, three policemen (Clifford Shaw, [Joseph Lukasek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/138496096/joseph-f_-lukasek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923209468&usg=AOvVaw2-u-tkG_PBDTy3xMrI3c6X), and Dan Diglovanni) see a bright cigar-shaped object in the sky. The headlights and spotlight on the squad car dim. The car chases the UFO for a mile and a half, which dips and rises before speeding off. Fireman Bob Volz also sees a reddish-orange UFO about the same time. (NICAP, “[Bright Cylinder Chased by Police, E-M Effects](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571104elmwoodpark_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923209863&usg=AOvVaw0MQPPrDeC7UUAwb6tY4iCe)”; Aimé Michel, Straight-Line, p. 239; Keyhoe, FSTS, p. 117; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923210514&usg=AOvVaw3r7naJVPbcl-0dl4tiJxEl), pp. 90–91; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-3-5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923210878&usg=AOvVaw06Q4-Aqh7Q7RSquiYTYPSN) [of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957 November 3rd–5th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-3-5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923211244&usg=AOvVaw1Oz42Hix4rAEO-vXWf4Fqz)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-3-5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923211511&usg=AOvVaw2Y5Zukfwpm-HUc0i4qSg7o) The Author, 1997, pp. 22–27; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923211897&usg=AOvVaw2HbGO_t3iglyffU72aG1oa), p. 255)

November 4 — 1:10 p.m. James W. Stokes, electronics technician at Holloman AFB, New Mexico, is driving on US 54 about 8 miles south of Orogrande, New Mexico. The car radio fades, and the car slows as if the battery is failing. Stokes notices 6–12 cars ahead of him have also stopped and drivers are out looking at the sky (looking behind him to the northeast), including a Mr. Duncan and Allan D. Baker. Stokes stops and gets out, sees a pearl-white oval or egg-shaped object about 500 feet wide with a slight purplish tinge heading south at an estimated speed of 1,500–2,000 mph. It is below the elevation angle of the Sacramento Mountains ridgeline, descending from about 5,000 feet above ground level in a shallow dive to about 1,500–2,500 feet altitude as it swerves to pass to the south of Stokes and the other stopped cars. At its closest it is about 2–5 miles away. It then circles around headed west and disappears. The same or another object appears in the northeast (as if the object has completely circled) and performs the same rounded course but passing farther to the south of the parked cars and disappears in the west. Duncan takes a 35mm film of the object. Stokes notices a wave of heat from the object at closest approach. Later that evening he is sunburned, but it clears up the next day. The Air Force calls it a hoax based on the Levelland sightings. (NICAP, “[Stokes Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571104orogrande_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923212645&usg=AOvVaw3c_ahAJlc9_aZZHnL38ExQ)”; “[The New Mexico Story,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201957%252011%252000%2520-%2520Nov.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923213083&usg=AOvVaw1CXqdqEcQfxL0HSPruX0e4)” APRO Bulletin, November 1957, pp. 1–2; L. J. Lorenzen, “[The Stokes Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201958%252001%252000%2520-%2520January.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923213670&usg=AOvVaw1h34anlm_M0BGobYPW58Tk)” APRO Bulletin, January 1958, pp. 2, 6; UFOEv, [p. 169](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D181%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923214179&usg=AOvVaw1qISspOZv-uvj3gX0gzI_b); [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923214633&usg=AOvVaw0JazgfuJpEkZzK5S7IsqrO), pp.

39–42; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923215116&usg=AOvVaw3KwGxxwX6su9XCjybE8fc5)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923215349&usg=AOvVaw1OPmNdzJ02xvWbM3MkEPVo) p. 255; Swords 256–259; Randle, Levelland, 2021, pp. 32–42, 228)

November 4 — 7:30 p.m. A Texas state border inspector is driving 3 miles southeast of El Paso Airport in Texas when his car engine stalls and the headlights go dim then out. He gets out and notices an object approaching that is making a whirring sound like an artillery shell. It passes above his car at about 150 feet, heading west and changing altitude occasionally. When it gets to the Franklin Mountains, it lifts into the air vertically. (NICAP, “[Egg-Shaped](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571104elpaso_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923216034&usg=AOvVaw08d8HAxqCbptVkfM9_A1d4) [Object Stalls Car](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571104elpaso_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923216334&usg=AOvVaw0674GABKR5h6RP0PCmHugl)”; Hynek UFO Report, [p. 181](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/180/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923216732&usg=AOvVaw1-JbTKr9RLuGYgiQXwr5Y8))

* * *

November 4 — 10:00 p.m. Jan Boucher, a policeman in Kodiak, Alaska, sees a red ball of fire with a greenish-yellow trail as he is patrolling on Mission Road. It apparently moves 50 feet above a nearby school. He tries to radio in a report but his radio gets interference for 2 minutes after the sighting. (Anchorage (Alaska) Daily News, November 7, 1957; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923217544&usg=AOvVaw2kbP2afOWlFZqotNgXuJya), pp. 89–90)

November 4 — 10:45 p.m. CAA air traffic controllers R. M. Kaser and E. G. Brink see a highly maneuverable 15–20-foot egg-shaped object with a white light at its base circle over one end of Kirtland AFB in Albuquerque, New Mexico, at 150–200 mph. It comes down in a steep 30° dive as if landing on Runway 26 to the north of the tower at about 1,500 feet. Radar tracks part of this maneuver. The object then crosses the flight line, runways, and taxiways heading towards the tower at about 50 mph and 20–30 feet above ground, observed through 7x binoculars until it reaches about 3,000 feet near the northeast corner of the flood-lit restricted Manzano Nuclear Weapons Storage Area and a B-58 bomber service site. It hovers for 20–60 seconds, then heads east again at about 200–300 feet altitude. Suddenly it shoots up in a steep climb. Controllers contact Radar Approach Control, which tracks the object on CPN-18 radar traveling east, then turning south, circling the Albuquerque Low Frequency Range Station. It then heads north, disappearing at 10 miles and reappearing 20 minutes later to follow 1/2 mile behind a USAF C-46 that has just taken off to the south. It continues for 14 miles until both go off the scope. A hovering radar target then appears to the north over an outer marker for 90 seconds before fading. (Wikipedia, “[Kirtland AFB UFO sighting](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kirtland_AFB_UFO_sighting&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923218280&usg=AOvVaw0e0puX8tIm1uG65-48ydyI)”; NICAP, “[Kirtland UFO Incident / Radar Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571104kirtland_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923218611&usg=AOvVaw3mZJPss0gK5SCZ46wwKXiN)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923218935&usg=AOvVaw32MRRyDD_W-wh7wwMsn9Ad), p. 256; J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 87–90](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/86/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923219385&usg=AOvVaw1dUlpE-Gz5m8_xW5n8-g2E); Condon, [pp. 141–143](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/140/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923219725&usg=AOvVaw0mZOOfVS-Z9ysMQ7xklvVP); James E. McDonald, “[The Kirtland Airfield UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923220086&usg=AOvVaw2sLoBTpES8SxvsnBcTa8Ke),” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1970): 6–8; Swords 259–260)

November 5 — 5:10 a.m. The US Coast Guard Cutter [Sebago](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USCGC_Sebago_(WHEC-42)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923220752&usg=AOvVaw27IRHbOpnJVZ_GchZ7f3Lk) (WHEC-42), Commander [Clarence H. Waring Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49333776/clarence-henry-waring&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923221211&usg=AOvVaw0m9_Ag6BVJ_4z47lygJe8p), cruising in the Gulf of Mexico about 200 miles south of Mobile, Alabama, tracks a radar target at a range of 22 miles moving at 650 mph.
