It disappears at 55 miles range. Three other unusual radar contacts are made in the next 10 minutes. A visual object like a brilliant planet is seen at 5:21 a.m. speeding north to south for five seconds by Ensign Wayne Schotley, Lt. Donald E. Shaffer, 1stClass Quartermaster Kenneth Smith, and radio operator Thomas Kirk. The Air Force ascribes it to confused radar operators who mistake ordinary plane blips for a UFO. (NICAP, “[The Coast Guard Cutter](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571105sebago_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923221633&usg=AOvVaw0QysaCm5sfKiYiCBpmlCOI) [Sebago](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571105sebago_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923221881&usg=AOvVaw01lAUmkw8N7stR6Mha4zvL) [Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571105sebago_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923222176&usg=AOvVaw3_ttDgU-CJPBrJPmQyUHd1)”; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-3-5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923222535&usg=AOvVaw00SA-sXv-CokmhVNgAh3Lv) [a History: 1957 November 3rd–5th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-3-5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923222875&usg=AOvVaw1lqiZ90me_pJHM7YKdUEte)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-3-5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923223126&usg=AOvVaw0WJm3eLuYZfiKXOTamDn2a) The Author, 1997, pp. 50–51; Condon, [pp. 165–167](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/164/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923223521&usg=AOvVaw1BQrEd3o1U-lJdjloaEzDn); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923223801&usg=AOvVaw0ZDyg4oki2KgmppytG-bX0)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923224032&usg=AOvVaw0sMAVnMm4UEBPGZfAD5qsZ) p. 256; Swords

260–262)

November 5 — Late afternoon. Grain buyer [Reinhold O. Schmidt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reinhold_O._Schmidt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923224544&usg=AOvVaw0--WzhpB3lkGnFUjQBMhSW) is driving through the countryside near Kearney, Nebraska, when he notices a large, cigar-shaped object resting in a field. He is soon escorted inside the spaceship, which turns out to be crewed by completely human-looking space aliens, four males and two females, who apparently speak perfect German and claim to be from the planet Saturn. They also claim to be interested in the recently launched Russian sputniks and the satellite-launching plans of the US. Later Schmidt brings local police to view the landing site, where they find deep imprints and some “mysterious green residue.” Schmidt also claims subsequent visits to the spaceship and many friendly conversations with its learned crew. Schmidt notices they drink MJB brand coffee, and also carry in their cigar-shaped craft an ordinary terrestrial MG sports car, which they use for running errands and buying groceries. (A schematic drawing of the ship’s interior in Schmidt’s later booklet depicts a Volkswagen Beetle.) Unlike most spaceships, the Saturnian ship has large propellers at both ends. Eventually Schmidt gets a ride up to earth orbit and a tour of the mother ship. On October 26, 1961, Schmidt is convicted in Oakland, California, for grand theft after bilking a widow out of $5,000 for a worthless mining venture in Tulare County, where he claims to have seen huge quartz crystals from a spaceship. Judge [Donald K. Quayle](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/40784320/obituary-donald-k-quayle-1991/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923226089&usg=AOvVaw0l8WrKVoVJphP5L9Hc_Gy9) sentences him to 1–10 years in prison. (Clark III 1038–1039; Swords 262; Curt Collins, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2020/08/the-trial-of-ufo-gold-digger.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923226581&usg=AOvVaw1DrSkz7FKDq5_LS7mcEiG8) [Trial of a UFO Gold Digger,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2020/08/the-trial-of-ufo-gold-digger.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923226936&usg=AOvVaw1izg-BxzTgoXNcl8ne44Gg)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, August 27, 2020)

November 5 — The Department of Defense Office of Public Affairs issues a new UFO fact sheet, emphasizing the high percentage of explained cases and the lack of a threat to national security. (UFOEv, [p. 107](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D119%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923227412&usg=AOvVaw01HuCp6ZANbAsWyU8QwbKd); Swords 262)

November 5 — 6:30 p.m. Larry and Marilynn Beaman are driving near Antioch, Illinois, when they notice a ball of fire fluctuating from white to yellow pacing their car on the right side, about 1,000 feet up. It goes out for a time then switches back on. At its largest, it seems 30 feet in diameter. It follows them all the way to Ringwood and then lands in some trees behind a school building two blocks from where they live. It glitters like a welder’s arc and makes a sound like water swishing. Beaman rounds up some other witnesses and goes back to the landing site, but the object takes off, changes to purple, and moves away to the southwest. TV sets in town dim, finally losing both picture and sound during the same time period. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923228020&usg=AOvVaw3Z9DqCSJkrCT5dQgKBhf-_)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923228278&usg=AOvVaw0i1PPq5WEZg2w2MTosApnJ) pp. 104–109)

November 5 — 8:43 p.m. A witness in Woodstock, Illinois, sees a large, red, triangular object with a green light in the front and a yellow light in the rear. It makes a low droning sound and moves west to east. Woodstock police officers and another individual in Genoa City see the same object. At 10:15 p.m., an amber or orange UFO 200

* * *

feet long is seen for 5 minutes at Delavan, Wisconsin. Project Blue Book claims it is an aurora or jet aircraft. (Marler 131–132)

November 5 — 9:30 p.m. Civil service employee Lon Yarborough is driving along US Highway 81 about 1.5 miles southwest of San Antonio, Texas, when he sees an extremely bright object settle down in a ravine about 600 feet from him. The egg-shaped object is approximately 60 foot long and causes the lights and engine of his car to fail. The object rests a few minutes and finally takes off to the northeast. (San Antonio (Tex.) Light, November 6, 1957; NICAP, “[60ʹ Egg-Shaped Object Disables Auto](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571105sanantonio_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923228931&usg=AOvVaw12bsYsruetwYUIs-hVWWtE)”; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923229144&usg=AOvVaw31LbK3sI2d9kTD_QLZwzwO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923229345&usg=AOvVaw0xfe5Qf59Hsg7GXFkcoWES) pp. 44–45)

November 5 — 11:00 p.m. Two young men see a red light north of US Highway 62 at a point 38 miles west of Hobbs, New Mexico. They watch for 9–10 minutes, thinking it is an oil flare, but the light suddenly rises straight up. After pacing their car for a few minutes, the light turns toward the car, passes over it, and hovers over the Permian Basin Pipeline plant. As it passes overhead, the car engine sputters, then dies, and the lights go out. After the men coast the car down the road, the motor restarts and they drive away. The battery is found to be dead the following morning and the dashboard clock is stopped. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923229672&usg=AOvVaw2GHMr_M4oXNAJAa2unw567)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923229869&usg=AOvVaw21whZGV618TjL4F7mPfeEC) pp. 45–47; Mark Rodeghier, [UFO Reports Involving](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/books/UFO_REPORTS_INVOLVING_VEHICLE_INTERFERENCE.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923230113&usg=AOvVaw2B_jbaNlJS0nglRq5X4uBy) [Vehicle Interference](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/books/UFO_REPORTS_INVOLVING_VEHICLE_INTERFERENCE.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923230323&usg=AOvVaw307qkTu5Af1OUJt-AkWcHD), CUFOS, 1981, p. 12)

November 6 — Just after 12:00 midnight. A taxicab company owner, Joe Martinez, and one of his drivers, Alberto Gallegos, sees a UFO approach them in Santa Fe, New Mexico. They hear a humming sound as it comes close. The object is egg-shaped and multicolored. As it passes over their car, the engine stalls and the dashboard clock stops. The UFO then pulls up and moves rapidly into the southeast. One witness later discovers that his wristwatch has also stopped at the time of sighting. (Aimé Michel, Straight Line, pp. 246–247; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923230728&usg=AOvVaw2UJUwlH22jnh-WT4oD4uWO), pp. 47– 48; Mark Rodeghier, [UFO Reports Involving Vehicle Interference](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/books/UFO_REPORTS_INVOLVING_VEHICLE_INTERFERENCE.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923230960&usg=AOvVaw26IT-f2XipnG2-3ShmXl7c), CUFOS, 1981, p. 12)

November 6 — 4:30 a.m. William Rush II is driving on Long Point Road in Houston, Texas. A brilliant red, egg-shaped UFO kills his car engine and causes static on his radio. (Houston (Tex.) Chronicle, November 6, 1957; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923231367&usg=AOvVaw37I4W5TXhQfd2iiGLl4r7F),

p. 48)

November 6 — 5:40 a.m. Richard Kehoe is driving along Vista Del Mar in Playa Del Rey, California, when his engine fails. Two other cars on the highway are also affected, and the drivers (Ronald Burke and Joe Thomas) all get out. They see an egg-shaped object that seems to be wrapped in a blue haze. It is tan or cream-colored and has two metallic rings around it. Two smallish men, about 5 feet 5 inches tall and wearing black leather pants, a white belt, and a light-colored jersey, exit the object. They ask Kehoe and the others where they are and what time it is in something approaching English. They walk back to the object, which takes off. After it leaves, Kehoe’s car starts with no problem. (Lorenzen, Flying Saucer Occupants, Signet, 1967, [pp. 126–127](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsauceroccu00lore/page/130/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923231791&usg=AOvVaw2epo00YyUCZ5qc3yI5VSWn))

November 6 — 6:30 a.m. [Everett Orain Clark](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/186597176/everette-orain-clark&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923232081&usg=AOvVaw2gQxi0XWkHCWfpEia4dFAF), 12 , of Dante, Knoxville, Tennessee, lets his dog Frisky outside and sees an object like an elongated egg in a field 300 feet away from his house. 20 minutes later, he calls to bring the dog back and sees Frisky with other dogs on the other side of the road close to the object. Clark walks toward the UFO and sees two men and women, apparently dressed in a normal manner. One of the men tries to catch Frisky who grunts and moves away. They are speaking in a foreign language that sounds like German to him. The four people go into the craft by seemingly walking right through the wall. Journalist [Carson Brewer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carson_Brewer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923232317&usg=AOvVaw2mbhUfAkXfqHi9WN0KZ3Qx) goes back to the site with Clark and finds an “oblong ring of pressed grass” 24 feet by 4.5 feet. In the afternoon, two men from the Oak Ridge National Laboratory (engineer [Wallace Russell Gambill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.tributearchive.com/obituaries/23749101/wallace-russell-gambill-obituary&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923232573&usg=AOvVaw34m0L-tkdy1IPUyIQ3S_l6) and physicist N. D. Greene) collect soil samples and check for radiation (they find none). (“[Scientists Check](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95281666/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923232805&usg=AOvVaw1VcpGKFZM2Pp8b78_5JBwp) [‘Space Ship’ Field,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95282194/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923233011&usg=AOvVaw1V2FzIQ2P3LSp8_e7C8D_f)” Knoxville (Tenn.) News-Sentinel, November 7, 1957, pp. 1, 12; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-6.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923233288&usg=AOvVaw2mPLX0HpvgiuDE4QOy3fHZ) [November 6th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-6.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923233465&usg=AOvVaw0cqLCbinGjIpVgUWoGuvG0)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-6.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923233698&usg=AOvVaw21eFR-ot6utFKzTcX2Ilkt) The Author, 1997, pp. 17–19; Clark III 672–673; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1957-11-06-usa-dante.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923234046&usg=AOvVaw3VEuQOQbbr6FJSAh5ucwMR)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1957-11-06-usa-dante.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923234295&usg=AOvVaw3G7mWSpPMYxCzGe87b-VbL) August 17, 2006)

November 6 — US scientists are “pretty shook up” about the recent UFO sightings, according to astronomer [Charles F.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.alpo-astronomy.org/jbeish/ChickCapen.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923234641&usg=AOvVaw1mli36d2lURQOGTnLOevu6) [“Chick” Capen](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.alpo-astronomy.org/jbeish/ChickCapen.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923234871&usg=AOvVaw2Cwapt29LMEy95Sc6KLZc-) in the November 7 El Paso Times. However, Capen talks more about missile launches and lunar photography than UFO sightings. (“[Sighting ‘Shakes’ Scientists,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99804264/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923235337&usg=AOvVaw313o9N24s7MpxHGtyTmeMp)” El Paso (Tex.) Times, November 7, 1957, p. 21; “[El Pasoans Take Look](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99803781/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923235637&usg=AOvVaw0ttq30EdgF2NrY0LYRUWUR) [at Sputnik,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99803893/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923235931&usg=AOvVaw26xCUU8VPrObI4Uzw8Pz9o)” El Paso (Tex.) Times, November 7, 1957, pp. 1, 3; Swords 264)

November 6 — 5:00 p.m. Two Malay fisherman are in a waterway near Bagansiapiapi, Sumatra, Indonesia, when they see a black and red object swiftly approaching their boat and trailing black and greenish smoke. The top and bottom of the object are curved like discs. When it is 60 feet away it stops in mid-air about 35 feet above the water, and the bottom part continues to rotate as the water foams below it. The object is a triangular shape and white smoke is coming out from each point. The object speeds up and disappears, leaving behind black and greenish smoke lines. (Marler 133)

November 6 — Early evening. [Varine “Rene” Gilham](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/143536580/varine-n_rene_-gilham&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923236493&usg=AOvVaw27cDTy34RxpTG40xLhVEAR) sees a brilliant object radiating a strong red light as he is using an outhouse on his farm near Merom, Indiana. The whole farm and surrounding area are bathed in the light for 10 minutes. A small object joins the larger one and the light grows more intense. The two objects fly away. The next day, Gilham has “sunburn” in many places. Two days later he is admitted to a hospital for treatment. (NICAP, “[Merom/Gilham Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/meromrep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923236764&usg=AOvVaw1sdPrlRcg9csTigyNxtTcA)”; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-6.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923236996&usg=AOvVaw1tggJO675quCE1jtEGsG7S)

* * *

[November 6th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-6.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923237343&usg=AOvVaw1S4yUAnRcZbKa11E-flXhO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-6.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923237499&usg=AOvVaw1KzcbDYTXiNefPPn3P8CmV) The Author, 1997, pp. 67, 72–73. Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-6-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923237768&usg=AOvVaw01k-5M9jsyNldGx9pIiOua) [a History: 1957 November 6th, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-6-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923237993&usg=AOvVaw2IXpAu73g8fL3rmZKgzexG), The Author, 2003, pp. 6–7; Michael D. Swords, “Messing Around with the Force,” IUR 31, no. 4 (March 2008): 30)

November 6 — 8:02 p.m. Six people in Toronto, Ontario, watch a yellow-white light travel silently from south to north across the eastern sky. One experiences static on his TV set as the object passes, slower than a meteor. (Aimé Michel, Straight-Line, pp. 248–249; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923238581&usg=AOvVaw3QEzqBF6ts7R_3aVDITp6w)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923238803&usg=AOvVaw34thyQohhK7ufFt0M4Yr9C) pp. 80–81)

November 6 — Night. Two state policemen in Danville, Illinois, observe a brilliant white light that changes color successively to amber and orange. They chase it for 15 miles because the light appears to be low in the sky. During the chase, their communications radio does not function. The light eventually flies out of sight. (“[2 State](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99808224/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923239125&usg=AOvVaw19BkVadrXnkST91ZQalAIu) [Troopers See ‘Object,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99808224/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923239408&usg=AOvVaw2ICSLBqoik_o5dfbqKVuFK)” Hammond (Ind.) Times, November 7, 1957, p. 12; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923239732&usg=AOvVaw21v1TdW8HPRFMUAcvfLvqa)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923239931&usg=AOvVaw3tITbdqZ6nk6RlHsqT8aHG) pp. 91–92)

November 6 — 9:00 p.m. Jacques Jacobsen and three others are in a hunting lodge on the Baskatong Reservoir, Quebec, listening to a battery-powered radio. Outside, they see a glowing, yellow-white sphere 2–3 miles away to the southwest. It remains in place for 15 minutes. During this time the radio goes off, and one of the men’s shortwave radios is working on only one frequency that emits a strong, rapidly modulated tone that sounds like, but is not, Morse code. The UFO rises into the clouds and the radios function normally again. (Aimé Michel, Straight-Line, pp. 248–249; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923240366&usg=AOvVaw2pc5u0msSeNsAzhBRlNNsB)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923240546&usg=AOvVaw2S48hW-db6dNrmq1i97Ein) pp. 79–80; Randle, Levelland, 2021, p. 114)

November 6 — 9:43 p.m. [Kenneth J. Delano](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/179862761/kenneth-j_-delano&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923241003&usg=AOvVaw2xNLykWh0l2YLXZ6GNMXJH), who is participating in aurora and meteor watches for the International Geophysical Year, is observing the sky at St. Mary’s Seminary in Baltimore, Maryland, when he sees a brilliant white light in the northwest. He watches it approach until it is nearly overhead. Then a faint, silvery-gray, elliptical disc is visible for a few seconds above the light. It is silent, except for a faint whirring sound. He watches it for a total of 4 minutes until it passes behind some buildings. (Kenneth J. Delano, “UFO over Baltimore,” IUR 32, no. 4 (October 2009): 17–18, 24)

November 6 — 11:30 p.m. Olden J. Moore is driving home in Montville, Ohio, when he sees an object like a bright meteor split into two pieces, one of which heads straight up. The other becomes larger while its color changes from bright white to blue green. It hovers about 200 feet above a field and lands with a soft whirring sound, perhaps 500 feet away. Moore watches cautiously for 15 minutes, then approaches it. The UFO is shaped like a “covered dish,” and is about 50 feet in diameter, 15 feet high, with a cone on top about 10 feet high. It is pulsating slowly, and a haze surrounds it. Moore goes home to get another witness (his wife) but when they return the UFO is gone. Mrs. Moore reports the sighting to County Sheriff [Louis Robusky](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/107231232/louis-arthur-robusky&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923241671&usg=AOvVaw1pUjWLiXEFvE1TxebH7bp5) the next morning, and a civil defense director, Kenneth Locke, visits the site. Locke finds high levels of radioactivity (a maximum of 150 microroentgens/hour, suggestive of an approximately one-hour radionuclide half-life or less) two perfectly formed holes six inches in diameter, and unusual footprints that come from nowhere and go nowhere. (NICAP, “[Olden](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571106montville_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923242016&usg=AOvVaw1YJRykJBmag9Rebrz0qrFu) [Moore Case / Close Encounter](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571106montville_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923242206&usg=AOvVaw0MpRncpeOScaI-U7VAULFH)”; UFOEv, [pp. 169–170](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D181%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923242469&usg=AOvVaw0xe-DldRRXLh4t6qnRduGu); Center for UFO Studies, \[[case files](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufohistoryfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/63C.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923242681&usg=AOvVaw1XqctQNfzykfUy7hZAFSm-)\]; Clark III 772–773, 950; Sparks, p. 257)

November 7 — 1:45–1:55 a.m. Seven airmen at Holloman Air Force Base near Alamogordo, New Mexico—Bradford Rickets, James Cole, Dennis Murphy, Wayne Hurlburt, and Harry Uhlrich—see a UFO while on duty at a salvage yard on the north side of the base. The object makes a whistling noise and turns from white to orange to red. (Lorenzen, FSHoax, [pp. 100–101](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/1966CoralLorenzenFlyingSaucersTheStartlingEvidenceOfTheInvasionFromOuterSpacenotOCR/page/n97/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923243459&usg=AOvVaw1H6hNZjrhLx6fiVZv3g97m))

November 7 — 7:25 a.m. Truck driver Melvin Stevens stops one mile east of House, Mississippi, because a silvery “blimp” about 5 feet high and 2 feet long is blocking the road. He walks toward it, a sliding door opens, and three small, pasty-faced men about 4.5 feet tall emerge. Stevens feels paralyzed. After a short time, the beings make a military about-face and reenter the UFO, which takes off vertically. (Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT Index](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1957.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923243858&usg=AOvVaw28Ah_1XwTX9icl2TtKTrB-) [1957](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1957.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923244069&usg=AOvVaw2gMx8fM2eSk5sFV8Ixzn-V)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1957.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923244238&usg=AOvVaw2XkQmk05YTvU1vDuAGFfQ4) p. 32; Clark III 269)

November 7 — 9:20 a.m. Trent Lindsey and his wife and son Byron are driving on US Highway 54 near Orogrande, New Mexico, when Byron notices that the speedometer is jumping wildly back and forth from the top to the bottom of its range. It then stops just as suddenly. The three witnesses later see a metallic-appearing UFO high in the sky to the southwest. It continues moving away for three minutes until it was lost from view over the Organ Mountains. The speedometer functions normally after the UFO is gone. (“[Family Reports Seeing Large Object over NM,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99616431/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923244537&usg=AOvVaw3IkYPSdXFAmPLHjp8D7BTo)” Albuquerque Tribune, November 8, 1957, p. 1; Lorenzen, FSHoax, [pp. 99–100](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/1966CoralLorenzenFlyingSaucersTheStartlingEvidenceOfTheInvasionFromOuterSpacenotOCR/page/n95/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923244973&usg=AOvVaw3tShSNvR-EBXvZBXLAkCzo))

November 7 — 9:38 a.m. Mysterious radio signals on the 108 megacycle radio band are recorded by RCA Communications at Riverhead, Long Island, New York. The signal is a continuous, tone-modulated hum at a low pitch of 200 cycles per second. The FCC admits it is baffled, but suspects that it comes from a radio amateur or equipment testing in the New York City area. Another report claims that Vanguard and Federal Communications Commission watchers at 18 monitoring stations throughout the Western Hemisphere are picking up signals at

14.286 megacycles, possibly connected with Sputnik 2. The signal is a long note of low pitch followed after a few

* * *

seconds by two short notes. (“[Mystery Signals Are](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/100140952/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923245872&usg=AOvVaw3HeKRPOG-vSUisRTSutex5) [Unconnected with Satellites,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/100141149/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923246105&usg=AOvVaw3zI5P3PaS6u4zbUVgAJDGT)” Fort Myers (Fla.) News-Press,

November 8, 1957, pp. 1–2; Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 83)

November 7 — 7:46 p.m. Bright, flashing objects hover for 30 minutes over the Atomic Energy Commission’s Pantex Plant 15 miles east of Amarillo, Texas. The UFOs are reported to the State Highway Patrol office by plant guards, and a patrolman dispatched to the plant arrives at 8:15 p.m. and sees a strange light. Guards at the plant are “all shook up” from watching three objects floating 50 feet above the ground. One of the objects apparently lands on Farin Road 2373, three miles north of Highway 60. Guards tell the patrolman they tried to approach the objects by turning off their lights, “but the things would just slip away from them when they got near.” They are unable to estimate the size of the objects but seem positive “they saw more than just lights.” (NICAP, “[Lights Shake Up](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571107amarillo_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923246744&usg=AOvVaw0PE7-RP4XXHOOzlxESV1Uh) [Guards at Nuclear Plant](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571107amarillo_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923247008&usg=AOvVaw1HhSoRjfhxN-TD4cujjiK1)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923247247&usg=AOvVaw2_dsRdgAEs-0KzsHqfnh6x)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923247435&usg=AOvVaw0YG56Uh0yG3akbWs3gNlMA) p. 258)

November 7 — Night. Paul Rutledge, a packinghouse worker at Waterloo, Iowa, sees an object hovering above his garage. He can see two figures walking around inside. The object is about 30 feet long and has a shiny bottom and a glass top. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 84; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1957-11-08-usa-waterloo.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923247954&usg=AOvVaw3evE93idQnhKiMf6i9GoNF)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1957-11-08-usa-waterloo.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923248140&usg=AOvVaw2xX0VQXgZMfBSl36mwEWCg) January 24, 2007)

November 8 — 3:03 a.m. Polish-Australian astronomer [Antoni Przybylski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antoni_Przybylski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923248448&usg=AOvVaw1lFqpqXOEalK38eWSxjmgz) and Dutch-American astronomer [Bart Bok](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bart_Bok&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923248766&usg=AOvVaw0pb5RX_fi2HTMQxvq4TikS) see a vivid pink object moving slowly across the sky at Mount Stromlo Observatory near Canberra, Australia. It is visible to the naked eye for two minutes. Przybylski has just finished observing Sputnik 1 and 2, so it wasn’t a satellite or a meteor. Assistant Director [Arthur Robert Hogg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Robert_Hogg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923249083&usg=AOvVaw0rHLKXMsOHcjuY1z7XW6Ww) thinks it might be circling the earth like a satellite. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957, November 7th–12th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-7-12.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923249403&usg=AOvVaw1jarWN8OYE2ZgdFV3sz-Ox), The Author, 1998, p. 36; Michael D. Swords, “Gazing at the Moons,” IUR 32, no. 4 (October 2009): 10–11; Center for UFO Studies, “[Moonwatch Mystery Satellites, 1958–1962](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Moonwatch_Mystery_Satellites/1958-1962_Moonwatch_Mystery_Satellites.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923249808&usg=AOvVaw2srcrUCChBP8SoGnwZy0-W)”)

November 8 — 6:22 a.m. Connie Foster watches a lighted triangular object flying from southeast to northwest over Camarillo, California. It is moving with the base facing forward and has bright lights on the tips of the triangle. She watches it for nearly 30 minutes before it disappears. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-7-12.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923250176&usg=AOvVaw3YEJiH0wUnxNboSd0yVcf7) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957, November 7th–12th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-7-12.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923250376&usg=AOvVaw18F1_7EV5o73HWFgqUfIyV)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-7-12.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923250521&usg=AOvVaw3DLMXReUPCDH8dQRW2N0Bd) The Author, 1998, p. 37)

November 8 — Spencer Whedon, chief of Air Intelligence at Wright-Patterson AFB near Dayton, Ohio, tells the press that of 5,700 UFO reports received by his office since 1940, 97% have been identified satisfactorily and the other 8% remain unidentified due to insufficient information. (“[Seeing Things? No, Sky Really Red,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/100142456/the-cincinnati-post/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923250850&usg=AOvVaw2CpotytSsIMlKE8EL8I1fG)” Cincinnati (Ohio) Post, November 7, 1957, p. 8)

November 8 — 6:00 p.m. Pan Am Flight 7, a Boeing Stratocruiser flying across the Pacific mysteriously crashes midway between San Francisco and Honolulu. One of the crew is UFO witness Capt. [William H. Fortenberry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pan_Am_Flight_7&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923251185&usg=AOvVaw06o9ByqN5uocgDCZ2-BjN1). The cause of the crash is never determined. Fortenberry’s journalist son, [Ken H. Fortenberry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ken_Fortenberry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923251369&usg=AOvVaw01DWN00Ndxp2O5PJfnS6WE), suspects that the bereaved and mentally unstable purser Oliver Eugene Crosthwaite, has deliberately caused the crash, killing himself and murdering 43 innocent people in the process. (Wikipedia, “[Pan Am Flight 7](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pan_Am_Flight_7&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923251557&usg=AOvVaw0hUghFbW3mQV9tiQiXYp0k)”; Ken H. Fortenberry, Flight 7 Is Missing: The Search for My Father’s Killer, Fayetteville Mafia, 2020)

November 8 — Night. 12 female and 4 male farmworkers are in a truck on the Newhailes Road returning to Edinburgh from picking Brussels sprouts in a nursey at Musselburgh, Scotland. One of them spots a gray, round object seemingly following the truck at a distance of 60 feet. Mary Horne says it is domed on the top and bottom. It follows them for 5–10 minutes then moves off towards Portobello leaving a double vapor trail. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957, November 7th–12th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-7-12.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923251949&usg=AOvVaw0BaxF-T5WDmhAH98oikwZ3)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-7-12.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923252101&usg=AOvVaw2DdrWnHPa7c1Uqft3eyFf6) The Author, 1998, pp. 54– 55)

November 9 — 12:15 a.m. A man is driving in Sacramento, California, when his car engine and headlights fail. He looks up and sees an elongated egg-shaped object with delta-shaped wings, 150–200 feet long and 40–50 feet wide. The wings come back to about 30 feet from the rear of the fuselage. It has a bright bluish hue and leaves a bluish fluorescent trail. The sighting lasts 2–3 minutes. (Herbert S. Taylor, “An Update on Vehicle Interference Reports, Part Two,” IUR 34, no. 1 (September 2011): 19)

November 9 — 9:15 a.m. Eastern Airline pilot Capt. [Truman Gile Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/119188315/truman-gile&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923252558&usg=AOvVaw3B1-sWZfQCvHKglR87-C0t) is preparing to take off from Lafayette (Louisiana) Airport when he sees a big silvery object about 20,000 feet in the air. Gile watches it for 3 minutes and it doesn’t move. He alerts copilot James E. Hall, the stewardess, and the ground agents, and they all watch it another 5 minutes before it fades away. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-7-12.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923252831&usg=AOvVaw2wuvjbVWh6PqFq2WqmXSrG) [November 7th–12th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-7-12.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923253075&usg=AOvVaw2x2ZIPTMEe14DlcPYatbm8), The Author, 1998, pp. 61–62)

November 9 — 7:20 p.m. Several witnesses are driving 12 miles northeast of Carrizozo, New Mexico, on US Highway 54 in the vicinity of White Oaks when a large, rapidly moving light approaches their car from the south and apparently causes the vehicle’s lighting system to fail. The light changes course and speeds off to the southwest. [Jim and Coral Lorenzen](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://robert-barrow.blogspot.com/2007/05/remembering-coral-lorenzen.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923253446&usg=AOvVaw0tnKPVT3-N19VwD3ocXS10) are driving east on US Highway 380 about 10 miles east of Carrizozo when they spot an anomalous light that might be the same object. (Lorenzen, FSHoax, [pp, 101–102](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/1966CoralLorenzenFlyingSaucersTheStartlingEvidenceOfTheInvasionFromOuterSpacenotOCR/page/n97/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923253768&usg=AOvVaw1NYL7OiXPE1-O5Bnc3vc4k))

* * *

November 10 — 1:25 a.m. [Leita Mae Kuhn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/90719676/leita-mae-kuhn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923254141&usg=AOvVaw2HlZhEjuyVP9Nz5KQO5P7y) is checking the stove in her Doberman dog kennel at Madison, Ohio, when she notices a glowing, domed disc hovering 60 feet above the rear of the kennel. It is about 40 feet in diameter and emitting puffy clouds of smoke. Her eyes begin to burn after watching it for 20–30 minutes, and she runs back into the house and locks the door. She has rashes and her eyes hurt so badly she visits a doctor. (Donald E. Keyhoe and Gordon I. R. Lore Jr., [Strange Effects from UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923254455&usg=AOvVaw2DZFfdkC7ejRNaA9qmkxKN)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923254629&usg=AOvVaw0yFcOygdl7VDejq1gBOyna) NICAP, 1969, pp. 11–12; Loren E. Gross, [The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-7-12.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923254880&usg=AOvVaw00ngmhBAPWyEugbD_Xxy1K) [Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957, November 7th–12th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-7-12.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923255119&usg=AOvVaw3aR-qBLj6SLABe2Pxm5CdU), The Author, 1998, pp. 69–71; Michael D. Swords, “Messing Around with the Force,” IUR 31, no. 4 (March 2008): 30–31; Michael D. Swords, “Can UFOs Cause Physiological Effects? Part 1,” IUR 33, no. 4 (May 2011): 10)

November 10 — Residents of Skaryszew, Poland, watch a huge, radiant, cigar-shaped object slowly moving west. (Poland 20)

November 10 — Evening. UFO witness Olden Moore of Montville, Ohio, is visited by Sheriff [Robusky](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/107231232/louis-arthur-robusky&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923256056&usg=AOvVaw3JT2128ll8drcUp5ZAT8ZB), a deputy, and a USAF officer who asks him to go with them to Youngstown to be interviewed by military officers. They drive him to the field where the encounter took place and put him aboard a military helicopter. He is interviewed in Youngstown, then he is returned to the field at 11:00 p.m. (Clark III 773)

November 10 — 5:55 p.m. [Wilfred S. Hardy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209207265/wilfred-ivan_samuel-hardy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923256480&usg=AOvVaw1maAIttKXVGqtxXQ2pXwCA), an assistant safety engineer at the Tokyo, Japan, Engineer Supply Center, sees (along with his wife and a Japanese boat boy) a huge cigar-shaped object with lighted portholes above Lake Imba-numa 10 miles away. He estimates it is about 200–500 feet long. The object lights up the entire lake, then disappears to the south 10 seconds later. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 86)

November 10 — 7:00 p.m. Many people see a UFO at Hammond, Indiana. Two policemen (Sgt. [Charles J. Mauder](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48437421/charles-j_-mauder&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923256883&usg=AOvVaw0RGaGRuHGud6kXCbEQopMm), Office Steve Betuslak) see a red and white light hovering 500–1,000 feet overhead. They hear a beeping sound and there is interference on the police radio while the object is in view. Another witness sees a green light on a basket-shaped object; his car radio fails. The lights fly away when anyone tries to approach. (Aimé Michel, Straight-Line, p. 268; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923257287&usg=AOvVaw0W8rOAMcw_-NOP8bQ6jOF_), pp. 92–95; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-7-12.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923257498&usg=AOvVaw2bbhh7JJLwsWmiYukmxP4-) [History: 1957, November 7th–12th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-7-12.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923257686&usg=AOvVaw0kCk1WZTnotR4sz2XQCQYY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-7-12.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923257859&usg=AOvVaw1lybbr-xOZAZs9jarPg1vY) The Author, 1998, pp. 73, 75)

November 10 — Night. French astronomer Jacques Chapuis at Toulouse Observatory in France observes a maneuvering, yellow, star-like object for 5 minutes. It ascends straight up out of sight. (UFOEv, [p. 50](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D62%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923258186&usg=AOvVaw2jhFVNDrm7JGbf0IDwX-Ar))

November 11 — A silvery elliptical UFO is seen flying below Western Airlines Flight 61 over the desert east of Los Angeles, California. Robert D. Hahn, a jewelry designer, is a passenger and describes it as a large, elliptical, metallic object with dark patches zigzagging about 200 feet above the ground. (UFOEv, [p. 67](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D79%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923258476&usg=AOvVaw06cz044RFO8P8RgpQe3X5V))

November 13 — An object explodes over the State Hospital at Crownsville, Maryland, and two or three burned pieces of metal fall on the hospital grounds. It is recovered by employees William A. Zick and J. Caswell. The pieces are checked for radiation and confiscated by army intelligence officers at Fort George G. Meade. They are apparently sent to the Air Research and Development Center in Baltimore. An ARD colonel tells NICAP member and WFBR news director [Lou Corbin](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/corbin/index.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923258767&usg=AOvVaw3afTfSHIoWS0VFQ06x4RlQ) that he has no idea what the metal is. Some of the material is perhaps sent to ATIC. (“[Metal Object from Skies Rushed to ATIC for Analysis,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/003%2520JANUARY%25201958.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923259094&usg=AOvVaw2FJY3qWhQG5c2bV9cH2Gw4)” UFO Investigator 1, no. 3 (January 1958): 5–6)

November 14 — Afternoon. [Evalyn Riead](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22308264/evalyn-riead&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923259672&usg=AOvVaw3CLc7DWdjqub0wxwhXwGtU) hears a sputtering noise like someone is pulling into her driveway in Tamaroa, Illinois. She looks outside and sees a bright, moon-shaped object with a tail moving above the trees bordering US Highway 51. It disappears after 5–6 booms and 3 flashes of light. As soon as this happens, the lights in her home go out. Electrical power in a 4-mile area between Tamaroa and Du Bois is interrupted for 10 minutes. Power is restored when the company closes an open circuit breaker, but they could find no cause. (“[Current Cut Off As](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99860979/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923260132&usg=AOvVaw0wq80nStg8cevfkTEq09Oc) [Flying ‘Thing’ Appears in Illinois,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99860979/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923260439&usg=AOvVaw1EJaWt72k8GJgM6yuQhQzA)” Lima (Ohio) Citizen, November 15, 1957, p. 10; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923260951&usg=AOvVaw3C9P7yn7KLBCPQLBIxD1Pd)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923261272&usg=AOvVaw0rH3vCj3SkWekodbsVkkI5) pp. 140–141)

Mid-November — The US Senate Committee on Government Operations, chaired by Sen. [John L. McClellan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_L._McClellan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923261729&usg=AOvVaw3yXy9JIKCaUWbnlXIEyHSA) (D-Ark.), begins an inquiry into UFOs. [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923262125&usg=AOvVaw3_d7I-WFuWuuLWTT8B2FR3) is called to give testimony. (Ruppelt, 1960 ed., p. 253)

November 16 — Afternoon. [Cynthia Appleton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.thefreelibrary.com/The%252Briddle%252Bof%252BBrum%2527s%252Balien%252Bbaby%253B%252B44%252BYEARS%252BON%253A%252BWHERE%252BIS%252B%2527BOY%252BFROM...-a096940811&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923262774&usg=AOvVaw0lVXC-yqHv-tI-cdAnsAel) blacks out unexpectedly at her home in 87 Fentham Road in Aston, a suburb of Birmingham, England. On November 19, she feels faint again as the light outside dims, and a man with blond hair and wearing coveralls materializes in the center of the room. She hears him speaking to her telepathically. He tells her not to be afraid and that he is from a world he calls Gharnasvarn (which we know as Venus) and he shows her what seems to be a holographic image of two spaceships. She has other visitations by entities on January 7 and February 7, 1958. In September 1958, the spaceman informs her that she is pregnant, which is apparently true, as she gives birth on June 2, 1958, to a boy with blond hair that she and her husband Ron name Matthew. Appleton says the Venusians visited her a few more times, but the trail grows cold in July 1960. (“[Birmingham Woman Meets Spacemen,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CMar-Apr%252CV%25204%252CN%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923263366&usg=AOvVaw1OQKf0bejwNHI1H7Y7k4Nd)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 2 (March/April 1958): 5–6; Jenny Randles, “A Visitor from Gharnasvarn,” IUR 13, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1988): 4–8; Birmingham Sunday Mercury, January 26, 2003; Andy Roberts, “The Space Baby,” Fortean Times 191 (December 2004): 32–38; Bill Chalker, “[Flying Saucery, Cosmic Bethlehem, and Midwich Cuckoos: The Cynthia Appleton Contacts (1957–1959),](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.auforn.com/Bill_Chalker_34.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923264155&usg=AOvVaw04UCiVkeKOMluyru9el3cd)” Australian UFO Researcher Bill Chalker, 2005)

* * *

November 17 — An Air Force car with two officers comes to UFO witness Olden Moore’s house in Montville, Ohio. He is told they are taking him to Washington, D.C., for extended questioning. They drive him to a waiting airplane, which stops briefly at Wright-Patterson AFB to pick up one officer and drop another off. In Washington, Moore is housed in a building said to be a federal courthouse \[US Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces?\]. He is kept there and interrogated for several days. Officers watch him constantly, even when he is sleeping. Toward the end of his stay, Moore is shown slides of UFO photos and a UFO film taken from inside a military plane. Moore is asked to sign a document that swears him to secrecy. (UFOEv, [p. 114](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D126%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923264928&usg=AOvVaw1aOI-xgUSRuoe9YuZ39En6); Clark III 773)

November 21 — The Army Chief of Research and Development responds to CONARC’s October 22 request on the feasibility of building a manned “flying saucer,” stating that he had reviewed the Avrocar disc concept and that it looked promising. (Richard P. Weinert, History of Army Aviation, 1950–1962, US Army Training and Doctrine Command, November 1976, [pp. 220–221](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/DTIC_ADA236573/page/n225/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923265490&usg=AOvVaw0OScSvklkqlXk2-BHsE_7v); Wikipedia, “[Avro Canada VZ-9 Avrocar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avro_Canada_VZ-9_Avrocar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923265707&usg=AOvVaw3dsWvHp2mU8awgUvjeuZcU)”)

November 21 — Merchant [Hans Haugaard Hansen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.geni.com/people/Hans-Haugaard-Hansen/6000000021669778682&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923266057&usg=AOvVaw2dptBBs4D4vWygV7Yz8X1E) is driving out of Gesten, Denmark, on the road to Egholt when he sees a triangular UFO moving low over a field some 300–600 feet away. It is emitting a red or orange light and makes no sound. The bottom of the object is solid, but the upper part is transparent, and he can see two figures inside. He stops the car to watch as it moves about 40 mph. Similar objects are seen at Jordrup and Vorbasse. (“[Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CJul-Aug%252CV%25204%252CN%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923266402&usg=AOvVaw30udw29I7kAGe56zAiU-ri) [Saucer Reports Pour in from Denmark,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CJul-Aug%252CV%25204%252CN%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923266669&usg=AOvVaw0imLid7kdAUGZh3qJRpPGA)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1958): 2; Loren E. Gross, [The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-13-30.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923267129&usg=AOvVaw0QWMuz0dIdFgOp1v4RIfzV) [Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957, November 13th–30th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-13-30.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923267410&usg=AOvVaw2Tg-sOZhImnW6Vr9PyBGza)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Nov-13-30.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923267631&usg=AOvVaw1urgrGDYs6G1Je-pxSO6u2) The Author, 1998, p. 56; Willy Wegner, “[UFO bogen, Kapitel 19: Rumfolkene viser sig,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.skeptica.dk/?p%3D8019&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923267930&usg=AOvVaw3t-34OSqsvS8-7d_vijTW8)” Skeptica, September 1, 2004)

November 21 — Night. Frank Dickenson and two friends are driving up Reasty Hill near the village of Silpho, North Yorkshire, England, when their car stalls and they see a glowing object in the sky that appears to fall to the ground on a ridge above Broxa Forest. Dickenson leaves the car with a flashlight, climbs up a bank, and finds in a patch of bracken a metallic saucer shaped like a “large flattish spinning top,” 18 inches in diameter and weighing 33 pounds. As he returns to tell his friends, he passes a young couple walking toward the scene. When the tree men return to search for it, the disc is gone. Dickenson places an advertisement in a Scarborough newspaper about the disc, and he is able to recover it for £10 from a man who claims he was the mystery man on the moor. Photos taken by UFO researcher John Dale show that the copper base of the object is inscribed with a mystery script. The top of the disc is made from layers of laminated metal that has been painted with a white substance. The two halves are stuck together with a grayish substance resembling cellulose, and a pencil-thick iron rod runs through a “white metal bearing” in the top. When the bearing is drilled out, they find a heap of ash inside the cavity, as well as pieces of fused glass and a tightly rolled cylinder of copper. Also inside is a tiny booklet of 17 sheets of thin copper foil fastened at one edge. The booklet is engraved with script similar to that found on the outside. The coded script is translated by a café proprietor from Scarborough named Philip Longbottom, who claims the 2,000- word inscription is from an alien named Ulo, with later text added by an apparently female companion named Tarngee. A metallurgist at the University of Manchester analyzes the disc and finds the outer casing is made primarily from lead, and the copper foil is triple laminated an unusually free from impurities. In 2017, [David](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Clarke_(journalist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923268500&usg=AOvVaw168dGj_6F0e6YwMo03znXi) [Clarke](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Clarke_(journalist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923268708&usg=AOvVaw1HlitYAapF47H1vwE9Rswm) discovers that five specimens from the Silpho disc have been preserved in a tin cigarette box housed in London’s Science Museum. The specimens were sent to aviation historian [Charles Harvard Gibbs-Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Harvard_Gibbs-Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923269061&usg=AOvVaw0-ZZ6bno9m8r-dFLrEBy_u) in 1963 by Essex ufologist C. C. Stevens for analysis. Gibbs-Smith judged the items to be of terrestrial origin, and they were donated to the Science Museum with his papers after his death in 1981. Veteran Scarborough Evening News editor Mick Jefferson said in 2003 the newspaper had long ago exposed the object as a hoax made from a “domestic hot-water cylinder.” However, the hoaxers have never surfaced. (“[The Silpho Moor Mystery,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CMar-Apr%252CV%25204%252CN%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923269447&usg=AOvVaw0vSoOagS1Jc5Nnnk4X5yxm)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 2 (March/April 1958): 4; “[Silpho Moor Controversy,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CJul-Aug%252CV%25204%252CN%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923269737&usg=AOvVaw0FwhYp6d5d_X7jfhjd-so2)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1958): 19; Philip Longbottom, “[The Silpho Moor Mystery,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CNov-Dec%252CV%25204%252CN%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923270039&usg=AOvVaw0jSWpEp7a4GyInkyPQX0om)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1958): 15–17; Jenny Randles, UFO Retrievals, Blandford, 1995, [pp. 77–82](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/uforetrievalsrec0000rand/page/76/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923270375&usg=AOvVaw3mZo0SdQVzq3P_rXwoHdP5); David Clarke, “The Return of the Silpho Moor Saucer,” Fortean Times 364 (March 2018): 42–46)

November 23 — 6:10 p.m. Fighter pilot 1st Lt. Joseph F. Long’s car engine stalls 30 miles west of Tonopah, Nevada. He hears a high-pitched whining noise and sees four 50-foot, domed, saucer-shaped UFOs landed on the right side of the road about 900–1,200 feet away. They are glowing brightly and equipped with three landing gears. Long estimates they are about 10–15 feet tall. When he approaches to within 50 feet of the closest object, the hum increases in intensity and Long’s ears begin to hurt. The objects take off abruptly, retracting the landing gears.

The rise about 50 feet into the air and proceed across the highway to the north at about 10 mph. The total time of the sighting is 20 minutes. Shallow, bowl-shaped ground impressions in the shape of a triangle are found at the landing site. (NICAP, “[Four Huge Saucers Land near Car, Engine Stalls](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571123tonopah_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923270870&usg=AOvVaw3mkgcc2a80NZbwq1vwVDaU)”; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 182–186](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/182/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923271103&usg=AOvVaw35Vda_Li0WyWgpVePlUl0V); Good Need, [pp. 222–223](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/222/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923271362&usg=AOvVaw2xpiWsmlxuci95Hp640Jgg)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/222/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923271509&usg=AOvVaw3B9U9xV9UpClfbU-EZZGAq) [228](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/228/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923271698&usg=AOvVaw3HWnvEfOq3nw5IQcQ4udqB); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923271903&usg=AOvVaw1ExkOaiRgSGmOErl01Q6cf), p. 259; Randle, Levelland, 2021, pp. 101–106)

November 23 — 7:30 p.m. Six truck drivers watch a strange object with three lights in a triangular pattern hovering above a field off State Highway 8 just north of the Butler Valley Turnpike exit in Richland Township, Allegheny

* * *

County, Pennsylvania. It has a green light at the bottom, a red light at the right corner, and a yellow light at the left corner. They get out of their car and approach the object, but when they are 75 feet away, it moves to the east, then south. They go back to the car and shine their lights on the object, which is about 20 feet above some trees. The lights go out and the object disappears. (“[3-Lighted ‘Whatsit’ Floats over Field,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99081594/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923272572&usg=AOvVaw0klN_p9KVu7oIzDERcnJ7V)” Pittsburgh (Pa.) Sun- Telegraph, November 27, 1957, p. 3)

November 25 — 10:00 p.m. All the lights in the town of Mogi Mirim, São Paulo, Brazil, suddenly dim and fail.

Numerous people see a circular light traveling directly overhead. Two similar lights follow a short time later. The blackout only lasts 5 minutes, but the power station has no explanation. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923273229&usg=AOvVaw13ACCS9UA8fwil3yq8lYui)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923273442&usg=AOvVaw0xuiRndZwmpK8hS5TmWz6P) pp. 141–142)

November 27 — The director of an engineering firm and four of his staff members see five black, disc-shaped objects hovering in the French Alps for 8 minutes. The group performs a series of maneuvers, after which a parachute- shaped object emerges from one of them. Suddenly they all shoot away at supersonic speed toward the Swiss border. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 87)

November 28 — 8:30 p.m. Regino Lacuesta is driving on the Hawaii Belt Road near Ninole, Hawaii, when his car engine begins missing. Suddenly he sees a bright flash of light 20 feet above the highway in front of him. The engine dies, the headlights go out, and the car rolls to a stop at the point where the light had been. Lacuesta feels numb and cannot move. Soon the headlights come on and the car starts up again, although it is in high gear and he has not touched the starter. He drives straight home. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923274035&usg=AOvVaw3NsFpITK034jmFhS1EsvBp), pp. 49–51)

November 29 — 2:30 a.m. Capt. Fred Sutton, skipper of the fishing trawler Ella Hewett, is 4 miles off Port Jack, Douglas, Isle of Man, when an orange ball of fire crosses the sky. As it passes over the hull of the small boat, the vessel grows luminous, with firefly-like sparks of luminescence everywhere. The fireball bursts like fireworks, seen by others on the island as well as Scotland. The crew notices that the white paint on the metal railings at the edge of the boat has disappeared, leaving only the red undercoating. At daybreak, however, the paintwork is perfectly normal again. (Jenny Randles, “Mysterious Island: The UFO Legacy of the Isle of Man,” IUR 29, no. 1 (Spring 2004): 13–14)

November 29 — Two German expatriates, G. R. Miczaika and Eberhart W. Wahl, form Project Space Track in Building 1535 of the Geophysics Research Directorate at the Air Force Cambridge Research Center at Hanscom AFB in Bedford, Massachusetts. Its mission is to track and compute orbits for all artificial earth satellites and space probes, including US and Soviet payloads, booster rockets, and debris. (Wikipedia, “[Project Space Track](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Space_Track&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923274798&usg=AOvVaw3I1c6mnnnHyFWdQu11_ArR)”)

December — National Intelligence Estimate (NIE) 11-10-57 predicts that the Soviets will “probably have a first operational capability with up to 10 prototype ICBMs” at “sometime during the period from mid-1958 to mid- 1959.” The numbers of the missile gap start to inflate. (Wikipedia, “[Missile gap](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Missile_gap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923275289&usg=AOvVaw09nUYRihpoJFyLRvWUc6n3)”)

December — A classified Canadian Department of National Defence memorandum states that the “RCAF has no official policy concerning the subject” of UFOs and “there has never been a serious investigation of any report on file” at RCAF headquarters. (Gregory M. Kanon, “[UFOs and the Canadian Government, Part One,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Canada/Canadian%2520UFO%2520Report%2520(Magor)/Canadian%2520UFO%2520Report%2520-%2520vol%25203%2520no%25206%2520-%25201975.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923275625&usg=AOvVaw2I8xgkS3kdKzCakYpJDxNd)” no. 22 (1975): 22)

December — Several UFO sightings take place along the Finland-Russia border. A cigar-shaped object is seen by two Finnish farmers moving horizontally at a high altitude from west to east. (Good Above, [pp. 307–308](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/306/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923276025&usg=AOvVaw0YTDSpqsglglBVJhh1ojhZ))

December — Walter K. Buhler launches the Sociedade Brasiliera de Estudos sobre Discos Voadores in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. It publishes the Boletim SBEDV through 1988. ([Boletim SBEDV](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Brazil/SBEDV/SBEDV%2520-%2520No%2520001%2520-%25201957.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923276381&usg=AOvVaw2K5jUj6id8tBru7cGi1e5M), no. 1 (December 1957))

December — Night. Edmund Rucker is awakened by a roaring noise in El Cajon, California, and watches a strange object land near his house. Its windows are lighted and he can see some strange-looking heads inside. An opening becomes visible, and four creatures emerge. They have large heads, dome-like foreheads, and bulging eyeballs.

They deliver a message to Rucker in English, saying they have philanthropic and scientific purposes. (Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1957-12-usa-elcajon.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923276771&usg=AOvVaw0qWQ6cI3Hq238kFg3e-SDl)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1957-12-usa-elcajon.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923276946&usg=AOvVaw3kn55_cpTsPzNmj7lWvPbI) July 28, 2007; Mark Cashman, “Behavioral Classification System for UFO Occupants,” IUR 24, no. 1 (Spring 1999): 19)

December — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923277258&usg=AOvVaw2pIajvluHfyT88Z912OKbg) is invited to appear on the CBS Armstrong Circle Theater anthology drama TV program hosted by [Douglas Edwards](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_Edwards&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923277519&usg=AOvVaw0Ol3lSJDbQWN8UmrN5nWmh) to talk about UFOs with [Kenneth Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923277720&usg=AOvVaw00qMrChXdkOHrd_EEg0ie2) and [Clarence S. Chiles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22086850/clarence-shipe-chiles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923277958&usg=AOvVaw1K6O8t0VDBCVGiVdTwSvDt)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22086850/clarence-shipe-chiles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923278109&usg=AOvVaw3iJo_BLezwHWwHzqMZ9C8m) Others invited are [Edward J.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923278307&usg=AOvVaw1Isc4sYEL1NDUlkN4h2Taz) [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923278470&usg=AOvVaw3sw74aKKda8enyEd22Nqgf)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923278597&usg=AOvVaw2E_QDx6P_YHfs9ZH6cYWqT) [Donald Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923278765&usg=AOvVaw3l1McY2I0Rj0iBrN7NVVQM)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923278922&usg=AOvVaw3JLQqYeZV_oixHDQkd9hP5) and an Air Force representative. But Keyhoe finds out that it will not be a panel discussion but a scripted conversation, and he will only have 7 minutes. He is promised he will have final say over his part of the script, and he agrees. However, writer [Irve Tunick](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1987/09/10/obituaries/irve-tunick-dies-at-75-led-tv-writers-group.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923279165&usg=AOvVaw3mLwmZXjrVVVnCdxrXkVBA) cuts out critical portions of Keyhoe’s material (including references to the Estimate of the Situation and the Robertson Panel), saying it is too long.

Ruppelt, Chiles, and Arnold soon withdraw from the program, expanding Keyhoe’s segment to 11 minutes. (Clark III 167–168)

December 1 — 1:30 a.m. Swissair pilot [Walter Borner](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.pionnair-ge.com/spip1/spip.php?article127&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923279579&usg=AOvVaw2D0Ec8zbo2KDWErfEL38b8) is flying a DC-6B at 18,000 feet over Ras El-Kanayis, Egypt, when he sees a “giant, red, burning cylinder falling down vertically, leaving a yellowish trail.” It is possible that this is

* * *

the reentry of the final stage of the rocket that launched Sputnik I. (Luis Schoenherr, “Unknown Missiles,” IUR

19, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1994): 22)

December 3 — 2:30 p.m. [Z. Thad Fogl](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/f/FoglThad/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923280105&usg=AOvVaw3KG_6Nb8-V_G3GUTPRrr3A), radio officer of the SS Ramsey, claims to have taken a photo of a saucer off the coast of San Pedro, California. The photo appears in Flying Saucer Review in 1959 and Life in 1966. However, in 1967 Fogl admits that he had faked the photo using parts of plastic airplane models. (NICAP, “[Disc with Landing](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/5712XXcalifornia_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923280566&usg=AOvVaw3O-REiyRVSfvT30cLcKweE) [Gear Photo / Fogl Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/5712XXcalifornia_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923280737&usg=AOvVaw20qfXa3RI6aSgNEeNe-e8x)”; “[Radio Officer’s Amazing Story: UFO Snapped from Ship,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1959%252CJan-Feb%252CV%25205%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923280970&usg=AOvVaw1JwNmTad0aDlX4H_DeaPNH)” Flying Saucer Review 5, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1959): 6–7; “[A Hoax Exposed,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923281241&usg=AOvVaw196F3tgl6YfuJ6UNTVobyl)” Flying Saucer Review 12, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1966): 7)

December 3 — 7:00 p.m. Many residents of the Menastash Ridge area of Ellensburg, Washington, watch a “strange ball of fire” for 20 minutes. A truck driver sees the light hovering above his truck, causing the motor to cough and sputter. His engine does not stop completely, however, so he drives away. The night is misty, but the object is so bright that it lights up the sky as if it were daytime. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923281624&usg=AOvVaw3ni64Cs-FxTSGEaupqjFSm)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923281799&usg=AOvVaw3e54Yh4TnPNyO2h88Cguz8) pp. 51–52)

December 4 — Blue Book Capt. [George T. Gregory](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/158570232/george-thurston-gregory&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923282145&usg=AOvVaw05I4kUyAN9fO_4wmYSEPah) complains that as a result of pressure from the press and public, “Assistant Secretary of Defense requested that ATIC immediately submit a preliminary analysis to the press” of the Levelland, Texas, cases, even though he has “limited data.” (J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [p. 147](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/146/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923282510&usg=AOvVaw2Q3Fxd8jCiaB_c2vIrpnOu))

December 6 — A letter written to contactee [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923282904&usg=AOvVaw0Z91wRyldIyqAxMmtv57_g) on State Department stationery from R. E. Straith, Cultural Exchange Committee, is a hoax concocted by ufologists [Gray Barker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gray_Barker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923283128&usg=AOvVaw3hwqrw23yujBnQ6L13WBt1) and [James W. Moseley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_W._Moseley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923283401&usg=AOvVaw3ipvtwGKjp7Tv8JuO-kWBU). The letter informs Adamski that the State Department knows his claims are true and they encourage his activities. (James D. Villard, “[The ‘R. E. Straith’ Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Saucers%2520(Max%2520B%2520Miller)/Saucers%2520vol%25206%2520no%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923283763&usg=AOvVaw1dXpv80VEoNEzqBZzTeW3M)” Saucers 6, no. 4 (Winter 1958/1959): 2–6; Clark III 44–45; Saucer Smear, January 10, 1985; Lou Zinsstag and Timothy Good, George Adamski: The Untold Story, Ceti, 1983, pp. 148–153; James W. Moseley and Karl T. Pflock, Shockingly Close to the Truth! Confessions of a Grave-Robbing Ufologist, Prometheus, 2002, pp. 124–127, 381–402; Marc Hallet, [A Critical Appraisal of George Adamski: The Man Who](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ACriticalAppraisalOfGeorgeAdamskiTheManWhoSpokeToTheSpaceBrothersREVISEDANDENLARGEDEDITION2016/page/n1/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923284697&usg=AOvVaw1Bpz8ckLjXDQDihH8dy6tI) [Spoke to the Space Brothers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ACriticalAppraisalOfGeorgeAdamskiTheManWhoSpokeToTheSpaceBrothersREVISEDANDENLARGEDEDITION2016/page/n1/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923285166&usg=AOvVaw0nQJSi0i7khrAKSrmT1jkH)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ACriticalAppraisalOfGeorgeAdamskiTheManWhoSpokeToTheSpaceBrothersREVISEDANDENLARGEDEDITION2016/page/n1/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923285518&usg=AOvVaw0qwy16cgCameM3PrSrZMRA) The Author, 2016)

December 7 — 10:00 p.m. In western Victoria and eastern South Australia, witnesses see a moon-like object explode with a vivid flash. Unexpected blackouts are reported in the area. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 87)

December 8 — 5:30 p.m. A disc-shaped UFO with a dome and three pads on the underside suddenly comes toward a car with three passengers at Woodward, Oklahoma. The car heater, wipers, and radio fail and finally the car stalls out as the UFO hovers overhead at 200 feet. It emits a high-pitched whining sound. It is over 50 feet in diameter and has portholes. The whine increases in pitch after about two minutes, and the UFO rises vertically out of sight. The headlights come on and the engine of the car starts by itself. The driver spends 4 hours with two officers from Kirtland AFB in New Mexico who tell him of similar observations. (Vallée, Magonia, [pp. 267–268](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/passporttomagoni0000vall/page/266/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923286500&usg=AOvVaw1GS1m8P2pT3vJzY_Kxf-MY))

December 8 — 9:00 p.m. Eight people traveling together in two cars on Highway 17 between Coulee City and Soap Lake, Washington, see a huge, fiery object pass overhead from north to south. Both cars stall out and their headlights also fail as the UFO passes overhead. In addition, the inside dome lights come on, even though they aren’t turned on. The cars remain stalled until the object passes out of sight. Police say the object stalled as many as six cars along that sparsely traveled road. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923287056&usg=AOvVaw0gQiXpPpPmKbh7JFTd8WSb), pp. 52–53)

December 11 — Night. Mexican pilot Gilberto Castillo del Valle is flying at 10,000 feet near Mexico City when a brilliant light illuminates his cockpit. He turns off the aircraft lights and sees a large luminous object darting from left to right and back again ahead of him. Passengers and crew also see the light, as do personnel at the Mexico City control tower. (Lorenzen, UFOs; The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 88)

December 5 — Morning. An unidentified beeping sound is picked up for three minutes on KBR Rural Public Power Radio in Ainsworth, Nebraska, operating at 72.3 AM. (“[Unidentified Beeping Heard on KBR Power Radio on](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/100167452/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923287774&usg=AOvVaw0avUALvd__h2Njjkhgh9-5) [Thursday,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/100167452/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923288065&usg=AOvVaw1BFlSohGTS19cP8ACUQ8Po)” Ainsworth (Neb.) Star-Journal, December 12, 1957, p. 1)

December 12 — A USAF pilot attains 1,208 mph in a McDonnell F-101A Voodoo at Edwards AFB, California. (Wikipedia, “[McDonnell F-101 Voodoo](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/McDonnell_F-101_Voodoo&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923288628&usg=AOvVaw2neBMNCzXApJitXPrGeT54)”)

December 12 — 5:45 p.m. At least 13 witnesses see a bright light over the Sea of Japan. The object is tracked on radar and seen through binoculars. At 7:22 p.m., a scramble is ordered and two F-86D’s take off from Misawa Air Base, Japan. Multiple radar and visual sightings take place over the next three days. (NICAP, “[Jets Scrambled](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571212misawa_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923289115&usg=AOvVaw0yQo7WQXtCwwySsoEUeREv) [after Radar/Visual UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/571212misawa_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923289414&usg=AOvVaw05tiFwVJb31hWpIB00wpdP)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923289701&usg=AOvVaw1Frr64TuBSlypVJKN_Es8T)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923289933&usg=AOvVaw0wIUjNG-_xexHPIVob4KbW) p. 261)

December 14 — Night. Ed Waslashi sees a lighted green object fall into a haystack on his farm at Langdon, North Dakota. He picks out a strange metallic substance from the ashes of the burned hay. The material finds its way to geologist [Nicholas N. Kohanowski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21539755/nicholas-n-kohanowski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923290416&usg=AOvVaw3UvdTgJsPT1PVajvpy__hM) at the University of North Dakota, who finds that it is light, porous, and mostly magnesium dioxide. (“[What Is It?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/100146678/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923290771&usg=AOvVaw3aOjXQtTAMOVIievXLLCaN)” Winona (Minn.) Daily News, December 17, 1957, p 1; Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 87)

* * *

December 15 — 1:00–2:00 a.m. Three young men see a huge light in the sky at Almind, Denmark. It is oval-shaped, emits red or orange rays, and appears to be descending. They watch it for 18–19 minutes as it hovers at a 10° angle and quivers. Suddenly it becomes still and from its center emerge two small objects that drift away in a northerly direction and soon disappear. The large object lies on its side and quivers some more. Later it ascends and a fan-shaped tail of light spreads after it. The UFO is seen later along the coast and photographed. (“[Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CJul-Aug%252CV%25204%252CN%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923291726&usg=AOvVaw1KbwPsKrnC2rDI0K7MBXpq) [Saucer Reports Pour in from Denmark,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CJul-Aug%252CV%25204%252CN%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923292061&usg=AOvVaw3Yvc398xDLjXtJr0IK7x1w)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1958): 2; Herbert S. Taylor, “Satellite Objects: A Further Look,” IUR 29, no. 2 (Summer 2004): 25)

December 16 — Between 2:00 and 3:00 a.m. Mary M. Starr, a resident of Old Saybrook, Connecticut, and a former teacher with a master’s degree from Yale, is awakened by a bright light in her room. A cigar-shaped object, brightly lit and with square portholes, hovers just above her clothesline. She can see men inside. The object is approximately 20–30 feet long and dark gray or black in color, hovering motionless about 5 feet above the ground. Through its lighted windows Starr sees two figures that pass each other, walking in opposite directions. (Donald E. Keyhoe and Gordon I. R. Lore, eds, UFOs: A New Look, NICAP, 1969, [pp. 27–28](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/newlook/section_VII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923292899&usg=AOvVaw1AaiUJLh97vckT5-hjI0q5); Clark III 269)

December 17 — Skandinavisk UFO Information is founded in Denmark by [Hans-Christian Petersen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufo.se/index.php/p/1237-petersen-hans-christian-1923&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923293322&usg=AOvVaw0poHlfWiUCp7E6H9OmhGKw) under the name Sydjysk UFO Information. It publishes the journal UFO-Nyt from 1958 to 2010.
