(Wikipedia, “[Skandinavisk UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://da.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skandinavisk_UFO_Information&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923293651&usg=AOvVaw3rfZQxdHxDSN7YQ5BHKyZc) [Information](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://da.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skandinavisk_UFO_Information&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923293875&usg=AOvVaw0Gh4d2zDL45sP6oiOj8WX1)”)

December 17 — The US conducts its first successful launch of an SM-65A Atlas missile at Cape Canaveral, Florida. (Wikipedia, “[SM-65A Atlas](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SM-65A_Atlas&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923294235&usg=AOvVaw0oFpFQ4SmPW_x36zg9Bx9e)”)

December 18 — Luis E. Corrales of Caracas, Venezuela, finds an odd luminous streak on a photographic plate recording the passage of [Sputnik 2](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sputnik_2&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923294544&usg=AOvVaw3aYOSYpfzhQkZvXdUkj6oK)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sputnik_2&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923294749&usg=AOvVaw0AlABaLS0ajKslfiomrOfF) It is a luminous trail running parallel to the satellite’s trail, then veering away. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957 December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923294996&usg=AOvVaw3GVKcJbu7sJzuHgDmJYdWZ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923295159&usg=AOvVaw02bubZMdQp2qxlV_XgLSlc) The Author, 1998, p. 57)

December 21 — 6:30 p.m. Yvonne Torres de Mendonça, her three small children, and a servant are traveling in a jeep driven by her mechanic, Marcio Gonçalves, towards Ponta Porã, Mato Grosso do Sul, Brazil, along the Paraguayan border. They see a large ball of light about the size of the full moon that starts moving toward them, and they realize that it is two lights flying silently side by side. The lights straddle the road, oscillating from one side to the other in a strange wobbling motion and spinning on their axes. One of them stops in mid-air and dives toward the ground in a falling-leaf motion 60 feet ahead of them, while the other maneuvers in circles around the jeep. The lights are spherical and encircled by a Saturn-like ring at the center. The upper hemisphere and rim are fiery red, while the lower hemisphere is silvery white. The two objects follow the jeep for 2 hours, all the way to town, maneuvering intelligently around them, especially when the jeep stops twice to evaluate the objects. (Olavo

T. Fontes, [“Shadow of the Unknown, Part II: UAOs Chase Cars,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201959%252003%252000%2520-%2520March.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923295728&usg=AOvVaw0KCU-clEGhzpXZ87YE_Q2n)” APRO Bulletin, March 1959, pp. 3–6; Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 148–150; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923296170&usg=AOvVaw3hJeSarskmdwFz970QPXfW) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1957 December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1957-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923296373&usg=AOvVaw3qEWzen2sTvlLPG2hztRfs), The Author, 1998, pp. 60–63; Clark III 245–246)

December 30 — Night. George Chowanski is cutting wood at his home in Schooley’s Mountain, New Jersey, when his two dogs begin to bark and howl. He hears a whirring noise like an electric shaver that persists for one minute. Then he sees a saucer-shaped object, 5 feet high and 15 feet wide, hovering about 2 feet above the ground in a grove of trees 100 feet from the back porch. Three individuals come out of the craft and walk about in the clearing. One of them bends over to pick something up and carries something heavy back to the object. After 2–3 minutes, it slowly rises, spiraling through the tall trees, and flies off. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 88–89)

1958

1958 — The Atomic Energy Commission puts a barbed wire fence around Area 13 at the Nellis Air Force Range, Nevada, where the Project 57 “dirty bomb” had been detonated in April 1957, with signs indicating “do not enter / nuclear material.” (Jacobsen, Area 51, [p. 297](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/296/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923297426&usg=AOvVaw38oNPaNJL-BqeeNXJPiD2n))

1958 — Project Orion, an effort to build a nuclear-powered spacecraft, begins at a maximum-security facility in Area 25 of the Nevada Test Site. Led by [Ted Taylor](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ted_Taylor_(physicist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923297873&usg=AOvVaw2Rk7X6mFBQMU6mHv3bRHFS) of General Atomics and physicist [Freeman Dyson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freeman_Dyson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923298100&usg=AOvVaw0Mdhxv40xfEXu64s-4hJtX), its initial focus is to send astronauts to Mars and back. The spaceship would be 16 stories tall and piloted by 150 men. Soon ARPA and the Air Force take over the project and redesign it for a space-based battleship that could launch nuclear missiles from space. But no one builds Orion and it is effectively disbanded by the 1963 nuclear test ban. (Wikipedia, “[Project Orion (nuclear propulsion)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Orion_(nuclear_propulsion)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923298357&usg=AOvVaw3E7RX7_R9igC31UoFJ3Zk9)”; Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 304–305](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/304/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923298584&usg=AOvVaw3kKc1KkW3zwbem0-9AmUw7))

1958 — French ufologist [Aimé Michel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aim%25C3%25A9_Michel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923298853&usg=AOvVaw1PMGmwAjRExlQi1woxbDwx) publishes Flying Saucers and the Straight-Line Mystery, an examination of the UFO wave of September–October 1954 in France. The book’s preface is written by Gen. [Lionel-Max Chassin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel-Max_Chassin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923299308&usg=AOvVaw0jZ87L0LBEkkZld0rHmFBU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel-Max_Chassin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923299532&usg=AOvVaw02gxKkFXOAelSHi36XswuG) in which he expresses his opinion that UFOs are genuinely mysterious (“That strange things have been seen is now

* * *

beyond question, and the ‘psychological’ explanations seem to have misfired”). Michel contends that each day’s sightings, when plotted on a map, occur along straight-line paths, even though different objects seem to figure in each sighting. The alignments, which he calls “orthotenic lines,” do not necessarily correspond to a trajectory.

However, [Jacques Vallée](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacques_Vall%25C3%25A9e&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923300215&usg=AOvVaw09dalOymH8gDjg4dhcdIPr) later concludes that the alignments can be explained by chance alone. (Aimé Michel, Flying Saucers and the Straight-Line Mystery, Criterion, 1958; “[An Evaluation of Aimé Michel’s Study of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/coufo/partII/chIX.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923300755&usg=AOvVaw2jYyMWnUzpdzEliR_MXfY3) [Straight Line Mystery,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/coufo/partII/chIX.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923301082&usg=AOvVaw13co3SYd8yHpo-5XWCIe-n)” in C. A. Maney and Richard Hall, The Challenge of Unidentified Flying Objects, NICAP, 1961, pp. 90–98; Jacques Vallee and Janine Vallee, Challenge to Science: The UFO Enigma, Regnery, 1966, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/challengetoscien00vall/page/57/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923301675&usg=AOvVaw24tyhU_dQ8CKzUjNmHFrNx) [57–82](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/challengetoscien00vall/page/57/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923301900&usg=AOvVaw0GQlLIlGeHCfU5SxQyvwYQ); Don Johnson, “New Lines in UFO Research: Orthoteny Revisited,” IUR 25, no. 1 (Spring 2000): 18–19, 32; Claude Maugé, “Orthoteny: Lost Cause, or a Redeemed One?” IUR 25, no. 3 (Fall 2000): 24–28; Clark III 747, 858–860)

1958 — [Trevor James Constable](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trevor_James_Constable&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923302458&usg=AOvVaw1BZk3l7jeRyJvUSX56gKQ6) writes They Live in the Sky, which explains UFOs as etheric (good) and astral (bad) entities that are engaged in a battle for control of earthly minds. He bases this on his analysis of occult texts and channeled communications from cosmic informant Ashtar. The astral entities are based inside the earth, but they can leave it through an opening in the South Pole and fly 125,000 miles into space. Only the atomic bomb can penetrate the astral realm, which is why astrals disguised as benevolent Space Brothers argue fervently for nuclear disarmament. The men in black are reincarnated versions of [Richard Shaver](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Sharpe_Shaver&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923302907&usg=AOvVaw26U5G5VbhcRhMzl9wOnUrU)‘s deros. (Trevor James \[Constable\]. They Live in the Sky, New Age, 1958; Trevor James \[Constable\], “[Scientists, Contactees, and Equilibrium,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1960%252CJan-Feb%252CV%25206%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923303196&usg=AOvVaw3_rNoMhKwOSm1i5N45LT93)” Flying Saucer Review 6, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1960): 19–21; Clark III 1102)

1958 — Night. A sergeant in charge of a fire truck crash crew at an air base in South Korea is positioned near the runway awaiting an emergency landing by an American jet fighter low on fuel. The men see a bright light approaching from across the Yellow Sea. It grows bigger and, within several hundred yards of the shore, stops and hovers. The control tower operators, watching the object through binoculars, do not know what it is. Suddenly the object shines a beam of light straight down on the water. It soon goes out, but the water remains luminescent for a while before fading out. The object again shines a light on the water and turns it off a minute or so later. By this time, the jet that is low on fuel is landing. A second jet is asked to check out the object, which instantly shoots back toward China and disappears in seconds. (Bob Pratt, UFO Danger Zone: Terror and Death in Brazil—Where Next?, Horus House, 1996, online ed., [p. 164](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/UFODangerZoneBobPrattHowTheyStealOurBloodAndMayKillPeoplePreIceAgeUfoOccupantsAn/page/n163/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923303776&usg=AOvVaw3sJ3udKZXaODqAYz5CUjuM); Carl W. Feindt, “Beam of Light into a Body of Water,” IUR 33, no. 3 (December 2010): 22)

January — The US Senate Committee on Government Operations asks to meet with representatives from the Secretary of the Air Force Office of Legislative Action to discuss the possibility of holding open hearings on the Air Force UFO program. USAF fears “uncontrolled publicity,” but agrees to go along with it. Soon, however, [Richard E.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.astronautix.com/h/horner.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923304229&usg=AOvVaw3P972s_rP8iWsCyBIBzR_9) [Horner](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.astronautix.com/h/horner.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923304436&usg=AOvVaw2XVOfZM42Ocdr7wuB8KZHm), USAF assistant secretary for research and development, persuades the committee’s chief counsel, Donald O’Donnell, that hearings are “not in the best interest of the air force,” nor necessary for national security. Horner says Project Blue Book has things well in hand, and he tells Sen. [Barry Goldwater](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barry_Goldwater&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923304664&usg=AOvVaw3l2Qx1T2l4EnAkvAdZWOBL) (R-Ariz.) that allegations about the Air Force withholding information are “entirely in error.” People who report UFOs simply want confidentiality, and the Air Force respects that. (Jacobs, UFO Controversy in America, Signet ed., 1976, [pp. 140–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/140/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923304997&usg=AOvVaw28wcnp4WU-obI9wApSkfZ2) [141](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/140/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923305200&usg=AOvVaw0_fHu6VfUQRP4hoi_qdi1M)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/140/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923305350&usg=AOvVaw2HyW5kO8bW6Qaqyz04C0qH) [144](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/144/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923305628&usg=AOvVaw1X4wy5v6zMJjZ1YHnINwnG))

January — Lackland AFB in San Antonio, Texas, asks for [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923305957&usg=AOvVaw1eh__GZ_ejiaGt8uFyjDb5)’s permission to use The Flying Saucer Conspiracy to develop a script for closed-circuit broadcast at the base. Keyhoe agrees. (Keyhoe, FSTS, p. 218)

January — 1:30 a.m. A woman is driving along the New York State Thruway near Niagara Falls, New York, when she sees an illuminated 50-foot pole in the center parkway ahead. It seems to be retracting and getting shorter. As she closes in on it, her engine stops and the headlights go out. The pole is attached to a saucer-shaped object, and she sees shadowy figures floating around it. The UFO rises and moves away, and she starts the car again. An area of snow a foot in diameter has melted dry where the pole has been. (Michael D. Swords, “Messing Around with the Force,” IUR 31, no. 4 (Mar. 2008): 16)

January 3 — Cliff DeLacey, a 23-year-old college student from Vallejo, California, shoots 90 seconds of film of UFOs at Diamond Head, Hawaii. DeLacey sees nine UFOs flashing across the sky and immediately grabs his camera. He is careful enough to shoot the tops of nearby trees, allowing a reference to the height and relative speed of the unknown objects. The objects appear to be about 3–4 miles away from the camera, flying at an altitude of 7,000– 8,000 feet, and moving at a speed slightly greater than that of a jet. The silvery globules appear to be no more than 20 feet in diameter. They are spherical, and no tail fins or protrusions of any kind are visible. The film, in color, is said to be clear and to show at least two of the nine UFOs in considerable detail. (NICAP, “[‘Genuine Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/580103diamond-head_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923306645&usg=AOvVaw2eKAt2Pd-yhDTQUC7EiD4C) [Saucer…Caught on Movie Film’](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/580103diamond-head_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923306863&usg=AOvVaw0DbdKEI0AheE_ZZBsSQ6tP)”; Max B. Miller and Norman S. Kossuth, “[How to Film Unidentified Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Saucers%2520(Max%2520B%2520Miller)/Saucers%2520vol%25206%2520no%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923307088&usg=AOvVaw0947DK1HWzhCGX0Uxe3yRr) [Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Saucers%2520(Max%2520B%2520Miller)/Saucers%2520vol%25206%2520no%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923307383&usg=AOvVaw1tfRVTvyiRzpFMCtY-c75k)” Saucers 6, no. 3 (Autumn 1958): 8)

* * *

January 10 — Day. Capt. Chrysólogo Rocha is sitting with his wife on the porch of a house in Guarujá, São Paulo, Brazil, overlooking the South Atlantic. He is trying to focus with his binoculars on what appears to be a small island.

When he does get focused, he realizes the island is getting bigger and is in two parts, both a clear, gray color. One part is in the sea, while the other seems suspended above it. Without warning, both parts suddenly sink out of sight. Shortly afterwards, a steamer comes into view, on a course that will take it very close to the object. About 15 minutes later, when the ship is out of sight, the object again rises slowly out of the sea. He now sees clearly that the two parts are joined by several narrow upright shafts or tubes that are bright and visible to the naked eye. These shafts, “like beads on a necklace” pass in a “disorderly and simultaneous movement.” Shortly afterwards the two parts of the object close up again, and it disappears below the waves. Probably an inferior mirage of an island in combination with a towering effect. (Charles Bowen, “[A South American Trio,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CJan-Feb%252CV%252011%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923308384&usg=AOvVaw2eq4pccrEA35nZxwm1KzdV)” Flying Saucer Review 11, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1965): 20–21; Wim van Utrecht, “[A UFO Dives in and Out of the Ocean,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.caelestia.be/curitiba.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923308750&usg=AOvVaw09nVQwwQcE6Asbus2Z2a32)” Caelestia)

January 13 — 11:45 p.m. Brian Crittenden sees a dome-shaped light with a long narrow light underneath coming directly towards him as he is leaving a friend’s house southwest of Casino, New South Wales, Australia. He jumps into his car and heads home. The UFO chases his car along Benns Road, practically touching the telephone poles. His car radio develops interference when the UFO approaches him. It follows him all the way to town, 7 miles away. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923309135&usg=AOvVaw2zp6EmR4XmyZyYAUYzsL0L), p. 81; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1958 January–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Jan-Feb.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923309393&usg=AOvVaw2UaAzns_1hCv-dcwXT_T19) [February](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Jan-Feb.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923309604&usg=AOvVaw2osa3VWxEHu1uio0V6RCQh)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Jan-Feb.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923309807&usg=AOvVaw1kEA2DH08rW6n2I4eWYh1Q) The Author, 1998, p. 21)

January 16 — Around 12:00 noon. As the International Geophysical Year research ship [Almirante Saldanha](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.naval.com.br/ngb/A/A044/A044.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923310143&usg=AOvVaw3Pir3bVVsqSbtwq6vwYYdd) is anchored on the south side of Ilha da Trindade, Brazil, 730 miles off the coast in the Atlantic Ocean, the commander and many crew members, including photographer Almiro Baraúna, see a Saturn-shaped object maneuvering over the island. It reportedly comes toward the island from the east, flies towards the Pico Desejado, makes a steep turn, and goes away very quickly to the northwest. Baraúna takes four photos with a Rolleiflex 2.8 model E. Commander [Paulo Moreira da Silva](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paulo_Moreira_da_Silva&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923310488&usg=AOvVaw2Xb6dfK7nM6vR33yAUYRrJ) of the Brazilian Navy Hydrography and Navigation Department (who technically outranks the ship’s captain, [José Santos de Saldanha da Gama](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%25C3%25A9_Santos_de_Saldanha_da_Gama&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923310747&usg=AOvVaw3qxuOAFQMOo-TY-k2EaMVP)), is apparently an eyewitness and states, “the object was encircled by a greenish glow, our \[meteorological\] balloon was of a red color.” Baraúna is officially there to take photos of the island, underwater photos, photos of the IGY activities, and the ship’s operations. The radar detection of an unexplained supersonic target reportedly occurs the day before, at about 12:05 p.m. There is a power failure on the ship when the object is seen; the power returns upon the object’s departure. Instruments like radio transmitters and apparatus with magnetic needles cease operating while the flying object remains in the island’s proximity. [Willy Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.oocities.org/ufomiami.geo/Obituary.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923311223&usg=AOvVaw2Pr_zvsoSWBL9uDjLe2Qds)’s April 20, 1983, interview of Baraúna takes on more significance: “I asked if the object had been detected by ship’s radar. He \[Baraúna\] replied that it hadn’t because all the electrical power aboard ship was out at the time. He was sure of the reality of the power outage because just before the object appeared a launch was being hauled up from the water by electric pulley, and it stopped midway just as the UFO appeared!” The ship’s log is provably incomplete since it does not even mention the UFO photo incident. A 1999 analysis by [Martin J. Powell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.aenigmatis.com/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923311661&usg=AOvVaw0ebv8J_RomP1RkHGXTfF1E) seems to indicate that the object photographed is an airplane, distorted by Baraúna through a double-exposure process. In August 2010, a major TV show in Brazil airs information stating that the original photographer had made hoax photographs in the past. (Wikipedia, “[Trindade Island UFO hoax](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trindade_Island_UFO_hoax&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923312112&usg=AOvVaw27pt5VVhnnZeUY9clYclZM)”; Wikipedia, “[Caso da Ilha da Trindade](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trindade_Island_UFO_hoax&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923312454&usg=AOvVaw3sgjw0dv0cE7eHIZ900pv_)”; NICAP, “[Trindade Island Photo (E-M,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/580116trindade_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923312739&usg=AOvVaw21x8KJWRFDTYXFr_2za-Wv) [Radar, AR) Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/580116trindade_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923313038&usg=AOvVaw1pnaOklmg5focqVVqYVj26)”; Olavo T. Fontes, “[The UAO Sightings at the Island of Trindade, Part 1,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201960%252001%252000%2520-%2520January.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923313429&usg=AOvVaw27N-x4QvfoQbtod3uzKytC)” APRO Bulletin, January 1960, pp. 5–9; Olavo T. Fontes, “[UAO Sightings over Trindade, Part II,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201960%252003%252000%2520-%2520March.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923314050&usg=AOvVaw359C5CFEmO63S3QLUSL8y5)” APRO Bulletin, March 1960,

pp. 5–8; Olavo T. Hopf, “[Exclusive IGY Photo Analysis,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201960%252005%252000%2520-%2520May.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923315247&usg=AOvVaw0Dan3xKgZzUAJh5ITrqG6k)” APRO Bulletin, May 1960, pp. 1, 4; “[New Evidence on IGY](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201965%252001%252000%2520-%2520January.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923315785&usg=AOvVaw1V1PQYy5-7d-tWrGlXiPgN) [Photos,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201965%252001%252000%2520-%2520January.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923316215&usg=AOvVaw2QRBJh_ELhR4wO_uJkcAeP)” APRO Bulletin, January 1965, pp. 1, 3–8; Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 205– 210; Willy Smith, “[Trindade Revisited,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/trindade/cufos_pages/baraunaIUR.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923316803&usg=AOvVaw0w60oKFw2qPde1zdS0JRuk)” IUR 8, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1983): 3–5, 14; Willy Smith, “UFOs in Latin America,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, pp. 109–111; Martin J. January 22 — The “UFO: The Enigma of the Skies” segment of Armstrong Circle Theater airs on CBS. USAF Reserve Lt. Col. Spencer Whedon from ATIC says all UFOs are explainable. [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923320920&usg=AOvVaw1Re1fFn6oNW9xq_j7zOr_M) comes on and starts reading his script for a few minutes, then shocks everyone by deviating from it, saying “And now, Mr. [Edwards](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_Edwards&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923321297&usg=AOvVaw1YaZDBizh0Lalqo_nCoOeh), I would like to make a disclosure, something which has never been revealed to the public. For the last six months our committee has been working with a Senate committee which is investigating official secrecy on UFOs. If the

* * *

hearings are held, open hearings, I feel it would prove beyond doubt that flying saucers are real—”. Then his microphone is cut off, although the filming continues. [Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923321928&usg=AOvVaw0IC6uHAViCHFMJKZ6eo5gI) then appears, then USAF spokesman [Richard E.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.astronautix.com/h/horner.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923322313&usg=AOvVaw3F0hl-kY2PfGY6zG-VeCHj) [Horner](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.astronautix.com/h/horner.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923322611&usg=AOvVaw1LFFlMSdu3-5BTc_x7cnOM) comes on afterward and says that the Air Force is not hiding anything about UFOs. Keyhoe later claims this is not censorship by the show, although he thinks it is the Air Force silence group at work. In April, CBS director of editing Herbert A. Carlborg tells NICAP that Keyhoe’s deviation “might lead to statements that neither this network nor the individuals on the program were authorized to release. As a consequence, public interest was served.” (Clark III 167–168; Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 22–23, 155–165; “[UFO Archives: Project Blue Book—Col.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DwQOGN6h9RC0&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923323014&usg=AOvVaw3D6HFqaI7WYX8qgezArH3A)

[Spenser Whedon, Dr. Donald Menzel, Major Donald Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DwQOGN6h9RC0&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923323257&usg=AOvVaw37p4_gYGJHQkuOeZI4HVMQ)” \[audio only\], UFO Archives YouTube channel, May 22, 2014; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1958 January–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Jan-Feb.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923323462&usg=AOvVaw074xEpWi4C0-5w_k8KfbDr) [February](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Jan-Feb.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923323648&usg=AOvVaw0tAb6bwXM0TFZ0B3t7Dljj)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Jan-Feb.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923323937&usg=AOvVaw0aYYqdgdxhz2ttke7L0Rk6) The Author, 1998, pp. 23, 28–30, 35–39; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Mar-Apr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923324345&usg=AOvVaw1BhIqXBC7WHejHCQm0lOcV) [UFOs, a History: 1958 March–April](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Mar-Apr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923324680&usg=AOvVaw1FrnNFfpCF7uufL3ji7yZN)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Mar-Apr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923324959&usg=AOvVaw0vw2DysuRYyfBn6Ma8Lj0o) The Author, 1998, pp. 10–17; Swords 272; Good Above, [pp. 286–287](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/286/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923325350&usg=AOvVaw2daYHMLxRJLHmPRXmlFyV6))

January 23 — Capt. G. H. Oldenburgh, public information officer at Langley AFB, Virginia, writes to a NICAP member who has been denied a request to place an ad in the base newspaper asking for UFO reports: “I felt it would encourage Air Force personnel to violate present Air Force policy and specifically AF Regulation 200-2.” (Frank Edwards, FS Serious Business, Bantam ed., 1966, [p. 51](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersser00edwa/page/50/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923326075&usg=AOvVaw078q_RGMHYLA0m8UKhUdeg))

January 26 — 4:00 p.m. Some chemical workers at Shimada, Japan, see a bright object land and claim that beings fell from the sky without parachutes. They wear strange suits and speak an unknown language. (“[They Are Landing in](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CMay-Jun%252CV%25204%252CN%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923326584&usg=AOvVaw3eRRFCYnjsTN3YeiQalgyl) [Japan, Too,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CMay-Jun%252CV%25204%252CN%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923326953&usg=AOvVaw1Y3A5gdOxVCX6wJIqZGQ78)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 3 (May/June 1958): 33)

January 28 — [Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923327513&usg=AOvVaw0zFCSbY_wRu3vLh1svsajX) announces that “two committees on Capitol Hill” are investigating the UFO controversy. Rep.

[William Hanes Ayres](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Hanes_Ayres&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923327988&usg=AOvVaw2U4waWbpq-Fndiy76EZFaf) (R-Ohio) writes a letter to constituent Melvin V. Knapp, saying that “Congressional investigations have been held and are still being held on the problem of unidentified flying objects (UFO’s). Since most of the material presented to the committees is classified, the hearings are never printed. When conclusions are reached, they will be released if possible.” (“[Flying Saucer Proof Clouded by Air Force, Private Probers Say,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94512727/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923328420&usg=AOvVaw1mI5zvCSmJFnJ2DTym33Be)” Rochester (N.Y.) Democrat and Chronicle, August 3, 1958, p. 8; UFOEv, [p. 173](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D185%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923328924&usg=AOvVaw3imu9kik_Plr2TVfNuUiwb))

January 30 — 11:45 p.m. Attorney José Valencia Dongo, his wife, and their nephew feel an electric shock as they are driving between Arequipa and Lima, Peru, at a point (roughly around the Yauca District) along the Pan American Highway 220 miles northwest of Arequipa. Several seconds later the headlights and engine of their car fails. They then see an inverted mushroom-shaped object, about 15 feet in diameter, descending from the sky. It hovers for about 8 minutes at a 150-foot altitude, glowing red. A truck and bus are also affected. (Civilian Saucer Intelligence, “[Shapes in the Sky,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/FantasticUniverseV10n04195810/page/n111/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923329492&usg=AOvVaw3LZtiJi5dPCPHGfpb7lLKR)” Fantastic Universe, 10, no. 4 (October 1958): 111; Charles A. Maney and Richard Hall, The Challenge of Unidentified Flying Objects, NICAP, 1961, [p. 82](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/challengeofunide00mane/page/82/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923330084&usg=AOvVaw0RPRiVI7d5D6qZBVnL6GJq); [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923330483&usg=AOvVaw2b5i3Pv8hll52KbMnn66EK), pp. 58–59; Mark Rodeghier, [UFO Reports Involving Vehicle Interference](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/books/UFO_REPORTS_INVOLVING_VEHICLE_INTERFERENCE.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923330870&usg=AOvVaw0iwT8Hv0zisO83uwquuCo8)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/books/UFO_REPORTS_INVOLVING_VEHICLE_INTERFERENCE.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923331176&usg=AOvVaw24g_5uFm8bUsjSdbip7nNV) CUFOS, 1981, p. 14)

January 31 — A meeting is held in the office of Assistant Secretary of the Air Force [Richard E. Horner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/sanantonio/obituary.aspx?n%3Drichard-e-horner%26pid%3D88822680&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923331754&usg=AOvVaw3JPpF2wBUC7QElqsJbtzht) under the auspices of the Subcommittee on Investigations of the Senate Committee on Government Operations, even though Sen.

[John L. McClellan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_L._McClellan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923332271&usg=AOvVaw1YmJQ0kA68kARIrz2B-UhU) (D-Ark.) and other senators are absent. The Air Force is represented by Maj. James F. Byrne, Maj. [Joseph E. Boland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8792087/joseph-edward-boland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923332669&usg=AOvVaw3QekN3gCPCh5GuTHFlxqRv), and Maj. [Lawrence J. Tacker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30450384/lawrence-j-tacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923333020&usg=AOvVaw3QDriHh2gK_LFit8Uc2_nK) who meet with the subcommittee’s FBI liaisons. Tacker declares that USAF does not want a congressional investigation, and the McClellan effort dies immediately. (Swords 275)

January 31 — 10:48 p.m. The US launches its first satellite, Explorer 1, from Cape Canaveral Missile Annex, Florida. It is the first spacecraft to detect the Van Allen radiation belt. (Wikipedia, “[Explorer 1](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Explorer_1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923333605&usg=AOvVaw3RFqgdxSTvko8VFP-Afncq)”)

February — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923334143&usg=AOvVaw3aTm8UHTDREXtUBvo2_lLl) meets again with Rep. [James C. Healey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_C._Healey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923334542&usg=AOvVaw1fQLImvdOH3gasmeFm-imB) and tells him that the Armstrong Circle Theater incident was Air Force censorship. A few days later, Healey tells Keyhoe that the Air Force is claiming that the program proves “there are no such things as flying saucers.” Keyhoe gives Healey the facts about the 1956 [Ryan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62514778/raymond-e-ryan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923335122&usg=AOvVaw28LC3A1KM7xaaOoNaJ-zfL) case pointing to USAF ordering a commercial flight to pursue UFOs, citing the Meet the Millers tape from April 16, 1956, which he has obtained. He offers to get the committee a transcript. (Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 166–167, 182–184)

February — Ufologist Raymond Veillith launches the UFO journal Lumières dans la Nuit in Le Chambon-sur-Lignon, Haute-Loire, France. It continues on under various editors until at least 2018. ([Lumières dans la Nuit](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/France/LDLN/LDLN%2520-%2520No%2520001.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923335811&usg=AOvVaw0MwOcMlWL-TJIHhPN3ATo5)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/France/LDLN/LDLN%2520-%2520No%2520001.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923336022&usg=AOvVaw13mY8Uy1m_gMYZQE0274Iw) no. 1 (February 1958); Wikipedia, “[Lumières dans la Nuit](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lumi%25C3%25A8res_dans_la_nuit&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923336271&usg=AOvVaw1zvFoh8j01Z_M3fuc5PgTD)”; Story, p. 218)

February 2 — An elliptical UFO with two porthole-like markings is seen somewhere in New South Wales, Australia. (UFOEv, [p. 137](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D149%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923336802&usg=AOvVaw175W1AzbuKhOG9mpNkbAtO))

February 3 — OTC Enterprises runs a two-page ad in a Baltimore, Maryland, newspaper and distributes a well-printed brochure announcing that [Otis T. Carr](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otis_T._Carr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923337230&usg=AOvVaw2wkgQQC6RFLG1jGdS7f6ZW) has approached the US government and offered to build it a working spacecraft called the OTC-X1—circular, 45 feet in diameter and 15 feet high—for $20 million. He sets a date of December 7, 1959, to take a three-man crew on the spacecraft on a round trip to the Moon. Some press accounts treat Carr as if he is a real scientist. (Clark III 860)

* * *

February 5 — The Air Force revises AFR 200-2 and recreates the system of air base commanders conducting initial investigations of sightings in their areas. It also continues ATIC’s responsibility to “reduce the percentage of unidentifieds to the minimum.” (Department of the Air Force, “[Intelligence: Unidentified Flying Objects (UFO),](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Documents/AFR_200-2_020558.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923337877&usg=AOvVaw2-XaYGdSECkxBPI4-v3nib)” Air Force Regulation 200-2, February 5, 1958; Department of the Air Force, “[Intelligence: Unidentified Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Documents/AFR_200-2A_070358_change.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923338287&usg=AOvVaw163vhclJsxSfrqh4D2Jtxs) [Objects (UFO),](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Documents/AFR_200-2A_070358_change.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923338603&usg=AOvVaw1W6HWYhWapkTA06q_n_E_3)” Air Force Regulation 200-2A, July 3, 1958)

February 7 — In response to the launching of Sputnik, President [Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923339058&usg=AOvVaw08CYDFxTgSh4TKy19nbDwa) creates the Advanced Research Projects Agency and houses it in the Pentagon. (Wikipedia, “[DARPA](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DARPA&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923339427&usg=AOvVaw086sfljBxaTB2p78IH39Bs)”)

February 17 — Evening. [Flora Evans](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64039683/flora-janette-evans&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923339879&usg=AOvVaw3BGNSIoJ1Gh4rcxGb9fDR6) and Bernice McIntosh twice encounter an intensely brilliant orange light about 15 feet in diameter that sends out peculiar grid-like or diamond-shaped patterns and lights up a canyon northeast of Alcalde, New Mexico, along State Highway 68. The two women are temporarily blinded. Their trip home to Albuquerque inexplicably takes 4 hours instead of the normal 2 hours. Both witnesses are exhausted and have burned or reddened areas on their skin, some on their kneecaps and the back of their lower legs, even though they have not left the car. Evans has a reddened area shaped like a triangle on her back. An acquaintance, Paul Boyett, has a Geiger counter, with which he gets a high radiation count from both women on February 19. The next day Evans, who is working in some capacity in civil defense, goes to her doctor at the Lovelace Clinic in Albuquerque, to see about possible radiation burns and exposure. She overhears a comment about “178 roentgens” exposure, but the doctor says there is nothing to worry about. McIntosh’s symptoms (nausea, vomiting, rash) are initially more irritating but subside substantially, although both women have swellings in their lower legs, and both gain serious weight (some 50 pounds) over the next few months. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Jan-Feb.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923340475&usg=AOvVaw0BLaB6zWT0hOh3OeqB0C2e) [Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1958 January–February](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Jan-Feb.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923340784&usg=AOvVaw1cqwPnYiCKW6nKqDXhnbrr), The Author, 1998, pp. 60–64 ; Michael D, Swords, “Can UFOs Cause Physiological Effects? Part 2” IUR 34, no. 1 (Sept. 2011): 4–5; Swords 280–281;

Clark III 1–2, 950)

February 19 — 10:30 p.m. Cicero Claudino da Silva, Mustafa Esgaib, Alegario Campos, and João Manuel Vasquez are investigating the Ponta Porã case from December. They are at Porteiro Ortiz, Mato Grosso do Sul, Brazil, along Highway 463 and shining their lights in the direction of the Paraguayan frontier when a reddish light appears and becomes larger, as if approaching them. The ground around their car is illuminated for a few seconds, and they realize that another red light is nearing them on the other side of the car. They head for Ponta Porã at breakneck speed. (Olavo T. Fontes, “[The Shadow of the Unknown,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201959%252003%252000%2520-%2520March.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923341585&usg=AOvVaw32bnzRdIbquzgyYsmqTIQx)” APRO Bulletin, March 1959, p. 6)

February 24 — 3:05 a.m. Attorney Carlos José de Costa Pereira, Manoel Mendes, and Antônio de Araujo are driving near Santo Antônio de Jesus, Bahia, Brazil. The car engine sputters and fails. All attempts to detect the trouble fail.

The next inhabited place is far away, so the travelers decide that the best thing to do is to sleep at that spot, beside the road. Next morning they will try to do something about their situation, getting help from some nearby village or farm. It was then that they notice a large luminous Saturn-shaped object silently approaching to about 240 feet from them and only 90 feet from the ground. It then descends in a falling-leaf pattern to about 12 feet. They can see it is about 60–75 feet in diameter with a rotating center section. Suddenly it climbs vertically to 600 feet, makes a tight circle, then tilts to 45° and makes a number of high-speed maneuvers, then descends again in a falling-leaf motion before shooting up vertically at tremendous speed. After this, the car starts easily and they proceed to Salvador. (Olavo T. Fontes, “[The Shadow of the Unknown,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201959%252005%252000%2520-%2520May.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923342157&usg=AOvVaw0Wc1A2JVqiN6l40r1QaZFx)” APRO Bulletin, May 1959, p. 7; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923342487&usg=AOvVaw329Ykor-s7Hp_PvIJz2QHX)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923342758&usg=AOvVaw3xjfim6fVPOXqRhqgc4zsK) pp. 59–61)

February 28 — USAF Director of Information Gen. [Arno H. Luehman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arno_H._Luehman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923343159&usg=AOvVaw0sJZm4BwdotvE9uvjGJ6-f) naively inquires of the McClellan Senate subcommittee whether, based on its “preliminary informal investigation,” it would state that the Air Force is investigating UFOs and not withholding information. (Swords 275)

February 28 — Brig. Gen. [João Adil Oliveira](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jo%25C3%25A3o_Adil_Oliveira&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923343607&usg=AOvVaw2jLIWEnfin64EFl3AVU-NR)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jo%25C3%25A3o_Adil_Oliveira&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923343838&usg=AOvVaw3ZBR6Q8A4L4COJZwKhqvI_) chief of the Brazilian Air Force’s General Staff information service, tells O Globo that the UFO phenomenon is a “fact confirmed by material evidence. There are thousands of documents, photos, and sighting evidence demonstrating its existence.” (Good Need, [p. 233](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/232/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923344271&usg=AOvVaw1o1lwp7eM6sAttebnFwD9e))

February 28 — Police detective [Faustin Gallegos](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/678921/faustin-gallegos&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923344656&usg=AOvVaw3sosgR0Qv7Q3fdQd9Tn9Fb) and his wife Dorothy see something like a “large medicine ball” descend and land in their back yard in Miami, Florida. Outside, he sees a football-shaped object 20 inches long and 8 inches high, lined with “thousands of minute cells resembling those of a honeycomb. It is clear and pulsating. He touches it and his fingers leave marks. They put it in a jar, but it evaporates on the way to the police station. (Faustin Gallegos, “The Pulsing Honeycomb from Space,” Fate 11, no. 9 (September 1958): 40–43; Clark III 1102)

March — The Air Force releases parts of the 1953 Robertson Panel report, a mere three paragraphs recommending that “the national security agencies take immediate steps to strip the Unidentified Flying Objects of the special status they have been given and the aura of mystery they have unfortunately acquired.” (“[CIA Evades, Then Denies](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/004%2520JUNE%25201958.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923345467&usg=AOvVaw3XuNFRo7HAhn2tzjSsjiWN) [Charge of Attempted UFO Censorship,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/004%2520JUNE%25201958.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923345724&usg=AOvVaw3hndwqR0ExqHvfEfTOhpeS)” UFO Investigator 1, no. 4 (June 1958): 4)

* * *

March — A French Foreign Legionnaire on sentry duty at Bouamama, near Sidi Chami, Algeria, hears a whistling noise and sees an enormous, elliptical-shaped object descend and hover 115–131 feet above the ground 165 feet away. The object is surrounded by pale green light, and a relaxing emerald-green beam of light is coming from its base to the ground. Seemingly paralyzed, he stares at the object for 45–50 minutes. The noise returns, the object rises gently, and flies off at tremendous speed. (Joël Mesnard, “[Tranquillizing Visitation at Bouahmama: An Algerian](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201973%2520V%252019%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923346219&usg=AOvVaw0dWT5JGZgrnGHE8p2cReLd) [Report of 1958,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201973%2520V%252019%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923346450&usg=AOvVaw3n8qEh5VpH1LPTuToDP1mj)” Flying Saucer Review 19, no. 3 (May/June 1973): 17–18)

March 2 — The Brazilian Navy, after an analysis of the January 16 Ilha da Trindade sighting and photos, offers an ambiguous conclusion: “the existence of personal testimonies and of a photographer, of some value given the circumstances involved permit the admission that there are indications of the existence of the UFO.” (Brazil Department of the Navy, “[Clarification of the Observation of Unidentified Flying Objects Sighted on the Island of](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/barauna_docs.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923347076&usg=AOvVaw1aGuqRsJpUwSySBNi8NxeT) [Trinidad, in the Period of 12/5/57 to 1/16/58,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/barauna_docs.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923347349&usg=AOvVaw0WOpkAoR7zKQkGWP20fBd1)” March 2, 1958)

March 3 — Gen. [Joe W. Kelly](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_W._Kelly&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923347606&usg=AOvVaw3ufyBM0wypwF7IKB_M1y-r) responds to [Luehman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arno_H._Luehman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923347812&usg=AOvVaw15HtM-gJtqSFfvWlGzxC-q), falsely stating that the Air Force has done “considerable work” with the McClellan subcommittee. (Swords 275–276)

March 8 — A USAF radar site in Korea tracks a UFO slowly descending from 77,000 to 25,000 feet. (UFOEv, [p. 80](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D92%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923348182&usg=AOvVaw0Ka9echfJDnmEPHWMRWn4e))

March 8 — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923348424&usg=AOvVaw3EF6uiRP4BE68XTckhqzuU) appears on ABC’s The Mike Wallace Interview and mentions the Estimate of the Situation, [Fournet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/ufochop2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923348680&usg=AOvVaw20cHZ6xkRnntFhugynt3NS)’s motion study, and the CIA Robertson Panel. [Wallace](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Wallace&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923348874&usg=AOvVaw0u7L1RwqcvH9UYNshH_u7B) surprises him by saying Assistant Secretary of the Air Force [Richard E. Horner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/sanantonio/obituary.aspx?n%3Drichard-e-horner%26pid%3D88822680&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923349111&usg=AOvVaw00V6LHdHCNyFF7C_PPBkAj) told his producers that the Senate Committee “show no interest in any hearings.” This is news to Keyhoe. Wallace also quotes from the Robertson Panel summary that was just released. A few days later, Keyhoe receives two letters from the Senate Committee confirming that it “does not intend to investigate the United States Air Force.” (“[Major Donald Keyhoe Interviewed by Mike Wallace (1958),](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DEi9tgxqYCaI&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923349429&usg=AOvVaw1jWMWZfF5BXSYYH2ykvgwg)” pfreal1 YouTube channel, August 25, 2012; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1958](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Mar-Apr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923349631&usg=AOvVaw3WZJdFmzNYtCZdyuSwsGs9) [March–April](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Mar-Apr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923349811&usg=AOvVaw1Rgqidt7xIQW2p6G23sl9e)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Mar-Apr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923349983&usg=AOvVaw29IvHu_P-IV7mxo1dTgkaj) The Author, 1998, p. 9; Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 189–190; Swords 272–273; “[Mike Wallace Interview](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/jufoh/JournalUFOHistoryVol2No1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923350204&usg=AOvVaw1OYOnWD_j2Z3X8CAveotTO) [of Maj. Donald E. Keyhoe: A Sequel to the Arnstrong Circle Theater,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/jufoh/JournalUFOHistoryVol2No1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923350403&usg=AOvVaw3EkdyyhD663_9IqVM-VDq0)” Journal of UFO History 2, no. 1 (March/April 2005): 8–11)

Late March — NICAP begins a new campaign to open another government UFO investigation. This time it approaches the Department of Justice, the National Security Council, the CIA, and the US Army. It receives rebuffs and denials. (Keyhoe, FSTS, p. 191)

April — Edgar Sievers begins publishing a pro-Adamski newsletter titled Approach in Pretoria, South Africa. It folds in March 1960. ([Approach](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/South%2520Africa/Approach%2520(Edgar%2520Sievers)/Approach%2520-%2520Vol%25201%2520No%252001%2520-%25201958%252004.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923351188&usg=AOvVaw3lwchJU7_hf046AL9ATZsu) 1, no. 1 (April 1958))

April — 6:00 a.m. At some place along the Brazilian coast between Maceió and Paripueira, Alagoas, Brazil, Wilson Lustosa stops to ask some fishermen what they are looking at. He hears a humming sound and sees a disc-shaped object hovering about 50 feet above the ocean and 120 feet away. It has a small lighted dome on top and a band of square portholes around its midsection through which a red light is shining. Under the UFO the water seems disturbed. The object is visible for an hour. (Gordon W. Creighton, “[A Brazilian Sighting,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1964%252CNov-Dec%252CV%252010%252CN%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923351681&usg=AOvVaw1gbnKoxOzlRZoy8ZsyMXQK)” Flying Saucer Review 10, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1964): 18)

Early April — Night. A 2-foot red blinking light frightens children over the Walnut housing area in Ellwood City, Pennsylvania. Police officers Joseph Scala and Emanuel Mavero investigate and watch the bright disc for 10 minutes. Their police radio malfunctions. They try to get closer, but it disappears when they get to the top of a hill. (C. W. Fitch, “[Monitoring and Scanning Discs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201964%252009%252000%2520-%2520September.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923352410&usg=AOvVaw1Retee9-sKcWH8wQriVB_T)” APRO Bulletin, September 1964, p. 5)

April 9 — A family in Cleveland, Ohio, sees a flight of nine UFOs that suddenly separates into two groups of four and five objects. (UFOEv, [p. 15](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D27%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923353054&usg=AOvVaw32p4aQNqxySE4kRLO8ScpW))

April 9 — 7:15 p.m. Mr. and Mrs. B. Mills are driving on St. Vincent Street in Nelson, New Zealand, when they see a bright-red triangular object with white lights around its perimeter. It is descending from the northeast at a 45° angle and moving across Tasman Bay. They see the object again, somewhat dimmer, around 8:00 p.m. from a friend’s house on Matipo Terrace. (“[Triangular Object over New Zealand,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CJul-Aug%252CV%25204%252CN%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923353557&usg=AOvVaw3wTMyfpWMojFpmoE_Fl8kX)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1958): 6)

April 10 — A Danish fighter pilot reports seeing a formation of UFOs. They are also tracked on radar at Skrydstrup Airport in Vojens, Denmark. The pilot attempts to overtake them, but they accelerate and disappear. The commander of Fighter Wing Skrydstrup appeals to the public to report any UFOs. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Mar-Apr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923354235&usg=AOvVaw1Xk5Z8StPjH3D9Sqz7wxu9) [Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1958 March–April](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Mar-Apr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923354585&usg=AOvVaw2jDV6yLf6GMhyBv8daEk3j), The Author, 1998, p. 69)

April 13 — 9:40 p.m. Lester Billheimer and Carl Kern watch an object shaped like a “solid right angle” glowing like a white neon light over Allentown, Pennsylvania. It travels northwest at first, then turns west and disappears after three seconds. (NICAP case file)

April 15 — Day. A witness in Broager, Denmark, sees a large, black, low-flying, triangular object. As it flies over town, a number of horseshoe-shaped objects emerge, emitting a strong light. Twenty other witnesses see a triangular

* * *

“spaceship” at the same time. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1958](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Mar-Apr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923355479&usg=AOvVaw2YiaGz7OdR4flC55Zi8WHg) [March–April](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Mar-Apr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923355791&usg=AOvVaw3j5oLOrG_ZYZ8EJTtBRh6p)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Mar-Apr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923356074&usg=AOvVaw2BQtn9F6qHTKsxfBBWf1yl) The Author, 1998, p. 77)

April 25 — The officer for UFO investigation in Denmark, Lt. Col. [Hans-Christian Petersen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufo.se/index.php/p/1237-petersen-hans-christian-1923&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923356594&usg=AOvVaw3mTxXD_eQ60BIluyuysolQ), tells the magazine B-T that multiple-witness sightings are commonplace and that the current Danish wave is comparable to that of the US 1952 wave. “Nothing is gained by rejecting all the accounts as fantasy,” he tells reporters. Petersen has founded the Skandinavisk UFO Information group in December with five other Danish military jet pilots. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1958 March–April](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Mar-Apr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923357128&usg=AOvVaw10UgJydxG3lWp92Lc1CA8l), The Author, 1998, pp. 97–99)

May 4 — [Dewey Fournet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/ufochop2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923357712&usg=AOvVaw0kRDiyAfmGC8KyCtEKfX-A) confirms, in a statement to NICAP, the existence of the Estimate of the Situation and his own motion study from 1952. (UFOEv, [p. 110](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D122%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923358178&usg=AOvVaw20mnostxP9sen8vn1gkSTX); Swords 509)

May 5 — 3:40 p.m. Experienced pilot [Carlos Alejo Rodriguez](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://desdevergaraylaregion.blogspot.com/2016/11/alejo-rodriguez-y-su-perrito-piper.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923358649&usg=AOvVaw04AD_hnlGnxkdy0ksTewpG) is flying his Piper Cub in the vicinity of Capitán de Corbeta Naval Air Base \[now part of Capitán de Corbeta Carlos A. Curbelo International Airport\] near San Carlos, Uruguay, when a brilliant top-like object (symmetrical above and below) suddenly approaches his plane head-on. The UFO is about 45–60 feet in diameter, stops about 6,500 feet away and “rocked twice, in a balancing motion.” Rodriguez feels strong heat, so he removes his jacket and opens the aircraft windows. The UFO takes off abruptly toward the sea “at a fantastic speed,” leaving a thin vapor trail. (NICAP, “[Top-Like Object Heats Up Piper Cub](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/580505uruguay_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923359160&usg=AOvVaw2AIpM1p3lzMMse2z_HB2T4)”; UFOEv, [p. 120](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D132%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923359488&usg=AOvVaw364LsfFeMg1Y7AhGBSSyEi); Donald E. Keyhoe and Gordon I. R. Lore Jr., [Strange Effects from UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923359873&usg=AOvVaw3pVA69BjXywMM1EFzMag-Y)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923360171&usg=AOvVaw3VnzZPZvb0UQCwQ0BGAmSk) NICAP, 1969, p. 16)

May 6 — In a letter to NICAP member George Stocking of St. Petersburg, Florida, [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923360671&usg=AOvVaw09auKfc9THkf6lJCNZO0BL) says he is “now convinced that the reports of UFO’s are nothing more than reports of balloons, aircraft, astronomical phenomena, etc. I don’t believe they are anything from outer space.” (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-May-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923361137&usg=AOvVaw3fZuz7VkvMnO_jiqzTHTnk) [History: 1958 May–July](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-May-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923361482&usg=AOvVaw2qUdOXs3AY-PN_Uf8BUy0A)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-May-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923361755&usg=AOvVaw0Vbg40fak2choJqKQDZuvk) The Author, 1999, p. 5)

May 7 — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923362236&usg=AOvVaw2jptfGIueaNnJcWCBhoJXb)’s friend [Lou Corbin](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/corbin/index.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923362465&usg=AOvVaw3aHWLAxiaV02be7fwruUjv) has received from a military friend of Gen. [Nathan Twining](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923362774&usg=AOvVaw3twaThC_KWBDhusqa1t8Xi) news that Twining is still concerned about UFOs. Keyhoe writes to him and receives a note from Twining’s executive officer, Col.

[James C. Sherrill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105639/lieutenant-general-james-c-sherrill/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923363198&usg=AOvVaw10X_IJ1pdJ7SBuKvan--dz): “No effective means have been developed for the establishment of communication by radio or otherwise with unknown aerial objects. The technical obstacles involved in such an endeavor, I am sure, are quite obvious to you.” (Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 198–199)

May 8 — US Rep. [John E. Henderson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_E._Henderson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923363590&usg=AOvVaw3V4IRQyAbwpPABB5NAQNEW) (R-Ohio) writes to Secretary of Defense [Neil H. McElroy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neil_H._McElroy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923363955&usg=AOvVaw03qN1Yftxm9QHDvD8qi5m7) asking about the status of UFO reports and the USAF investigation. ATIC decides to give Henderson a formal briefing. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1958 May–July](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-May-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923364219&usg=AOvVaw2-qEbKD5p8ZvW1mGmcHtUy)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-May-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923364369&usg=AOvVaw2bWkrchVhNEAe96BHDvouA) The Author, 1999, pp. 5–8, 42; Swords 276)

May 13 — 12:15 p.m. A Royal Canadian Air Force Dakota DC-3 is flying to RCAF Station Cold Lake, Alberta, from Victoria, British Columbia. When it changes its heading about 25 miles southwest of Calgary, Alberta, a large, thick, black cloud suddenly appears directly across their flight path at the same altitude. Their VHF communications with Cold Lake and Calgary suddenly cease working. The cloud has indistinct, hazy edges, and it increases in size as they approach at about 155 mph. The pilot unsuccessfully tries to radio Calgary to request a flight path change to avoid the cloud, which is now about 10 miles away. Suddenly he sees a brilliant white pinpoint of light materialize in the dark mass. It grows in size, forming a brilliant ball that quickly approaches the aircraft on a collision course. He braces himself, but the light disappears, and the black cloud vanishes. (Don Ledger, “Two Spherical UAP Cases Witnessed by Pilots in Canadian Airspace,” IUR 33, no. 2 (July 2010): 7–9)

May 15 — The Soviets launch Sputnik 3 from Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan. (Wikipedia, “[Sputnik 3](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sputnik_3&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923365026&usg=AOvVaw3NDOJUTSb3yYEhQkzpbPOG)”)

May 15 — Lackland AFB’s chief of education planning for the officer candidate school, Maj. Warren Akin, suggests, at a meeting of the Junior Chamber of Commerce in San Antonio, Texas, that UFOs are spacecraft. (“[Visitors from](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94523637/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923365344&usg=AOvVaw0a2hg5bU8ahx9SSFeXAVwt) [Outer Space Already May Have Visited Us, Major Says](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94523637/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923365519&usg=AOvVaw2Jo_Ers57y7vssHBs0Vmc5),” San Antonio (Tex.) Express, May 16, 1958, p. 2)

May 16 — USAF Capt. [Walter W. Irwin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.thisdayinaviation.com/tag/walter-w-irwin/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923365975&usg=AOvVaw0htlzL51dtrSkKaUnJRqW1) reaches 1,404 mph in a Lockheed YF-104A Starfighter at Edwards AFB, California. (Wikipedia, “[Lockheed F-104 Starfighter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_F-104_Starfighter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923366257&usg=AOvVaw3UALst-Hy3oTe6PP1bzbb8)”)

May 31–June 1 — The fifth Interplanetary Spacecraft Convention takes place at Giant Rock, near Landers, California. [Dana Howard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dana_Howard_(contactee)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923366591&usg=AOvVaw0NWtWy7oZVz1BFQf-7L4Y9), [Truman Bethurum](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truman_Bethurum&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923366777&usg=AOvVaw2fdoq6kPHwV4A6dASIPHrv)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truman_Bethurum&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923366957&usg=AOvVaw3ajXclpZnC8M0P_j-wHoFr) John McCoy, [Wayne Aho](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wayne_Sulo_Aho&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923367164&usg=AOvVaw05AhfArO3QbGPSx0VTVySm)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wayne_Sulo_Aho&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923367370&usg=AOvVaw3h-GSahUWzzSCsHHMYEwk4) [Daniel Fry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_Fry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923367545&usg=AOvVaw1SQ9KVt4yB9N6TGAMjoxnC), and [Reinhold O. Schmidt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reinhold_O._Schmidt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923367741&usg=AOvVaw1KAqYjwenSEZSRrXGw-CQQ) join host [George Van Tassel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Van_Tassel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923367980&usg=AOvVaw1A3MX4q108k-WkKtPwlmos) for two days of contactee conviviality. (Dana Howard, “[Dana Howard Reporting the Giant](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CJul-Aug%252CV%25204%252CN%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923368286&usg=AOvVaw0o6WxK6DDIttaK5pwwAtGQ) [Rock Convention, 1958,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CJul-Aug%252CV%25204%252CN%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923368652&usg=AOvVaw3p6e-0Hmj5L5v2qJk-0Ay8)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1958): 20–21, 25)

Summer — At an unidentified Air Force base in the Southwest US, two jets are vectored in on two UFOs flying together as seen on radar. As the jets close in, one UFO disappears from the radarscope and quickly reappears behind the first jet. The first pilot reverses his course and again tries to close in. The UFO climbs out of range. The second pilot has the same difficulty with the other UFO. (“[UFO Chase by AF Jets Revealed to NICAP,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/008%2520JUNE%25201959.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923369488&usg=AOvVaw3ctqxPVkESYllI0x9dlxrV)” UFO Investigator 1, no. 8 (June 1959): 7)

* * *

Summer — Evening. A mechanic at Holloman AFB, New Mexico, allegedly sees a disc-like craft hovering silently above the tarmac. As the object retracts its landing gear, he manages to alert another mechanic in time for them both to see it take off at high speed. The Air Force officers who interrogate them tell them the object was also seen by control tower operators. (Good Need, [p. 223](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/222/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923370297&usg=AOvVaw35okklnscGTBtpfI7aHowK))

June — A USAF officer secretly meets with [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923370734&usg=AOvVaw2mWFtPs7413dJmFlfxC-HF) and gives him three UFO reports and warns him that the Air Force will ask him for “certain UFO information. Think it over carefully before you decide.” NICAP could be in trouble, he says. Two days later, NICAP receives a request from the Air Force requesting any cases that indicate intelligent maneuvers by UFOs. Keyhoe refuses the request, sensing a setup. (Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 199, 232–233)

June — [Richard H. Hall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_H._Hall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923371189&usg=AOvVaw2orFWi9KbdAW_d9haycmeO) joins NICAP as executive secretary and associate editor. (Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 30, 208)

June — Lackland AFB in San Antonio, Texas, has prepared a 17-page TV script based on a straightforward interpretation of [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923371694&usg=AOvVaw3DGVKmtY4fEYWmNX4PnQDz)’s The Flying Saucer Conspiracy, even including the 1953 [Moncla](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Felix_Moncla&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923372133&usg=AOvVaw1bm9-zu2CPHtr630jUDXYH) case. The script states that “the most logical explanation is that the saucers are interplanetary.” It also says that USAF has “concealed information which was thought to be of danger because of the impending possibility of hysteria and panic.” Keyhoe approves the script, but Lackland withdraws it from consideration by December. (Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 219–227)

June — 4:00 a.m. A woman doctor at a resort at Sinaia, Romania, sees a silvery domed disc traveling slowly and silently toward the southeast at 1,500 feet. On its underside it has a bluish triangular section with rounded points. It passes within 900 feet of her hotel. (Hobana and Weverbergh 159–160)

June — 9:00 p.m. B. Muratov and his father are returning home to Chimbay, Uzbekistan, after a fishing expedition to the Aral Sea. They notice a disc-shaped object approaching them directly at low altitude from the northeast. It flies over them and see that its diameter is about 82 feet and it is traveling at 150–180 mph. Its hull is shiny and one side shines with a red color. A pipe is attached to one side, and it gives off a steady “zing zing zing” sound. (Stonehill and Mantle, Russia’s USO Secrets, Flying Disk, 2020, p. 123)

June 1 — 11:15 a.m. Bjørn Taraldsen, Nils M. Turi, Kate Julsen, and Rasmus Hykkerud watch a silent “unknown aircraft” like a twin-engine, delta-wing jet with no identifying marks plunge into the Altafjord, Troms og Finnmark, Norway. A column of water rises up, and dead fish float to the surface. The frigate [KNM Arendal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Badsworth&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923372943&usg=AOvVaw3UWvTglw9eFSWhc4xI5gz5) and the submarine KNM Sarpen, along with divers, search fruitlessly for more than a week, although the Arendal does get a sonar reading of a mobile object. (Ole Jonny Brænne, “Observations of Unidentified Submarine Objects in Norway,” IUR 20, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1995): 12)

June 3 — Physicist [Freeman Dyson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freeman_Dyson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923373486&usg=AOvVaw2wRg40zUnYJfBHIk-SzIFh) in Princeton, New Jersey, writes a speculative paper on “The Search for Artificial Stellar Sources of Infrared Radiation” in which he discusses how an advanced civilization might be visible from Earth. He suggests that the logical endpoint of the drive to capture as much energy from a sun would be for engineers to completely enclose it in a hollow sphere. Once the builders have completed it, the only light visible from their star would be the muted infrared glow of radiation heat. Such a structure, which becomes known as a “Dyson sphere,” would be a sure sign of an advanced race. (Freeman J. Dyson, “[Search for Artificial Stellar](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.islandone.org/LEOBiblio/SETI1.HTM&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923373897&usg=AOvVaw1JBW0vP-egcidYk1aPZXo8) [Sources of Infrared Radiation,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.islandone.org/LEOBiblio/SETI1.HTM&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923374082&usg=AOvVaw3dBWZ_cSJImGH_foIqz3pT)” Science 131 (1960): 1667–1668; Wikipedia, “[Dyson sphere](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dyson_sphere&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923374341&usg=AOvVaw3YcEFgx5wR-gJUvIaF284r)”)

June 6 — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923374591&usg=AOvVaw2r8Zqo3H3FSR9TS3Wb3M46) writes to NICAP member George Stocking saying that [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923374846&usg=AOvVaw0R4fqoxLGa4y3zDHX3s2Ml) has a job at an aircraft company that contracts with the Air Force and thus might be playing it safe about UFOs. (Clark III 1023)

June 10 — MP [George Chetwynd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Chetwynd&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923375217&usg=AOvVaw2IaCmtC2pS7IvU69sHbP6E) in the UK House of Commons asks the Air Ministry how many instances of UFOs were reported in the past 12 months and what steps were taken to look into them. Under-Secretary of State for Air [Ian](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ian_Orr-Ewing%252C_Baron_Orr-Ewing&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923375572&usg=AOvVaw3OHQZG3AVwhUfYeWosB5G0) [Orr-Ewing](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ian_Orr-Ewing%252C_Baron_Orr-Ewing&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923375772&usg=AOvVaw3DKw1JsFO2pywfTFs_Mrtp) replies that 54 reports were received and that most were meteors, balloons, aircraft, and satellites. (“[Unsatisfactory Answer to M.P.’s Question on UFOs by Undersecretary for Air,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CJul-Aug%252CV%25204%252CN%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923376073&usg=AOvVaw36sl64qOVF5jaDEcCQqydR)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1958): 5; Good Above, [p. 51](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/50/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923376385&usg=AOvVaw3JP0thoMUdWNdjsO1RKX3J))

June 20 — USAF Maj. [Joseph E. Boland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8792087/joseph-edward-boland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923376651&usg=AOvVaw3b0R--vfxIh9XPeTFOLB1T) and Maj. [Lawrence J. Tacker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30450384/lawrence-j-tacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923376994&usg=AOvVaw2YecgAsh5-AKymtelK22AF) brief Rep. [John E. Henderson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_E._Henderson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923377314&usg=AOvVaw2e6ez4gPtQETF1tNls8X9O) (R-Ohio) for one hour on the status of Air Force UFO investigations in the Capitol building in Columbus, Ohio. Also in attendance are Rep. [William C. Cramer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_C._Cramer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923377571&usg=AOvVaw2qavTMnqXUlcIEdpjRT5bE) (R-Fla.), and Rep. [Donald H. Magnuson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_H._Magnuson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923377786&usg=AOvVaw3bWQ37S9f9E_IrnELlMHOR) (D-Wash.). Afterward, the legislators express confidence in the investigation and agree that publicity is unwise, “particularly in an open or closed formal congressional hearing.” (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1958](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-May-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923378209&usg=AOvVaw3Wwj8oy00zGnDlbUWRblik) [May–July](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-May-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923378429&usg=AOvVaw3Mgn5rBd40jAmlPapo5E9t)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-May-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923378622&usg=AOvVaw1F4K88dWOaWndGPL1ZFXeD) The Author, 1999, pp. 48–50; Swords 276–277)

June 25 — 8:05 p.m. Rádio Renascença in Lisbon, Portugal, broadcasts a Portuguese-language version of The War of the Worlds with only the names of characters and places changed. The Martians are supposedly landing in Caracavelos, Portugal. A certain amount of confusion results. (John Gosling, Waging the War of the Worlds, McFarland, 2009, pp. 120–129)

June 26 — The New York sector becomes the first operational component of the Semi-Automatic Ground Environment, a system of large computers that coordinates data from many radar sites and processes it to produce a single unified image of airspace over a wide area. SAGE directs and controls the NORAD response to a Soviet air attack,

* * *

operating in this role from the late 1950s into the 1980s. Its enormous computers and huge displays remain a part of Cold War lore. (Wikipedia, “[Semi-Automatic Ground Environment](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Semi-Automatic_Ground_Environment&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923379515&usg=AOvVaw1E2DdPd0XRYt9x2qOVQg6L)”)

June 28 — [Otis T. Carr](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otis_T._Carr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923379768&usg=AOvVaw032NCVeaORFRUz2iMQIP5a) and Norman Evans Colton appear on the [Long John Nebel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_John_Nebel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923379995&usg=AOvVaw0vMoC-eHpeinoS2zEIKP4i) show on WOR-AM in New York City.

After Carr praises his mentor, [Nikola Tesla](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nikola_Tesla&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923380266&usg=AOvVaw15c5_oo8FquO9xFpiFWjGz), another guest asks Carr to enumerate one or two of his discoveries. Carr feigns a memory lapse, then later is unable to recite even one of [Newton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isaac_Newton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923380461&usg=AOvVaw1q8AZl6P0Z_lWw7LARDZV5)’s three laws of motion. (Clark III 860)
