June 28–29 — [Lee Childers Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1955-04-usa-detroit.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923380882&usg=AOvVaw3LnGyAQoZ69vRppBchvGON), a baker from Detroit, Michigan, speaks at a flying saucer convention near Mountain View, Missouri, in the Ozarks hosted by contactee [Buck Nelson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buck_Nelson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923381108&usg=AOvVaw2s1CIhzRo8leVKIXFzcY7D)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buck_Nelson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923381267&usg=AOvVaw0Q8gmHehwUXp6_DXVcrnwk) He claims that since April 1955 he has made 21 trips to other planets (and even to “Wolf Star 359 in the Titanian system” that has 2 planets revolving around it) on a saucer piloted by a spaceman named Commander Marcosan. He also went to a space station 2,000 miles in diameter called Trijanon. Other people tell their personal fantastic stories, among them [Wayne Aho](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wayne_Sulo_Aho&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923381503&usg=AOvVaw1xBrrLnbUy4Gzj3FvkVEXp) and Buck Nelson himself. (“[Out-of-This-World Ozark Convention,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94527629/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923381718&usg=AOvVaw1ERPATtNaIKS3s3xJAL_TE)” St. Louis Post-Dispatch, July 6, 1958, p. 71; Clark III 915)

June 29 — Day. Former RAF Flight Engineer Peter Spencer is flying in an Auster aircraft piloted by Dennis Jackson at 800 feet near the docks at Grimsby, Lincolnshire, England. A large black dumbbell appears below them, flying against the wind. Suddenly it rises up to their height and flies along with them for a while at their speed. Then it accelerates in a terrific burst of speed to a position above them. They try to follow it, but it speeds out over the docks at 1,000 feet and 800 mph. Spencer manages to take three photos of it, but the images show a speed blur. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1958, May–July](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-May-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923382188&usg=AOvVaw2s0A7LXcrUXKhIP6JXStt6), The Author, 1999, p. 59)

July — President [Dwight Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923382550&usg=AOvVaw0UPNG_NETkt_5m92ATT_wm) requests permission from Pakistan to establish a secret US intelligence facility at Badaber (Peshawar Air Station) to fly U-2 reconnaissance missions over the Soviet Union. (Wikipedia, “[1960 U-2](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1960_U-2_incident&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923382799&usg=AOvVaw0sKrTNi7BKTNwuZx0MABhn) [incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1960_U-2_incident&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923383006&usg=AOvVaw26PXMfOUMExcfeF2zelQRL)”)

July — Dusk. [Michael D. Swords](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_D._Swords&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923383251&usg=AOvVaw3s5oLIb5pel1j4LFRZbfAa) and his brother Tom are at home in St. Albans, West Virginia, and listening to WCHS- AM radio where someone is calling in a UFO report. They rush to a window and see a domed disc with a revolving top cruise quietly across the landscape. (Michael D. Swords, “We Know Where You Live,” IUR 30, no. 2 (January 2006): 12; Michael D. Swords)

July — Night. A 509th Refueling Mission is returning to an Air Force Base in New Hampshire \[Pease AFB in Portsmouth?\] from Goose Bay \[now CFB Goose Bay\], Labrador. The crew is flying a KC-97 at about 17,000– 18,000 feet. A light like a “moving star” appears. It approaches below the cloud cover and seems to be spherical and as bright as Venus. It soon becomes the apparent size of the Moon, lighting up the clouds above it. The light is a brilliant blue-white with two dark spots, possibly indicating a structure. The object angles upwards and speeds out of sight in 5 seconds. (Michael D. Swords, GrassRoots UFOs: Case Reports from the Timmerman Files, Fund for UFO Research, 2005, pp. 24–25)

July–September — A civilian in Washington, D.C., manages to repeatedly photograph “geometrically shaped flying objects as they passed between his telescope and the moon.” The photos are “remarkably clear and certainly indicated a phenomenon for which he had no ready explanation.” The writer of an October 1 memo, a CIA employee, requests advice on “how we might get our hands on these materials to examine them firsthand and to make a more complete analysis of them.” (ClearIntent, [pp. 136–137](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/136/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923383929&usg=AOvVaw2LssGAr83c5QsqJokub1lS))

July 17 — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923384186&usg=AOvVaw2-mSWL8-xcx6dTKIkuj9uv) writes to [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923384446&usg=AOvVaw0NhncNmJ5QKNaMVT7bn5yb) to say he is puzzled about his current stance on UFOs, but understands that he might be under pressure from the Air Force. (Michael Hall and Wendy Connors, “[The Forgotten Correspondence of](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/papers/ruppelt_forgotten.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923384722&usg=AOvVaw0iD4py7K4LPTAhkOgzcACg) [Edward J. Ruppelt: The Story behind](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/papers/ruppelt_forgotten.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923384930&usg=AOvVaw28sB3VXiRM5KqODl1W5F-x) [Report on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/papers/ruppelt_forgotten.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923385144&usg=AOvVaw2uDk-RzhMViLkCwd9cde2M)” pp. 15–16)

July 18 — 8:30 p.m. High-school student Chris Kauffman is gazing at the night sky in Albuquerque, New Mexico, when he sees an object shaped like an equilateral triangle pass directly overhead in a north to south direction at 70–100 mph and 1,000 feet altitude for 10 seconds. It is flying with one point of the triangle as a forward edge and has 12 small orange lights along its edges. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-May-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923385501&usg=AOvVaw0qrrB8xHk01iiZcGA64Bs5) [1958, May–July,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-May-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923385688&usg=AOvVaw1r9GJTRcf7Ej64O6fUwJiq) The Author, 1999, pp. 76–77)

July 29 — The National Aeronautics and Space Administration succeeds the National Advisory Committee on Aeronautics. The new agency is to have a distinctly civilian orientation, encouraging peaceful applications in space science. (Wikipedia, “[NASA](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923385999&usg=AOvVaw3blj3GfDpm7SozMiZZzY_a)”)

July 29 — An Associated Press writer in Alamogordo, New Mexico, sees an abridged version of [Carl Jung](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Jung&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923386255&usg=AOvVaw0OpzogERTpq33OQN5MuwX7)’s 1954 letters on UFOs in the APRO Bulletin and jumps to the conclusion that the psychologist believes them to be extraterrestrial in origin. (Carl Jung, “[On Unconventional Aerial Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201958%252007%252000%2520-%2520July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923386553&usg=AOvVaw1bOsfP4bTNuAiO2OZwrPfi)” APRO Bulletin, July 1958, pp. 1, 5; “[Dr. Jung Says ‘Saucers’ Exist: Bars Psychological Explanations,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1958/07/30/81921973.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923386849&usg=AOvVaw12FOyhEYgEMLSklpsRqgIM)” New York Times, July 30, 1958, p. 13; Clark III 637)

* * *

July 30 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923387237&usg=AOvVaw1NrtOAhOenNPnzAAcvvqix) writes [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923387444&usg=AOvVaw1pFtnCSc3lYSFeDHhZLNbs) back, saying he has “always been convinced that UFO’s were nothing more than reports of airplanes, balloons, astronomical phenomena, etc.” He says he is not being intimidated, he is just not interested in UFOs anymore and too busy. (Michael Hall and Wendy Connors, “[The Forgotten Correspondence of](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/papers/ruppelt_forgotten.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923387691&usg=AOvVaw1wgiHPl3d22dhhvlK9TQoO) [Edward J. Ruppelt: The Story behind](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/papers/ruppelt_forgotten.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923387888&usg=AOvVaw0ZIMRs3nyJh7H4o61hn0mT) [Report on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/papers/ruppelt_forgotten.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923388039&usg=AOvVaw263gzsKY_PUrNa8kpk_zGY)” p. 16)

July 30 — MP [George Chetwynd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Chetwynd&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923388326&usg=AOvVaw1ZUEDZ6vjqeH4EOaBs6bXM) presses further questions in the UK House of Commons by asking the Secretary of State for Air [George Ward](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Ward%252C_1st_Viscount_Ward_of_Witley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923388721&usg=AOvVaw33bphQms9ECXxjEltbvw3z) what action is taken to identify unexplained UFOs. Ward replies that the unidentified reports are “not sufficiently precise.” (“[More Questions in House of Commons,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1958%252CSep-Oct%252CV%25204%252CN%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923389124&usg=AOvVaw0-GswuaQaLdoYrXeSK2qqN)” Flying Saucer Review 4, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1958): iv; Good Above, [pp. 51–52](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/50/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923389492&usg=AOvVaw32hxminNIjrdGKtDOygFHr))

August — Polish Air Force pilot Apoloniusz Czernów of the 3rd Fighter Regiment in Warsaw, is returning from an attempted balloon interception in the area around Świdnica, Poland. Flying at 26,000 feet, he sees another possible balloon 9 miles away at a height of 3,200 feet and turns his MiG-17 toward it. But when he approaches it, he sees it is a cigar-shaped object tilted at a 45° angle, silvery-orange in color, and pulsating with a weird light. He gets closer and the object ascends at high speed, heads north, changes to orange-red, and disappears. Base radar has detected nothing. (Poland 63–64)

August 1 — The Teak thermonuclear test, part of Operation Hardtack I, is launched from Johnston Atoll in the North Pacific Ocean and carries a payload of 3.8 megatons. The warhead is carried on a Redstone missile, which has a “program failure,” causing it to go straight up and detonate directly above the island. In a sanitized film record of the event, men in flip-flops and shorts can be seen ducking for cover as a phenomenal fireball consumes the sky overhead. During the Teak test, all crew on and around Johnston Atoll are given protective eyewear to prevent flash blindness from the explosion. Besides the hazard of blindness, thermal radiation is another concern—even at an altitude of 50 miles. A crew member on Johnston at the time is said to have received a slight sunburn from the amount of thermal radiation that had reached the island. While only slight to the crew member, it creates issues for the local fauna. Many birds are seen in distress. Unsure if this is caused by blindness or thermal radiation, the project members decide to take precautions to protect local wildlife during the next test. The explosion can be seen from Hawaii 806 miles away and is said to be visible for almost half an hour. After the explosion, high- frequency, long-distance communication is interrupted across the Pacific. Due to this failure, Johnston Atoll personnel are unable to contact their superiors to advise of the test results until about 8 hours after the detonation. The detonation disturbs [Wernher Von Braun](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wernher_von_Braun&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923390296&usg=AOvVaw3rJnS82DP1qqh7yIBKOsnJ) so greatly that he leaves the island shortly after comms are restored. The explosion causes the blue sky to turn red, white, and gray, and it creates an aurora 2,100 miles long along the geomagnetic meridian. (Wikipedia, “[Operation Hardtack I](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Hardtack_I%23Teak&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923390588&usg=AOvVaw1rz4a-O51waKCsfqLQLEz0)”; Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 170–171](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/170/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923390881&usg=AOvVaw2o_tM4UOPhxebwhPXKBIq-))

August 3 — 2:25 a.m. A sudden violet-orange brightness illuminates the sky over Rome, Italy, for about 3 seconds. Lights in the city dim, failing completely in some areas. Physician Angelo Corsi witnesses it 37 miles southeast of Rome in Sgurgola. After his car radio fails, and the house and streetlights go out, he sees a long whitish trail like a fan in the sky. At 2:22 a.m., in Rieti a sergeant and some guards see a yellow-green cigar-shaped object moving rapidly toward the southeast. It leaves a luminous trail that lights up roads, mountains, and houses for several seconds. A similar sight is seen in Naples. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923391270&usg=AOvVaw2w85bgwOIfEVH43E6BMuOn), pp. 142–143; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Aug-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923391526&usg=AOvVaw1HwnLLt-vNHdE-3SZpH5sb) [UFOs, a History: 1958 August–September](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Aug-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923391720&usg=AOvVaw3mv1xJSZmaQkfrOP4c4BUm), The Author, 1999, pp. 1, 3)

August 8 — An informal two-hour hearing on UFOs is held by the House Subcommittee on Atmospheric Phenomena, chaired by Rep. [William Natcher](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Natcher&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923392075&usg=AOvVaw3vVPSBvYaB2XIqHeyZfI9J) (D-Ky.), which is part of the Select Committee on Astronautics and Space Exploration, chaired by Rep. [John W. McCormack](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_W._McCormack&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923392309&usg=AOvVaw3opY4JQhzkd2qm4a7fS9Bo) (D-Mass.). Although McCormack wants an extended hearing in closed secret session, unrecorded, ATIC Capt. [George T. Gregory](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/158570232/george-thurston-gregory&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923392609&usg=AOvVaw3w9CfKZH_OmnrTvmqaG5aj) persuades him to allow the Air Force to give a briefing, while allowing people like [Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923392846&usg=AOvVaw1SROwE5vftNYBcE8BFTW6l), [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923393015&usg=AOvVaw10X7A17JxDFMscELnwrOj8), and [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923393197&usg=AOvVaw0TqoZ7KSCx-z1_glqYYI58) to offer their opinions later. NICAP as a whole should be excluded, he emphasizes. The main witnesses turn out to be Gregory and Maj. [Tacker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30450384/lawrence-j-tacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923393417&usg=AOvVaw3AFgZYRzHjyhF1ZJKglHnp). The subcommittee, which also includes [Kenneth Keating](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Keating&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923393597&usg=AOvVaw1dqy8Cb2yi2Q_sHcrSoIwp) (R-N.Y.) and [Lee Metcalf](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lee_Metcalf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923393799&usg=AOvVaw3zpiTHtS1tEc_fcSPtpSg1) (D-Mont.), commends Gregory for his presentation on Project Blue Book’s “improved” methods. The hearings were to have been extended to the following week, but they decide to call no more witnesses at the suggestion of scientific consultant Dr. [Charles S.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1981/09/12/charles-sheldon-ii-dies/904f7180-198d-4a93-82ac-ff28c700b9e0/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923394113&usg=AOvVaw1uKLAZRuD3XEZk5aKte3vN) [Sheldon II](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1981/09/12/charles-sheldon-ii-dies/904f7180-198d-4a93-82ac-ff28c700b9e0/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923394367&usg=AOvVaw1JdzFOifS4ZQ4YSVF3qJ3-)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1981/09/12/charles-sheldon-ii-dies/904f7180-198d-4a93-82ac-ff28c700b9e0/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923394550&usg=AOvVaw1_5CkbFdn7eouDzhKe9MHB) who thus maneuvers Keyhoe out of appearing. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Aug-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923394742&usg=AOvVaw3SwmtDK268n1lqE6YLceEp) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1958 August–September](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Aug-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923394975&usg=AOvVaw3IIdqoricD0Yydl6Mu1AVf)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Aug-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923395130&usg=AOvVaw38cKgeUULsbsUvKqowK1uE) The Author, 1999, pp. 5–27; Swords 277–279)

August 9 — [Carl Jung](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Jung&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923395429&usg=AOvVaw1NksYSoHtiTfMkfdwPP4nY) issues a denial to the Associated Press about his “extraterrestrial” statement, saying that witnesses are “in need of fantasy.” He thinks “something is being seen,” but his interest is more in what they think they are seeing. (“[Dr. Jung Says Flying Saucers Are a New ‘Savior Myth,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94531153/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923395669&usg=AOvVaw2e1rq5l0VyRuoFxDs_zmuY)” St. Louis Post-Dispatch, August 9, 1958, p. 5)

August 11 — The Orange thermonuclear test is launched by Redstone missile from Johnston Atoll with a yield of 3.8 megatons. Although Orange is visible from Hawaii, it is not the great spectacle Teak had been. The light from the 28-mile-high blast is visible for about 5 minutes, but does not cause a large communication interruption; however,

* * *

some commercial flights to Hawaii are said to have lost contact with air traffic controllers for a short period of time. (Wikipedia, “[Operation Hardtack I](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Hardtack_I%23Orange&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923396206&usg=AOvVaw3nvHqfqSdDng2xPRYiEB3Z)”)

August 11 — Betty Jane Williamson dies in Lima, Peru, when her husband [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923396505&usg=AOvVaw3iXvBd5yXAqd7ia1kbxZpk) is on a lecture tour in Europe. Her death is caused by malnutrition generated by an alternative diet regimen. [James W. Moseley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_W._Moseley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923396770&usg=AOvVaw1wR7tJHb_XNVJJkgyzw8wC) later circulates an outrageously false accusation that Williamson killed Betty by pushing her off a cliff, but the charge is a complete fabrication. (Clark III 1286; James W. Moseley and Karl T. Pflock, Shockingly Close to the Truth! Confessions of a Grave-Robbing Ufologist, Prometheus, 2002, pp. 137–138; Jerome Clark, “The Trivialist,” IUR 27, no. 1 (Spring 2002): 15–19, 29–30; Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, pp. 117, 123–124)

August 16 — Around 5:00 p.m. Several persons on Lake Geneva, Switzerland, watch a bright light descending. It comes to hover about 45 feet above their boat. It is saucer-shaped, about 39 feet in diameter, and has a cabin on top with several windows. It causes a noticeable current in the water. After several leaps in the air, it flies off at high speed. (Vallée, Magonia, [p. 272](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/passporttomagoni0000vall/page/272/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923397451&usg=AOvVaw3aVwMwQm4VMX1X6WF9Qez5))

August 18 — 7:05 or 7:10 p.m. Typewriter repairman Alex Donald Chisholm is at home at 21950 Cunningham Avenue in Warren, Michigan, with Walter Moilanion and his wife and possibly a young daughter, when he sees a light much brighter than Venus in the vicinity of a flight of four military aircraft. He watches the object through 8x30 mm Japanese artillery-observer field glasses. It looks to be a Saturn-shaped grayish object like a “fried egg in pan.” Later it flips over, and another more elongated ring can be seen surrounding it. The object is about 60 feet long and is stationary for 5-8 minutes. However, the object is probably a Skyhook balloon launched from the University of Minnesota on August 17. (Clark III 392; NICAP, \[[case file](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs2/1958_08_18_US_MI_Warren_Chisholm.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923397783&usg=AOvVaw1Tlby6ZGB2yBN1sQPEagte)\])

August 27–September 6 — In Operation Argus, three nuclear warheads are launched from X-17 rockets from the deck of the [USS Norton Sound](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Norton_Sound_(AVM-1)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923398138&usg=AOvVaw3QrYaoNzCSxROddPutn7Tb) in the South Atlantic Ocean off the coast of South Africa. They explode approximately 300 miles into space. The tests are proposed by [Nicholas Christofilos](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicholas_Christofilos&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923398413&usg=AOvVaw1I0z7JfgaCkkUeuJ7mQLH9) in an unpublished paper of the Livermore branch \[now the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory\] of the Lawrence Radiation Laboratory in Berkeley, California, as a means to verify the Christofilos effect, which argues that high-altitude nuclear detonations will create a radiation belt in the extreme upper regions of the Earth’s atmosphere (they do create artificial electron belts that persist several weeks), or an electronic pulse that could hypothetically damage the arming devices on Soviet ICBM warheads (they do not). (Wikipedia, “[Operation Argus](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Argus&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923398780&usg=AOvVaw26wZyEZsyfswNFcpybpnVb)”)

September — NICAP fires its office manager, treasurer, and typist Rose Hackett Campbell after she gives membership cards to [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923399314&usg=AOvVaw1v3SI-f-asrfkTBk4_xfAF) and other contactees. [Richard H. Hall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_H._Hall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923399664&usg=AOvVaw0ZJ4sHEx-VEL9sCa9LZd6o) begins work at NICAP as associate editor. (“[Resignations,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/005%2520AUG-SEPT%25201958.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923400096&usg=AOvVaw1IgG5X3s3_58nUFMrH076x)” UFO Investigator 1, no. 5 (Aug./Sept. 1958): 2; “[Richard Hall Becomes Assoc. Editor,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/005%2520AUG-SEPT%25201958.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923400576&usg=AOvVaw00GgoTRyINj52zYCPN0Zc9)” UFO Investigator 1, no. 5 (Aug./Sept. 1958): 2)

September — Around 9:00 p.m. The [USS](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Franklin_D._Roosevelt_(CV-42)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923401180&usg=AOvVaw2wp6Zl05bRveI0sVaGVOsU) [Franklin D. Roosevelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Franklin_D._Roosevelt_(CV-42)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923401443&usg=AOvVaw0BoRFmeWgQOGrINOYyST5D) is on a shakedown cruise in the Caribbean Sea out of Guantanamo Bay Naval Base, Cuba, when at least 25 of the 3,000 crew members notice a light following the aircraft carrier. Fireman’s apprentice [Chester C. Grusinski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://digital.lib.ecu.edu/special/ead/findingaids/0677-039&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923401949&usg=AOvVaw0u0181eMar5zTKs99xt5ea) watches it as it comes close and sees a cigar-shaped object with portholes and figures inside looking out. Grusinki can feel heat coming from the object, and some of the ship’s power apparently goes out. After a few minutes, the object turns red-orange and takes off. (Chester C. Grusinski, “[UFOs Seen by Crew of an American Aircraft Carrier (1952–1958),](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201995%2520V%252040%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923402457&usg=AOvVaw2apGKpsuCM97LcVzg8LoQT)” Flying Saucer Review 40, no. 3 (Autumn 1995): 1–4; Gordon Creighton, “[Confirmation of an Important U.S. Naval Sighting,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25202001%2520V%252046%2520N%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923402982&usg=AOvVaw0mVSyNbLOY8B8x7V3iN97R)” Flying Saucer Review 46, no. 2 (Summer 2001): 17–20; Good Need, [pp. 234–236](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/234/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923403474&usg=AOvVaw3Y-FiZwSnGAeCzuwh8i_o6))

September 8 — 6:40 p.m. At Offutt AFB, Omaha, Nebraska, SAC Operations Officer Maj. [Paul A. Duich](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43844001/paul-a-duich&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923403980&usg=AOvVaw2yDna-Ud3wmk-q18F-G8_J)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43844001/paul-a-duich&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923404263&usg=AOvVaw0FDIWmOeAWjqzKBKqiqtVB) plus several officers from USAF Ballistic Missiles Division, Los Angeles AFB in El Segundo, California; many other air base officers and airmen; and Offutt air traffic control tower personnel see a brilliant-white, elongated, cylindrical object hovering in the west just after sunset. The object is oriented vertically with the blunter end highest. After several minutes, the object turns dull orange-red and becomes sharper in outline. A swarm of about 10 “black specks” appears to “cavort” around the lower end of the object for about one minute before disappearing. Then the cylindrical object begins to rotate counterclockwise and starts drifting slowly to the south from due west and drops in elevation angle over about 5 minutes. During the final 5-minute observation, the object continues angular descent and gradually decreases in angular size, but it begins rotating clockwise until it disappears by fading into the slight atmospheric haze. A USAF colonel takes several color photos with a 35mm camera on a tripod but later claims nothing came out. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1958](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Aug-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923404810&usg=AOvVaw1GhPzuWoe3c5VEnsX-Kbf5) [August–September](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Aug-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923405194&usg=AOvVaw014vDAjz6RrdkrX5xdobU6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Aug-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923405473&usg=AOvVaw30WiF-QEErL24_tpN4WRmu) The Author, 1999, pp. 59–63; UFOEv, [pp. 25](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D37%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923405929&usg=AOvVaw2cDnICZNJbqCFH6Pw_D6Il), [27](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D39%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923406320&usg=AOvVaw2iWSW_2veyIvsGhr2AV4r4); Herbert S. Taylor, “Satellite Objects and Cloud Cigars,” IUR 29, no. 1 (Spring 2004): 5–6; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923406697&usg=AOvVaw0zhkiADNONWpA0UNYdXBiG), p. 265; Swords 280)

September 12 — The Operation Hardtack II series of 37 nuclear tests takes place at the Nevada Test Site through October 30, all within 18 miles of Area 51. (Wikipedia, “[Operation Hardtack II](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Hardtack_II&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923407126&usg=AOvVaw1VWYEtR1lsvZbviOqBgBtH)”)

* * *

September 21 — 3:00 a.m. Mrs. William H. Fitzgerald of Sheffield Lake, Ohio, sees through her east-facing bedroom window a metallic domed disc, 12–22 feet in diameter and 6 feet thick. It sweeps in over the front lawn heading north and descending in a falling-leaf oscillating motion to about 6 feet altitude, then crosses over her driveway, and stops for several seconds about 40 feet away. It then reverses course heading south and hovers 5 feet above the lawn about 25 feet away, making a jetlike sound. The object wobbles and emits gray smoke, makes two tight clockwise turns, then rises and takes off straight up over the house towards the east. Her 10-year-old son also observes the event from another room. (NICAP, “[12ʹ Diameter 6ʹ Thick Disc within 40ʹ](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/580921sheffield_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923407778&usg=AOvVaw2ESeu6OnUqL5JOwGTYujDY)”; UFO Ev, [p. 113](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D125%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923408087&usg=AOvVaw01cRWaIwTxcSUSuBLB1r7U); Loren

E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1958 August–September](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Aug-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923408556&usg=AOvVaw3KbLj_LFKLEZ5BBGbzb5QW)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Aug-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923408807&usg=AOvVaw3FGvnoWAd3wpkww5jCcp0O) The Author, 1999,

pp. 68–72)

September 25 — The Project Moonwatch team in Portland, Oregon, is looking at the Moon when they see objects crossing the lunar disc. Occasionally they recognize the transit as a bird, but there are “tiny dark objects” that behave differently. All the object pass in the same direction and in the same location for about one second.

Supervisor Alex Geddes, who was not present, sends a supportive letter to the observers, thanking them for the data. (Michael D. Swords, “Gazing at the Moons,” IUR 32, no. 4 (October 2009): 15)

September 29 — 5:30 a.m. Pvt. Jerome A. Scanlon, stationed at Nike missile base W-93 in Derwood, Maryland, is walking from his sentry post to the barracks to sound reveille when he hears a humming sound above him. He looks up and sees a teardrop-shaped object 300 feet up and coming in for a landing at 30 mph. It moves over trees, breaking branches, and lands about 1.5 miles away. Exhaust flames issue from its rear, and its luminous green skin illuminates the terrain. It rises again and disappears. Scanlon runs to inform Riney Farris, the sergeant of the guard, who has also seen the object. They go to the landing site and find broken branches and a scorched strip of earth and vegetation about half a mile long. After the story appears in newspapers, the Air Force explains it as repair trucks doing welding jobs. (“Brass to Hear GI’s Account of Fiery ‘Saucer,’” New York Journal- American, October 7, 1958; “‘Saucer’ Landed, Say Two Soldiers,” Goldsboro (N.C.) Record, October 9, 1958; Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 90–91; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Aug-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923410427&usg=AOvVaw050FkkAHpHK51-sHnv-tbi) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1958 August–September](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Aug-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923410765&usg=AOvVaw3D9s9TtrsG5uRBQN9iRXHk)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Aug-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923411032&usg=AOvVaw008gG9yVAarIg4Se-GaZCq) The Author, 1999, p. 79)

October — Maj. [Robert J. Friend](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Friend_(pilot)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923411636&usg=AOvVaw0MkYbpta1ecjyALtVAsErR) takes over as head of Project Blue Book, relieving Capt. [George T. Gregory](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/158570232/george-thurston-gregory&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923412064&usg=AOvVaw1puZB266qUZZF3ReU0c05L)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/158570232/george-thurston-gregory&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923412351&usg=AOvVaw3YWv08DZ92sAZTsEAbJyN6) About this time, a new USAF fact sheet states that investigative improvements have reduced unsolved sightings to 1.8%. The “refinement” comes from lumping “probable” and “possible” identifications into “identified.” At the same time, a secret staff study by USAF intelligence officers addresses the public relations problems caused by [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923412747&usg=AOvVaw2HK2BNfmiOE3KOppYD-6cG), who is characterized as a “political adventurer” allied with [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923413087&usg=AOvVaw1XrP-ofcVA_HfyP10MRtXX)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923413334&usg=AOvVaw1fde45-3j-wOD171fhKMXH) both of whom are in the UFO “business” strictly for the money. Yet together “they represent a formidable team from which plenty of trouble can be expected.” The study recommends that 18–20 personnel be assigned to temporary UFO investigation duty. They would solve reports that have not been sent directly to Blue Book. Though ATIC urges implementation of the plan, Air Force Headquarters kills it. (Jacobs, UFO Controversy in America, Signet ed., 1976, [pp. 146–151](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/146/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923413812&usg=AOvVaw01YjbZAlhHzxMvKDAgZPZJ); Clark III 920; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 25–27](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/24/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923414082&usg=AOvVaw1LkXfmO0tXltJRiQ44Lnrr); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923414273&usg=AOvVaw2YC8qAw_Tkyi1of4yokN3n), p. 14)

October 1 — NASA begins operations. It includes three major labs: Langley Aeronautical Laboratory \[now Langley Research Center\] in Hampton, Virginia; Ames Aeronautical Laboratory \[now Ames Research Center\] in Mountain View, California; and Lewis Flight Propulsion Laboratory \[now Glenn Research Center\] in Brook Park, Ohio. It incorporates elements of the Army Ballistic Missile Agency and the US Naval Research Laboratory. (Wikipedia, “[NASA](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923414673&usg=AOvVaw26px61c4tJOpii5TxwXd58)”)

October 2 — Shortly after 5:00 p.m. Naturalist [Ivan T. Sanderson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivan_T._Sanderson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923414970&usg=AOvVaw18ao7FapENCgVMznDokrwU) sees a dull-gray object, shaped like a pickle with a flat bottom, fly erratically in loops over the Delaware Water Gap near Stroudsburg, Pennsylvania. (NICAP, “[Nickel-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/581002blairstown_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923415317&usg=AOvVaw3gwvJWhhQVjZfFxHIHYCce) [Shaped Object Flies Loops (Sanderson Case)](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/581002blairstown_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923415618&usg=AOvVaw2ktoOfT9bUWemLEJLJfLSY)”; UFOEv, [p. 52](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D64%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923415990&usg=AOvVaw2vMZtfg7x9TWz92EuWHJfR); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923416219&usg=AOvVaw2o7VgY-53UXC56y48RBqM6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923416358&usg=AOvVaw2RbxzTxntFgyT7SPlfpA06) p. 266)

October 3 — 3:10 a.m. A Monon Railroad freight train is traveling between Owasco and Kirklin, Indiana, when a formation of four odd white lights crosses ahead of the train. The entire crew watch the UFOs turn and traverse the full length of the train, front to back (about a half mile). After passing the rear of the train, the objects swing east, turn back, and follow the train. The bright glow conceals their exact shape, but they appear flattened and sometimes fly on edge. The objects follow the train until the conductor shines a bright light on them. Immediately the objects speed away, but return quickly and continue to pace the train. Total time of observation is about 1 hour 10 minutes. Finally the UFOs move away to the northeast and disappear. (NICAP, “[The Monon RR UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/581003wasco_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923416659&usg=AOvVaw2hIR3lEbaKVnOzhjrEIrhu) [Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/581003wasco_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923416845&usg=AOvVaw3XJac9EB6LXmKOGNTPFRtR)”; “[They’re Back Again—in Indiana,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201958%252011%252000%2520-%2520November.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923417073&usg=AOvVaw1vGu9TDnYRUItPZKbKhFB1)” APRO Bulletin, November 1958, 1, 3; Frank Edwards, “UFO Buzzes Train,” Fate 12, no. 2 (February 1959): 25–30)

October 7 — 2:55 p.m. Joseph Gwooz, master of the [SS Nantucket](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS_Nantucket_(1957)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923417531&usg=AOvVaw0Ze-7DfsLKtQLJiUtE3qnL), sees a gray, oval object in the sky at an altitude of 8,000–10,000 feet at the entrance to the Nantucket Channel, Massachusetts. It remains stationary for more than one minute, then shoots up and away to the northeast. (UFOEv, [p. 71](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D83%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923417847&usg=AOvVaw0JrcvpvA7DfXygRyv924tZ))

* * *

October 7 — 6:02 p.m. Chemist John R. Townsend, special assistant for research and engineering to the Assistant Secretary of Defense, sees a large, stationary, sharply outlined Saturn-shaped silvery object (with a “gossamer” surface appearance and a rim or girdle around its equator) in a clear sky in Alexandria, Virginia. It rapidly rises at an estimated speed of 1,000 mph and disappears to the south after 40 seconds. At one point a passing Capitol Airlines Flight 407 flies directly between his line of sight and the UFO at 2 miles distance, allowing him to estimate the UFO’s size as about 500 feet. Townsend reenacts the timing by walking the half block down Lee Street to get a better feeling for its distance and size. (NICAP, “[Saturn-Shaped Object Observed, Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/581007alexandria_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923418240&usg=AOvVaw00ljIjvuzX-gU2teU7JiDn) [Confirmed by Pilot](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/581007alexandria_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923418423&usg=AOvVaw1rMZRy378-u23SZuxRlz2A)”; Swords 282; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923418604&usg=AOvVaw0GSmkWlFYQRs8cccYX8fi3), p. 267)

October 26 — 10:30 p.m. Alvin Cohen and Phillip Small are rounding a curve on Maryland Route 146 some 600–900 feet south of the bridge at Loch Raven Reservoir, Maryland. They see a large (100 feet long) egg-shaped object hanging 100–150 feet above the bridge. When they drive to within 75 feet of it their car stalls and the dash lights turn off. They get out of the car and watch the UFO from behind it for 30–45 seconds. The UFO flashes a beam of white light and they feel heat on their faces. They also hear a dull explosion. The UFO rises vertically and disappears in 5–10 seconds. They are able to start the car and drive into Towson, Maryland, to make a phone call to the Ground Observer Corps and the police. Police Cpl. Kenneth Hartmann and Patrolman Richard Fink drive up and they tell them the story, then they go to St. Joseph’s Hospital in Baltimore and are given a cursory examination for burns. Other people in the neighborhood either see an object at the time or hear the boom. (“[Baltimore’s Flying Saucer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99777236/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923418952&usg=AOvVaw1r-0hJeY2eReUr8UbNBLS3)” Baltimore (Md.) Evening Sun, December 15, 1958, p. 21; NICAP, “[Egg-Shaped](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/581026lochravendam_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923419197&usg=AOvVaw1pqYW-SHmjPHeeT6pcR5Yq) [Object & E-M Effects over Bridge](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/581026lochravendam_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923419367&usg=AOvVaw1GNJm0PT3guwOTdOIAuipQ)”; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923419579&usg=AOvVaw0hf7R2Wy5rkuqhLViyyp-t), pp. 62–63; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923419763&usg=AOvVaw1K2ZDacByWNXioCmJXLA8A) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1958 October](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923419971&usg=AOvVaw1rQtP0xdNjXu4xyduCfYMB)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Oct.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923420107&usg=AOvVaw1Mx-o1uCfzpvlkmCvNiDnC) The Author, 1999, pp, 73–86; J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 132](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/132/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923420386&usg=AOvVaw01lIlAsEpcmMxcJyssyTpd)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/132/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923420584&usg=AOvVaw2qlGyrl-zJeiyrFTospv2u) [139–140](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/138/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923420917&usg=AOvVaw3qalGlsb8037vI4Sl6IVH_); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923421172&usg=AOvVaw01E_JVdVOnnnZ6ZjXZELXG), p. 268; Clark III 686)

November — Skandinavisk UFO Information in Denmark begins publishing UFO-Nyt. ([UFO-Nyt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Denmark/UFO%2520Nyt%2520(SUFOI)/1958/UFO%2520Nyt%2520-%2520November%25201958.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923421835&usg=AOvVaw0w1_XaZDBTfz5qAlB_sQ_P)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Denmark/UFO%2520Nyt%2520(SUFOI)/1958/UFO%2520Nyt%2520-%2520November%25201958.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923422139&usg=AOvVaw2bOuhtqVQJulMDRSjPPRPJ) November 1958) November 3 — 2:01 p.m. At Minot, North Dakota, M/Sgt. William R. Butler, a medic, sees one bright-green object,

shaped like a 10-cent piece, and one smaller, silver round object. The first object explodes, then the second object moves toward the location of the first at high speed. Sighting lasts 1 minute. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923422608&usg=AOvVaw02qO6PHEVQomeeaJGxmrIs), p. 268)

November 4 — 9:03 p.m. The pilot of a KB-50 USAF tanker is in the downwind leg of the traffic pattern during a ground- controlled approach to Pope AFB \[now Pope Field\] in Fayetteville, North Carolina, when he notices an object on a collision course. He and his flight crew also notice that “strange lights were observed in his cockpit while he was on the final approach...” He executes a go-around maneuver and climbs in altitude to await the disappearance of the object. Air Force tower personnel also see the UFO hovering above the airport, watching it through their binoculars for 20 minutes. They are convinced it is not an atmospheric phenomenon. They say that “the UFO presented a hazard to aircraft operating in the area.” (NICAP, “[Object on Collision Course with KB-50 Tanker,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/581103pope_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923423012&usg=AOvVaw1Go0OQJr6rRaqD8Xv0SA4u) [Circles](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/581103pope_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923423310&usg=AOvVaw1C5FBC2lf-wiOAx8aWctjp)”; Richard F. Haines, “[Aviation Safety in America: A Previously Neglected Factor,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://static1.squarespace.com/static/5cf80ff422b5a90001351e31/t/5d02ea1772637c00014776c5/1560472092579/narcap.TR1.AvSafety.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923423708&usg=AOvVaw0stDApIGZ-2j72vlBdvMZq)” NARCAP, October 15, 2000, pp. 53–54; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923424099&usg=AOvVaw0FIvIMIUF83cDNHHWprgHG)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923424327&usg=AOvVaw2pTthcbSBoNTDViLyQioM9) p. 268)

November 5 — MP [Roy Mason](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roy_Mason&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923424759&usg=AOvVaw2WUxrf7h2U0gTvNQD1gshT) asks the Air Minister in the UK House of Commons to what extent official records are kept of UFO sightings and what departments are involved. Air Minister [George Ward](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Ward%252C_1st_Viscount_Ward_of_Witley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923425223&usg=AOvVaw2jJWU0kyiRnW6kiqkJWoiI) replies in writing that reports involving national security are investigated but “nothing suggests that they are other than mundane.” (“[Come Off It, Mr. Ward! ‘Nothing Suggests That They Are Other Than Mundane,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1959%252CJan-Feb%252CV%25205%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923425681&usg=AOvVaw0v3xIsoYGUb4mmWO4X2cnh)” Flying Saucer Review 5, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1959): 2; Good Above, [p. 52](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/52/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923426183&usg=AOvVaw0xtpfUNwuO1BGpwRsuhvDA))

November 9 — Residents of Trinidad, Rio Dell, and other towns in northern California report showers of cobweblike material, some in strands 5–6 feet long. Two fishermen at sea, [George Korkan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/210091895/george-washington-korkan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923426651&usg=AOvVaw1CJG2YIigPVk4Y46ZbYZXq) and Jack Curry, say the substance settles on their boat in such quantity that it makes the boat appear “a million years old.” A sample obtained at McKinleyville is examined by biologist Erwin Bielfuss at Humboldt State College. He rules out mold or an animal product and suggests it is plant material or plastic. (“[Cobweb Like Substance in Area Mystifies](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94537253/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923427081&usg=AOvVaw0n8f4ZNAgm3eGYue4kYEms) [Zoologist,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94537253/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923427397&usg=AOvVaw0BYAjIwFASfo-q_UdPMyrp)” Eureka (Calif.) Humboldt Standard, November 10, 1958, p. 5; UFOEv, [p. 99](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D111%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923427870&usg=AOvVaw0aMTDqAKCcFuN4leZDeXS6))

November 9 — 10:00 p.m. Two carpenters, Stig Ekberg and Harry Sjöberg, are returning from Stockholm, Sweden, to their cabin on Väddö island, about 20 miles to the northeast. About 6 miles north of Älmstä their car engine begins to sputter and fail, and the headlights go out. They see a huge, shining object descending toward them and making a turn above Väddö Bay to the left of the road. It lands in the middle of the road about 300 feet in front of their car, its neon glow illuminating the landscape. They estimate it is 53 feet long and 20 feet high, with a bright glow underneath the object and a dazzling mist surrounding it. They watch the object for about 10 minutes, then it rises from the road and shoots into the sky to their right. Afterward, the air is stifling and hot, but the engine starts up right away. A few minutes later they return to the landing site and find flattened grass and a still-hot, smooth, triangular piece of metal the size of a matchbox, which they retrieve. They submit the metal to several labs over the next few years, apparently without ambiguous results, but in the process it is split into three pieces. Finally, an

* * *

engineer in Linköping named Schalin finds the metal has the hardness of sapphire and a specific weight of 15.2. It can take several thousand degrees C. heat without getting red hot. One of the pieces is submitted to the US Air Force and not returned. In the early 1970s, another piece is examined by [James Harder](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Harder&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923428944&usg=AOvVaw1Px1ULvcU92JP6zHUX4GfB) at the University of California, Berkeley, who establishes it is composed of tungsten carbide, cobalt, and traces of titanium, and that it has been manufactured. (Christer Nordin, “[The Väddö Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Norway/Nordic%2520UFO%2520Newsletter%2520(English%2520language)/Nordic%2520UFO%2520Newsletter%2520-%25201981%2520No%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923429457&usg=AOvVaw2QiOJIq0MgQEqYzg1VcvHC)” Nordic UFO Newsletter, no. 1 (1981): 2–6)

November 11 — 1:35 a.m. A Mrs. Kinney, who is a Lt. Col. in the Civil Air Patrol in Topeka, Kansas, wakes up when her bedroom floods with an amber-colored light and her three dogs begin barking. The source is a 25-foot diameter sphere that is sitting on the walkway in the yard about 30 feet away. Kinney opens a door to go out on a porch, but the light zooms straight up and out of sight. She goes back to bed and the phone rings; it is a neighbor who has seen the light going toward her house. At 7:30 a.m., the phone rings again; this time it is the controllers at the Philip Billard Municipal Airport, who know her well and tell her about the light they saw. In the evening, she finds there is an electrical failure on the east side of the house. Lights, radios, and refrigerators are not working.

Kinney replaces some fuses, but not everything turns on again. An electrician comes and replaces some wiring on November 12, but Kinney’s eyes develop subconjunctival hemorrhages and sensitivity to bright light. She begins to wear sunglasses regularly. Both of her male dogs develop cataracts. (Swords 287–288)

November 17 —10:03 p.m. Somewhere in Russia a luminous object hovers and lands. It is seen for 2 minutes. (Vallée,

Magonia, [p. 273](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/passporttomagoni0000vall/page/272/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923430630&usg=AOvVaw2k2FU9s2EgrvSV2nc7CvyK))

November 30 — Tom Gerber of the Boston Herald features interviews with unnamed Air Force officers who proclaim an “undeclared war on phony organizations that capitalize on the ‘mystery’ of flying saucers.” Supposedly, the Air Force has evidence that “perhaps as many as 100,000 persons belong to these UFO organizations” and are “making a wad of money.” As many as 16% of the UFO sightings investigated by USAF are “hoaxes originated by members or officials of these organizations”—an obvious swipe at NICAP. (Swords 282–283)

December — The Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, California, is transferred to NASA from the Army, becoming the agency’s primary planetary spacecraft center. (Wikipedia, “[Jet Propulsion Laboratory](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jet_Propulsion_Laboratory&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923431493&usg=AOvVaw1NdY_yFpWYb0Ed6_MJ9ZXr)”)

December — Some 450 airline pilots have signed a petition protesting the official policy of debunking UFO sightings.

One pilot describes the policy as a “lesson in lying, intrigue, and the ‘Big Brother’ attitude carried to the ultimate extreme.” Of the signatories, more than 50 personally have reported UFO sightings but are told by the Air Force that they are mistaken. USAF warns them that they face up to 10 years in prison under JANAP 146 if they reveal details of their sighting to the media. Because of situations like this, Maj. [Friend](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Friend_(pilot)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923432112&usg=AOvVaw1qdo6hSZPaYUOfx5RQvM30) unsuccessfully requests that Blue Book be transferred from ATIC to Air Research and Development Command on the grounds that UFOs are a scientific, not a military problem. His staff complains that the work is time-consuming and unproductive, and ARDC could speak to the public with authority and persuasiveness. ARDC briefly considers, then declines, the offer. (Good Above, [p. 284](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/284/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923432566&usg=AOvVaw0N-CAJ6AnSjb3uAL6rGQcR); Clark III 922)

Early December — Contactee [Lee Childers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1955-04-usa-detroit.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923433042&usg=AOvVaw1sBzAW3LwAA_WAvjw9dWJ4) visits a New York City group called the Bureau of UFO Research and Analysis to present a lecture. By now he is calling himself Prince Neosom of Tythan, which is 8.5 light years from Earth. He also answers to the name Dana. (Clark III 915)

December 6 — Between 6:38 and 6:40 p.m. Along the border of Russia and India, an observer sees a bright UFO cross his field of vision through his telescope from north to south as he is observing Mars. He thinks it might be Sputnik 3, but the location and direction of the object do not bear that out. (ClearIntent, [pp. 137–138](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/136/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923433672&usg=AOvVaw2_p1414ZaYYQSAFOBViQSd))

December 6 — 5:44 a.m. The first launch of a Juno II, carrying Pioneer 3, at LC-5 at Cape Canaveral, Florida, suffers a premature first-stage cutoff, preventing the upper stages from achieving sufficient velocity. Pioneer 3 cannot escape Earth orbit but transmits data for some 40 hours before reentering the atmosphere. A malfunction in a propellant depletion circuit is found to be the cause of the failure, although the exact nature of it cannot be determined. The circuit is redesigned afterwards. (Wikipedia, “[Juno II](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juno_II&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923434196&usg=AOvVaw1M7n2RiQp-3lrNgLQ-iXmA)”)

December 19 —John Lester, a writer for the Newark (N.J.) Star-Ledger, has polled 1,000 US government radar operators over the past month and found that 80% have observed UFOs traveling at fantastic speeds, executing perfect 90° turns, steep vertical climbs, and hovering stops. They fly in formation and manage to stay just ahead of USAF jets scrambled to intercept them. [Tacker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30450384/lawrence-j-tacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923434802&usg=AOvVaw3QtTsnAAXS9a8O-x_2dfFy) responds immediately that the UFOs are natural phenomena (“lightning, meteors, and meteorites”). (Newark (N.J.) Star-Ledger, December 19, 21, 1958)

December 20 — 2:55 a.m. Hans Gustafsson, a 24-year-old truck driver, and Stig Rydberg, a 30-year-old student, claim that while driving home to Helsingborg, Sweden, from a dance they see a strange light in a glade on their right near Domsten. They leave the car and walk up to the object, which turns out to be a disc-shaped vehicle 16 feet in diameter resting on 3 legs. The two are suddenly attacked by four gray creatures about 4 feet tall who try to drag them to the UFO. In January 1959, a medical doctor, Lars-Erik Essén, hypnotizes the men in what is perhaps the first use of hypnosis of a UFO witness, but the two manage to fool Essén. In the late 1980s, Gustafsson’s brother

* * *

Artur reveals to ufologist [Clas Svahn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clas_Svahn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923435732&usg=AOvVaw0YihQ9yotSxF3NyM1W7iGv) that before he died his brother had told him the story was a hoax. (Clark III 413–414; Rob Morphy, “[Terrible Flying Jelly Bags aka Domsten Blobs (Sweden),](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cryptopia.us/site/2018/05/terrible-flying-jelly-bags-sweden/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923436194&usg=AOvVaw15aKmuc_oPKPpB7WomlFEs)” Cryptopia, May 6, 2018; Swords 366–367; Clas Svahn and Anders Liljegren, Domstensfallet: En svensk närkontakt 1958, AFU, 1989)

December 21 — A group of more than 50 commercial airline pilots, all of whom have had at least one UFO sighting, tell reporter John Lester with the Newark (N.J.) Star-Ledger that the Air Force policy of censorship and denial regarding reports is the “Big Brother attitude carried to the ultimate extreme.” Most express disgust with the USAF methods of interrogating civilian pilots and complain about the gag order about publicly talking about their sightings under penalty of 10 years in prison or $10,000 in fines (JANAP 146). “Nuts to that. Who needs it?” (Newark (N.J.) Star-Ledger, December 22, 1958; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Nov-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923437089&usg=AOvVaw16coufUAt6-6hWicYUoKOt) [a History: 1958 November–December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Nov-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923437415&usg=AOvVaw0C2oxg_Z5dsaSJjg2zpJK0)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1958-Nov-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923437658&usg=AOvVaw2kEb5vWcDyGBzq7Lv8tq3v) The Author, 1999, p. 55)

December 22 — 3:00 p.m. Stanislaw Kowalczewski, a physician, takes a photograph of a dark, disc-shaped object over Muszyna, Poland. (Hobana and Weverbergh 67–68; Wiki Meteoritica, “[Muszyna 1958](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://wiki.meteoritica.pl/index.php5/Muszyna_1958&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923438214&usg=AOvVaw1F5-jIHgGI0poSJbXAuaT1)”; Poland 21–23)

December 30 — 3:30 p.m. Joseph Bennett, a farmer in Portglenone, County Antrim, Northern Ireland, is out walking and hears a noise like a rush of wind. A black object 7 feet across comes hurtling through the air about 20 feet above the ground. Moving from south to northwest, it crashes into an oak tree, splitting it in two at a height of 10 feet, then ascends and disappears in seconds. The tree has no burn or scorch marks. (“[UAOs Collide with Tree, Roof,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201959%252003%252000%2520-%2520March.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923438792&usg=AOvVaw0Q11m_HnVfJobrvdILTJsG)” APRO Bulletin, March 1959, p. 2; “[We’re Not Roswell, We’re Portglenone,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://forteanireland.blogspot.com/2019/03/were-not-roswell-were-portglenone.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923439304&usg=AOvVaw3XC4nmT7UJ4AAC4XVlXzHM)” Fortean Ireland, March 17, 2019)

1959

1959? — According to weapons specialist David Middleton, sometime in the late 1950s a few hours prior to a nuclear weapons test at the Nevada Test Site, he and several other technicians watch two silver discs race across then swoop down and maneuver near the detonation tower where the atomic weapon is mounted. The two objects fly a tight circle around the tower before zooming off at high velocity. The test is immediately postponed by senior AEC personnel. Middleton is debriefed and sworn to secrecy. (Nukes 58–59)

1959 — The original US Navy Space Surveillance System goes into operation. From 1960 until the early 1990s the system is used in conjunction with a network of Baker-Nunn cameras that can see an object the size of a basketball at 25,000 miles. The system is operated by the US Navy for NORAD from 1961 to October 2004. Initially independent, it is run by Naval Space Command from 1993 to 2002, and then by Naval Network and Space Operations Command from 2002 to 2004, when it is taken over by the Air Force. (Wikipedia, “[Air Force](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_Force_Space_Surveillance_System&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923440494&usg=AOvVaw0jNIsICDOZeKANYYgw8_wT) [Space Surveillance System](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_Force_Space_Surveillance_System&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923440696&usg=AOvVaw34oSwaeQSZEP6lRh5xyPUB)”)

1959 —The US Army and CIA at Edgewood Arsenal at Aberdeen Proving Ground, Maryland, show significant interest in deploying a new drug, 3-quinuclidinyl benzilate (BZ), as a chemical warfare agent. The drug’s effects last for three days, perhaps as long as six. Between 1959 and 1975, some 2,800 soldiers are given BZ at Edgewood. (Reid Kirby, “[Paradise Lost: The Psycho Agents,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.sussex.ac.uk/Units/spru/hsp/documents/CBWCB71.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923441028&usg=AOvVaw1gRqu6VnwlXIQF2wCWl44p)” The CBW Conventions Bulletin, no. 71 (May 2006): 1–5)

1959 — Psychologist [Carl Jung](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Jung&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923441344&usg=AOvVaw3_cWkYpFYoZx-MwKFKoPY-) publishes Flying Saucers: A Modern Myth of Things Seen in the Skies in the UK, a translation of Ein moderner Mythus von Dingen, die am Himmel gesehen werden, published in Zürich, Switzerland, in 1958, in which he compares the discs to archetypes, dreams, visions, paintings, and the metaphysical symbol of a mandala: “the rounded wholeness of the mandala becomes a space ship controlled by an intelligent being.” However, he remains puzzled by the physical evidence. (Carl Jung, [Flying Saucers: A Modern](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersmod0000cgju&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923441736&usg=AOvVaw2gu0E73fZMHMRxAmq1jmD5) [Myth of Things Seen in the Skies](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersmod0000cgju&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923441929&usg=AOvVaw1gMlvusU4TtpsDJgN-5cv5)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersmod0000cgju&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923442074&usg=AOvVaw3pbNZqlTe9E2Pn_ZA-TQo0) Routledge & Kegan Paul, 1959; Clark III 637–638)

1959 — Author [Hugo Correa](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Chile/UFO%2520Chile/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923442363&usg=AOvVaw0Bu_RuisBX2OBi8EOb49zX) founds UFO Chile in Santiago, Chile. Its newsletter appears from August 1967 to May 1969. (Hugo Correa, “[¿Que es ‘UFO Chile’?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Chile/UFO%2520Chile/UFO%2520Chile%2520-%2520Issue%252001.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923442606&usg=AOvVaw0mvnwC6Y8Jb83Z8Et0gdOz)” UFO Chile, no. 1 (August 1967): 1)

1959 — The Soviet KGB has created its own disinformation Department D (Dezinformatsiya) in the First Chief Directorate, which under [Yuri Andropov](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuri_Andropov&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923443007&usg=AOvVaw2JxGmJu-sDBcICrLWq-85P) is later renamed Department A (for “active measures”). It specializes in the fabrication and dissemination of forged documents, tapes, letters, manuscripts, photos, rumors, and false intelligence. (Wikipedia, “[Active measures](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Active_measures&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923443238&usg=AOvVaw3-pFgGHeyJcqQ0Dspn7kpx)”; John Barron, [KGB: The Secret Work of Soviet Secret Agents](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/kgbsecretworkofs00barr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923443426&usg=AOvVaw3cIFTGKKfH879W6MDphglQ), Bantam, 1974; Richard H. Shultz and Roy Godson, [Dezinformatsia: Active Measures in Soviet Strategy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/dezinformatsiaac0000shul/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923443642&usg=AOvVaw3OOL5Lj40ZjNFATb6nNbmd)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/dezinformatsiaac0000shul/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923443806&usg=AOvVaw1ggS98H9LH2_juj_fUAg8n) Pergamon-Brassey’s, 1984)

1959 — Contactee [Howard Menger](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_Menger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923444104&usg=AOvVaw3kS0iTkezGtMFk_R9UIL7j) publishes From Outer Space to You, an account of his meetings with space people. (Howard Menger, [From Outer Space to You](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/fromouterspaceto00meng/page/n3/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923444403&usg=AOvVaw0Wpqy38cpnP8iwVsi-P0MM)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/fromouterspaceto00meng/page/n3/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923444562&usg=AOvVaw1BuJ3D0l_Bcwf_b6zdkLnb) Saucerian, 1959; Clark III 739)

1959 — [George Van Tassel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Van_Tassel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923444857&usg=AOvVaw1EYlEhGt6pasmFkBF3jno1) claims the space people have taught him a method of rejuvenating the human body. Using his new-found knowledge and funds provided by [Howard Hughes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_Hughes&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923445071&usg=AOvVaw1zrSHcwdybgWPzQwaaypX6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_Hughes&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923445202&usg=AOvVaw0stk_L-1ex1meUhzOljY_u) he completes the outer structure of the Integraton at Giant Rock, California, a four-story domed structure, 55 feet in diameter, built mostly of wood without nails, screws, iron, or steel. Van Tassel claims it will harness the EMF energy required for recharging the cells in our

* * *

bodies. In the course of its construction, Van Tassel discovers that the Integraton functions as a time machine. (Wikipedia, “[Integraton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integratron&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923445541&usg=AOvVaw37iqarnOixoLWuPd2fib7n)”; Clark III 1219; Douglas Curran, In Advance of the Landing: Folk Concepts of Outer Space, Abbeville, 1985, [pp. 79–81](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/inadvanceoflandi00doug/page/78/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923445806&usg=AOvVaw1mGYofhMZcRl4-R3dpdqSC); David Clarke and Tom Clark, “Going ‘Out There’ in SoCal,” Fortean Times 388 (January 2020): 75–76)

January — Leonard Hewins sees a fiery, round object come down near Stratford-on-Avon, England, from the east and land 300 feet away. A blue haze forms and three figures emerge and sit down with clumsy movements. Hewins is unable to move until the UFO takes off. (John D. Llewellyn, “[Stratford-on-Avon Landing with Occupants:](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201967%2520V%252013%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923446277&usg=AOvVaw07VIsILU0oaC8jF_6e47_K) [January 1959,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201967%2520V%252013%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923446505&usg=AOvVaw3iBwUVIVboXPzJrPZIQ99e)” Flying Saucer Review 13, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1967): 15; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1959-01-uk-stratfordonavon.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923446914&usg=AOvVaw0K4GC-NWNhGxPk6pQaguHX), March 9, 2008)

January 1 — Rocket scientist [Wernher von Braun](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wernher_von_Braun&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923447188&usg=AOvVaw3VkU-jSCD49sXuRzz5PcHY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wernher_von_Braun&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923447326&usg=AOvVaw2xRCOiSVvXOzPBJuKn24i1) on holiday in Germany, makes a cryptic statement about the failed launch of [Pioneer 3](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pioneer_3&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923447502&usg=AOvVaw1z2gKi0p2vI-JstFQjWMIk) by a Juno II rocket on December 6, 1958: “We find ourselves faced by powers which are far stronger than we had hitherto assumed, and whose base is at present unknown to us. More I cannot say at present. We are now engaged in entering into closer contact with those powers, and in six or nine months’ time it may be possible to speak with more precision on the matter.” (Good Above, [p. 370](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/370/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923447755&usg=AOvVaw1999ka9rCTdvKBpYMCSWI4))

January 1 — 4:55 p.m. Deputy Fred Gunzelman of the Harbor Department in Corona del Mar, California, spots a bright object outside department headquarters. He summons Deputy Elmer Sandling and Sgt. Bruce Young and the three watch the object through binoculars, where it appears to be a disc-shaped object with a rotating tail. They notify the lifeguard headquarters at Newport Beach, where Lt. Mike Henry, Guard Jack Bell, and Lt. Jim Richards also see the UFO. The planet Venus is clearly visible in the same section of sky. During the 15 minutes it is visible, it starts moving to the southeast and then splits into four parts. Two rise vertically at high speed, another heads southeast, and the last remains stationary. (UFOEv, [p. 137](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D149%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923448142&usg=AOvVaw2UhQmEPpAQNWl59uu4TlY8); Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p.

95)

January 11 — [Wilbert Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923448627&usg=AOvVaw1EQryWuerxUuamu7tplakO) speaks on UFOs at the Illuminating Engineering Society’s Canadian Regional Conference in Ottawa, Ontario. He claims that “Various items of ‘hardware’ are known to exist, but are usually clapped into security and are not available to the general public.” (Frank Edwards, FS Serious Business, Bantam ed., 1966, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersser00edwa/page/48/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923448985&usg=AOvVaw35-0mUFWSDmdTpl_m8qNev) [48](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersser00edwa/page/48/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923449211&usg=AOvVaw3XGySQgCwHoXh_H6vYygzX))

January 13 — 7:00 a.m. Robert Collins is driving a pickup truck south on Hartstown Road across Pymatuning Lake, Pennsylvania, when he sees a bright light approaching from the east and illuminating the ground. It stops above his truck, hovering 200 feet above it for several minutes. The truck’s electrical system fails, the engine dies, and the headlights and radio go out. The object’s light illuminates an area about 300 feet in front of him. It takes off and disappears in seconds, and the truck begins working again. (“[Area Man’s Encounter with Unidentified Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99784357/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923449514&usg=AOvVaw2VPjx4i1fbaQJfe6Oiw4b5) [Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99784357/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923449702&usg=AOvVaw3GXW0lK9az5E5xz_PTv9GU) [Called Weirdest Experience,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99784380/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923449897&usg=AOvVaw1xK6DV5OdtxxJBhh6-3x9_)” Greenville (Pa.) Record-Argus, January 31, 1959, pp. 1–2)

January 17 — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923450235&usg=AOvVaw2TQ_0C7BzqmX5GPR9_TOXE) arrives in Auckland, New Zealand, on the first stop on his world lecture tour where he is received by North Island Adamski Correspondence Group leaders [Henk](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ufoupdateslist.com/1998/may/m27-004.shtml&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923450453&usg=AOvVaw0zZjhouzWRQdHm8Hbt4Nbf) and Brenda Hinfelaar for a 6-week engagement starting with a talk in Kaikohe on January 20. (“[World Lecture Tour,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-mission/global-reach/world-tour/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923450673&usg=AOvVaw3FUfRnxaqT1GlW8VPvwg1V)” The Adamski Case, October 5, 2019; Marc Hallet, [A Critical Appraisal of George Adamski: The Man Who Spoke to the Space Brothers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ACriticalAppraisalOfGeorgeAdamskiTheManWhoSpokeToTheSpaceBrothersREVISEDANDENLARGEDEDITION2016/page/n1/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923450953&usg=AOvVaw2FmrS141fwcsgI04iUdGf1), The Author, 2016)

January 18? — Eight people see a UFO over Stigsjö, Sweden. The round object, 18–24 feet in diameter, approaches slowly from the south over Lake Länsjön at a height of 900 feet. It is surrounded by a luminous ring 6 feet wide. It is visible for 3 minutes. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1959](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923451292&usg=AOvVaw3pdar5OJ11j3GfHtiJXKIZ) [January–March](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923451551&usg=AOvVaw1WBwnZanhX7XRPZMMAbzNF), The Author, 1999, p. 25)

January 21 — 6:00 a.m. A flying object is seen crashing into the waters of the harbor at Gdynia, Poland. Rumors later claim that a rust-free fragment is retrieved by divers and, after being examined by the Polish navy, sent to Gdynia Polytechnic University \[possibly the Polish Naval Academy\]. A few days later, an injured occupant of the craft is allegedly found wandering in the area. He speaks no known language, wears an odd uniform, and apparently has burns on the face. He is taken to a hospital, but he dies when doctors attempt to remove an armband. His remains are said to have been shipped to the Soviet Union. (Hobana and Weverbergh 1–2; Poland 25–28, 115)

January 21 — MP [Roy Mason](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roy_Mason&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923452000&usg=AOvVaw0pBwr8sOxen2r53ozQ5ufK) asks the Air Minister another question in the UK House of Commons: What instructions have been sent to RAF stations about collecting military UFO reports, and what collaboration is there with Canada and the US? Air Minister [George Ward](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Ward%252C_1st_Viscount_Ward_of_Witley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923452275&usg=AOvVaw3qlAZFxA9_XRyDXOqr0OOR) replies that RAF units have standing instructions for handling reports, and there is no special collaboration with those countries. (“[Roy Mason Asks Another,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1959%252CMar-Apr%252CV%25205%252CN%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923452525&usg=AOvVaw3reP6_BB2y6Bq4wIr2tlhy)” Flying Saucer Review 5, no. 2 (March/April 1959): 2; Good Above, [p. 52](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/52/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923452791&usg=AOvVaw1UFQSBcyW2HiDiry7IXT8s))

January 28 — At a Symposium on Aerospace Technology by the Institute of the Aeronautical Sciences at the Astor Hotel in New York City, USAF Maj. Gen. [Donald J. Keirn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106554/major-general-donald-j-keirn/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923453090&usg=AOvVaw2N4WoXtfsz5JcmvymWOozn), assistant deputy chief of staff on development for nuclear systems, talks about nuclear aircraft propulsion. He mentions that if intelligent extraterrestrials do exist, “it is entirely possible that some of them may have passed through our stage of evolution, and may have already

* * *

achieved a higher level of social and technological culture than our own.” He suggests using electromagnetic emissions to detect them, as they may be doing with us. (US Congress, Joint Committee on Atomic Energy, Hearings, Aircraft Nuclear Propulsion Program, July 23, 1959, [p. 153](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aircraftnuclearp00unit/page/152/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923453554&usg=AOvVaw1hA-T6mPN1ccygsvU_e4oR))

January 31 — The US Ground Observer Corps is deactivated with the advent of automated Army (Missile Master) and Air Force (SAGE) radar systems. (Wikipedia, “[Ground Observer Corps](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ground_Observer_Corps&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923453989&usg=AOvVaw0aoFN7dJmjRidw3F4NFpsO)”)

February — 9:30 p.m. The people of Digeliotika, Greece, hear a humming noise coming from the direction of the sea. Running out of their homes, many people see a luminous disc circling the village for about 10 minutes. Radios fail to operate and the electrical current in one house fails completely.
