When the disc flies low over the house of the priest, Papa Costas, there is a loud noise and the whole house shakes. The object moves off to the west.

Inspection of the house the next day reveals that many of the roof tiles have been displaced, and others are on the ground. (“[UAOs Collide with Tree, Roof,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201959%252003%252000%2520-%2520March.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923454514&usg=AOvVaw19DUhKK4b9I1948R8GukYd)” APRO Bulletin, March 1959, p. 2)

February 1 — JANAP 146(D) integrates Canada into the CIRVIS reporting instructions. The Canadian Department of National Defence launches a series of Communications Instructions for Reporting Vital Intelligence Sightings in line with the JANAP procedures. (Gregory M. Kanon, “[UFOs and the Canadian Government,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Canada/Canadian%2520UFO%2520Report%2520(Magor)/Canadian%2520UFO%2520Report%2520-%2520vol%25203%2520no%25207%2520-%25201976.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923454962&usg=AOvVaw1rKo1TDlAO7m9FggJVmrvR)” Canadian UFO Report 3, no. 7 (Spring 1976): 17–18; Antonio F. Rullán, “[Blue Book UFO Reports at Sea by Ships,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.waterufo.net/bluebook/bbpdf.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923455229&usg=AOvVaw1Nd7iY9VJDAbQqZEDsJ8Gd)” December 10, 2002)

February 17 — [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923455462&usg=AOvVaw0VMkIFeCCMf3-GxhgMkakT) wants to start bringing together ATIC and Blue Book personnel for monthly meetings where scientific and PR problems are reviewed. To get it going, he meets with Air Force Intelligence, Secretary of the Air Force officials, and Blue Book staffers in the Pentagon. This meeting includes, besides Hynek, Maj. [Robert J.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Friend_(pilot)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923455717&usg=AOvVaw2hLPANAsnv8pwsTSYhAEVm) [Friend](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Friend_(pilot)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923455909&usg=AOvVaw1jIg3n-o7YG6g493G_teIa)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Friend_(pilot)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923456074&usg=AOvVaw1zgMz-6oFfPKR1p86SzDls) Col. [Lawrence](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30450384/lawrence-j-tacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923456876&usg=AOvVaw3JrkFLNJK4gH88Tpkx7MXt)

[J. Tacker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30450384/lawrence-j-tacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923457109&usg=AOvVaw1T1NAW-RPdBcYcywcogY_D)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30450384/lawrence-j-tacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923457271&usg=AOvVaw30rdSajCSm3JVm6qZKo6Pt) and [Burgoyne Lee Griffing](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/107124036/burgoyne-lee-griffing&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923457453&usg=AOvVaw0IHQHHHor_f02DuXPiXyDj)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/107124036/burgoyne-lee-griffing&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923457607&usg=AOvVaw2XSKKQF7jybT2adgWhSjyu) The group agrees that eventually the term “UFOs” should be jettisoned and older unsolved cases reexamined in the light of “greater scientific knowledge” that will move them from unknowns to knowns. February 20 — Pfc. Bernard G. “Gerry” Irwin, on leave from Fort Bliss in El Paso, Texas, is driving near Cedar City, Utah, when he stops to investigate what seems to be a crashing plane. He is later found unconscious in the snow and treated at the Cedar City hospital. He suffers from amnesia, continues to have fainting spells, and returns more than once to the site in some kind of fugue. He soon deserts and perhaps disappears, but not forever, as he is living in Idaho in 2013, where [David Booher](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.coasttocoastam.com/guest/booher-david/88852&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923458429&usg=AOvVaw3pq6iK1QqUpIJ4Rnis7eWy) interviews him about his PTSD-like symptoms. (Coral Lorenzen, “[Soldier Sees Flash; Unconscious 24 Hours,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201959%252003%252000%2520-%2520March.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923458709&usg=AOvVaw2ApO9_EMgjop5nwwfCA9Um)” APRO Bulletin, March 1959, pp. 1, 10; Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 97–99; Lorenzen, Encounters with UFO Occupants, Berkley Medallion, 1976, pp. 347+; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1961 July–December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923459170&usg=AOvVaw0DaWFTq5qYNRiK-BuE2TCp)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923459323&usg=AOvVaw3VpRLqMO3RcysIRPlH3sEC) The Author, 2003, pp. 56–60; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1962 July–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1962-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923459597&usg=AOvVaw3fA4bIH5TJXolYehR1J-8r) [December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1962-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923459793&usg=AOvVaw39BEBUT8AMGCXXCGx53HJd), The Author, 2005, pp. 68–70; Kevin D. Randle, The UFO Dossier, Visible Ink, 2015, [pp. 134–141](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufodossier100yea0000rand/page/134/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923460145&usg=AOvVaw1Ke9ZrQyDdi8V0btYSdpyY); David Booher, No Return: The Gerry Irwin Story, UFO Abduction or Covert Operation?, Anomalist, 2017; Clark III 2)

February 20 — Just as the first working models of the Army’s VZ-9 Avrocar are being manufactured, the Canadian government cancels the Avro CF-105 Arrow program. Almost all Avro Canada employees are laid off, including those with the Special Projects Group. However, three days later, many of the Special Projects employees are rehired, but it isn’t quite business as usual. The USAF Project Office devoted to the Avro projects recommends that the WS-606A and all related work (including the Avrocar) be cancelled. However, in May the USAF authorizes Avro to continue its “flying saucer” programs. (Wikipedia, “[Avro Canada VZ-9 Avrocar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avro_Canada_VZ-9_Avrocar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923460853&usg=AOvVaw3nAxmlXa1yrCmILahOZRmw)”)

February 24 — 8:20 p.m. Capt. [Peter W. Killian](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48370897/peter-w_-killian&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923461182&usg=AOvVaw1wHpTRR73MP5HnFsqYN9bR) is flying an American Airlines flight from Newark to Detroit when he encounters three bright lights flying in a precise line. The initial detection takes place when the aircraft is flying at 8,500 feet and 50 mph about 13 miles west of Williamsport, Pennsylvania. At first Killian thinks he is seeing Orion’s sword, but he can see those stars elsewhere. One of the objects abruptly leaves formation and approaches the plane, slows down before Killian takes evasive action, then rejoins the other two. Killian alerts copilot James John Dee and then announces on the intercom for the passengers to take a look. He also puts out a call to nearby aircraft, and five other commercial airline pilots indicate that they can see the objects. The lights remain at about the 9 o’clock position for 40 minutes, providing an opportunity for many of the 35 passengers to observe them.

They are also seen by the crews of two other planes flying much farther to the south, as well as by the tower operators in Pittsburgh. The Air Force quickly identifies the objects as the three Orion stars, changes that to an aerial refueling operation, then accuses Killian of being drunk. But an independent sighting of the UFOs by an Air Force transport plane 150 miles further south confirms Killian’s observation, and no refueling routes exist in central Pennsylvania. [Brad Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Brad_Sparks.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923461746&usg=AOvVaw0RKcfTRpuIiUL3EfSjThTK) uncovers new evidence in 2016 that supports the witnesses’ story. (NICAP,

Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923462649&usg=AOvVaw1Cjj3zy4eqOxz4wOiaEdGi) [History: 1959 January–March](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923462873&usg=AOvVaw2CLLs1YwNwB0MZi1eZOVgK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923463185&usg=AOvVaw3qxCnkDl3sNBKXDsMCA3wt) The Author, 1999, pp. 58–60; Clark III 385–387; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923463617&usg=AOvVaw1tdvy5EjcSIzfDrBjhXkRB), p. 270; Willy Smith,

“Over Pennsylvania,” IUR 23, no. 1 (Spring 1998): 13–14, 29–30; Swords 285; Patrick Gross, “[The Killian–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/killian59.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923464157&usg=AOvVaw18Kz1EB_Uqw3Df7ctODhBR) [Orion Belt Sightings, 1958](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/killian59.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923464360&usg=AOvVaw24-QSHW4DZgLkXY7DyqBYi)”)

February 24 — 10:00 p.m. A 17-year-old male is home babysitting the family pets and his younger brother in Victorville, California, when he sees a bright light shining in his bedroom window. The dogs begin to howl and run around. He goes outside and sees a luminous object like an “elongated egg,” dull red with purple waves inside it, flying in a descending path toward his house. It passes over the front yard at a height of only 8–10 feet. As the object returns, he goes inside to get a gun, but as he goes outside the object is making a third pass and he goes back inside. When the parents return home, they find the dogs in a terrified state. (Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 167–170](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/166/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923464727&usg=AOvVaw27TPv2a4xXDzv6ZMz9qSTP); Swords 286–287)

Late February–April 15 — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923464999&usg=AOvVaw1KyfcngQemlEaaWd8caczM) continues his world lecture tour in Sydney, Perth, Adelaide, Melbourne, and Brisbane, Australia. (“[World Lecture Tour,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-mission/global-reach/world-tour/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923465252&usg=AOvVaw32Im437zcCsNhemDVzkUxO)” The Adamski Case, October 5, 2019)

February 25 — 8:30 a.m. Jim Dobbs Jr. is driving south on State Highway 18 south of Hobbs, New Mexico, when he sees an egg-shaped object glowing like radium on a watch dial. He estimates it is 10° above the southern horizon and traveling fast. His radio fades out and produces only a steady succession of two dots and a dash. The object disappears in the east after 30 seconds. (“[Hobbs Man Sees Glowing UFO, Hears Signals,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201959%252003%252000%2520-%2520March.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923465600&usg=AOvVaw29wPK72u4qPXewm_Yg0xgf)” APRO Bulletin, March 1959, p. 1)

February 25 — Lt. Col. [Lee B. James](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.astronautix.com/j/jameslee.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923465950&usg=AOvVaw0AVfIzHu3jlrqC_qnN7D8V), chief of the Liaison Branch of the Army Ballistic Agency in Huntsville, Alabama, gives a talk at the Detroit Chapter of the Michigan Society of Professional Engineers on space flight. Because of the recent Killian incident, he is asked about UFOs. Referring to the witness on that aircraft, he says: “If they (35 passengers and several crew members) saw what they really saw, it would have to come from outer space—a civilization decades before ours.” (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923466208&usg=AOvVaw1kA3kfmpNsPWDUIit2vTV6) [1959 January–March](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923466413&usg=AOvVaw0DDDABxuasMMtCrfLdzqGD)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923466569&usg=AOvVaw3X6DNUteXBEvNQp3mJLakT) The Author, 1999, p. 68)

February 25 — 7:25 p.m. A pale-yellow light is seen by officials above one of the runways at London Airport \[now Heathrow\], England. Airport and air defense radars do not pick up any target. RAF Fighter Command Headquarters says the light fluctuates in intensity and is about 200 feet from the ground. It stays in one position for 20 minutes then climbs away at high speed. (Charles H. Gibbs-Smith, “[Venus and the Nose-Cone Light: A](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1959%252CMay-Jun%252CV%25205%252CN%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923466950&usg=AOvVaw16sr_W47FXkpr6rOWuQNjE) [Study in the Lunacy of Explainistics,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1959%252CMay-Jun%252CV%25205%252CN%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923467234&usg=AOvVaw2x41sy4bG-DR_ofrDvlkRv)” Flying Saucer Review 5, no. 3 (May/June 1959): 10–11, 31; Good Above,

[p. 52](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/52/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923467651&usg=AOvVaw0OM1kK_gEpZ-2TjQjhTck5); UFOEv, [p. 122](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D134%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923467991&usg=AOvVaw2cW3dfRAjexLsUdHSxI7Bh))

February 28 — The US Air Force launches Discoverer 1, the first of a series of satellites that are part of the Corona spy program. The mission is a failure due to problems with the Agena upper stage. (Wikipedia, “[Discoverer 1](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discoverer_1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923468334&usg=AOvVaw2JkiyiBJNOZ0dnd9ur5GKx)”)

March — On the Baltic Sea coast near Kołobrzeg, Poland, soldiers watch the sea become turbulent as a triangular object, 12 feet in diameter, emerges, circles the barracks, and flies away at high speed. (Vallée, Magonia, [p. 275](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/passporttomagoni0000vall/page/274/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923468958&usg=AOvVaw0CvAg3HEzimloAn6GuYFvg))

March 11 — Rear Admiral [George J. Dufek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_J._Dufek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923469319&usg=AOvVaw1Rg74Z9OSAhUYVeGPuMR_K)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_J._Dufek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923469546&usg=AOvVaw2m6YLQ4L7Gl28O9hTXwGWi) on his way back from commanding Operation Deepfreeze in Antarctica, tells reporters in Wellington, New Zealand, that he does not think the existence of UFOs can be discounted: “I think it is very stupid for human beings to think no one else in the universe is as intelligent as we are.” Asked years later why he said this, he explains that it was because of sightings related to him by people who worked with him at the South Pole. (Swords 290)

March 12 —Several witnesses at Bergen, Norway, see a bright object passing north to south, taking two minutes to move from horizon to horizon. Several minutes later another appears, following the same course. This is soon followed by three more in succession. (ClearIntent, [p. 138](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/138/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923470009&usg=AOvVaw1IUJGlZeSwg2jbVIA7CiQ_))

March 13 — 2:00 a.m. Percy Briggs is driving from Purnong to Mannum, South Australia, with a load of vegetables and Claypans Postmaster C. Towill as passenger. They have just climbed Cournamont Hill near the Purnong Ferry over the Murray River. They see to the left of the road a huge dome-shaped object with 8–9 red and blue lights about 20 feet apart. The UFO soon rises from the ground at a 15° angle and moves away to the southwest. The separate lights merge into one big light. They watch it recede for about 10 minutes. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923470409&usg=AOvVaw3IIKG5U6Sm__HtpvHtURHt) [Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1959 January–March](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923470612&usg=AOvVaw0MZufx4CzKzZSYksN-QCKa), The Author, 1999, pp. 79–80)

March 18 — 8:50 p.m. Jesse Wilson of Denville, New Jersey, is taking photos of the Moon through a telescope and captures an image of two groups of multiple objects. (Center for UFO Studies, \[[case documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1959_03_18_US_NJ_Denville_NICAP_Wilson-Moon-Photo.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923470970&usg=AOvVaw20v9EFMzwl7-YcBqluBkYs)\])

March 19 — USAF spokesman Maj. [Lawrence J. Tacker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30450384/lawrence-j-tacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923471236&usg=AOvVaw2G4byIiSOawUFI1MTb5KcY) retracts the dubious Orion explanation for the [Killian](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48370897/peter-w_-killian&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923471455&usg=AOvVaw2sCDMrPUHKndE3zdvSkXjS) case and says instead that the pilots saw B-47 bombers refueling in flight from a KC-97 tanker. Killian tells the papers, “I don’t care what the air force says,” he knows what refueling looks like and the UFOs were “at least three times the size of any tanker or bomber we have. They could travel at 2,000 mph. And they were not conventional

* * *

aircraft.” (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1959 January–March](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923471936&usg=AOvVaw1uVCitjRCD-jovF0M5crtb), The Author, 1999, pp. 82–84)

March 20 — 5:30 p.m. Witold Sambrowski, an electronics engineer, sees two noiseless cigar-shaped, reddish-pink objects flying over Ostroleka, Poland. They are traveling horizontally at a speed greater than a jet. When the two vanish, a third appears and follows the path the others have taken. (Hobana and Weverbergh 211–212)

March 22 — 1:30 a.m. Mr. and Mrs. Gary Bond are driving near Ann Arbor, Michigan, when they see an intensely lighted object hovering about 2 miles to the southeast. It is about 200 feet in the air and just south of a main road. Intense shafts of light are shining from two oval ports at the bottom. As they drive closer, they can hear no sound and find it is about 50–75 feet from the road. The UFO parallels their car at first, then the light shafts go out, and a circle of 8–10 red lights appear on the bottom. Then it rises rapidly and disappears in seconds. A local radio astronomer, Allen Barrot, claims the couple saw the lights of his telescope. But the Air Force finds that the couple were never looking in the direction of Barrot’s observatory. (Swords 288–289; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923472429&usg=AOvVaw3KlUPecAysDmaQNwi7M_2C) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1959 January–March](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923472629&usg=AOvVaw2Mw3uIMBtaodx8-0qS1kI7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923472784&usg=AOvVaw1PmyLPDVhJQNchPEDntxd0) The Author, 1999, pp. 87–90)

March 27 — [Lou Corbin](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/corbin/index.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923473084&usg=AOvVaw1s4sfrlSKpnqclZNe5QtXd) has told [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923473299&usg=AOvVaw1zLgeoCG5Iw_fMs9hcnVpH) that Rep. [Samuel Friedel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_Friedel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923473498&usg=AOvVaw0BeTJ_9qKIPjMnwj1Jk0UH) (D-Md.) is “all set to hop on this [Killian](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48370897/peter-w_-killian&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923473704&usg=AOvVaw1Orhd9uNW6H778zuzeRgGW) business” and begins to plan for Killian to meet with him. But Killian’s [wife](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48370921/catharine-m_-killian&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923473951&usg=AOvVaw0BIrp7DaYssfzgEoWbQA-v) now tells Keyhoe that he is under strict orders from the Air Force not to talk to anyone about the sighting or risk losing his job. Soon afterwards, the Air Force releases a statement from Killian that says, “Having never seen night refueling of jets by a tanker, I suppose that could be what we saw.” (Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 27–36; UFOEv, [pp. 116–117](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D128%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923474218&usg=AOvVaw2837wTVHlyLjUZ9KTbsdNH))

March 31 — 11:30 p.m. Barry Neale, operator of the Port Elliot movie theater, is driving home to Goolwa, South Australia, and sees a dome-shaped, reddish-orange object with a row of evenly spaced portholes around it. He estimates it to be about 15 feet wide, and it is on the ground about 900 feet from the road. He sees it disappear to the east. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1959 January–March](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923474579&usg=AOvVaw1aBge3dOqGmKdrMdEI_wck), The Author, 1999, pp. 99–100)

Spring — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923474929&usg=AOvVaw1epAvGK7YuG2xKE7VhjZ0l) meets with [Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923475137&usg=AOvVaw3qBY6n5xmVIUb0okDchwWF) at the New York Yacht Club to discuss NICAP strategy. USAF Public Information Officer [Lawrence J. Tacker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30450384/lawrence-j-tacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923475358&usg=AOvVaw2tEgQWrvK2MLkEegAcjskZ) has sent the organization a letter asking it to stop writing to Air Force personnel about UFOs. Keyhoe tells Hillenkoetter that three scientists have contacted a certain congressman to report UFO sightings. Hillenkoetter advises, “we’ll have to do something to speed things up.” (Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 15, 247–248)

Spring — Soviet radar and Air Defense personnel observe UFOs circling and hovering for more than 24 hours above the headquarters of the Tactical Missile Command at Sverdlovsk, Russia. Fighter aircraft sent to intercept them report that the UFOs easily outmaneuver them and zigzag to avoid machine gun fire. (Flying Saucers, no. 47, May 1966, pp. 6–10; Good Above, [p. 227](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/226/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923475762&usg=AOvVaw0VQF03k0CKDT2y_TaAg6jU))

Spring — Early evening. A weather officer with the US Fifth Air Force in Tokyo, Japan, is in the operations center when the staff tracks a UFO near Misawa Air Base on the north end of Honshu. One of the officers says this happens frequently, that the objects travel at 2,000 mph, and they often stop in one position and hover for 30 minutes to several hours before taking off westward along the Tsugaru Strait and disappearing in a burst of speed. The center commander orders the pilots of two specially equipped F-106s based at Misawa to intercept the target. One of the planes is having instrumentation problems, but the other goes up. After 10 minutes he is being guided toward the target through Misawa. The pilot says the object is circular and metallic with a cockpit on top. The commander calls the Pentagon for authorization for the pilot to fire on the UFO, and he gets permission for the pilot to make a firing pass. The pilot fires two missiles, but they detonate just at the edge of the object, as if it is protected. The UFO then turns toward the terrified pilot, and the command center watches as the two blips merge into one. The blip disappears. Crews search for wreckage for 4 days but find none. (Bruce Maccabee, “Hiding the Hardware,” IUR 16, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1991): 8–9)

April 1 — An Air Force C-118 plane with four on board crashes between Sumner and Orting, Washington, about an hour after taking off from McChord AFB \[now Joint Base Lewis-McChord\] in Tacoma. Their last radio message indicates that they hit something or that something hit them. [Bob Gribble](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://avalonlibrary.net/Wendy_Connors_Faded_Disc_archive/NuforcDirectory.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923476283&usg=AOvVaw1wYUe7oARavwrPHx4qhdhV) and other UFO investigators find witnesses who claim to have seen two orange or yellow objects closing in on the plane. Best guess is that the plane hit a tree and the UFO observations are unrelated. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Apr-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923476527&usg=AOvVaw1wmALG4AKv15qzZXHBGjbJ) [UFOs, a History: 1959 April–June](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Apr-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923476705&usg=AOvVaw36UHzyBeLMC1wDkTKKLMEl), The Author, 1999, pp. 2–4)

April 7 — 8:00 p.m. Control tower operators at CFB St. Hubert \[now Montreal/Saint-Hubert Airport\], Quebec, spot a red, glowing light hanging in the sky for a few minutes at 3,000–7,000 feet altitude. It suddenly darts to the north at supersonic speed. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 100)

* * *

April 11 — Two businessmen at Woodlands, New Zealand, watch a glowing 40-foot-long object with a balloon-like attachment on the underside hovering just above the trees. As they approach it in their car, it speeds off to the north. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 100)

April 12 — 8:00 p.m. Control tower personnel and airport officials at St. Hubert Air Defence Command Base \[now CFB St. Hubert\], Quebec, as well as local residents watch a red ball of light hovering above the airfield at 3,000–7,000 feet. Descriptions vary from a black ball with a red light to a long red cigar. Radar does not pick it up. Suddenly it takes off toward Montreal to the north. (Yurko Bondarchuk, UFO Sightings, Landings, and Abductions, Methuen, 1979, pp. 94–96)

April 17 — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923477488&usg=AOvVaw3Vo1l7B5wco68Lcbr3T2Sf) meets with [Sisir Kumar Maitra](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sisir_Kumar_Maitra&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923477683&usg=AOvVaw3pbG7G8irqKv5D2jkM2g3R)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sisir_Kumar_Maitra&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923477862&usg=AOvVaw1yRprNBhgvcnSdM_ug06Jp) head of the Department of Philosophy and dean of the Faculty of Arts of Banaras Hindu University in Varanasi during a stopover in Kolkata, India. (“[World Lecture](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-mission/global-reach/world-tour/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923478094&usg=AOvVaw286y7jWe0HAdBMyOVPGmFd) [Tour,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-mission/global-reach/world-tour/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923478284&usg=AOvVaw1grOoxEyx5zlx9KXd11vIX)” The Adamski Case, October 5, 2019)

April 18–May 14 — [Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923478518&usg=AOvVaw0RNK3vqYB7Kmt39_pbT0TB) arrives in London, England, and appears on the TV show In Town Tonight on April 18 and on the BBC program Panorama on April 20 where he debates with astronomer [Patrick Moore](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_Moore&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923478868&usg=AOvVaw1oJp2Td6aMIPL-EInclIx3), a show that is seen by 9 million viewers. Both Gen. [Frederick Browning](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_Browning&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923479040&usg=AOvVaw1xB3QCbxsOpJXsmB6qL_wB) and RAF Commander [Peter Horsley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Horsley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923479251&usg=AOvVaw0VCM-gO6bbQv5f2ftrlOes) meet with Adamski and [Desmond Leslie](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desmond_Leslie&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923479454&usg=AOvVaw1-0c7fF0NnqWpmTQIqIqAK) during their visit to a private address in London. Adamski gives further lectures in Tunbridge Wells, Weston-super-Mare, Bournemouth, at Caxton Hall in London (on April 28), Birmingham University (April 29), Manchester (May 1), and several more around the British Isles. (“[World Lecture Tour,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-mission/global-reach/world-tour/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923479710&usg=AOvVaw380nZ_0nvPT5vVya5aJ08C)” The Adamski Case, October 5, 2019; David Clarke, “The Prince and the Saucers,” Fortean Times 406 (June 2021): 19)

April 19 — 3:00 p.m. [Otis T. Carr](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otis_T._Carr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923480102&usg=AOvVaw155kjPDgFAn6Pw1SsJvuyJ) and Norman Colton, who have been in Oklahoma since February, pretend to attempt the launch of their OTC-X1 spacecraft in a gravel pit 6 miles east of the Frontier City amusement park northeast of Oklahoma City. Frontier City obligingly erects a model of the spacecraft as a ride. However, Carr comes down with a mysterious throat ailment and goes to Mercy Hospital on April 17. He invites [Long John Nebel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_John_Nebel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923480501&usg=AOvVaw1YLbO3uWVSqhGmq7g_ALNf) to have a brief glimpse of the model, but Nebel thinks it looks like a jumble of unconnected parts. As it turns out, the OTC- X1 develops a “mercury leak” and the launch is delayed then canceled. Those who have come for the April 19 launch hear contactee [Dana Howard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dana_Howard_(contactee)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923480799&usg=AOvVaw27TPVRV0LQ15VO72bEW2us) talk about her trip to Venus, and [Margaret Storm](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://hello-earth.com/margaretstorm/margaretstorm.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923481070&usg=AOvVaw39N1eCJDFmry5L4CosJUlj) (Carr’s “publications editor” in Baltimore) declares that Carr is inspired by the “Divine Master St. Germain.” (“[Difficulties Put Off](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94562531/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923481372&usg=AOvVaw2cu_2VEEJDxqqZQdJfB5eT) [Flying Saucer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94562581/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923481620&usg=AOvVaw2halNllYJnL4mpUj48G0ct) [Test,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94562635/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923481858&usg=AOvVaw3VxVATO8vXolw71ctSs1GK)” Oklahoma City Daily Oklahoman, April 20, 1959, pp. 1–2, 13; Clark III 860–861)

April 20 — Ufologist [Morris K. Jessup](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morris_K._Jessup&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923482416&usg=AOvVaw3hVJpkkEvSbNVSjZ8XMnGT) commits suicide in a Dade County park, Florida, from carbon monoxide poisoning. Some theorists connect his involvement with the Allende letters and the [Philadelphia experiment](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philadelphia_Experiment&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923482676&usg=AOvVaw36CIpseC38h1-Pz0gDmZXe) to his death, but friends say Jessup has been discussing suicide with them for several months. (Clark III 635; “[Jessup](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Pursuit%2520-%2520SITU%2520(Sanderson)/Pursuit%2520-%2520No%252004%2520-%2520Vol%252001%2520No%25204%2520-%25201968.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923482975&usg=AOvVaw0ibTrwuQ1W4m4vNNJUt3RP) [and the Allende Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Pursuit%2520-%2520SITU%2520(Sanderson)/Pursuit%2520-%2520No%252004%2520-%2520Vol%252001%2520No%25204%2520-%25201968.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923483234&usg=AOvVaw1UPfsi8UUZnRch1h_o3EUK)” Pursuit 1, no. 4 (September 30, 1968): 8–10)

May — The first Avrocar, #58-7055, rolls out of the Avro Malton factory in Mississauga, Ontario. From June 9 to October 7 it is tested in a static hover rig. A second Avrocar is completed in August. (Wikipedia, “[Avro Canada](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avro_Canada_VZ-9_Avrocar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923483653&usg=AOvVaw1um8vWpcQhbZStDgcWSSPX) [VZ-9 Avrocar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avro_Canada_VZ-9_Avrocar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923483855&usg=AOvVaw3Qr6Ls6wB3MJRTldm0A-rJ)”)

May 4 — [Otis T. Carr](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otis_T._Carr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923484104&usg=AOvVaw2uAmMBVeKasyKO2Ah6is9e) and his attorney are summoned to the county courthouse in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, to answer questions about stock sales by OTC Enterprises, including a block of 21,000 shares to Frontier City promoter [Jimmy Burge](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frontier_City%2523Burge/Williams_era_(1958-1981)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923484349&usg=AOvVaw0Xvimw6zVUw73u8KOpmmYo)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frontier_City%2523Burge/Williams_era_(1958-1981)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923484504&usg=AOvVaw0TMefoKzAddprfMTAajHq0) oilman [Frank Buttram](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://oklahomahof.com/member-archives/b/buttram-frank-1940&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923484680&usg=AOvVaw0fS7CFgw0vV7Uvt-HtGWJd)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://oklahomahof.com/member-archives/b/buttram-frank-1940&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923484839&usg=AOvVaw3o0aVYnn1Q_LIn7wrRiFkB) and publisher [Edward K. Gaylord](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_K._Gaylord&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923485012&usg=AOvVaw3l6il7fCHP1_FpWFb-TEw7)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_K._Gaylord&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923485156&usg=AOvVaw2knwPs-bjp1i-6vaoepJ5m) Carr pleads the Fifth Amendment. (Clark III 861)

May 5 — [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923485423&usg=AOvVaw0Ee01XBGRhlb7p_4diurD0)’s newly formed UFO Advisory Panel holds its first meeting at Wright-Patterson AFB in Dayton, Ohio.

Graham](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49191941/richard-marshall-graham&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923485685&usg=AOvVaw2Aoy3NZRt1nc4D4915KF6g) (chaplain), Lt. May 18 — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923486875&usg=AOvVaw0fhxdsnExTLQLQXdirtX7N) has an audience with Queen [Juliana](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juliana_of_the_Netherlands&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923487124&usg=AOvVaw0iSHKAoRSdiSJThSqxPM9Q) and Prince [Bernhard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_Bernhard_of_Lippe-Biesterfeld&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923487372&usg=AOvVaw1RmX-58Fmb1BWFjtz50alc) of the Netherlands at Soestdijk Palace in Baarn on his world lecture tour, amid fiercely critical media coverage. The royal audience, scheduled to last 45 minutes, goes on for two hours, making Adamski 20 minutes late for his lecture in The Hague. The royal couple claim that the British royal family, especially [Prince Philip](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_Philip%252C_Duke_of_Edinburgh&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923487635&usg=AOvVaw3ErqOJUU8i6rs0gyykIVyt), are also keen to meet Adamski. After the audience, Dutch Aeronautical Association president [Cornelis Kolff](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nl.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cornelis_Kolff&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923487874&usg=AOvVaw1fxIE30iPVxDIYh9BzVivj) says “The Queen showed an extraordinary interest in the whole subject.” Royal Netherlands Air Force Chief of Staff Lt. Gen. Haye Schaper says, “The man’s a pathological case.” (“[World Lecture Tour,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-mission/global-reach/world-tour/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923488247&usg=AOvVaw0NA7wUYQxlwuQ7GOdI2TTX)” The Adamski Case, October 5, 2019; David Clarke, “The Prince and the Saucers,” Fortean Times 406 (June 2021): 19)

May 20 — 5:30 p.m. Antonio Sanchez and Ernesto Fogliani are hunting rabbits about 7 miles from Pehuelches station, Buenos Aires, Argentina. They see a saucer-shaped, silvery machine resting on the ground about 980 feet away. They approach to about 490 feet when the object rises into the sky and disappears. At the spot where it was, they

find the grass flattened in the shape of a large oval. (Loren E. May 22 — The UFO Advisory Panel meets to “determine the type of information which should be used for correlation in bringing Special Report #14 up to date.” (“[Saucer Reading Fest,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/saucsum13.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923489397&usg=AOvVaw1l9YkE42GoxWsoi5Zu8wF7)” Saturday Night Uforia, January 25, 2019)

Late May — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923489658&usg=AOvVaw14Pey9vzL810C7Rrva9g3C) tells [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923489886&usg=AOvVaw0Ae5qP65hTNEWHd8avviLa) he is revising his book to bring it more up to date and requests NICAP’s most recent information. May 26, 29 — [Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923490312&usg=AOvVaw3mSBDIVqleKwJG3QBSPWlD) gives two lectures in Zürich, Switzerland. At the second talk, he meets with organized resistance by a group of 300 students (in an audience of 700) who have been led to believe he will discredit Swiss astronomer [Fritz Zwicky](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fritz_Zwicky&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923490715&usg=AOvVaw2KT9DrWc2J3f_ku0OBLLGz)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fritz_Zwicky&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923490959&usg=AOvVaw1DO6SF9cJ9Vktv_lIpDSVW) When a reporter afterwards asks if he will accept an apology, Adamski replies that it should not be given to him, but to the Swiss public. Due to recurring heart problems, Adamski cancels his remaining lectures in Switzerland, Italy, Austria, and Denmark. (“[World Lecture Tour,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-mission/global-reach/world-tour/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923491365&usg=AOvVaw3bziaAycnhlae5DyRN2XXp)” The Adamski Case, October 5, 2019)

May 28 — [Otis T. Carr](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otis_T._Carr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923491803&usg=AOvVaw1aP0y7FNRrRN79XAkvFwMO) and two OTC Enterprises employees (Lari Kendrick and Charles O. May 28 — Night. Two observers on a Project Moonwatch team in San Antonio, Texas, see two silvery objects through their telescopes that shoot across the sky in less than one second, one curving away in a parabolic path, the other executing a more gradual hyperbolic curve. (Michael D. Swords, “Gazing at the Moons,” IUR 32, no. 4 (October 2009): 13–14; Center for UFO Studies, “[Moonwatch Mystery Satellites, 1958–1962](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Moonwatch_Mystery_Satellites/1958-1962_Moonwatch_Mystery_Satellites.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923493063&usg=AOvVaw30mAevtF0enMUZbh_VcOGs)”)

June — The Argentine Navy bottles up a fast, submarine-like object in the Buenos Aires harbor, Argentina. It is shaped like a huge fish, is silver in color, and sports a tail like the stabilizer on a B-17. (Lorenzen, UFOs over the Americas, Signet, 1968, pp. 52–53)

June — The radiation effects reactor at Lockheed’s Georgia Nuclear Aircraft Laboratory \[now closed\] in the Dawson Forest outside Dawsonville, Georgia, is brought up to full power and unsheathed for the first time. It is a water- cooled 10-megawatt nuclear reactor in a shielded underground shaft with the purpose of irradiating military aircraft as well as the forest itself to determine the effects of nuclear war on wildlife. The experiment exposes everything within a 1,000-foot radius to a lethal dose of radiation. Bugs fall from the air, and small animals and the bacteria living in and on them are exterminated, in a phenomenon the technicians call “instant taxidermy.” Oak trees turn brown, yet crabgrass is seemingly unaffected. Pine trees are the hardest hit of all. Clear Coca-Cola bottles turn brown, hydraulic fluid coagulates into chewing gum, transistorized equipment stops working, and rubber tires become rock hard. Documents about the reactor remain highly classified, and the entrance to the underground portion of the facility has been buried. The area is closed in 1971, and only objects left above ground were the concrete foundations on which the buildings and reactors were placed. (Wikipedia, “[Georgia Nuclear](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgia_Nuclear_Aircraft_Laboratory&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923494091&usg=AOvVaw0bLmfv2RBbxZlZ6EOKqTKS) [Aircraft Laboratory](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgia_Nuclear_Aircraft_Laboratory&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923494442&usg=AOvVaw1298mt2V2cBPVM_DI4hTOt)”; Adam Higginbotham, Midnight at Chernobyl, Simon & Schuster, 2019, p. 30)

June 12 — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923495057&usg=AOvVaw3_s8HiriF5_pdRUgfCySYv) writes an open letter to [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923495437&usg=AOvVaw1S3XCKjvc_srL1sJituwhm) that lists his past statements on UFOs and urges him not to let the Air Force intimidate him into retracting. (Donald E. Keyhoe, “[Capt. Ruppelt Revising His UFO Book: Air Force](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/008%2520JUNE%25201959.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923495868&usg=AOvVaw1PRhbC8I-XmwInNxmDTz8B) [Rumored to Be Pressuring Former Project Chief,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/008%2520JUNE%25201959.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923496230&usg=AOvVaw0yyZg3oxuGv8I4jGERnA7B)” UFO Investigator 1, no. 8 (June 1959): 5–6)

June 13 — [Charles S. Sheldon II](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49313174/charles-stuart-sheldon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923496753&usg=AOvVaw0XmoxeQTgfBm3o2viOPMAy)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49313174/charles-stuart-sheldon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923497049&usg=AOvVaw2oGRC0NAXWmOGqkQ9d5jLY) technical director of the House Science and Astronautics Committee, writes to [Richard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_H._Hall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923497394&usg=AOvVaw0ao0o-7y6dx1UhfuKYLaW9)

[H. Hall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_H._Hall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923497736&usg=AOvVaw3q-BIX-1WbrW8RWdV6z6O9) at NICAP to say that while he thinks UFOs are “extremely interesting,” they do not pose a national security threat.” (Swords 290)

June 13 — [Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923498229&usg=AOvVaw37cwGq1RU9hMl27qxcp7vt)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923498439&usg=AOvVaw1HpNHi-IXZg168UXHXaCiH) along with follower Lou Zinsstag, meets with diplomat [Alberto Perego](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-mission/global-reach/alberto-perego/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923498747&usg=AOvVaw1Ot0uNZYK9lWQW5v_URA5e) and Mario Maioli at Ristorante La Cisterna in the Trastevere area of Rome, Italy, then go on an all-night taxi ride around the city. (Bernardo Passíon, “[Report from Argentina,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201959%252011%252000%2520-%2520November.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923499686&usg=AOvVaw2jNtkh5yRuL7rISFbVoH7v)” APRO Bulletin, November 1959, p. 9; Loren E. June 26–28 — 6:45 p.m. At Boianai Mission, Papua New Guinea, Rev. [William Booth Gill](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://theozfiles.blogspot.com/2007/08/reverend-william-bill-booth-gill-1929.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923501083&usg=AOvVaw0yc_f5LraBGHFUH9k9avt1) and 38 others watch a platform-shaped object with legs that appears in the sky above Venus. It has an electric blue spotlight and is hovering about 500 feet away at a height of 300–400 feet. On top of the object, four humanlike figures, their bodies surrounded by illumination, are busy with some unknown task. The men and spotlight disappear at 7:20

p.m. and the object vanishes into the clouds. It reappears at 8:28 without the men or spotlight but now joined by second, third and fourth objects at 8:29, 8:35, and 8:35–8:50 p.m., coming and going through the clouds. The

* * *

main UFO, “large, clear, stationary,” gives off a red light and disappears overhead into clouds at 9:10 p.m., reappears at 9:20, moves across the sea to Giwa appearing white-red-blue, then disappears at 9:30. An overhead object reappears at 9:46, hovering, disappears behind a cloud at 10:10, reappears in a gap between clouds at 10:30, then is gone at 10:50. The next day, the object returns at 6:00–6:30 p.m. with two others, one to the west and one overhead. “Two of the figures seemed to be doing something near the center of the deck. They were occasionally bending over and raising their arms as though adjusting or setting up something (not visible). One figure seemed to be standing, looking down at us.” Father Gill and another teacher wave their arms, and two of the figures on the main object wave back. Gill waves a flashlight and the object moves back and forth laterally. Gill goes in for dinner and a church service; when he returns at 7:45 p.m., the UFO is gone. The next evening at 6:45 p.m., some eight objects align themselves across a section of the sky. No occupants are visible. [Martin Kottmeyer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.dios.com.ar/notas1/biografias/escribas/kottmeyer_martin/kottmeyer_martin.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923502192&usg=AOvVaw2TpYDod6Ou0DJ7Uz3hLPZQ) suggests that Gill was watching a lighted squid-fishing boat close to shore, but Gill has confirmed the object was over his head. (“[Saucer Men Seen in Flight: Amazing Sighting from Papua,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1959%252CNov-Dic%252CV%25205%252CN%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923502645&usg=AOvVaw1jZLH-0q7cDkSemHhjwHXF)” Flying Saucer Review 5, no. 6 (Nov./Dec.

1959): 7–8; Norman E. G. Cruttwell, “[Flying Saucers over Papua: A Report on Papuan Unidentified Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.theblackvault.com/casefiles/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/frgill1959.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923503288&usg=AOvVaw3ziarFfb6R-CYv_LXrBbrv) [Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.theblackvault.com/casefiles/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/frgill1959.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923503600&usg=AOvVaw3FaWQovPciOn1mKmAf-yuZ)” March 1960; Norman E. G. Cruttwell, “[What Happened in Papua in 1959?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1960%252CNov-Dec%252CV%25206%252CN%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923503951&usg=AOvVaw28vBcfRWc3VwvUKJP02cSz)” Flying Saucer Review 6, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1960): 3–7; “[Father Gill and the Rev. 1961): 23–25; Norman E. G. July — The Air Force reassigns UFO investigative duties to the 1127th Field Activities Group stationed at Fort Belvoir, Fairfax County, Virginia, replacing the 1006th AISS. The unit will also be responsible for Project Moon Dust and Operation Blue Fly. (Jacobs, UFO Controversy in America, Signet ed., 1976, [p. 134](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/134/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923510272&usg=AOvVaw2fIzke57pz3yFWZ_cQXTgW); Kevin D. Randle and Donald

R. Schmitt, “Secret Projects and Open Eyes: A Response,” IUR 19, no. 3 (May/June 1994): 16–17)

July — Contactee [Gabriel Green](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_Green&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923510968&usg=AOvVaw2DQ6dX_-eyR1HXTSxy7jwK) rebrands his group as the Amalgamated Flying Saucer Clubs of America and publishes the AFSCA World Report from 1959 to 1961, UFO International from 1962 to 1965, and Flying Saucers International from 1966 to 1969. ([AFSCA Information Sheet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/AFSCA%2520World%2520Report%2520(Gabriel%2520Green)/AFSCA%2520Information%2520Sheet%2520-%2520No%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923511805&usg=AOvVaw0iHIuHpmLObYLT92mfn2aS)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/AFSCA%2520World%2520Report%2520(Gabriel%2520Green)/AFSCA%2520Information%2520Sheet%2520-%2520No%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923512161&usg=AOvVaw0_NGdxVvSNNg3CEhfgf5sJ) no. 1 (1959); [AFSCA UFO International](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/UFO%2520International%2520(Gabriel%2520Green)/UFO%2520International%2520-%2520No%252017.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923512624&usg=AOvVaw2QDEmT8FrdA3mJnwI4bfM7), no. 17

(Sept./Oct. 1962); [Flying Saucers International](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Flying%2520Saucers%2520International%2520(Gabriel%2520Green)/Flying%2520Saucers%2520International%2520-%2520No%252024.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923513252&usg=AOvVaw0ImjRMcGdelYUycVrMf3FN)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Flying%2520Saucers%2520International%2520(Gabriel%2520Green)/Flying%2520Saucers%2520International%2520-%2520No%252024.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923513639&usg=AOvVaw1_E_UCGXZ88NllvveLXYUf) no. 24 (July 1966); Clark III 99)

July 5–6 — US Navy Cmdr. Julius Larsen, an ONI liaison officer to the CIA’s Photographic Intelligence Center in Washington, D.C., rediscovers the Swan-Knowles-Affa correspondence from 1954 in a file and decides to follow up on it. He goes to Eliot, Maine, to visit Adm. [Knowles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1976/03/06/75711948.html?pageNumber%3D23&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923514274&usg=AOvVaw25rbfvjyogIazeI9uwb7qr) and interview Frances Swan. Larsen tries his hand at automatic writing and channels a message from Affa. Back in Washington on July 6, Larsen goes to director of the Photographic Intelligence Office, [Arthur C. Lundahl](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_C._Lundahl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923514665&usg=AOvVaw1b7DdSZgrKmTfkfEe2-koS), and tells the story to him and his assistant Lt. [Robert S.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/n/NeashamRobertS/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923514984&usg=AOvVaw0TFYjSFS560qEqn1dr-vhi) [Neasham](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/n/NeashamRobertS/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923515259&usg=AOvVaw1tg7ArMgdhwAH-eeJbYDEK)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/n/NeashamRobertS/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923515479&usg=AOvVaw1-RrTJ6nngeUpd-Nfn8RAC) They urge Larsen to try to contact the extraterrestrials. Larsen goes into a trance, asks Affa questions, and writes the answers down. When Neasham challenges Affa to appear in person or let them see his spaceship, Larsen stops writing and tells Neasham to go to the window. Lundahl sees nothing unusual, but Neasham insists a spaceship is hiding behind some fluffy clouds. He also insists that he later contacted Washington National Airport and heard from the radar tower that the sector where the UFO appeared had been “blocked out.” Neasham urges Project Blue Book’s Maj. [Robert Friend](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Friend_(pilot)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923515944&usg=AOvVaw3c3U58iw0soKTnuyh-p_QN) to come over for a briefing. He shows up on July 9 and hears Neasham’s version of the story, and Larsen even channels some messages. Friend goes back to Dayton, Ohio, and prepares a memo for his boss. (Jacobs, UFO Controversy in America, Signet ed., 1976, [pp. 153–154](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/152/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923516439&usg=AOvVaw1amsaDERIXDdUCpgiO_CCe); Clark III 1118–1119; Robert Emenegger, UFOs: Past, Present, and Future, Ballantine, 1974)

July 8 — Night. Mrs. Napau Abednego and other indigenous people on Prince of Wales Island in the Torres Strait off Queensland, Australia, see a huge, glowing red object land on top of a hill at Port Lihou. The same night, residents of nearby Thursday Island see a green UFO flying low, and a strange object is also reported at Mapoon Mission on the west coast of Cape York. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923516880&usg=AOvVaw13lvMn6ZtcPaEyIoSUdy2q) [History: 1959 July–September](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923517191&usg=AOvVaw0Pq3ffgowzsw9vY1P30ars)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923517457&usg=AOvVaw0aeE1r5UE1OizqTyTqMSkt) The Author, 2000, p. 13)

July 11 — 6:02 a.m. A Pan American Boeing Stratocruiser piloted by Capt. George Wilson flying over the Pacific Ocean about 1,035 miles northeast of Honolulu, Hawaii, encounters a large bright light with 3–4 satellite lights in a line below, behind, and to the left of the main object. It makes a sharp right turn and disappears to the south. Copilot

* * *

Richard Lorenzen and Flight Engineer Bob Scott also see the UFOs. Another Pan Am flight sees essentially the same phenomenon, as well as an Air Force bomber crew, a Slick Airways plane, and a Canadian Pacific airliner. (UFOEv, [p. 125](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D137%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923522670&usg=AOvVaw1YLVIQ0qQkkCLmJ3m9FLR5))

July 13 — 5:30 a.m. Eileen Moreland, a farmwoman in Blenheim, New Zealand, goes to the barn to milk her cows and sees a huge object, about 20–30 feet in diameter, with two intense green lights on its underside descend towards her and hover at rooftop height. It bathes her in green light. Two rows of jets around the middle shoot out orange flames. She can see two men inside, dressed in close-fitting suits of shiny material and opaque helmets. The jets turn on again, the object tilts, and it shoots up vertically at great speed, making a high-pitched sound. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1959 July–September](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923523321&usg=AOvVaw0Ph_nlFZy7eMWM9ilZWzFK), The Author, 2000, pp.

25–28; Richard H. Hall, “Dyad ‘Scout Craft,’” IUR 25, no. 4 (Winter 2000–2001): 23; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1959-07-13-nzealand-blenheim.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923523775&usg=AOvVaw3oULjSVlwZpv6QpImvn6T8)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1959-07-13-nzealand-blenheim.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923523999&usg=AOvVaw39fv9MLxpeJHjnrrByyKnO) November 2, 2006)

July 14 — 8:22 p.m. TV sets in Salisbury, North Carolina, mysteriously go dead as residents see a flash of light and hear a loud vibrato noise. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923524412&usg=AOvVaw3Ez9nm6mgGdHKf0IK27BsM)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923524630&usg=AOvVaw1KUANYWzcMpO5JtVJXs257) pp. 111–113)

July 20 — A shuttlecock-shaped UFO is seen over the RAAF Woomera Range Complex in South Australia. (Lorenzen,

UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 100)

July 27 — The UFO Advisory Panel meets at Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio to discuss trends and statistics and recent sightings. (“[Saucer Reading Fest,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/saucsum13.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923525309&usg=AOvVaw3p6OHqxy2yYqF2tUZnFpnS)” Saturday Night Uforia, January 25, 2019)

July 28 — 2:10 p.m. [Ray Stanford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/magazine/tireless-tracker-rewrote-the-book-on-dinosaurs-in-maryland/2012/04/17/gIQARzRcTT_story.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923525839&usg=AOvVaw1x8Bj0BUjFNWrL_7-nRRmV) and a friend simultaneously take 8mm and 16mm film footage of three cigar-shaped objects maneuvering in the sky above his parents’ home at 2629 Lynch Street, Corpus Christi, Texas. A fourth UFO appears about 5 minutes later. At one point a jet aircraft appears to alter its course to fly closer to one of the objects. (Ray Stanford, “[The July 28 Movies,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Saucers%2520(Max%2520B%2520Miller)/Saucers%2520vol%25207%2520no%25203-4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923526312&usg=AOvVaw3B2We4JLIqPbj6oQMvZcvz)” Saucers 7, no. 3/4 (Fall/Winter 1959/1960): 20–23; “[Out of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1984-85_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923526713&usg=AOvVaw1mUeXnsiNaSmmDeD7sApTz) [Past,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1984-85_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923527037&usg=AOvVaw2C3g34koVB8-1yjrWJejeG)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 5, no. 4 (Aug./Sept. 1984): 5–7; “[Out of the Past,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1984-85_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923527518&usg=AOvVaw3SB2zBufBa8jGCpscyomtc)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 5, no. 5 (Oct./Nov. 1984): 7–8)

August — Stan Seers, president of the Queensland Flying Saucer Research Bureau \[now UFO Research Queensland\], is contacted by a man who requests a meeting with him in a Brisbane car park and offers him important information on UFOs. At the meeting he finds out that the man is an agent of the Australian Security Intelligence Organisation, who indicates he knows quite a bit about the group and its officers. By suggesting that ASIO could offer them significant information, the agent subsequently infiltrates the group and causes dissension and confusion. Some QFSRB members are pacifists, apparently, and are seeking to contact Russian scientists about the UFO phenomenon through the Soviet cultural organization VOKS. (Good Above, [pp. 164–166](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/164/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923528297&usg=AOvVaw1gEw_xYEIaMYUnSWhu573f); Kremlin 137– 144)

August — 2:00 p.m. A son and his father are driving near Skiatook, Oklahoma. Upon nearing a bridge, the car engine dies. Another car is stopped on the other side of the bridge with its hood up. They see a metallic, domed disc with a flexible hose hovering less than a foot above the water of a creek. They watch it for 5 minutes, then the hose draws in and the disk rises to 10 feet, disturbing the water’s surface into a foot-deep trench. It flies upward and the cars start again. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1959 July–September](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923528654&usg=AOvVaw2YDBoSAhQRj7rzEuzcEgg_), The Author, 2000, pp. 59–61; Michael D. Swords, “Messing Around with the Force,” IUR 31, no. 4 (March 2008): 16–17)

August — Kathleen O’Rourke is asleep with her two children in her bedroom in New Matamoras, Ohio, when her son yells her awake. There are a dozen globes of yellow light circling about a foot above his bed. They are about 3 inches in diameter. Then a second group enters the room, passing through the screen. They split, half joining the first and half sailing over Kathleen. They all then move to her bed and circle above her. Not one of the lights goes to her daughter’s bed. She presses the light switch, and the lights turn into straight-edged streaks of light and disappear. There are no holes in the screens. (Michael D. Swords, “A Trick of the Light,” IUR 31, no. 2 (June 2007): 10)

August 9 — 7:30 p.m. Petroleum engineer Armando Uribe is returning home from Cerro Sombrero, Tierra del Fuego, Chile, with his wife and an 11-year-old housemaid when their pickup runs out of fuel. As they are waiting for another vehicle, the girl spots a bright blue light around 7:54 p.m. that is swinging in the air with a pendulum-like motion. As it approaches, they see it is an object like a metallic egg standing on end with two shafts of white light projecting from the bottom. A rose-colored, rotating device is on top. The object makes a quick movement when Uribe gets out of the truck, but then moves closer. Uribe points a rifle at it, and it quickly recedes and disappears. (Lorenzen, UFOs over the Americas, Signet, 1968, pp. 14–16; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923529404&usg=AOvVaw1DDGTzD7ZuFPoz7_ZPq1Kb) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1959 July–September](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923529610&usg=AOvVaw2MKHcnsal0kMjpnr_LJzYK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923529841&usg=AOvVaw1Y-hmbbV4mps29Ae4ON7ux) The Author, 2000, pp. 53–54)

August 13 — 4:00 p.m. Pilot Jack H. Goldsberry, flying a Cessna 170 from Hobbs to Albuquerque, New Mexico, at 8,000 feet, notices halfway between Roswell and Corona, that his Magnesyn electric compass has suddenly moved

* * *

around a slow 360° rotation in about 4–5 seconds. His other standard magnetic compass is spinning wildly. About this time, he sees three small, gray, and slightly fuzzy elliptical objects in close echelon formation passing in front from left to right and around his plane at a distance about 450–600 feet at a speed of about 200 mph. The Magnesyn compass follows the objects’ position as they circle the plane, and after one full circle they disappear to the rear. Then both compasses settle back to normal. The controller at Albuquerque cancels his flight plan and orders him to land at Kirtland AFB, where he is interrogated by a USAF major, who tells him that he might become ill from the experience. (NICAP, “[Former Navy PBY Pilot Encounter / EME](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/590813roswell_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923530471&usg=AOvVaw04Yq6m9dLY1hFGFPmoR5OH)”; Clark III 950; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923530649&usg=AOvVaw3-ydduOodiobQvfoq1AVQx)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923530788&usg=AOvVaw15bcfZFiVIrnYiVtjvM6KN) p.

278; Swords 287; “[AF Secretly Warns Pilot of Danger,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/025%2520MAR-APR%25201965.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923531085&usg=AOvVaw2sO72ef2mpb6HbZxMIlMVy)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 1 (March/April 1965): 5;

[Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923531442&usg=AOvVaw1kyewBMJlQ0PXO93ubVv-Y)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923531744&usg=AOvVaw2xEgxUzNIm1sFBm0RH5KcG) pp. 127–128)

August 13 — Around 9:45 p.m. Orville Shanks is driving with three passengers on Highway 332 north of Freeport, Texas, when they see a bright object with two satellite lights approach at low altitude. The car motor stalls and the headlights go out. The two lights appear to land, the main object follows them, continually changing colors and varying the intensity of its light. The motor and lights come back on when the UFOs cross the road, and Shanks drives on. About midnight they return, and the object is still there. Shanks gets out and approaches, but the UFO starts glowing brightly and making a noise, and they drive off again. (“[Object Lands in Texas, U.S.,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201959%252009%252000%2520-%2520September.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923532376&usg=AOvVaw1GNL4xC_6qBGhWgLK6DzQz)” APRO Bulletin, September 1959, p. 3; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1959](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923532862&usg=AOvVaw2leX4nRRoP7opyhK390Q1-) [July–September](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923533201&usg=AOvVaw0AiHRyz3j75iQ19XgKBnkZ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923533458&usg=AOvVaw3w-xpF880tTZXE_obrGHiB) The Author, 2000, pp. 55–60)

August 17 — The automatic keys at the power station in Uberlândia, Minas Gerais, Brazil, suddenly disconnect power to all four trunk lines. A technician at a substation 45 miles away reports that all the keys disconnected as a UFO passes overhead, traveling toward the main station along the power lines. The chief engineer resets all the keys but they turn off again. Outside he sees a bright object approaching at high speed. As soon as it passes, the entire system returns to normal. (Lorenzen, FSHoax, [pp. 179–180](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/1966CoralLorenzenFlyingSaucersTheStartlingEvidenceOfTheInvasionFromOuterSpacenotOCR/page/n179/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923534121&usg=AOvVaw3WjPVNTMeIi3ZfuleaxE1e); [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923534398&usg=AOvVaw3uGVHDVNgEuTr8bD6O1YYY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923534605&usg=AOvVaw1z1DMaeRQ-N7xrmLBrBwdL) pp. 143–145; Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 152–153; McCampbell, Ufology, 1976, pp. 66–67; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923534993&usg=AOvVaw2SdlH8ygJ5F54wNib4JuuK) [of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1959 July–September](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923535206&usg=AOvVaw1BD2B_QOcQ_UuGmdO-tqAK), The Author, 2000, pp. 66–67)

August 25 — 11:00 a.m. At Eveking, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany, Lutz Holtman walks towards a bright object in a forest and faints after he gets close to it. When he regains consciousness, he sees the UFO take off silently and vertically. The object is circular, has a tripod landing gear and two rows of bright openings, and is about 90 feet in diameter. (Vallée, Magonia, [p. 277](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/passporttomagoni0000vall/page/276/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923535602&usg=AOvVaw1FNmvZ2fD-AIV1qUPKZWne))

September — Employees of Lockheed’s Skunk Works are the first to return to Area 51 in Nevada to develop an aircraft that will replace the U-2. The Archangel-12 (A-12) spy plane will be designed to reduce its radar cross section by 50%. Following tests with wooden models at Burbank, California, proof-of-concept tests are to be carried out at Area 51 with full-scale mockups elevated onto 50-foot pylons. The CIA program to develop the follow-on aircraft to the U-2 is code-named Project Oxcart. EG&G agrees to move its radar test facility here. (Jacobsen, Area 51, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/130/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923536110&usg=AOvVaw0f1wpWz_C2ZyB2jlLTFTDD) [131](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/130/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923536317&usg=AOvVaw3V-9U29l5RiaPoVGvhmt47); Peter W. Merlin, “[Groom Lake Timeline: The First Fifty Years,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://area51specialprojects.com/area51_timeline.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923536637&usg=AOvVaw3mHm5PJ_GZskUWs9wiONXq)” Secret Heroes, November 10, 2021)

September — [Waveney Girvan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.joshuablubuhs.com/blog/ian-waveney-girvan-as-a-fortean&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923536928&usg=AOvVaw2keIj3OLC3_D_GSpTVbgry) takes over the editorship of Flying Saucer Review from [Brinsley Le Poer Trench](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brinsley_Le_Poer_Trench%252C_8th_Earl_of_Clancarty&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923537257&usg=AOvVaw147WNgqtq06iSgFf0lF0r2)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brinsley_Le_Poer_Trench%252C_8th_Earl_of_Clancarty&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923537424&usg=AOvVaw0wertMuxjqfLQAx0Jm1K35) (“[Trench Resigns,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1959%252CSep-Oct%252CV%25205%252CN%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923537629&usg=AOvVaw1b9E6PRNWxRetY3DAZqYhN)” Flying Saucer Review 5, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1959): 2; Clark III 498)

September — Harvard University psychologist [Henry Murray](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Murray&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923537984&usg=AOvVaw25lR8ur6ub62_p06bXBUu1) begins what are widely considered unethical experiments, in which he uses 22 Harvard undergraduates as research subjects in Cambridge, Massachusetts. Among other purposes, experiments focus on measuring people’s reactions under extreme stress. The unwitting undergraduates are submitted to what Murray calls “vehement, sweeping, and personally abusive” attacks. Specific, tailored assaults on their egos, cherished ideas, and beliefs are used to cause high levels of stress and distress. The subjects then repeatedly view recorded footage of their reactions to this verbal abuse. Among them is 17-year-old [Ted](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ted_Kaczynski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923538282&usg=AOvVaw3OnM8Hrhbe6KavUqYcqyFN) [Kaczynski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ted_Kaczynski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923538449&usg=AOvVaw1V5_X9KWkCG6hxOOTj1KIP)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ted_Kaczynski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923538582&usg=AOvVaw3F9YpxdVTUhDen1_chAtcw) a mathematician who goes on to become the Unabomber, a domestic terrorist targeting academics and technologists for 18 years. [Alston Chase](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.identitytheory.com/alston-chase/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923538758&usg=AOvVaw2MAxNzVfU6BKG7IpAAOieq)’s book Harvard and the Unabomber connects Kaczynski’s abusive experiences under Murray to his later criminal career. His participation in these experiments and his service in the OSS have led many to believe that Murray was a part of the MK Ultra program. His experiments are not so much for observing stress reactions, but for a study of brainwashing and enhanced interrogation techniques. (Wikipedia, “[Henry Murray](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Murray&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923539073&usg=AOvVaw2qJJHncgYHS5K36zFM3yEJ)”; Alston Chase, [Harvard and the Unabomber: The Education of an American Terrorist](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/harvardunabomber00chas&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923539278&usg=AOvVaw3s786koNTZ6DYkHQdrKJoY), Norton, 2003)

September 7 — 2:00 a.m. Rural mail carrier [Walter E. Ogden](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/116830199/walter-e-ogden&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923539572&usg=AOvVaw0frWiM-yFCgf7fk-tg2UOB) sees a glowing, pumpkin-shaped object about 40 feet above the trees in his pasture at Wallingford, Kentucky. After a minute, a bluish blaze of fire comes from the bottom and it rises about 500 feet, leaving a circular smoke ring. It then zooms away horizontally. Six days later, a 12-foot depressed ring of scorched earth is discovered on the spot, along with a kerosene smell. Air Force investigators show up and declare it a hoax. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1959](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923539863&usg=AOvVaw2YNYXZjfg9fEzyegLs8M1k) [July–September](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923540062&usg=AOvVaw31mOUvspUC3iEunf4lgHA3)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-July-Sept.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923540217&usg=AOvVaw0JX11xN08v6rwj5vN-poMU) The Author, 2000, pp. 74–75, 77–80)

* * *

September 9 — The first Atlas-D ICBM is successfully launched at Vandenberg AFB \[now Vandenberg Space Force Base\] near Lompoc, California, and Gen. [Thomas S. Power](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_S._Power&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923540586&usg=AOvVaw3GAFQdZvjrFhgzLqkrw6Kc)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_S._Power&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923540724&usg=AOvVaw2ff4mU1HP3KIbgQages7iO) CINCSAC, declares the first ICBM to be operational. Shortly afterward, the first operational Atlas-D ICBM squadron goes on alert at Francis E. Warren AFB, west of Cheyenne, Wyoming. It is equipped with six SM-65D Atlas missiles based in above-ground launchers. (Wikipedia, “[Vandenberg Space Force Base](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vandenberg_Space_Force_Base%23SM-65_Atlas&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923541078&usg=AOvVaw3MQvHIsK7g47aNgbICNsMq)”; Wikipedia, “[SM-65 Atlas](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SM-65_Atlas%23Atlas-D_deployment&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923541273&usg=AOvVaw0kwy-Vb10MFZsQl1YfCYOS)”)

September 13 — 9:58 p.m. A radar target is tracked at Kirtland AFB in Albuquerque, New Mexico, moving at 2,300 mph at an altitude of 60,000 feet and heading northwest. A total of four radar stations track the object. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 103)

September 14 — Air Force Regulation 200-2 is revised, with additional emphasis on reducing the number of unknowns. This version devotes five full paragraphs to public release of information, which is now restricted to the Secretary of the Air Force’s Office of Information Services at the Pentagon. Local base commanders can release information only if an object is positively identified. Air Force personnel are not to contact private individuals on UFO cases or discuss their operations unless ordered to. (“[USAF UFO Program,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/590928-staff-study.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923541806&usg=AOvVaw3DXJq3zK-RIVUdFvXebhPs)” September 28, 1959; Clark III 920–921)

September 14 — The CIA emphasizes antiradar study, aerodynamic structural tests, and engineering designs, selecting the Lockheed A-12 over rival Convair’s Kingfish. [Edward Lovick](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/182829326/edward-lovick&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923542131&usg=AOvVaw2Eqkcdu8hMpwu9OraYyZnJ)’s suggestion for adding cesium to the A-12’s fuel in order to ionize the exhaust and mask it from radar is also persuasive. Lockheed has also added twin canted fins instead of a single right-angle one. Project Oxcart is officially established.
