The A-12 design, a combination of their A-7 and A-11 submissions, emphasizes low radar cross section, extremely high altitude, and high-speed performance. (Wikipedia, “[Lockheed A-12](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_A-12&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923542371&usg=AOvVaw3g7L0kKdIh8GeGEKnA8NxH)”)

September 17 —The first powered X-15 flight is piloted by [Albert Scott Crossfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_Scott_Crossfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923542627&usg=AOvVaw0SWCpU1smYFXMsmcp4uBz9) out of the Dryden Flight Research Center at Edwards AFB, California. (Wikipedia, “[North American X-15](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_American_X-15&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923542857&usg=AOvVaw0p2oqDW5I54GaZ5P2_sAac)”)

September 21 — The Air Technical Intelligence Center is renamed the Aerospace Technical Intelligence Center. (NASIC, “[National Air and Space Intelligence Center Heritage](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nasic.af.mil/About-Us/Fact-Sheets/Article/611728/national-air-and-space-intelligence-center-heritage/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923543302&usg=AOvVaw051si47yl7s04GcI2_pIcv)”)

September 24 — About 4:55 a.m. In Redmond, Oregon, police officer Robert Dickerson sees a bright white light rapidly descending north of the airport. It stops abruptly and hovers about 200 feet above ground for several minutes, lighting up the juniper trees below. Dickerson drives toward it on the Prineville Highway, then turns toward the airport. The object turns reddish-orange and moves rapidly to about 10 miles northeast of the airport to hover again. Dickerson arrives at the airport to report his sighting in person to the FAA Air Traffic Communication Station. Flight Service Specialist [Laverne Wertz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/189049553/laverne-john-wertz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923543679&usg=AOvVaw1mj2F62v5BtgA3sVLZgpEL)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/189049553/laverne-john-wertz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923543873&usg=AOvVaw36Qoo7Gz_dn_iz8nDj1kjN) Dickerson, and others view the object through binoculars as flat and round with occasional flames extending from its edge. The FAA reports the UFO to Seattle Air Route Control Center in Washington at 5:10 a.m., which in turn reports it to Hamilton AFB \[now closed\], Novato, California, which scrambles six F-102 jets from Portland to intercept the object. FAA station observers see the object hover and emit long tongues of red, yellow, and green light that extend and retract at irregular intervals. As the jets approach the object from the southeast, it turns into a mushroom shape, emits red and yellow flames from the lower side, and ascends rapidly, disappearing above scattered clouds at about 14,000 feet. The object’s departure forces one F-102 to swerve to avoid collision. Another nearly loses control from the UFO’s turbulent wake. The UFO is tracked on one F-102 gunsight radar, but the jets cannot intercept. The UFO reappears about 20 miles south of Redmond at about 25,000 feet. The Seattle Center reports at 6:20 a.m. radar contact with the object about 25 miles south. The USAF Air Defense Center radar site at Klamath Falls, Oregon, tracks a large target abruptly changing course and vectors B-47 and F-89 aircraft to identify it. Redmond FAA controllers lose sight of the object. Seattle FAA reports at 7:11 a.m. that Klamath Falls radar still is tracking it at 25 miles south of Redmond but varies in altitude from 6,000 to 52,000 feet. The Air Force claims the UFOs are caused by false radar returns, with excitable witnesses imagining the glow. But locals notice the FAA is checking for abnormal radioactivity, so the Air Force changes its explanation to weather balloon. And NICAP obtains FAA logs showing all the details. The Air Force again changes its explanation to Venus. (NICAP, “[Huge Disc Sparks Scramble](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/590924redmond_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923544227&usg=AOvVaw2g-nXiNfB_5gaWuxBkJy_w)”; UFOEv,

[pp. 44](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D56%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923544491&usg=AOvVaw1vparCKCyYjOM2OZmUuTvR)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D56%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923544739&usg=AOvVaw2EpAq9Hk3u95ouQbO-kMR0) [48](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D60%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923544974&usg=AOvVaw2Hd4NEl0nzLfd5-RGLS-Qo), [113–114](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D125%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923545173&usg=AOvVaw2L2WuICRezVYOTkTTxVHIP)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D125%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923545349&usg=AOvVaw0W8UQWR0RjGAdyEp6bVQ6E) [138](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D150%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923545611&usg=AOvVaw2ZDDU7IBGI_U4WYaFQXdNo); Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, [pp. 33–36](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/32/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923545917&usg=AOvVaw2yUUzGEykwuxrfDAo4ZmKF); WFAA, Dallas, Texas, “[Archive 1959: Fighter Jets Sent to Intercept Redmond UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.wfaa.com/video/news/special-reports/archive-video/redmond-oregon-ufo-fighter-jets/283-2189790&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923546143&usg=AOvVaw2Z0XlnrZr5t6BSmS2TFjiK),” May 12, 2016; Patrick Gross, “[The Redmond UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/redmond59.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923546353&usg=AOvVaw2ZKnub8gKi5izoarNPczPh) [Incident, USA, September 24, 1959](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/redmond59.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923546533&usg=AOvVaw3YOEj_zCSXrA1oTdlIoA96)”)

September 28 — ATIC issues a staff study by Col. [Richard R. Shoop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/197896549/richard-raymond-shoop&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923546806&usg=AOvVaw2ggozYUNE8pOQIAK6YgEzv) reassessing its UFO investigating role. It recommends that the UFO program be transferred to the Air Research and Development Command, which has better scientific capabilities, and then implement an effective public relations campaign with the goal of “the eventual elimination of the program as a special project.” (“[USAF UFO Program,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/590928-staff-study.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923547089&usg=AOvVaw1rAmX6vBT0tBExH5pP0kNK)” September 28, 1959; “[Saucer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/saucsum13.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923547306&usg=AOvVaw1IPXtWHVWK2-o5oc3yZipT) [Reading Fest,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/saucsum13.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923547509&usg=AOvVaw3AolRyxtG7IULl5g_7GU7D)” Saturday Night Uforia, January 25, 2019; Jacobs, UFO Controversy in America, Signet ed., [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/150/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923547789&usg=AOvVaw0kDe-6kpEg61DeSePZ7NNY)

[151](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/150/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923548047&usg=AOvVaw2207lO1pmc28xsL87F9146))

* * *

September 29 — Maj. R. O. Braswell, flying an Air Force C-47 at 6,500 feet over Texas, sees a “large red fire” that looks like a mushroom cloud. It is 5° above his plane, with its base at 12,000–15,000 feet and its top at 16,000 feet. (Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, [pp. 160–161](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/160/mode/2up?q%3DBraswell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923548546&usg=AOvVaw2pt7LroCdjVuCId6uDpiQu))

September 29 — The first attempt to hover a tethered Avrocar is made. After the vehicle becomes airborne, an uncontrollable roll and pitch-coupled oscillation starts that forces each of the three wheels into the ground in turn. The pilot, W. D. “Spud” Potocki, immediately shuts down all engines. Changes are made to the stability system to provide more control authority, while new tethers are investigated to improve the ability to control the problem. (Wikipedia, “[Avro Canada VZ-9 Avrocar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avro_Canada_VZ-9_Avrocar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923548910&usg=AOvVaw08B_8oKb3_I6e294TT1qvV)”)

September 30 — Night. During a training flight with a student over Poznań, Poland, a pilot named Leszczyński sees two large circles of light with another pair some 12 miles away. He makes a close approach, but one of the objects shoots off while the other grows dimmer. After a short while, the dark object moves away. (Poland 63)

October — NICAP continues collecting statements in preparation for potential congressional hearings. It gets statements from USAF pilot and UFO witness Lt. Col. [Richard T. Headrick](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21731388/richard-throop-headrick&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923549345&usg=AOvVaw3gZbBCdDVG80Gf3ugsYbG9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21731388/richard-throop-headrick&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923549504&usg=AOvVaw0Hx_CosffZ9VIir-FhUti6) Sgt. James H. Sawyer, and Sgt. Oliver Dean. (Keyhoe, FSTS, pp. 252–254; UFOEv, [p. 25](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D37%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923549700&usg=AOvVaw0yZWx9BZDx8tSpIuy5icSF))

October — 10:00 a.m. Fr. Raimundo Nascimento Teixeira, a professor at Don Bosco College, is walking in the Núcleo Bandeirante region in Brasília, Federal District, Brazil, when he sees a crowd watching a strange object moving and stopping in the blue sky. He sees a student of his with a box camera, and he takes six photos of what he calls a flying saucer. A few days later, Teixeira meets with another witness, Israel Pinheiro, president of the New Building Company, who takes the negatives of his three best photos to forward to the Brazilian Navy for analysis. A few months later, the Navy returns different photos and offers no technical report. (Clark III 197; Roberto Affonso Beck, “[Um Fenômeno Desafiador,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://doczz.com.br/doc/754518/um-fen%25C3%25B4meno-desafiador&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923550029&usg=AOvVaw38xus7EKL9u2VOUpBweNCu)” September 2005, pp. 35–36)

October 1 — 9:20 a.m. A radar target moving at 719 mph on a northwest course is tracked at Kirtland AFB in Albuquerque, New Mexico. At 10:29 a.m., another radar target is detected moving at 1,000 mph to the northwest. Its altitude is 41,000 feet. Two F-89J Scorpion fighters are scrambled to intercept it but they can see nothing. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 103–104)

October 2 — 12:20 a.m. For three hours, a Hercules radar site (#13) at McChord AFB \[now Joint Base Lewis-McChord\] near Tacoma, Washington, tracks a total of five objects that usually appear in pairs. The radar returns are said to be “weak.” Visually, at least one soundless, round. “quarter sized,” blue-white light is seen in the sky. ARTC reports no air traffic in the area of the radar site during the time of contact. The first object on radar is seen at 10° elevation. The last object seen on radar was at 20° elevation. The visual object is at 10° degrees elevation. When last observed, the visual object is 20° elevation. Flight patterns are erratic. Range changes from 12,000 feet to 24,000 feet, and azimuth from 190° to 170°. Objects seem to fade from the scope and visual contact when finally lost. Visual contact is disrupted by intermittent fog. (NICAP, “[Hercules Site Tracks Objects for Three Hours](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/591002seattle_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923550523&usg=AOvVaw1sFZ1Uh4WVR_2bR1ojECIp)”; Condon, [pp. 145–148](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/144/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923550707&usg=AOvVaw2zsT3tpm7ubvtmAkxqQDsh); Swords 287)

October 8 — Night. Two amateur astronomers in Mobile, Alabama, observe an unknown object traverse the Moon’s disk from west to east directly over the crater Copernicus. They watch the fast-moving shape “every night the weather permitted for a period of 33 days.” They write to Project Moonwatch about the observations, but they reply that no other lunar observers have seen the phenomenon, so it must be closer to the Mobile observers. (Michael D. Swords, “Gazing at the Moons,” IUR 32, no. 4 (October 2009): 15)

October 12 — 1:00 p.m. Multiple witnesses at Washington, Sharon, and Crawfordville, Georgia, watch “brown or black footballs” traveling southeast to west, followed by angel hair covering a vast area. The substance consists of “threads from 10ʹ to 50ʹ long connected at ¾ʺ intervals by minute particles resembling snowflakes.” The material falls for about 2 hours. Five samples are collected and sent to the Chemicals and Materials Laboratory at Robins AFB, Georgia. No unusual elements are discovered except for high amounts of silver in one and some silver in three others. The conjecture is that “cloud seeding with a silver salt could have caused the phenomenon.” (Brian Boldman, “Angel Hair Physical Analyses: A Review,” JUFOS 9 (2006): 103–104)

October 13 — In his syndicated column, [Joseph Alsop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Alsop&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923551415&usg=AOvVaw3X-4xhG6toLsNtO6JuuUVV) goes so far as to describe “classified intelligence” as placing the Soviet missile count as high as 1,500 by 1963, and the US will have only 130 at that time. (Joseph Alsop, “[True](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94633531/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923551640&usg=AOvVaw0e_Uj7VWKYZtrMH9Ze5DCu) [Missile Gap Picture Belies Pentagon Response,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94633531/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923551838&usg=AOvVaw2g0ieLJTklTMdJOqaWi2sl)” Eugene (Oreg.) Register-Guard, October 13, 1959, p. 10)

October 22 — Night. Three witnesses are driving through Cumberland, Maryland, when they see a metallic disc emitting a bluish-green light around its edge. The driver abruptly stops, but leaves the car running. Suddenly the object drops down to 50 feet altitude and hovers 100 feet away in front of the car, making a humming vibration. As two of the witnesses open the door to get out, the car engine, lights, and radio fail. Shortly afterward, the disc shoots straight up, then forward, makes a 90° angle, then disappears in clouds. The car begins functioning normally

* * *

again. (Newark (Md.) Evening News, November 5, 1959; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923552461&usg=AOvVaw31NLju8hPIuxjlSvFsvOfM), pp. 67–68; Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 104–105)

Late October — 6:55 p.m. Electrician Gideon Johansson is at home in Mariannelund, Småland, Sweden, when there is a power failure. He goes outside to look at the power lines when he bumps into his son Rolf, who points out a brilliant white object hovering above a three-story building. The object descends slowly and appears to be heading toward Johansson’s garden. The machine oscillates three times and smashes into the top of a maple tree, descends through the branches and hovers about 18 inches above the ground. Only about 10 feet away, Johansson can see the object has a large window, through which two entities are visible. Their heads have high crown and they have big, friendly eyes. They have mall mouths and pointed chins and are wearing white uniforms with broad black belts. One seems to be working at an instrument panel. They are only the size of a 14-year-old. Soon the object moves up and shoots away in a flash. Glassy deposits are found on some power lines in addition to the damaged tree, and Johansson gets prickly pains in his lower body. (Anders Liljegren, “[Mariannelund UFO and Occupants,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923552945&usg=AOvVaw2TCFHygu8waIDT6E1lrVKm)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1970): 14–17)

October 31 — Soviet Col. [Georgy Mosolov](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgy_Mosolov&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923553309&usg=AOvVaw3V0lq3MG55cIw_0IK4c6bf) reaches an airspeed record of 1,484 mph in a Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-21 over the Soviet Union. (Wikipedia, “[Georgy Mosolov](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgy_Mosolov&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923553540&usg=AOvVaw3-sNkux-QlIfbVLXrzocPW)”)

November — A full-scale mockup of the A-12 is shipped to Area 51 in Nevada for radar signature testing by EG&G. (Peter W. Merlin, “[Groom Lake Timeline: The First Fifty Years,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://area51specialprojects.com/area51_timeline.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923553867&usg=AOvVaw2oDeRTiHjHXg8qlGhMWn-A)” Secret Heroes, November 10, 2021)

November 2 — 12:00 noon. A substance described as angel hair falls from two UFOs seen in Evora, Portugal, and is collected and analyzed under a microscope by a school director, Dr. Amaral, and later by armed forces technicians and scientists at the University of Lisbon. The scientists conclude that the substance is produced by a small insect or some strange kind of single-celled organism about 4 millimeters in length. (Hayley Price, “[Evora Angel Hair,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufoweeklynews.com/ufo-sightings/evora-angel-hair&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923554273&usg=AOvVaw3sI2CgtZrbAfei4lXlR4mj)” UFO Weekly News; Nicole Guardiola, “[An Extraterrestrial Living Being, Captured and Studied Eighteen Years](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://caballodetroy.medium.com/an-extraterrestrial-living-being-captured-and-studied-eighteen-years-ago-222dfa7bfe78&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923554557&usg=AOvVaw3cyT23fXlcqZFfSzp1TwiO) [Ago,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://caballodetroy.medium.com/an-extraterrestrial-living-being-captured-and-studied-eighteen-years-ago-222dfa7bfe78&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923554849&usg=AOvVaw21nsi9aHwLka6h5_dYtKQR)” translated from El País, October 13, 1978)

November 8 — A large, luminous object is seen moving at great speed over Kandahar, Afghanistan, to the northwest. Shortly afterward it explodes with a loud roar in nearby mountains, causing some slight earth tremors. Possible Russian missile test. (Good Above, [p. 308](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/308/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923555257&usg=AOvVaw06f9kPoVo1YE2ky-2ceu8d))

November 10 — Requests to transfer responsibility for UFO investigations from ATIC to ARDC are sent to Maj. Gen.

[Charles B. Dougher](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107232/major-general-charles-b-dougher/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923555613&usg=AOvVaw033nz2Xlus-CqfSwCzyVkY) (ATIC commander), Col. Philip G. Evans (ATIC Deputy for Sciences and Components), and Maj. Gen. [James H. Walsh](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105288/major-general-james-h-walsh/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923555899&usg=AOvVaw0O5kpWD9Vu5IIjKR0k_ZPa) (AF Assistant Chief of Staff for Intelligence). (“[Saucer Reading Fest,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/saucsum13.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923556194&usg=AOvVaw2KwOMwt1fWC0t1szFnEaQ3)” Saturday Night Uforia, January 25, 2019)

November 12 — The first completely free flight of an Avrocar takes place. This test proves the nozzle control system unacceptable. (Wikipedia, “[Avro Canada VZ-9 Avrocar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avro_Canada_VZ-9_Avrocar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923556510&usg=AOvVaw3xhWMPaWJq_RHIi1ZwQQoO)”)

November 16 — 8:00 p.m. Czech Air Force officer Commander Duchoň is driving with another officer named Bezák to a Czechoslovakian airfield \[now in the Czech Republic\] to supervise night-flying exercises. At about 6 miles from the airfield, the car engine begins to stall. Suddenly they see a light sapphire-colored band moving at high speed at an altitude of 1,600–2,600 feet. It is completely silent. Some minutes later they are able to start the car again.

Personnel at the airfield tell them they had seen a flaming ball that rotated, made a 90° turn, and passed over the airfield again. The tower tracks the object on radar at an altitude of 3,000 feet during its second pass. The object is about 500 feet in diameter with a glowing ring around it. (“[Saucers and the Iron Curtain: A Report from](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1960%252CJul-Aug%252CV%25206%252CN%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923557156&usg=AOvVaw1ZO7GBQWNoMqhZkn6EXIcF) [Czechoslovakia,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1960%252CJul-Aug%252CV%25206%252CN%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923557390&usg=AOvVaw16mZx4m_cpSBsNlSDcT9z4)” Flying Saucer Review 6, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1960): 31–32)

November 19 — [Otis T. Carr](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otis_T._Carr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923557732&usg=AOvVaw1FfVdIcdOOW36wTZZy-AKf) is convicted in federal court of selling unregistered securities to [Gurney G. Warnberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/80077817/gurney-g-warnberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923558123&usg=AOvVaw1DqfHLd653Fs36o8aXhXVB)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/80077817/gurney-g-warnberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923558368&usg=AOvVaw23iZDM_mZIFrgigZpz6uCP) a pilot and railroad man in Yukon, Oklahoma, and fined $5,000. Unable to pay, Carr works off his fine in jail at a dollar a day. (Clark III 861)

December — The new edition of [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923558892&usg=AOvVaw21Bv-p32rg7OuBmygD9Sir)’s The Report on Unidentified Flying Objects is published with three new UFO debunking chapters, the last of which is completely different in tone from the rest of the book. He claims there is no Air Force secrecy on UFOs and NICAP is just a bunch of grandstanding nuts. (Clark III 1024; Michael Hall and Wendy Connors, “The Forgotten Letters of Edward J. Ruppelt,” IUR 24, no. 4 (Winter 1999): 20–26, 30, 32;

Swords 301)

December — The London UFO Research Organisation is founded by Paul Teugells, Nigel Stephenson, Susanne Stebbing, and Roy Stemman, and begins publishing a monthly magazine, LUFORO Bulletin. ([LUFORO Newsletter](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520Kingdom/BUFORA%2520-%25201959-1963%2520LUFORO%2520BULLETIN%2520Vols.1%2520to%25204/LUFORO%2520Bulletin%2520-%2520Vol%25201%2520No%252001%2520-%25201st%2520Dec%25201959.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923560034&usg=AOvVaw3PiCWis584Omb9pCnoMT9d)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520Kingdom/BUFORA%2520-%25201959-1963%2520LUFORO%2520BULLETIN%2520Vols.1%2520to%25204/LUFORO%2520Bulletin%2520-%2520Vol%25201%2520No%252001%2520-%25201st%2520Dec%25201959.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923560464&usg=AOvVaw1INHJd1ioGjmLh6h3SOTGL) no. 1 (December 1959))

December — Project Space Track moves to a new building in Cambridge, Massachusetts, the National Space Surveillance Control Center (NSSCC), which is formally dedicated on February 9, 1960. The NSSCC is part of the Air Force

* * *

Command and Control Development Division, Air Research and Development Command. Harold O. Curtis of Lincoln Laboratory is the director of the NSSCC. (Wikipedia, “[Project Space Track](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Space_Track&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923561418&usg=AOvVaw0K12k93VsHa2WiPji3c_o8)”)

December — 5:45 a.m. Larry Jensen is driving to work on US Highway 99 near Proberta, California, when his radio begins making “snapping” noises, and his lights dim. He pulls over to the side of the road and gets out to check his headlights, which he finds are shining feebly. He notices a huge, bright, bluish-green, crescent-shaped object hovering about 60 feet above the road a quarter of a mile behind him. It appears to be 80–90 feet across and 15– 20 feet thick. Suddenly and inexplicably, he finds his clothes are soaked and he feels an alarming feeling as if he is getting crushed inside. He also feels as if he is being sucked up into the object. He grabs for a car door, then collides with a side mirror and staggers backward, but manages to get inside. Looking out the right-door window, he sees the UFO a few miles away, heading northeast and climbing at a shallow angle over the Sierra foothills. It vanishes within 10 seconds. Jensen’s car lights come back on. He resumes driving, but 600 feet away is forced to stop because he smells burning rubber. The battery caps are blown out, and the battery is swollen out of shape, the generator is not working, and the armature and field wires have melted together. Later, he finds it odd that he has not encountered another single car during or after the episode. (Clark III 866; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Oct-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923562148&usg=AOvVaw0Ri0oTHT4Z_Eg7pKAosR08) [Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1959 October–December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Oct-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923562541&usg=AOvVaw3aLwWd4NOIbLCZ3kxbSgrw), The Author, 2000, pp. 56–59)

December 1 — At a NASA news conference in Washington, D.C., Cal Tech geochemist [Harrison Brown](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harrison_Brown&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923563051&usg=AOvVaw1sK26vssd4lXvnSpA04HKr) suggests that boneless animals similar to jellyfish abound in oceans on Venus. The speculation comes in the wake of the discovery that the planet’s atmosphere contains water vapor. (“[Scientist Says Jellyfish May Live on Venus,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/100914555/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923563434&usg=AOvVaw2G8NyQVRnv__2ddqZ6PR7m)” Wilmington (Del.) News Journal, December 2, 1959, p. 29)

December 2 — A bright, circular object is seen in the sky heading southwest over Ghazni, Afghanistan. It disappears after 2 minutes. (Good Above, [p. 308](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/308/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923564034&usg=AOvVaw1eL1fABxC13PeLtcTpobsq))

December 5 — After five flights, testing of the Avrocar is temporarily halted, by which time it has logged 18.5 hours of test time in total. (Wikipedia, “[Avro Canada VZ-9 Avrocar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avro_Canada_VZ-9_Avrocar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923564529&usg=AOvVaw2xTkWN2Z9OSk6HX-DOy2l2)”)

December 7 — Maj. Gen. [James H. Walsh](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105288/major-general-james-h-walsh/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923565024&usg=AOvVaw3tAIoLWXMBlKX4s5Hhqh9_) writes to Lt. Gen. [Bernard A. Schriever](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernard_Schriever&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923565395&usg=AOvVaw2ApMUwwkAqdq9YLLpOOBqN)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernard_Schriever&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923565616&usg=AOvVaw2gRiVj7TKDNT8ygW5BKbbt) commander of ARDC, regarding transfer of UFO duties. (“[Saucer Reading Fest,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/saucsum13.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923565997&usg=AOvVaw3Pst4WFo3yg0HnuToWCnfQ)” Saturday Night Uforia, January 25, 2019)

December 11 — A memo reaches CIA head [Allen Dulles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allen_Dulles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923566404&usg=AOvVaw3GJaYFSvvOpvhRFXJgEmOh)’s desk recommending the removal of [Fidel Castro](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fidel_Castro&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923566690&usg=AOvVaw3JdhKTmmsOyGLG7CVBuHe5). He sets the wheels in motion. ()

December 13 — Karl Lars Dersson is walking on the deck of the Danish tanker Dorthe Mærsk just north of La Orchila Island, Venezuela. He sees a brilliant cone-shaped object descending from the sky and alerts the crew. It gets brighter as it nears the surface of the Caribbean, and the crew hear a loud concussion as it enters the water. The surface becomes turbulent and brilliant with many colors. (Lorenzen, UFOs over the Americas, Signet, 1968, pp. 50–51)

December 13 — Early evening. A rocket project officer at Fort Bliss in El Paso, Texas, is out looking at the Moon with binoculars when a lighted object approaches the Moon very slowly in the six o’clock position. Once nearly in line with the lunar edge, it begins a precision journey, skirting the edge until it reaches three o’clock. It then leaves on a straight track directly away. During the observation, the man calls his wife and two neighbors to watch the performance. (Michael D. Swords, “Gazing at the Moons,” IUR 32, no. 4 (October 2009): 14–15)

December 15 — USAF Maj. [Joseph Rogers](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.arlingtoncemetery.net/jwrogersjr.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923567802&usg=AOvVaw3XfOAe-EIIrggQczTmRAat) attains an airspeed of 1,526 mph in a Convair F-106 Delta Dart at Edwards AFB, California. (Wikipedia, “[Convair F-106 Delta Dart](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Convair_F-106_Delta_Dart&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923568199&usg=AOvVaw3p63fiy7s_yMxV9FNe-xlz)”)

Late December — 10:00 p.m. Lorentz Johnsen sees a dark, silent object with a row of windows fly slowly by at an altitude of 500 feet, headed in the direction of Namsenfjorden, Trøndelag, Norway. It descends to about 160 feet, grows fiery red, then explodes with a crash and falls into the water. He says that it looks like a cover is torn off in one piece like a “curved sheet of metal.” (Ole Jonny Brænne, “Observations of Unidentified Submarine Objects in Norway,” IUR 20, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1995): 13)

December 24 — Maj. Gen. [Richard E. O’Keefe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106024/major-general-richard-j-okeefe/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923568658&usg=AOvVaw25XWBwcjLTa0sfO3_MfxHK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106024/major-general-richard-j-okeefe/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923568859&usg=AOvVaw07bpjw_y-lw6XGLw417m0v) acting inspector general of the Air Force, issues instructions pertaining to “UFO business” to every air base commander in the US. The document is not intended for public distribution, but NICAP obtains a copy. Across the top are the words “UFOs Serious Business.” It says that UFOs “must be rapidly and accurately identified as serious USAF business in the ZI \[Zone of Interior\]” and specifies that UFO investigators “should be equipped with binoculars, camera, Geiger counter, magnifying glass and have a source for containers in which to store samples.” O’Keefe asks that UFO explanations be “reasonable and knowledgeable.” (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1959 October–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Oct-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923569156&usg=AOvVaw1S6ZEWL0mhMgV7qFAzehZ_) [December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1959-Oct-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923569445&usg=AOvVaw3ET1P7bXkTgNPZIpSf2Wh2), The Author, 2000, pp. 61, 65–66; Swords 286; Good Need, [pp. 226](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/226/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923569789&usg=AOvVaw238hcdur0dXCuMftBhqNGL), [229](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/228/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923570008&usg=AOvVaw3k1d5H99dRFmGIqIjpbPzk))

* * *

1960

Early 1960 — Night. Vice Chief of Air Staff Gen. [Curtis LeMay](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curtis_LeMay&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923570520&usg=AOvVaw3mTzPLXob1QBk93VheOpOp) is conducting an exercise to test his bombers’ capability to penetrate US air space. An F-89J Scorpion jet instructor pilot and his radar observer, 1Lt. Joe Meyer, have just successfully intercepted a B-47 and are descending to land at James Connally AFB \[now TSTC Waco Airport\] near Waco, Texas. They notice a pinpoint of light at their level 12 miles away over Waco and decide to approach and attack it as if they are armed. As they approach on a collision course, they see the object has four bright blue- white lights on it and it is stationary. They estimate it is 25–30 feet in diameter. But the object shoots straight up at incredible speed before they reach it. They look up and see the object is bright blue white on its underside. It disappears at about 90,000 feet altitude. (“[Pilot Finally Reveals UFO Encounter,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Documents/Books%252C%2520Manuals%2520and%2520Published%2520Papers/Specialty%2520UFO%2520Publications/Personal%2520Collection%2520of%2520UFO%2520Publications/MUFON%2520Journals/1999/07/July%25201999.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923570993&usg=AOvVaw2JX-nBKDVIrsaZ0lGumNw4)” MUFON UFO Journal, no. 375 (July 1999): 17)

1960 — [Jim Lorenzen](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://robert-barrow.blogspot.com/2007/05/remembering-coral-lorenzen.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923571459&usg=AOvVaw0sIUlwfvvDNJGTi4S9TIAb) is hired as senior technical associate with the Kitt Peak National Observatory, so he and [Coral](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://robert-barrow.blogspot.com/2007/05/remembering-coral-lorenzen.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923571724&usg=AOvVaw3FjNICP1qtK0zn-064oTpD) move to Tucson, Arizona, from Alamogordo, New Mexico. On their third day in Tucson, an “exterminator” visits them, offering to inspect their rented premises for free. He fails to mention the name of his company, nor does he seem interested in his occupation. He talks with Coral about their reason for moving, where Jim is employed, and UFOs. (Clark III 50; Lorenzen, Encounters with UFO Occupants, Berkley Medallion, 1976, pp. 3, 251)

1960 — [Brinsley Le Poer Trench,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brinsley_Le_Poer_Trench%252C_8th_Earl_of_Clancarty&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923572196&usg=AOvVaw3xyVTq08WccsfmuwP0SPQ6) 8th Earl of Clancarty, publishes The Sky People, in which he claims that [Adam and](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adam_and_Eve&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923572496&usg=AOvVaw2cw6KeCgOzfZ_4EO5vBQjM) [Eve,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adam_and_Eve&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923572662&usg=AOvVaw3jmuQxm5ucGY75jYVpfBg5) [Noah,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noah&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923572838&usg=AOvVaw04NXGtCZpGQE88n4Dw2T9q) and many other characters in the Bible originally lived on Mars. Trench believes that Adam and

Eve were experimental creations of extraterrestrials. The biblical description of the Garden of Eden is inconsistent with what Earth is like, and because Mars contains canals, the Garden of Eden must have been located on Mars.

He further claims that the north polar ice cap melted on Mars, causing the descendants of Adam and Eve to move to Earth. The Book of Genesis is a symbolic version of what actually happened to groups of people on Mars, he writes, with the Great Deluge referring to the flooding of Atlantis and Lemuria, which were populated with Adamic migrants. (Brinsley Le Poer Trench, [The Sky People](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/skypeople00lepo&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923573692&usg=AOvVaw1cuYkW_t8Jf51WDAf-1Y07)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/skypeople00lepo&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923573850&usg=AOvVaw348cvg_f37GLagy1Pai5eq) Spearman, 1960; Jerome Clark, “Vimanas Have Landed: Ancient Astronautics in Ufology,” IUR 22, no. 3 (Fall 1997): 26–27)

1960 — Contactee [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923574260&usg=AOvVaw0UC1aIAzB5gO5yoxvZlOZa) legally changes his name to Michel d’Obrenovic, said to reflect an ancestral connection to the throne of Serbia. However, John Griffin says the real reason is that Williamson’s sensational claims have rendered his anthropological work (such as it is) completely unacceptable. (Clark III 1287; Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, pp. 119–124)

1960 — Night. During a pause in army maneuvers near Brno \[now in the Czech Republic\], soldiers see a peculiarly colored light above the city. After hovering a while, it vanishes but reappears in another part of the sky. Their commanding officer tells them to look at it with binoculars and check the radar. Headquarters sends up interceptors to chase the object, but every time one of them gets near, the light disappears from the radar screen, only to turn up elsewhere. The incident goes on for an hour before the light disappears for good. (Hobana and Weverbergh 90)

1960 — The invention of transponders that transmit an electronic identification signal from aircraft to ground control helps to further reduce clutter on air traffic control radars. This means that “aerial phenomena” appear on radar only if they intrude on flight paths and create a near miss of the type investigated by the Civil Aviation Authority. (David Clarke, “Gremlins and Black Projects,” Fortean Times 291 (August 2012): 26–27; National Air Traffic Controllers Association, [A History of Air Traffic Control](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.natca.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/NATCA_ATC_History.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923574880&usg=AOvVaw1id5yv_MjdTrKkMJzesGKI), 2019)

January — The first issue of the Australian Flying Saucer Review is published jointly by the Victorian Flying Saucer Research Society and UFOIC, edited by Peter E. Norris and [Andrew P. Tomas](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_Tomas&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923575300&usg=AOvVaw1LGuHrn3roLu3LLqb_A81B)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_Tomas&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923575428&usg=AOvVaw0gHiJYDsoe4qy_ZoQ17_3x) It will continue until December 1972, various issues confusingly sponsored by each group, plus the Queensland Flying Saucer Research Bureau and the renamed Victorian UFO Research Society. ([Australian Flying Saucer Review](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Australia/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review%2520-%25201960%252001%2520-%2520vol%25201%2520no%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923575688&usg=AOvVaw1RhDt9_VRg01xbqH3F8Orv) 1, no. 1 (January 1960))

January — Tests continue with a slightly modified Avrocar. (Wikipedia, “[Avro Canada VZ-9 Avrocar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avro_Canada_VZ-9_Avrocar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923576164&usg=AOvVaw3zZanDs7KkvtGRFedVu_Rl)”)

January 18 — 10:45 p.m. Leo Haley and Bert C. Baker are driving on US Highway 2, some 9 miles west of Lakota, North Dakota, when the headlights dim just as a brilliant green flash lights up the sky. In a field to the north about 1 mile away they can see a 5–6 foot crescent-shaped object with a 9-foot exhaust tail. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923576500&usg=AOvVaw33d8h33m48ghV2ydtBqsX6), p. 69)

January 26 — [Richard Bissell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_M._Bissell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923576883&usg=AOvVaw1fPRbFnUSFMRB6vYJXeG-q) notifies [Kelly Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kelly_Johnson_(engineer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923577118&usg=AOvVaw092sLoIR6_oPQY68WR5Rya) that the CIA is authorizing the delivery of 12 A-12 aircraft that will be five times faster than the U-2 and fly three miles higher. Skunk Works will move into production at Area 51 in Nevada to work on Project Oxcart. (Wikipedia, “[Lockheed A-12](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_A-12&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923577368&usg=AOvVaw0MPEq61-CJ4yVGEHJ_VA5v)”; Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 134–135](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/134/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923577587&usg=AOvVaw2tC6QhGZt3G3BQz9FjCAaa)) ()

February — The US Navy reportedly detects a “dark satellite” thought to be a Soviet spy satellite in orbit. However, a follow-up article alleges that the object was “the remains of an Air Force Discoverer VIII satellite that had gone

* * *

astray.” (“[Trackers Spot Mystery Object Orbiting Earth,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP83-01022R000100230012-6.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923578054&usg=AOvVaw3OuriELQqaty8mxvrI07ja)” Washington (D.C.) Evening Star, February 11, 1960; Wikipedia, “[Corona (satellite)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CORONA_(satellite)%23Discoverer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923578377&usg=AOvVaw0zfxscL6pEEHVQ0IqbRCvE)”)

February 5 — The office of the AF Chief of Intelligence is informed of ARDC’s rejection (by Maj. Gen. [James Ferguson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Ferguson_(general)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923578626&usg=AOvVaw2CrAKvSA615_CZo1DTGucZ)) of the ATIC proposal. (“[Saucer Reading Fest,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/saucsum13.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923578855&usg=AOvVaw28kzAr8bvwAJd5HHVvcdOW)” Saturday Night Uforia, January 25, 2019)

February 5 — 11:15 p.m. Many people see a distinctly round UFO hover and maneuver slowly over or near the intersection of Sunset Boulevard and La Brea Avenue in Hollywood, California. Cars are stopped bumper-to- bumper, according to employees of several businesses around the intersection, with people gaping at the object overhead. Persons on hotel and apartment rooftops go out to see a bright “cherry-red, circular light.” Two service- station attendants at the intersection, Jerry Darr and Charles Walker, say that “hundreds of people saw it— everybody was looking” as the light hovers for at least 5 minutes over a busy drive-in. Pen Meyer, another service station attendant a third of a mile to the north, watches it hovering for about 10 minutes. Harold Sherman, his wife, and two others watch it as it resumes motion very slowly eastward. After proceeding east for a distance of a block or two, it veers southeastward and passes out of sight. No sound is heard over street-noise background. (Los Angeles NICAP Subcommittee case files; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23cities&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923579217&usg=AOvVaw2mwvXEz1ymkeRz7KoM7jhm)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 54–57)

February 6 — 11:15 p.m. The red object reappears over Hollywood, California, this time about one block further east, above Sunset Boulevard and Sycamore Avenue. A number of witnesses observe it hovering for about 10 minutes at an altitude of 500–600 feet. Then with a loud explosion it emits a brilliant bluish-white flash that extends downward and to the west, lighting up the ground all around La Brea Avenue. A mushroom-shaped cloud appears and dissipates. As the red light is extinguished, an object described by most witnesses as long, tubular, and about 70 feet long shoots upwards. A few seconds later, the red light appears about 1,000 feet above Sunset and La Brea for about 8 minutes. It then begins drifting slowly eastward, turns sharply toward the north-northeast, accelerates and climbs steeply, not stopping again until it is at a very high altitude well to the north. (Los Angeles NICAP Subcommittee case file; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23cities&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923579684&usg=AOvVaw0WqElwHAiKyUdm9IWNP3Mo)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 54–57)

February 17 — [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923580027&usg=AOvVaw0yu24qAgGQ-PLZlE9piNJc) writes to Brig. Gen. [Benjamin G. Holzman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/108142/brigadier-general-benjamin-g-holzman/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923580364&usg=AOvVaw0uP7QlmEC4fz0d7MWCfjP7) at ARDC in the hopes of interesting him in assessing UFO reports. (“[Saucer Reading Fest,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/saucsum13.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923580644&usg=AOvVaw3TMcgHXyJLrzHSCw-0xTRh)” Saturday Night Uforia, January 25, 2019)

February 27 —NICAP sends photocopies of [O’Keefe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106024/major-general-richard-j-okeefe/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923580950&usg=AOvVaw2shdjZteHLsJ8GFjKR7dRe)’s 1959 “UFOs Serious Business” memo to the media and to committees in the House and Senate, calling for congressional hearings. NICAP Board member Rear Adm. [Roscoe Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923581170&usg=AOvVaw1P26RjfmRsbOaE6bSFpnkV) adds a statement: “Behind the scenes, high-ranking AF officers are soberly concerned about the UFOs. But through official secrecy \[AFR 200-2\] and ridicule, many citizens are led to believe the unknown flying objects are nonsense.” NICAP board member [Albert Baller](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Baller.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923581414&usg=AOvVaw14jTq9-C6cAst-poBIzk7K) writes: “If the UFOs are believed a threat, it would seem incumbent on the armed forces to waste no time in alerting the people. Any sudden, hostile act against a nation left in relative ignorance could have serious consequences.” (“[UFO Warning Issued: Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/28102136/lincoln-journal-star/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923581676&usg=AOvVaw0coMnrzwUhyjNHbQKOXWn5) [Objects ‘Now Serious Business,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/28102136/lincoln-journal-star/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923581876&usg=AOvVaw1W_zJnbulDGFqTWb6ZVe23)” Lincoln (Neb.) Journal Star, February 27, 1960, p. 1; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923582138&usg=AOvVaw0EnATHb0zG3JzQO9U7YDBY) [Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: January–June 1960](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923582324&usg=AOvVaw3WtpMq5yhsxUfnkIbRY0mh), The Author, 2003, p. 37)

March — The Ottawa Flying Saucer Club begins publishing Topside, edited by [Wilbert B. Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923582684&usg=AOvVaw0hfBK-UNurPSbw9w0mXmVL) until 1962. It continues until winter 1971. ([Topside](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Canada/Topside%2520(Wilbert%2520B%2520Smith)/Topside%2520-%2520Issue%252001%2520-%25201960%2520March.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923582947&usg=AOvVaw2WO3kHShst_r3PuXSZO5h_)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Canada/Topside%2520(Wilbert%2520B%2520Smith)/Topside%2520-%2520Issue%252001%2520-%25201960%2520March.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923583135&usg=AOvVaw1eB0sKUeSeIRaBquM0GtCl) no. 1 (March 1960))

March 6 — 5:15–5:27 a.m. Photographer Esse Jansson of Norrtälje, Sweden, goes out early in the morning to try to take a photo of an unidentified satellite, termed 1960 Alpha \[however, the designation of 1960 Alpha 1 is reserved for the Pioneer 5 space probe, which isn’t launched until March 11\], “which was expected to pass the Stockholm latitude in a southerly direction about 0525 hours.” He sees two objects that come from the north and move in a southeasterly direction. They are similar to phenomena he has seen before, but these objects reverse direction completely. One of his plates shows a third object. The CIA takes note of this and another mystery satellite viewed by a Swedish airplane and reported in Dagens Nyheter, March 8. (Central Intelligence Agency, “[UFO’s](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/DOC_0000015447.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923583553&usg=AOvVaw3L04QJhgexiaY9RJGaYk0d) [Sighted, Photographed in Sweden; Unidentified Satellite Seen,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/DOC_0000015447.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923583723&usg=AOvVaw0baGxdRCOknPUd18kbyO8X)” FDD Note 1107, March 17, 1960)

March 8 — [Holzman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/108142/brigadier-general-benjamin-g-holzman/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923584052&usg=AOvVaw3uh8gnL9KAp-EBIwN3DB5d) forwards [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923584290&usg=AOvVaw3jPcVfMTdabuluJb4Y_3kq)’s letter up the chain of command. (“[Saucer Reading Fest,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/saucsum13.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923584511&usg=AOvVaw140hAsUm4b2OKt2dBgt6jH)” Saturday Night Uforia, January 25, 2019)

March 17 — President [Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923584759&usg=AOvVaw3xGlLB6hHBW7U7OVv8Pift) signs off on a CIA paper titled “A Program of Covert Action against the Castro Regime.” The order gives the agency authorization to create an organization of exiled Cubans to manage opposition programs, begin a propaganda offensive to draw support for the movement, create an intelligence gathering network inside Cuba, and develop a paramilitary force to be introduced into Cuba to organize, train, and lead resistance groups against the Castro regime. Its budget is $4.4 million. Under the Cuban Project and under

* * *

the direction of CIA Directorate for Plans [Richard M. Bissell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_M._Bissell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923585140&usg=AOvVaw0ckTg23fNWmm2N5Ep1iKVE), MKUltra’s [Sidney Gottlieb](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidney_Gottlieb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923585330&usg=AOvVaw0vU8pcLiqxnO8BDClcG-9j) proposes spraying [Fidel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fidel_Castro&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923585510&usg=AOvVaw3STQmKczoThzvmd7ASkwXe) [Castro](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fidel_Castro&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923585658&usg=AOvVaw0FKwOjFdLzOIJsUe2_2_n1)’s television studio with LSD and saturating his shoes with thallium to make his beard fall out. Gottlieb also hatches schemes to assassinate Castro, including the use of a poisoned cigar, a poisoned wetsuit, an exploding conch shell, and a poisonous fountain pen. (Wikipedia, “[Sidney Gottlieb](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidney_Gottlieb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923585866&usg=AOvVaw2-EFCi_SpR4MosQHAQK6H2)”; Kris Hollington, [Wolves, Jackals, and](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/wolvesjackalsfox00holl/page/n7/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923586039&usg=AOvVaw25vdo7yLCYxig3U7jks8AO) [Foxes: The Assassins Who Changed History](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/wolvesjackalsfox00holl/page/n7/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923586238&usg=AOvVaw1ntVVJ3ZFsA0PvU42VfggF)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/wolvesjackalsfox00holl/page/n7/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923586375&usg=AOvVaw0nxjc78VSNRcm0WOJ1UDf7) St. Martin’s, 2008; Wikipedia, “[Operation Mongoose](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Mongoose&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923586653&usg=AOvVaw3giAVqUTKvX4n3_8fdNOA9)”)

March 24 — Two policemen are in the vicinity of Lambert–St. Louis International Airport in Missouri, one on the north side, the other on the south side. A bright light illuminates the entire area. Three objects in a V-formation whisk overhead. They are round, white, and 9 feet in diameter. (Swords 293)

April 8 — Project Ozma, set up only a few days earlier by [Frank Drake](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Drake&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923587276&usg=AOvVaw3j--G-Jtc8xSTg3ZBZkUOM) at the National Radio Astronomy Observatory at Green Bank, West Virginia, seems to hit paydirt. As he slews his antenna off Tau Ceti and onto Epsilon Eridani, Drake is greeted with a strong, periodic, pulsed signal on 1420 MHz, the hyperfine transition emission line of interstellar hydrogen atoms proposed for SETI by [Giuseppe Cocconi](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giuseppe_Cocconi&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923587634&usg=AOvVaw2frGrCsn_RfiD91gkEFFm0) and [Philip Morrison](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philip_Morrison&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923587978&usg=AOvVaw2JarmB0TKKRRlU7kzaUqwY), and still favored as a promising hailing frequency for interstellar communications. Drake is ready with a second, low-gain antenna. The pulses are there as well, sadly disproving their extraterrestrial origin. But they are not exactly terrestrial interference, either. The rate at which the phantom signal traverses the sky suggests that it is emanating from an aircraft cruising at unprecedented altitude—perhaps 80,000 feet. At the time, no known aircraft can reach the stratosphere. Such an aircraft, as it happens, doesn’t “come into existence” until the following month, when [Francis Gary Powers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Gary_Powers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923588373&usg=AOvVaw0ITOnoy6nAq58d9w8K2tMb) is shot down over the Soviet Union. (Drake wisely decides to withhold publication of this positive result, so he never does receive proper credit for “discovering” the U-2.) The project only lasts through July. (Wikipedia, “[Project Ozma](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Ozma&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923588739&usg=AOvVaw1mx0MiFETQGHHE419vQvQt)”; H. Paul Shuch, “[Project Ozma: The Birth of Observational SETI,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/h.-paul-shuch-searching-for-extraterrestrial-intelligence-seti-past-present-and-future/page/13/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923589160&usg=AOvVaw201M9RC8MoatQmgXMJYw9G)” in Searching for Extraterrestrial Intelligence, Springer, 2011, pp. 13–18; Seth Shostak, “[Project Ozma,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.seti.org/project-ozma&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923589580&usg=AOvVaw1VzSfRqD2N4RMtWuVVbM5e)” SETI Institute, July 2021)

April 9 — The U-2 spy plane piloted by [Francis Gary Powers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Gary_Powers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923589998&usg=AOvVaw2fbT1I98JydO1zsLiiaRPm) crosses into the Soviet Union from Pakistan and flies over the Semipalatinsk Test Site in Kazakhstan; the Dolon Air Base in Semey, Kazakhstan; a SAM test site near Saryshagan, Kazakhstan; and the Baikonur Cosmodrome near Tyuratam, Kazakhstan. The plane is detected by Soviet Air Defense Forces but avoids intercepts by a MiG-19 and a Su-9. Powers lands at an Iranian airstrip at Zahedan. A 1994 CIA monograph by Gerald K. Haines, “CIA’s Role in the Study of UFOs, 1947–90,” claims that “According to later estimates from CIA officials who worked on the U-2 project and the Oxcart (SR-71, or Blackbird) project, over half of all UFO reports from the late 1950s through the 1960s were accounted for by manned reconnaissance flights (namely the U-2) over the United States.” (Wikipedia, “[1960 U-2 incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1960_U-2_incident&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923590505&usg=AOvVaw3Ap0TqI2_KlAOm8QYZcTwj)”; Gerald K. Haines, “[CIA’s Role in the Study of UFOs, 1947–90,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/static/105bd8290b90de13ee136fecc9fe863f/cia-role-study-UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923590864&usg=AOvVaw1gpXmnvbvQCpDFO-G2Wp7z)” Studies in Intelligence 40, no. 5 (1997): 67–84)

April 30 — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923591414&usg=AOvVaw1v0oPSpLHV6RLxtPVHAyrr) appears on [Long John Nebel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_John_Nebel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923591759&usg=AOvVaw2HT6QFsmi2cp_UVO7IJnp1)’s late-night TV show on WOR. (“[Long John Nebel, The Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3D_jclUlNXAhA&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923592081&usg=AOvVaw1gh_owtGtDs1Ta-v9EfR_b) [Saucer Story (George Adamski interview),](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3D_jclUlNXAhA&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923592370&usg=AOvVaw0Ke1DVXwAyfr_pGn3X2vz3)” ThriftStoreVinyl YouTube channel, September 4, 2018; “[Final](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/final-years/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923592667&usg=AOvVaw25JZh_lY3GIvrs2PCyVphP) [Years,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/final-years/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923592980&usg=AOvVaw3wwGqlP-aYU209vKhvW1_w)” The Adamski Case, June 11, 2009)

May — The CIA begins to recruit anti-Castro Cuban exiles in the Miami, Florida, area. Infantry training is carried out at a CIA-run base that is code-named JM Trax near Retalhuleu in the Sierra Madre mountains of Guatemala. (Wikipedia, “[Brigade 2506](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brigade_2506&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923593471&usg=AOvVaw3N8LxN6eCQu53ybMZKkbnT)”)

May 1 — 6:26 a.m. A US U-2 spy plane, flown by CIA pilot [Francis Gary Powers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Gary_Powers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923593894&usg=AOvVaw0TcGeyi8nbBEuXyJoBHEoj)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Gary_Powers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923594105&usg=AOvVaw3mlI3ncPIlzsPpSofaviT2) takes off from Peshawar, Pakistan, and performs photographic aerial reconnaissance over Baikonur, Kazakhstan, and Chelyabinsk, Russia. Powers has orders to continue across Siberia to get a look at the new Plesetsk Cosmodrome, but at 8:53 a.m. local time he is hit by an S-75 Dvina (SA-2 Guideline) surface-to-air missile fired by a defense battalion near Kyshtym, Russia.

The U-2 crashes near Sverdlovsk \[now Yekaterinburg\]. The Soviet Air Defense Forces have anticipated the flight and give orders to “attack the violator.” Powers parachutes safely and is captured. This is the first time in five years of overflights that the US is caught. (Wikipedia, “[1960 U-2 incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1960_U-2_incident&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923594568&usg=AOvVaw0RB8M61BvVlepXDcLxe158)”)

May 5 — NASA issues a press release saying a weather research aircraft has “gone missing” north of Turkey and speculates that the pilot has fallen unconscious and the plane has crashed. Under the impression that the pilot has died and that the plane has been destroyed, a U-2 plane is quickly painted in NASA colors and a photo is shown to the media at NASA Flight Research Center \[now the Armstrong Flight Research Center\] at Edwards Air Force Base in California. Premier [Nikita Khrushchev](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nikita_Khrushchev&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923595071&usg=AOvVaw1nHrT1470FjrtydeR_4eaf) announces the shoot-down to the Soviet parliament but does not reveal yet that the pilot has survived. (NASA, “[U-2,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nasa.gov/centers/dryden/multimedia/imagegallery/U-2/U-2_proj_desc.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923595485&usg=AOvVaw14nrFl8YALdSqAnjxj7tQN)” September 4, 1997)

May 7 — [Khrushchev](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nikita_Khrushchev&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923595887&usg=AOvVaw1vJ9Q9-pCrs-hd30VmY01g) now reveals to the Soviet parliament that [Powers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Gary_Powers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923596268&usg=AOvVaw0wzucJt9jhQvQS_3hljZ2x) is alive and much of the U-2 technologies have survived the crash. ()

May 9 — Director of Central Intelligence [Allen Dulles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allen_Dulles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923596703&usg=AOvVaw1lfQV6hhAicBPjTMaAiu17) tells Congress that all U-2 flights are used for aerial espionage and are flown pursuant to “presidential directives.” ()

* * *

May 10 — House Appropriations Chair [Clarence Cannon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clarence_Cannon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923597358&usg=AOvVaw3xpJ0YpIGLVdvi1OOzg2Z6) (D-Mo.) reveals to the press that the U-2 is a CIA plane engaged in aerial espionage over the Soviet Union “under the aegis” of the president. The press begins to suggest that [Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923597675&usg=AOvVaw2vJxxCM1c9hYPWjjPcoald) has lost control of the intelligence agencies. (Wikipedia, “[1960 U-2 incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1960_U-2_incident&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923598001&usg=AOvVaw0ETxvGL3kxmz9G85GJumNM)”)

May 13 — 7:00 p.m. More than 100 people at Paracuru, Ceará, Brazil, watch a disc-shaped UFO. Flying about 600 feet in the air at low speed, the silent object maneuvers over the downtown area or a long time. About 60 feet in diameter, it hovers at an angle by a church. A strong bluish light is on top of it. The same day, 20 cities and towns in Céara state, four in Rio Grande do Norte, three in Pernambuco, two in Paraíba, two in Bahia, and one each in the states of Piauí and Maranhão report UFO sightings. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp.

220–221; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: January–June 1960](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923598695&usg=AOvVaw0vQ1AaL1wr51FaIFXcAg7s), The Author, 2003, pp. 92–93)

May 14 — 4:00 a.m. Fisherman Raimundo Ursulino dos Santos sees two metallic discs landed on a sandy hill by the beach at Paracuru, Ceará, Brazil. As he approaches, he sees two humanlike beings outside, talking to each other. They are small and pallid. One is dressed in a blue suit with a helmet. Dos Santos turns and runs away. Marks in the sand are found later. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: January–June](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923599191&usg=AOvVaw0OPOrvQTNBPj-ENZVoBsLX) [1960](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923599555&usg=AOvVaw369fOkwegwBb73g1HRcQIa)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923599842&usg=AOvVaw1RdbI3gX4NCE7wEUJtdhg5) The Author, 2003, p. 93; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1960-05-14-brazil-paracuru.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923600258&usg=AOvVaw2ofpRJo12hGLYnj8BE7uAh)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1960-05-14-brazil-paracuru.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923600517&usg=AOvVaw2I6O25cDlniQBkPLQJ9S2l) September 29, 2007)

May 19 — A silver-colored round object, 20–25 feet wide with hanging appendages, hovers 50–100 feet away from Indigenous observers in the village of Ekuk, Alaska, south of Dillingham. It barely clears electric wires 12 feet above the ground. It sucks up two empty five-gallon trashcans and drags them swirling along the ground. It flies between two houses and crosses to the other side of a ridge for 100 yards, drops the trashcans and sucks up some swirling grass, makes a loud sucking sound, then ascends rapidly. [Thomas M. Conrow](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/104848925/thomas-m_-conrow&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923601168&usg=AOvVaw28XlXYdpwZrVrhtL09eP8Z)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/104848925/thomas-m_-conrow&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923601454&usg=AOvVaw3y6SvnR5wGgTP-ENycjiyR) chief of intelligence at a nearby Air Force Base, interviews the witnesses and concludes that “there still appears to be no logical explanation of the sighting.” At Wright Patterson AFB, Blue Book analysts classify it as a “weather balloon with a radar reflector,” even though it is traveling against the wind. (Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 146–149](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/146/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923601889&usg=AOvVaw3KjKFKITKwRHL9PC84Bden); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923602195&usg=AOvVaw2fgjfwvx9QnQpD94TRyprI), p. 284; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: January–June 1960](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923602538&usg=AOvVaw03JTPX9AWWHMcxIJpwWRz4), The Author, 2003,

pp. 99–101)

May 22 — 9:33 a.m. An observatory on Majorca, Balearic Islands, Spain, sees a white, triangular object one-quarter the size of the moon spinning on its own axis and maintaining a steady course. It cables a report to NASA in Washington, D.C. (UFOEv, [p. 123](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D135%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923603179&usg=AOvVaw0Oo-hph0qEGQVvocYIeAli))

May 28 — Engineer [Ronald N. Bracewell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronald_N._Bracewell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923603573&usg=AOvVaw3QZ_kLokrBJZB-RUvItPca)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronald_N._Bracewell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923603785&usg=AOvVaw3EDo_3cMX67hs_3nZ16dZR) suggests that extraterrestrials may already be in our neighborhood through an autonomous interstellar space probe (now called a “Bracewell probe”) sent for the express purpose of communicating with alien civilizations. (Ronald N. Bracewell, “[Communications from Superior Galactic](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nature.com/articles/186670a0&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923604128&usg=AOvVaw2r17K8z7SXp2nVSCvL_fKh) [Communities,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nature.com/articles/186670a0&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923604425&usg=AOvVaw1UUnnKKsY-wTr3_Q4xWOk5)” Nature 186 (1960): 670–671)

Summer — 2:00 a.m. Two brothers are alerted by their journalist brother about an elusive UFO that local police in Walkerton, Ontario, have been pursuing for about an hour. They drive out along country roads until they get within 300 feet of the object, which is hovering around a large tree. The object is circular and apparently about 3 feet in diameter. It is very bright and changes color repeated. It then circles the tree purposefully for several minutes. The brothers climb a fence and approach it, but the UFO suddenly accelerates and disappears to the south. (J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 54–56](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/54/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923605061&usg=AOvVaw3fYIqpDngvJeDIVSSDqqKA))

June 1 — [Bulkley Griffin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62471784/bulkley-southworth-griffin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923605377&usg=AOvVaw0b48rAXA-tZbo8beNZ3JDG)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62471784/bulkley-southworth-griffin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923605570&usg=AOvVaw3NSaT8GG5OCamcQ0gFNtr9) chief of the Worcester (Mass.) Evening Gazette’s Washington, D.C., Bureau, writes a well- reasoned story about the Air Force’s unilateral control of UFO information and its national security implications. He quotes Adm. [Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923605895&usg=AOvVaw0QWcgvvFlNrFYqmm5lS53b)’s opinion that UFOs are intelligently controlled and are neither US nor USSR devices, which is why he is pushing for a Congressional investigation. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923606201&usg=AOvVaw3RbziEo3NaKd8P7MiDZIl9) [the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: January–June 1960](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923606534&usg=AOvVaw05VP6hctn30AWDmNITcx9Y), The Author, 2003, pp. 111–112)

June 12 — 3:00 or 4:00 p.m. Following a sonic boom above Quebec, a fiery object falls from the sky from an altitude of 1,000–2,000 feet and splits into two pieces that fall into the St. Lawrence River near Les Écureuils, about 20 miles upriver from Quebec City, Quebec. A beachcomber runs across the pieces, one closer to the shore and visible at low tide, the other one further out and mostly submerged. He retrieves a smaller piece (800 pounds) and sells it to a scrap-metal dealer, who fails to recognize it as ferrous and possibly ships it to Japan. The other piece is picked up by the Canadian Armament Research and Development Establishment \[now DRDC Valcartier\] near Quebec City. [Wilbert Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923607067&usg=AOvVaw1zPyDAB2aSkfLPOoL5nt_-)’s Ottawa Flying Saucer Club \[later the Ottawa New Sciences Club\] tells its members that the material is high-strength metal that is 6 feet in diameter and 2 feet thick at the center with an embedded tube, an “electronic potting can,” and a transistor. CARDE’s analysis is said to have revealed an alloy with a high manganese content, although it was identified as the “normal product of a foundry, consisting of slag with semi- molten scrap embedded in it,” likely coming from Sorel Iron Foundries in Sorel, Quebec. Smith rejects those findings and and conducts his own tests (although he is an electrical engineer and not a metallurgist) on a chunk

* * *

the club retrieves from the river around July 1, supposedly engaging in a “tremendous amount of detective work on this metal.” In November 1961, Smith tells Ohio UFO researchers C. W. Fitch and George Popovitch: “We are speculating that what we have is a portion of a very large device which came into this solar system…we don’t know when…but it had been in space a long time before it came to Earth; we can tell by the micrometeorites embedded in the surface. But we don’t know whether it was a few years ago—or a few hundred years ago.” In June 1968, the Colorado project’s [Roy Craig](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.iowastatedaily.com/news/ufo-investigator-isu-alumnus-dead/article_d3e1f4e4-28e6-5600-bff7-846c287c3b6b.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923607849&usg=AOvVaw2GLyNJb3CkhsRzY2HuBMYt) is in Ottawa and offers to examine the club’s chunk of metal because they had offered it to Condon a year earlier. Craig obligingly takes a piece with him but does not analyze it since there is no connection to a UFO and it looks like foundry slag anyway. Later, the Montreal UFO Society’s Ronald Anstee has a piece of it analyzed by an independent metallurgist, who finds that the composition “does not correspond to any known commercial manganese steel.” In September 1967, Eric Smith of the Canada Department of Energy, Mines, and Resources visits the Ottawa club and examines their large artifact, but fails to report back. In 1969, the National Research Council’s [Peter Millman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Millman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923608134&usg=AOvVaw3-4QyaFVuvSm86A-Se4J5b) takes a look and is convinced that it is ordinary manganese steel from the Sorel plant. June 22 — 6:20 p.m. John Person is setting up camp at Clan Lake, Northwest Territories, on a prospecting expedition and is waiting for his partner. He hears a noise like an aircraft approaching and something bounces and hits the surface of the lake about 1,700 feet behind him. Person sees an object 4–6 feet wide with arms or spokes is rotating rapidly in the water, but gradually slows down and stops spinning. When his partner arrives, they get into a canoe and travel to the impact area. They find an area of burned grass and another area where grass it cut up in small pieces. They use a pole to probe the lake bottom and find a channel that is one foot deeper at one end and three feet deeper at the other, RCMP Cpl. Matheson flies to the lake in a seaplane on July 19 and August 15 and finds the impact area as Person has described but no submerged object. (Royal Canadian Mounted Police, “[Report of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.bac-lac.gc.ca/eng/discover/unusual/ufo/Pages/GeoMaps.aspx%23nwt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923614958&usg=AOvVaw2VF9AM3g1FVQZD-GVuKvoM) [Strange Object Striking Clan Lake, Clan Lake Dist., N.W.T.,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.bac-lac.gc.ca/eng/discover/unusual/ufo/Pages/GeoMaps.aspx%23nwt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923615170&usg=AOvVaw1BbVBsL_3IJ8Od1tRVC9Tg)” July 19, July 25, and August 25, 1960; Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, pp. 98–102)

July — Members of the US Senate Preparedness Committee and the House Science and Astronautics Committee, as well as the CIA, ask for hearings on USAF’s handling of UFOs. (Clark III 922)

July 1 — 10:30 a.m. Four witnesses at the Leefe Mine in Lincoln County, Wyoming, see a shiny disc move in from the south and hover above a slag heap. It has a diameter of at least 185 feet and is 14 feet thick. Five transparent bubbles are visible on the bottom as it rocks gently before moving off to the south at high speed. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 221)

July 2 — Early morning. A couple driving in the vicinity of Kankakee, Illinois, see the landscape light up with a bright blue light as a ball of fire approaches out of the south. It passes above their car dragging a trail of bluish light behind it. The inside of the car heats up uncomfortably, waking up their daughter and her husband who are asleep in the back. The light gradually fades and disappears in the north. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 221–223)

July 3 — 4:30 p.m. Argentine Air Force Capt. Hugo F. Niotti is driving north near Villa General Belgrano, Córdoba, Argentina, when he notices a dark object hovering to the right of the road. He stops his car, grabs his camera, and takes a photo of the object, which is moving slowly over a field. As he is winding the film to take another shot, the object accelerates and disappears into the clouds. The photo shows a conical object low above the ground, as well as a horse whose attention is attracted to the object. Analysis shows that the object is about 23 feet high, 20 feet in diameter, and 56 feet above the ground. (Guillermo C. Roncoroni and Gustavo J. Alvarez, “[Foto de OVNI](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Argentina/UFO%2520PRESS/UFO%2520PRESS%2520-%2520No%252003%2520-%2520(Abril%25201977).pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923616363&usg=AOvVaw3oE8HdKh3jJBly9sE0Thjd) [Avalada por la Fuerza Aerea Argentina,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Argentina/UFO%2520PRESS/UFO%2520PRESS%2520-%2520No%252003%2520-%2520(Abril%25201977).pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923616766&usg=AOvVaw0MqBAXarV6cS06b00n9D-F)” UFO Press 1, no. 3 (April 1977): 32–38; “[Cone-Shaped UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1980_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923617177&usg=AOvVaw251bVedL31JYyuTt2GMw3c)

Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyndon_B._Johnson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923618742&usg=AOvVaw2j10VCdSO_9irAzf4tbXGP) (D-Tex.) states that he has ordered the staff of the Senate Preparedness Investigating Subcommittee to keep a close watch on UFO developments. July 13 — The Air Force gives a preliminary briefing to associate counsel Stuart French, staff member of the Senate Preparedness Committee, who wants to know about USAF explanations for the Washington National Airport and Levelland cases.
