July 26 — Lt. Col. [Lawrence J. Tacker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30450384/lawrence-j-tacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923625682&usg=AOvVaw3CQ-wsOOaRyBD1t4GeCpib) writes to [Stringfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923626068&usg=AOvVaw0fBwxNDuvW8lM-18MxW00_) that “There is absolutely no truth in the charge that the Air Force or any other governmental agency is withholding information on the subject of UFOs from the general public.” (Stringfield, Situation Red, Fawcett Crest, 1977, p. 167)

August — The US severs diplomatic relations with the Dominican Republic. The CIA’s Special Group decides to arm Dominicans in hopes of an assassination of generalissimo [Rafael Trujillo](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rafael_Trujillo&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923626610&usg=AOvVaw0mJNz2J7vHP2t4wpkKNbHs). The CIA disperses three rifles and three

.38 revolvers, but things pause in 1961 as [John F. Kennedy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_F._Kennedy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923626876&usg=AOvVaw1ak68Z87nzglCXTKgxTzdV) assumes office. ()

August 9 — Contactee [Gabriel Green](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_Green&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923627185&usg=AOvVaw2Se6uCw9rgDs99MlmqLeDJ) announces his candidacy for the presidency of the United States at a press conference at the Los Angeles Biltmore Hotel. He publishes his Space Age Platform at the second meeting of his Amalgamated Flying Saucer Clubs of America convention in the Shrine Auditorium in Los Angeles, California, on August 13–14, but soon drops out and lends his support to [John F. Kennedy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_F._Kennedy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923627505&usg=AOvVaw07ZP2mymD8QVkTGGZEOd9D). (Wikipedia, “[Gabriel Green](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_Green&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923627699&usg=AOvVaw1mTGtffIuRY2TURBK7VEvR)”; “[Space Age Platform of Gabriel Green: Candidate for the Office of President of the United States,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/AFSCA%2520World%2520Report%2520(Gabriel%2520Green)/AFSCA%2520World%2520Report%2520-%2520No%252016.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923627980&usg=AOvVaw04Q_b1bQGiqCXE9h0_fd2j)” AFSCA World Report, no. 16 (July/Aug. 1960): 4–7; Clark III 99; S. D. Tucker, False Economies: The Strangest, Least Successful, and Most Audacious Financial Follies, Plans, and Crazes of All Times, Amberly, 2018, chapter 3, excerpted in “Taxing Credulity,” Fortean Times 367 (June 2018): 52–55)

August 10 — The Discoverer 13 Corona KH-1 photoreconnaissance satellite is launched from Vandenberg AFB \[now Vandenberg Space Force Base\], California. The primary goal of this series of satellites is to replace the U-2 spy plane in surveilling the Sino-Soviet Bloc, determining the disposition and speed of production of Soviet missiles and long-range bombers assess. The Corona program is also used to produce maps and charts for the Department of Defense and other US government mapping programs. On August 11, after 17 orbits, the satellite splashes down in the North Pacific and its payload is recovered. It represents the first-ever successful recovery of an object from orbit. (Wikipedia, “[Discoverer 13](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discoverer_13&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923628906&usg=AOvVaw2-kpw0pJBxyL4njpZUgbN5)”)

August 11 — 3:10 p.m. Ray Hawks is operating a farm tractor at Left Hand Canyon near Altona, Colorado, when he hears a muffled explosion. Looking up, he watches a disc dropping vertically out of the cloud cover. It stops in midair about 650 feet away from him and 200 feet above the ground, wobbling a bit. When it stabilizes, he sees it looks like two concave discs joined together at the rim and dull aluminum in color. Bluish smoke is issuing from an apparent gap in its surface. An electric hum seems to come from inside the object. The section where the smoke is issuing is withdrawn inside, and a new section appears to replace it, settling in with a click. The hum increases in intensity, and the object appears to be surrounded by a heat haze. It then shoots up into the clouds and vanishes. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 223–225)

August 12 — NASA’s Echo 1 balloon satellite is launched by a Thor-Delta rocket and becomes the first passive communications satellite. Microwave signals are bounced off the satellite from one point on earth to another. (Wikipedia, “[Project Echo](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Echo&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923629495&usg=AOvVaw3tQsCueRmq3p8tOjzAGTqW)”)

August 13–14 — 11:50 p.m.–2:05 a.m. Highway Patrol officers Charles A. Carson and [Stanley E. Scott](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/11203984/stanley-edward-scott&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923629764&usg=AOvVaw39sqcW45DljiRq-I6pw7-z), plus three others at Red Bluff, California, are on patrol when see what they think at first is an airliner about to crash. It turns out to

* * *

be a maneuvering, silent red light with five white lights, descending to 100–200 feet altitude. It suddenly reverses course, climbs to 500 feet, hovers, sweeps the ground with a red beam, performs aerial gymnastics, then heads east, chased by the police car. It is joined by a similar object from the south, then it disappears in the east. A local radar operator confirms the UFO at the time but denies it the next day. Tehama County sheriff’s officers also see the UFO and another similar one the same night. (NICAP, “[Red Bluff Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/600813dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923630141&usg=AOvVaw06Xzlvjdl4DFy3PbTGIk7j)”; “[False AF Answer in Red Bluff](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/Special%2520Bulletins.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923630372&usg=AOvVaw2PW_ZS93iLldRChzNYzIjj) [Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/Special%2520Bulletins.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923630674&usg=AOvVaw1N2yMRrVoNENKAf1Y8VL9E)” NICAP Special Bulletin, October 1960, pp. 1, 4; February 16, 2017)

August 15 — Air Force Information Policy Letter for Commanders, vol. 14, no. 12, is issued by Office of the Secretary of Air Force. In “AF Keeping Watchful Eye on Aerospace,” it states, “There is a relationship between the Air Force’s interest in space surveillance and its continuous surveillance of the atmosphere near Earth for unidentified flying objects—’UFOs.’” (UFOEv, [p. 108](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D120%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923633556&usg=AOvVaw223DbfuN49ynvAc-5FliJi))

August 16 — Night. A woman in Charleston, South Carolina, takes a photo of a mystery satellite that is in the same part of the sky as Echo I, which is also in the photo. (Michael D. Swords, “Gazing at the Moons,” IUR 32, no. 4 (October 2009): 13)

August 17 — The trial for downed U-2 pilot [Francis Gary Powers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Gary_Powers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923634191&usg=AOvVaw1DuHGQw9-79wGkOuyE5RQm) begins in Moscow. ()

August 18 — The Discoverer 14 Corona KH-1 spy satellite is launched. It is the first completely successful mission and returns images of the Mys Schmidta airfield in Siberia. (Wikipedia, “[Discoverer 14](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discoverer_14&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923634623&usg=AOvVaw1uY8jvvCnSkZK5lbTaz0uN)”)

August 25 — The “dark satellite” is seen and photographed five times by Grumman Aircraft Engineering Corporation at Bethpage, Long Island, New York. It is supposed to be three times faster than the Echo 1 satellite and travels east to west in a retrograde orbit, rather than west to east. Its inclination to the equator is about 135°. The color of the object varies from “carrot to straw.” The Grumman observers estimate that the object is in an eccentric orbit with an apogee of as much as 4,200 miles and a perigee of about 300 miles. They immediately produce a proposal to the US Air Force to share data in the hopes of plotting a firm orbit for the mystery satellite. (NICAP, “[Grumman](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/600825mystery_satellite_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923635058&usg=AOvVaw1Zyj-UuLLjxjKtCO0J_o45) [Mystery Satellite](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/600825mystery_satellite_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923635355&usg=AOvVaw0Zd_uGgjlyjcEdwyc2D0od)”; Gordon W. Creighton, “[Unidentified Satellites,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1961%252CJan-Feb%252CV%25207%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923635674&usg=AOvVaw1qnBsYno-oF6lXSYPHq5g5)” Flying Saucer Review 7, no. 1 (Jan./Feb.

1961): 3–6; “[The Unidentified Satellite: Grumman Aircraft Writes to One of Our Readers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1961%252CMar-Apr%252CV%25207%252CN%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923636049&usg=AOvVaw0OI0Xe8Vok9_nMcEhpVaIa)” Flying Saucer Review 7, no. 2 (March/April 1961): 29; Blue Book files, “[Grumman Proposal for Optical Surveillance of the Retrograde](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/grummanreport.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923636296&usg=AOvVaw0iBA26fTCdh-vn4i-3dgHI) [Satellite,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/grummanreport.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923636512&usg=AOvVaw2Bl8XLBsLp_EwJSBY08CLs)” 1961; UFOEv, [p. 138](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D150%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923636715&usg=AOvVaw2qLDJJpTtnDiagDbeGaoO8); Michael D. Swords, “Gazing at the Moons,” IUR 32, no. 4 (October 2009): 13; Center for UFO Studies, “[Moonwatch Mystery Satellites, 1958–1962](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Moonwatch_Mystery_Satellites/1958-1962_Moonwatch_Mystery_Satellites.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923637083&usg=AOvVaw0TFdivqMXKrd4LSEzVIGXE)”)

August 25 — The National Security Council recommends to President [Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923637366&usg=AOvVaw0WMtlRdyElkIn71THVAC8r) the establishment of a top secret National Reconnaissance Office to coordinate USAF and CIA reconnaissance satellite activities because of management problems with the USAF satellite program. (Wikipedia, “[National Reconnaissance Office](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Reconnaissance_Office&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923637598&usg=AOvVaw3yEJqaqExOxdx8b46Qgs2O)”)

August 26 — 9:00 p.m. Director Robert I. Johnson and other staff at the Adler Planetarium in Chicago, Illinois, observe a faint reddish object in the sky moving from east to west, apparently the same mystery satellite seen and photographed by the Grumman observers. (Michael D. Swords, “Gazing at the Moons,” IUR 32, no. 4 (October 2009): 13; Swords 294; Center for UFO Studies, “[Moonwatch Mystery Satellites, 1958–1962](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Moonwatch_Mystery_Satellites/1958-1962_Moonwatch_Mystery_Satellites.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923638068&usg=AOvVaw380WruX5KiQAJqg0jIPwzR)”)

August 31 — Rep. [Leonard G. Wolf](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_G._Wolf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923638340&usg=AOvVaw3UGvNRHtU-wQWhqXelYkX-) (D-Iowa) makes a statement in the House on NICAP’s “Dangers of Secrecy on UFOs” report, saying that it is “imperative to end the risk of accidental war from defense forces’ confusion over UFOs.” He mentions NICAP board member Adm. [Roscoe Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923638591&usg=AOvVaw3IU6GTO4y5T0_PV5qn-AsE)’s request that “Congress inform the public as to the facts.” Based on a there-year NICAP study, Wolf states that all defense personnel “should be told that the UFOs are real and should be trained to distinguish them—by their characteristic speeds and maneuvers— from conventional planes and missiles…. The American people must be convinced, by documented facts, that the UFOs could not be Soviet machines.” (“[NICAP UFO Report: Extension of Remarks of Hon. Leonard G. Wolf of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/sim_congressional-record-proceedings-and-debates_august-29-1960-september-1-1960_106/page/18954/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923638899&usg=AOvVaw0MY2t9je4LNhpEAKgx0Hdq) [Iowa in the House of Representatives, Wednesday, August 31, 1960,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/sim_congressional-record-proceedings-and-debates_august-29-1960-september-1-1960_106/page/18954/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923639212&usg=AOvVaw0Bj29OD-L9QZVovFwwxaw9)” Congressional Record, Proceedings and Debates of the 86th Congress, Second Session, vol. 106, Part 14, pp. 18955–18956; Good Need, [p. 261](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/260/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923639543&usg=AOvVaw3kGL1ry1Sa-XFxTo086tKW))

Late August — Two men in a car near Butte Falls, Oregon, see a pale-white light hovering 300 feet ahead of them. They watch it for 15 minutes, then decide to drive closer. The light then rises to 100 feet and recedes, then changes to orange. No sound is heard. The light performs geometrical maneuvers, creating rectangle paths and other zig- zags. It then accelerates, changes back to white, and zooms off. (Swords 294)

Late August or early September — Evening. [Rhodes McCarroll](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/112625739/rhodes-mccarroll&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923639964&usg=AOvVaw0oCVtI70PI5wJfGNIX7Nc2) and his grandfather, sitting on the upstairs back porch of their home in Memphis, Tennessee, notice a glowing basketball-sized globe in the soil by the hedge. They watch it for 5 minutes, then see a figure standing behind the ball. It is a glowing nude, generally humanlike figure, about 6 feet tall, holding a light at chest level. The figure is square-shouldered and has disproportionately long legs that are narrow and pointed between the knees and ankles. The witnesses watch another 5 minutes, at which point the globe and the entity begin to fade and are gone from sight in another 5 minutes. (Clark III 279–280)

September — Groom Lake in Nevada receives the name “Area 51” when A-12 test facility construction begins, including a new 8,500-foot runway (Runway 14/32) to replace the existing one built for the U-2. (Wikipedia, “[Area 51](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Area_51&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923640380&usg=AOvVaw0SmJybudkHFoqy3M6ZQJF4)”)

September — CIA officer [Richard M. Bissell Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_M._Bissell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923640651&usg=AOvVaw2ryjSYK1D6ioUDlVjemQL_) and DCI [Allen W. Dulles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allen_Dulles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923640872&usg=AOvVaw1qt__dEB1Xg6ClRuCGh1WM) initiate talks with two leading figures of the Mafia, [Johnny Roselli](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Roselli&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923641077&usg=AOvVaw35e7DF3SRGrjkpHAme1xJe) and [Sam Giancana](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sam_Giancana&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923641281&usg=AOvVaw0I86XV_ieC9YQiaiRAGspS)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sam_Giancana&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923641430&usg=AOvVaw1MQkTR-I71WnjG4mmkHPkD) Later, other crime bosses such as [Carlos Marcello](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Marcello&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923641630&usg=AOvVaw3xFmKtLngSxazXEYNsyZsO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Marcello&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923641844&usg=AOvVaw29R3iJoH-VbJdJbvZrQhMm) [Santo Trafficante](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santo_Trafficante_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923642038&usg=AOvVaw0yzrh7APsByopHtBx-lMIF) [Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santo_Trafficante_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923642217&usg=AOvVaw3BIRZZLZBNGyjoP9wvPrlL)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santo_Trafficante_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923642350&usg=AOvVaw1rhCnKkgfqE7ce-EJryk-T) and Meyer Lansky become involved in the first plot against [Fidel Castro](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fidel_Castro&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923642911&usg=AOvVaw03TKJ77nAiSpj3JmcVe8cv)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fidel_Castro&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923643043&usg=AOvVaw1GBWEG-0zLXoi-zg7-llKy) The strategy is managed by [Sheffield Edwards](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://spartacus-educational.com/JFKedwardsS.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923643224&usg=AOvVaw1sbkfk3z1h-x1XRuVOVBHK). [Robert Maheu](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://spartacus-educational.com/JFKmaheu.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923643383&usg=AOvVaw1BfEGK9bcJQZBYsfDTp8TJ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://spartacus-educational.com/JFKmaheu.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923643538&usg=AOvVaw0RpLt_4j4x-U7hYm1SADzf) a veteran of CIA counterespionage activities, is instructed to hire the Mafia to kill Castro. The advantage of employing the Mafia for this work is that it provides the CIA with a credible cover story. The Mafia are known to be angry with Castro for closing their profitable brothels and casinos in Cuba. On September 14, Maheu meets with Roselli in a New York City hotel and offers him $150,000 for the “removal” of Castro. [James O’Connell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.historycommons.org/entity.jsp?entity%3Djames_o__connell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923643768&usg=AOvVaw3OdpUXKTknwSbrnMqEOyit)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.historycommons.org/entity.jsp?entity%3Djames_o__connell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923643944&usg=AOvVaw0_GEHofheMbfwk16irSMRW) who identifies himself as Maheu’s associate but is really the chief of the CIA’s operational support division, is present during the meeting. Declassified documents do not reveal if Roselli, Giancana, or Trafficante accept a down payment for the job. According to CIA files, it is Giancana who suggests poison pills to add to Castro’s food or drinks. Such pills, manufactured by the CIA’s Technical Services Division, are given to Giancana’s nominee named [Juan Orta](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.historyofcuba.com/history/havana/Orta.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923644191&usg=AOvVaw2ClzcHEPoMdNzdvgfnKp0e). Giancana recommends him as being an official in the Cuban government with access to Castro. Allegedly, after several unsuccessful attempts to introduce the poison into Castro’s food, Orta abruptly demands to be let out of the mission, handing over the job to another unnamed participant. Later, a second attempt is mounted through Giancana and Trafficante using [Tony Varona](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://spartacus-educational.com/JFKvarona.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923644399&usg=AOvVaw1PDYnYMDCFvvoaON-uwACT), the leader of the Cuban Exile Junta, who has, according to Trafficante, become “disaffected with the apparent ineffectual progress of the Junta.” Varona requests $10,000 in expenses and $1,000 worth of communications equipment.

However, it is unknown how far the second attempt goes, as it is canceled due to the launching of the Bay of Pigs Invasion. (Wikipedia, “[Sam Giancana](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sam_Giancana%23CIA_connections&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923644704&usg=AOvVaw2XrA6w9en9OgsxaC7Qdi--)”; Wikipedia, “[Assassination attempts on Fidel Castro](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assassination_attempts_on_Fidel_Castro%23Mafia_engagement&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923644952&usg=AOvVaw10sXwu5htQeOxvmQrrbvcC)”)

September — MKUltra chief [Sidney Gottlieb](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidney_Gottlieb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923645213&usg=AOvVaw0BMpfRv5mEzrKU09fnwlle) brings a vial of poison concealed in toothpaste to the Democratic Republic of the Congo with plans to place it on Prime Minister [Patrice Lumumba](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrice_Lumumba&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923645435&usg=AOvVaw2bMPOTzu37lUXnUXOAHJ7r)’s toothbrush. The plot is abandoned, allegedly because CIA station chief [Larry Devlin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Larry_Devlin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923645605&usg=AOvVaw1BG56UjmeCwU1KfAitSp5o) refuses permission. (Wikipedia, “[Patrice Lumumba](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrice_Lumumba%23United_States_involvement&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923645854&usg=AOvVaw2DbgvhQxnaAglwQ3bhiOku)”)

September — The USAF Assistant Chief of Staff for Intelligence turns down ATIC’s request for one additional staffer for Project Blue Book (raising it to 3) and additional funding. (Clark III 922)

September 2 — 11:30 p.m. Richard Ireton and his wife are driving on US Highway 1 in Westbrook, Connecticut, when they notice what seems to be an aircraft about to crash. It veers close to the shore and the Iretons drive to the beach to look for it. They see a triangular-shaped object flying silently at the speed of a Piper Cub airplane, alternately hovering and moving horizontally and vertically. When it reaches the public beach, it takes off at great speed toward Long Island, New York. They see a similar object the next evening around 9:30 p.m. at Chalker Beach in Old Saybrook, Connecticut. (“[‘Flying Triangle’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/82980313/hartford-courant/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923646263&usg=AOvVaw3lKESdpU22zYiv05wEhkan) [Seen in State,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/98867328/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923646434&usg=AOvVaw0ezLqyJeGNSaRHsoTZatBA)” Hartford (Conn.) Courant, September 17, 1960, pp. 1–2)

September 8 — Night. Witnesses in Consett, South Shields, and Newcastle upon Tyne, England, see a triangular formation of lights with a red light in the center. (London Evening Chronicle, September 9, 1960; Marler 76)

September 10 — A married couple in Scituate, Massachusetts, sees a trio of brilliant discs parked in a triangle formation in the sky. About 12° to the objects’ left is a huge cylinder. One witness watches them through binoculars, and the brilliance hurts his eyes for two hours. Two more discs seem to be attached to the top of the cylinder. Small domes sprinkle their surface. The large object disappears too quickly for the eye to follow. (Swords 294)

September 10 — 9:50 p.m. Mr. and Mrs. M. G. Evans see 2 light-gray glowing objects, saucer or boomerang-shaped, that swish when accelerating, over Ridgecrest, California. (Swords 294; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923647291&usg=AOvVaw3usqSAspdvs1MuU_CWeIi3), p. 285)

September 14 — 2:50 a.m. A dispatcher in Lorain, Ohio, is taking a coffee break when he sees a light that he thinks is the Echo 1 satellite. As he watches it, knowing it is not the right time for Echo 1, he sees four objects traveling in a perfectly spaced line of flight. It makes a surprising right turn, after which the objects move on their way, apparently at a great height. (Michael D. Swords, “I’ve Seen the Light…But What Was It?” IUR 32, no. 3 (July 2009): 3; Swords 294–295)

September 15 — 7:30 a.m. A witness sees a UFO hovering 300–400 feet above the Douglas Aircraft plant in Santa Monica, California, and calls it into the West Los Angeles police station. Desk Officer Don Anderson goes outside and sees a dark triangular object moving slowly to the northeast at 3,000 feet. It disappears in the vicinity of Santa Monica Boulevard and Beverly Glen Street. (“[Officer Reports Flying Triangle,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/98869738/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923648024&usg=AOvVaw2EIt8fWpmCxqAMeFtJ2cT_)” San Pedro (Calif.) News-Pilot, September 15, 1960, p. 1)

September 15 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923648522&usg=AOvVaw1o_45r9X0w-OG-BSiKprLd) dies of a heart attack in Long Beach, California, at age 37. (Clark III 1024)

September 29 — 9:25 p.m. Five people are out looking for the Echo 1 satellite in New Westminster, British Columbia.

After they spot it, they remain for a few minutes talking. One of them sees three objects come up from the

* * *

southeast, pass overhead, and disappear over the rooftops in 10 seconds. The objects are luminous, round- cornered triangles. (Michael D. Swords, “Timmerman’s Triangles,” IUR 29, no. 2 (Summer 2004): 16)

September 30 — [Tiffany Thayer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tiffany_Thayer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923649181&usg=AOvVaw1QkKuJWNLj4kc4UVF10r9d)’s widow [Tanagra Thayer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47550731/tanagra-thayer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923649368&usg=AOvVaw3YkQ-vmwsqQmxs4hjZ821w) formally disbands the Fortean Society. (Clark III 516)

October — Reynolds Electrical and Engineering Company begins construction of “Project 51” at the Nellis AFB complex in Nevada with double-shift personal schedules. They mark an Archimedean spiral on Area 51’s dry lake approximately two miles across so that an A-12 pilot approaching the end of the overrun can abort instead of plunging into the sagebrush. Area 51 pilots call it “The Hook.” For crosswind landings, they mark two unpaved airstrips (runways 9/27 and 03/21) on the dry lakebed. (Wikipedia, “[Area 51](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Area_51&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923649935&usg=AOvVaw0byWH7wpxOCgKWhPvpPwS3)”)

October 4 — 6:10 p.m. Rev. Lionel Browning and his wife are looking at a rainbow outside their rectory in Cressy, Tasmania, when they see a gray, cigar-shaped object emerge from a raincloud. It has 4 or 5 vertical, dark bands around its circumference and an aerial array that projects from the top. Browning estimates it to be 100 feet long and about 4 miles distant. It moves north at about 60–70 mph at about 400 feet altitude. After one minute, it stops and is joined by 5–6 smaller objects that emerge from a cloud. After another minute, all the UFOs abruptly reverse back into the rain squall at the same speed. (“[Mysterious Ships in the Sky,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Australia/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review%2520-%25201961%252002%2520-%2520vol%25201%2520no%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923650323&usg=AOvVaw35WukH5Il4qpw-qZKDhrIH)” Australian Flying Saucer Review 1, no. 4 (February 1961): 1–2; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923650667&usg=AOvVaw1ey4azle61qUIssR45-weV) [July–December 1960](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923650883&usg=AOvVaw3_XqO51n4kCN1mD4l5RDRp)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923651029&usg=AOvVaw2unqju7IDT-uaoYxZcjzdX) The Author, 2003, pp. 104–107; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923651258&usg=AOvVaw2Mh7jFZh0ZJyR8EVW14HwJ) [UFOs, a History: January–June 1961](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923651442&usg=AOvVaw1Ma3SbEII-8k5f--UK81jR)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923651620&usg=AOvVaw3eLIqRwdECkdtEXv6vTdMn) The Author, 2003, pp. 35–36; Clark III 350–352; Bill Chalker, “The Australian Government and UFOs,” IUR 22, no. 3 (Fall 1997): 19–20; Swords 385–388)

October 5 — A formation of UFOs is detected by the new Ballistic Missile Early Warning System at Thule Site J in Greenland. The objects appear to be heading directly toward North America from the direction of Russia. Within seconds, Strategic Air Command headquarters in Omaha, Nebraska, scrambles the crews of B-52 bombers armed with nuclear warheads to prepare a retaliatory strike. But at the last moment checks reveal that the objects are spurious radar echoes. Unusual atmospheric conditions create phantoms on the BMEWS that cannot be seen by other radars. (Eric Schlosser, Command and Control: Nuclear Weapons, the Damascus Incident, and the Illusion of Safety, Penguin, 2013, [pp. 253–254](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/commandcontrol00eric/page/252/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923652227&usg=AOvVaw3Ct2ius5Ws7Bbfg-AYROII)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/commandcontrol00eric/page/252/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923652388&usg=AOvVaw0lyywhJ_o2IxeKT2YMpBz3) [542](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/commandcontrol00eric/page/542/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923652607&usg=AOvVaw2-VVhFSjxqYASYBN3AoL9L))

October 20 — Australian MP [Gil Duthie](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gil_Duthie&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923652923&usg=AOvVaw1HNxvgX5nryl6auezDhYqa) asks [Frederick Osborne,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_Osborne&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923653130&usg=AOvVaw3YEVEmtmBEVMpoUrEyLlhR) Australian Minister for Air, whether he has read the account of the UFO seen at Cressy, Tasmania. Osborne responds that he has, and he admits that the Department of Air receives UFO reports and shares them with the RAF and the US Air Force. However, all of them are “explainable on a perfectly normal basis.” (Clark III 352; Swords 387)

October 31 — Most guerrilla infiltrations and supply drops directed by the CIA into Cuba have failed; these are replaced by a plan to mount an initial amphibious assault with a minimum of 1,500 men. ()

November 3 — 4:30 p.m. Two 8-year-old boys are walking over a small hill in rural Price County, Wisconsin, when they hear an odd high-pitched, humming noise. The air has become unusually warm. They look back and see an aluminum-colored object on the hill behind them. They run back toward it, but it lifts off and shoots away. They find the soil of the hill to be warm to the touch. (“[Small Boys See Warm, Landed UAO,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201961%252001%252000%2520-%2520January.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923653699&usg=AOvVaw1m-xtoHLe_jevWNawMlLYX)” APRO Bulletin, January 1961, pp. 1, 4)

November 4 — House Majority Leader [John W. McCormack](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_W._McCormack&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923654059&usg=AOvVaw2DbiVDVxOMDDvZPVgiq7fA) (D-Mass.) writes to [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923654283&usg=AOvVaw3F2vWFFaudfOnrQeCgSDuO) that “it was pretty well established by some, in our minds, that there were some objects flying around in space that were unexplainable.” (“[Congressmen Confirm AF Secrecy: Pressure for Investigation Increasing,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/011%2520DEC-JAN%25201960-61.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923654572&usg=AOvVaw3D4Ge5Ri4vndGqFYsSOVN2)” UFO Investigator 1, no. 11 (Dec./Jan. 1960/1961): 1; UFOEv, [p. 175](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D187%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923654959&usg=AOvVaw2soQWxh3LpWwlN0m4sIwaj))

[Douglas G. Ludlam](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/130004429/douglas-glen-ludlam&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923655268&usg=AOvVaw001lPCvS_nYkCXFKPPJm17) and Capt. [Joseph W. UFO Report Files,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201982%252011%252000%2520-%2520Vol%252030%2520No%252011.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923655850&usg=AOvVaw0DUnaKDaSRvpq4OsZY9ZPm)” APRO Bulletin 30, no. 11 (December 1982):4; Clark III 352; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923656141&usg=AOvVaw1DNjPhWcfEP-m6PpHa4_sX)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923656266&usg=AOvVaw1E5tNlymbJS17mCsJRHknl) p. 285)

November 18 — Director of Central Intelligence [Allen Dulles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allen_Dulles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923656514&usg=AOvVaw1LIVdrkQWzfNci6F0GaeFb) and CIA Deputy Director for Plans [Richard Bissell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_M._Bissell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923656765&usg=AOvVaw0JsrGomUJFtx_cWnsWUxsq) brief President-elect [John F. Kennedy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_F._Kennedy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923657045&usg=AOvVaw2Yi8NwPI_cgguZfWSL7PUZ) on the Cuban invasion. November 29 — [Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923657558&usg=AOvVaw06nTtN-HImMxQ_UZnqdWXl) meets with the chiefs of the CIA, Defense, State, and Treasury departments to discuss the new concept of a Cuban invasion. No one expresses objections, and Eisenhower approves the plans with the intention of persuading [John F. Kennedy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_F._Kennedy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923657870&usg=AOvVaw2sKbBizUHObKVwzNcAbZvj) of their merit. ()

December 5 — Pentagon UFO spokesman Lt. Col. [Lawrence J. Tacker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30450384/lawrence-j-tacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923658256&usg=AOvVaw3AhYhfVp1EUAG5Edfzd4JT) publishes Flying Saucers and the U.S. Air Force, in which he blisteringly attacks critics of Project Blue Book, depicting them all as charlatans and opportunists and gullible believers. (Lawrence J. Tacker, [Flying Saucers and the U.S. Air Force](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Digitized_by_AFU/Tacker%252C%2520Lt%2520Colonel%2520Lawrence%2520J%2520%2520-%2520Flying%2520Saucers%2520And%2520The%2520U%2520S%2520Air%2520Force.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923658784&usg=AOvVaw0nygDy0D6w9VezHXa8GCZb), Van Nostrand, 1960; Clark III 922)

December 5 — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923659171&usg=AOvVaw1ueq9GrVmCaB1-CJF-mtvR) debates Lt. Col. [Lawrence J. Tacker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30450384/lawrence-j-tacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923659421&usg=AOvVaw265mEDN9E94q3v5hSimlhU) on the Today show, hosted by [Dave Garroway](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dave_Garroway&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923659683&usg=AOvVaw3RcZHtzMAV3hQjEIIUQHM8). Tacker says he wrote the book Flying Saucers and the US Air Force because “I felt the Air Force was being set upon by Maj. Keyhoe, NICAP, and other hobby groups who believe in spaceships as an act of pure faith.” Keyhoe repeatedly challenges Tacker, whose statements ring hollow, and even Garroway asks Tacker pointed questions and coolly notes Tacker’s apparent ignorance of basic physics. The show generates numerous phone calls and letters to NBC, most of them critical of the Air Force. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923660006&usg=AOvVaw2vcj0n60h7coG2VF2D7S1m) [July–December 1960](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923660317&usg=AOvVaw2_u6Ur2JCCRbiJA0AfvN3a)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923660515&usg=AOvVaw0sFQV9Yy6ABOeZfDjf3LEJ) The Author, 2003, pp. 129–135; “[New Debunking Campaign Backfires,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/011%2520DEC-JAN%25201960-61.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923660762&usg=AOvVaw1i8jDFiL3sF0mlVeU-w1WW)” UFO Investigator 1, no. 11 (Dec.–Jan. 1960/1961): 1–2; “[Dave Garroway Show NBC-TV UFO Discussion: Tacker vs. Keyhoe,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/jufoh/JournalUFOHistoryVol1No4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923661044&usg=AOvVaw0b6OFeBN6evURRAmqPiozQ) [December 5, 1960,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/jufoh/JournalUFOHistoryVol1No4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923661272&usg=AOvVaw2vW4dY5xjBTjpryYJjDGf_)” Journal of UFO History 1, no. 4 (Sept./Oct. 2004): 3–6)

December 8 — [Richard Bissell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_M._Bissell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923661596&usg=AOvVaw3j9lVaUv0kYMVV1JBwAvq1) presents an outline for the Cuban invasion to the Special Group, while declining to commit details to written records. ()

December 9 —8:30 p.m. Mme. Dhelens in the Château des Mailles (31 miles south of Carignan-de-Bordeaux), Gironde, France, sees a luminous oval object twice the size of an automobile hovering just above the ground in the château’s park. It has two round portholes, behind which she sees indistinct shadows moving. It takes off, leaving a 12-foot circle of yellowed grass, which later dies. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923661982&usg=AOvVaw3qMfoCxGNgT_QlFSefVgJA) [UFOs, a History: July–December 1960](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923662186&usg=AOvVaw1iJlwE6PsLKI8aMhJXs-2R)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1960-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923662334&usg=AOvVaw0Zu28rMNkth6oycR1Cgtf3) The Author, 2003, p. 138)

December 14 — The Brookings Research Institute in Washington, D.C., releases a 186-page report prepared for NASA titled Proposed Studies on the Implications of Peaceful Space Activities for Human Affairs. It is later published as a 272-page Committee Print for the House Committee on Science and Astronautics on March 24, 1961. The report includes a section on “Implications of a Discovery of Extraterrestrial Life.” It is sent to the House Committee on Science and Astronautics for approval by Rep. [Overton Brooks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overton_Brooks&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923662719&usg=AOvVaw1S9x4C4qSvmkiASIeJTw8g) (D-La.) and discusses the effects of meeting extraterrestrial life: “It is possible that if the intelligence of these creatures were sufficiently superior to ours, they would choose to have little if any contact with us.” It also speculates on the possibility of finding alien artifacts on earth and the possibility that contact might result in social disintegration. (Wikipedia, “[Brookings](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brookings_Report&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923663027&usg=AOvVaw0q43y-hlNznajy0GCGKnJs) [Report](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brookings_Report&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923663264&usg=AOvVaw1ir2bXTLrulkBxECWJ8FDC)”; Proposed Studies on the Implications of Peaceful Space Activities for Human Affairs, committee print prepared for NASA by the Brookings Institution, Report of the US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 87th Congress, First Session, March 24, 1961, [pp. 215–216](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015003453936%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D229%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923663580&usg=AOvVaw3C-7kmw_5nVIk-NpwoGGQa)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015003453936%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D229%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923663747&usg=AOvVaw13VpvRQuSas1rXz7vQFiEf) [225–226](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015003453936%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D239%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923663973&usg=AOvVaw3o2GYr1jMZ4mHHIze13VMP) (note 34))

December 14 — The first Single Integrated Operational Plan, titled SIOP-62, is completed. It describes a massive strike with the entire US arsenal of 3,200 warheads, totaling 7847 megatons, against Russia, China, and Soviet-aligned states with urban and other targets being hit simultaneously. Nine weapons are to be “laid down” on four targets in Leningrad \[now St. Petersburg\], 23 weapons on six target complexes in Moscow, and 18 on seven target areas in Kaliningrad. Weapons scientist [George W. Rathjens](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://news.mit.edu/2016/george-rathjens-professor-emeritus-political-science-dies-0610&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923664449&usg=AOvVaw3x1DVON1rYnZbDbtcuucwK) looks through SAC’s atlas of Soviet cities, searching for the town that most closely resembles Hiroshima in size and industrial concentration. When he finds one that roughly matches, he asks how many bombs the SIOP “laid down” on that city. The reply: one 4.5 megaton bomb and three more 1.1 megaton weapons in case the big bomb is a dud. The execution of SIOP-62 is estimated to result in 285 million dead and 40 million casualties in the Soviet Union and China. Presented with all the facts and figures, USAF Gen. [Thomas D. White](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_D._White&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923664805&usg=AOvVaw1uooIn6N2uodyzJkj6uIE1) finds the plan “splendid.” Disregarding the human aspect, SIOP-62 represents an outstanding technological achievement. (Wikipedia, “[Single Integrated Operational Plan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single_Integrated_Operational_Plan%23The_first_SIOP&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923665166&usg=AOvVaw3vmhvkv9aD3By_fH1uZdRr)”; Daniel Ellsberg, The Doomsday Machine, Bloomsbury, 2017, pp. 90–103)

December 27 — Blue Book officer Maj. [Robert Friend](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Friend_(pilot)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923665501&usg=AOvVaw3hdt7kMqQ0WyMP4Can5DYK) and his boss at ATIC, Philip G. Evans, write a memo to Air Force Intelligence in the Pentagon. Friend complains about civilian UFO organizations supported by people for “financial gain, religious reasons, pure emotional outlet, ignorance, or possibly to use the organization as a ‘cold war’ tool.” He is upset by their accusations that the Air Force is withholding UFO information. (Swords 292)

1961

1961 — The first American to publish on the microwave auditory effect is biophysicist [Allan H. Frey](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://slowdigital.com/2017/12/07/allan-frey-a-pioneer-of-radiation-research/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923666193&usg=AOvVaw0yHkqZvRufnut7BTtNciHV)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://slowdigital.com/2017/12/07/allan-frey-a-pioneer-of-radiation-research/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923666357&usg=AOvVaw0B5npN1Qb1T15TJv2i_vZX) In his experiments, the subjects are able to hear appropriately pulsed microwave radiation from a distance of 328 feet from the transmitter. This is accompanied by side effects such as dizziness, headaches, and a pins-and-needles sensation. (Allen H. Frey, “[Human Auditory System Response to Modulated Electromagnetic Energy,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://journals.physiology.org/doi/abs/10.1152/jappl.1962.17.4.689?sid%3D7c073ad2-6324-4b47-94e1-124dc0a5f154&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923666658&usg=AOvVaw1hggirVG-rqbLffWBfZkER)” Journal of Applied Physiology 17 (July 1, 1962): 689–692; Wikipedia, “[Microwave auditory effect](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microwave_auditory_effect&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923666990&usg=AOvVaw0gI-5ullhAI9qnOLCHD94A)”)

1961 — [Ray Palmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923667310&usg=AOvVaw08oiRvj3KCM9U-PiFnIX36) begins publishing The Hidden World, a quarterly magazine in trade-paperback format that runs through 1964. It consists of reprints of [Richard Shaver](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Sharpe_Shaver&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923667585&usg=AOvVaw03aPleMESF00VSylbbbDKT) stories and readers’ contributions. (Clark III 873)

1961 — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923667908&usg=AOvVaw2Meotad_ILtZ5Am_m1ve4j) publishes Flying Saucers Farewell, signaling his intention to refocus his efforts on teaching about life and consciousness. (George Adamski, Flying Saucers Farewell, Abelard-Schuman, 1961; “[Final](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/final-years/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923668312&usg=AOvVaw073XK3curVboLnJD_Irk4N) [Years,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/final-years/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923668511&usg=AOvVaw3LxBDwB_uXzesnceUPLsjg)” The Adamski Case, June 11, 2009)

1961 — An Antonov AN-2P mail biplane takes off from an airfield at or near Sverdlovsk, Russia, bound for Kurgan with seven people on board. About 80–100 miles from Sverdlovsk, the aircraft disappears from the radar screen.

Ground control cannot regain contact, so a search is launched with helicopters and troops. The aircraft is found in a small clearing in a dense forest, completely intact. The authorities state that it looks like it was placed there gently from above. All the mail is intact, and there is no sign of anyone on board. No marks or footprints are seen. A 100-foot wide, clearly defined circle of scorched grass and depressed earth is found at a distance of 328 feet from the plane. A report by the Moscow Aviation Institute claims that a UFO was tracked on radar at the control tower and that strange radio signals were hear at the time of the disappearance. (Good Above, [pp. 228–229](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/228/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923669074&usg=AOvVaw3Zqg0F1QbKtOoMTVLwUNkW))

1961 — A UFO appears above the iron-ore mine of Catalina Huanca, owned by the Marcona Mining Company, near Apongo, Peru. It hovers for 5–15 minutes, only about 300 feet away from a young mining engineer. It is round and glowing, with windows on the upper part. The engineer gets a look at it through his theodolite, but it still looks fuzzy. The object reappears throughout the day, allowing all the mine workers (about 70) to view it. The following day it follows a supply truck for several hours as it exits the mine heading south over a dirt track. (S. Parker Gay Jr., “Peru, 1961,” IUR 24, no. 3 (Fall 1999): 29)

January — Day. Government topographer Adolfo Paolini Pisani is driving a jeep along the highway between La Victoria and El Vigía, Mérida, Venezuela, when a truck passes him. A few minutes later, a brilliant metallic disc like polished blue steel swoops down and passes dangerously close above the hood of the truck. The truck rises a few feet into the air and overturns in the direction taken by the object, falling in a sandbank with its wheels in the air. The object ascends and is lost to view in a few seconds. Pisani stops his jeep to assist, but fortunately the lone driver has only a few scratches. (Horacio Gonzales, “[Disc Upsets Truck,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201961%252009%252000%2520-%2520September.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923669732&usg=AOvVaw2ufZOXFqIzzrUEMqFXhod2)” APRO Bulletin, September 1961, pp. 1, 3)

January 3 — President [Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923670127&usg=AOvVaw1HQ6ZQdXR9j27CqK0MMAgv) severs diplomatic relations with Cuba. ()

January 3 — 9:01 p.m. An explosion at the US Army’s SL-1 nuclear power reactor in Idaho Falls, Idaho, causes a meltdown, killing three operators. The direct cause is the improper withdrawal of the central control rod, responsible for absorbing neutrons in the reactor core. The event is the only reactor accident in the US that results in immediate fatalities. (Wikipedia, “[SL-1](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SL-1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923670573&usg=AOvVaw30EiFC3Zd6XYKpboyvJmXi)”)

January 4 — The CIA Deputy Director of Plans [Richard Bissell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_M._Bissell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923670833&usg=AOvVaw1eaJBjiOp3YYwHDxao25LY) plans for a “lodgement” by 750 men at an undisclosed site in Cuba, supported by considerable air power. ()

January 8 — Pravda asserts that “some regions” (including Uzbekistan and Tajikistan) of the USSR are reporting UFOs.

It quotes physicist [Lev Artsimovich](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lev_Artsimovich&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923671241&usg=AOvVaw0ET7MXvgyEI78WxGCT7rRR) saying that “it is about time that these tales be stopped no matter how breathtaking they may be.” (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: January–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923671547&usg=AOvVaw0Vr-nXHcVF4LIwF5s74tQS) [June 1961](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923671733&usg=AOvVaw0GJRI5IR9nURaqGltH3-lC)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923671900&usg=AOvVaw3Xq22ZM6OI8C0xSZXgTXW6) The Author, 2003, pp. 5–6)

January 10 — A US Navy A-1 Polaris missile is launched from a ground pad at Cape Canaveral, Florida. A disc, whose diameter is close to the length of the Polaris, alters its tracking, but does not block the missile firing, since the tracking system continues to follow the object and later returns to again to track the Polaris downrange. The diameter of the disc is approximately 20–25 feet and it is about 6–8 feet thick at its center. It is visually lost to ground observers and the primary witness ([Clark C. McClelland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://clarkcmcclelland.wordpress.com/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923672212&usg=AOvVaw1gGoo4FRh9fCs2dXtv7UzZ), with 10x50 binoculars) as it continues downrange. The original investigation is conducted by McClelland and his Florida NICAP subcommittee. (NICAP, “[UFO ‘Alters’ Tracking of Navy Polaris Test](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/610110capecanav_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923672433&usg=AOvVaw3RMnYp7UYuLMWeiUjfi84u)”; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923672631&usg=AOvVaw117Zm1mqQmn2YdUpchMgO3) [UFOs, a History: January–June 1961](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923672855&usg=AOvVaw0CD1Os2YLMgm8hZu8XkQAw)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923673037&usg=AOvVaw1VpE3-x8QMC68DDpYmZWwp) The Author, 2003, pp. 6–7; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923673249&usg=AOvVaw2ZNDPIQKQosROavU7bCL6O)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923673382&usg=AOvVaw1U0kDWPtoiL48qTwoZWJFe) p. 286)

January 12 — In a press conference in Moscow, Russia, Minister of Merchant Marine [Viktor Bakaev](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://encyclopedia2.thefreedictionary.com/Viktor%252BBakaev&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923673657&usg=AOvVaw1P5X57IHsoUG1Csk2cJAPx) charges that US military aircraft and ships are systematically conducting “provocative actions” against Soviet vessels around Cuba. He is probably referring to close approaches to Cuban airspace by Fort Bliss–based reconnaissance aircraft that are testing the responses of Soviet electronic countermeasures. (Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 155–157](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/154/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923673980&usg=AOvVaw2N28n0eIuD30zW_DliEPof))

January 17 — DRC Prime Minister [Patrice Lumumba](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrice_Lumumba&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923674222&usg=AOvVaw2LAatWbWeTVo8pRqAcKUnE) is executed by firing squad near Élisabethville \[now Lubumbashi\], Democratic Republic of the Congo. CIA Station Chief [Larry Devlin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Larry_Devlin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923674442&usg=AOvVaw2iVOkpnz9yZhIfuTXtei-j) has helped direct the search to capture Lumumba for his transfer to his enemies in Katanga, he is involved in arranging Lumumba’s transfer there, and he is in direct touch with the killers the night Lumumba is killed. The Congolese leaders who kill Lumumba, including [Mobutu Sese Seko](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobutu_Sese_Seko&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923674669&usg=AOvVaw2sdW7wTMvIuuueg_RAQHii) and [Joseph Kasa-Vubu](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Kasa-Vubu&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923674884&usg=AOvVaw1SmYzaT2tZb0SAxf5g57uy), receive money and weapons directly from the CIA. [John](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Stockwell_(CIA_officer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923675056&usg=AOvVaw2ptQwctB9L6YqKaJr6t0bX) [Stockwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Stockwell_(CIA_officer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923675233&usg=AOvVaw1ZZaP9EvP--JKYxEJzAc5V) writes in 1978 that a CIA agent had the body in the trunk of his car in order to try to get rid of it.

* * *

Stockwell, who knows Devlin well, feels Devlin knows more than anyone else about the murder. However, documents released in 2017 reveal that the US role in Lumumba’s murder was only under consideration by the CIA and never carried out. (Wikipedia, “[Patrice Lumumba](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrice_Lumumba%23United_States_involvement&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923675648&usg=AOvVaw0Cf6HP9Fl_544f9K-kpK5m)”)

January 17 — [Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923675910&usg=AOvVaw1sbTdVAqWfIUzSjz2tYMtI) delivers a farewell address in a TV broadcast. Perhaps best known for advocating that the nation guard against the potential influence of the military–industrial complex, a term he is credited with coining, the speech also expresses concerns about planning for the future and the dangers of massive spending, especially deficit spending, the prospect of the domination of science through federal funding, and, conversely, the domination of science-based public policy by what he calls a “scientific-technological elite.” (Wikipedia, “[Eisenhower’s farewell address](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eisenhower%2527s_farewell_address&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923676183&usg=AOvVaw0p0xmxF6DJVxrjbpA0RDol)”)

January 17 — 6:17 p.m. A former weather officer at Holloman AFB is driving with some companions near Cimarron, New Mexico, when they see three different groups of amber UFOs flying in V-formation about 15 miles away at 30,000 feet. There are six lights in the first group and eight in the second and third. They fly away to the southwest and then return to where they first appeared. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp.

226–227)

January 19 — A USAF press release proclaims that “not even a minute fragment of a so-called ‘flying saucer’ has ever been found.” (Frank Edwards, FS Serious Business, Bantam ed., 1966, [p. 48](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersser00edwa/page/48/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923676721&usg=AOvVaw042FX-aTiih8lSSipv1jw3))

January 22 — 4:45 p.m. An elliptical, metallic-looking UFO approaches Eglin AFB near Valparaiso, Florida, from over the Gulf, makes a U-turn and speeds back over the Gulf. Harry Caslar is filming his son on the beach with 8mm movie film and captures the UFO. (UFOEv, [p. 95](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D107%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923677028&usg=AOvVaw34NXqQ-runUq1RcCgf6BQg))

January 28 — President [Kennedy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_F._Kennedy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923677256&usg=AOvVaw3uS5L1HOhDIp5V0AMzvMHD) is briefed, together with all the major departments, on the latest plan (code-named Operation Pluto) that involves 1,000 men landed in a ship-borne invasion at Trinidad, Cuba, about 170 miles southeast of Havana at the foothills of the Escambray Mountains in Sancti Spiritus province. Kennedy authorizes the active departments to report progress. ()

February — Forester Vasili Brodski finds a mysterious crater 100 feet long, 50 feet wide, and 10 feet deep on the bank of a frozen lake in Karelia, Russia. It had not been there two days earlier. The base is remarkably smooth, and around the edge are lumps of grass and soil but no trace of the excavated dirt. Six investigators from Leningrad \[now St. Petersburg\] arrive and find odd, crumbling black pellets on the edge of the lake. Divers discover a 330- foot strip where the soil has been displaced along the floor of the lake, as if something slid along the ground and submerged, ploughing up the soil. Geologist Vsevolod Charmov examines ice, water, and soil samples but cannot explain a green discoloration on some of the submerged pieces of broken ice. The pellets seem to be an inorganic substance. (Hobana and Weverbergh 61–63)

February 5–7 — Many people report strange lights flashing around in the sky over Maine. Some blink and move up and down. A Portland Press Herald editorial, February 9, says: “Mysterious objects ‘lit up like a ball of fire and going fast’ zoom over Portland. Unidentified shapes with green, yellow, and red lights hover over Brunswick, then dart away with ‘unbelievable quickness.’ Strange things are happening. . . The military had us just about convinced that no such objects existed. The only trouble was that many people—good, reliable observers— continued to see these things.” (UFOEv, [p. 138](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D150%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923678005&usg=AOvVaw3mR_XxerN3YUQyRGVGyPST))

February 28 — 3:20 a.m. Clarence Blackwood and his wife hear a roaring sound in the sky at their home in Lakewood, Massachusetts. They look out the bedroom window and see a fiery cigar-shaped object moving at low altitude to the northeast. It is bright yellow in the middle with a bright red edge and surrounded by thin clouds of black smoke. The object rolls back and forth rapidly and travels slowly to the southwest. It passes directly above their house, illuminating the bedroom. The lights that they have left on in the kitchen dim three times and go out for 4– 5 minutes. The object returns at 3:40 and the kitchen lights repeat their previous actions. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923678398&usg=AOvVaw29X6oZawf7CIYxZi-ETyMO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923678601&usg=AOvVaw1uD9wUZlg4jcRBHdnxUFOm) pp. 115–117)

March — In an article in Argosy, Maj. [Lawrence Tacker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30450384/lawrence-j-tacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923679001&usg=AOvVaw3XF7bJowRa0mMB5DqJb9-I) says that critics of the Air Force investigation are “absolutely erroneous,” “a hoax,” “sensational theories,” and the work of “amateur hobby groups.” NICAP’s evidence is “drivel,” its claims “ridiculous,” and it is making “senseless accusations.” (Lawrence J. Tacker, “‘Flying Saucers Are Fakes!’ ‘—U.S. Air Force,’” Argosy, March 1961, pp. 58, 125–126; UFOEv, [p. 108](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D121%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923679332&usg=AOvVaw1ob3pO_Tz_VXII3yqsgsU7))

March — House Majority Leader [John W. McCormack](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_W._McCormack&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923679615&usg=AOvVaw2ruFe9LrzTOfpKvVt-5Xj1) tells [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923679808&usg=AOvVaw0evmENM8q0ME5yylklGSFj) privately that he has urged the Science and Astronautics Committee, headed by Rep. [Overton Brooks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overton_Brooks&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923680036&usg=AOvVaw2M7MWWGAk8i2DfwECZs5Bi) (D-La.), to investigate Air Force UFO secrecy. (Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, [p. 76](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/76/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923680318&usg=AOvVaw2B3lQV0uTNJ_qvA2GpuE2U))

March 16 — 6:15 p.m. Brazilian meteorologist Rubens J. Villela, on the deck of the [USS Glacier](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Glacier_(AGB-4)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923680573&usg=AOvVaw1nKdiIWsut6yGlgIOQbyJX), watches a tear-shaped fireball over Admiralty Bay, South Shetland Islands, Antarctica, in slow, level flight. It leaves a long orange trail like a tracer bullet, then abruptly divides in two as if exploding. It disappears after 10 seconds. (UFOEv, [pp. 53–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D65%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923680872&usg=AOvVaw1KybnpicWtuxhB-KxLFXeJ) [54](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D65%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923681069&usg=AOvVaw2KrPK8n9uoq_FcvxvQoSEr); James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23meteorologists&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923681278&usg=AOvVaw1kooXcnV5qP3mQAK3zPngm)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying

* * *

Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 64–65)

March 16 — 8:45 p.m. Mr. F. Reynolds and his 15-year-old son Lloyd are camped in their trailer 900 feet from the Murray River, at Bowna, New South Wales, when they see what appears to be a huge trailer with four windows and a red light at the end standing by the water. A fire is visible to the right of the object, and they can see four figures moving quickly between the object and the fire. Reynolds watches through binoculars and sees the entire array moving sideways in a jerking manner. After 45 minutes, it is all gone from sight. In the morning they can find no traces on the soft mud flat. (“[UFO Landing?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Australia/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review%2520-%25201961%252007%2520-%2520no%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923681884&usg=AOvVaw1EMIusoq8bXqDMb79-E3dk)” Australian Flying Saucer Review, no. 5 (July 1961): 1–2)

Spring — Late evening. A couple parking in Millville, New Jersey, watch a bright light silently moving northward. It hovers, reverses direction, and maneuvers for 5 minutes. At one point it races directly at a star, abruptly stops, draws a neat, right-angled, half-box around it, and goes racing on. Finally it speeds out of sight in about 5 seconds. (J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [p. 44](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/44/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923682424&usg=AOvVaw02kE9Q8SNK21Pz-XT354nE); Michael D. Swords, “We Know Where You Live,” IUR 30, no. 2 (January 2006): 10)

April — Maj. [Tacker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30450384/lawrence-j-tacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923682833&usg=AOvVaw0WI9pUpmQzyPKUXOk9rhDA) is removed from his job as Pentagon UFO spokesman and reassigned to Europe. He is replaced by Maj. [William T. Coleman](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.abovetopsecret.com/forum/thread1243564/pg1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923683159&usg=AOvVaw0rILPpEs_Ept0_4C80hDHW). (“[Tacker Replaced As Spokesman,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/012%2520APR-MAY%25201961.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923683372&usg=AOvVaw04tr0wpzJm69gjHpS1LD1m)” UFO Investigator 1, no. 12 (April/May 1961): 1– 2; UFOEv, [p. 108](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D120%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923683629&usg=AOvVaw2UzPkzBdUHedJi5e4Xo4bn))

April 4 — President [Kennedy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_F._Kennedy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923683917&usg=AOvVaw1S87P9bs3egdkRuBsLbbi3) approves the Bay of Pigs plan (also known as Operation Zapata) for the invasion of Cuba because it has an airfield that does not need extending to handle bomber operations, it is farther away from large groups of civilians than the Trinidad plan, and it is less noisy militarily, which would make any future denial of direct US involvement more plausible. (Wikipedia, “[Bay of Pigs invasion](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bay_of_Pigs_Invasion&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923684161&usg=AOvVaw07un5Dt_4vj4ZYjVoZdfTp)”)

April 12 — Soviet cosmonaut [Yuri Gagarin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuri_Gagarin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923684495&usg=AOvVaw25iruXLeK55_GA4j81_2W3) becomes the first human to go into outer space when his Vostok spacecraft completes an orbit of the earth. (Wikipedia, “[Yuri Gagarin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuri_Gagarin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923684812&usg=AOvVaw1zG1cjxDfNTvRTmRXh5erv)”)

April 17 — The Bay of Pigs invasion takes place in Cuba. A counter-revolutionary military (made up of Cuban exiles), trained and funded by the CIA, Brigade 2506 fronts the armed wing of the Democratic Revolutionary Front (DRF) and intends to overthrow the increasingly communist government of [Fidel Castro](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fidel_Castro&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923685281&usg=AOvVaw3_ocAYjBtOf7jNwXID_-ER). Launched from bases in Guatemala and Nicaragua, the invading force is defeated within three days by the Cuban Revolutionary Armed Forces under the direct command of Castro. (Wikipedia, “[Bay of Pigs invasion](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bay_of_Pigs_Invasion&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923685581&usg=AOvVaw06ihJ3tyfZ71SOrkYqzqgf)”)

April 18 — 11:00 a.m. [Joe Simonton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21117456/joseph-g-simonton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923685884&usg=AOvVaw1ERrQCDlmt3A_i9TeADnl9) hears a whining sound on his farm four miles from Eagle River, Wisconsin, and sees a silvery object, 30 feet in diameter and 12 feet high, with exhaust pipes around the periphery, land nearby. A door opens and a man appears, about 5 feet tall and wearing a black, turtle-neck pullover with a white band at the belt, and black trousers with a vertical white band along the side. Two other figures are visible inside. The creature is holding a metallic jug and making gestures suggesting he wants a drink. Simonton takes the jug into his basement, fills it with water, and returns it to the man. Simonton notices one man frying on a flameless grill and motions for some food. Simonton receives four ordinary pancakes or cookies, 3 inches in diameter, perforated with small holes. The object takes off after 5 minutes. Simonton gives one of the pancakes to Judge [Frank](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21119059/frank-wellington-carter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923686220&usg=AOvVaw36vcEhL6VnTqcjRJw2zXbc) [Wellington Carter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21119059/frank-wellington-carter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923686410&usg=AOvVaw10qDeqIlYauI2ewZ88T32J)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21119059/frank-wellington-carter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923686563&usg=AOvVaw1GsUIKh_X828FsdWxE7dC3) who then passes it on to the National Investigations Committee on Aerial Phenomena; another he gives to [J. Allen Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923686745&usg=AOvVaw2YgdPP7roApf8g1UaELR96) for Project Blue Book; and the third he keeps for himself. A thorough analysis is performed on one of the pancakes by the US Department of Health, Education, and Welfare, and the food is found to be made of terrestrial but tasteless ingredients, including hydrogenated oil and buckwheat flour. The Air Force concludes that Simonton is honest but has mistakenly conflated the reality of his breakfast with a dream. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923687066&usg=AOvVaw3ziC49rSpkdBI4SQ9rThcb)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923687205&usg=AOvVaw0ZAbtXkNpZ8uVuj8T_jEWc)

p. 287; Vallée, Magonia, [pp. 23–25](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/passporttomagoni0000vall/page/22/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923687511&usg=AOvVaw3XGfPfdjNOGnYs-_akCCCQ); Clark III 421–426; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923687710&usg=AOvVaw00UH8SR6xB7TVzD4qMXciq) [UFOs, a History: January–June 1961](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923687942&usg=AOvVaw3JUQEN8k1NndJBMT-ehwG7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923688082&usg=AOvVaw2_h6KvU0CNXEXiEoHfeLtP) The Author, 2003, pp. 32–34; Center for UFO Studies, \[[Hynek case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/cases/1961_04_18_US_WI_Eagle-River_HYNEK_Simonton-CE-III.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923688328&usg=AOvVaw06wVyPosc64XwVIWDus6C-) [documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/cases/1961_04_18_US_WI_Eagle-River_HYNEK_Simonton-CE-III.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923688517&usg=AOvVaw12GVCOlt5X0he5dKIyM21L)\]; Center for UFO Studies, \[[case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/images/1961_04_18_US_WI_Eagle-River_HYNEK_Simonton-CE-III_Photo1-400dpi.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923688724&usg=AOvVaw0GthPmGj2hG_ixdlDX-SqZ) [photos](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/images/1961_04_18_US_WI_Eagle-River_HYNEK_Simonton-CE-III_Photo2-400dpi.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923688968&usg=AOvVaw1gciAvADCpfL5E9cYCxZvY)\]; Center for UFO Studies, \[[Lex Mebane case files](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/cases/1961_04_18_US_WI_Eagle-River_MEBANE_Simonton-CE-III.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923689185&usg=AOvVaw01MAwXbwTUYfINAhOMK_ra)\]; Center for UFO Studies, \[[NICAP case documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/cases/1961_04_18_US_WI_Eagle-River_NICAP_Simonton-CE-III.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923689413&usg=AOvVaw3hqH26Y7g1xgPfufWN22gT)\]; Jerome Clark, “[The Pancakes of Eagle River,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/cases/1961_04_18_US_WI_Eagle-River_Clark_IUR.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923689607&usg=AOvVaw1RbKxrt1BVPBwnnB01URRr)” IUR 21, no. 1 (Spring 1996): 3–8, 27; Joshua Cutchin, “The Great Alien Bake-Off,” Fortean Times 332 (November 2015): 42–44)

April 19 — 7:40 p.m. Commanding Officer C. J. Peterson of the minesweeper HMS Maxton sees a swiftly moving object as the ship is 33 miles off San Vito Lo Capo, Sicily, Italy. It is green and leaves an orange trail as it moves higher and disappears to the northwest. The ship’s crew sees a similar object on April 20 at 4:50 a.m. when it is 25 miles south of Capo Carbonara, Sardinia, Italy. (1Pinotti 112–113)

April 25 — US Air Force Intelligence Collection Guidance Letter no. 4, originally classified Confidential, describes and provides guidance for Project Moon Dust reporting. Several items of interest appear in the document: classification level of Moon Dust Alerts and reports, focus of Moon Dust on “foreign earth satellite vehicles,” and destination agencies for Moon Dust reports among them. Project Moon Dust is a covert project to exploit the discovery of Soviet hardware when it temporarily lands in American hands. (Department of the Air Force,

* * *

“[MOON DUST Reporting,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/af_doc/MoonDustICGL4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923690516&usg=AOvVaw1rZ_BHuqS_Ts32CqJKDpeQ)” Intelligence Collection Guidance Letter, no. 4, April 25, 1961; Kevin D. Randle, A History of UFO Crashes, Avon, 1995, [pp. 157–169](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/historyofufocras0000rand/page/156/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923690944&usg=AOvVaw1zRMjjE2xXvSDe_JKEHEDU))

April 29 — Around 4:00 p.m. Contractor John P. Gallagher is working at a home adjacent to Bailey’s Beach, Newport, Rhode Island. He sees a red spherical object bobbing on the ocean waves about 600 feet from the shore. Suddenly the object rises into the air to 60 feet and moves out to sea at about 100 mph. (“[‘Head’ Floats—Flies,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201961%252007%252000%2520-%2520July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923691361&usg=AOvVaw260ZQIGs0oflBz20bksitY)” APRO Bulletin, July 1961, p. 4)

May — Rep. [Overton Brooks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overton_Brooks&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923691734&usg=AOvVaw2UJfcoTwF6UBDolZuUdGwV) (D-La.) appoints Rep. [Joseph Karth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Karth&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923691982&usg=AOvVaw3upnkw75fxKHC2Lst8H7LV) (DFL-Minn.) head of a Subcommittee on Space Problems and Life Sciences. Karth and two other members plan for hearings in early 1962. The plan calls for a statement by [Roscoe Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923692224&usg=AOvVaw2iKfVw6XsDqqUXXRhFZKRv)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923692364&usg=AOvVaw0l2iLnB9j_PDK1ru4fyntq) NICAP releases a joint statement by 21 American scientists that calls for an open investigation by UFOs without secrecy. It says the Air Force should have a more straightforward information policy that releases all facts on major UFO sightings. (“[Scientists Urge Check on AF Investigation,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/012%2520APR-MAY%25201961.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923692584&usg=AOvVaw1Rr6hTr-gMil9i94pOzs4U)” UFO Investigator 1, no. 12 (April/May 1961): 7; “[UFO Inquiry behind Closed Doors: NICAP Asks Right to](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/013%2520JUL-AUG%25201961.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923692868&usg=AOvVaw2frUE1ZEBYpA3QxB53WVfO) [Question Air Force,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/013%2520JUL-AUG%25201961.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923693084&usg=AOvVaw2kJ-PbL7xuJhwOIoO1kqnd)” UFO Investigator 2, no. 1 (July/Aug. 1961): 1)

May 5 — Astronaut [Alan Shepard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alan_Shepard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923693402&usg=AOvVaw3BjXmiZe7Qz0zRoKtiRT6Z) becomes the first American in space (for 15 minutes and 22 seconds) when his [Freedom 7](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mercury-Redstone_3&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923693597&usg=AOvVaw0Lw-KoFF50bS7iQw54YtYd) capsule is launched from Cape Canaveral, Florida, as the first manned Project Mercury launch. (Wikipedia, “[Mercury-Redstone 3](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mercury-Redstone_3&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923693802&usg=AOvVaw3J5o31NX80NXJJcUiy_e4y)”)

May 10 — Late evening. Richard Vogt, driving on a rural road south of Osakis, Minnesota, sees a “ball of fog approximately 3 feet in diameter” swiftly descending toward him at a 45° angle from a clear sky. Unable to take evasive action, Vogt can only stare as the object hits the upper part of his hood and windshield.
