The noisy impact generates a tremendous amount of heat; the windshield becomes extremely hot to the touch. The object leaves pit marks burned in the windshield, circular tracks on the glass, and burned specks in the finish of the hood. (C. W. Fitch, “[Monitoring and Scanning UFOs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201963%252007%252000%2520-%2520July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923694224&usg=AOvVaw3vAAEVKWJe8zC-3TE1SiCo)” APRO Bulletin, July 1963, p. 5; Clark III 716)

May 15 — An order approved by President [Kennedy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_F._Kennedy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923694528&usg=AOvVaw0lBmCBkwjYTtyN3hoC1E9J) results in the dispersal of four machine guns to insurgents in the Dominican Republic. President [Rafael Trujillo](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rafael_Trujillo&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923694737&usg=AOvVaw0JHZQkgFbIvofFwhNXGM3g) dies from gunshot wounds on May 30. In the aftermath, [Robert](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Kennedy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923694976&usg=AOvVaw35pnTxIHbQz4DtxWdXcLoH) [Kennedy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Kennedy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923695159&usg=AOvVaw3eZFdhYsVdD1OK5i0QuV10) writes that the CIA has succeeded where it has failed many times in the past, but in the face of that success, it is caught flatfooted, having failed to plan what to do next. (Wikipedia, “[Rafael Trujillo](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rafael_Trujillo%23Assassination&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923695387&usg=AOvVaw0LGm4_a1Mz_9jzLAHH7nhm)”)

Summer — Near Rybinsk, Yaroslavl Oblast, Russia, crews are setting up new missile batteries as part of Moscow’s defensive network. A huge disc-shaped object allegedly appears at an estimated altitude of 12.5 miles, surrounded by a number of smaller objects. A nervous battery commander panics and gives unauthorized orders to fire a salvo at the disc. All the missiles explode at an estimated distance of 1.2 miles from the target. A third salvo is not fired, because at that point the smaller objects stall the electrical apparatus of the entire missile base. After the smaller disc rejoin the big UFO, the electrical systems return. (Good Above, [pp. 227–228](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/226/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923695754&usg=AOvVaw1jF_wfsK9jc_aCB5I6PZ-4); Flying Saucers, no. 47, May 1966, pp. 6–10)

Summer — Capt. [Robert Filler](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/197031899/robert-eugene-filler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923696113&usg=AOvVaw2U7K-poWvWND4LKfYFpo0J) and Lt. Phil Lee, based with the 82d Fighter Interceptor Squadron at Travis AFB in Fairfield, California, are scrambled in their F-102 Delta Dagger jets to intercept a radar target that has been hovering at 50,000 feet for 30 minutes. They get a radar lock-on 20 miles out above the Sacramento Valley. The target is still stationary until they are 5 miles away, then the target moves quickly several times to a higher altitude. Filler estimates it is moving at 36,000 mph. (Good Need, [pp. 245–246](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/244/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923696379&usg=AOvVaw2nAECkxwDftyzZ3OtBN_zc))

Summer — Day. Glenn E. Bradley watches a group of six metallic discs pass over his farm near Beloit, Ohio, at a low altitude. They are traveling in single file at about 30 mph and are spaced 1–2 miles apart. The objects are each about 60 feet in diameter at the bottom with a 30-foot dome on top. Within a transparent section in the center he can see two figures on each side. The objects begin banking to the left about 200–300 feet away. (“[Soup Bowls](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1985_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V6.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923696711&usg=AOvVaw2GEhpoh556XcEkx7spYG3V) [over Ohio,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1985_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V6.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923696924&usg=AOvVaw0PYm5TbCxXSriSfZsyOO_9)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 6, no. 1 (Feb./March 1985): 4, 6)

June 3 — 6:35 a.m. Giacomo Barra, Giuseppe Pordoi, Filippo Marin, and Silvano Guardinfante are in a motorboat off Savona, Italy, when the boat begins to roll badly. More than one-half mile away, they notice the surface of the sea is “bulging like an enormous ball, with long billows going out.” An object emerges from the sea and stops still for a few seconds at a height of 30 feet and rocks slightly. A halo forms around the base and it shoots away quickly across the sea and vanishes towards the northwest. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923697332&usg=AOvVaw2xSCxsd-cjl45eGxzBn3L8) [UFOs, a History: January–June 1961](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923697513&usg=AOvVaw3ZZBwzeSucxtbbxgV5sQYn)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923697652&usg=AOvVaw1Jn6j6jfk3FogwfQNj5H-r) The Author, 2003, p. 50; 1Pinotti 117–118)

June 3 — A civilian weather observer sees an object through a theodolite at Mercury, Nevada. It remains in sight for 2 hours at an altitude of 80,000–120,000 feet. Project Blue Book evaluators correctly identify the object as a probable U-2 aircraft flying out of Nellis AFB. (Mark Rodeghier, “The U-2 Spy Plane and Blue Book: Another Look,” IUR 27, no. 3 (Fall 2002): 21)

* * *

June 4 — Mrs. James W. Annis, a librarian, sees a large, narrow, elliptical object hovering low in the sky to the north of Blue Ridge Summit, Pennsylvania. Farther to the east, a cluster of smaller objects is hovering. She then watches the smaller objects streak across the sky to the larger one. All then move out of sight behind trees to the north- northwest. (UFOEv, [p. 71](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D83%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923698256&usg=AOvVaw3tV5p52lyZJwclzxgvqKqu); Herbert S. Taylor, “Satellite Objects: A Further Look,” IUR 29, no. 2 (Summer 2004): 25)

June 5 — 2:30 a.m. Patrolman Jaime de Miranda and Astrogildo de Medeiros are called to the scene of a sighting on the Rodovia Anchieta highway 30 miles northwest of Santos, São Paulo, Brazil. When they arrive, they find about 20 cars stopped along the road and people watching a luminous disc-shaped object maneuvering in the area. The patrolmen try to signal the object by shining a spotlight on it, but they get no response. When they focus a red light on it, the object moves toward the cars at high speed. They take cover. Another responder, Marshal José Otavia Leite, is about to shoot at the object but other police prevent him. After 3 hours, the object gets dimmer. At 5:30 a.m., it is still visible through binoculars when it lands on the ground some distance from the highway. By daybreak it is no longer visible. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 227–228)

June 9 — A second USAF/NASA flight evaluation of the Avrocar is conducted on a modified second prototype at the Avro facility in Mississisauga, Ontario. During these tests, the vehicle reaches a maximum speed of 20 knots and shows the ability to traverse a ditch 6 feet across and 18 inches deep. Flight above the critical altitude proves dangerous if not nearly impossible due to inherent instability. The flight test report further identifies a range of control problems. (Wikipedia, “[Avro Canada VZ-9 Avrocar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avro_Canada_VZ-9_Avrocar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923698916&usg=AOvVaw3z549q4NXxFQt7MpowdNDl)”)

June 11 — 11:00 p.m. José-Gregorio Darnaude y Rojas Marcos, 28, is lying in a hammock in the front of his house on the Fuenteluega Estate in Sevilla, Spain, when he feels a peculiar pricking sensation throughout his whole body but particularly in his head. His dogs are cowering, the sheep go completely crazy, and the crickets and cicadas become silent. Suddenly, a luminous disc about 15 feet in diameter appears from behind the house, flying from northeast to southwest. It makes an abrupt 90° turn and moves directly toward him, hovering about 400 feet away from him and 80 feet in the air, changing colors from white to orange to red to purple several times. Darnaude runs inside, but the disc turns bright white and shots away at enormous speed. (Vicente-Juan Ballester Olmos, “Twelfh Night: And a UFO,” Flying Saucer Review Case Histories, no. 18 (September 1974): 11)

June 19 — A flying object hovers for more than an hour above an airport at Exeter, Devon, England. Officials say: “We do not know what it is. It was seen on the radar screen and we have had it under observation for some time. We think it is pretty big. It appears to be shining brightly and is about 50,000 feet up.” (UFOEv, [pp. 80](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D92%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923699787&usg=AOvVaw2jnfH5ukqECS-H52HedMCN), [139](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D151%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923700031&usg=AOvVaw0zbBEjUawsn5xk2to8eDEy))

June 30 — 2:00 p.m. Residents of Warsaw, Poland, see a large, luminous, roughly spherical, slowly moving object in the sky. It supposedly remains visible for more than 8 hours. (Poland 29–31)

July or August — Dusk. Florin Gorănescu is staying at a villa in Lacul Roşu, Romania. He and two colleagues notice on top of a nearby high cliff an intensely red light that remains motionless until it begins moving slowly northeast. (Romania 13)

July 1 — ATIC is removed from USAF Intelligence and added to the new Air Force Systems Command. Its name is changed to the Foreign Technology Division. Project Blue Book is included in the reorganization. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923700538&usg=AOvVaw0cUKUynvLyNxjSJ6zQTSAI), pp. 12–13; Wikipedia, “[National Air and Space Intelligence Center](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Air_and_Space_Intelligence_Center%23Foreign_Technology_Division&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923700752&usg=AOvVaw2oaNJr1MuUJzbNGVgY3TdI)”)

July 1 — A new squadron that will become the 1st Aerospace Surveillance and Control Squadron becomes operational under the USAF Air Defense Command at Ent AFB \[now the US Olympic Training Center\], Colorado Springs, Colorado, part of NORAD’s Space Detection and Tracking System. The first squadron commander is Col. Robert Miller. The Space Track organization at Hanscom Field, Bedford, Massachusetts, assumes a backup role for squadron operations. (Wikipedia, “[1st Space Operations Squadron](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1st_Space_Operations_Squadron%23Space_Track&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923701288&usg=AOvVaw0Ciyaifr3btrf6ZAVVtWyA)”)

July 11 — 10:35 p.m. Jacques Vallée and others at the Paris Observatory in Meudon, France, see a mystery satellite as part of Project Moonwatch. The following day the director of the project confiscates all their data and destroys it, apparently in fear of being laughed at by the press, scientific colleagues, and the Americans. (Jacques Vallée, Forbidden Science, North Atlantic, 1992, [pp. 41–42](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/forbiddenscience00vall_0/page/41/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923701718&usg=AOvVaw09At8EE8MfErXejfqcgaRm); Michael D. Swords, “Gazing at the Moons,” IUR 32, no. 4 (October 2009): 11–12)

July 17 — 2:00 a.m. Two people driving about one mile north of Bonnie Springs Ranch \[now the Ranch at Red Rock\] in the Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area, Nevada, see in the rear-view mirror a low-flying object that overtakes their car, followed by a rush of cold air. It stops, circles the vehicle, flies off, and is lost to sight behind the mountains, where it might have landed, but an investigation by the military finds no trace. (Vallée, Magonia, [p. 282](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/passporttomagoni0000vall/page/282/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923702412&usg=AOvVaw1GLt26zHzCcqzPvIsR5KEg); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923702687&usg=AOvVaw2IFBpllr8Hgksxv6q7Yd0W)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923702914&usg=AOvVaw1UlJ77bD_4e3wcxXxC967p) p. 288)

August — Construction of essential facilities is completed at Area 51 in Nevada; three surplus Navy hangars are erected on the base’s north side. The original U-2 hangars are converted to maintenance and machine shops. Facilities in

* * *

the main cantonment area include workshops and buildings for storage and administration, a commissary, control tower, fire station, and housing. The Navy also contributes more than 130 surplus Babbitt duplex housing units for long-term occupancy facilities. Older buildings are repaired, and additional facilities are constructed as necessary. A reservoir pond surrounded by trees serves as a recreational area one mile north of the base. Other recreational facilities included a gymnasium, a movie theater, and a baseball diamond. (Wikipedia, “[Area 51](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Area_51&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923703650&usg=AOvVaw0dInKHL3jgYFWdvBuFLeSF)”)

August 4 — Rep. [Thomas N. Downing](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_N._Downing&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923703962&usg=AOvVaw2jYh7plMLfOK3nV39XTMPL) (D-Va.) advises NICAP that the House Science and Astronautics Committee is considering hearings on UFOs by a three-man subcommittee headed by Rep. [Joseph Karth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Karth&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923704259&usg=AOvVaw1U2b3ndr314KBWrS443gVB). Meanwhile, Rep. [Overton Brooks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overton_Brooks&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923704440&usg=AOvVaw3gFicT4ckUwHRHurL30QlG) meets privately with [Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923704682&usg=AOvVaw0lfAG3rlesR4oIN9xQeqgT) and [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923704915&usg=AOvVaw3OL87r0iDqHEHMjkP0r8WH), asking them to prepare the best cases and proof of official censorship for a meeting on August 24. (UFOEv, [p. 139](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D151%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923705232&usg=AOvVaw0o6yx1kp9O3yN6rziZPTFE); Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, [pp. 77–78](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/76/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923705542&usg=AOvVaw3k78EsL3ZFOv0aY5_xBJ7l))

August 5 — 8:20 a.m. John Lee-Steere sees a “snowy white meshlike substance” float to the ground from 12 white metallic discs traveling in pairs over the Mount Hale shearing station, 50 miles northwest of Meekatharra, Western Australia. Sheep-shearing contractor Edwin C. Payne picks up the material and it fades away in his hands. (“[Discs Trail White Fibrous Stuff,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201962%252001%252000%2520-%2520January.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923705893&usg=AOvVaw0qinGMTMUWgfUsUpOLAJ3g)” APRO Bulletin, January 1962, p. 1; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923706166&usg=AOvVaw22be-gkOneXk3f05XffFpO) [Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: July–December 1961](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923706480&usg=AOvVaw1vRmIitvK6ErLyx2Fgx1rQ), The Author, 2003, p. 23; Keith Basterfield, “Angel Hair: An Australian Perspective,” IUR 27, no. 1 (Spring 2002): 7; Clark III 324)

August 12 — 9:00 p.m. College seniors J. B. Furkenhoff and Tom Phipps see a large oval object with a fin extending from one edge to the center, like a sled with lighted car running boards, near Old Mission High School on 50th Street in Kansas City, Missouri. It hovers at 50 feet altitude for 3–5 minutes, then flies straight up, disappearing in about 5 seconds. (Patrick Gross, “[Kansas City 1961, a Blue Book ‘Unknown’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/kansascity61.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923707217&usg=AOvVaw3_F36A7SocIhubM4Z-_8IR)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923707506&usg=AOvVaw3o2j8ZeyAv3SeMZrnt10mK), p. 289)

Mid-August — House Committee staff consultant Richard P. Hines visits ATIC in Dayton, where Col. [Robert Friend](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Friend_(pilot)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923707968&usg=AOvVaw3AkirqDhqHsZeY2SsEIzNJ), [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923708286&usg=AOvVaw1pfcYejjNx6kkrvqH4Ah8u)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923708521&usg=AOvVaw2rMcFTTxRXh5pQ-No-mXYC) and other officials give him a tour, tell him that Project Blue Book has the UFO problem at hand, and that Rep. [McCormack](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_W._McCormack&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923708896&usg=AOvVaw3N2l11C5Y9bSBHWKanibgc) has been pressured by NICAP to hold hearings. Hines leaves ATIC “favorably impressed.” (Jacobs, UFO Controversy in America, Signet ed., 1976, [pp. 160–161](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/160/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923709469&usg=AOvVaw3LadlhSDtitpKpRHRR_12r); Swords 293)

August 16 — [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923709933&usg=AOvVaw1JIhqnUkD_Br24l1wlnzaj), now going by the name of Michel d’Obrenovic, arrives in Japan at the invitation of the Cosmic Brotherhood Association and its contactee leader [Yusuke Matsumara](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://hatch.kookscience.com/wiki/Yusuke_Matsumura&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923710302&usg=AOvVaw2Q56r2Qb50NhJKhB_dwcvE)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://hatch.kookscience.com/wiki/Yusuke_Matsumura&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923710556&usg=AOvVaw3YswL3gZc_ww4rYLKX92F0) (Zirger and Martinelli, The Incredible Life of George Hunt Williamson, Verdechiari, 2016, pp. 129–130)

August 22 — Adm. [Roscoe Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923711173&usg=AOvVaw0gPwSFZYT6_WjeWCGudz5x) signs a NICAP letter to Congress urging “immediate congressional action to reduce the dangers from secrecy about UFOs, including accidental war and the Russians falsely claiming UFOs are Soviet weapons. (Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, [p. 85](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/84/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923711712&usg=AOvVaw2d_8WuE-f4fwIf2f8JnkVO))

August 25? — Five people at Toulouse, France, see a luminous, yellow object, 24 feet in diameter, flying about 30 feet above a road. The object has horizontal and vertical bands of darker tone that give the appearance of “windows.” The UFO flies upwards very quickly when the car reaches town. (Vallée, Magonia, [p. 282](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/passporttomagoni0000vall/page/282/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923712251&usg=AOvVaw2s07Q4HykAIWQQjITCPf9t))

August 28 — Rep. [Karth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Karth&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923712544&usg=AOvVaw0SAIlWZH35UKj9aLLUPQCM) writes a harsh letter to [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923712751&usg=AOvVaw1Zpr9qgQMSNZ7TytGxDdVR) and attacks him for trying to defame and ridicule the Air Force.

He had thought Keyhoe would be proving the existence of spaceships, but he knows now he cannot do this. Therefore, he is no longer interested in holding hearings. He tells a newspaper reporter that he will not be part of Keyhoe’s “cheap scheme to discredit the Air Force.” (Jacobs, UFO Controversy in America, Signet ed., 1976, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/160/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923713201&usg=AOvVaw2isvygi2GXFr1PeCKpudeM) [161–162](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/160/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923713434&usg=AOvVaw3P31yKXUT_bwhujXCwlrXS))

September — A National Intelligence Estimate concludes that the USSR has no more than 25 ICBMs and will not possess more in the near future, effectively discrediting the missile gap myth. (Wikipedia, “[Missile gap](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Missile_gap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923713755&usg=AOvVaw0j0o7P2HOaOUC8kvlk8d9d)”)

September 2 — 4:40–4:50 p.m. A man named Ziegler is reclining outside his home in the northeast section of Albuquerque, New Mexico, when he sees a shiny round white object moving erratically to the west. At two different times it emits several small silvery objects about one-sixth the size of the main object. It fades out of sight to the south. (NICAP, “Silver Object and Smaller Ones Emitted”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923714295&usg=AOvVaw3EFUH6Sxxo9k-Mi2gJCshI)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923714526&usg=AOvVaw34y_9ME6RoiZoGCXY1q0mS) p. 289; Herbert S. Taylor, “Satellite Objects: A Further Look,” IUR 29, no. 2 (Summer 2004): 25)

September 6 — The National Reconnaissance Office is officially launched with headquarters in Chantilly, Virginia. It designs, builds, launches, and operates the reconnaissance satellites of the federal government, and

provides satellite intelligence to several government agencies, particularly signals intelligence (SIGINT) to the National Security Agency, imagery intelligence (IMINT) to the National Geospace-Intelligence Agency,

and measurement and signature intelligence (MASINT) to the Defense Intelligence Agency. Its existence remains top secret until September 18, 1992. The move creates a protocol that requires the CIA deputy director and the undersecretary of the Air Force to co-manage all space reconnaissance and aerial espionage programs. The public face of the NRO is the Office of Space Systems. (Wikipedia, “[National Reconnaissance Office](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Reconnaissance_Office&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923715619&usg=AOvVaw3H0H4JVit24voqLClpJZj4)”; Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 168–169](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/168/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923715898&usg=AOvVaw2MEvAQkFYBoirXe739xb3i))

* * *

September 16 — Rep. [Overton Brooks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overton_Brooks&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923716267&usg=AOvVaw0dneaCqFBhoVM4h7vKagxQ) dies of a heart attack; the August 24 meeting about UFO evidence has not taken place. He is replaced on the House Science and Astronautics Committee by Rep. [George Paul Miller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_P._Miller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923716490&usg=AOvVaw0Sy0711TXS07CCtXcDV4sw) (D-Calif.) who indicates he will not order UFO hearings. (Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, [p. 78](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/78/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923716776&usg=AOvVaw3TDTou5ijcDfUWSKdD4OOc))

September 18 — Fourth Officer G. Gendall of the cargo ship [Queensland Star,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.clydeships.co.uk/view.php?ref%3D6675&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923717185&usg=AOvVaw2ooCc7VHsHF3uMCtfjYOnx) in the Indian Ocean, sees a white UFO through a cloud formation. It vanishes into the clouds and then reappears, dropping toward the sea. The water in the surrounding area grows intensely bright. Particles of white matter continue to fall into the sea after the object disappears, and the sky and water are illuminated for several minutes. (Sanderson, [InvRes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scribd.com/document/429706119/Invisible-Residents-The-Reality-of-Underwater-UFOs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923717646&usg=AOvVaw2Esa11EHCNmwR3Jsm71m7Z)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scribd.com/document/429706119/Invisible-Residents-The-Reality-of-Underwater-UFOs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923717961&usg=AOvVaw2RqF7BYxSMMu45jMmXI1f8) pp. 47–48)

September 19 — 5:22 a.m. The North Concord Air Force Station \[now closed\] at East Mountain, Vermont, picks up an unidentified radar target at 62,000 feet for 18 minutes. It moves at a slow speed on an erratic course. (NICAP, “[Radar Tracks Object before and after Hill Abduction](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/610919nconcord_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923718396&usg=AOvVaw1PXXU0aHc5WizMkfmqZGph)”)

September 19 — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923718796&usg=AOvVaw2dMeW9O2TdWFpusO2ejmfd) has smoothed things over with Rep. [Karth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Karth&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923719160&usg=AOvVaw2s1mg1bZlFCjLMzzPgUoCd)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Karth&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923719370&usg=AOvVaw2tKPBYjrTbPackw_FjaJT1) who writes: “Now that we better understand each other, I would hope we could properly proceed with a hearing early next year—providing the new chairman \[[Miller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_P._Miller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923719696&usg=AOvVaw3-i_QsdIAS5zea2PcXE1Jw)\] authorizes hearings.” (“[Majority Leader Support Indicates Early Congressional Action: Chairman Karth](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/014%2520OCT%25201961.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923720076&usg=AOvVaw2eN9_q0NzMG3aFAhQaN_9_) [Backs Open Hearings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/014%2520OCT%25201961.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923720415&usg=AOvVaw3XzTRqWUFE3Mz9WHfowTsC)” UFO Investigator 2, no. 2 (October 1961): 1–2)

September 19–20 — 10:30 p.m. [Barney and Betty Hill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923720999&usg=AOvVaw31MFLgf5WObl93G37akbCN) are driving home to Portsmouth, New Hampshire, from a vacation in Quebec, going south on US Highway 3. Near Groveton, New Hampshire, Betty sees a bright light moving upward and erratically, growing larger. Later, Barney stops the car at a scenic picnic area south of Twin Mountain. Through binoculars, Betty sees a solid object against the moon that “appeared to be flashing thin pencils of different colored lights.” Barney thinks it’s a plane, though it might be “playing games” with them.

Barney drives slowly through Franconia Notch, watching the object. At one point it passes near the Old Man of the Mountain. About one mile south of Indian Head (north of Lincoln), the object rapidly descends toward their vehicle, causing Barney to stop in the middle of the highway. The huge, silent craft hovers approximately 80–100 feet above the Hills’ 1957 Chevrolet Bel Air and fills the entire field of view in the windshield. It reminds Barney of a huge pancake. Carrying his pistol in his pocket, he steps away from the vehicle and moves closer to the object. Using the binoculars, Barney claims see about 8–11 humanoid figures who are peering out of the craft’s windows, seeming to look at him. In unison, all but one figure move to what appears to be a panel on the rear wall of the hallway that encircles the front portion of the craft. The one remaining figure continues to look at Barney and communicates a message telling him to “stay where you are and keep looking.” Barney has a recollection of observing the humanoid forms wearing glossy black uniforms and black caps. Red lights on what appears to be bat-wing fins begin to telescope out of the sides of the craft, and a long structure descends from the bottom of the craft. The UFO approaches to within 50–80 feet overhead and 300 feet away from him. Barney tears the binoculars away from his eyes and runs back to his car. In a near hysterical state, he tells Betty, “They’re going to capture us!” He sees the object again shift its location to directly above the vehicle. He drives away at high speed, telling Betty to look for the object. She rolls down the window and looks up. Almost immediately, the Hills hear a rhythmic series of beeping or buzzing sounds which seem to bounce off the trunk of their vehicle. The car vibrates and a tingling sensation passes through them. At this point in time they experience the onset of an altered state of consciousness that leaves their minds dulled. A second series of beeping sounds return them to full consciousness. They find that they have traveled nearly 35 miles south, but have only vague, spotty memories of this section of road. They recall making a sudden, unplanned turn, encountering a roadblock, and observing a fiery orb in the road. At 5:00 a.m., they arrive home, about two hours later than expected. Barney feels compelled to examine his genitals, and they both take long showers. Betty notices a pinkish powder and a tear in her dress.

There are shiny, concentric circles on their car’s trunk that were not there the previous day. Betty and Barney experiment with a compass, noting that when they move it close to the spots, the needle whirls rapidly. But when they move it a few inches away from the shiny spots, it drops down. (Wikipedia, “[Betty and Barney Hill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923722227&usg=AOvVaw1SSpqVRrpRyLK67fhzCgFC)”; NICAP, “[The Betty and Barney Hill Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/610919indianhead_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923722549&usg=AOvVaw2aQcVvVm5REQlqkFveBmQs)”; Clark III 577–581; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923722860&usg=AOvVaw3LprC2Lw42h9huX4GU5_Fj), p. 289; John G. Fuller, [The Interrupted](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/interruptedjourn00full&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923723160&usg=AOvVaw0oD5H4w_GN_-VPX9WUsM3S) [Journey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/interruptedjourn00full&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923723463&usg=AOvVaw3j8NyU4FKVKydWJVfFfe0h)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/interruptedjourn00full&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923723714&usg=AOvVaw2e7aIrtDSVbiA_rWXP6FYE) Dial, 1966; J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 178–184](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/178/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923724103&usg=AOvVaw1H5NcWH0OiR6zh-OR5Gy0m); Mark Rodeghier, “Hypnosis and the Hill Abduction Case,” IUR 19, no. 2 (March/April 1994): 4–6, 23–24; Robert H. Coddington, “The Hill Experience,” IUR 19, no. 3 (May/June 1994): 18–19; Michael D. Swords, GrassRoots UFOs: Case Reports from the Timmerman Files, Fund for UFO Research, 2005, p. 143; Greg Sandow, “The Hill Case and the Limits of Ufology,” IUR 31, no. 4 (March 2008): 3–7, 19–28; Stanton Friedman and Kathleen Marden, Captured! The Betty and Barney Hill UFO Experience, Weiser, 2007; Mark Cashman, “Behavioral Classification System for UFO Occupants,” IUR 24, no. 1 (Spring 1999): 19)

September 20 — 2:14 a.m. Pease AFB \[now Pease Air National Guard Base\] in Portsmouth, New Hampshire, picks up an unidentified radar blip 4 miles away from the base, with no visual contact. (NICAP, “[Radar Tracks Object before](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/610919nconcord_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923724799&usg=AOvVaw2y10Ff-JQ2KVc21fGJ9jP-) [and after Hill Abduction](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/610919nconcord_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923724990&usg=AOvVaw2ON4OwRh5fxlwPNM8K-sc8)”)

* * *

September 21–22 — [Betty Hill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923725314&usg=AOvVaw00d6F5xONAd-LkMfOPLaON) calls Pease AFB and reports her UFO incident (without mentioning the figures). Maj. Paul

W. Henderson of the 100th Bomb Wing calls back with a few questions. ()

September 26 — [Betty Hill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923725731&usg=AOvVaw1DBjmWZaFqmsRxvJK9CP_Q) writes to [Donald E. Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923726038&usg=AOvVaw3icgQv9qsDyyrfzOxFpBPf) (mentioning the figures Barney remembers seeing) and asks for more information. She mentions that she and Barney are considering hypnosis. (Mark Rodeghier, “Hypnosis and the Hill Abduction Case,” IUR 19, no. 2 (March/April 1994): 4–6, 23–24; Michael D. Swords, “Radio Signals from Space, Alien Probes, and Betty Hill,” IUR 29, no. 4 (July 2005): 15)

September 27 — [Allen Dulles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allen_Dulles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923726552&usg=AOvVaw307zZnRTVqJQZUjijutPIh) resigns as director of central intelligence; [John A. McCone](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._McCone&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923726762&usg=AOvVaw01OzcntitwoxFHFXgUmX8P) replaces him. ()

September 27 — 7:57 a.m. The radar operator on a USAF Airborne Early Warning and Control aircraft off the California coast spots five targets on his scope. Four of the objects are on a heading of 90°, and all of them are moving at a high rate of speed. They soon disappear into sea clutter. Three minutes later, two objects appear heading 70° then also disappear into sea clutter. The speed of one of the objects is measured at about 2,070 mph over a distance of 230 miles. While the two objects are on the scope, a single stationary object also appears. After remaining stationary for about two minutes, it moves on a heading of 265° at 70 mph and is lost in the sea clutter. The objects can only be painted with the IFF on. The radar is an APS-95. (NICAP, “[Uncorrelated Targets on APS-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/610927pacificcoast_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923727115&usg=AOvVaw0S44-05tgj7nA262WTm0vg) [95](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/610927pacificcoast_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923727278&usg=AOvVaw2Dr1EgtZsJCQvahT7RDIWW)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923727467&usg=AOvVaw0l6ycsIgL-6y4RCcFA8yjp)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923727600&usg=AOvVaw1DHDM_gcCK6jolsQjAYc3h) p. 290)

September 29–October 3 — [Betty Hill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923728010&usg=AOvVaw30ll87fNEgKcm05KTY17hD) has a series of intensely vivid dreams in which she and Barney encounter a strange roadblock and are approached by a group of men. She loses consciousness and awakes on board a craft where they are given a medical examination by “intelligent, humanoid beings.” (Clark III 581–583)

Autumn — Evening. Emanoil Manoliu, son of the prominent novelist [Mihail Sadoveanu](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mihail_Sadoveanu&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923728589&usg=AOvVaw1VW-RKEqY4kQJfm-NwsXPP), is at the Neamț Monastery west of Târgu Neamț, Romania, when he sees a blinding, multicolored light. After a few seconds it rises quickly and he can see it looks like a disc with a concave base about 20–23 feet long and 10 feet broad. It vanishes “like a tornado in the air” and he feels the rush of wind. The next day he goes to the site with a priest and finds an area of singed grass and a light imprint in the soil. (Hobana and Weverbergh 167–168)

October 1 — The Defense Intelligence Agency, created at the request of Defense Secretary [Robert S. McNamara](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_McNamara&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923729049&usg=AOvVaw113gZkcMhLiDbYFZ0ZByx3) to integrate all military intelligence operations, begins work with a handful of employees in borrowed office space. Its mission is the continuous task of collecting, processing, evaluating, analyzing, integrating, producing, and disseminating military intelligence for the Department of Defense and related national stakeholders. Other objectives include more efficiently allocating scarce intelligence resources, more effectively managing all DoD intelligence activities, and eliminating redundancies in facilities, organizations, and tasks. (Wikipedia, “[Defense](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Defense_Intelligence_Agency&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923729378&usg=AOvVaw0txALZuxmZcshuUuKl415c) [Intelligence Agency](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Defense_Intelligence_Agency&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923729566&usg=AOvVaw3_b2lETasKrFccKdx_JTxy)”)

October 2 — Around 12:00 noon. [Waldo J. Harris](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6996311/waldo-james-harris&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923729926&usg=AOvVaw09whPKhkvhfT8V0WE0hwfJ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6996311/waldo-james-harris&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923730163&usg=AOvVaw0uAOB84qqMcZhoR3ZPKwts) private pilot and real-estate broker, is getting ready to take off in a Mooney M20A from Utah Central Airport \[now closed\] in Granger, Utah, when he sees a bright spot in the sky. After he takes off, he notices that the light is still in the same location. He flies toward the object to get a better look, and sees that the UFO has no wings or tail and is hovering with a slight rocking motion. He later estimates the diameter at 35–50 feet, with a thickness of about 4 feet, and the appearance of sand-blasted aluminum. Harris estimates he has approached within 2 miles of the object before it rises abruptly and zooms away for 10 miles before it resumes a rocking hover. He approaches again, but it departs in about 2–3 seconds. Several other people, including airport controller [Jay Galbraith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/125516/jay-webster-galbraith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923730471&usg=AOvVaw04FUaEYtJflE3F6QBCERuu)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/125516/jay-webster-galbraith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923730695&usg=AOvVaw0N6RbphI_I2K1VAeZ1-vxW) also see the UFO from the airport. Investigators from Hill AFB near Ogden arrive quickly. Airport attendant Russell M. Woods tells them he thinks the object was at 2,500 feet altitude. On October 9, [Douglas M. Crouch](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/171937609/douglas-merle-crouch&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923731045&usg=AOvVaw3Qx8shsoQMOFq_UK9D4Ftc) forwards the Hill AFB official report, including transcripts of interviews, to Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio, saying “No unusual meteorological or astronomical conditions were present to account for the sighting.” Nonetheless, Blue Book wanders from Venus to a research balloon to a sundog (an assessment [James E. McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923731438&usg=AOvVaw3oxVuWDA_I_a38UAvW5d-7) calls “nonsensical”) as explanations. (Clark III 1025–1028; UFOEv,

[pp. 1–2](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D13%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923731908&usg=AOvVaw3NdE5a5ACkSjTafLZH_aW9) ; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23multiwit&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923732300&usg=AOvVaw0dY3VbaOD-i9U_LRYSSmHO)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 49–50)

October 4–5 — Two IBM engineers, C. D. Jackson and [Robert E. Hohmann](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/15851368/robert-e-hohmann&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923732831&usg=AOvVaw2j_GPpFlfwOkL1vaIlcBuE), have lunch in Washington, D.C., with [Donald Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923733114&usg=AOvVaw2LSAyp84KFFO1eOpoisfR8)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923733320&usg=AOvVaw3HAqCer2hwnAk_uS0e2kax) who shows them the letter from [Betty Hill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923733605&usg=AOvVaw2iT7eSPcclnp05jzWXxDJj)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923733843&usg=AOvVaw1PEaeUtB7YehOSBygGV-fC) (Michael D. Swords, “Radio Signals from Space, Alien Probes, and Betty Hill,” IUR 29, no. 4 (July 2005): 15)

October 14 — 5:00 p.m. Mrs. Erwin Riley, a summer resident in Two Harbors, Minnesota, sees a large object slide into the water of Lake Superior about one mile from shore and bob about on the surface. She summons a neighbor, Jack Ray, and they both watch through binoculars, but they can’t make out what it is. At dusk, the Lake County Sheriff responds to their call, but he can’t see much due to swells on the lake surface. He calls the Air Force and Coast Guard to make sure it’s not part of a training exercise. Shortly afterward, Riley sees the object rise into the

* * *

air and travel southeast at about the speed of a car. A Coast Guard search the next day turns up only a floating log. (“[Flying Log?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201961%252011%252000%2520-%2520November.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923734688&usg=AOvVaw172DF_hYBh5O8W6rcw6d_7)” APRO Bulletin, November 1961, p. 3)

October 14 — 5:30 p.m. Mayor Michael Burson and his wife watch two pairs of UFOs move to the east above Sunset, Utah. The first pair looks like puffy cotton joined together by “stringy stuff,” and the second pair are metallic discs. (“[More Discs in Utah,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201962%252003%252000%2520-%2520March.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923735357&usg=AOvVaw3hQpNnP682k4YBOz2TD19t)” APRO Bulletin, March 1962, p. 2)

October 15 — 5:00 p.m. Mrs. John P. Vanicky and Norine Gribble are driving from Marquette, Michigan, to Hurley, Wisconsin, when they see a brown cigar-shaped object spouting fire from its rear and moving southeast. They stop the car and watch for 20 minutes until it disappears. (Duluth (Minn.) News-Tribune, October 19, 1961; “[Flying Log?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201961%252011%252000%2520-%2520November.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923736136&usg=AOvVaw0CaLF3RveDBV_S30rv-7ny)” APRO Bulletin, November 1961, p. 3)

October 19 — NICAP secretary [Richard H. Hall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_H._Hall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923736601&usg=AOvVaw0hXwVL2z4wT4o0UYt4kA-1) writes to [Walter N. Webb](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Webb.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923736838&usg=AOvVaw0ucKVozUc-x9K7sbRTazPs) at Hayden Planetarium in Boston, Massachusetts, and asks him to talk to [Betty and Barney Hill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923737132&usg=AOvVaw1bnrbArr4NA1isXjfcxSCP). (Clark III 578–579)

October 21 — 2:00 a.m. A brilliant fireball flashes in front of Richard and Rhonda DuBois’s car on US Highway 60 as they are driving between Datil and Pie Town, New Mexico. It then veers into the sky. Later, as they approach a canyon they see that the light is traveling along in front of them. It breaks into four lights that move along with the car, even as DuBois drives at 100 mph, until they stop at a roadside motel. The lights then zoom straight up and disappear. (“Woman Says Flying Objects Chase Car,” Garden Grove (Calif.) News, October 23, 1961; Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 231; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923737573&usg=AOvVaw2mKFNm9c7A__PrVwpG_kAZ) [History: July–December 1961](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923737770&usg=AOvVaw3nFwQkHgyZcrmLQL1YtsVI)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1961-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923737944&usg=AOvVaw3ULo1zTp2r7zWwz4XhCA98) The Author, 2003, p. 97)

October 21 — [Webb](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Webb.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923738210&usg=AOvVaw3-q39qYBQKJVIGFaDLhkQs)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Webb.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923738336&usg=AOvVaw36Z7PS-uGXm_AGdVGlvoya) initially skeptical, winds up interviewing the [Hills](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923738519&usg=AOvVaw2Ap8xNnXoEgZThonTh46XW) for 6 hours. He finds that their amnesia concerning some parts of the episode has unsettled them, and Betty tells him she had vivid nightmares for six straight nights a couple weeks after the incident. (Clark III 581)

October 26 — [Walter Webb](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Webb.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923738880&usg=AOvVaw0lLihoKBORuHdHYskfzwHQ)’s report to NICAP concludes that the [Hills](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923739075&usg=AOvVaw02-DLymu8odDRlZ8WueCLM) are telling the truth. (Walter N. Webb, “[A](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/610919hill_report1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923739316&usg=AOvVaw1wNQJgEqMM0u0AZYvN5jp1) [Dramatic UFO Encounter in the White Mountains, N.H., September 19–20, 1961,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/610919hill_report1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923739524&usg=AOvVaw0AKRn_aP__VRTl2O9am1jp)” NICAP Massachusetts Subcommittee, October 26, 1961; Clark III 581; Mark Rodeghier, “Hypnosis and the Hill Abduction Case,” IUR 19, no. 2 (March/April 1994): 4–6)

October 30 — The Soviet RDS-202 hydrogen bomb, the 50-megaton Tsar Bomba, is supposedly the most powerful nuclear weapon ever tested. It is detonated at the Sukhoy Nos Cape of Severny Island, Novaya Zemla, Arkhangelsk Oblast, Russia. It flattens entire villages in surrounding areas and breaks windows in Finland 1,000 miles away. (Wikipedia, “[Tsar Bomba](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsar_Bomba&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923739941&usg=AOvVaw3rNCng47h3fc0akABMJOeN)”)

November 1 — At a small, informal conference on SETI at the National Radio Astronomy Observatory’s facility in Green Bank, West Virginia, astronomer [Frank Drake](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Drake&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923740256&usg=AOvVaw33ReimOP8GskpMiaRsq304) writes this equation on a chalkboard: N = R fp ne fl fi fc L. The equation, the Green Bank Formula, summarizes the main concepts that scientists must contemplate when considering the question of extraterrestrial life capable of communicating by radio across space. It is more properly thought of as an approximation rather than as a serious attempt to determine a precise number. (Wikipedia, “[Drake equation](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drake_equation&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923740572&usg=AOvVaw3LDCGqZgj9fjtEZOyltkcF)”; Lee Billings, “[The Alien-Life Summit,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://slate.com/technology/2013/09/green-bank-conference-seti-frank-drakes-equation-for-estimating-the-extraterrestrial-life.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923740809&usg=AOvVaw2dFGSVAqVq6o4SFwU6rmUP)” Slate, September 27, 2013)

November 3 — 4:30 p.m. Mr. E. Adkins observes a brilliant object with an orange center flying south over Eyres Monsell, Leicester, England, at an estimated 600 mph. It is triangular in shape and about 300 feet wide. (“[Triangular Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1962%252CMar-Apr%252CV%25208%252CN%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923741209&usg=AOvVaw2VfanfQVdwRgprmMHn4tPV) [over Eyres Monsell,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1962%252CMar-Apr%252CV%25208%252CN%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923741418&usg=AOvVaw06auhetORKdvmmI-HS8NUS)” Flying Saucer Review 8, no. 2 (March/April 1962): 24)

November 13 — The AFCIN-1E-0 Draft Policy letter (Betz Memo) is prepared by Lt. Col. [Norman M. Rosner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62960897/norman-morton-rosner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923741748&usg=AOvVaw0YkCGV7cxeGibK1TEd17N4) for Col.

[Ward Reid Betz.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.deseret.com/1997/3/30/19303700/death-colonel-ward-reid-betz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923742038&usg=AOvVaw3WFLWsQJaD1vEhJsqBX_Di) Among other things, it specifies three peacetime functions of the 4602d Air Intelligence Service Squadron at Ent AFB \[now the US Olympic Training Center\], Colorado Springs, Colorado: UFO investigations, Project Moon Dust (an exploitation program to locate, recover, and deliver descended foreign space vehicles), and Operation Blue Fly (to facilitate delivery to the Foreign Technological Division of Moon Dust and other items of great technical intelligence interest). These three functions involve “employment of qualified field intelligence personnel on a quick reaction basis to recover or perform field exploitation of unidentified flying objects, or known Soviet/Bloc aerospace vehicles, weapons systems, and/or residual components of such equipment.” (Paul Dean, “[The Rejuvenated ‘Betz Memo,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufos-documenting-the-evidence.blogspot.com/2016/05/the-rejuvenated-betz-memo-in-recent.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923742341&usg=AOvVaw2V0cGzc2PYNt_XJeD4Xceu)” UFOs: Documenting the Evidence, May 8, 2016)

Late November — Evening. A group of four friends are hunting on a Sunday in the area of Harvey, North Dakota. As they are returning in the car, the two men in the front seat notice a descending glowing object in the sky ahead of them. Assuming they are witnessing a plane crash, they rush to the scene of its landing, where they find at 150 yards distance, a “silo-appearing craft which was sticking in the ground with this glow around it.” The men shine a hand spotlight and shine it on the object, whereupon they see four human-looking individuals standing around it. At this point they seem to hear an explosion and “everything went out.” The principal witness wakes up from dozing in the back seat as the car is negotiating soggy ground looking for the craft and crew. They return to the spot where the landing takes place, and they see the figures again, wearing white coveralls and standing 5 feet

* * *

high. They get out of the car and one figure waves them away. Eventually, the men agree to return to a small town, possibly Martin, North Dakota, 11 miles away, where they find a police officer, who listens to the story and agrees to accompany them back to the site. They see red lights moving in the field and both cars go in pursuit of them. The lights go out, the police officer drives away, and the four men resume driving home. Two miles down the highway, the silo-like object reappears, landing gently 150 yards away with two of the figures watching them. Two of the men get out of the car again and shine the spotlight on the craft. One of the men is carrying a rifle; he drops on the ground and shoots, apparently hitting one of the figures in the right shoulder. The figure spins around, goes down on his knees, gets help from the other figure, then yells, “Now what the hell did you do that for?” Weirdly, as soon as the men return to the car, the two who have remained inside insist the rifle had not been removed and no shot was fired. The primary witness (who remains in the car) has no recollection of what happened to the craft and figures. By the time they get home, dawn is breaking, and their wives are waiting for them. They all know it has taken longer than it should have to return. A few hours later, around 12:00 noon, the principal witness is at work when three well-groomed, official-looking men visit him. He presumes they are Air Force intelligence officers who say they have a “report” about the previous night’s event. They ask him what clothes he was wearing and what the object looked like, but they never ask about the shooting. Later, they show up at his house and ask to see his hunting gear and boots. They tell him not to say anything more about the incident. In January 1968, US Border Patrol agent \[later BATF agent\] Donald E. Flickinger manages to interview the primary witness, who works as a supervisor at Minot AFB hospital, and two of the others, one a small-town high school superintendent and the other an active-duty Air Force sergeant. They all are “extremely reliable and responsible,” Flickinger says. (J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 164–165](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/164/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923743193&usg=AOvVaw0l_MMJOB-bS7tPyZgq1R90); Clark III 825–827)

Late November — 9:30 p.m. Real estate agent Cavalheiro Mendes is walking along the beach in Balneário Pinhal, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil, when he sees a huge light 900 feet away. As he walks toward it, he sees it is a huge disc resting on the sand. He feels compelled to approach it and sees two helmeted figures come from behind the object. They seem to be telling him telepathically not to resist. Mendes finds he is completely unable to move. He feels one of them scratching his forearm with an instrument, then he blacks out. When he wakes up, he is nearly back to his beach house and it is 11:30 p.m. After a few weeks he feels anxious and sad for no apparent reason. He refuses to be hypnotized. (Lorenzen, Flying Saucer Occupants, Signet, 1967, [pp. 199–200](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsauceroccu00lore/page/202/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923743707&usg=AOvVaw2Zv8mOaIX6PCzUMkS-So_g))

November 22 — US Navy pilot [Robert G. Robinson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_G._Robinson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923743992&usg=AOvVaw2b9ijbEv79_pcLPkHmwTIt) reaches an airspeed of 1,606 mph in a McDonnell-Douglas F4H-1F Phantom II over Edwards AFB, California. (Wikipedia, “[Robert G. Robinson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_G._Robinson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923744248&usg=AOvVaw0R0N-YcNPlB-sIkGZPXN2_)”)

November 25 — IBM engineers C. D. Jackson and [Robert E. Hohmann](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/15851368/robert-e-hohmann&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923744506&usg=AOvVaw1o-b3ZwuKpbl3GMhmxofrC) interview the [Hills](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923744729&usg=AOvVaw1wzIz7Kp4M1Kij571dbsmq). Swords, “Radio Signals from Space, Alien Probes, and Betty Hill,” IUR 29, no. 4 (July 2005): 15)

November 28 — President [Kennedy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_F._Kennedy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923745235&usg=AOvVaw0VNVOuoAX8A0iAvD-H-V5K) presides over the dedication of the new CIA headquarters in Langley, Virginia. (Wikipedia, “[George Bush Center for Intelligence](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Bush_Center_for_Intelligence%23History&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923745562&usg=AOvVaw1j_lhBWqp5y2ZgavmmWo1z)”; CIA History Staff, [50 Years in Langley: Recollections of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/static/f4b6cf75ca9efcabacc393400eb01dd8/50-Years-in-Langley.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923745886&usg=AOvVaw14GxcXfDEe6snrJbmvVqZc) [Construction of CIA’s Original Headquarters Building, 1961–2011](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/static/f4b6cf75ca9efcabacc393400eb01dd8/50-Years-in-Langley.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923746110&usg=AOvVaw0riY72xvydj4OIDPODXB6W)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/static/f4b6cf75ca9efcabacc393400eb01dd8/50-Years-in-Langley.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923746306&usg=AOvVaw2k8LfGp209qxqSUgptcp1S) January 2012)

November 30 — Covert operations against [Fidel Castro](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fidel_Castro&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923746641&usg=AOvVaw2bEBJh4gl_nR7leH7YJtPB) are officially authorized by President [Kennedy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_F._Kennedy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923746872&usg=AOvVaw0rKLsFD0KvMSa3R4GuRAao) after being given the name Operation Mongoose at a White House meeting on November 3. The operation is led by USAF Gen. [Edward Lansdale](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Lansdale&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923747069&usg=AOvVaw2Gr2SFo6Lo9jSOaBLigHEq) and goes into effect after the failed Bay of Pigs Invasion. A document from the Department of State confirms that the project aims to “help Cuba overthrow the Communist regime,” including Castro, and it aims “for a revolt which can take place in Cuba by October 1962.” One of Lansdale’s ideas is to project a huge image of the Second Coming of Christ above the island, spread the word that Castro is the anti-Christ, shoot starburst shells from a submarine into the air, and hope far an uprising. US policymakers want to see “a new government with which the United States can live in peace.” (Wikipedia, “[Operation Mongoose](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Mongoose&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923747382&usg=AOvVaw3_ARwAizSVDGrAxtjGbJww)”; Kremlin 131– 133)

1962

1962 — According to a “former Project Blue Book Chief” (probably Maj. [Friend](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Friend_(pilot)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923748685&usg=AOvVaw2zR0C3eQlBcXLFTgDa1Ysd)) gun-camera films obtained during jet interceptor UFO chases are routinely referred to the CIA’s National Photographic Interpretation Center (established in 1961) for analysis. [Richard H. Hall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_H._Hall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923749056&usg=AOvVaw23HjAWEosJKOENgQndwiTE) writes, “This cannot be documented at present, but I heard him say so to a UFO researcher colleague. 1962 — The Air Force tries once again to get rid of the UFO program, but its attempts to get NASA or the National Science Foundation to handle the program prove futile. It finally gives up the entire idea. The program remains at FTD as a special project and without expanded resources. (Jacobs, UFO Controversy in America, Signet ed., 1976, [p. 164](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/160/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923749951&usg=AOvVaw3Vpmc3aQyMuELcG3HpCpbS))

1962 — Day. An Air Force pilot is flying a brand new B-52 with a full crew out of Wichita, Kansas, headed for an air base in the southwest. He notices a bright flash of sunlight in his left side and turns to see a metallic object “like polished chrome.” It is pacing the aircraft near its left wingtip. The object is 4–8 feet in diameter and has no seams or markings. His First Officer is watching an identical object off the right wing, and the crewman in the tail reports that there is a round shiny metal ball following close behind the B-52. The top and bottom gunners also see spheres above and below the plane. The pilot goes into an evasive maneuver, but after 10–15 minutes the objects are maintaining their positions. He returns to his previous assigned altitude and heading. After a few minutes, the five objects leave, one at a time, first the bottom one, then the top, then the tail. The two objects on the wings shoot away at the same time and climb out of sight parallel to each other. After landing, the crew is told not to talk about the sighting at all. (Richard F. Haines, “NARCAP’s Project Sphere: Are Spherical UAP a Threat to Aviation Safety?” IUR 33, no. 2 (July 2010): 5–6)

1962 — 12:00 midnight. Actor [Jamie Farr](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jamie_Farr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923750630&usg=AOvVaw18SnivDso0ZCT-PR-eKlXk) and his wife Joy Ann are driving through the desert near Yuma, Arizona, when they notice a light moving erratically at the top of a mountain. It zig-zags across the sky as it approaches them, moving to within 150 feet, then 60 feet of their vehicle. They can see two lights, red and blue, revolving beneath the silent object. It paces them for a short time then moves away at incredible speed. (“[Jamie and Joy Farr Report](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1980_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923750958&usg=AOvVaw3EfX8kC3U1yFjko3T76Xji) [UFO Sighting,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1980_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923751163&usg=AOvVaw0-hhEXajh4KrzUruG7b9bc)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 1, no. 8 (December 1980): 3, 5)

1962 — [René](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://data.bnf.fr/fr/12606509/rene_fouere/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923751915&usg=AOvVaw3HiRD91CRjO6b3GSBgt3Pp) and [Françine Fouéré](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.euroufo.net/tag/rene-fouere/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923752175&usg=AOvVaw2KVY4d-PMeNCInoUAviECd) establish the Groupe d’Étude des Phénomènes Aériens in Paris, France, with an initial group of 60 interested members. 1962 — French composer [Paul Misraki](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Misraki&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923753271&usg=AOvVaw0B0o9F2uY4SGVTev6mIuDl) writes Les Extraterrestres using the pseudonym Paul Thomas. He links modern UFO sightings with biblical and mythological tales and claims that angels are aliens, that the Bible and other ancient texts are filled with many UFO flying saucer sightings, and that throughout human history extraterrestrial visitors have intervened in human affairs. Misraki is also one of the first authors to suggest that apparitions may be UFO-related phenomena. (Paul Thomas \[Paul Misraki\], Les Extraterrestres, Plon, 1962; Jerome Clark, “Vimanas Have Landed: Ancient Astronautics in Ufology,” IUR 22, no. 3 (Fall 1997): 28–29)

January — The IBM 7950 Harvest computer, designed to be used for cryptanalysis, is delivered to the National Security Agency. It includes Tractor, a large automated tape cartridge library. An NSA-conducted evaluation finds that Harvest is more powerful than the best commercially available machine by a factor of 50–200, depending on the task. It remains in use until 1976. One purpose of the machine is to search text for keywords from a watchlist.

From a single foreign cipher system, Harvest is able to scan more than 7 million decrypts for any occurrences of some 7,000 key words in under four hours. The computer is also used for codebreaking, and this is enhanced by a system codenamed Rye, which allows remote access to Harvest. (Wikipedia, “[IBM 7950 Harvest](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IBM_7950_Harvest&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923754465&usg=AOvVaw2wEDqQWrruZAbDcfTpPvzu)”; “[Timeline of](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://archive.computerhistory.org/resources/text/IBM/Stretch/102636400.txt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923754665&usg=AOvVaw36dT-wSB02VL8yiEkFMp7j) [the IBM Stretch/Harvest Era (1956–1961),](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://archive.computerhistory.org/resources/text/IBM/Stretch/102636400.txt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923754927&usg=AOvVaw1xeHlE9_mSyhOf2NXZbFAv)” computerhistory.org)

The jet’s radar also picks up the object and control tower radar (somewhere) is also tracking it. He attempts to give the object an urgent warning by radio, but it goes unheeded. He arms a Sidewinder rocket and tries to close in, but the

February — Alec Birch, 14, snaps an out-of-focus photo of five domed discs that he and two friends see hovering 500 feet above his backyard in Mosborough, Sheffield, England. Alec and his father show the photo later to the Air Ministry, which pronounces them “temperature inversions” in October. However, in an interview on BBC-2 television on October 6, 1972, Alec confesses that he had superimposed images painted on glass over the backyard scenery, fooling even his father. (“[Schoolboy Snaps Saucer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1962%252CSep-Oct%252CV%25208%252CN%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923758447&usg=AOvVaw0YesB5gsDEvX_Qigy8i10O)” Flying Saucer Review 8, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1962): 4; Gordon Creighton, “[‘No Kidding This Time.
