February 24 — NORAD Requirement 64-73 states that its radar coverage “would provide warning from all directions, not just northern approaches.” (Clark III 811)

February 28 —The first A-12 test aircraft covertly arrives at Groom Lake, Nevada, from Burbank, California. (Wikipedia, “[Area 51](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Area_51&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923761167&usg=AOvVaw3-ZHlKcERYOXxJPTB3mjKY)”)

March — Chemical engineer [Leon Davidson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leon_Davidson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923761561&usg=AOvVaw0PIj2l4rbnHr9XY0QiyYLa) writes a two-part article in Saucer News explaining how he has become convinced that the CIA, especially under the influence of [Allen Dulles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allen_Dulles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923762068&usg=AOvVaw3c1f4RQTeyNXK5UNXmx1MH), has engineered disinformation about UFOs and even manufactured some seemingly legitimate radar sightings as a tool in the Cold War. Its aim is to cause the Soviet Union to waste time and effort in preparing defenses against fictitious aircraft and weapons that the US might be developing. Furthermore, UFOs can be used to capture headlines, diverting attention from unwelcome news coverage of espionage operations. Davidson writes that Dulles has resorted to using contactees and UFO organizations as a propaganda vehicle. Messages supposedly from spacemen calling for a halt in nuclear testing could influence public opinion in a test ban treaty that, in effect, would benefit the US more than the Russians, since the Soviets were seen as overtaking the American lead in weapons development. Davidson attributes CIA involvement in the claims of [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923762511&usg=AOvVaw0p72sRCt7DFbDx_-fcm3IL) and [Daniel Fry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_Fry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923762895&usg=AOvVaw2HYbM-SVHkL7weefP0Z7nh). He also points out that electronic countermeasures (ECM) equipment is capable of creating fake radar returns and goes so far as to say that secret working models of saucers, perhaps piloted by “midgets,” are responsible for some sightings. (Leon Davidson, “An Open Letter to Saucer Researchers,” Saucer News, March 1962, April 1962; Leon Davidson, “[ECM + CIA =](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1960%252CMar-Apr%252CV%25206%252CN%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923763539&usg=AOvVaw04-mJorRJVuZVov9W71M5r) [UFO: Or, How to Cause Radar Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1960%252CMar-Apr%252CV%25206%252CN%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923763923&usg=AOvVaw3jl9pQyMQC3F828G28vSxh)” Flying Saucer Review 6, no. 2 (March/April 1960): 9–12; Gerald K. Haines, “[CIA’s Role in the Study of UFOs, 1947–90,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/static/105bd8290b90de13ee136fecc9fe863f/cia-role-study-UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923764431&usg=AOvVaw11xbjjX9HYzZcDf-RwfxmF)” Studies in Intelligence 40, no. 5 (1997): 67–84)

March — [Betty and Barney Hill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923764906&usg=AOvVaw16GCBrMIG4JDHdY5ENMolV) meet with Patrick J. Quirke, a psychiatrist at the Baldpate Sanitarium in Georgetown, Massachusetts, but he is unsympathetic and discourages them from undergoing hypnosis. (Clark III 583)

March 25 — The [Hills](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923765243&usg=AOvVaw1H2uvebS1ERHwxbc8KNj-N) meet with a psychiatrist (Duncan Stephens of the Exeter Clinic, New Hampshire) who rules out simultaneous hallucination. Around this time, Barney develops a series of warts in an almost geometrically perfect circular ring in his groin but does not associate his malaise with the UFO incident. (Clark III 583–584)

March 25 — Evening. Mrs. R. H. Chappell and her sister Janie Kidd watch two triangular objects, one larger than the other, hovering 40–50 feet above the water at Saanich Inlet, British Columbia. They have flashing ruby-red lights. After two minutes, the lights change to orange and they move off silently and gracefully. Mrs. L. Austin Wright sees a stationary flashing yellow light around the same time. (Dan Lloyd, “[Are They Really Seeing Things over](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923765627&usg=AOvVaw2zT-nbHJuapAOz59KHxHMi) [Canada?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923765836&usg=AOvVaw2x-zbgaCWQKOh3V7940Oab)” Flying Saucer Review 12, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1966): 27)

March 27–30 — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923766156&usg=AOvVaw1QLcLoVOFmSVjASSOUhY2J) claims to attend a Twelve Counsellors Meeting on Saturn that addresses the threat of nuclear war on Earth. In the report that he publishes in June, Adamski writes that the “present explosions of atomic energy are going in the wrong direction, and if these experiments do not stop, the only results will be a lost civilization… This is even affecting their planets.” Ridiculed by many, some of Adamski’s descriptions in the

* * *

report about his trip clearly show this was a deeply spiritual experience for him, which may have unbalanced him for some time. (George Adamski, [George Adamski’s Special Report: My Trip to the Twelve Counsellors Meeting](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.biblioteca-ga.info/50/toon/412/28&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923766573&usg=AOvVaw0U8jim0j5swnd7fqLCtcs4) [That Took Place on Saturn, Mrach 27–30, 1962](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.biblioteca-ga.info/50/toon/412/28&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923766798&usg=AOvVaw1wM3xcqglvU8tJdVJRil9Y), Science of Life, 1962; “[Final Years,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/final-years/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923767114&usg=AOvVaw1vQpUvrfIseTJx_G7Z8Wjc)” The Adamski Case, June 11, 2009)

Spring or summer — All base personnel on flying status attend a briefing in the theater at the Clinton-Sherman AFB \[now the Clinton-Sherman Industrial Airpark\] near Burns Flat, Oklahoma. The airmen are shown a short 20–30-minute Air Force film showing, spliced together without interpretation, five or six gun-camera clips apparently documenting attempts by aircraft to intercept UFOs. Afterward, the commander of the 4213d Strategic Wing reads a statement (probably JANAP 146(D)) stipulating fines and jail sentences for anyone publicly reporting a UFO sighting and hands out UFO sighting forms in the event of an incident. One technician recalls there is a section on reporting any electronic signature emitted from the UFO picked up by specific ECM devices. (Nukes 123–125)

April 18 — Evening. A red, glowing object is first seen at a great height over Oneida, New York, heading west silently.

There are reports from Kansas and Colorado. NORAD radar picks up the object; ADC alerts several bases, including Nellis AFB near Las Vegas, Nevada. Fighters are scrambled from Luke AFB near Phoenix, Arizona, and the jets are possibly heard over Nephi, Utah, after the object passes overhead. Capt. Herman Gordon Shields, flying a C-119 two miles west of Levan, Utah, sees it as a slender object. A man in Silver City, Utah, claims that the object is a glowing ball of light about the size of a soccer ball. He says it is white with a yellowish tint and a bright yellow jagged flame coming from the rear: “As the object passed over Robinson \[in Ogden, Utah?\], it slowed down in \[the\] air, and after, \[a\] gasping sound was heard, the object spurted ahead again. After this procedure was repeated three or four times, the object arched over and began descending to earth after which the object turned bluish color and then burned out or went dark. After the object began to slow down it began to wobble or fishtail in its path.” Several people see the object over Eureka, Utah, apparently crashing and interrupting electrical service from a power plant close to the landing site. It is described as a “glowing, orange oval which emitted a low, whirring sound.” It takes off a few minutes later, continuing to the west. The object lights up the streets of Reno, Nevada, and then turns to Las Vegas. It blares brightly like a “tremendous, flaming sword” over Nellis AFB and then disappears from their radar scopes at 10,000 feet. Witnesses say the object is traveling almost horizontally northeast of Las Vegas until a final explosion occurs from the direction of Mesquite, Nevada. Sheriff’s deputy Walter Bun, who leads the search and rescue unit, moves the unit into the Spring Mountain area in jeeps to search for wreckage. They search through the night, and when the sun comes up they continue using aircraft. They do not find anything of importance except some ashes that might easily be the remains of a campfire started by a hunter some weeks earlier. When no one reports a downed or missing aircraft, Bun and the other deputies call off the search. The object seems to have changed direction, because at Reno it passes west to east, in Utah it is seem going southeast to northwest, and at Nephi it travels west. The duration of the sighting, from New York to Nevada, is only 32 minutes, giving a speed of 4,500 mph, below the speed of meteors. On May 8, the Air Force sends [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923768235&usg=AOvVaw3nOUgxxIpV_RUVxznCGzAy) and Lt. Col. [Robert Friend](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Friend_(pilot)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923768482&usg=AOvVaw26R_q3ZqLq3Ei_Pq_T6QB9) to Utah with [Douglas M. Crouch](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/171937609/douglas-merle-crouch&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923768768&usg=AOvVaw0aJhuq_ZTikxa1-11Mskxf)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/171937609/douglas-merle-crouch&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923768954&usg=AOvVaw0nC5iC4U2rBcZGUK2UpkgT) chief of criminal investigation at Hill AFB, south of Ogden, Utah. They determine it is a bolide. Blue Book lists it as two sightings: a multiple radar sighting at Nellis on April 18 with no visual (despite hundreds of observers in Las Vegas), and a bolide over Utah that it claims occurs on April 19. In reality, the Utah and Nevada sightings are only minutes apart (8:15 p.m. Mountain Time). However, there is quite a bit of information from numerous sources concerning this major incident, including Project Blue Book documents, and now possible [confirmation](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/papers/transcript_radarman.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923769206&usg=AOvVaw1MJmY8hXoYOt-lIO1iNwZE) by a radar man at ATIC. The case is also not explained in a Blue Book monthly sighting listing for April 1962. It is interesting that every one of these states except Utah has or was in the process of obtaining ICBM bases: New York (Plattsburg AFB); Kansas, (Forbes AFB and McConnell AFB); Utah (Minuteman production at Air Force Plant 77 at Hill AFB); Idaho (Mountain Home AFB); Montana (Malmstrom AFB); New Mexico (Walker AFB); Wyoming (F. E. Warren AFB); Arizona (Davis Monthan AFB); California (Beale AFB). (NICAP, “[National](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/620418adc_alert_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923769543&usg=AOvVaw33ENdhBPSjHeJVgggh__QY) [Defense Alert](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/620418adc_alert_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923769721&usg=AOvVaw1W19ibd7RX5U08Jnt8iDby)”; Frank Edwards, Strange World, Ace ed., 1964, [pp. 38–41](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/strangeworld00edwa/page/38/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923770014&usg=AOvVaw2awEiA7S8Qfoz6S8rEBdZJ); “[Meteor Lands in Utah, Lights](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94770755/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923770221&usg=AOvVaw1-Qd5Be-XqKSD3kT0ZvpLc) [Western Skies,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94770755/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923770383&usg=AOvVaw3u3w3lTspx2AOg3xfH1Tnr)” Los Angeles Times, April 19, 1962, p. 15; “[Brilliant Fireball](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94770911/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923770640&usg=AOvVaw2vaPdTD7qYGXTHcpSAt0fw) [Flashes in Skies,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94771052/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923770809&usg=AOvVaw3jpJVdfodyIg4eOfc7ezq4)” Salt Lake City Deseret News, April 19, 1962, pp. 1, 5; Las Vegas Sun, April 19, 1962; Kevin D. Randle, A History of UFO Crashes, Avon, 1995, [pp. 79–94](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/historyofufocras0000rand/page/78/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923771237&usg=AOvVaw0jzeQQ4JhA9RLsfUsGRk5u); Clark III 333–335; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923771444&usg=AOvVaw34cxadqQtU-3U_gd3VpCVm)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923771599&usg=AOvVaw3ZevadgLaTzBxhrLTw7-_0) p. 291; Randle, Levelland, 2021, pp. 87–99)

April 24 — 7:45 p.m. [Alice W. Gasslein](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70133470/alice-w-gasslein&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923771963&usg=AOvVaw3RXFNnXdrwjEJZAVoCg8xR) and her mother are driving near their home in Springfield, Delaware County, Pennsylvania, when they see a large domed object emitting flashes of green light moving over the roofs of nearby homes. A rotating band around the main body consists of a series of square windows from which come shafts of bright white light. They drive back home to alert her husband, [Joseph A. Gasslein](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70133471/joseph-a-gasslein&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923772253&usg=AOvVaw3ZhAwlqWGtrWjPL2zFtL6d), an aviation worker. By that time, the UFO is about a half-mile distant, giving off colored lights. Around 8:10 p.m., the object returns flying

* * *

toward the Gassleins’ home (south of Walsh Park) only 20 feet above ground level and passes over their backyard before making a sharp left turn and moving away to the east. (“Out of the Past: A Very Close CE-1,” IUR 10, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1985): 9–10, 14; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: January–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1962-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923772697&usg=AOvVaw1y6u_j5bV-Bjc4AeMIDo_5) [June 1962](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1962-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923772953&usg=AOvVaw3wfgMGtKcv49CDYoUimxhY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1962-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923773152&usg=AOvVaw22NrU1MMVHUUeY_xb0vGCM) The Author, 2005, pp, 56–57)

April 25 — The A-12 is taken on its first (unofficial and unannounced) flight with Lockheed test pilot [Louis Schalk](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_Schalk&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923773455&usg=AOvVaw1gbns8dMv8Eo8e8y8oLBgG) at the controls. Intended as only a taxi run, the A-12 unexpectedly takes flight and Schalk lands it 2 miles past the runway. (Wikipedia, “[Lockheed A-12](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_A-12&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923773705&usg=AOvVaw3eca8ADsGQZVY47AM6V4Le)”; Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 177–178](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/n211/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923773974&usg=AOvVaw2J780lQd8iCKfyRixHFSgR))

April 26 — [Schalk](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_Schalk&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923774232&usg=AOvVaw1uVpP5fD23IPGUNkyuT0Po) makes another unofficial low-altitude, 40-minute test flight with the A-12. The takeoff is perfect, but after the A-12 gets to about 300 feet it starts shedding all the “pie slice” fillets of titanium on the left side of the aircraft and one fillet on the right. (On later aircraft, those pieces are paired with triangular inserts made of radar- absorbing composite material.) Technicians spend four days finding and reattaching the pieces. Nonetheless, the flight pleases [Kelly Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kelly_Johnson_(engineer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923774512&usg=AOvVaw2lt-DLjoTlZ8kuUTMTi2LW)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kelly_Johnson_(engineer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923774656&usg=AOvVaw0_5mkJ_0vQyGNkaZR1aOi0) (Wikipedia, “[Lockheed A-12](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_A-12&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923774839&usg=AOvVaw24difFNT-vYzVROusUkIbZ)”; Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 178–179](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/178/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923775058&usg=AOvVaw0JNstljLPQY5-y1MmtMbW_))

April 30 — [Schalk](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_Schalk&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923775299&usg=AOvVaw2GRdafj9_p6p9t3dJIvT7H) takes the A-12 up to 30,000 feet on its first official flight at Area 51 for 59 minutes. His top speed is 400 mph. (Jacobsen, Area 51, [p. 179](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/178/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923775560&usg=AOvVaw3feWWxEBGNuuRzWg6xpa27))

April 30 — Just before 10:00 a.m. During a free-flight test (Flight 52) of the X-15 to a height of 246,700 feet (46.7 miles) by NASA pilot [Joseph A. Walker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_A._Walker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923775836&usg=AOvVaw2GmBHrnycK2MGHXex0dPId) from Edwards AFB, California, to Ely, Nevada, the instruments photograph 5–6 cylindrical objects. No visual confirmation. On May 11, at NASA’s Second National Conference on the Peaceful Uses of Space in Seattle, Washington, Walker mentions the objects photographed (and perhaps shows the slides; it is not mentioned in the proceedings). NICAP is unable to obtain the photos. NASA claims the objects are ice flaking off the aircraft (“fireflies”). They are described by a NASA spokesman as “barbell shaped, bright-orange in color, and passing in groups up to six behind the X-15.” Opinion ranges from “definitely something up there,” to “film spots,” to “sun rays on the lens.” [Jacobsen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annie_Jacobsen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923776130&usg=AOvVaw3BGQLuXka1_0qngV9_bT6P) implies it was the A-12 test the same day. (“[AF Criticizes](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/017%2520AUG-SEPT%25201962.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923776359&usg=AOvVaw37LlHWl4aTLfpWmpPBC45B) [NASA Release of ‘Mystery Object’ Photo,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/017%2520AUG-SEPT%25201962.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923776559&usg=AOvVaw2SaZmE_5M1MpHxDSTiDH7y)” UFO Investigator 2, no. 5 (Aug./Sept. 1962): 8; UFOEv, [p. 139](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D151%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923776812&usg=AOvVaw3xC1o9dSwkr8_-O6qxBvwv); Los Angeles Herald-Examiner, May 11, 1962; MUFON UFO Journal, November 1989, pp. 6–7; Good Above, [p. 366](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/366/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923777154&usg=AOvVaw3DAxg5y_U9XsO4JXOgfj9L); [Proceedings of the Second National Conference on the Peaceful Uses of Space, Seattle, Washington, May 8–10,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ntrs.nasa.gov/api/citations/19630001263/downloads/19630001263.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923777359&usg=AOvVaw27UKwUQJ6VSvhYnNEqBnJq) [1962](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ntrs.nasa.gov/api/citations/19630001263/downloads/19630001263.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923777542&usg=AOvVaw0FaS_pMDnxtBsnC5o8EkKg)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ntrs.nasa.gov/api/citations/19630001263/downloads/19630001263.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923777689&usg=AOvVaw0dDJ-fyhK-3R5kge9_xEfb) NASA Office of Scientific and Technical Information, November 1962; Curtis Peebles, “[Fireflies: The X-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://magoniamagazine.blogspot.com/2014/01/fireflies.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923777935&usg=AOvVaw3mGYoj_nFXeJaPGaDr86Vs) [15 ‘UFO’ Sighting Controversy,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://magoniamagazine.blogspot.com/2014/01/fireflies.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923778172&usg=AOvVaw1LlLirLTOTTvVzy5yeqn_A)” Magonia 78 (June 2002); Jacobsen, Area 51, [p. 205](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/204/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923778438&usg=AOvVaw070VWo9_-SvhWEExwIewws))

Late April or early May — Three women and a 10-year-old boy are driving home to Granby, Connecticut, when two bright yellow lights appear in the sky ahead. The lights cross the road and disappear behind some shrubbery. Driving nearer and stopping, the witnesses see the lights hovering above a field, one above the other. The objects realign horizontally and move toward the car. The driver starts the car up and speeds away, but the lights are right behind her, only a few feet from the rear window and matching the car’s speed. The yellow lights are only a few feet in diameter and have a reddish patch that rotates. They follow the car for four minutes then turn away. (Swords 299–300)

May 4 — The A-12 achieves supersonic speed of Mach 1.1 at 40,000 feet during a test at Groom Lake, Nevada. May 11 — 7:40 p.m. Argentine Rear Adm. [Eladio M. Vázquez](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eladio_V%25C3%25A1zquez&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923778915&usg=AOvVaw1Hv-yj_tmQ5gSNPH7rSQ5K) and Capt. Aldo Molinari watch a UFO from the US

Military Mission at the Comandante Espora Air Naval Base in Bahía Blanca, Argentina. (UFOEv, [p. 170](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D182%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923779212&usg=AOvVaw2EIdeN78oRE3sn4XjJaTQw); “[In](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201963%252007%252000%2520-%2520July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923779420&usg=AOvVaw1Uicu0Y10x-ch21nZPNn_i) [Argentina,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201963%252007%252000%2520-%2520July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923779638&usg=AOvVaw1zYpmPJH-5BkGCa0V7v-Qv)” APRO Bulletin, July 1963, p. 4)

May 12 — 4:10 a.m. Three truckers (Valentino Tomassini, Guro Tomassini, and Humberto Zenobi) are driving from Bahia Blanca to Jacinto Aráuz, La Pampa, Argentina, when they see a lantern-like light resting in a nearby field. It brightens and dims alternately. As they slow down, a row of 20–30 lights come on. When they approach to within 210 feet of the object, it rises up and crosses the road at a height of 12 feet. Its lights go out, a reddish flame comes from the bottom, and it makes a soft humming noise. The UFO then divides into two parts that fly off in different directions. Navy Capt. Luis Sanchez Moreno, chief of intelligence at the Puerto Belgrano Naval Base, interviews the witnesses. At the landing site, grass is burned over an area 180 feet in diameter, and there are damp, gray-colored patches. These are taken for analysis to either or both the Puerto Belgrano Naval Base and Universidad Nacional del Sur, both in or near Bahia Blanca. It consists of calcium carbonate and potassium carbonate. (UFOEv, [pp. 170–171](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D182%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923780050&usg=AOvVaw0KpoMyfRuprz117XEJe0tB); “[In Argentina,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201963%252007%252000%2520-%2520July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923780281&usg=AOvVaw1p7nkTG6xdlQTflyq1da2v)” APRO Bulletin, July 1963, pp. 2–4; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1962-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923780525&usg=AOvVaw2PjOqWAnq-Kd2zLESjMlOf) [Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: January–June 1962](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1962-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923780702&usg=AOvVaw27vMbES3gI8YOcMCa7nHME), The Author, 2005, pp. 60–61; Oscar A. Uriondo, “[Preliminary Catalogue of Type 1 Cases in Argentina,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR-CH%25201972%2520N%252012.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923780939&usg=AOvVaw2qxaEFVJscRxseNdFQ9zzJ)” Flying Saucer Review Case Histories, no. 12 (December 1972): 10)

May 13 — 4:00 a.m. Near Oncativo, Córdoba, Argentina, two women driving from Rosario see a long object flying at moderate altitude and emitting a powerful, multicolored light. They enter a fog and see through the trees a sort of “little house” on the ground, with green, red, and yellow lights set in an arrow-shaped arrangement. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: January–June 1962](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1962-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923781285&usg=AOvVaw3_Yp2l0NqjrSniVrTOt6E0)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1962-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923781479&usg=AOvVaw3Mk1imCWWzARjJmozP0dgC) The Author, 2005, p. 62;

May 21 — Miguel Thomé, a reporter for La Nueva Provincia, takes several photos of a luminous object above Bahia Blanca, Argentina, one of which is exactly at a point when the object changes course. (UFOEv, [p. 170](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D182%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923782392&usg=AOvVaw2m_8rEPYmW6LmvyTYWD6lK); ClearIntent, [pp. 138–139](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/138/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923782630&usg=AOvVaw3Zc7URbVJGJBcsFQEXqi3a); “[Un avistaje de OVNI en Bahía Blanca aparece en los archivos de la CIA de Estados](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.lanueva.com/nota/2016-2-3-1-19-0-un-avistaje-de-ovni-en-bahia-blanca-aparece-en-los-archivos-de-la-cia-de-estados-unidos&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923782906&usg=AOvVaw3B752tVAOuszcvLohOWQcO) [Unidos,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.lanueva.com/nota/2016-2-3-1-19-0-un-avistaje-de-ovni-en-bahia-blanca-aparece-en-los-archivos-de-la-cia-de-estados-unidos&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923783193&usg=AOvVaw1F5BgiDfHUSv-GLQ_tXD_d)” La Nueva (Bahía Blanca), February 3, 2016)

May 21 — Day. Capt. Gordon Pendleton and First Officer J. P. Murphy are flying an Aer Lingus Vickers Viscount airliner above southern England at 17,000 feet when they see a brown globe-shaped object approaching head-on. It speeds 3,000 feet below the aircraft at about 700 mph. The object has a number of antenna-like projections on its surface. (Irish Times, May 22, 1962; UFOEv, [p. 122](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D134%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923783681&usg=AOvVaw1wEZAQzf2HL3gO3BXpIRWA))

May 22 — 7:10–7:45 p.m. A formation of Navy planes, led by flight instructor Lt. Rodolfo César Galdos, near Comandante Espora Air Naval Base in Bahia Blanca, Argentina, observes several UFOs over a 35-minute period. Witnesses at the control tower also see an object. Student pilot Roberto Wilkinson sees a luminous object trailing his plane. It lights up his cockpit and his radio transmission is disrupted as it passes underneath. (UFOEv, [pp. 119](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D131%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923783990&usg=AOvVaw0vbYfI5xSv46dyowdGeekY), [171](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D183%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923784186&usg=AOvVaw0FP_y6WfLFuD6ImzuEUqzD); [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923784379&usg=AOvVaw0NgrUmkfht1N97QY6EdvTp)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923784537&usg=AOvVaw3rzMFswqwcfcgnTKNzzWOt) p. 129; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: January–June](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1962-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923784718&usg=AOvVaw2GfkuPTmteHnPdf7491bqr) [1962](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1962-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923784908&usg=AOvVaw1l2ccgca7WkW2DdSDKS3xF)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1962-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923785048&usg=AOvVaw0QqGR69Xbkni75loKQXMIe) The Author, 2005, pp. 65–67; Scott Corrales, “[Saucers in My Backyard: Argentina’s Trancas Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://inexplicata.blogspot.com/2007/05/saucers-in-my-backyard-argentinas.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923785330&usg=AOvVaw1a71ewf19sc4SpIqne-hJX)” Inexplicata, May 8, 2007)

May 22 or 24 —A woman is hospitalized after she and her husband see an object land near Winifreda, Las Pampas, Argentina. Two large “robot-like creatures” emerge. Argentine Air Force investigators find a circle of scorched grass. (Lorenzen, Encounters with UFO Occupants, Berkley Medallion, 1976, p. 152)

May 25 — USAF Pentagon spokesman Maj. [Carl R. Hart](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/63582043/carl-robert-hart&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923785726&usg=AOvVaw1X_B41yZp54RUnpqYFmCNz) tells NICAP that Air Force investigations involve hundreds of intelligence officers, as well as “the best scientific brains available in the laboratories of all government agencies,” also scientific investigators in commercial laboratories, wherever needed. He adds that [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923785967&usg=AOvVaw2swOtemExHetUymGg9YQe_) has consulted with the “world’s leading scientists.” Around the same time, Lt. Col. Spencer Whedon from ATIC informs NICAP that the Air Force spends about $10,000 on each major sighting investigation. (“[AF Admits UFO Probe Still in Full](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/016%2520MAR-%2520JUL%25201962.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923786226&usg=AOvVaw0di7qSUzkQxLN0ncYYZROZ) [Operation,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/016%2520MAR-%2520JUL%25201962.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923786446&usg=AOvVaw0rEUiCrbhuT3p_Oo2jJBDR)” UFO Investigator 2, no. 4 (March/July 1962): 2)

Summer — Col. [Joseph J. Bryan III](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.encyclopediavirginia.org/Bryan_Joseph_III_1904-1993&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923786842&usg=AOvVaw1mp_BVa8HNaDY7Zr8w_YfU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.encyclopediavirginia.org/Bryan_Joseph_III_1904-1993&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923786989&usg=AOvVaw0G23yrblq66Sh1gXK2cpCO) special assistant to the Secretary of the Air Force and advisor to NATO, joins the board of NICAP. In 1959 he had contacted [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923787160&usg=AOvVaw0TPoy3kdfa1p1ZtFAxsiRp) and asked to see some of his “really hot cases.” It is later revealed that he was also founder of the CIA’s psychological warfare staff. Bryan never discloses his CIA background to NICAP or Keyhoe. Although Bryan, the father of later UFO author [C. D. B. Bryan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C._D._B._Bryan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923787371&usg=AOvVaw3J3AJefaFs0M0FLHEGoOIJ), makes strong pro-UFO statements, he is later suspected of helping to discredit Keyhoe and undermine NICAP; his son and [Richard H. Hall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_H._Hall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923787535&usg=AOvVaw1HnWcIK7lxC9SVLIK-JXJJ) deny it. (“[AF Colonel, Noted Astronomer, Join Board,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/017%2520AUG-SEPT%25201962.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923787842&usg=AOvVaw2lhGn4sm98YZ2cL6Q0D7Ny)” UFO Investigator 2, no. 5 (Aug./Sept 1962): 2; “[Col. Joseph Bryan,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/032%2520MAY-JUN%25201966.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923788113&usg=AOvVaw1vd1smx0Y_4yurNfJ7KguW)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 8 (May/June 1966): 5; “[NI-CIA-AP or NICAP?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Just%2520Cause%2520(CAUS)/Just%2520Cause%2520-%2520Old%2520Series/Just%2520Cause%2520-%2520Vol%25201%2520Issue%252007%2520-%2520Old%2520Series.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923788414&usg=AOvVaw1CPmXtCCQaGFepw-kX-0tN)” Just Cause 1, no. 7 (January 1979): 5–13; “[CE4K Author C. D. B. Bryan Dies,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://rigorousintuition.ca/board2/viewtopic.php?t%3D26301%26p%3D306297&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923788671&usg=AOvVaw23i0T4TtWNOJpayA2JNtiM)” Rigorous Intuition, December 18, 2009)

Summer — Around 9:00 p.m. Harvey Packard and five other men are fishing near East Peru, Maine, when three orange globes show up across the pond and begin dancing about. The globes move toward the witnesses, who get scared and jump in their car and speed away. The globes follow the car, one in the rear and the others on each side. The objects appear to be transparent, 3-foot spheres that easily pace the speeding vehicle. Occasionally they leave their positions and form into a triangle with squarish bridges between them, then split up and continue the car chase.

The car radio is filled with static. Finally, they veer off and fly into the woods. (NICAP case file; Swords 300) Summer — Donald MacKenzie, a shepherd, discovers some strange wreckage in a remote moor near Ardgay, Sutherland,

Scotland, that he thinks is related to Sputnik. In October, a team from RAF Kinloss \[now Kinloss Barracks\] on the Moray Firth arrives to investigate. They find a strange box-shaped object, large enough to have carried a person and containing spaces for cameras and a brass panel that explains, in pictures, what the finder should do in the event of discovery to claim a reward. Buried nearby are a number of bottles of colorless fluid. The team is mystified and suspects something Russian but can’t confirm it. The debris now seems likely to have come from a secret spy balloon, one of many launched in 1955–1956 by the US Air Force from RAF Evanton \[now closed\], to take reconnaissance photos of Russian military and nuclear facilities. Once clear of Soviet territory, the balloons were designed to drop into the Pacific Ocean where its VHF beacon would guide recovery efforts. (David Clarke, “[The Scottish Roswell?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://drdavidclarke.co.uk/2012/07/29/the-scottish-roswell/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923789270&usg=AOvVaw0xV13jwBxnG-zt7I_gtGyV)” Dr. David Clarke: Folklore and Journalism, July 29, 2012)

June 5 — Contactee [Gabriel Green](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_Green&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923789505&usg=AOvVaw1kyWHjx-pbqXqvU86THdra) runs for the US Senate in California and claims to have received 171,000 votes in the Democratic primary. (Wikipedia, “[1962 United States Senate election in California](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1962_United_States_Senate_election_in_California&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889923789756&usg=AOvVaw0cSbcSHQG1JIDUv-HjEa7L)”; S. D.
